review_body: The location of this hotel is great, but the hotel felt old and dated, the rooms were dated, the staff was great, the gym was small and stunk. The view from our room was great, but they need to make some upgrades. I know they are currently working on the bar and restaurant, next they need to work on the rooms.

The restaurant and roof top bar was under construction and the rooms were basic bottom end rooms that you would expect from a lower hotel chain. The staff was cordial but nothing over the top but it was located near some great restaurants nearby. We utilized our friends hotel as home base as our lobby and room was too small as a meeting location.

This hotel is extremely dismal The lighting is very poor and the rooms are even more dismal dark blue wallpaper poor lighting looking out onto a factory type building.Do not book a room here if you are depressed because you will end up feeling more depressed.On the plus side the hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff were superb nothing was too much troubleUfortunately the restaurant and rooftop bar were closed for refurbishment so I cannot there are plenty of places to eat in the area. I did not like the area as I thought it was rather grubby but as usual New York was wonderful as were it's people.

We were looking for a quick getaway to NYC for a few nights and this hotel fit the bill. We arrived by train and the hotel wasn't far from Penn Station. We arrived early and thought we would need them to hold our bags, but our room was ready early and we were able to check in. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The restaurant was not open (under construction) but we were aware of this when we booked the room, so it was not an issue.

When I checked into the hotel, I saw hair everywhere in the room! On the bed, on the pillow, in the bathroom. It's gross and the room looks so outdated. We checked in around 3am and my friends said it's okay. We will only be here for 3 nights. On the last night, I was complaining to my friends how I couldn't sleep cause I'm itchy every night. My friends said they are too! I just thought I had dry skin. There are bed bugs for sure! We stayed at a different hotel after and no more itch. Also, on the last night, the house keeper knocked on our knock at 8:30am!! I had to tell and said "NO cleaning!!!" I was pretty upset at this time. When I checked out, I complained and the lady gave me a look and said you should have said something. I told her " it's not like anything was going to happen." If this room is dirty, I can't imagine it'll be clean elsewhere. It's a 4 stars hotel, you should NOT wait for guests to complain how dirty the place is or if there are bed bugs. I will NEVER stay at a Hilton property again and would not recommend to anyone.

The hotel is placed right next to the Fashion Institute, next to several subway line. The room are fairly good furnished and comfortable.Two issues:The restaurant of the hotel is under restructuring but no one inform you about it unless at check in. The replacement is a modest grocery store (Sunac Fancy Food) which provides also warm food. Way to poor replacement solution for the standing of the hotelWe had an issue with the coffee machine and in the room there was no phone to call the assistance.

Although the restaurant and bar are under renovation, the front desk staff have been phenomenal check in was a breeze room is clean and nice. The 17th floor not much of a view (a water tower) but it's New York and who spends time in their hotel... wine and sweets at the front desk for Valentines day. Restaurant across the street was fabulous with great drinks. Marion was a fantastic help with my Valentunes Day presents that got shipped to the hotel. Would recommend. Need a mini fridge for my left overs though.

Stayed for 2 nights here in January. The room was very clean and good size for New York. The location is quite good , 1 mile to Times Square and Maddison Square Garden is just 2 minutes walk. However if you are a Diamond member please avoid this hotel. I think they don’t even know what Diamond member means . No upgrade, no drink vouchers, there is no lounge and you get nothing at all as a Diamond member. Why being a diamond??? Aa their restaurant is closed they gave me breakfast voucher for 12,50 to use in a convenience shop / deli cafe. For 12,50 in new york you get a coffee and a bagel and thats it. Really poor. disappointed as they charge you much more for their breakfast (when the restaurant was open) than 12,50. One evening I called and asked for a dental kit and the girl at reception told me I have to come down to collect it as there is not enough staff. This is really bad when guests are paying a fair amount of money and also I am a diamond member . I will never ever use this hotel again. There are hotels around much cheaper that basically provide you the same experience or even better. Its a waste of money.

From the hotel you have easy access to many sights within New York. It is a couple of blocks from Times Square and the port authority, Nordstrom rack is also super close where you can buy discounted couture. The restaurant was closed for renovations, therefore cannot review but the rooms are spacious, for New York. Will recommend for cleanliness and accessibility to Times Square.

Hotel is in good location, but a bit noisy if your room faces towards the street even if you are high up. Rooms are lovely and clean, but no fridge. No one to help with bags and small temporary entry built to the hotel like tent like (I assume for winter only to not let cold air in), but very difficult to get through with suitcase if noone helps you. No restaurant and bar was a dealbraker if you stay for business and for this reason I would not return. Check in staff friendly, but check out staff was half a sleep (I did check out 5am).

While the hotel can't be faulted for its location in a very noisy part of town, the lack of effective soundproofing meant for a long and sleepless night filled with sirens, car horns, trucks backing up, construction equipment (even after midnight), loud car/motorcycle exhaust, garbage trucks, delivery trucks, and people yelling in the streets -- despite my room being on nearly the 20th floor. These "city view" rooms also cost extra to book, and the rooms and hotel itself are rather worn and dated. Rooms are also small and the hotel had relatively few amenities. If all Manhattan hotels were this noisy, I'd give a higher rating, but I've stayed at plenty that, despite the street noise outside, have relatively quiet and comfortable rooms. Apparently the rooms on the backside of the hotel are quieter (and sometimes cheaper), which would have been nice to know when booking, not when checking out. The hotel itself isn't "bad," no one there was unkind, and it surely beats having no hotel at all, but this is not the standard I would expect from a Hilton (or any Hilton chain) hotel.

The Hilton New York Fashion District was conveniently located, extremely tidy and staff was super nice. Would stay again when visiting NYC. I stayed right across from elevator and it was not too noisy. Price was also very good for a New York hotel.

I came as an Honors club member and the restaurant was closed. Chairs for the restaurant were being tossed in a dumpster outside...Never was picked up......NO benefit to being an Honors Club Member. .

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days at the end of November and start of December and chose it due to the location. The plus side of the location was it’s proximity to many popular places including the Flatiron, The Empire State Building and Macy’s which were all around a 10 minute walk. The downside of the location is that there’s not a great deal immediately outside the hotel or on the nearby streets other than fast food outlets.We booked the hotel back in January 2019 as we got a good deal and the hotel website boasted a rooftop bar and on site restaurant. When we checked in we were told the rooftop bar was closed for refurbishment and that the restaurant went out of business 3 months ago. This meant there was nowhere on site to get food or drink which we were very disappointed by. The reception desk gave us a sheet of food options to order in but we didn’t take up this option.The room itself was a decent size but very basic and not what I’d expect from a Hilton. Our view was onto other buildings so we couldn’t see outside properly. There was a bug on the bed and a bug catcher under the radiator which was a bit concerning! However we never saw any other bugs so we chose not to make an issue out of this. The bed itself was comfortable but the duvet didn’t have a proper cover, it was 2 sheets folded round the duvet itself, which became unfolded during the night which was really irritating, and not very pleasant seeing marks on the duvet.The room was made up daily but sometimes quite late in the day. There were a couple of occasions where we returned to our room around 4pm for a rest before going out again and had to wait for the maid to finish the room. We had to ask for additional drinks one day where they hadn’t been replenished and our final day they had run out of bath towels and we only had hand towels. We always tipped the maid as we appreciate the busy job they have and the time pressures, however it was disappointing that we didn’t always have the items in our room that we should have had.The reception team were all very helpful and stored our luggage on our last day when we checked out and arranged us a private cab back to the airport that afternoon.On the whole the location of the hotel was handy, the price we paid was reasonable and the reception staff were courteous, we were just disappointed that the hotel room appeared more of a low budget hotel than we were expecting. We were also unhappy at the lack of food options available at the hotel and felt that because this change had happened since we placed our booking over 10 months previously, we should have been advised prior to our stay either by Expedia or the hotel themselves.We definitely plan to return to New York again in future however we will be paying more for a more upmarket hotel.

From the moment I arrived to the moment I left the staff was both unfriendly and rude. You would assume Hilton has a strict hiring policy but the staff here show otherwise. Nothing but attitude and dismissal. Very disappointed

Stayed here as a Hilton Diamond member but did not get a room upgrade or any other meaningful perk beyond a few extra Hilton Honors points because they couldn't offer breakfast on site (the property is undergoing renovation, apparently on multiple floors at once). The only saving grace is that at least prices are competitive for this part of town. I would recommend this place if you get a rate that is competitive with similarly tiny rooms elsewhere in the area.

Lovely spot in a great location. I stay here anytime I am in NYC. Great staff, and excellent restaurant when it's open. It's closed for the moment and "Room Service" menu from different restaurants is less than ideal.

Great hotel love it . Always stay here when in New York and always love it . The staff helpful and friendly and the rooms nice and comfortable . If your in New York choose this hotel it’s situated in a good location very easy to get around . Great hotel .

This centrally located Upper Chelsea property is clean & fairly modern, BUT it’s not a true upscale Hilton Hotel. Staff isn’t welcoming. Rooms are small & bathrooms are tiny; had to turn sideways to shower! No restaurant, bar or even a coffee/snack bar in this facility; fitness room is a joke. Beware of the dispensing minibar; touch something & you’re automatically charged, with no refunds! Only ice machine is down in the lobby & it’s NOT self-serve. Safe is on the floor in dark “broom-style” closet; ironing board has to come out to hang anything. Hear EVERY sound in narrow hallways. This place should be marketed as a Garden Inn (motel variety), really dilutes the Hilton brand:

I had wondered why this Hilton in Chelsea had reduced rates. Thought it may be the post-NYE low season or something. Was really stunned by how dismissive the staff was. The beds and room sizes were good, as you would expect from a Hilton. But the walls were paper thin and there was construction outside on the street the entire night. The hotel had NO services whatsoever because it was undergoing renovation, so you’d think the staff would be a little more courteous to keep people’s spirits up so we can ALL manage our expectations. But they refused to tell me where I could even fill my reusable water bottle while I waited for my room to be ready. “Is there a faucet anywhere?”“No.”“What about the gym? Can I use the cooler?” “No.” I walked away because honestly I hate confrontation, and it felt like this person just wanted to be petty over one thing or another. When I got my room and they swiped my credit card, they told me there’s “nothing to charge to it because all facilities are shut down,” but then refused to tell me what the deposit was for. My reservation was prepaid. Look, I get it. It’s crazytown in New York City and I’m sure the staff deal with a ton of stressful situations and rude tourists. But cut the rest of us some slack. It’s not our fault.
user_name:
TheatreAndTravelFan
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel was nice and a good price point. Had a few small issues but overall it was in a good spot and had a great view. No mini fridge though and the mini bar was almost empty with no price and no bar on the premises. But a nice staff that do they're best to help

Christmas day disappointment, restaurant was closed, rooftop closed. Heater not working. Had it fix at 1am. I booked third party was I wasn't aware that everything was out of service. I would stay elsewhere. Finding a decent meal on Christmas day wasnt easy. To top it off the front desk was not helpful instead they were rude. Especially since there website apparently stated both restaurant nd rooftop were closed. I was not aware  I will never stay again.

We stayed here after the holidays, the location was great. Plenty of good food and bars near by, right in the middle of the city. We were located next to the 1 subway so travel around the city was made easy. Highly recommend a stay here.

This was a convenient hotel for a fourth of July cruise.It is within walking distance of Pier 62 at Hudson River Park. Though I recommend not taking a cruise from there, no amenities while waiting and in a heavy traffic area. Chelsea Pier cruises are preferable.The hotel! Stylish, as advertised, sorry I didn't have time to check out the roof top bar. Rooms are small, as expected in NYC. I stay alone, so not an issue. A bit tight for two. Coffee maker, mini-bar, safe. The mini bar contents, are not inviting and you are advised if you "pull flap" you will be charged, therefore, you can't use the fridge. There is a safe, but it's up on a top shelf of a closet, in the dark, so you can't read the instructions. Note to management: Post instructions in a visible place. I would stay there again if I was in that area.

This was a birthday gift to my 15 year old daughter. She always wanted to see NYC. The room location was horrible the beds was uncomfortable and if I was given any notice of the renovations I would’ve picked a different location. The room was extremely hot because I was told NYC hotels don’t have AC during winter. A bit rediculous because it had cool on the thermostat in the room but oh well. Was given a shower and not a tub it was hard to shower a 2 year old. Just not satisfied with our 7 day’s stay.

I have stayed at this hotel the last few years and it used to be great. It is showing its wear and the mattress is completely worn out and needs to be replaced. Woke up with the worst back pain of my life. Was offered no fix and was told that there was nothing wrong with the mattress. Asked to swap it with another room even but again they stated engineering says there is nothing wrong with it. When the springs squeak and sag and the mattress bottoms out when you lay on it how is it not worn out. This property is showing its age and no longer worth staying in.

Easy location near subway but quiet facility to get away from the busy streets. Great value for the price. Can’t wait to return when the rooftop is renovated. We did not take advantage of other amenities as we only stayed one night.

I forgot a pair of Chanel sunglasses in the room. I called the hotel 1 hour after i checked out and 2-3 times per day. for the last 3 days. I’m still waiting for housekeeping or management to call me back. Each day is an excuse. Guests beware - if you forget something in the room the staff will ignore your calls and keep your forgotten belongings.

Expensive, no complimentary breakfast, closed rooftop, dirty room and rushed service. Not worth paying hundreds to stay a night. The surrounding location isn’t so great...a lot of used condoms on the streets :\

Room was comfortable and clean, hotel was nice and quiet. There's a daily room deposit fee of $50, which isn't stated in the email, though you do get it back once you check out. They have room service, and they also allow food delivery to come to your door, which is convenient.

Spent one night during the Christmas season. Easy walk from Penn Station, and not that far from the theater district. Staff was very friendly, and we never had to wait in a line at the check in/out counter. Check in/out was quick and easy. The room was bigger than comparable hotels in NYC. I chose a city view room on the 18th floor and had a great view of the Empire State Building. Wifi worked well. Room was very clean and modern.
user_name:
Sara B
West Sand Lake, New York

review_body: Good location good front desk but poor housekeeping - No vacuums floor, dust, hairs on the shelf and hair dryer. Lack of coffee creamers and cups in the room, not enough towels. anyway DIRTY ROOM. Sad

Extremely small rooms and very pricey! Diamond members are not welcomed properly. I stay many nights a year at Hiltons hotels and this has been the worse specially for $500 a night stay. I personally will never stay here again

I was a little disappointed with a number of things during my stay as i have listed in the survey. hopfully i can get some bonus points to reconsider staying here agian during one of my numerous work travels.

Room was not properly cleaned as we found used lotion under the bed, a toenail on the carpet, snot on the blinds, a used ear plug on the floor and 75% of products in the fridge to purchase were out. We let the front desk know and it was basically laughed off and didn’t feel like it was a big deal. The Asst Front Desk Manager tried to make excuses around the conditions. You don’t do that in the hotel/hospitality industry. You accept the mistake/challenge and use it as an opportunity to grow and correct the issue and create the outcome for the guest to have a reason to believe why they should be spending money at the property. They gave two vouchers for breakfast and 2k in points and a refresh of the room. Unfortunately, the room was never refreshed the next day and never was offered a different room. Will not be staying at this hotel again.I emailed pictures the Asst Front Desk Manager for follow up. She copied 5 different individuals on the reply. No one else reached out and no additional follow up or phone call was made to make sure everything was ok. Part of the definition of hospitality is hospitable treatment of a guest. This was not felt.I hope this provides a learning opportunity for Hilton and this property.

Hotel is situated in an good location. The staff were all very accommodating despite the fact the hotel's online system was done when arrived. The room was missing a television remote but this was quickly fixed with a quick call to have someone send it up.

In NYC, I've stayed at the Hilton Midtown, Hilton Times Square, Hilton by the United Nations, and I've visited the Hilton Millenium Downtown. Each property has its own special feel. There is something that makes the hotel unique. The Hilton Times Square offers turndown service, but no executive lounge. The Hiton midtown has a lounge. The Hilton Fashion District is just a hotel. It could easily be a Doubletree, as it feels just like the one up a few blocks off of 6th ave. The staff is awesome at the Hilton FD, but there arent even ice machines on the floors, any of them. When I inquired I was told to go to the front desk to get ice. The rooms are small, especially in comparison to midtown and times square Hiltons, and the elevators work really, really, hard to keep up with the traffic. The gym is undersized, what you would expect at a Hampton Inn. 2 treadmills, a bike, and an elliptical. The cardio machines only have 2 television channels. Back in the rooms, guests are treated to comfy beds, which is what really matters, but cheap toilet paper and tissues. I end this asking, what makes this a Hilton? It seems to have a presence for the brand in Chelsea to me, and that's all.
user_name:
JMW757677
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed in this hotel after being booked it through work. It is very centrally located in Manhattan which meant that access to attractions and my work was good. The hotel however was a bit old and tired and could do with a refurb. The restaurant is being refurbished so that means no breakfast in the morning! Also soundproofing is poor, I was on the 9th floor and the traffic noise was bad (I lived in central London for 16 years so I am used to traffic noise, but this was something else). Beds were comfy though and wifi was fast. I probably wouldn't go back if I had a choice, unfortunately.

Hotel with a good location in the middle of Nomad , however do not expect Hilton quality Closet and drawers were minimal specifically considering the room was equipped with two queen beds. Toiletries are exactly the ones you may find in a Doubletree Hotel

Had issues with this hotel a year or so ago. Figured I give it a second chance since it’s convenient to my customer. Won’t go back. No restaurant and no bar due to construction but the room nights were still $500. No notification till I checked in. Breakfast offer was to go up the block! Ridiculous! Room was noisy small and bathroom was worse! As a diamond member really disappointed.

I called to cancel a reservation and was given the run-around for three days by hotel employees. When I was finally put in touch with the manager, Jackie, she screamed at me and slammed the phone down without even allowing me to respond. I was shocked and taken aback. I have 400k Hilton Honors points from staying at Hilton properties and have never been treated this way, anywhere around the world. I see that the hotel has tried to justify its poor service in response to some of the other negative reviews. Sadly, there is no policy that excuses treating paying customers like garbage. I will be staying at the Conrad and look forward to enjoying their excellent standards.
user_name:
jenshan88
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Visited with family and had two rooms close by on 21st floor, good view and rooms clean and spacious by New York standards. Reception staff welcoming and helpful. Location is great, easy walk to Chelsea Market, Macy's, 5th Avenue and most sights. Two negatives to our visit, rooftop bar and restaurant closed during our stay which was disappointing and airport taxi booked by hotel did not arrived in promised timescale, proved stressful end to visit, concierge not particularly helpful in resolving this just suggested we got an uber!

Stayed here in November 2019 for 5 nights with family.The location is very good - close to many attractions and the 28 Street subway station to connect you to the rest of the city. The area is kind of run down though, although the hotel have no control over this.The rooms are very very tired and in need of a refresh. The furniture is not particularly well kept and has obviously not been changed for a number of years. The cleaning service was terrible - our room was serviced just once during a 5 day trip. We were left without clean towels, toilet paper and toiletries were not replaced and trash was not removed from the room for the duration of our stay. The reception staff were however very nice - checking in and out was simple and efficient. The hotel also provided a car service to JFK for $73 fully inclusive. Overall, it was adequate but very expensive for the service and facilities that are provided. There are many better properties to spend your cash at in Manhattan and I would definitely not recommend for family groups.

I booked a hotel room at the Hilton New York Fashion District today thinking it was for the 11th to the 12th of December. Through some error it was registered for tonight (Dec. 3rd). When I called the hotel and spoke with the manager, Jackie, she refused to cancel the booking! I am currently in Los Angeles and it is impossible for me to stay there tonight. This was an honest mistake and I am very surprised Hilton would treat their Honors members and the general population this way! I am not sure that one night for $144 is worth Hilton losing a customer that stays 50-70 nights per year in hotels

I checked into thie hotel, gave my car to the hotel to be parked and it was a great experience. The night was good and I checked out early am. As I checked my receipt I was charged $60 for parking yet I had a rate which included parking (I made a reservation with an agent who confirmed that the $129 rate included parking at 1/2 off with regular rate being $106). The hotel refused to refund that and told me to call Hilton corporate. After getting into the car and getting out to get coffee down the block I noticed the car was hit while in the possession of Hilton, I emailed pictures to the hotel and contacted the corporate for these issues and no one was very forthcoming with resoilution. I was told to contact garage. Seriously? I was charged by Hilton and gave my car to Hilton yet I have to speaek with someone else? 2 days later I am told I should have contacted police, garage, etc. And here I was thinking that Hilton and this property are professionals and will try to help the customer who was trying to get home before the snow sotrm. Guess not. So go somewhere else if you do not want to be charged twice and get your property damaged. Sad that if the Diamond customer is treated like this what happens to others?P.S. I was asked if I wanted breakfast or 2000 points and I chose points. Yet to see them.....
user_name:
Argus2000
New York City, New York

review_body: Visited the Hilton hotel on 26th Street in mid-November. It was a central location, in the middle between good restaurants to the south and theatre to the north. The staff was very friendly. Maririan, at the front desk, was exceptionally nice and courteous. The hotel elevators are extremely fast. My room was on the 15th floor and it never took more that 12 seconds (I actually counted) to get from the lobby to my room, so that was a nice bonus. The hotel itself was okay. It was rated 4 stars. But it was a little tired looking and the rooms (at least mine) was a little dated. The hotel is more of a 3 or 3.5 stars than 4. On a positive note, my room was quite spacious (by New YORK City standards).

Definitely a very good place to stay. Staff at check-in, front desk, and room maid service all very friendly and happy to answer requests. I didn't have many. Very clean rooms. Also my room facing back was very quiet.

Once again, Hilton missed the chance to make good on the lack of beverage and food services. My suggestion would have been to have a delivery option. I'm hung up on this, since I keep mentioning it. Bottom line, this was a rip off. Sorry, but that's how I feel.

This Hilton is in close proximity to the action but far enough away that you have peace and quiet. Small, clean rooms, Comfortable beds and pillows. Roof top bar and hotel restaurant were under construction.

On November 10, 2019 my husband and I checked into the Hilton NY Fashion District. We found a used condom and a grape on the floor. This was deeply disgusting and disturbing. Once we saw the used condom and grape . We packed up and went to the lobby to report this and to request a refund. The Director of Front Office refused to refund the money. She said that we would have to contact Priceline to have them approve a refund. When we called Priceline, they said she denied the refund. We called her back she said they were conducting an investigation and that she did not say that Priceline had to authorize the refund. Hilton complaints said they would follow up as the Director has not been honest about the protocol. Hilton never followed up, and when I called back they denied the claim. No refund or voucher offered, instead we were offered dishonesty. The agent on the last call hung up.The irony is that Hilton vacations has no problem incessantly calling me. Deeply disappointed by the brand and hotel.

This hotel is just a short walk from the most iconic part of Manhattan, Madison Square Park. From there you can see the Flatiron Building, Empire State Building, Met Life Tower and New York Life Insurance buildings. There are also plenty of great restaurants. The hotel staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful.

Great location! Great staff! Very clean. Need drink and vending machines on premises. Breakfast would have been nice. Staff very helpful. Room was very clean. Lobby was great. Check in and check out was very easy.

Rude front desk if you like being mistreated from the minute you walk in this is your lady. Not a hello, not a smile, a perfunctory you have two free bottles of water. It wasn’t busy it wasn’t late why not great guests. The rooms are small and the district is pretty dirty

The (really fun) roof bar and restaurant are closed for renovations, and they have dropped the room prices accordingly, making this an absolute bargain for NYC in holiday season. Really. We got a king bed, high floor, city view for $215 (just under $255 with all the various taxes). There's me, long time metro resident and "bridge and tunnel" gal the last 40 years, snapping pix of the Empire State Building from our room! We really enjoyed the old rooftop bar; looking forward to the improvements. But right now it's a great opportunity if you're looking for a place in Midtown. Ten minutes walk to Penn Station and less to the 23rd St. PATH station. Also check out Crompton's across the street.

I am staying at this hotel now and this morning at 8 am someone opened the door to our room - while we were in bed. Who had the key to our room and how did this happen? We reported the incident to security. But there is definitely a security breach here. Is there someone running around with a master key, hoping to find an empty room at breakfast time ? Scary possibility. Let’s see if security even bothers to get back to us. In the meantime, beware
user_name:
charlotteandwilbur
New York City, New York

review_body: I was surprised on check in to find the restaurant and rooftop lounge under consrtuction. I chose this facility since it was supposed to be a full service hotel. There was nothing online or in any communication that advised me of the renovations. The hotel is very tried and worn in the Lobby, Hallways and rooms. However, the staff (Front desk, Sid especially) was friendly and very helpful. They are the only reason I did not change hotels.

This is a great location, close to subway to travel to all of the different areas. Walking distance for a lot as well. The staff is excellent and friendly, one of them even went out of her way to go outside and help me get my car parked! There is a sweet restaurant/bar right across the street I recommend to unwind at the end of the day. The restaurants inside the hotel were all being renovated so I cannot comment on that. We ordered room service from the local place they use and it was really good and quick. One of our items was wrong and they just credited our bill - no quest asked! The room was small and faced the alleyway..but it was comfortable. Not a luxury Hilton but clean. We weren't there much anyway. The only thing that I really was disappointed in was the parking. They have self parking and valet but there is no signage when you get there so you pull up in front of the building and have no idea where you are supposed to go? The streets are crowded so its very nerve wrecking...If you arrive, you can pull directly in by the door to check in and from there you will be told where to park or get valet. prices are about 45-60.00 and you pay a fee to take it out and in again. You should prob avoid this. Weekend street parking is free but if you don't move your car before 7 am Monday it WILL have a ticket for 115.00! I have the ticket. So I feel that the parking is the biggest issue here, the stay was comfortable and clean.

Spent two nights - total cost was $670 with parking, so price was OK. Location isn’t bad - near several subway lines. Staff is nice. Clean.Rooftop restaurant and bar is closed. Get that, but at least put up a vat of coffee in the lobby in the interim. Room had minibar stocked with a can of coke, nuts and KitKats. Either stock in properly or remove it. Carpet in room seemed new, but it wasn’t laid right. Bed was not great.Hotel could be much better with fairly minor fixes and attention to detail.

The hotel was clean but tired. Management notified me in advance that the restaurant and bar are shut down for renovation. The front desk staff was helpful and polite (impressively polite for NYC.) My room was missing part of the towel supply on day one, and the bathroom sink drained very slowly. While acceptable for a short business stay, you may want to look at alternate Hiltons or Doubletrees in NYC, at least until the restaurant reopens.

The mattress was very comfortable and the room was spacious for New York. Very nice and clean bathroom with great desktop work area. In room coffee, ironing board and large mirrors. The room is nicely lit.

The hotel's on-site restaurant was closed for renovation. The rooftop bar/lounge was closed for renovation. The only restroom facility was a single-occupant facility located at the front desk which the employees posted an "out of service" sign on the door half of each day. The mattresses are hard and need to be replaced, and the bed pillows are extremely uncomfortable. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Stayed one night for a concert at MSG. This property is in a great location. Walkable to a lot of sights such as Central Park, Times Square, Empire State Building, Broadway, etc. Front desk staff was incredibly friendly and apologetic for not having an upgrade due to my Hilton status. The restaurant and bar on property are both closed indefinitely at the moment, however, there are endless options close by. I had a standard queen room. Some might find the room size small, but I found it typical for a Manhattan hotel. It was well laid out, spotlessly clean, and it’s purpose very well. Being NYC you will hear street noise but I didn’t find it to be a problem and slept very well. I won’t hesitate to book this property again. I enjoyed my stay very much.

I suggest that anyone stays here. It's a great place for the location. In addition, the price is also was great. I would always go again. Anytime I go to NYC I'll always think of this location. Next time I need to try the fitness center and other services they offe .

Nice midtown location near subway. Restaurant was closed for maintenance but there are many options to eat nearby. Staff very friendly. Room size was good (for NY) and very clean. I would stay here again.
user_location: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
user_name:
sofas186
Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates

review_body: This was our fifth year in a row to NYC and the best hotel yet. There is a great rooftop bar with a laid back beachy vibe (it works in the city weirdly). There's also a great bar across the road, Crompton Ale House which does tasty food (mahi mahi fish tacos) and a nice signature cocktail. I asked for a quiet room when making our reservation. When given our room on the 3rd floor, I was concerned about traffic noise but we were at the back of the hotel and it was the quietest hotel I have stayed in New York! There was no view but you can't have it all. Will stay here again.

We were only in town for one night for a Billy Joel concert at Madison Square Garden and this hotel checked all the boxes for us. Great location and easy walk to MSG. I had limited interaction with the staff but they all seemed pleasant. The room was fine. It’s NYC so everything is a little cramped. We would definitely stay here again.

Enjoyed my stay, staf was friendly and helpful. I just wished their were microwaves and refrigerators(that you can place your own beverages in). Their is a refrigerator with prefilled beverages that you can use at a cost. Overall it was a quick pleasant stay!! I would stay again!!

Clean friendly over the top staff. This hotel continues to excel be it their customer service cleanliness of their rooms. I love staying here! The staff can never do enough. I can’t wait for their remodel to be completed for the restaurant and bar.

We enjoyed our stay here. The hotel room was very nice and roomy and had a nice bathroom, although, the shower door was weird with the way it opened. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. My only concern is that it wasn't in the nicest of areas. My friend and I felt a little 'unsure' about walking back to the hotel late at night by ourself once we were out of Midtown so we took a cab every night back to the hotel which adds up! But, I really did like the hotel itself.

This hotel needs renovation. Very expensive for the quality provided. Room lighting was very bright white. The temperature of the lighting needs adjusted down. Room is tired and fixtures in the room were broken. Location is good.

The hotel is dating. A lot of the furniture is damaged and the hotel generally shows its age. The rooms are some of the smallest I have seen - even in NyC. The size can be okay for a solo traveller but any more and it gets problematic. Had to walk to front desk to get ice, no ice machines and no room delivery. Not the end of the world but definitely not the expected level of service.

From the moment we arrived at the Hilton located in the New York City Fashion District, we were impressed with the level of customer service. When checking in, we had to stand in line longer than the desk clerk thought was reasonable, so the first thing she did when we got to the front of the line was give us four coupons for two free drinks each. The rooms were a bit small, but that is typical in New York City. The rooms were quiet, the beds were very comfortable and there was a large flat screen TV in the room for us to watch our favorite college football play on Saturday afternoon. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant, but breakfast was excellent. A buffet was available or we could order off the menu. The hotel begins serving breakfast at 7:30 AM on Sunday mornings. There were ... I believe four elevators, so we didn't have to wait for an elevator very long at all. The street in front of the hotel was relatively quiet and there was a bar and three reasonably priced restaurants across the street. One of them was a sandwich shop.

I was originally going to give this a 2 star but I am actually going to give it 1 star considering how the front-desk person who checked me out was rude and did not care and did not care when I had issues during my my time here.Most of the front-desk people don't care except for the first I talked to when I checked in and she was helpful and willing to give me high-speed wifi. I had issues throughout my entire stay.The first thing that happened is my room's door could not close all the way and I had to put in a lot of extra work just to close it. I called the front-desk to fix it and to move me to a new room because I did not want to deal with it.When I changed my rooms I could not use the digital key in the Honors App. I tried calling and asking the front-desk for help and they kept saying they were trying but they clearly weren't and did not care one bit especially the front-desk manager who was rude to me when I checked out. That same manager then told me to call the Honors IT Support and when I did they couldn't help me because only employees can call the number and ask for help. They never were able to fix it at any point when I was there. The front-desk person who was useless also never apologized for her garbage actions and was arrogant and kept saying she was the highest up when she clearly wasn't.As for the room, it's quite small. You don't get a couch chair like you do in other hotels. You only get some super tiny ottoman. The bathrooms are pretty good especially the water pressure. But it's overall a tiny room that doesn't have much. You won't like it if you spend a lot of time in your room. It's doable and adequate if you are out all day and night.The sad thing is that this isn't even the worst hotel in NY but nonetheless this is vastly below Hilton average/standards. I would not recommend this hotel due to their terrible customer service and not to mention you can't cancel your booking for this hotel after a day as they want your money as soon as possible.
user_name:
Thomas L
Buffalo Grove, United States

review_body: Just got home from here on October 1st. I would most definitely recommend this hotel. The rooms are large by New York standards... and VERY clean. One of the most exciting things was having HOT water and great water pressure! HA!! The bed was comfortable and the a/c worked well. We had a group of 4 couples and requested rooms near each other - they gladly accommodated us. The elevators worked great, no long waits at all. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is near the 1 line and the F - so we had no issues getting around. They have luggage storage and also an airport shuttle. This was a great stay and very reasonable (by NY standards!)

So disappointed that we had booked to visit New York over Thanksgiving and The Hilton has not mentioned that they were having a full refurbishment during our stay meaning there are no eating/drinking facilities for the duration of our stay!!! Certainly no roof top bar or restaurants to enjoy - as their website is still advertising......Very rude response and very much a don't care attitude that we are a large group.Have stayed at Hilton Hotels in the UK in the past, we have never received such poor customer service as we have with this hotel manager.Appalling "standard" response from the Hilton regarding this!!!!

Those considering booking here should know in advance of no rooftop bar and restaurant from 27 November -2 December.I had booked via Expedia (who were BRILLIANT) for my 50th Birthday for 19 people. A few emails were sent and I eventually ended up being emailed by the most rude hotel manager, who said if we weren’t happy with the facilities to look elsewhere. As a gesture of “goodwill” he would waive the cancellation penalty for the 19 of us.The holiday was paid in full in January 2019. No-one had contacted us to say there would be no facilities for breakfast, dinner, eating or drinking.I am the organiser of 19 family and friends over thanksgiving.The Hilton were rude, unsympathetic, gave me inaccurate information and basically couldn’t care less. Their attitude - if you don’t like it go elsewhere.Expedia informed me that I had the right to cancel my Hilton booking up until 24 November at NO EXTRA Charge. The Hilton manager was disingenuous in offering us a goodwill gesture of waiving the cancellation fee.I feel that travellers should be aware of the lack of facilities available at the hotel, I took a screenshot of their website this afternoon, still promoting the RARE rooftop bar and terrace.I have all of the emails, screenshots and evidence of my experience and If the facilities at the hotel are an important part of your stay, I would strongly recommend checking the situation with hopefully a far more professional and sympathetic member of the Hilton team.

The hotel is very, very clean and the staff in all departments is so nice they are all so helpful, I actually look forward to seeing them each day that is how nice they are. The hotel is close to everything you would possibly need.

This was walking distance from my meetings- so right there is enough to get at least three stars. Then there was the easy breakfast place below, ( with nice staff) pleasant bell station to hold my bags the day I was leaving, a town car to take me to the airport that was not more expensive than Uber, and decent sized rooms in a city where you could find yourself in a closet. No big extras ( wine at five , that sort of thing) but easy and free wifi- and a noon check out. I think as mid range hotels go, this one is a good deal.

Location was exactly what we had hoped for. However, this hotel does not come close to living up tot he Hilton brand. While clean and well appointed, careful which room you choose. we ended up in a shoe box. The mattress was awful, like sleeping on a park bench. The worst part was we had asked for ice several times upon our arrival to chill champagne for our anniversary. We never got it. We called 3 or 4 times. We ended up going out to dinner without our pre-planned toast. I would not stay at this hotel again.

This hotel is one of the best locations in NYC, you are in the heart of Chelsea, walking distance to Flatiron, subways, restaurants, bars, coffee shops! My friends and family stayed here for my wedding weekend and we were all so impressed! The staff is so warm and helpful. Cannot recommend this hotel enough!

Had to fly to NY for a business event, and stayed at the Hilton NY Fashion District...good call by my travel department. Wonderful staff and amenities, and the convenience of having a restaurant on site was an extra plus.
user_name:
Dionne P
New York, United States

review_body: Everything from check in to check out was brilliant with this hotel. The trip was for my mum’s birthday and the hotel left a lovely handmade card and cake in her room which was very nice of them. My room was on the 22nd floor with some great city views. The rooftop bar had some great views across to the Empire State Building. Breakfast in the morning was fantastic and the staff in the restaurant were great. In fact, all staff we came across were great. The hotel is in a great location and really not a far walk from some of the main tourist attractions. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone for a stay in New York!

This hotel in Chelsea is a great location. Lots of restaurants, Whole Foods, Trader Joes, and Fairway. The staff is friendly and helpful. I would suggest you don't do the "free breakfast" which is a $20 per person credit, however, their buffet is $22 and not great, but after taxes and tip, we paid $15 for free breakfast. The other days we went elsewhere for less. The rooms are small but it's NYC, but very clean. The hotel temperature is way too cool for me and the thermostat is cranky.

They didnt have my invoice ready on both the stays. I called them 3 times, they said they will email it, but never emailed them to-date. And they hang up rudely in the middle of the conversation.They then transfer you to 1-800 hilton phone number and send you on a wild goose chase.

We had an enjoyable 5 night stay at this hotel. The rooms are a bit on the small size but very comfortable and clean. Good in room amenities include large TV, coffee/tea maker, bar, iron, safe, hair dryer, toiletries, broadband WiFi, etc.The hotel also has a small gym in the basement and a splendid roof top terrace.The bed was comfortable. There was a bit of noise at night due to squeaky/clunky doors but very little street noise.Location is very good, around 20 mins stroll to Times Square. Plenty of eating places nearby.

I guess as to be expected for the fashion district, the hotel was very stylish and swank, with a modern design and rooftop bar. The front desk staff were all nice and pleasant, and it was super easy to check-in and check-out online, right down to picking a room. It all feels extremely 21st century and I like that the elevator could not be accessed without a room key for extra security. In terms of functionality though, the room was pretty small and felt cramped. We had a city view which I personally liked, and housekeeping was excellent, with the housekeepers always complying with our requests to come back at a certain time right down to the minute. But still the room, bed, and bathroom were all smaller than expected. It was very quiet though - didn't hear any noise from the rooftop bar or the city once inside. And the bed was comfortable as well. It wouldn't be my first choice for staying again, just because overall I would prefer something a bit more spacious than swanky. But it was a good stay!

Location - 26th street 7th Ave. Perfect for Metro access and walk to 5th ave shops or long walk up 25 blocks to Time square. Whatever the preference is. Staff - Friendly and approachableRoom - Disappointing. Room on 20th floor full of dust. I wiped my finger across tops of drawers and bedside table full of dust. Under the bed never vacumed. The TV remote control perfect example of how dirty the room was. Sticky and dirt stuck in the keys. Bedsheets ink stains. Was quite upset for the price i could have stayed somewhere not a Hilton for better quality but being Diamond i always stayed in Hilton. Cleaning service - didnt change loo roll when empty..no shower mat..just little touches were missing. Overall not value for money. Would not stay in a Hilton NYC again.

Everything you need in a hotel. Very nice front desk staff. Clean rooms with comfortable beds. Great water pressure in shower. Restaurant and rooftop bar on premises. Room service. Nice breakfast either a la carte or buffet

Very nice option that is slightly more affordable than some other Hilton Hotels in NYC. Amazing views from rooftop deck on 23rd floor. Clean rooms, excellent staff, and good location! Highly recommend!

Arriving into the Big Apple via the Megabus, we were seeking a close-by location from our drop off with luggage. Walking distance to Times Square and Chelsea was a plus. Standard, perhaps smallish-room. Due to a sudden snow storm, we had to stay an extra night that fortunately the hotel was able to accommodate outside our original reservation. Reception staff seemed busy and always with heads down working. Some good coffee spots close as well.

Room clean. Good coffee and tea selection in room. Good shower. Pillows comfortable. Decor gloomy, not what I expected from a Hilton our room had a dismal view of water towers. I'd rate it a 7/10 - no frills, pretty basic - good base for sightseeing.
user_name:
Hannah4446
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent Friday and Saturday night used the valet checked in early got an awesome room as a Diamond member. The staff was excellent very attentive and helpful. The location is great walking distance to everywhere and the price was very reasonable. Breakfast credit of $20 pretty much covers your breakfast buffet or ala cart you have the option. The rooftop bar is very cool and again very reasonable prices for NYC. Overall excellent stay. I'll be back to this location when visiting this part of Manhattan. Thank you to the staff at this location everything went extremely well.

This Hilton is the definition of VERY GOOD. The staff is extraordinarily friendly, the beds are supremely comfortable, the housekeeping is superlative as the rooms are ultra clean and in good condition, and overall it is very nice. The negatives are that the location is marginal (walking the hundred feet to 7th Avenue is a gauntlet with the same four or five guys sitting on the sidewalk glaring at you and one of them loves to spit at you while you pass) but that of course is not the management's fault. As it isn't their fault that not more than 10 feet from the hotel I saw a cat sized rat dragging half a rotten burger. Another aspect that you can't blame the management for it the view from the room. It is a panoramic view of fire escapes across the tiny alley. To be fair you pay FAR less here than at other Manhattan Hiltons so overall it is quite acceptable!

In the center of Fashion district close to subway and Fashion Institute; conveniently located. The rooms are dingy and dated. Service is sub par. The roof top bar is worth visiting but service is spotty.

Loved this hotel. The room was slightly larger than other NYC hotels I’ve stayed in. Clean and a wonderfully helpful staff. This hotel is in a perfect location and only a couple of blocks from a subway station. Easy walking distance to Times Square and other midtown locations. Also easy to access downtown either by foot or by subway. It’s our new “go to” hotel in the city.

This hotel was the worst Hilton I have stayed in. No fridge (they say, if you ask they will install one - where?) no hairdryer. Small dark room, very limited guide in room, But there was half a chicken under the bed for the whole week I was there. Only discovered it when I was leaving. Not a particularly good area.

AS a Hilton fan It was disappointing to find an old hotel with small rooms ,dark, limited amenities. While the location was good( close to NYU),and the reception staff helpfull. .TYHe hotel did not live up to basic Hilton standards.

We loved the location, great place to base yourself and explore the city. Far enough away from Time Square. We loved Chelsea restaurants and location. The hotel was OK, a typical corporate hotel, no fridge in room, only an electronic mini bar that charged you if you touched it. Staff at reception were lovely and helpful. The roof top bar was an attraction when we booked, disappointing when we got there. It was only open for a few hours a day, we had to line up and show ID to get into the lift. Only went up there once. The Flatiron room around the corner and the Oscar Wild bar when a must see experience for the decor and atmosphere.

I stay in New York city all the time but it was my first time in the fashion district. First of all, it's a great area of the city (so accessible) and the Hilton NYC Fashion District is a terrific hotel. I was there celebrating my girlfriend's birthday and the hotel staff could not have been more accommodating or more willing to make her time in the city special. I particularly would like to highlight the assistant manager John who reached out to me before our trip, was always accessible during the stay, and even followed up after we left. Great overall trip made so much better by this terrific hotel. Absolutely recommend!

Hilton Fashion District is a great location. Close to retail and business districts. Great restuarants for sit-down and take-out. Across the street from great Ethnic and Traditional eating establishments.

I’ve stayed at the Fashion Hilton many times over the past 10 years. The hotel and the staff never disappoints. The rooms are always clean. The restaurant and rooftop bar are very nice and the view is sensational.

The hotel is in a great location with easy access to many attractions and transportation. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, and amenities were comparable to an average 4-star hotel in New York. The front desk staff was pleasant but not very accommodating with a simple request, which was surprising to me from the Hilton brand. It didn't impact my stay and I would certainly go back, I was just surprised that the Hilton brand wasn't more accommodating to guests. I would recommend a stay here and will certainly return.

I'm a Hilton Honors member so check in was easy via the app. My digital key didn't work so I had to be issued a physical key card. I'm hearing from friends that the digital key, while convenient needs some improvement because Hilton has many issues with it. I have used it in the past and it worked fine so this is my first time having a problem. The room was medium sized and good for no more than 2 people I would say. I stayed alone. The bathroom was a decent size. The room was clean overall. The only downside to my room was the refrigerator. It was full of beverages for PURCHASE only. No room for storing food you may bring from outside. Since this hotel is in midtown area there's very few parking options. You can pay for self-park or valet. The parking is NOT cheap. self-parking cost me $40(more for an SUV) and you CANNOT go in/out. Each time you leave you pay the full price again. If you choose valet parking you pay the flat rate $40 plus $10 each time you go in/out. The property is close to public transportation, Uber and cabs are everywhere, or if you like to walk there's some nice things to see close by such as times square(40th/42nd street areas). The staff was very friendly but were limited in granting me a late check-out because they said the hotel was sold out that next day, I was granted and extra half hour but because I utilize the Hilton Honors app I was checked out at the regular check out time. Overall this was a nice stay I just wish there were cheaper parking offered and hopefully they can resolve the digital key issues.

Great Property in a GREAT location. The Hotel is quiet and comfortable. Special shout out to Sid in Reception. Friendly, Professional and ALWAYS remembered my name during my stay. Made me feel welcome and special. Not always the case even though I am a Hilton Diamond. Bravo Sid for the outstanding customer service.

Front desk said " How about I return your... and you go find another Hotel?" At Saturday night. As we were told NICE QUIET room will be ready 3 pm when we early checked in 10am. But when we came back at 6pm, we found out the room is the worst one.

This hotel is in the Fashion District and close to the Peloton studio. I took the bait and went for a "Room with a View" The rooms faced south and I looked at water towers on top of buildings. I learned this at check-in and there was no way to reduce my rate and give me a regular room. Seriously, I don't know how they get away with charging extra for this.

I have love the Hilton Brand for years. This has remained my Brand of choice for over 20 years. I was extremely disappointed with the cleanliness of this hotel and the management unwillingness to stand by the promise of the brand and make it right. Out of respect for the brand I choose to not go into details publicly. My concerns were made clear to the appropriate people.

I stay at this hotel often, several times a month over the past several years. The hotel is located in the Fashion District off of 7th avenue. Within walking distance to Times Square and immediately close to mid town, Flat Iron and Chelsea.The front office staff is superb, very accommodating and they bend over backwards to make sure your stay is pleasant.

My only disappointment was no refrigerator in the room. A mini bar was installed, but no refrigerator. I was told that I can request a refrigerator, but I really do not know where it could fit in the room that would not cause me to trip over it when I get up during the night (and I always have to get up at least once). Otherwise, it is an excellent location for my travels to NYC and I will stay at this property again. The hotel employees provided outstanding service!

Got a great deal from an email. Terrific location, and the hotel looks like it is brand new. For you shower fans, the shower is super strong! The bar left something to be desired, the staff did not care about a couple who came in near closing looking for a meal. Would recommend highly.

I was unable to cancel my reservation with this hotel prior to their deadline. Unfortunately we had a family emergency and spoke to the manager to try to cancel the reservation and instead get a credit or a reduced fee. But she not understanding and very rude despite the reservation being greater than 24 hours away and after explaining the situation resulting in us having to pay the full amount. My family and I have been a loyal Hilton customers but will no longer stay at their hotels after this incident.

My husband and I traveled to NYC for July 4th. Our view as the Empire State Building. The room service is fast, called for ice within minutes it was there. The In room dinning was wonderful the breakfast was delicious. We also had a great meal at the RARE downstairs.

We had just come from a newer Hilton in Boston so maybe had been spoiled. The hotel was nice and helpful staff but maybe rooms looked slightly tired. Location great near to nice areas for dining and short walk to subway. We did not have a fridge but a minibar, you could request one on a waiting list but this did not arrive. In this day most people surely prefer fridge to store own drinks etc. Staff helpfully sent ice on demand though so not a big issue. Air con noisy so take ear plugs in summer! We managed to get late check out for a small charge which was great bonus as we had late flight. In all a good hotel for a short stay with nice staff.

Great choice for business and pleasure in the fashion district. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and generally quiet. Rooftop bar is 21+, and it is a shame that children can not be accompanied by parents to enjoy the view! Otherwise a good Hilton with a nice staff.

It was easy to navigate to the subways and there are plenty of restaurants around the area. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was the perfect size for two people. Will definitely stay here again in the future.

King Bed. Full Bath. Clean hotel. Very relaxing. Black out curtains, AC , valet parking, 12 o clock checkoutMobile app checkoutDigital keyHilton honors Why a 200 text min?Solid hotelNice hotelSpent $100 was well worth it

We stayed on a busy weekend (World Pride Weekend June 2019). The front desk staff was very accomodating, friendly and attentive. The only reason I didn't rate this hotel with a top score was due to the accessibility of the hotel's rooftop bar and the room size. The rooftop bar was only accessible from the main floor/front lobby. On a busy weekend, you will need to wait in line in the lobby to go up to the roof top. We frequented the bar/restaurant directly across the street more than we did the hotel's bar. As noted by a few others who have posted, the rooms were smaller than other Hilton hotels.

Was an awesome experience . We got our room early and were brought a bottle of wine and chocolates .room was very nice and clean. We needed ice and the staff delivered within minutes.We will be visiting again great location between broadway and the village

It's a good location decent price for the room size. Good service at the front desk and the room is very clean but too busy street. The window isn't blocking enough noises from the street. I'd recommend on general but if you wanna get a quality sleep you might wanna choose different side of the hotel

Hilton New York Fashion District is a solid option for stay while in NYC. It is remodeled, and represents standard hotel of Hilton chain. Rooms are smaller than usual, but comfortable, clean and beds are great. This is a no thrill, but a very solid and good place to stay.

Location is great, food in the restaurant is also good, but rooftop bar closed at 11:00 pm which is too early I think.Room is nice, kind of small but it has everything. Coffee in the room was ok not impressive.

I would say that whatever hotel has to deal with - they’re doing great. Check in was smooth, luggage stored until our room was ready, complimentary water bottles given, instructions for breakfast stapled to the bag etc. Room looks new, liked the design, view was okay. Stayed on 12th floor, was relatively loud, all the noise from the street, plus came during Pride Parade and that was another noise issue, hotel has nothing to do with it. Fridge in the room is not designed to store any of guests drinks or food - had to just throw out some leftovers and drinks.Rare Bar and Grill attached to the hotel is what ruins the Hilton Hotel nice impression and image a lot. First, was told during dinner that they are “independent” from the hotel, so I can’t use my 50% employee discount. Decided to have drinks at rooftop - happened to be closed at 10:15pm, quite early and unexpected.During breakfast was seated by hostess who’s looking no other than any hotel guest (sneakers, hoodie, T-shirt, jeans, no name tag or introduction), ordered 2 eggs Benedict Duo, been waiting for them for good 20-25 minutes only to receive hard boiled eggs instead of poached eggs as for the recipe and menu.On top of that, be aware that restaurant automatically charges you 18% gratuity for the service - didn’t deserve that at all for the service we received, that feels almost as a ripoff.

We picked this hotel for a few reasons - proximity to train station, cost, and reviews. I would stay here again above any of the other places I’ve stayed at in the city. It’s really quit, given that the hotel is down a side street. The double bed room is pretty spacious for New York. It’s very clean and nice size bathroom. The water pressure is amazing ! When have you ever had good water pressure in New York! It’s easy to catch a cab and most things are less than 20 mins away. Free WiFi and tv channels for the kids. The restaurant, Rare, is super delicious - the wait staff is super kind and accommodating. The elevator situation is a little strange - you have to get the right one. But literally I have no complaints. My parents also stayed here in a king room and my dad is using a walker - he had no issues with the walk in showers or room space. Really great hotel.

Without a doubt the worst Hilton in the family. I booked a "stay and parking" rate and the Hilton and their parking people severely damaged my car to the tune of $1,200 of damage and refuse to take responsibility. They even attempted to cover up the damage with mismatched paint. They claim the parking lot is responsible although the Hilton NY Fashion District got my money. When I called the hotel manager Tim Peters about the $1,200 of damage, he hung up on me. He has the proof that hotel/agents are responsible. Never again at any Hilton.

I have stayed at this property multiple times and for the most part, it has been a pleasant experience. However, this time around it was a total let down. **Beware of the following**1. Pay attention to your folio at the end of your stay. They will try to sneak charges in your bill e.g. minibar, etc.2. The food at Rare (house restaurant) is marginal at best. Pay close attention to the times they consider breakfast. Get this in writing. 3. Do not allow them to place you on the 22nd floor. The music from the rooftop bar is extremely loud and so are the vibrations--so much so that not even the earplugs we bought made it better.4. Elevators are in need of serious maintenance. 5. Their business center is a joke so if you have work to tend to, forget it. 6. Be prepared to be confronted and greeted with rudeness should you ask for clarification about your charges and concerns especially by the likes of Sade, a manager there.Housekeeping did a great job. To be fair, it's in a great neighborhood but I would recommend Embassy Suites or Hilton Garden Inn around 35th St. John, the manager at the property understands hospitality and he's very professional. Unfortunately this trip around, he was away.

This is my second time staying at this property. I stay here because of the convenience, I normally take the Vamoose Bus from MD and the final stop is at 30th St and 7th Avenue, which is a 5-minute walk to the hotel. Since this hotel is located in the Fashion District and across from FIT, there are plenty of restaurants and shops all within walking distance. There are several Subway stops and the crosstown bus on 23rd is a convenient way to travel to the Eastside. I would recommend this hotel for a great weekend stay.

Thanks to an Amtrak snafu I arrived at the hotel a little before 3am after the short walk from Penn Station. I had used the Hilton app to check in early and select my room, so check-in could not have been any smoother - just what you want at 3am! I asked for a 6am wake-up call, and the call came at 5:58. Well done! My room (201) was nicely appointed, with a fully stocked fridge and all the attention to detail one would expect from a Hilton property.

Conveniently located with a great terrace top view of the city. This hotel is in the Fashion District. We were greeted by Friendly staff and helpful concierge. At check out the car service was waiting as arranged by the hotel to ensure we made it to the airport on time. The restaurant Food left a bit to be desired. We found several great restaurants within walking distance. Safe neighborhood

I stayed here last month with a friend in a 2 bed room. We were on a low floor at the back which was good for us as it overlooked other buildings so no traffic noise, but there was noise from people using the doors to the stairs next to the room. Great location, not as busy as midtown and would definitely stay in this area and hotel again.

Room is always clean and comfortable, but the staff makes this one of my favorites in the city. They are super personable, have great tips on the area and remember repeat guests exceptionally well. I always stay here when it's available.

Excellent Hilton property with a wonderful rooftop bar. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The room was clean and well apportioned. The location was ideal, although there may not be any bad spots in Midtown.

This is a nice and modern style hotel. Rooms are updated and the location is great.... Central to Madison Square Garden... 6 blocks away.... walked to Chelsea as well as Herald Square. Very convenient to everything and rooms are very clean

This is a very nice hotel with great staff. Only stayed for one night but the room was cleancomfortable and the location was great. We were near everything we needed to see for the one night. Easy walking distance to Madison Square Garden, Times Square and Fifth Avenue. For NYC it was easy in and easy out parking provided only a few buildings away, they do validate so some savings. Did not eat in the hotel so nothing to say about that. Clean comfotable modern hotel for what was a great rate for NYC. Woudl stay again.

The staff is awesome (front desk, bellhops & maid service), however the MOST important is the cleanness of the rooms and they are very clean :) I stay here about 40 times a year and always enjoy my stay here

The hotel is conveniently located in Chelsea neighborhood with access to various subway lines. Rooms are nice but walls are very thin. I heard a baby crying early in the morning and could hear children in the hallways. Nice hotel and location but not sure if I would return.

For a Manhattan hotel, the location is excellent. Good value and lovely service. Go to the Highline, which is within walking distance. We enjoyed the restaurant at the hotel as well. Chelsea Market is also fun.

This hotel is far from the best hotel I’ve been these last years. I do not recommend to stay over there as the personal at front desk are unpleasant and also the cleaning team.Just the personal at the restaurant were polite and took care of the customers. Rooms were not really clean and I was literally surprised of the cold attitude towards the customers. It was my first trip in NY and for sure next time I will not go in this hotel . It’s a pity as the geographic place is interesting downtown NY.

This hotel is in a perfect Location. Really enjoyed my stay. Room was a good size, great bed and the staff was very nice! The parking garage was just a few steps away. This will definitely be my go to hotel within the Fashion District.

With Hilton you expect a level of quality and service above that of other brands, This hotel met the high standards expected of Hilton and enjoyed my stay and the customer service provided. I would stay here again

The room and beds were clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly. The rooms are good sized and everything in the room was in working order. I requested and received a refrigerator in the room. The top floors are high enough that street noises do not disturb. The housekeeping staff was ok -> did not replace dirty glasses and did not restock coffee properly.The gym did not have working A/C one day and the temps in there got close to 76 degrees.
user_location: Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska
user_name:
Farhana B
Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska

review_body: Stayed over for an early meeting and chose this hotel for it's restaurant,rooftop lounge and proximity to my office. The staff was great, greetings as soon as I entered and checked in in less than 5 minutes. The room was clean, but a bit small. Food at Rare was great and reasonably priced. There was a private party on the rooftop lounge, so had to wait until after 9:30 to be able to go up. I was a bit disappointed by there claims for 360 degree views as part of it is basically from a hallway. But it is still rooftop bar in the city so I'm not going to grade it too harshly. Overall great stay, and will stay again.

This hotel is a full-service Hilton in a sort of out of the way location. Rooms are good sized and equipped. Good elevators. Has a roof-deck bar which uses one of the elevators during evenings. Excellent front desk staff. No executive lounge but fill breakfast provided. Clean and better than most hotels surrounding it. And less expensive than similar properties.

Stayed at this property for a work event. Perfect proximity to downtown area attractions like the High Line and the Whitney Museum. Also close to many good restaurants and bars. Room is adequate, clean comfortable and not too small.

Overall experience is very good but the room doors noise isolation should be better. Good location. Several blocks from the Penn Station. No breakfast but many places for breakfast around. Stayed only for one night.

Enjoyed my stay. Staff friendly and helpful. Location is great, walking distance to many sites, just a couple blocks from the Subway at 26th St Station. Beds, pillows, and room temperature/AC comfortable. Just remember to turn the vanity light on in the bathroom because the main light is on a timer and the room went dark while I was in the shower, which was reactivated as soon as I reached for the shower door. Ha ha. I had a street-side room and even on the Saturday night it was quiet. Also appreciate the flat-rate car service to the airports provided by the hotel, basically same price as ride-share companies but you can organize up to 30 minutes in advance of when you need it. Definitely will return.

Excellent location, service and quality. Loved the neighborhood and nearby subway #1 train made getting around even easier. I travel by train to NYC and the hotel is only one stop from the train station.

had to go to nyc for a conference at the javits center and location was great. It's away from the busyness and crazyness of time square and was about 15-20 minute walk to javits center. There's also a cool rooftop you can have a drink on.

Google classifying this as a 4-star hotel is comical. This is a basic Hilton with basic amenities. It has a bed that's not that comfortable, towels that feel like sandpaper, and a fridge that's stocked with expensive goodies leaving no room for you to store your drinks. The location is good, but not worth the money unless you really want to boost your HH status.

This is a well run hotel in a less congested portion of Manhattan yet still readily accessible to Times Square. It was not time consuming to get the elevator and the staff was very friendly. However, be advised the room is barely adequate in space, 1 queen size room, but the lighting is insufficient to read by.

The location on 26th and 6th is pretty good because the hotel area is not as crowded as in the Theater District but still very walkable to Hudson Yards, the theater and hundreds of good restaurants. The rooms are very small and the staff is helpful, nothing surprising in NYC and the lighting is dim, hello mood lighting. All in all a perfectly fine place to stay. The staff is very helpful and pleasant.

We were with family of 5 stayed for 7 nights end of April / beginning of May. We had two rooms on 21st floor - 1 king bed (for 2 pers), one double beds (for 3 pers). Nice, clean rooms, very comfortable beds (best sleep since long, and no lag :-) ), clean bathroom with spacious shower, everything well equipped: safe, hair drawer, iron and ironing board. Fridge only for hotel drinks (no possibility to place own stuff). Free Wi Fi, which however needs to be refreshed every day. We enjoyed nice view on Empire State Building (our kids less lucky, but still OK). I highly recommend higher floors (15+). Excellent location, just few minutes walk from Empire State and Maddison Square Garden (perfectly located on the 26th St, between three subway lines, between 7th Ave and 6th Ave. A comfortable and friendly hotel to stay to explore New York. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you want to eat breakfast or lunch nearby, enjoying wide selection of freshly made ready food we recommend Sunac, just 100 m over the corner.

The big point of this hotel is the staff. All of those we met are great. We were in NYC for Easter Sunday and the next day. We stayed at 2 different hotels because we wanted to see both and one of them was this one. I am a bit disappointed with the quality of rooms at this hotel. We have had to call reception a few times for different things: thermostat that doesn't work, missing coffee in the room, no ice machine etc etc. I am just surprised that Hilton does not upgrade in such a prime location. We are used to the Hilton in Québec City and frankly it has much more class than this. The beds were not comfortable at all, it felt more like a trampoline than a bed. The bathroom was ok and although we could hear quite a bit of noise at night, not many hôtels in NYC have fully sound proof locations. I dont know, if I would go back to this specific location...

In the past year, I have stayed at five different Hilton brand properties around Manhattan. I believe I have now found my new home for when I come to New York City. The staff was friendly and helpful.The hotel is perfectly located between three subway lines -- 8th Ave (FM), 7th Ave (1), and 6th Ave (CE). It is also only a five minute walk to/from Penn Station.

Family of 5 stayed for 7 nights over Easter. We had two rooms. Both with two double beds. Reception very pleasant and very helpful. Rooms clean, beds very comfortable, shower spacious and rooms made up to a high standard daily. Hotel restaurant pleasant and staff wonderful. We asked for a fridge in our room. Wi Fi provided for our entire stay - a real bonus with three teenagers!Hotel is central and only a few minutes walk from Empire State, Maddison square garden,Penn station and Maddison square park. A great clean, comfortable and friendly hotel to stay to explore New York. We also enjoyed eating in Wagamama’s at Maddison square park, good value and quick service.

Hotel was very convenient for a one night stay. An easy walk from penn station and a good base for exploring the midtown area. Staff was courteous and pleasant.
