My friend left his passport in the room safe and they were quick to retrieve it which was very much appreciated. As a diamond member I received the following benefits:-$20 per person for breakfast or 2,000 bonus points -2 free bottled waters at check in -premium WiFi usage-no upgrade applicable (I don’t think the hotel offers more than a standard king or queen with view)The room itself was clean and comfortable. I had room 1911 which offered a nice view of the city and faced the street. Bed was very comfortable. Standard size room for manhattan (re: small) but adequate. Though the diamond benefits were not mind blowing I would not hesitate to stay here again if need a convenient midtown base.

I stayed at this hotel 4/24-4/25. Hotel is lovely, my room was great, no issues. The reason for my review is to compliment Shavonne (I think I am spelling this wrong, sorry!) she was fantastic and very kind. She assisted me with all my bags including this huge, heavy box I had for work. If it wasn't for her I would have struggled. A big thank you! I will certainly be back given how I was treated. Great job!

My rating for this hotel is based on the service provided by the staff. Everyone was attentive and made sure that my needs were met. I received emails before and after my stay asking about the hotel and how my stay was. Attention to customer detail is important to them and I like this!

During our stay, 1 elevator was torn up the entire time (4 days). They have a rooftop bar and at about 5-6 they dedicate one elevator to the bar. That left 1 elevator for all guests to use. Hotel staff was there and they ignored those of us waiting to go to our rooms and made the bar guest the priority. It was rude and totally not acceptable. I would understand if they had 2 other elevators going but they did not. Also, i arrived early and asked for an early check in. Nope! It was almost 3:30 before our room was ready. We sat at the restaurant next door for 1 1/2 hours waiting. Also, i asked for a quiet room because my daughter has health issues and needed to be sure she could rest at night. Nope! They put us in the room right behind the elevator shaft. Not okay! It was the worst experience we have ever had at a Hilton!

The good: The room was clean, shower was hot, and the bathroom was clean and everything worked well. The staff was friendly especially Mily at the front desk and John who helped me with car services. The bad: I paid extra for a higher floor and bigger room. Wow, it was like a bedroom and we were on the 22 floor close to the rooftop bar which I thought was going be fun but ended up keeping us awake. DJ on Saturday evening was loud. I am pretty hip for my age but we did a lot of sight seeing and walking. So the noise was a bit disturbing. When I called the front desk to complain they offered me eye plugs. When we tried to drink at the two hotel bars they did not have Jack Daniels, Captain Morgan, Absolute Vodka, or Riesling. Are you kidding me? Where in NYC? 1 out of the 3 elevators was broken and it made going up and down a logistical nightmare. Waiting as long as 20 minutes just to go up or down is ridiculous. The Keurig coffee maker in the room was on this high shelf which was strange and difficult to use and fill with water. I am 5'7 so not exactly short but it was almost impossible to use. This was a surprise weekend for my girlfriends 50 th birthday, and we got engaged on Saturday when we were there. Not exactly the best experience. Do you want to be in the bar business or the hospitality business? Because the noise from the roof top bar disturbed your guests and you didnt care. When we checked out NO ONE asked how are stay was. Next time I am in NYC I will stay at a Marriott.

Cleanliness of the room was poor, 2 out of the 3 elevators were out of service, and the email correspondence directly from the hotel manager (on duty) contradicted what was actually done, re: having a room key disabled with my wife unable to access a new key. This despite the manager assuring me that my stay would be uninterrupted form a split reservation stay. We are met with rudeness at the front desk when I voiced my complaints. Stay away.

You don’t expect large rooms in NYC but the room at the Hilton Fashion District was well laid out and met everything I needed for my stay at the hotel. Good staff, helpful and friendly and resolved a minor issue with billing for laundry very quickly. I would definitely stay here again.

Going to a Hilton in NYC, I expected it to be luxurious and spacious, like other Hilton’s I’ve stayed in, but it was neither. Of course it was clean, and the staff were lovely, but the rooms were extremely small, the breakfast food was just atrocious and the walls let in all the sounds from everyone around you. I would whole-heartedly recommend looking elsewhere to stay, even though it is in a good part of town.

I'm a former New Yorker - was back this week for a conference at FIT. This hotel is great - clean rooms, relatively quiet, and in a perfect location. Had a hiccup with the internet that was remedied immediately by Nick. Had room service last night - delicious burger with truffle fries. Bathroom is shower only - so if you're looking for a soaking tub you're out of luck. Love the digital key - works like a charm. Hotel is pretty tiny but it's NYC - if you're spending your time in the hotel you've missed the point of this city. Will definitely stay again if I'm back for events in this neighborhood.

I stay for a weekend to meet some friends and my experience was great. All of us stay at this hotel and we like it very much. I would stay here again. The app makes the check out process very effective. The front desk personnel were welcoming, helpful, they speak several languages and very attentive. Located in the fashion district was very important for the type of trip I had. The view from room 2008 was great and loved observing the night lights from the room. It was very clean and bed was very comfortable helping me to fall asleep quick. There are a lot of eating options around as well. Love it!

Really great front desk staff, very friendly housekeeping staff. Rooms were a decent size, with a good king bed, small closet, desk space, drawers, nightstands and plenty of power outlets. In room Keurig. No clock in the room! Large enough bathroom with good sized shower and cubbies under the sink for storage – good lighting (for once) however, no magnifying mirror. Nothing special about the room décor, the shower tile grout showing some mold/discoloration that should be attended to. They missed our standing request for feather-free, but brought foam pillows quickly when requested - two decent, two overly firm; comforter was not feather. We were on the back (alley) side facing the office building next door (no view, limited sunlight), so completely quiet all night long, but you can hear room doors banging when people come back at night and leave in the AM (normal business hours, not late night and late rising folks). Location at the edge of Chelsea, but easy enough to walk to a number of sites and restaurants in Chelsea, Flatiron, etc. Parking is $45 for self park with no in/out privileges and $60 for valet with in/out (add $5 if it's a SUV). We did not take the continental breakfast offered to elite members. We did not get to the rooftop bar.

Staff was amazing. They were fast, always available, knowledgeable and super friendly. The room was small but very clean. Plenty of water pressure. I just wish it was a little quieter but it is a hotel (not my home) so no complaints.Breakfast (I chose buffet) options were fresh and serving area clean. Servers and host were friendly and attentive.

This hotel is fairly basic in terms of facilities and design, but is a great option if you're looking for a basic-solid stay in the city.The location is great, room was super clean, the bed was especially comfortable and the fitness room is small but good.A special shoutout to the front-desk team:I stayed there for my wedding weekend, and even though it's not your typical honeymoon option, after we mentioned this to the reception, they sent some sweet treats and a bottle of wine to our room later that day - which we really appreciated.

Helpful and friendly staff, easy check in. Rooms are small but very clean and comfortable Hilton beds. Noise was not an issue and certainly can be in NYC. The thermostat didn’t work and the room was pretty warm. If you stay here, the location is walking distance to all kinds of food/sights/shopping but there are no views from the rooms.

The hotel is not what you'd expect of the Hilton brand. It's incredibly old and dated - felt dirty. Only 2 elevators were operational and wait times were crazy. It just wasn't a quality experience for me.

Stayed for 2 nights (22 - 23 Feb). Hotel location was great and there were amenities nearby for your essential needs. The staff at the reception were really helpful and nice. I will come back again if i am next in NY.

This hotel is well located near many restaurants near by. It has his own and if you like a great hamburger with a cold beer ,that is the place .The rooms are averages ,a little bit old. Mine was fairly large facing an office building but no noise from the street.The complementary internet connections was okYou get your money's worth for your stay.Try it.

Stayed one night during snow storm in February. Had high floor queen bed room with view down upon buildings in the area. Room was sufficient and compact, but smallish and lacked a comfortable sitting seat (albeit there was a desk chair). Also lacked a frig, which would have been nice. The cooler in the room was restricted to items in the minibar with no extra room for personal items (and note about incurring a charge if anything was moved). Also, strangely there was no ice bucket for cooling food items or access to ice machines (apparently ice has to be requested at the front desk). If you can get a decent price it is a good place to stay, but other Hilton family properties in the area can provide more value as they have more amenities. Staff were helpful and the location is a plus if you want to stay in this area, as it is loaded with places to nosh and shop. About short two block walk to #1 train, uptown or downtown. Has top floor bar area which is accessed via a separate and guarded elevator. Breakfast buffet offerings have broadened since my last stay a few year ago, but be aware that buffet items are in a separate room adjacent to restaurant. If you can get a good price, it is worth the stay.

First off, I hated my room. Yes, I’m used to small nyc rooms, but this one was really cramped and dark. Also, it lacked a room service menu. And after calling for one in the morning, it took a really long time for one to be delivered. Since I’m here on business, not having a menu promptly delivered is a problem because then I don’t have enough time to eat. All in all, a hotel fail. Luckily I have lots of other options in the future.
user_name:
rastagrrl
Castleton On Hudson, New York

review_body: I travel extensively and was pleasantly surprised. The room is small, typical NY. Clean, modern and well laid out. Liked Keurig coffee machine rather than the usual undrinkable swill and cheap machine in many hotels. I like room service because I work late. This Hilton still has it and the food was very good and the french onion soup was terrific. Scope of menu limited but ok. Service was friendly and quick.

This hotel is in a fantastic location for all of New York's "tourist-y" attractions - Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Museum are all a walk or a walk + subway ride away. We also used Lyft rides a few times when we got too far away from a subway station or got tired. The room was a bit small, but we haven't stayed anywhere else in Manhattan and maybe that's just the norm? Would have liked to have a microwave and especially a fridge. Other than that, great hotel and location for the price - we would stay here again!

My family and I stayed here at the last minute. Rooms were bigger than expected for a Manhattan hotel and very central. Service was good at front desk with bilingual staff. Would repeat again no doubt. We stayed for one night at decent rate.

I stayed at this hotel last week and the overall experience was horrible. Here are some of the "low"lights from my stay ...- issues during check-in- only two of the hotel's three elevators were working, so usually had to get in line to get to my room- the room, which overlooked 26th Street, was quite dark to begin with ... this was compounded by the fact that the lights in the pantry were out of order (service came up and looked, told me the lights were on backorder)- no room service other than from the restaurant downstairs .... which, when I ordered a steak from them refused to substitute my mashed potatoes for a salad (seriously)- garbage put outside of the room during the evening was still there in the morning (three times)- no complementary water in the rooms- coffee service is via Keurig (yuck) with coffee-mate creamers to go!- shower ran out of hot water on one occasion- ran out of Kleenex in the bathroom- shower leaked on the floor (every time)- elevators smelled like potetc....The best part of my visit to this hotel was checking-out. Don't go.

My friend chose this hotel because of his work. The subway station is very close by. Also close to where a Wendy Williams tapes as well as Rachael Ray. Restaurants near by. Room was clean bed comfortable. Room has mini bar but not a fridge.

Hilton Closets to 5th Ave! Excellent service and atmosphere. Convenient location and restaurant right across the street! Close to 5th Avenue shopping and cafes for coffee. Parking however is down the street.

Visitors from the UK but very familiar with NY and its hotels. This Hilton is in the Chelsea/Garment district and well placed for most sights, we walked both north and south. We struggled a little for restaurants in the immediate area however. Interesting area with lots of architectural history. Greeted very warmly by reception and on discovering it was both a birthday and anniversary celebration for us, tried to upgrade our room but it was a Saturday and the hotel was full, so gave us a choice instead. We opted for a 2nd floor room overlooking the street. To be fair we were told it might be noisy. It’s New York, we haven’t come for peace and quiet..... however with the exception of a garbage truck one morning, and we were already awake, we didn’t hear a thing. The room was at the end of a corridor and was quiet also, no passers by. Room itself was big enough for two, a little more lighting would have been helpful, bathroom good except shower leaked onto floor each time but towels sorted that out. Bed was comfy and we slept well. Furniture a little scratched and tired and the window was missing a privacy curtain. Two lifts which were sometimes swift in arriving and on other occasions took forever. Our flight was late in the evening but hotel happily stored our luggage after check out. Small lobby but perfectly adequate with decorations nodding to the fashion district it resides in.

We had a group of 7 stay at this hotel for a Girl's Weekend and it was fantastic. The rooms were spacious (4 in one room and 3 in another room) and very clean. The beds were super soft. The dining here is excellent. The only downside was that the "sky view" we requested was not what we expected. We were not in our rooms except for sleeping so it really didn't make a difference anyway.

My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. Check in was extremely smooth and all the staff was friendly. The room was a nice size however lighting was poor, the closet space was small as well. The quality of the room was high with a very comfortable bed. This hotel is in a great location. The rooftop lounge is beautiful even in the cold weather. I would highly recommend this hotel.

We only needed a room for an overnight stay. We live within driving distance but planned on having a few drinks during a show and didn't want to worry about the drive home or missing the last train back. I booked this hotel because there is a year-round roof-top bar and I thought it would be perfect to attend the show and then catch the roof top bar once we arrived back at the hotel. I had never been on a roof-top bar in the city before. It turned out that the roof-top bar was closed, and closes much, much earlier than other bars, like 11pm. When I mentioned to the hotel person that I had booked the hotel because it had a roof top bar and I was surprised it was already closed this early on a Saturday night, she just answered, "There are lots of other bars." Great. But I spent $199 so I could be at YOUR bar, lady, not some other bar. There should be a warning that it closes early if they use that bar in their marketing to attract bookings. I could have had a hotel literally across the street from our show but the rooftop bar was the deciding factor for me even though it was 2.5 miles from the show.Because the bar was closed, we looked in the hall for ice. There is no ice in the hall at this hotel. We went down to the counter and asked for ice and they said, "Sure, no problem!" but no ice ever showed up. We waited and waited and finally I cracked open a warm beer I had packed with me from home.Checkout is nice and late, 12 noon, so we didn't have to rush getting out. We did end up waiting 40 minutes for the hotel to bring our vehicle. We were supposed to get warned to call ahead for our car, but no warning was given upon check-in. There is no coffee in the lobby and we had already made the Keurig from in the room- one small cup of coffee each with fake creamer. So when they warned us the car would take a while, I said, "How long, because I'd love to run to the corner and grab a cup of coffee to wait with." The valet said, "No need, wait right here, it'll be 5 minutes." Well, it was 40min and I could have run to that corner coffee shop 10 times. It was annoying. The room itself was fine and the king bed was comfy. It was an ok night, but if ever spent the night in the city again, nothing would compel me to come back to this hotel.

Unfortunately was not what I expect from Hilton. Hotel is very old. Staff is overwhelmed. Rooms are so noisy!! You can hear the conversation in rooms next door. You can hear above and beside when the sink is on and toilet flushes. People taking in hallway sound as if they are standing in your room. Doors slam shut. It was impossible to get a good night sleep. Only way to fix is for Hilton to renovate and sound proof rooms and update doors so you can turn handle to quietly close door instead of slamming shut. Fridge in room for guests would be nice. Will not stay here again.
user_name:
Magnolia0802
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We made a quick in and out trip to New York to see our son perform in his latest show. We parked our car beside the Newport PATH station and were on 23rd Street at 6th Avenue in a few minutes. From there, it was a quick three block walk to the Hilton Fashion District where we were pleasantly greeted at the front desk, thanked for our Hilton Honors loyalty, and provided the keys to a room on the 15th floor. The lobby is compact, but clean and pleasant. The hallways were bright. Our room was nicely sized for NYC, clean, nicely furnished, and very comfortable. The bathroom was large enough and nicely equipped. There is nothing not to like about this hotel, including the great price we scored. Everything is within walking distance and the subway is nearby. We look forward to returning.

I was traveling for a quick work trip and had a horrible experience at this Hilton. Having recently traveled to New York and stayed on the lower east side at a Mariott, I decided to change up my hotel (Hilton) and location. Based off reviews, I was confident this would be a good selection. I imagined myself having a drink and snacks on the rooftop bar or grabbing a bite to eat in the swanky burger restaurant, but boy was I was wrong. My flight from California was delayed 5 hours, putting me in New York around 11pm. Needless to say, by the time I got to the hotel, I was exhausted, hungry and excited to shower and get ready for bed. As I got to the hotel, there was no one in sight to help me with my bags, or even to hold the door open. I walked to the check in desk and when I inquired about room service or hotel restaurant, I was told that they were all closed and I would have to go out to get food. It was then that they told me all the water had been shut off as well. The front desk kindly passed me a few bottles of water and said the hotel wouldn't have water until the morning. I then went out into the snow to find food. Unfortunately, all kitchens in the open bars were closed. I went back to the hotel starving, and kindly asked the front desk again about showering. I said I had a horribly long day and wanted to see if there was any way I could shower. The man at the front desk held 2 water bottles over his head and went, "you can pour these all over you". You could imagine how frustrating that would be to a customer. I had traveled all day to show up to a hotel that had no food and no water, not to mention a very unapologetic staff. There was no compensation for guests for this inconvenience - not even a batch of complementary coffee. I was very upset about the experience, so much so that I went to pack my things up and leave but I was just too tired. As I went to bed that night, I couldn't help but think, "I didn't pay a decent amount of money and fly all the way to NYC to camp". Needless to say, I will never stay at this hotel again nor recommend to anyone traveling to NY. There are plenty of hotels to choose from and this one was beyond a disappointment.

The hotel is located in a quiet street, providing a roof top terrasses.The lobby is nice and you are well welcomed. The rooms are small and dark but this is true for all hotels in NYC. You can hear people talking in the corridor or slamming doors. I even got woken up at 2:00 AM by next door showerThe cleaning ladies did a very good jobFor the breakfast, you are offered a menu for extra order and they don t purpose you the buffet which is well hidden. I am not really a bit fan of those practices where you are offered the most pricey options. The buffet was pretty poor for a Hilton
user_name:
yveslouisp
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This midtown hotel was in a great location. Room was decent size and clean. The restaurant meal was delicious. The hotel and restaurant staff were both very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

There are two small issues. One was the noise, lots of guests slamming doors until the early hours of the morning so not great for getting to sleep and the other was (rather randomly) the lack of loo roll! We were given one to last the entire stay and it wasn’t restocked during room cleans, in the end we went to a shop and bought our own as didn’t particularly want to have to ask for some in the open reception area!

We were charged for an extra room and manager refused to resolve it and was told different stories on why I was charged. Appears we paid for someone else to stay there. Do NOT recommend this location.
user_name:
Jodi F
Washington, DC, United States

review_body: Rooms at this hotel are very nice and the shower was huge. The staff were all friendly even when faced with a large amount of guests to service. In particular, it was very helpful to proactively be sent an email before my stay highlighting the hotel's policies and amenities. The Hilton Digital Key was awesome to use and worked faultlessly. My corner room was perfectly sized. From the fifth floor, I had an enjoyable view of the street below. While street and hallway noise can be an issue for those on lower floors, it generally dies down by an acceptable time.The Hilton Gold/Diamond breakfast benefit is not quite as generous as other hotels at either a 20 USD voucher per person for the hotel restaurant or 2,000 Hilton points. However, the value of the points is enough to cover breakfast at the excellent Brooklyn Bagel nearby. For all other meals, prices at Rare, the hotel restaurant, are reasonable by Manhattan standards.The only minor thing is that I wish that the hotel would offer a sign-in page for the premium WiFi instead of having to get a passcode from the front desk.

good location - a short walk from Penn Station and Madison Sq Garden as well as shopping. Clean rooms, helpful staff, restuarant on site is decent. Hotel roof top bar is nice and has a pretty view at night.

The hotel is great and has a cool lobby bar. If on business it's close to most parts of town close to Chelsea. Also some cool restaurants within striking distance. The hotel bar has a mix of attendee types

This hotel was quite a gem. The price was right for the location and amenities. I had a great dinner at Rare with a wonderful server who made me forget I was dining alone. The room was comfortable and quiet. It provided nice amenities for a great night's rest. I will return for sure.

I stayed at this hotel as it was close to a training class i was doing. The service is more that 5 stars the bellman service excellent always willing to help. Shavon she is the sweetest and remembers you by name was a great feeling. Front desk was effective and friendly. We had 2 book room as the double room wasn't available for the entire stay so we change to a king room . The greatest part was the transaction for one room to the next was smooth. We didnt have to waiting until check out then to check back in.The room service was fast food refresh and very tasty. Its was a lil expense and didnt no have a lot of veg options. The only thing I didnt like is that housekeeping didn't want to clean the room while we were in there so we had to leave or not have it cleaned. The rooms are a bit small but cozy. Will be back.

I stayed here for business. The staff was friendly at check-in and the hotel has an onsite restaurant. I had a room near the elevator facing the street. No noise from the elevator but lots of street noise despite being on the 18th floor. The room was comfortably warm and clean. I would have appreciated an extra blanket it is February after all but the thermostat was adjustable. The bed was very firm. I wouldn’t stay here again if I didn’t need to.

Stayed here for my birthday weekend, we arrived 3 hours before check in and the staff allowed us to check in early. Our room was located directly across from the elevator and was noisey, we were promptly offered another room. Room was clean and all the staff was very friendly and attentive! We will be staying again , fantastic location.

I visited in September 2018, during the US Open Tennis, for business. With the tennis in action, hotel prices in the city were very high. As a first impression, this hotel is fine. Open and compact lobby, and I was welcomed as a Diamond member after a long-haul flight. NYC was especially humid that week so the a/c was welcoming. Up the lift, which took a while to arrive, and I arrived on a high floor to a soulless corridor. Along I went, to a plain door, and entered the bedroom. My first impression was the damp/fusty smell that was faint in the corridor but noticeable in the bedroom. Second was the tiny size of the room - I know it's New York, but even still. Not impressed. Then I saw the bathroom from the 90s, and remembered that the room still smelled bad. On the upside, the wifi was good and the a/c kept pumping the cold air, though it was likely the source of the smell too. Come morning breakfast in the attached restaurant was fine, though some natural light would be nice when adjusting time zone. Location is a subjective thing in the city, this hotel was fine for meetings I had on the West side of Manhattan. All in all I wouldn't stay here again - I'm surprised at the state of the property given the amazing competition in New York.

My spouse and I stayed at the Hilton Fashion District on a Saturday evening in early December 2018. We last stayed at this hotel in July of 2013; see our review titled “Good Location for Midtown Sightseeing”. We booked our stay online using the Hilton website; although we are Hilton HHonors members, we did not receive an upgrade upon arrival (not even to a higher floor); however, we were able to check in online the day prior to our stay and choose our room number. The Hilton Fashion District is located in Midtown in the Garment District bordering Chelsea, not far from Madison Square Garden/Penn Station. It provides a convenient location for Times Square sightseeing and access to various subway lines, bars, restaurants, and souvenir shops. A Whole Foods grocery store and the Sunac Market are located within one block of the hotel, in case you need to purchase food, drinks, or forgotten items. The Fashion Institute of Technology (FIT) and its museum are a half-block away.The lobby area itself is not large, but still offers a few places for guests to sit and chat. The decor fits the theme of a Fashion District hotel, with spools of thread composing an interesting art piece behind the front desk and mannequins with interesting costumes in the front windows. A tiny concierge/tour desk is located adjacent to the front door, although it is not staffed. RARE Bar and Grill is located at one end of the lobby, where breakfast is served (complimentary for HHonors Gold and Diamond members). The hotel also features the RARE rooftop bar and lounge, where we joined some friends for drinks one evening. At night, one elevator is dedicated to whisking patrons from the lobby to the 23rd floor rooftop. Two additional elevators access guestrooms on the 2nd to 22nd floors. The hotel has valet and self-parking for an additional fee, and the garage is located just a few yards from the hotel entrance. Taxi cabs were plentiful in front of the hotel, and Uber provides an additional transportation option. We had a corner room on the 9th floor, which regrettably did not give us a view of the Empire State Building because of an adjacent building. (On our last visit, our corner room on the 22nd floor had a great view.) The room was average size for New York City (about 300 square feet), with a king-size bed abutted by two nightstands, a desk/dresser/bureau combination, a small ottoman/seat that could be moved around, and a shelving unit that housed the glass-fronted weighted minibar (do not move anything or you will be charged) and coffee-making supplies, and a small closet that contained an electronic safe, iron, and ironing board. The room decor was modern and appealing, and the fashion theme (or sewing theme) carried through on some of the artwork. The bathroom was a decent size, with a combination tub/shower unit and large countertop vanity with a single sink. Complimentary toiletries include soap, shampoo, conditioner, and body lotion. Three sets of towels were provided, despite the fact that the room could really only sleep two guests. The hotel does not offer turndown service, nor does it have vending or ice machines; however, you can call down to the front desk to request ice delivery.We enjoyed our second stay at the Hilton Fashion District, and we had fun at the RARE rooftop bar.

Great location, walking distance to Chelsea Market Penn Station, Macys and other stores, even Greenwich Village, short commute to Times Square! However Room Service and the Bar was average. One of the days there was no Hot water in the cold January Temperature!

This is located between 6th and 7th on 26th Street, pretty close to Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. The service was solid. It is attached to a restaurant called Rare and has a rooftop bar. It is easy to grab a cab or Uber from this location. The rooms are your typical NY size. The closets are really small and tight. The bed was very comfortable and I had a great nights sleep. I was disappointed with the wifi and myself and numerous others had issues with hot water in the morning. I was told that the lower floors had issues and everyone I spoke to on the upper floors said they had hot water. I was here for an event with fellow employees. I would recommend it for the business traveler.

My friend and I came to NYC for a quick girls trip and I was highly impressed with my stay at this Hilton property in the NY Fashion District. The staff was accommodating and friendly during the entire stay. They were eager to help and after a rough flight, I was glad to check into a hotel with such a warm environment. The hotel bar and restaurant was good, the rooftop bar view is out of a dream, and my entire stay was comfortable and restful. Milly was especially helpful and nice anytime I had a question. You can't go wrong if you choose this property!

I stay here once per year for the last few years for a tradeshow. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Excellent rooms service food due to the steak restaurant attached. Rooftop bar also. I will continue to use this spot in the future.

Hilton is a great place to stay in the Fashion District or for business anywhere in the mid-20's. Also easy access to West Side uptown and downtown via the Subway just a few blocks away. The rooms are comfortable, staff is friendly and breakfast is great. Low key location and hotel is more like staying at a residence than a hotel.

My family stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights. We had rooms across from each other in the nineteenth floor. The rooms were immaculate. The hotel is walking distance to a number of diners- as well as Times Square. I booked rooms with a skyline view- so, there was no traffic noise at all. We really had a great trip!

This hotel is in a nice part of New York City and walking distance to a number of great places to eat and drink, as well as the subway. We stayed here for our honeymoon, travelling from Australia, and had a largely pleasurable experience. Our standard room was pretty spacious and there is not too much noise at this hotel compared with others that we stayed at in NYC. It was reasonably priced by NYC standards. One glitch was that we were unable to get 2 champagne glasses from the bar to enjoy a bottle of prosecco in our room that we had brought with us when we checked in on new year's eve, but otherwise, the staff were friendly and attentive.

Hotel had great location, walking distances to many sights and restaurants in safe neighborhood. Friendly efficient check-in, we were given two complimentary water bottles. As expected, the room and bathroom were very small. The room had a small closet with ironing board and iron, and a safe. There was no noise from the outside, and blackout curtains kept out the light. There was Keurig coffee machine, but unfortunately ours did not work. After two calls on two different days the machine was never fixed or replaced during our four night stay. The honor bar posted a warning that “pulling flap incurs a charge- no refunds can be made”. The room was worn with dinged baseboards and pealing wallpaper. The a/c wall unit was noisy, with a musty, mildew odor. The bathroom had Crabtree and Evelyn bath products, an old wall heater at floor level, that got hot when turned on, a definite hazard for small children, especially if they poked their finger into the coils. There were three elevators for the twenty-two floors, however when the rooftop bar opened, one elevator was dedicated to transport guests directly up the entire night, so was out of commission during that long time period, resulting in long wait time for elevator. Very disappointing stay. With the numerous hotels in the area would not return.*Note for families who want a crib from the hotel - my daughter also stayed here at the same time of us. The crib from the hotel *barely* fit in the room and used pretty much all of the free space.

Rooms are small and can get a bit noisy depending on neighbors etc. As a Diamond member, was disappointing that there was no lounge but nice breakfast credit option that could be used in the restaurant and even for room service. That was nice.

Excellent value. Clean comfortable room. Very quiet. Staff was very helpful and welcoming.One suggestion is to make the restaurant more visible. We thought it was only a bar to the last day. It definitely is a great place to visit again.

This hotel is great! The location is ideal, centrally located in the fashion district, with clean and comfortable rooms. The staff was friendly and helpful at all times with great room service from the restraint rare next door. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Absolute disgusting service Since check-in and upon checkout.Made several in house guest complaints without any resolution of the problems. 1) Upon check out Christine the receptionist told me boldly that I am wasting her time because I requested luggage assistance, they send me someone who knocked like crazy on the door and I asked them to wait 1 second but they didn't and left.Then she called me from reception saying to me that when she knocked and that I said no I do not want the service!!2) Tim the manager, seeing me so furious of the attitude instead of calming me down he on the other hand told me that I am not going to get past him and told me to leave immediately!!!3) There is a 350 USD deposit paid upfront my checkin and I received my bill and need to ensure this amount is released from the hotel too.4) When I asked for room service they told me they close at 11pm. The next day when I asked room service to bring me plates and cutleries they sent me cartoon and plastic ones. Then when complained about it they sent me small plates only then they sent me finally what I asked for but after I finished dinner. Rubbish

Stayed here over Christmas to tick off a bucket list item and love this part of NY. It’s close to everything, I walked everywhere. Hotel is pretty new compared to others and service was great. Highly recommend

The location is great, close to Madison square gardens, time square and the Empire state not too far from anything really. The woman that we checked in with was very nice and helpful however that's all the positives I'm afraid...The rooms are very small, dark and dates! Desperately needs a make over and not up to Hilton standard at all!! Our towels didn't get changed for 3 days dispite being wet and dirty! Doors slamming all night long, rooftop bar closed 4 of our 7 night visit. Got told we would get an upgrade due to it being our Honeymoon sadly the only "upgrade" we got was a room with a bath.......(not exactly what I would call I honeymoon upgrade). And to top of our stay at a hotel that should NOT be classed as a Hilton as it is not that standard on our check out date we left our luggage in the luggage room went to collect it just before our transfer arrived and they had lost it.....we ended up missing our transfer as it took that long for them to find it!

Although the room was clean and appeared to have been decorated recently, it was not really very comfortable. Although there was sufficient space for one, there was no comfortable chair in which one could sit and read, only a desk chair. There was not a good place to open one's luggage and easily access needed items. The stone floor of the bathroom was a slick safety hazard. When it came time to depart, there did not seem to be effective methods for getting a cab. It was a tough time for that but the hotel is not on a main street with many cabs going by. The bellman tried hard it seemed but we eventually had to go ourselves to a busier street and snag one. I thought the hotel would have a way to order a cab.

We stayed Friday and Saturday night at this hotel. Friday was very loud, the doors and walls are very thin!!! We had to call security at 4:00 AM because the neighboring room was very loud and wouldn’t stop talking or slamming doors.

John DiMatteo, Front Office Manager and his team are true professionals. My wife and I did a weekend in NYC for her birthday. We flew separately because of work schedules. She arrived 8 hours late at 2am because of weather delays. The staff was waiting for her and had arranged champagne and chocolate strawberries in her room. On our final night, John personally delivered a wonderful birthday cake to the room (and texted me a heads up before arrival). This was our second stay. Great room. Great views. Great location. Nice stay all around. Roof top bar is awesome. Highly recommend.

My husband and I met our son and his girlfriend in NYC and chose the Hilton New York Fashion District due to its wonderful location and the fact that I'd stayed there twice before. All my stays have been superb. I love that it's walking distance to Penn Station. We were also able to walk to the theater district for our show, and easily catch a subway to go downtown or uptown. The hotel staff was wonderful and the rooms were very clean and quiet. One room was paid for with Hilton Honors points, so that was fantastic. I felt the cost of the other room during the holiday season was very reasonable as well.

Location is close to Madison square garden, which is an easy walk. We walked from Times Square too which is about 1.5 mile walk. Rooms are very small. We had a king with skyline view on 22nd floor. (2210 to be exact) I know NYC rooms are small but for two people we were on top of each other. The noise is an issue as well. Noise from the street and other rooms was easily heard. Made for a tough night sleep. Didn’t deal with any of the staff other than when I had to check in for some reason after I had my digital key through the app and my credit card was already processed. It was fine for the amount of time we spent there.

We stayed overnight at this hotel and for the price and the time of year, it was a great stay. Clean bedrooms, clean bathrooms, quiet. I would recommend it. If your driving a car, you can park in a parking lot that's at the end of the block for 42 dollar for a full day. Make sure you get the ticket validated by the hotel otherwise you'll pay full price for parking. It's like 90 dollars.

Went to NY during the holiday season to see the tree at Rockefeller Center, the 911 museum, Tiffanys, Time square and the windows at Macys and Saks. Great time with family and the hotel was wonderful. They have a roof top bar with a great view of the Fashion District, cool bar in the lobby and the rooms were fantastic with comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. Would stay here again.

The hotel is in a great location however every inch of it needs renovating. The elevators are old and rickety. The room decor is ancient. Chairs,desk, night tables beds. It all needs to be put in the dumpster. Does not exemplify Hilton Standards especially for the prices they charge. Go elsewhere.

Hidden on 26th street and 7th, the hotel is perfect for those who find NYC a bit too big and a bit too stressful. Close to 28th Street 1 Subway line. Excellent food, although limited menu. Good Juice and smoothie bar 4 blocks north on 7th (the Juice Shop). If you want something out of the way, this is it.

This was my 2nd time staying at the Fashion District Hilton Hotel in New York City. I stayed from the 16th - 17th December. I always found it to be one of the most convenient Hilton branded hotels near Penn Station for catching the Amtrak. It is also within a short distance walk to Times Square, Madison Square Garden and Shopping.From time of arrival, the staff immediately checked me in without wait and thanked me for my loyalty as a Hilton Honors Diamond Member. I was offered a 1 KING BED SKYLINE VIEW room which same room type I booked (there are no upgraded rooms above this type). I was assigned a room on the 16th floor (1606). I was also explained the restaurant, room service and other options available at the hotel. I also was provided details regarding breakfast. They provided me details on connecting to the Wi-Fi, and provided me the room keys and I was on my way. As I was going out shortly after getting settled the front desk provided me with an umbrella as it was raining out. The room itself was nicely appointed and located on one of the highest levels in the hotel. The view from the room gave me a great skyline view and also full view of road below. The furniture was in good condition and the room very clean overall. The overall stay was pleasant and comfortable.The hotel did not have an Executive Lounge, but does have a great rooftop bar which provides amazing views of the skyline of New York. Checkout was as easy as check-in. I was given an option to check out via Hilton app. I chose this time to check out face to face this time and again worked with the pleasant staff.I look forward to future stats at this hotel and recommend for staying as it is a very nicely maintained hotel with great staff.

The Hilton Fashion District is a great hotel. The location is near to two subway stops and walking distance to many of the midtown locations you want to see. The staff is wonderful and helpful and the rooms are so clean! I'd stay here again!

Nice neighborhood location. Hotel could use refresh in bathrooms & window treatments- our shades were inoperable, which made sleeping difficult as the street lights streamed in. Easy walk to area restaurants & some bars. Rooftop bar service was good, great city views & good ambiance for a nightcap.

We travel to NYC often and usually stay at one of the many Hilton Garden Inns there. This time we tried a Hilton hotel, which supposedly is a step up. While the hotel was clean and staff were super, it’s not nearly as convenient for traveling as a family. Instead of a fridge in room, there is a minibar. There are no ice machines, you have to call room service for ice, $3 for a small bucket of cubes. Rooms were nice, if a bit tired, and beds were okay, not as comfortable as the HGIs we have stayed at (at least five in NY to date). Toiletries were more upscale but sparse (no shower cap!). Great location and probably good for a business traveler. I would recommend families or leisure travelers to look for places with more conveniences.

We were going to a concert at MSG and wanted a hotel close to the event. This hotel is about 4 blocks! Great staff and wonderful ground floor bar and restaurant. The rooms are a good size for NYC. Well appointed rooms with good beds!

This is a great location and the staff was friendly, also close to many shops and subway station (red line) I was there with my wife and teenage daughter and we had a wonderful time in the city and the hotel was great, we left our luggage there while we spent the last day in the city and they called us a cab when we were ready to leave.

The hotel is situated in the middle of Manhattan...great walkability to so much, easy access to subway and of course easy for Uber pick ups. The rooms are NYC sized, but have great heating on those cold winter days. The rooms are quite quiet as it sits on a quieter road. Would recommend.

I was in New York for business and the location was very close to the office. The rooms are nice and the staff was very friendly. However, I did make the mistake of asking for a bottled water at the bar. It cost me $8. I quickly learned where Walgreens was located and purchased it there.

The hitel was an 8 minute walk from Penn Station. Rooms were large. Beds were very comfortable and the bedding was very high quality. The staf was ver friendly as well. Great stay for my family. Would stay again!

Quality hotel and accommodations. Convenient walking distance to so much. Warm and friendly staff, very helpful. Recommend stay hotel for mid-town activities. I enjoyed a 3 day stay with easy access to 34th street area

I recently stayed at this hotel while I was in town for a business dinner. I'd emailed the hotel prior to arrival to let them know that I would be arriving at later in the evening and I'd need late arrival. I also mentioned that my Mom was tagging along with me and that it was our first trip to NYC. I'd asked for a high floor with a skyline view. Not only did they provide all of the above, but they sent an adorable welcome gift to the room. I was very impressed by each of the staff members we encountered while we were there. Nick in maintenance was great and fixed a clogged drain very quickly and was so nice and accommodating. The rooms are small, but ours was very comfortable. We had the buffet breakfast each morning as it was included in our room rate, and the buffet was great. We were a bit disappointed in the "rooftop bar" which provided great views but little else. A security guard came up to us around 10:30p and told us it was last call and they closed at 11:00p. We felt like we were getting kicked out. It is odd that there are no food/drink options at the hotel after 11:00p. After all, NYC is the city that never sleeps, right!? But other than that, we had a very enjoyable stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Stayed for 3 nights in Nov '18. The room was somewhat small but adequate for 1 person. No complaints about the property, the room was clean.Short walk from Penn Station and subway stop. Little further walk to Midtown, Macy's Bryant Park, etc.The roofdeck bar was fun with a nice view of the ESB. Would be great during the summer for a drink up there with the open roof.I'd stay again for the right price.

I stayed at the Hilton NY Fashion District for one night while in transit in September 2018 as a HHonors Gold member. I booked on short notice for a Skyline room with a note for an early check-in to freshen up before a series of meetings soon after arriving from London. The hotel was initially unable to accommodate an early check-in, even though it seemed like other non-status guests were receiving their room keys. I realized in a conversation with the hotel GM at the front desk later in the evening that the room category I had booked was the highest room category and I was offered a lesser room without my consent, even though my guest comments field prioritized an upgrade over other room preferences.I wrote to the property regarding the involuntary room category downgrade (without my consent) and the property's FOM responded with a service recovery gesture and credited the difference in rate. Without the prompt response, this would be a 2* review. My general sense is that the Hilton properties in New York can get things right, but only if they want to!

Check in was ok, rooms were very limited due to being sold out. Stayed on the second floor, the room was clean and decent layout. Nice option to open windows, but heating/ac unit runs continuously and is very loud. It can’t be shut off at all, and we found it difficult to sleep. Great views at roof top bar, but food selection is very limited (chips and guacamole is good). We had breakfast vouchers and food was good also. The location is great.

The hotel feels very old and my room was dimly lit. Fine for a night, but I was there for multiple and it was very depressing. Room service was also slow and my shower door didn't fully close so the bathroom floor would get very wet.

Stayed here for a girlfriends weekend in Oct 2018. Had a wonderful time. Rooms were clean as well as a modern & tidy decor throughout. Located close to Penn Station - apprx 5 blocks. This was perfect for us as we chose to take the train from EWR airport. Fast and easy. Great location. Breakfast was delicious!

The Hilton is a beautiful property. We had a room on the 20th floor and a view of the city lights in the evening was amazing. The only issue with the room was the traffic noise especially when trying to sleep.

This is a great hotel a few minutes walk from the centre of New York and yet very quiet, the staff are very friendly and will do anything to make you have a nice stay. There is a rooftop bar which is worth a visit and gives you a great view of part of New York.

The hotel was clean and neat and the staff was great. Check in and out were very smooth. My only complaint was that the rooms are very dark. Would prefer more light, but clean and comfortable. Thanks for a great stay!

first they tried to rip us for another $10 because they said we had king size bed and it was not part of the group rate that we booked. Room was so small almost fell out of window when getting up. They only use 40 watt light bulbs so it is hard to see. Mirroron bathroom door no light Keurig coffee maker had to get some one to help work properly.

This was a great hotel for the price. We upgraded to a view room and ended up on the 22nd floor, below rooftop bar. The Empire State Building was right outside the window! In Chelsea, very close to Greenwhich and great Korean food 4 blocks up.

Hallways small so that housekeeping constantly slams the door about 50 times all day long starting at 7am and no way to avoid the noise. Walls thing so could hear couples having sex next door. Saw a male hooker transaction go on in the elevator. Sheets stiff. No view. Room dark. Will NEVER stay at this hotel or another Hilton.

If you are spending a few days in New York City for pleasure, and looking for classy respite in the middle of the city, the Hilton Fashion District is not your place. First the good:-the staff is very friendly, welcoming, and personable.-the location is excellent although the block on West 26th is a little rough.-bed was comfortable.-shower was a stall…more hygienic than a tub.-window actually opensThe not so good:-as a Diamond member I was told the room assigned me was an upgrade; it was not. In my mind it was a downgrade. Very small, no view, right beside the elevator, noisy…from the up and down of the elevator, plus there was a screeching at times (like metal on metal). Not the way to treat your most loyal customers.-walls are thin; noise from the halls.-condition of the hotel in general is more Hampton than Hilton. -construction of a water tower on the roof of a building across the alley occurred at 8 AM on a Sunday. That made enjoying a leisurely Sunday morning in the hotel room impossible.-no ice machines; refrigerator in the room is one of those contraptions that charge you when you open the door. They will bring up ice but then you get into this tipping game,-noted to front desk my displeasure about the room and the noise from the elevator. The latter was a real nuisance that forced me to run the (loud) heating/AC unit to block out the noise. Asked me what could they do to make it right? Offered to change my room but this was not a solution at that point in my stay. I replied, comp me one night. Final bill…no comp for one night; no response; no feedback. Hollow promise.Rooms in the back of the hotel, some of which may be a little larger, either are adjacent to the elevators or have no view at all except for maybe the top three floors. Rooms in the front are smaller but at least face the street and are more removed from the buildings on the other side.Bottomline, a big disappointment. For the price paid, or a few dollars more, I believe that I could have done much better. I am a very loyal Hilton customer and this clouded my judgment on securing a true New York City hotel experience. Loyalty did not pay in this case.

The service was fantastic. They were able to check me in a few hours early. My room was clean & cozy; it was an excellent use of space. Housekeeping was attentive and I always had more towels than I needed. The room was quiet and my bed was so comfy I didn't want to leave. I usually have problems sleeping anywhere outside of my home, but I slept like a baby here. I suggest signing up for the free Hilton Honors membership because you can get a discount on your room along with other perks. I had no problems with the free Internet service, and I appreciated the 2 free bottles of water they gave me when I checked in. Overall, they arranged for an early check in and they were able to give me a late check out. Thanks for the hospitality! I highly recommend this hotel. The location is perfect and the staff is very professional.

There was a man with longer curly hair behind the reception. He seemed to be working there. But he did not appear to. It was not a busy moment at checkin. Two agents plus him serving two guests, me being the third. I greeted him and he ignored me. I greeted him again and he pointed me to wait - still not saying anything and then going to his conputer just to do something else. He also wouldn’t take care of my bags and was annoyed that he had toncall the bellboy. Overall an unacceptable attitude, especially in the hospitality world

Amazing stay and superb service. I will definitely be returning for any future visits to New York. The beds were in spectacular shape and the amenities were amazing. The location was also great due to a close location to time square.

Good hotel at great location. As many said rooms are a bit small , ask for high floor away from elevators..Shower and shower soaps are too basic for Hilton..Expected moreNice small Gym and good service by front desk.

The hotel was immaculate, the staff were very friendly & helpful. The location is awesome. Most importantly the hotel has unique safety features that allowed me to sleep knowing my kids had rooms on other floors and would be okay. Did I mention how courteous & respectful the staff was? Overall a great hotel! We’ll definitely stay here again when traveling to NYC!

West 26th Street is perfect location to explore New York from - located Chelsea midtown easy to explore downtown or uptown. 6 blocks from Maceys and Madison Square Gardens is this quieter side street. The hotel was perfect with great rooms, friendly and accommodating staff, roof top bar, restaurant and 24 hour room service. Great stay and would come back again

Stayed here to see a NYU theater production at the nearby Stella Adler studios. Really enjoyed the proximity of this hotel to the theater and the great restaurants. It’s also fairly close the the rest of NYU.

The hotel was located perfectly for what we had to do. It is not back huge Hilton property. Nice size, not crowded. Check in was quick and efficient. There room was even ready early. The room was clean and all I expected. Check out was quick and easy. I wish it were a little less pricey. But it was Friday night in Manhattan.

I stayed at the Hilton for a week. The hotel was conveniently located near 7th ave and less then a 10 minute walk to Penn Station. Check was friendly and the front desk staff were always available. Rooms were medium sized, modern, and comfortable.The only quirk was that there were no ice machines on the floors - you needed to ask at the restaurant in the lobby. Overall great location and nice hotel.

It was okay. Stayed on 21st floor thinking it would be nice and quiet but we could hear the elevators moving up and down all night and the people next to our rooms were loud. The heat/ air system was loud too when the air came out. Every time the air came out I woke up. They need a new/not quiet air control Overall I was hoping it would be a nice and quiet stay but it was not quite what we hoped for, besides the noise, everything else was okay.

The staff is friendly and willing to help with any concerns. I have stayed there many times and it's always a go-to property when visiting NYC. The breakfast voucher/room credit for their a la carte or buffet menu (both have a limited selection) are good, especially if traveling alone. The breakfast roasted potatoes aren't very good and it seems like the restaurant reheats them. The restaurant on site is lacking in that regard. I'm not sure if this restaurant is owned by Hilton.I had a couple of issues with extending or shortening my stay and the manager (name escapes me) was very kind, understanding and eager to help. The suites are small which is to be expected but are clean and modern. I prefer a bathroom with glass shower doors and they have them. I would ask for a room away from the elevator and not such a high floor.The business center is very small--tiny. If you're going to be there for business, call ahead that they have the technology you'll need.

So, I think it’s fair to note that advertised on the Hilton website Is that they have a rooftop bar. What we really didn’t appreciate is that when we went to go there at 9:30 PM on a Thursday they were closed. When we asked the hotel about it they said it’s not our problem because we don’t own that bar. As a truth in advertising person I don’t feel it’s fair to say that you have a rooftop bar in your hotel if it’s not actually owned by you. I just thought people should know.

Room was advertised as having "a skyline view", which cost more. View was of water towers on top of adjacent buildings; deceptive marketing. Room also had a strong smell of mold. Our clothing smelled like mold after our stay. In addition to paying for daily parking, we were charged $10 each time that our car was parked or brought out.

There is nothing wrong w this hotel. When you read reviews you always see good and bad on most hotels. We decided to go w this Hilton bc of The somewhat larger room for NYC. My budget isn’t huge but I didn’t want a room the size of a closet. I’ve read the lobby is small, the lobby was fine and check in took 30 seconds. I’ve read there are long waits for the elevators, we never waited more than a minute or 2 and at times there was no wait.We had room 1806. The size was fine, one king bed with a cool skyline view. This was King Leisure room I believe. The light was dim, that could be better and there’s no chair.Bathroom was nice size, big vanity with lots of shelves for your stuff. Water pressure was great. We needed extra towels and they were delivered in minutes. We asked for a mini fridge and that was also delivered very quickly, like 5 minutes . We had no issues at all. I think all hotel prices in NYC are ridiculous so not much can be said about that.We paid $1009 for 3 nights total, including tax. booked direct w Hilton.I’d stay here again

Bug bug bugs!!!! The bed was filled with bugs and the hotel did nothing about it. For $400 a night... the rooms are filthy, overpriced and the customer service is horrible. We have actually stayed at this hotel multiple times and yet they don’t care about providing good customer service or doing what is right. We asked for a room change and night free and the hotel did nothing about it. They claimed the bugs didn’t matter and the room was fine. Do not stay here! The customer service is horrible, the beds are dirty and you are better staying at the Holiday Inn down the block. At least they have free breakfast and clean beds.

The room had everything we needed, was clean and spacious by NY standards. A refrigerator would have been a bonus. The staff was welcoming and friendly. Want to mention Marian (I hope I spell the name correctly) at the front desk, she was very helpful. We tried the rooftop bar one night, but saw no reason to stay long or go again. All in all, a nice and well located hotel.

Check in was very quick and easy. Reception staff were very friendly, professional and made us feel very welcome. The lifts are few and busy BUT the little wait is worth it. Get a room as high up as you can. The room was quite, spacious, comfortable and had a great city view. And yay for the Keurig. Will definitely stay here again.

I stayed here on a quick one night business trip. My room was small, and while it was find for me alone -if I was traveling with a companion, we would have been tripping over each other. The room was quiet, which is often hard to find in NY. The amenities are nice, but I would have appreciated a refrigerator in the room. The best thing about this hotel is the rooftop bar. Since I was solo, I didn't spend too much time up there, but the views are amazing and the space is really cool. I would highly recommend checking it out if you're in the neighborhood.

Went for a quick business trip. The hotel and location are great. Staff was very friendly and helpful. My room was small but clean. I enjoyed being able to walk to Eataly for dinner. I will definitely stay here again.

Very disappointing for a 4 star hotel:- I felt cramped from the first moment I stepped in, the lobby is small, and the rooms the smallest I've ever seen in any U.S. hotel;- The room was basic, and another first was that there was no mini-fridge in the room where you could keep some cool water;- There was a patch of paint on the ceiling that was scraped / stripped;These are all minor details, but I've seen better at any 3 star hotel I've stayed at.The 2 star review is because of the following, which I don't expect from any respectable establishment: There was no heating in the entire building following several cold days (mid september). I had a hard time falling asleep due to the cold. Some friends stopped by to take some luggage and they complained as well, even though they were dressed for outdoors. When I asked at the reception, all I got was that the heating is turned off in the entire building, so it's best I stop the fan as it's only making things worse. Unbelievable.

My family visited New York to celebrate my daughters 10th birthday and 7 year wedding anniversary. The staff was so amazing they remembered the occasions and made sure to tell my sweet girl Happy Birthday. They also wished us a happy anniversary. During check- in we received 4 complimentary bottles of water. Once we got to our room a fruit plate arrive and it was so refreshing. Our room was a nice size and we had a beautiful view of the skyline. I loved the digital key feature, and it worked great. I have the app on my phone and I used it the entire visit. I was given a tour of the amazing rooftop lounge by Martha. The views were to die for. A great place to have a drink before a night out on the town. One of my favorite things was the detail on decorating. The hotel is in the Fashion District and they had such cute ways of incorporating that. The art behind the desk is actually several spoils of thread. There are well dressed mannequins in the windows. Even upstairs in the lounge there are tables that look like spools of thread. We loved all of the suttle hints to fashion. It was just enough and not overwhelming. Thank you to Miley, Zoribel, Martha, Sade, and Sid for a beautiful weekend. You all were gracious and we appreciate it. P.S. I had several pictures but I could only upload one due to their size. This is the view from the rooftop.

transiting through New York I wanted a hotel near to Penn Station and being a HH Diamond member obviously went for a Hilton. Check in was seamless and efficient, room was clean albeit small with 2 queen beds in it ( My only complaint is how they can justify no comfy chair in a hotel room - there was a desk chair only). Shower was refreshing and powerful after a days travelling and next morning check out was non-existent as it entailed handing card keys over, stating room number and accepting a friendly goodbye - invoice was in my email less than 5 minutes later.

A weekend in the city was made perfect by the size of the room and the friendly professional staff. I would highly recommend staying here. The location is just perfect for getting around to nearly all that the Flat Iron area has to offer.

Stayed here for a weekend in the city. Quite typical Manhattan hotel, small rooms, noisy ACs, nothing special here. Hotel is really crowded and it takes time to catch an elevator. Service is ok. Location is what makes this hotel great.

On our previous trips to New York, my family and I normally get a hotel on 46th street; closer to Times Square and in the heart of the tourist areas. However, this time around, our daughter who works in New York got us reservations at the Hilton on 26th Street and having spending five wonderful days at this hotel; were very pleased with it location. We were only a nice 20-30 minute walk from Greenwich Village and the East Village where the atmosphere with countless number of cafes, restaurants, etc were available. Rather than running into tourists, we felt like we were spending our days experiencing how real New Yorker. The hotel was very quiet and very comfortable and the staff were very helpful.

I stayed at Hilton New York Fashion District last week Excellent property in a central location in Manhattan very close to the Empire State and about 1 km from Times Square Rooms always clean and well maintained Staff very nice and always available to informations about NYAmazing rooftop on the last level with a panoramic view on the Empire State !!!!Special thank to Bonanza Viaggi Treviglio Italy for the reservation !

Rooms are too small. Missing amenities. Unfriendly staffs. Staffs were having attitude during late night. Our flights were delayed and didn't have dinner. We had trouble ordering food at 10:45 pm from services because they closed at 11pm.

Everything was perfect from early check in with Sid to luggage to the car with Shavonne. Excellent hotel with customer service at a 100%. Could not complain about anything at all. We were on the 20th floor, loved Rare, loved the rooftop bar. Wonderful location & I can not say enough about the staff. Everyone smiled & everyone asked if they could do anything for us! Will stay here again in a heartbeat just because of the staff alone. Best Hilton property for the money too!

We were at an Airbnb with 3 other couples that was horrible. My husband booked us a room here when we were visiting the Rare Rooftop bar for drinks as to escape the musty, crowded Airbnb. Best decision ever! We are Hilton Honors gold members & this property far exceeded my expectations. They checked us in early. Sid was so sweet & smiled & made us laugh. The room was perfect, it was room 2008. It was very clean, modern & had everything that we needed. We called down for ice & it was there within a few minutes & they even brought us another bucket without asking. The rooftop bar is exquisite! Beautiful views & great drinks. Sleeping was amazing, the beds were very comfortable. Check out was even a breeze & Shavonne loaded our car for us & she was a sweetheart! There was not 1 staff member that didn't smile or ask us if we needed something! This by far is the best experience we have had at a Hilton property & we stay in MANY! The location is also amazing, Dunkin Donuts is right around the corner & the subway is within walking distance. We are already planning to come back & stay here again. The staff at this particular hotel needs a HUGE pat on the back. I give them an A++. I can't thank them enough!

Staff are very helpful, check-in was easy, location good and rooms clean and comfortable. My shower was small but the room itself pretty big for Manhattan. My 2nd stay and I will be back. Only pitfall was the rooftop bar - great views but slow service.

I stayed here while in NY for business. The hotel rooms are a bit smaller (as you would expect in NY), but well laid out. My room had 2 queens and a desk (no other couches or lounge chairs). There is a nice bar / lounge on the first level.

Traveled for a short 2 night business trip. I selected this hotel because it was close to the office and was a 4 star in a 3 star price range. The room was typical NYC compact but everything was in good repair. The view was nothing to write home about but when you have buildings crammed that closely together what can you expect? The distinguishing mark about my stay was the service in the "Rare" restaurant. I ate there twice for breakfast and once for dinner. Each time the waiters were very attentive and professional. All of the restaurant staff was clearly well versed in customer service. My compliments to the management. The only minor complaint is that the bath towels were quite small and thin for a Hilton.

My husband and I stayed at the Hilton NYC Fashion District this past weekend. The hotel was a good value (by NYC standards), with friendly staff and a comfortable, updated room. We were given a nice bottle of Rioja when I told them we were celebrating our 45th anniversary. This location in Chelsea is not the typical tourist area, which was fine with us since we didn’t want to be in the chaos of Times Square. We were able to walk to many places we wanted to see, including the Whitney Museum, the Highline, the West Village, and the Theatre District, logging in more than 15 miles in three days. It helped that it was not the typical hot and humid August NYC weather!I’d recommend this hotel to other travelers. Just be aware that it will cost you $65 a day to park your car. But my research tells me that is not unusual in the city for a larger SUV.

This Hilton hotel is a decent place to stay either with friends or family at Manhattan. The rooms are a bit small with the price they charge for a single room. Otherwise, service was good and cannot review their food as I didn't try it here.
user_name:
NishantS774
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hello, this hotel doesn't accept standard credit cards without the use of debit. If you are using a credit card, call and check ahead before booking to avoid being stuck at check-in.I've stayed at this hotel before: the rooms are clean and the location is great.
user_name:
RJ P
Union City, United States

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights this week while moving my son into the Fashion Institute of Technology around the corner. I have stayed here before and always found the staff helpful and courteous (every staff member you see in the hallway will greet you). This time was truly exceptional though. The bell staff, especially Shavonne (and Moises) were so helpful to us, making sure the 'out-of-staters' got moved in, going above and beyond the call of duty! Shavonne is a treasure. She supported me emotionally as well as physically with all our boxes and bags! Thank you to all. Will see you again in 2 weeks!

This Hilton does the job, but considering the high price, even by NYC standards, I was not impressed. Not many extras. Feeling the past refurbishment has been partial, many things remain a bit old.Staff just average. Location is good. OK for one night but one can find much better value for money.

I have stayed here several times because my parents live in this area. You need to shop around the various hotels in the area as prices really vary but this is probably the best option in Chelsea. Room are decent size for NYC, where hotel rooms tend to be quite small. Service has always been very good. Parking is expensive, but that is true everywhere in NYC and really, there is usually no reason to have a car here. Good access to multiple subway lines makes getting around very easy.

This property is located in the Fashion District of NYC which was a good location to visit family and go to the theatre. My next visit to this area I'll look for a different venue. Needed to ask for a fridge as all of the rooms do Not have one.

We have been staying at this Hiltonfor the past 5 years. Always a great property. Service is very good. Nice restaurant on the property. Awesome rooftop bar. Clean room and bathrooms. Great location near penn station, madison square park, flat iron, and union square.
user_name:
Gigi G
Ft. Lauderdale, United States

review_body: The location is great, a few blocks away from Penn Station, 34th Street, Empire State and Madison Square Garden.The hotel is comfortable and clean, staff is very nice and helpful, and the facilities are great.

This is a great hotel in a great location. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in the city. Great rooftop bar.
user_name:
Rolando A R
Seaford, NY, United States

review_body: Fabulous location for the money. Close to shopping district and Madison Square Garden. Beds are so comfortable. Perfect nights rest after sightseeing and shopping . Rare roof top bar and restaurant provide awesome drinks and dinner options.

The room was small, which I expected, but lovely, clean and the bed wa a dream to sleep in. Everything was functional and well laid out in the room and the location was perfect — easy to get wherever you needed to be. Would definitely come back.

I stayed for a business trip in the Chelsea district and this hotel fit perfectly. Great staff, good bar and I liked the layout of the king room I had. Gym is a little tight so get there before 6am. I never made it to the rooftop bar but JD heard good things.

This is my 8 time to stay with the Hilton Fashion District hotel and they have done it again. Everyone makes me feel like family down to drawing a happy face and welcome back on my bag of water at the front desk when I checked in. I really feel like it's a home away from home! Everyone at the front desk are fantastic and Alex the group sales director is wonderful to work with. I highly recommend this hotel you will not be disappointed!!!

I stay in hotels quite a bit, work and pleasure. Hilton Finacial district is one of my tops stays in general and in NYC definitely. Location is good, convenient proximity to transportation and restaurants; however the best is front desk accommodation. NYC can be dismal when it comes to check in, but never at the HFD. All the ladies are great and make you feel like home, every time.

This is my 6th stay at this hotel and it is always a great experience . This hotel is great and the staff really friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and the facilities really good . The roof top bar is amazing with great views . I really love this hotel and totally recommend you stay here for your visit to New York no matter what the occasion. Brilliant hotel

Staff was excellent. Sid and John D. Were great!!! The went above and beyond typical customer service. These guys made the trip so much more enjoyable can't say enough about these two employees!! Will definitely be staying again while in NYC!

This was my sixth stay in this hotel in the last three years. The experience is always the same - the rooms are comfortable, quiet, and impeccably clean, and the staff is professional, helpful, and go the extra mile to ensure your needs are met. I find the location is great (easy in an out of the city, close to several transportation options). At this point I'm not sure why I'd stay anywhere else.

Pro. The rooms were clean, service was good at the lobby bar and restaurant. Easy access to local restaurants, bars, and shops. Cons. The air conditioning in the room smelled disgusting and it was overly cold for the thermostat setting (I had to set it to 74 to not feel like it was 65). The rooftop bar service was slow and rude at the bar, even when not crowded. We were in a conference room in training and it was very loud in the hallway outside with workers talking loudly And banging things. Also an extreme lack of available restrooms for breaks when 17 people need to go at once. Breakfast omelette had veggies that tasted like chemicals. I’d stay here again, because it was cheap, clean and convenient but not anything special.

Our first impression was the front desk personnel. Absolutely fantastic!! The Manager, John D., went above and beyond even printing out a couple documents we needed for a college program. Front desk attendant, Sid, had excellent customer service skills and was very helpful and called us by name daily during our seven day stay. After we moved into our room, we found it to be clean and comfortable. If you do get a double bed room, they are doubles and not queens.
