Location was excellent, we walked or rode a subway to everywhere in Manhattan. Breakfast is not complimentary. There is a rooftop bar that opens daily at 5pm. We would stay at this hotel again.

But this section of Manhattan is not the best. Hotel is clean and well maintained, but 23rd - 35th streets are rather dirty. Note previous comments about the roof top bar. One elevator is dedicated exclusively to that end from about 5:30pm on. And I was certainly glad to be several floors below. I did take a look at the top bar, and it appeared to be a happening scene for under 30s.

Comfortable room and spacious enough.. Helpful staff at front desk. Handy location. Enjoyed the rooftop bar at RARE, Super views and well worth a visit. Beds very comfortable good nights sleep.Would return.

Fantastic! And Raquel & Zorabel at the Front Desk are OUTSTANDING!.Room was great. Evelyn & Crabtree toiletries in the WC. Quiet AC. Great Rooftop bar ("Rare View") where the beautiful & fabulous "Ally" served us our happy hour drinks before we went elsewhere for a dinner reservation. GREAT views on the roof, both afternoon and evening! Just loved everything about this place. The room was the perfect size. Great bed (bathrooms have showers only save for only a few rooms the FD told me) and you can have a fridge on request(!?).This was a "chance" booking via the Hotels Tonight app; it was such a good deal, we went for it. GREAT location for restaurants if you are a foodie like me/us. Good neighborhood and plenty of street parking (hotel parking prices are too high!).WELL DONE!
user_name:
annarchynyc
New York City, New York

review_body: We've stayed elsewhere in the vicinity and this is now the favorite. Arrived on a Friday evening and bellhop suggested we park free on the street for the whole weekend after 7 PM! Excellent, friendly staff seems happy. (Front desk not so much.) Larger, newer bathrooms. Very good restaurant which is great if you don't have the time to walk somewhere.

Great location, clean room and a good service at a good price. You can walk everywhere (from Central Park to Times Square and even to Battery park) and that's a big plus! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

After reading the reviews we Stayed here for the weekend with my husband it was great! One to watch out for can’t rate it enough. We would definitely book again the next time we are on the East Coast.

I've stayed here twice and have enjoyed both visits. They have clean and comfortable rooms in a great location. Easy to get to Time Square but you aren't in the hustle and bustle of NYC. The hotel is on one of the quieter streets and we never heard anything from our rooms. They have a rooftop bar with some views. I would skip the breakfast and try one of the many, amazing restaurants in the city.
user_name:
unfurcatable
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed here on a Friday night. Great linens in a decent sized room for NYC. The rooftop bar scenery & crowd was fun as well! Not a bad walk to most of the sights. Parking was about a block away & they validate so $42 per day (24 hours). Staff were friendly & helpful as well.

Hotel was OVERBOOKED after I called three different times before leaving Virgina to verify I could check in when arrving by train at 2am. Could not check in until noon missing 10 hours of sleep, thanks Hilton THIS IS NOT HOW YOU TREAT YOUR HONORS MEMBERS!!!To add further insult to injury, the 800 number Hilton people told me I could check in their DoubleTree early for that day and transferred me (6:30am now), then DoubleTree said I would have to pay for the night before and I said no thanks... 20 days later I have a charge on my credit card for a stay at DoubleTree, went through numerous calls trying to get it resolved... Now waiting for a credit..Never again!! Hilton also told my sister they had a cot for her room before checking in NOT!!! Another lie!

Before I start this hotel will not get a 3 on rating outside New York as there are much better hotels with bigger rooms and better amenities in other major cities So to start the room is in a reasonable size ( for New York) clean good bed . Bathroom is good for Hilton standards, good towels and the usual amenities There is a problem with the US with this floor type window AC which looks like it that the casing was not changed from the 70’s of last century and upgraded a bit to some electronic controls which works good as long as it on or off so the rooms gets too cold or too warm . We managed to control it by just covering ourselves and sleep as we are mostly outside during the day. The neighborhood was a bit noisy but we were on the 14th floor ( which actually more like the 7th or 8th comparing to another older building in front of us) so it was manageable Breakfast system was a bit strange as you can eat what ever you want as long as it doesn’t go over 20 dollars and you have to pay the difference we optioned the buffet which was 22 dollars so we paid the difference. There are other a la carte which is below that but eventually you will pay a bit over the fixed amount Over all we have been treated well and things were okay for New York standard

The rooms here are a good value for the money and larger than many other NY hotel in a similar price range. I’ve stayed atbthis hotel before for work and had a solid experience. However, for this trip, the service of the front desk staff was underwhelming and makes me rethink staying at this hotel again in the future.

This is a really nice hotel, quiet and comfortable in the center of Chelsea near lots of great restaurants and other fine establishments. I stayed here a week for business. The room I had was comfortable and clean. It was also remarkably quiet. There's a rooftop bar that closes somewhat early but still presents a great time, a nice lobby bar and restaurant with great food as well. The staff was super friendly. The rooms were priced nicely with respect to other rooms in the area. I like this hotel. Lots of great places to eat all around it. Not much parking but there are parking garages on this street.

After getting an absolutely amazing deal for an overnight stay via HotelTonight, I had to write a glowing review. The room was quite large, the staff was welcoming and kind, and the location was perfect. They even found my misplaced sunglasses and left them in my room. Thank you to the entire front desk team. Highly recommend.

This hotel is fantastic.It is centrally located a few blocks downtown from NY Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. There is easy access to the different subway lines. This location provides excellent access to the Chelsea and surrounding areas. It is an easy couple of stops on the subway uptown to 42nd Street, Times Square and other uptown tourist hotspots.My room was clean, tidy and average size for a New York hotel room. Shower was great.Breakfast in the restaurant was well priced and good value setting up for a big day in the city. The RareBar & Grille also served great meals for lunch and dinner.Very much enjoyed this Hilton chain hotel and will be staying again on my next NY trip.

It's one of the plenty hotels we scrolled through while looking for a place to stay in Manhattan. We found a good offer (as cheap as a hotel can be around there, so not much) and went for it. As a matter of fact it was a very good choice: we found ourselves in the heart of Manhattan, very close to some subway stations and some very important landmarks (MSG, Times Square, Madison Square Park etc). You will also find a whole market foods very close by (that helps if you want to try some healthy food). Plus our stay was upgraded and we found ourselves at the 21st floor with a fantastic view, especially at night.The room itself was very cosy and absolutely not small in size, with a comfortable queen-size bed.Room service was very generous with soaps and towels and people where very friendly and willing to help.

We had a top floor room with a view to the empire state building. The room was clean and comfortable, only thing we didn't like was that the mattress was slippery and if you leaned on the bed (put on shoes and such) it would move and you'll lose your balance. Though it didn't matter when sleeping.

I travel a lot for work, so I know a good hotel and this was great! Rooms were clean, well appointed, loved having coffee in room, and the bathroom products were fantastic ... brand and all. The room was not teeny tiny as so many are in the city. Front desk staff was friendly and efficient. Great place to stay for a weekend in NY!

Lovely stylish hotel. Great sized rooms. Good location, not too far from Times Square. Friendly helpful staff who were able to recommend places to go in New York! Clean and tidy hotel. Great restaurant. Would stay here again!

Have stayed here a couple of times for work, along with other Hiltons in NY - I like Hilton better than Club Quarters, the two hotel chains my corporation prefers. Anyway, this is plenty nice for work, pretty clean and modern. Good location, depending on what you need, but it is central for me. Would stay again for work...

Overall, this hotel is fantastic. Great location for shopping both lower Manhattan and mid town. Staff is super friendly and the manager is Awesome. Celabrated out anniversary here and the staff sent us champagne and chocolate strawberries. Would definitely stay here again. I'm a Hilton Diamond member so we got breakfast in their connected restaurant, Rare.

The Hilton Fashion District was a wonderful stay for our family over the long Memorial Day weekend. We arrived prior to check in time and had already selected a room on the 21st floor using the HH app. (By the way all double beds city view rooms face south, we were hoping for North facing Empire State Building for our young girls to enjoy. I did find this out when trying to select room for check in on the app). Having arrived before check in time we asked to store our luggage while going to get lunch, and the kind lady checking us in offered a room on the 19th floor that was already available. Our two girls were also greeted with crayons and activity pads by the front desk staff, which after a long day of traveling brought smiles back to their faces. We were thanked for being Hilton silver members and given a bag with waters. We were told about the rooftop bar, which my husband was able to go up one night and enjoy drinks and the views. Kids were not allowed up, but the front desk did say if we came down to the desk early they would take us up with our girls so they could enjoy the view prior to the bar opening. We tried at 4:30 on Saturday after getting back from a broadway show, but they said the bar would be opening soon & to come back down the next morning. It was storming the next morning, so I never made it up there with my girls. Maybe next time.The hotel room had a view of water towers not much else; I would definitely recommend the higher floors. A positive, with the room facing south, it was very quiet as far as no street noise. The doors to rooms are extremely loud when closing though, so we could hear those during the middle of the night at times. The room was spotless (which is huge for me, especially traveling with little ones who are all over the place) beds were comfortable & room was cleaned & refreshed daily. The Keurig was a huge plus! Also requested a mini fridge & a couple foam pillows which were brought up. Loved the cotton balls in the bathroom for removing makeup, I would order those myself if I knew where Hilton ordered them from. Small, dense & soft :) the little things do make a big difference. The location is great. We walked to Google to meet a family member for lunch & a tour, walked the highline, walked to Chelsea piers so the kids could play, walked to Madison square park, & plenty of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. There’s a great coffee shop just around the corner & a Whole Foods a couple blocks away. Subway entrance was only a couple blocks away also, so that was easy to catch to head up to the natural history museum & Central Park.We loved our stay at the Hilton Fashion District & I will definitely stay again. Thank you Hilton!

The staff is top-notch. Rooms are small but very adequate. Clean. Great water pressure in the shower. The location is very central and we felt safe walking in the area day or night. I would definitely stay here again.

One of many small footprint hotels to open in NYC in the past decade or so.PRO: Great staff; well appointed rooms with plenty of drawer space, a safe, mini-bar; fast elevators; good location about 6 blocks from Penn Station, near stops on several subway lines, at the north end of Chelsea, so plenty of restaurants and services close-by including a laundromat with wash and fold service across the street. CON: Rooms are small even by NYC standards (e.g. smaller than the Hilton Garden Inn W. 35th St and Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea), no refrigerator in rooms; more noticeable outside noise than other NYC properties; small lobby.Has a small, but well equipped fitness room. The Rare Bar & Grill steakhouse is in the hotel – has a nice bar and serves a good breakfast (did not have dinner here). Has rooftop bar which seemed popular. I suspect some of the noise noted above came from the rooftop bar. BOTTOM LINE: A good choice, but compare prices to other nearby properties.FOR HILTON HONORS GOLD/PLATINUM MEMBERS: The breakfast benefit is $20 credit/person at Rare. While there are several hot items available at this amount, it does not cover the buffet (there is no continental buffet option). Food and service are very good.

What a great weekend dress shopping for my daughter's wedding dress. The Hilton was centrally located to a number of the places we went and very close to Kleinfeld where ultimately.... she said yes to the dress! Great hotel, clean rooms, very helpful staff and a great rooftop bar that has a great view of the city.

I returned to this hotel recently because my first experience was really good. The staff is nice and helpful and the rooms are clean and modern (enough). The breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced for NYC.

My husband and I have stayed at Hilton New York Fashion District hotel numerous times. The location is perfect for our needs, the staff friendly and accommodating, the room clean and inviting! Another excellent stay at the hotel!

Only stayed one night but Great location. Good restaurant on site. Lots of places to eat close by and places to walk too. Not too far from the subway. Nice staff and good accommodations. Great price and value.

The hotel is nice and in a good area. The rooms are small. However, DO NOT venture into the restaurant. The tip is added to all tickets which translates into horrible service. I would have found another breakfast spot except it was raining. The food is not good. I tried to substitute a little fruit for the gross potatoes and they refused...even at an up charge. I had to ask for more coffee each morning and ask for the ticket in order to leave. No one once came to check and see how my food was once it arrived. Why do you force a tip allowing the wait staff to completely ignore the guests? Seems ridiculous.

Staff and our room was amazing and the rooftop bar exclusively for guests was awesome! Husband and I celebrated our birthdays here in New York and the Hilton was great, housekeeping was amazing too. Would definitely book with Hilton again in the future.

we had an event in Chelsea, so this was a convenient hotel. It was clean and QUIET. I had a room on the 4th floor and was a bit afraid it would be noisey, but it was great - no road noise, no elevator noise. I got a great nights sleep!

I stayed in this hotel for two nights on a business trip. The room more than met my needs and I liked the decor. The makeup mirror in the bathroom was a nice touch. The elevators were fast. One thing I liked was that this is not a large hotel and there was never a crowd or wait for the elevators. The only negatives for me were the very small closet and the lack of in-room pay per view movies. The closet was so small that the ironing board had to fit vertically in front of the hangers. The number of hangers was adequate, thankfully. The luggage rack, also stored in the closet, was about half the normal size. The room did not have a refrigerator per se, but did have an automated mini bar which did not have extra space to put your own items. There were soft drinks and food in the mini bar but no alcohol despite this being offered on the in room menu. You could order food up to your room from the restaurant adjacent to the hotel. I enjoyed my meal at this establishment. I went down to eat in the bar rather than order room service. Good gourmet burgers.
user_name:
sladana
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Extremely friendly service. You feel really welcome. Rooms are not very big (but that's new york) but very clean and fully functional. Affordable breakfast options also. Subways are very close. We missed the rooftop bar because of the weather, but it is nice that they have it.

I recently spent 5 nights at this hotel. The room very clean & comfortable. The free wifi, rooftop bar & gym added value to my stay. The view from the rooftop bar is great when the city is lit up of an evening. The location is very good being close to downtown shopping and the Empire State Building.

On the date that we stayed, this hotel was an excellent value. Our room was large, by NYC standards, bathroom updated, beds comfortable. There was a work desk in the room, plenty of wardrobe and drawer space. My companion was especially enthusiastic about the makeup mirror. The wifi also worked great and we were on a higher floor.The staff of both hotel and restaurant were helpful. We liked that they allowed us to store luggage in a secured area both several hours prior to check in and several hours after our check out. Especially nice was the Tip Jar on the counter, instead of having to tip the luggage attendants directly. It's not as ackward at having to hand someone a tip, directly.The location is an easy walk to Penn Station or a couple of subway stations that have good connections. It's proximity to 6th and 7th Ave, make it an easy place to get a ride service or cab. Although we stayed on a Sunday night, we walked back to the hotel from about .5 mile away and felt safe in the hotel's neighborhood.

It takes about 2 minutes to reach to the closest subway stations which is very nice! The room is clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The toilet in the room however was very interesting, it flushes like the toilet on the airplane. Rooftop bar was kinda cool but cocktail selections wasn't many. The neighborhood is already a bit quieter than time square but still you can hear sirens and horns honking all the time.

This hotel is well situated in the fashion district and was a good mid-point departure for long walks through the city uptown and downtown. This Hilton is a notch below hotels like the Hilton Millenium. It is in a category more like a Hyatt Place or Holiday Inn. Rooms are small but well appointed with excellent bedding. The in-room coffee machine is a plus. Ask for a room on the back side of the hotel. The street side is very noisy. The rooftop bar closed early, but offers a nice view. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Really clean and the rooms were great couldn't fault it really. Only thing was it only had dim wall lights so struggled to see what you were writing while sat at the table as the lights were also situated behind you next to the bed and one on the wall near the door and permanently needed to keep the blinds closed because there are office blocks next door and can see straight in.I know it's new york but still nevertheless. Nice and quiet and really couldn't fault the location as it depends on what you want to do while you are there and how you want to get around.If it weren't for them little details it would of got a five.

First off, the breakfast bar closed really early. It was a clean hotel and the staff was kind. However, my friend had left his stereo and I had left a dust bag for my purse in the room after we had left and neither one of us got our stuff back, which isn't shocking, given that it is New York. In addition, we had requested a room with two queen size beds and we got twin size beds, which wasn't great for sharing.

Great service to make my room available for a early check-in to accommodate my fresh-up before my 2 PM meeting! The rooms are small but efficient en the beds are good. The rooftop bar (see photo) is great and the mini hamburgers are excellent finger food:)Value for money in NY.

For my experience, it did not reach my expectation of Hilton's standard. The room is small and the location is not convenient.The woman of housekeeping service was rude and complaint my late checkout.
user_name:
aimyl2018
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here for 2 weeks while in NYC for work. In a Hilton loyalist but I just cannot bear staying at the Millennium— that property has desperately needed a remodel for years.Anyhow, I actually found this hotel to be in a great area (Chelsea) and there are subway lines very close by. It’s also not that far to the High Line.The rooms are not cavernous so don’t expect that but they are decently appointed and I liked the chocolates on the pillow each night!The staff were very friendly, helpful, and accommodating. I just may stay here again the next time in town.

I spent a few days at the Hilton Fashion district and found the location perfect. The hotel itself was clean with a roof top bar and a restaurant and bar downstairs. Everything we ordered was delicious though we only had one meal there as we were spoilt for choice with so many places to eat around. It’s off 7th Avenue and a walking distance to Penn Station, Madison Square GARDENS. There’s a Macy’s store not to far a DSW and some other high street stores dotted around it was also were we caught the tour bus for our sightseeing.The staff were very friendly and helpful too. Surplus towels, hot and powerful shower as well.I did find the room decor a bit dark. Looked like dusk all the time even on a bright and sunny day. However, it’ll definitely be my go to for any trips to NYC.

I have stayed at this property on multiple occasions, including last weekend. While the hotel is showing its age a little bit, the lovely Hilton team makes up for it with their personality and hard work. We were there for a Peloton Event (indoor cycling) and we were treated so well by the entire staff. We were a very rambunctious bunch and they handled it all with good humor and great service. Well done!

We liked the location because we can usually find weekend on street parking. It is also quite close to Midtown and the Village for walking/dining purposes. The staff was very helpful and the room a little larger than many midtown hotel rooms.

WHERE IT SHINES+ It's a Hilton, so you know what to expect, more or less. + Modern decor that was relatively new; not dated.+ Nice bathroom with good shower pressure and bright lighting.+ Shower enclosure had a 3-inch curb and glass door, so no flood on the bathroom floor.+ Mini-fridge delivered to my room upon request. + Well located.WHERE IT FADES– No wOw! factor– Modern decor is dark and room is not well lit. My middle (12th) floor room with a back-alley view didn't receive much natural light so, dark decor + dark room = cave, even on sunny days. – The in-room refrigerator is a motion activated ($) mini-bar with zero free space and a “No Refunds” sign. It’s for Hilton’s use, not yours.– There are zero USB ports in the room. The only nod in that direction is an iHome clock radio featuring the long obsolete, 16-pin iPhone connector and no adapter. – The narrow yet deep closet is in the darkest corner of the room, far from the lone ceiling light, and without its own interior light. I always needed the flashlight app on my phone to see my clothes. It drove me crazy!– Wall thermostat is locked and temperature is controlled centrally, like an office building. Too warm? Too bad.
user_name:
chachi69
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We always choose the Fashion District Hilton for our stays in New York. It has a great location, the staff is friendly, the restaurant is good and never too crowded, and the price is reasonable. We stayed on the 16th floor. Not a great view, but a decent sized room, the room service was fast and good, and every staff person did their best to be of help.

For NYC, this is a go to hotel if I just want an easy and reasonably priced hotel. It’s always clean, pretty good size rooms, the people are so nice and you can ask for a quiet room. Not all rooms are quiet, but many are. It’s NYC so for those complaining about noise...honestly, even at a 5 star it’s nearly unavoidable; loudest city in the world! The service was lovely, and in fact, I had a bizarre allergic reaction one night and couldn’t even walk to a pharmacy. The front desk sent someone from the engineering department out to pick up some medication for me. The guy paid out of pocket. I didn’t have cash, and he couldn’t put it on my room. He literally said don’t worry about it, and it was $25! Of course, the next day I left him the money at the front desk, but the gesture was so kind and really over the top. I had to transfer to another hotel my last night as my plans changed, and the Hilton was booked. It was a terrible experience and so happy for only one night. And that was a more expensive and hipster hotel. Highly recommend, though reluctantly, as I don’t want everyone to find out about this little gem!

I expect my hotel rooms to be clean, comfortable, and quiet. It was clean and comfortable and I know it is hard to accomplish the "quiet" in NYC but this hotel/area seems more noisy than usual with loud bangs and trucks during the night. I felt like I was sleeping with the window open. Strike One. As a Diamond member, I get a free breakfast, which was good because if I had to pay for this food I would have been outraged. I ordered the $17 Western Omelette. It came with no ham, raw peppers/onions, and no cheese. Basically it was scrambled eggs. The toast was so dry it was inedible. Strike Two. When I got the bill it had a minibar charge on it even though I didn't use the minibar. I had just checked out and the room couldn't have been serviced in the two minutes it took me to get the bill. I did call the hotel and they took the charge off right away but where did this charge come from? Strike Three.

My wife and I were visiting NewYork for a short break to do some sight seeing and to catch a concert at the Madison Square Gardens. The hotel was in a good location with Madison Square Gardens, Macy’s and Time Square all within easy walking distance. The reception staff were courteous and helpful as were the other staff that we.encountered. We did not eat at the hotel as we chose to use a local diner for breakfast and to visit nearby restaurants for dinner. All in all this hotel was suitable for our needs and we would recommend to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel that provides clean and comfortable accommodation without the frills.

Suppose to get corporate discount ... nope not available. Check in ... terrible. Roof top bar ... terrible. Rare bar... terrible. Never had a worse experience. And I’m a diamond. He figure. Go somewhere else.

The Hilton in Fashion District is close to the train station and was centrally located for our family visit and taking in a Broadway show. We have stayed here before and were not disappointed. We will stay here again.

We had to pack up and move rooms at 11:30pm after an air conditioning unit broke and flooded several rooms. The room where the ac unit broke did have a do not disturb sign on it... but it was very clear that there was an issue in that room, the water spilling out from under the door and the condensation from the steam were giveaways. The staff didn't go into the room and shut off the ac unit until another hotel guest and I told the hotel staff that we had pinpointed the issue. When the hotel staff opened up the room, there were several inches of water covering the floor. Several rooms were effected, at least two rooms adjacent to the flooded room were filling with water, as were rooms below the flooding. It took about 30 minutes to get a new room - the floor of our room was quickly getting soaked and we were told to move. We were given a new room, and we told that new room keys would be slid under the door for us (they never were). When we got to the new room, the window was open, which was not ideal since it was 42 degrees outside. We were exhausted after having to get out of bed, helping the hotel staff identify the source of the flooding, packing, and moving. We didn't want to move yet again, but it sucked that the new room was ice cold.The hotel felt outdated and has no frills, and I wasn't a big fan before the flooding issue. We just feel lucky that it wasn't our room that flooded, and that we were able to move to another room. We did receive points to cover our stay the night of the flooding. The issue that concerned me is that the hotel staff was slow to react - they hesitated to go into the flooded room even though we could hear water running and there was water flowing from under the doorway.

Great place to stay, very close to everything. Easy check in and check out. The bathroom and shower were much larger than most places I've stayed in NYC. My only complaint was that the pillows were the size of throw pillows. Next time I will stay there again but I'll bring my own pillow

This hotel is in a great location, all local attractions are nearby. Times sq, empire state building are close by. There is also a subway station a couple of blocks away so you can get pretty much anywhere. The room was clean and comfortable, pretty small but hey its NYC. Staff are super friendly and accommodated all our requests. The rooftop bar is beautiful and a great addition to this location. Would stay here again.

This hotel is very nice and located in a very convenient location for Chelsea, fashion district, Madison Square Gardens, Empire State Building and the High Line (a few blocks of walking). The rooms are small but very nice and well equipped with everything you need. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The restaurant on site is good offering burgers, salads and other entrees. In addition, the hotel has a roof top bar that I can't comment on as I did not visit it on this trip.The hotel promotes fixed price transportation service to JFK for $73 or $74 including tolls and tip in a town car. It's a great option during rush hour when taxi's and Uber/Lyft are applying surge pricing. However, you should know that it is cash only (found out only after getting to the airport). Would be nice to know that in advance.

Came here for a long theatre weekend. The location is fantastic- right in Chelsea, a short walk to many great neighborhoods, including the theatre district. Check in was pleasant and easy. The front desk staff were helpful and pleasant. Room was comfortable, although housekeeping had the room stifling hot when I walked in. Good amount of hot water if you don’t shower during peak times, Sunday morning was cold! The worst thing was the fire alarms went off at 230 in the morning due to a malfunction, and the intercom kept waking people up. While malfunctions happen, the concerning thing was that NO ONE on the night staff knew what was going on. It was very evident that none has been trained on operating the fire panel and had no clue what was going on. They also never communicated to guests standing outside at 3 AM. We got more info from the fire dept. Very concerning that it seems there is a lack of training regarding emergency procedures and leadership overnight. They ended up comping the night(probably for the whole hotel). While this was a nice gesture, knowing that there is adequate staff in-servicing would be more reassuring for future stays.

This hotel is in a fantastic location, away from all the Times Square noise but close enough to walk there and see the sites on the way. Excellent bar and restaurants nearby.Rooms are very clean and comfy beds, wifi is also very good.Has an amazing rooftop bar with great views, I would definitely stay here again for business and would have no hesitation in booking this for my family.

Very nice hotel conveniently located. The room was lovely..but I wanted to call out the fine service. We moved rooms because we wanted a quiter one, we asked for a fridge, we needed help with a sewing kit, we had to store baggage, order a towncar etc. You name it, we did it! even though we were needy guests, everyone was absolutely super and I can highly recommend a stay! Plus the roof bar is great with friendly staff (including the door guy downstairs and the lady who was running the lift) and super drinks.

Nice okay easy to reach Hotel in the Fashion district of Manahattan. The Hotel is nice and with the new year a great rooftop party. The Personal is helpfull as seperate persons they do there best. The restaurant on the side is I think a seperate lease. The resaturant was for us a complete desepcion. We had to give our credit card before ordering, they kept it and at the end of your dinner or just drinks you get it back. At our first visit this was not the case, obviously we did not give our credit card to complete strangers. Than for the New Year party they double charged us. Lots of work, finally the great people of the Hilton helpdesk made them return our double charged money (over $700). Overall great hotel with terrible restaurant.And yes, I did get a itchy back from the bed sheets...and yes the answer was: that can happen some times... :-).

Fairly centrally located a few blocks from Penn Station with metro round the corner. Newly refurbished rooms and baths. Fast wifi internet access. Restaurant serves a nice breakfast buffet for 22$ (excluding coffee/tea, tax and service). The roof top bar is a must visit for the sunset view. Good beer and nice drinks and smaller bites for hangry guests

We love this location: it is walkable EVERYWHERE. Staff is very friendly, extremely accommodating. Room is good size for NYC, clean, nice decor. We'll look forward to staying here again, and definitely will recommend to family & friends.

We spent a week in New York and stayed at Hilton Fashion District. The hotel was within walking distance (with luggage) from Penn Station and there is also a subway station close to the hotel. The room had an ok size and was nice and clean. There was also a minibar, safe deposit box and a hairdryer at the room. The air-conditioning didn't work when we arrived, but the front desk was able to fix that within five minutes. The free wifi at the hotel worked fine for normal internet use. The location of the hotel was very good. The street in front of the hotel was quiet and the subway station nearby was very handy. There were also plenty of places to have breakfast in the vicinity. The wardrobe in the room was very small, but we managed. The sound-isolation between the rooms were very good, but the sound-isolation from the corridor could have been better. Thankfully we had a room some distance away from the elevators so weren't bothered by noise from the elevators. The beds were very comfortable so we woke up fresh and rejuvenated every morning. So, would we stay here again? Absolutely, but we would ask for a room away from the elevators.

Pro's - Location is great (Couple blocks from MSG) - Friendly Staff - Rooftop Bar 5/5 Stars - Decent Price for Room Con's - Room was a bit Small - My view was right across from an Office so there wasn't much privacy

I liked some of my past experiences in Hilton Hotels located in different cities, but definitely avoid staying in Hilton Fashion District in New York. Rooms are small, staff are impatient and rude, carpets are dirty, there is always noise coming from other rooms and outside and so on. Might consider staying in other Hilton Hotels but not this one, not again.
user_name:
i0zcan
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice rooms - what you come to expect from a Hilton. Be prepared for a really busy lobby area as it is close to Times Square and there are a lot of tourists. Large hotel with lots of rooms, so you may also be in for a great view on the upper floors.

I had a perfectly nice stay at this hotel. The location is good (walking distance to Midtown, Penn Station, MSG, Chelsea, the Village, etc) and the service was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a good size and were nicely furnished and were always clean. I would recommend this hotel when the prices are reasonable.

I’m a frequent visitor to this property - love the location! Easy checkin process, and reasonably sized rooms for NYC. Shoutout to Chitra in housekeeping! Such a pleasant and dedicated team member, who works hard to ensure we have a terrific stay!

Yes Hilton is a chain but it was very accommodating to a person with accessibility issues. We stayed a few nights and had everything we needed in the hotel. The concierge was helpful and helped us get tickets on short notice for a play. I thought this hotel was perfect (for us)!I will definitely stay there again.

I had such a great time at the Hilton Fashion District. The front desk staff, (Mily, Caroline, and Martha) made our group feel welcomed and were very helpful. The location is great and I highly recommend this hotel for anyone.

We got a great deal on Travelzoo for a Sunday-Tuesday stay. We arrived before check-in so they stored our bags and then took them to our room because we were returning late in the evening. The front desk staff was very pleasant and professional. We had a room up on the 18th floor where it was very quiet, even in close proximity to the elevators. I'd have given them five stars, but the pillows were a little hard for me and my husband. But that's the only slightly negative thing I have to say. The cappuccino was delicious in their restaurant, Rare, as well. Definitely would stay there again.

We recently spent an enjoyable weekend at the Hilton New York Fashion District. Check-in was handled efficiently by the friendly desk staff. Our room was on the 21st floor across from the elevators. We were pleased with our room's layout and amenities--it was small, but well designed and met all of our needs. The space was clean, the bed was comfortable, the room temperature was easily adjusted to our preferences. The city view from our window was unexpectedly impressive. We've stayed in NYC many times--often with a view of a brick wall or something equally uninteresting. In this case, we were pleased to find a gorgeous city skyline with a view of the Empire State Building--a very nice plus! The only downside--at one point we could clearly hear the conversation of a group who was laughing in the hall right outside of our room. This could have become a big problem if it had occurred more frequently, but fortunately it only happened one time. (Note to maintenance - there was a noticeable air gap at the edge of the door which probably lets sound travel quite easily.) The hotel's location turned out to be very convenient in several ways. We enjoyed the on-site restaurant for breakfast, where we opted to eat twice. We ordered from the menu. Everything was tasty, and there was a nice selection. We also visited the ale house directly across the street in the evenings, which was a very convenient location. The subway station was only a short walk from the hotel. There were numerous additional options for breakfast, coffee, or dining within walking distance. Based on the rate we paid, we were extremely happy with this choice and would not hesitate to stay again.

Nothing to write home about. Stayed here on a business trip. Room was small, but comfortable enough. Good iron and hairdryer. Just dont expect the staff to go out of their way to help you. Realized I forgot a cellphone charger. Saw the alarm clock radio had a dock. Hoped it would also charge my phone. No luck. Called down to the front desk and asked if they had a charger. All I got was a no sorry. Seriously, i assume people just like me forget their chargers on a daily basis. You serious down offer them for rent or purchase? Your concierge doesnt have one? You personally dont have one that I could borrow if I charged my phone at the front desk. Way to help me problem solve at 11pm. I won't be staying here again.

If you are a Hilton Honors member and need to stay in the fashion district or Korea Town, this hotel is above average. They renovated the hotel about 7-8 years ago, when they turned it into a Hilton property, so the rooms are relatively modern. The restaurant and the bar are decent, with good drinks and food. They have changed the breakfast policies for HH members and I really don't like them: any BF charge up to $20 is on the house, but the breakfast beet is 22 plus tip (they charge the tip upfront). I hope they reverse this policy!When open, the rooftop bar (terrace and covered) offers excellent views or both north and south parts of the city.

I booked this hotel for a work trip, as I normally stay at the Double Tree in Jersey City & have had pleasant experiences with other Hilton properties. The hotel itself is in a good location & had mostly positive reviews on Google (4.1/5). The staff was very friendly upon arrival & professional. Understanding that you're in mid-town NYC, it's going to be noisy, there was construction going on at a lot 2 doors down. The construction continued until about 3-4 AM in the morning. Not the hotel's fault but they should complain based on construction permits & noise ordinances. Additionally, the sheets in the room were very scratchy & likely needed to be thrown away. The rooms are mostly outdated to begin with. While I'll likely stay at another Hilton, I likely won't return to this property.
user_name:
Alex R
New York City, New York

review_body: Awesome Hotel. Great customer service and clean rooms. The staff was very friendly and gave great restaurant referrals. I was nervous about traveling to New York but they made our stay very comfortable.

My stay was average at best staff was friendly. There are a lot of places within walking distance. Beware of additional fees. Was offered early check-in through booking which the hotel had to approve they offered the check-in based on availability but never metioned that it would be a nominal fee. Though it wasn't really much it just would have been great to know prior to arrival.

The room was clean, and situated at a super convenient location. The restaurant downstairs, Rare was really good as well.. The only complaint I have is that the employee (shorter fellow) who took our luggage into the storage room for the day was not very friendly. He really looks like he dislikes his job.

Have stayed here twice, both times it’s been just fine. The rooms have little things that are a little old or don’t work well, but the important stuff all works fine. But, nothing special. Staff are friendly.

I truly enjoyed this hotel! It’s really centrally located with easy access to Madison Square Garden. The hotel and rooms are immaculate but it’s the staff the truly makes the hotel shine. The wait staff at Rare for breakfast, the Bartenders at the Rare bar in the evening were truly exceptional. The front desk crew was professional, engaging and truly made me feel welcomed. This was one of the best Hilton properties that I have stayed in. The city can be a tad bit noisy in the morning, but this little inconvenience was overshadowed by an overall outstanding Hilton stay!!

This small hilton in chelsea area is great for quick in and out. I usually stay at the Hilton New York which is huge and it can take 5-10 mins to get out of the hotel. This hotel is in a quiet lane and their is no traffic noise on any floor. I would stay here again.

It is a beatifull hotel whith situated in the center of Manhattan / NY. My room was enough big with comfortable bed. There are coffee-machine, iron, iron-desk besides standard things. I find one flaw - it is a view from window to the wall of other building.

The Hilton in the NYC Fashion District is in a wonderful location for walking. It is only a few blocks to Macy’s and shopping in Herald Square and we always felt very safe. It’s also only a few blocks to The Highline which was a new adventure for us. We even walked down to The Village area and then over to Chelsea Market. The staff was very helpful and super friendly. We ate breakfast every morning (Hilton Gold perk!) and it was a great menu full of options. Our waitress was a delight! The drinks in the bar were also very tasty and appetizers were yummy and plentiful. We would definitely return!

We stayed here for the weekend and the hotel is friendly, clean and convenient. Great if you want to walk the city in either direction and convenient to NYU and Union Square. The room was very comfortable for two people.

My stay at the Hilton Fashion District was excellent. I had given up faith in the Hilton brand after bad experiences in NYC and Italy.The assistance with some issues and changes by Christine from the front desk were very well appreciated. Felt like being an Honors member was actually worth something. Great Service all around. Excellent location to get just about anywhere.

Stayed here Friday-Sunday. Picked it to be close to the Peloton studio, but wound up being central to all of our weekend activities. Rooms are a good size, especially in NYC. Nice staff. Comfortable beds, good bathroom, in-room coffee. Coffee/tea shops nearby, as well as a Whole Foods. Neighborhood is quiet on the weekends. No complaints.

This hotel was definitely a good choice for our recent family trip to NYC. It was located close to Penn station, major attractions but set back away from too much chaos. We were able to do most of our travel on foot, which was nice, and also a central location so UBER wasn't too much of a cost when needed!The room was clean, the staff was wonderful and the hotel was beautiful. They also have a luggage hold for if you check out before you're done in the city!Thank you!

This Hilton is in the Fashion District - close to Penn Station and subway stations. It is a fairly short walk to Time Square. The restaurant and bat in the hotel are very good. The security is great and the room are decent size and clean.

Stayed this past weekend with my wife for our 30th anniversary. Arrived at 9 AM and received call at 945 AM that rooms was ready. We were on 18th floor and had very nice view. Room was spotless and team members were extremely friendly. They have a nice restaurant and great rooftop lounge/bar. Hotel is in the perfect location and very close walk to Penn Station for train back home. Times Square is very close and you are mid point to many locations. As Hilton Honors we always stay at Hilton branded properties - This is one of their top properties . We will absolutely return when heading back to NYC. Great job Hilton. Thank you

Hotel was fine asks for the area, price was very good. Found the good inn the hotel bar and restaurant to be excellent. A little pricey, but worth it. Clean rooms, don't plan too check inn before the allotted time, every time I stay here, I have to wait to check in...other than that, excellent stay.

I stayed here based on a recommendation from colleagues, specifically because of location. Based on my experience, I would not stay here again. The lobby is tiny and cramped, however the staff is pleasant and accommodating. Each floor is very small, so every room hears the elevator in the tiny hallways. The rooms are extremely tiny and barely adequate for one. The bedspread was scary stains on it, which was outright disgusting to say the least. The ventilation system is loud, waking you up each time it turns on. The bathroom is tiny, with a shower that is barely large enough to shower in. Cruise ship showers are larger. The mirror in the bathroom had optical distortions, which was interesting as well.

Arrived tired and sick. But staff at the Hilton made me feel special and cared for. Room service for breakfast, tea service was phenomenal. Very timely with awesome food! Thank you! One day resting and other 3 working. Enough time to to get me back on my feet! Thank you!

Stayed four nights for business and chose it for location nearby the office. The rooms were pretty descent size and aircondition work well (it was very cold in New York -20C /-4F)Not far from Chelsea, Madison Square Park and a lot of good restaurants and bars to chose from. (Belgian Beer Cafe).I like to run and always try to book hotels that has a descent gym. And the gym has 2 treadmills, one step machine, a bike, some weights and multi gym.Order dinner from roomservice (and the friendliness was not much to talk about, just took orders, and couldn't wait to hang up). So a better option is to dine in the restaurant Rare in the same building.

Wonderful stay in this prime location Hilton. Walking distance to everything you could possibly need. Friendly, courteous staff, immaculate clean facility, swanky rooftop bar. The rooms are small as it is NYC; however well laid out and Cozy. I generally choose Hilton for the Honors rewards program, and I generally enjoy my stay. Especially their new app. Cheers

The hotel is new, the interior is fresh, room is OK, relatively new furniture, the bathroom and toilet are new. the hotel staff was friendly, of the sensors of the door locks in the rooms should be checked because they either are not sensible or the system is not working properly.
user_name:
ulanbeka2015
New York City, New York

review_body: The location of this hotel is quite nice and there is absolutely nothing wrong with it but doesn't live up to the "Hilton experience". The lobby is small and crowded and we had to spend quite some time waiting by the lifts. The rooms are very standard and small as you'd expect in a Manhattan facility. Breakfast was quite expensive and ok but nothing that added anything extra to your hotel experience. Assuming this hotels sells by it's location. There is nothing wrong with it but keep your expectations moderate.

This hotel is located in fashion district between 6 and 7 avenue. 15 minutes walk to times square. From our room we had an amazing view on the empire state building. Great place to stay for visiting NY

Cheeky visit to new york and stayed. At this. Lovely hilton. Dont normally enjoy hilton but this did nit dissapoint and maybe turned my head. Will deffinately return and hope the service is fantastic again

Stayed for 4 nights as a 60th Birthday treat from my husband. My son and partner also travelled with us. Check in was quick. Day we arrived was my husband's birthday and on entering our room was pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of champagne and a greetings card for him, compliments of the hotel. Also my son and his partner received a bottle in their room aswell. Room was small but adequate with everything we needed. Complimentary toiletries and tea and coffee. Hairdryer and iron provided, also a mini bar but we didn't use this. Ate breakfast in hotel once during our stay. It was okay. Plenty of places to eat out and about. Highly recommend Ellen's Stardust Diner, solely for the experience of singing waiters and waitresses.My son and partner got engaged, whilst in New York. They were further surprised with flowers, balloons and bottle, in their room, again courtesy of hotel. Throughout our stay, staff very friendly and helpful. Room cleaned daily. We thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel and wouldn't hesitate staying again.

Enjoyed the place and the staff was warm and welcoming. I found the rooms a tad small but what can you expect from a hotel in new york. If you're doing things in the area this is a good option vs stayin higher mid-town

Great hotel to stay in the city. Bed very comfortable. Awesome hot water for a shower. Yes it is compact but very efficient. The downside was the cold weather. The cold was coming through the room window and the sliding front doors were not working so the restaurant door was working but not a great weather baffle. But I would add that these concerns only really cause a problem when it is like 10 degrees outside...Coffee maker worked well. The housekeepers were friendly and helpful. The front desk was awesome.

This hotel is in a nice location. It is 2 streets away from a subway station making it easy to get around. On the whole the staff were friendly and helpful. We were missing hot water on 2 mornings but we were compensated for the inconvenience.

We were a family of four staying for one night. The location (Chelsea) was great. Many restos and coffee shops around (Chipotle and Whole Foods). The beds were comfortable enough. No noise coming from the street as we had an office building as our view. Downside : shower in our room was bizarre. You had to reach in to turn it on and a glass wall was blocking the faucet which made it really hard to adjust the temperature before getting in. I'm not sure why most hotels have not switched to handheld showerheads to avoid these problems. The room was quite dark and even with all the lights on you cannot get proper lighting. I don't know how housekeeping can even get the room cleaned with so little light. That would explain why there were forgotten socks in the closet.

If anyone asks you where this hotel is, say Chelsea. No one calls this area "The Fashion District." :)Great location. Nice, clean hotel. Rooms are a bit on the small side, but that is common for rooms in Manhattan. Make sure you know what type of bed you're booking. Don't just assume you'll get a queen or king if you book a standard room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We discovered not long after checking into our room that there was an infant next door to us that really enjoyed screaming. A lot. Mily was extremely helpful and offered to switch us to a different room. We felt like valued customers. It was a very positive experience.

We've been to NYC well over a dozen times: this was our first time at the Hilton Fashion District. We'd definitely stay here again. The location was truly perfect: within 5-7 minutes of five different subway lines, tons of markets and eateries, and out of the way-touristy parts of towns. We could get to Theater District in less than 15 min, up to Lincoln Center in less than 25. Staff was friendly; rooms were clean and fairly spacious; and rates decent.

From check in to check out, my experience at hotel was not what expected from a full service Hilton. Checking in on a cold and snowy Saturday, I was told, by a very apathetic person at check in, that I would get a call when my room was available. That call never came. My Hilton Gold Honors Status was never acknowledged, my room, which was supposed to be an upgrade, was interior with a view of a brick wall.. shall I go on? I am puzzled by the better than average reviews. This was not the case in my situation. From the unwelcoming check in to the invoice at the end that was not the right size for the envelope that was handed to me, everything was subpar. Hilton sends a survey a day or two after check out. I gave my honest opinion and was contacted by a member of the hotel staff who stated they would review my comments with the hotel's Executive Team. That was over two weeks ago and I am still waiting for a response.. Never again!!!

We arrived at the hotel at around 1pm, and were allowed to check in early which was a bonus after a flight from London! The staff on the desk were always friendly and helpful. The rooms were a good size for NY, were lovely and clean, with a nice view of the Empire State Building. The beds were soooo comfortable, I slept even better than I do at home! The coffee machine in the room was great as well, and restocked everyday. There is a mini bar in the room, although pretty high prices so we didn't use it!The location was also very good, with plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. We would recommend Malibu for a good value, large breakfast! Also close by to 2 subway stations making it very easy to get around, and a short walk from madison square garden.Would definitely return to this hotel if I'm ever back in NYC.

We are HHonors members. First problem - received email invitation to check-in and pick room day before arrival. I clicked to do that - was given map of rooms available - not many left, but I picked one. Get here and my bill is $100 higher than I agreed when making original reservation online. Now I have to go argue with them about it, but I'm betting they will say I picked a high floor. For $50 more per night? But when I checked in online, I never agreed to any higher charges. MISLEADING! Can't wait to hear what they say, but seriously, I hate that I have to go hassle with the front desk instead of enjoy my vacation! Second problem - the beds, at least in room 1210, are horrible. My arm actually fell asleep and this morning my back is killing me! There is no free breakfast, not even continental, and slow internet (unless you want to upgrade that for another $14 per day!). This is picky, but the tissues are poor quality (like in the cheapest hotels), even the shampoo bottle was only 1/2 full. It's easy to get more, but again, this is supposed to be a luxury hotel, right? It IS convenient to Penn Station, but too far south to walk to many attractions like Rockefeller Center or Central Park and too far north to walk to Battery Park or the financial district, so now you'll need to spend even more money on taxis to get anywhere.

It was our first time to stay at this Hilton location but we will definitely consider for future stays in NYC. Liked the location a lot...plenty of restaurants near by and it was always easy to get a taxi. Staff was professional and friendly. Felt more like a nice boutique hotel.

Book this hotel when I book a flight from Bermuda to New York. I had always preferred to stay in Hilton in my travels but will likely think otherwise after this.First of all, the lifts were slow/congested and I have to wait 10mins to get down from 12 floor. Secondly, when I checked out on 26 December, I was late for 2 hours and I was informed that I will be imposed a late charge ($75?) even though the check in time for others was 3pm. Anyway, I was running late for my flight and can't be bothered to argue with the service staff and just need my key to be operational again. After I bring down my luggage and returned the keys, there was no mentioned about the late charge nor was I offered a receipt which in my mind was terrible service. At the very least, I should be offered the receipt or for it to be sent electronically.This is the first time I was imposed a late charge by Hilton for running late and never had that experience when I stayed Hilton in Asia. I am a HHonours Member who should have some slight discretion on the late charge when that is one of the benefits of the membership.The only good thing about this hotel is that it is a stone throw from Madison Square Garden if you are catching an event which I did on Christmas day on the NBA match between New York Knicks and the Sixers. Room is reasonably spacious and clean.Overall this is the worse Hilton experience for me

The hotel was pleasant with a nice coffee machine in the room to use free of charge. When we checked in we were asked for $200 upfront insurance for any damage caused to the room refundable 3-5 working days after the visit. Had to exchange more money in order to pay this. It may well have been in the smallprint somewhere though so I can only blame myself on that.

Not the most spacious Hilton, but for the convenient location in midtown Manhattan it is certainly good value at the price. Room was clean; restaurant was very good for breakfast, acceptable for dinner.

I was very impressed with the hotel location and the friendly customer service. The food at Rare was outstanding. It is very convenient to the subway and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

I have stayed in this area of Manhattan multiple times and this is one of my favorite hotels. The rooms are larger than most in the area and the hotel is clean and updated. The elevators are quick (which is a big deal for hotels in this area). The rooftop bar is also nice for a quick drink at the end of the day. The staff has always been friendly and helpful.

A decent hotel, in a good location. Situated a short walk (10mins) from Macy’s, Empire State Building and Maddison Square Gardens (basketball etc). A bit longer walk to Times Square, but still walkable (20 minutes). 20 minute walk to Chelsea Market & 10 minutes Walk to the High Line. For Battery Park, Central Park, Wall Street and 9/11 Memorial, subway is recommended. Nearest one is one block away, a 5 minute walk. Within walking distance there are shops, cafes, fast food places and places for breakfast. The area is fine and well placed for walking to attractions, but very busy. Our room facing the road (16th floor) was a little noisy during the busy hours outside. Ask for inside facing room if don’t like noise. The views are poor anyway, so you won’t be missing much. I think if you are looking for an area that’s a little less busy, more classy and you don’t mind a 10 minute subway ride in to mid town, then Central Park area is where we would recommend.The hotel is about an hour’s drive from JFK airport. Use the yellow cabs at the taxi rank. Fixed fee of $52, + tolls (I think it was $6.50 for the tunnel) and then any tip you wish to give. Now the hotel is fairly business like. It’s situated very close to 7th Avenue. The lobby is small, but due to the glass front, allows lots of light in. But what more do you need in a lobby then a check in desk and lifts. There is also a restaurant (fairly large) within the hotel if you want to eat there. Rooftop bar, which we didn’t experience. Appears out of the 3 lifts in the hotel, one is dedicated to the rooftop bar when it opens. If wish to us it, have to return to lobby to get lift back up, no matter what floor your room is on. Breakfast wasn’t included in our room rate and is an extra. Free (basic) WiFi. Free maps of the city. Luggage storage after check out.The rooms were fine. Clean, comfortable and all we needed for our 5 night stay. Large bed & comfy. Safe to use for valuables. Desk with chair. TV. Mini bar (charges to your account when remove items), free bottled water on our first day, iron & ironing board, coffee making facilities (no tea), wardrobe, chest of drawers and bedside drawers / lights. Bathroom was fine too. Clean. Fresh towels daily. No bath, but walk in shower. Hairdryer provided. The rooms are quite small, but seems to be standard for NYC. Was still large enough for the two of us and large suitcases, but not spacious. We found the interior lighting very poor. Was fine during daylight hours, but during hours of darkness, the lighting in the room was rubbish. The heating unit was also quite loud when it started up. Staff were good. Mostly helpful, friendly and happy. Provided good service. One fault with the staff, is the cleaner that decided to start hovering outside our room at 6am. Not cool! Allowed us an extra hour in the room after our check out time (1pm) on request. I would recommend avoiding the hotel’s own airport transfer service. We got ripped off. Wish we took a yellow cab now. The sign on the desk states fixed rate of $73 from hotel to JFK. I was told by staff this includes tip and tolls. This is more than a yellow cab (fixed airport price of $52), but when you add toll and tip, it seemed acceptable so i didn’t have to faff about hailing a yellow cab. Staff told me a yellow cab would be between $60 and $70, depending on the taxi meter, which is a lie, as it’s a fixed price to the airports, as set by the local government. Clearly wanted me to use the hotel airport transfer service. Firstly, the driver spent the whole journey on his phone. Secondly he took a detour around the tunnel, to avoid the toll (which was paid for in our fee) increasing our journey time to around 90 minutes. Thirdly he was nipping in and out of traffic, coming on and off the main roads to kangaroo jump traffic queues, fourthly he charged me $80 when I paid, claiming ‘tax’. He was quite insistent I paid cash, but I didn’t have any so this wasn’t an option. I challenged the fare, but he was adamant $80 was the price. Not wanting to get in an argument over $7, I paid this. This complaint is currently being managed by the hotel reception manager, but not yet resolved. ***avoid the hotel airport transfer service***Overall, this hotel was great for what we needed. Clean, comfortable, safe and a good location. Very pricey (£200 a night) and definetely not value for money, but it was xmas time and all hotels were expensive.

We (family of three including a toddler) stayed four nights in December to take in Christmas sites around New York.Pros:Location - while not a whole lot in the immediate vicinity, it is easy to catch at least 3 subway lines within 2-3 blocks, and also walk 15 minutes to MSG, Penn Station, Empire State Building, Harolds Square.Rooms - Were good size by NYC standards and in great shape.Staff - We didn't have a whole lot interactions with the staff, but check in and check out were quick and efficient and room was incredibly well cleaned/maintained each day.Value - Booked about 9 months in advance with free cancellation. Price was around $215 a night (pre-tax) which I found to be a bargain as I saw prices for comparable hotels in the $350 range.Cons:Very little negative to say, just a few minor quips. This is a bit more of a business hotel than something for a family vacation, but we knew this going in and made it worked. The rooms have large showers as opposed to tubs; our 4 year old thought she was being such a grown up learning to shower instead of having a bath. Also, no breakfast at the hotel, which we were fine with; ended up going to Whole Foods (two blocks away) each morning to pick up milk, juice, fresh pastries, etc.-Wifi was pay per use. Did not end up using it, but with smart phones, it was not really needed.

I stay at this hotel 10 times a year (as long as they are not booked out). The staff always has a warm welcome and make me feel like family. The same is true for the breakfast team! The rooms are very clean and comfortable too! I highly recommend this hotel.

Found this location on the Hilton website. Did not know about this hotel as I usually stay in mid-town or above. Wonderful find. Small boutique atmosphere. Staff were friendly, efficient and so helpful. Restaurant in lower level was convenient with excellent food and service. Felt very comfortable being solo. Definitely would stay here again especially since location so close to Madison Square Garden.

This is a great, safe location. The hotel room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The front desk associates were very friendly and informative. We did not have hot water one morning and maintenance was already working to resolve the issue before we called the front desk. I will definitely recommend and stay at this site again.

Ive just returned from NYC, where we stayed at the Hilton New York Fashion District hotel. We had two rooms, one for my partner and I, the other for my parents. LocationIt is very well placed for the main attractions, walking distance from Times Square, Empire State Building, the High Line and many others. If shopping is your thing then it is great as Fifth Avenue is not far, with Macy's just 8 blocks away.(I was told there are c.25,000 cabs in Manhatten and they are pretty reasonably priced if you dont want to walk everywhere). The RoomsWe stayed in a King Room which was a decent size with a good size bathroom. A coffee machine with coffee capsules, iron with ironing board, a safe and WIFI were all included in the room price. A good size tv with plenty of free channels to choose from was also a plus. The room had a well stocked mini bar, though that was chargeable. The room did have a really good heater, that warmed things up very quickly but heat also escaped quickly once the heater was off. Fair's fair though, it is December!NegativesThe only real negative for me was that one morning there was no water. Reception did provide a couple of bottles of water and whilst it was an inconvenience, these things happen. They had resolved the issue within a few hours and things remained ok for the rest of our stay. Above and BeyondI have to say that where the hotel really excelled was the additional service they provided. I had been in touch with them prior to our arrival to let them know that we arrived on my fathers birthday and that the next day I planned to propose to my girlfriend, so could they give me a price on a bottle of champagne on each day to mark the occasion. We arrived to champagne to celebrate my fathers birthday and the next day following my proposal we came back to our room to flowers, balloons and wine to celebrate our engagement. It was an incredible gesture and one that made our stay all the more brilliant. I would not hesitate to recommend staying here to anyone, though one tiny recommendation would be to add teabags and milk to the coffee welcome plate as some people love a cup of tea, especially the Brits!

Excellent location. Good size rooms for New York. Good price. Close to everything. The subway was very convenient. Located next to several Starbucks. Walking distance from Rockefeller and time square.

Great hotel with extremely polite staff. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were a great size considering your in New York City. Great amenities in the hotel room with a well stocked mini bar. Great location as your in Manhattan but not right in the middle of the hustle and bustle plus there is a subway around the corner if you didn’t want to walk.I would highly recommend this hotel and can’t wait to return next year.

the location is great very close to everything. there is big supermarket one block from the hotel.Parking is pricey without in & out. Wifi is free for members and good,the room is good, comfortable bed, and the size is reasonable to this area.

If you need to be in the mid-town area and want to be away from the crowds...this is a good location. You can walk to many of NY City attractions easily. It has a very modern look and has an onsite bar and restaurant. The roof top bar has a great view...but is very noisy at night.

We had a nice stay. The rooms are small, but nice and we did like the stay. The rooms were nice and clean and we liked the location. The breakfast was enjoyable and we looked forward to it. This hotel is just south of Times Square and a easy walk in the summer. In the winter you will want a cab.

Slow elevators - Out of 3 elevators, 1 is reserved to access the bar. You are left out with 2 slow elevators during rush hours. Food is terrible. Rooms small and outdated. Bathrooms are Very small and do not fit more than 1 person !

Myself, Mum and sister stayed here for 4 nights the first weekend in December! The hotel is in a good location, very close to Macy’s and within walking distance to Times Square and other attractions! We didn’t eat in the hotel, but did have some drinks and the bar service was good. Room was small and with 3 girls in the room with 2 cases each there wasn’t a lot of room! But considering you don’t spend a lot of time in the room, its fine. The hotel is clean and the room was serviced everyday.

Better designed for business, perhaps. Not a romantic setting. Close to mass transit. Staff always with smile, unfortunately not enough to make up for the very small rooms, the price point and the amenities provided.

Room is not big, but well designed. Air conditioning is a bit noisy, but tolerable. Bed is very comfortable. Lacking USB recharge outlets but has plenty of regular power outlets, easy to access. Good to have coffee maker in the room. Bathroom and shower are small but usable. Not much space around the sink. Nice common areas. Very friendly and welcoming staff. OK location (can walk from Grand Central or Times Square).

I stayed in the Hilton for three nights while I attended a conference. I didn't have any extra time to spend at the hotel, so can't comment on things like food, gym/pool, and rooftop bar. However, the room was spotless and quiet, despite facing a busy street. The bathroom was large and well-stocked with towels and toiletries, there was also a hairdryer and a coffee machine.Just one small issue: the heating/air conditioning system switched on in the middle of the night and woke me up with its loud noise. I could've turned it off though, so it's not a big deal.Overall, the Hilton is absolutely recommended for any business travellers who want the perfect spot in Midtown, Manhattan.

Lovely hotel, very modern and spotlessly clean. All staff we spoke to were lovely with no exceptions, nothing was too much trouble. Daily housekeeping was great, always cleans towels and fresh bed linen. Complimentary toiletries including cotton buds and cotton wool balls! Hairdryer in bathroom so no need to take your own and the best illuminated magnifying mirror I have ever seen. Coffee maker in room (a bit like a Tassimo with pods) which was a lovely touch. Safe in wardrobe which was easy to use and proved invaluable for our stay. Directly opposite is a fantastic Subway outlet and an Irish bar. About five minute walk from Penn station so if you’re flying into JFK get the air train and LIRR which will cost you around $20 for two adults - it starts your adventure and you can use the dollars you save to spend on yourself!! We did it there and we’re going to get a car back to JFK but we had loads of time to kill between vacating the room and getting to JFK so did it back too - such an easy way to travel. Overall, hotel was brilliant and we’d definitely stay there again.

We just came back from 5 nights at the Hilton Fashion District hotel NYC.Dial 7 Car from the airport $68.00 plus tip, organised from UK before we left.Although Penn Station is 10 minutes walk away where you can get a direct train to/from the airport.The Hilton Fashion Hotel is on W26th St between 6th & & 7th avenue.Ideally placed to walk to the sights of Times Square Rockerfeller Centre Etc.Nice bright large Reception areaVery Attentive reception staff on duty, quick easy checkin.17th Floor by a choice of 3 lifts.Room 1701 exceptionally clean & a good size.Very comfy bed, lots of storage Apple charger/clock radio on bedside cabinet.Free large safe above wardrobe area.Our window view was of an office block opposite so not so good but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway.Lots of Restaurants/cafes round about within 2 minutes walk.I had ordered some parcels from within the US prior to arriving & they were in the room on our arrival.Nice big clean shower room with W/C & Basin, Very clean & bright.Free complimentary wifi that worked fine for us. Large flat screen TV that we never watched as were to busy out walking.Used The Rare Restaurant within the hotel on one occasion but wasn't to our taste, reasonably priced but the food was a bit bland & over cooked.There is a roof top bar on the top floor that over looks Manhatten, we went there a couple of evenings after coming back from our days out, nice relaxing atmosphere,Reasonably priced & well used by locals & guests by the looks of things.Over all a very good place to stay for a reasonable cost. Would certainly stay again on our return trip.

This is an excellent hotel at this particular price point in NYC. Check in went very smoothly and Mary at the front desk was very nice and helpful throughout our stay. The room was clean and seemed to be a good size, we have stayed in much smaller rooms in New York. The Rave Restaurant was perfect for breakfast each morning, a great way to start the day. We mostly walked everywhere, but it is very close to the subway. Overall this was a very pleasant stay. We typically travel to NYC 2-3 times and year and will most likely use this hotel on future visits.

Friendly and attentive staff, clean rooms check in was easy rom was comfortable and did not experience any issues during this stay. I would stay here again if I am I nyc again. Restaurant was clean and food was good as well

I was here for a business trip in November, 2017. There is a fancy restaurant on the first floor. The lobby is kind of small. My room was small, but the wifi worked well and the TV worked well. The bathroom was well lit, but the rest of the room did not have enough lamps (and with dark décor, it was on the dark side). The shower worked well, and the bed was comfortable. There was a large in-room safe on the top of the closet, but it was 6-6.5 feet off the ground, so it was hard for me to reach it (and so I could not use it).The staff was friendly, and helped me catch a cab when I needed one.The gym was small and just had one bike, one treadmill, one elliptical, and some free weights. The equipment was in good condition.Also, it was one of the more reasonably priced hotels and close to my meeting. There are many dining choices within walking distance.
user_name:
Steve R
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great place to stay! Great location! Walking distance to everything. Lots of places to eat close by. Hotel was very clean and the staff was very nice. I will make reservations at this hotels the next time I come back.

The hotel was average, the room was OK, but we had a few problems with hot water running out 2 of our 3 days stay, plus noisy guests waking us three times during Saturday night. I wouldn't stay here again.

Great hotel close to restaurants and shops. Easy access to subway. Nice and clean rooms. Very nice staff too. Enjoyed the rooftop bar inside the hotel. There is a wash and fold laundry across the street that we used. Overall a very pleasant experience.

I’m a Hilton Honors member and was a little disappointed in this property. Small, oddly configured lobby which is annoying when everyone’s checking in & out. The rooms are small as they often are in Manhattan but these rooms were very worn on top. However, the location was good. Rare, the hotel restaurant, can’t seem to be able to make a decent Moscow Mule, but the brisket quesadilla was tasty.

Stayed here last week for 4 nights - in room 1215 - a good size room, spotlessly clean. All staff encountered were pleasant and friendly and they very kindly sent a bottle of champagne to the room for our anniversary. A good choice for people used to New York and like to stay away from Times Square.

Smallest King room I have ever stayed in. The same goes for the bathroom. If you stay here, you are staying because of the location and nothing more. They do have a very nice rooftop bar with solid drinks yet mediocre food. I have stayed at Hilton properties consistently for about 3 years. From a service standpoint, this was below expectation.But, if you are in town for a weekend and you just need a place to sleep at a good price - this is a good option.
user_name:
sethslebon
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I’m a bit disappointed that I was charged half day rate which is $99.00 for being late to come back in my hotel for 1 & 1/2 hrs. I was hoping they are just more considerate and just charged me pro rated instead since I stayed 2 days and arrived late than the check in time. The hotel was expensive and breakfast is not included.
