I will never go back here and would rather stay in the 34th street area.

This is a modern, comfortable hotel with a great staff. The folks at the desk are helpful, friendly, and welcoming (look for Caroline). The hotel's location is ideal - in Chelsea, convenient to mid-town, Greenwich Village, and The High Line (all an easy walk away). Our room had a fine view of the Empire State Building. The price was right and included breakfast (that was okay, but our server, named Blessing, was terrific). The amenities were fine. I would return.

Tennessee & Maryland visitors! First time staying at hotel and won’t be the last! Well kept hotel! Staff was great especially Peter R. They have a nice roof top bar. Enjoyed breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Close to Madison Square and subways stops. Great view of Empire State Building from hotel. Nice Irish bar/restaurant across from hotel. Most important the rooms were clean and nice.

Hotel was clean, service was good. Had drinks on the rooftop bar but we closed the place. It was not close to Times Square but we didn’t want anything close to the noise. We are walkers so the distance didn’t bother us. Affordable

I stay here about 20 nights a year and never leave disappointed. The location, service, amenities, and rooftop bar are always top notch. I walk over a mile to and from work just to stay here when in town. It’s just closer to all my favorite restaurants and bars in the village and other lower Manhattan neighborhoods.

Was there for a couple of nights. Nothing great to say about rooms or facilities. Very average and mediocre. Staff was helpful. Was hard pressed to stay near the office else would ave totally skipped.

Stayed here for 4 days post NYC marathon and we were really impressed with our stay. Overall -+ Was able to check in at midday for a Level 2 room, it was a bit noisy with street noise at night but that's to be expected on Floor 2.+ Staff were excellent+ Great location, so handy to so many things, particularly 28th street and 23rd street subway stations. A good place for NYC first timers, the Flatiron / Chelsea area isn't as overwhelming as other neighborhoods!+ Room was large by NYC standards+ Bed was comfortable+ Room and common areas very clean+ Very reasonably priced for NYC- Shower leaked, not deal breaking though- A few times cleaning staff or other people tried to get into our room at weird hours?- Room was always a bit cold, even if 'heat' on in the themostat and set at 72 degrees, it was always chilly and we couldn't figure out how to fix it. Warm air just wouldn't come out of the ventilation system- Ventilation system was a bit noisy, again not a deal breaker- Room was a bit dark, could have used 1 more light!I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone coming to the city looking for a reliable, comfortable stay.

Location is good within walks to restaurants and supermarket. The room size is decent but I find the shower area a bit small. Room is rather basic, and i find it pricey for what the hotel offers. Hotel staffs are rather overwhelmed with the group at check-in and assigned our guest to an occupied room. However, make-up with the extra effort to get our breakfast pre-packed by 6am. We really appericate the extra mile service from the lady at the front desk. Thank you.I would give a average rating.

Stayed in room 1211 and enjoyed our stay. Booked a King bed room and the size of the room was adequate. Regular amenities such as an automated mini-bar, in room coffee maker, etc. This location features the new Digital Key service where you can download the Hilton App on your phone and unlock your room key from your phone. The elevators are secured so you need either your "digital key" or a regular key card to unlock the elevator to get to your floor. We appreciated the security that this gives so that strangers aren't running around on our floor in the middle of the night. Check in process was a breeze and we appreciated the two bottles of water and the complimentary hot breakfast due to me being a Hilton HHonors Gold member. When we reached our room, the room was at a comfortable temperature. We were trying to find the ice machine, we called down to the front desk and advised that they would bring us a bucket of ice. There's no ice machines on any of the floors at this hotel. I found a small 1 inch stain on the left sheen drapes of the room, and my partner mentioned that the room was a bit on the dark side as the lighting doesn't have the ability to fully light up the room. This is probably due to the style that this hotel is trying to bring to the room, but I wanted to mention this for those who don't like a darker room. I understand the area this hotel is situated and that's why it's called "fashion district", so if that's the vibe you like, this hotel would be for you.

Stayed here for four days and couldn't believe how handy it was for so many different things. Chelsea Market, the high line, 34th street, madison square gardens and Penn Station all within a 15 minute walk which made my first visit to NYC a lot easier.Staff were very helpful and he room itself with nice with a lovely shower. Would definitely stay here again.

I used to think this was a nice hotel. It's probably been about a year since I've stayed here, but wow, totally not the same. We were given a dark, dank dirty room, perhaps because we booked with points. Room faced the back side of bldg and we were on the second floor. I don't mind the low floor, but very dark and just really dim yellow bulbs in crappy old light fixtures. Room was beat up and no one bothers to vacuum close to the mopboards. Also, they are no longer dusted mopboards anyway. Icky old carpeting, nasty mattress and tired old bedding. The comforter inside the duvet cover was stained. Staff very nice. Food in restaurant (Rare) is still good, although decor looks very tired. We did not complain about room. Looking around the place, we didn't think another room would be any better. But highly unlikely we'll stay here again, either. Too many better places to stay in NY to consider this one again.

Stayed 3 nights, 10th floor, HH Diamond member. Room was good and clean, comfortable bed and pillows. Problem was that even the 10th floor was really noisy, lots of trash trucks and other vehicles. Will give it a try again. Good breakfast. I'd have given 4 stars if not for the noise

Useful location, helpful and friendly staff, rooms clean. Walking distance to all the key areas and restaurants. Good value. Honars breakfast just ok - no healthy option. Roof bar, downstairs bar can get noisy

Customer service Outstanding!! We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Hilton Honors is the way to go..they really take good care of their members. If visiting New York City you must give this hotel a try...you want be disappointed

Hotel staff was great and very helpful at all hours of the day! Rooms are small, but nicer than many in NYC. Easy access to the Subway. The bars Schafer’s and Black Door across the street were fun and there were lots of food options nearby.

Very nice facility with personable, professional staff. Great location with access to the real New York. Valet parking was great and the quick response to get the car was great. Check in and check out was quick and simple.

Stayed here for one night for the weekend of Halloween, the staff were very polite and prompt whenever we requested something. The room was very nice and clean, a little small but does the job. There is also the Rare rooftop which is open all year and very nice. Close to a supermarket, a liquor store, and Penn Station/public transit
user_name:
jennielirez
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the Hilton fashion district during October 2017, front desk staff were lovely and very helpful as well as one of the doormen. Unfortunately we had another doorman who wasn’t so friendly and an air conditioning unit that wouldn’t stop..so overall not the best stay. I would recommend the Hilton a few blocks over, rather than this one.

It never ceases to delight me when I stay at the Hilton Fashion District. First and foremost, there's Zoribel Torres. She is professional, kind, generous and just a fabulous person. It makes my day when I see her and she is always very very helpful. But the whole staff is always very professional and lovely to deal with and talk to. I am there quite often and I have never had a bad experience. It has always been a very positive experience even when things in the room don't work the way they're suppose to. All I have to do is call downstairs and someone comes up right away to fix it, whether it be more towels or the A/C isn't working right, etc. This hotel is my go-to hotel when I am in New York City. And it's because of Zoribel and Marian and John and Miley and Christine and everyone there (I'm bad with names so forgive me for forgetting to mention more of you by name). Thank you!

This hotel is squeaky clean, modern and attractive. I ordered room service from Rare, the adjacent restaurant and the Cobb salad and onion rings were both excellent.The bed and linens were comfy as expected...but the sound insulation was horrible. I could hear every word from people passing in the hallway and the door slams drove me crazy and woke me up several times during the night. Even on the 21st floor, street noise was heard loud and clear. If the sound proofing was better, my review would be at the 4-4.5 level.

This hotel isn’t cheap, but not a bad location. 10 min walk to penn station and Madison square gardens. Time square isn’t too far either. Grand central about a mile and half or 20 mins in a cab!The rooms are small but clean and comfortable, nothing fancy and besides the other rooms door opening and closing they seemed to be quite rooms. They have a great burger restaurant on site and rooftop bar, but it was closed for a private event, so didn’t go up. Overall not a bad hotel.

Great hotel for what we needed it to be - easy to get to from Penn Station and easy to get around elsewhere in the City. It's in a nice location, it was quiet at night, but there were still bars around the area to go to. Room was clean and bed was comfy. Would stay here again.

Stayed at the Hilton recently for a work trip. When a hotel is chosen for you never know what you are going to get. But the staff at the Hilton was super friendly and accommodating. The front desk was very helpful upon checking in and Nick went above and beyond when I ran into a wifi issue. Highly recommended!

This is Hilton!It used to be an example of the best customer service and quality of accommodations. Now I can't even recommend it to my friends.With one exception, all the front desk staff, was acting as if doing us a huge favor, and we had minimal requests and usually are very easy going people.Even so we are Hilton Honors members, we'll never stay in this hotel again.

This was our second time at the Hilton in the Fashion District...intimate hotel, not overly congested neighborhood. Perfect location, near the High Line, Whitney Museum, Tribeca, SoHo, Chelsea and Greenwich Village. Subway accessible. Nicely decorated rooms, small but comfortable. Excellent service, front desk, problem w flat screen that was attended to immediately. We love NYC, it's our hometown, definitely recommend the Hilton.

We had the best stay and it was largely due to the friendly and accommodating representatives including: Zoribel, Marina, Mily, Christine, Raul, Sid, Martha, Brandon, John and Jose. Every time we came to the lobby everyone at the front desk had a smile on their faces, offered us water, and went out of their way to help us with whatever we needed. It rained our last day and they even gave us umbrellas so we could walk to a dinner and have breakfast. Such a great intimate and boutique hotel feel, and situated in the heart of the fashion district. We will definitely be returning to this property the next time we come to New York!

My husband and I like Hilton Hotels when in NYC since there are many in great locations. This HIlton is a great choice if you do not want to stay in Times Square but still want to be close to great restaurants and things to do and see. We had a room around the corner from the elevator and never heard it. Yes, the rooms are small but big enough to contain everything you want. The bed was one of most comfortable we have ever experienced. Unfortunately our view consisted of fire escapes and the back side of other buildings but it didn't matter as we did not spend a lot of time sitting around. The hotel is within walking distance of Eataly, Macy's and across the street from FIT. Lobby was nice with, the adjacent restaurant RARE, but did not offer a lot of seating. In keeping with the Fashion District, the decor was very modern. Staff was attentive and we were thrilled they had a room available for us at 11AM. Once again a great Hilton!

This hotel was very convenient and close to everything I was doing in New York. Close to the attractions I wanted to see and to a book signing I was going to and working. The room was excellent and the breakfast as good Overall an excellent stay.

Please don't book for leisure trips with family. Hotel is very inflexible to real-life scenarios and shall stick to the terms and fine print. Shall throw the book at you at any instance. Great for business traveller because of the location and if the employer is willing to pay.
user_name:
abhaya515
New York City, United States

review_body: I've stayed at this hotel several times. It's usually the first place I check when making reservations in New York. It's in a great location at 26th and 7th. The rooms are always clean and are relatively spacious for New York. Everything is modern and the staff have always been friendly. The beds are comfortable and I always sleep well. The walls are a little thin so noise from other rooms can be a problem (a baby screaming for 4 hours without a break gets old fast), but that's true of many hotels in New York. Overall, this place is always a nice stay.

My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and plan to return with my parents in a month. Mily who is part of the concierge staff was fantastic!! The lighting in the room could have been better. When the shades were down, the lighting was poor.

My husband and I stayed for one night as we had an event nearby. The hotel has a small modern lobby, good restaurant and is in a very convenient location if you want to be in Chelsea or close to Midtown. The room was very basic, on the smaller side and fairly dark. Unfortunately, the building had an issue and there was no hot water all morning. For $200 per night, one would hope for a hot shower. It never got resolved before I needed to leave. Based on our overall experience and the underwhelming room for the price point, this may be our only stay at this location.
user_name:
snacstang
New York City, New York

review_body: Rooms are nice; what you expect from Hilton. Nice little bar on the ground floor. Good location -- a couple blocks from the subway station to access the 1 (red) on 7th and then a couple blocks away other stations with access to the FM (orange) and then the RW (yellow)

Visited FIT for the weekend! Great location! Right across the street. Hotel is a little ways from 5th and time square but the perfect for the purpose of our trip!! Hilton always impresses and the staff was wonderful! No complaints!

Stayed here for one night with my daughter to attend comiccon. We were happy overall with everything. Room was slightly small, but understandable for NYC. Most all staff was friendly but some were to the point. Had breakfast in am and it was pretty good. Loved that we were able to leave car in valet and luggage at hotel while we attended the show.

My stay at this hotel was wonderful; the staff was very friendly and professional, they will answer my questions at all times no matter if it was the morning crew or afternoon crew they always greeted me with a smile. The rooms are clean.
user_name:
Ana Zarina B
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed one night recently and found the front desk team very helpful and friendly. I asked for a quiet room and was given one on the ninth floor. I heard no noise from the other rooms or hallway; only the usual outside NYC sounds. The room was clean and well equipped; a smaller size but adequate. The shower was kind of tiny and it was one of those that you have to walk into to turn on the water; don't know why they plan them like that. Not a big deal though. Breakfast eggs were not real eggs as far as I know; at least not freshly prepared eggs. I'm a stickler - maybe others would like them. Potatoes and bacon were good. Would stay again.

I stayed here on September 9th 2017 for one night. Location was good handy for subway and a pleasant walk to Times Square. The room was very comfortable. The only issue was that there was no hot water for showers. The hotel didn't inform us and I only had it confirmed at Breakfast the next day when a waitress told me. The front desk could have been more helpful. The breakfast was wonderful.

Rooms are very outdated. Not up to Hilton Standards at all. I had an emergency and needed to check out early, the staff charged me for an additional night. I usually like staying at the Hilton Brand. This was the worst I've ever been to

I stayed here for two night on business in NY. This is a great hotel from top to bottom. Service in all areas was above average and the room I got was very comfortable. I'd stay here whenever I need to be in this area of NY.

Staff was very welcoming and pleasant and always ready to help. Hotel was clean and well kept and certainly felt safe. The room was a little small - but we were not in there often (other than to sleep) so it was perfect.

Rooms are bad, so small and you can hear everything. We were on 2nd floor and had a very bad view, basically looking at another building wall. Walking distance to everything bars, clubs, restaurants u name it. Roof bar was ok, very limited space. Came here to for a relaxing weekend, but didnt happen coz we werent able to sleep with everything we hear in the other rooms and hallway.

We visited over new year.i liked the view from our room and it was more spacious than other hotels we have been to in NYC. The rooms felt a bit dated and I think my credit card details were compromised at this property-I had a card that has only ever been swiped at this property (as they do upon check in) and the card was used some months later in a New Jersey Walmart! (this was reported and customer service were helpful).i liked location of hotel too but for next trip I think I would pay a bit more and stay somewhere more stylish

No exec lounge for diamond members. Restaurant not part of hotel. Room service sometimes ok, sometimes terrible. All-day menu consisted entirely of some sort of beef product (hamburger, steaks). A chicken item was on the menu but not available any longer. Desk chair very uncomfortable (literally painful to sit in, not adjustable). AC very hard to control. OTOH Housekeeping and engineering were very accommodating, even beyond what was requested. One bed was comfortable, the other too hard (plywood board under mattress).

During my stay I ordered breakfast from room service - it was $48 - it was terrible, but this was not the problem. When in-room dining decided to call to ask how my breakfast was, I let them know that it was terrible, but no need for a refund. My purpose in telling them was 'well, since you called, I'll tell you the truth'. We hung up and I went on about my day. A few hours later, after returning to my room I receive another call. The person on the other line is addressing me by my full name and is calling to apologize for my breakfast having been bad and that they are going to refund me (note: this means that they were advised as to my experience on breakfast)- I said 'Great but really no need, it's OK'. Then they proceeded to informed me, 'We accidentally charged your card $480 instead of the $48 so we will just refund it all’ I of course said OK got it. They asked me for my card number to process the refund. I asked why they couldn't just void the transaction and for an unknown reason they weren't able to, so they requested I either provide my card number or to go to the lobby and give them my card there. I went downstairs and no one had any idea what I was talking about. This is when I realized someone was trying to steal my identity. After speaking to the front desk and asking multiple times to speak to the manager, which he didn't come out until about an hour later, and speaking to the restaurant manager, I realized that I was dealing with a bunch of incompetent buffoons. I went upstairs to let my coworker know what happened, when her phone rings and the exact same scenario is happening to her.We both walk downstairs to what are still a bunch of incompetent buffoons. Finally the manager comes out - head master of buffoons. After HOURS of his inspector gadget skills - it's been discovered that someone in the kitchen did 'accidentally' provide both me and my coworkers full name, room number and receipts of orders to someone outside of the hotel....Said head master of buffoons - I assume is attempting to protect the magnitude of this ordeal - A.) It’s illegal to provide an 'outside' entity a paying customers full name and room number without their consent as this is a very direct and clear safety issue. B.) it was NOT done by accident as the person on the 'outside' knew that I has unhappy with my breakfast and had been advised that I had previously indicated the food was terrible. C.) with the amount of information said theft has (full name, last four digits of CC, Room number and duration of stay, they are now able to access each of our rooms via downloading of the Hilton Digital Key App. Does your hotel and brand understand the magnitude of personal security that has been compromised?

This is hands down the WORST Experience I have ever had at a hotel. One of the employees at this hotel is attempting to steal identities. Someone from the kitchen staff provide me and my coworkers full name, hotel room number, and receipts of purchases at hotel to someone on the outside. This is an attempt at stealing identities and having their ID Stolen. Please also be advised that with just this information someone may then access your hotel room via the digital key. This puts each customers security at risk while staying at the hotel. It's terrible that the hotel is now aware that this is 'stemming from the inside' however they brushed this instance off as if it was done by mistake.

Everything was great from checking in to checking out. All the staff was very nice and helpful. The location was within walking distance to the hotel. I would stay at this Hilton again if and when I return to New York.

I travel a good bit for work, and I think I've finally found my "work home" in New York thanks to the wonderful staff at the Hilton Fashion District.When I check in, I'm greeted with smiles (even if it's 11pm). Jose, Moises, Marian and Zoribel (I asked for their names!) have become friends to me, warmly welcoming me and making sure my stay gets off to a great start. You couldn't make a better impression when you check in than with this dream team. Every morning I get a chance to talk to the housekeeping staff either on the elevator or on my floor, and every night, I return to a perfectly cleaned room. I love catching up daily with my new friends whose warm wishes lead to a great day. The hotel staff that does the breakfast service in Rare is also wonderful. They never make you feel rushed and are very friendly. All in all, please keep up the great work! I could go on and on about how wonderful your staff is, but if you keep hiring people like them, I'll be coming back every time I'm in the city.

I've stayed in this hotel two times and have enjoyed the service I've received. The location is convenient, the room is clean, staff are courteous. The digital check-in and digital key on your smart phone is very convenient. Will definitely stay again.

Wonderful hotel with a wonderful view. Had the pleasure of staying here this past weekend and enjoyed myself. Soft pillow, comforters and a BOMB shower. I would definitely plan on staying here again. There is a restaurant inside the hotel called RARE and the hotel also has a rooftop bar.

This place was great! It was very centrally located, clean, and the staff were gems. My internet went out twenty minutes before I had to be online for a meeting and Nik from the Hilton Engineering team had it fixed in under five minutes! Really top notch staff.Would gladly stay here again thanks to Nik - thanks again!! :)

We arived at hotel, very disorganise. Gave reception my HH number as did not have and agreed to put points on reservation, still not done. In the morning was going for a meeting, no hot water. Agreed to refund room rate on my card, as already pre-paid, still not received. Found a sock under bed.Room not cleaned properly.

This Hotel was a great place to stay, very central, only a few minutes walk from underground railway, supermarket, bars & restaurants. It has a great rooftop bar, very friendly/helpful staff, rooms very pleasant and for New York reasonably priced. Would highly reccomend.

I love the Chelsea neighborhood, so this hotel is perfectly located. The rooms are great (not too small), the staff is friendly, the email I received before check-in made me feel welcome, I could check-in early, Wifi is very good and we could connect our 4 devices for free. And one more thing : it is 2 blocks from Brooklin Bagel & coffee :)

I don't have any real complaints about this hotel. The staff was friendly and the lobby was nice. The room seemed clean. I had no issues. That said, for the price, you can find a nicer hotel. The walls and windows are VERY thin. I could hear my neighbor's tv as if I was in their room. And I could hear every sound on the street (and it's a side street). Sound doesn't bother me at all - I even sleep with the tv on. But it would definitely bother someone more sensitive than me. I'm not a large person, and the shower was very narrow. Just washing my hair, my arms banged the sides of the shower. Again, this is nothing to complain about. But there are other options with larger bathrooms.Overall, it was a good location when doing business in the garment district. It's certainly not cheap, though, and for the money, you can stay at a newer/larger hotel. I'd stay here again if I needed to.

We love, love, love the staff here!!! The young ladies at the front desk were very polite and accommodating. We enjoyed eating at the restaurant Rare and the bartender Tiffany is the best!!! She made us feel so welcomed and relaxed after a LONG day of delayed flights and rerouted planes. Shevonne the hostess was also wonderful and went out of her way to be accommodating to us. The hotel staff member Krishnek was also extremely helpful and we really appreciated his assistance and how polite and respectful he was. We had one issue with hot water going out and left before we could find out if it was resolved, but other that a perfect stay! We will definitely stay here again and the location was also awesome! Loved the bar across the street and the rooftop bar at the hotel was super fun and had a DJ and everything! All the ladies we were traveling with enjoyed their experience.

Great location. Very residential and much quieter than Times Square. Staff was very personable and welcoming. Best customer service we have experienced in a long time. Staff extremely helpful in getting transportation to airport.

The hotel is in a great location, it's really easy to get from it to the main sites and there are some great restaurants near by. The staff are all extremely helpful. The rooftop bar is great if the weather is nice.

Stayed here a full week and loved every minute of it. The location is excellent allowing for easy access to the subway for travels to the museums and other tourist spots. The staff and concierge were always friendly, helpful and eager to assist me with my daily travel plans. The hotel is also within convenient walking distance to many interesting sights like the Flatiron building and Eataly.

I stayed at the hotel the weekend of August 4 - 7th. After returning to the room on Saturday the 5th I realized that money I had hidden in a Calendar book which was hidden under clothing in a drawer was missing. Roughly $280.00. I know exactly the denominations of the bills. When I reported this to the front desk they did not fill out an official complaint. They said I had to wait until they viewed the security for the room access. Finally Monday upon check out they said the security only show the maid entering the room. And all of their employees were long term. They said they would submit a claim to their insurance company. Three weeks later and I still haven't heard anything. I travel 26 weeks a year for Business and I doubt I will ever choose Hilton again.

This hotel is an average business hotel in NYC. Rooms are not too small for one person. The windows are not noise canceling so you might experience some noise from the street at night, specially garbage trucks. Staff is friendly and the check out was quick.

My husband and I were in Manhattan for my birthday weekend, and selected the Hilton Fashion District, given its location and it was a named Hilton. I have Gold Status with Hilton and given that the hotel was not fully occupied expected an upgrade. Checking in, I was not recognized for my status and was specifically told I would not get an upgrade. Additionally, my profile has requests for a higher floor and away from an elevator, but we were put on the 3rd floor right across from the elevator, which kept us awake with noises from the bar across the street. While I could understand if the hotel was booked up and our reservation was made right before our stay, but I booked it nearly 3 months in advance. I would not recommend this hotel.
user_name:
christianbY7573UH
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: From the very first day we reserved, we received exceptional service. Hotel front desk answered every question and request we had. Check-in was a breeze, thanks to the Hilton Honours app. We were lucky enough to get the room we wanted (2202 - Beautiful view of the downtown skyline) and we also checked in early at 9am. Checkout took no longer than 10 seconds. (Literally)The room itself was great. Bed was very comfortable and room was very clean upon arrive and every day after housekeeping. Only downside would be the expensive room service. 22% service charge and 5$ (if I recall) in-room service. But it is room service and it NYC. The food it self (Rare resto) was okay. Defintely better choices elsewhere. The Rare Rooftop gives you a great view of the skyline. Pricey drinks but they taste great. The hotel is in an amazing location. Not in a loud area. Subway is just around the corner. Penn Station, Highline, Chelsea Market and Times Square are a few minutes away by walk and you're in between 6 & 7 Avenue which is terrific for walking. All in all. We were very happy with everything. Would definitely recommend to anyone!P.S: Book with Hilton.com and the Honours card! Well worth it. Free wifi, digital key, online check in and more... and it's free!

Good location, in a good area of NYC. Rooms are nice and are a decent size for NYC, not large but comfy for 1 not roomy for two or a family. For business purposes the rooms are very dimly lit and make it difficult to work but large desk. For leisure the lighting works fine as you can certainly sleep in after a night on the town and there is a coffee maker in room,

The hotel is perfectly situated far enough from the tourist hot-spots, that if you feel like venturing over to them it is a quick walk. It is far enough that you don't have all of the noise and pedestrian congestion so that you can wander around the area with restaurants and plenty of other places of interest. The staff is always wonderful at this hotel. Even just general greetings as you are coming back to the hotel after a long day, are genuine, sincere, and make the experience at this hotel stand out from others. I was in New York for business, and the bar area was the perfect place to setup, enjoy a decent menu, have some drinks, and get some work done. I will have to say that a lot of times, many hotels have not figured out the necessity of high speed wireless internet, and here, I never have an issue with speeds whether I am just doing general web based research, or uploading or downloading files from Dropbox and other storage clouds. Each morning and each evening there is always someone in the lobby either wishing you a good day, or asking how your day was when returning. Those little things do set this wonderful hotel apart from other hotels that I have stayed at in New York, and this is why I will continually stay at this property and help move more of my companies travel to New York to this hotel. Keep up the great work!

Great neighborhood a lot of stores, food options within walking distance. The staff is very accomodating. The roof top bar is exceptional and affords great views day and night. A 10 dollar cab ride to Chelsea Piers or Chinatown.

I stayed here on my wedding night and was completely satisfied. I found this hotel on a list of the top 10 hotels with the best rooftop bars. The room, while smallish, was completely modern and simply gorgeous. The views from the room were stunning especially at night. Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to visit the bar. The one thing that stood out the most was the service. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us. The hotel is right in the heart of everything. The only caution I would mention is be prepared to pay a pretty penny ($45-60) for a valet or to park in the garages. You can always take your chances self parking on the street but......yikes! The bathroom was very nice. The bed was uber comfortable. The TV was humongous. We will def be back for day trips and date nights. Cannot wait to go back.

Having just returned from a stay in NYC we were very impressed with this hotel. Firstly the location is super! A short walk from Penn Station and as it's mid town we were able to walk all over Manhattan to explore! Check in and out were both effortless with friendly staff who gave us help with our train journey back to Newark airport. The room was extremely clean and compact with everything you need available. The shower was probably the best I've had in a hotel for a long time! The bed was huge and so comfortable! My partner enjoyed a cup of tea from the tea/ coffee maker in our room and a minibar was also available but like all hotels pricey! We stayed on the 11th floor but had no issues accessing elevators during our trip. Our rooms were serviced daily with fresh linen and we couldn't fault the service we received. We did visit the rooftop bar which has an amazing view of the Empire State Building so would recommend that to anyone staying.....plus the cocktails were delicious!A funky, stylish and quirky hotel with is great for explorers like us....you won't be disappointed!

We come here on holiday and what an Excellent hotel, in a fab location too. We booked bed and breakfast and to be honest we were disappointed in this and wouldn't recommend it therefore won't do it again but I would definitely stay here again. The staff were friendly enoughThe roof bar is lovely with great views of the empire but as a family of 3 with a minor (16 year old) we couldn't all go in it together which was disappointing but this may be down to the laws instead of the hotel itself

One of the less expensive hotels in MAnhattan. But it represents good value.The rooms are not massive, but if you are visiting NYC then you shouldnt have much time in your room.Beds are okay. Bathroom is just a shower, no bath. Again its sufficient.Very dark rooms. Dont want to really open blinds too much as the outlook is likely another building.Staff are very friendly and helpful. Use the limo service to the airport it is good value.Best part is the location. Midtown, walk to chelsea and the village. Close to lots of subway lines including penn station. Lots of stores and cafes near by. A dry cleaner across the road.Would recommend

NYC has extraordinary art museums. I was able to visit the Museum at FIT, the MOMA, and the Whitney all in one day. The location is fantastic to walk to FIT. I was also able to walk to the Rubin. I will stay here again.

Loved this property in every way. Loved getting out of cab, straight to front desk,off to elevator with my rolling bag, all in a matter of minutes. Staff was friendly and helpful in every way.service with great smiles. Clean, efficient room and bathroom. Loved e bed and linens. Lighting could have been just a tad better but that's it. Great experience!

Located in the Fashion District. Easy access to restaurants, subways. The restaurant on site RARE is very good. Good food and good drinks and good service. Our room was on the 18th floor, highest floor in hotel. Close to elevator but couldn't hear much elevator traffic. Three elevators are available so not much wait to go up or down but one elevator becomes reserved in the evenings for their Rooftop Bar which means a longer wait for elevator after 5pm. Clean room but housekeeping never replaced our dirty drinking cup. But this is not a major issue we just dealt with it. Love the coffee machine and I appreciated the hot tea K-cup since that is what I prefer in the mornings. Front lobby staff is helpful. Best feature is they kept our luggage after we checked out in the morning till we left for airport late in the day at no extra charge. Only downside--room felt a bit dated, peeling wallpaper but generally clean. It was ok for a quick weekend visit to NYC

Stayed at the Hilton Fashion District hotel on Sunday, August 20, 2017 for one night.Let me tell you, not impressed. I have stayed at this hotel in the past. I think the toilet was haunted, it kept flushing all night, at least it didn't give up its dead. When we walked into the room on arrival, it smelled like an arm pit that had not been washed in weeks, i'm not kidding. In addition, the light over top of the sink in the bathroom was burned out. At least hey fixed it after we called down to the front desk.The air conditioning was more like a fan, not that cool, we were kind of hot the entire night. In summary, we were highly disappointed and the arm pit smell, that was 4 of the pillows that were in the room.

Went to visit NYC to celebrate my daughters 20th birthday. Great location away from the noise of time square. Room was clean, updated, modern .Was on the third floor and had no issues with street noise. Would stay there again.

I usually hate staying in NYC. You know your room is going to be small and loud and your probably not gonna get a good night sleep.This hotel was great. On the Hilton APP I picked a room away from the elevator facing 26th street.. and yes the room is still a small NYC Hotel but I was completely comfortable. It was quiet and clean.Great place!

Visiting New York City for the weekend. The Hilton is a nice and clean hotel with good customer service. We were able to check into our room a few hours early. Mily and Martha at the front desk were great!

Our stay on the 11th floor was amazing! The front desk associates Mily and Martha were so nice and helpful they even let us check in early! The rooms were clean and tidy and I would absolutely recommend to anyone looking to stay in the city for a good price to check this place out.

A great hotel in a great location if you want to explore NY. Rooms are small however clean with good beds. Great rooftop bars with stunning views of the Statue of Liberty lite up in the evening. Good value for money.

Stayed here on our last 3 visits to NYC - located for exploring all areas of NYC with great shopping, landmarks and quirky independents of Soho and Chelsea within a good walking distance- tidy, clean and great value stay with friendly staff and great concierge for assistance with luggage storage, travel arranging etc - recommended

Clean hotel, helpful staff and excellent location close to several subway stops and Penn Station. Good restaurant if you cannot venture out and roof top lounge with good views of city skyline. Two great coffee shops just around the corner (Variety and 7 Grams).

This stay was the final leg on a two week journey up the east coast, the hotel is well located and alot of sites are easily within walking distance. The bar and restraunt in the hotel are great and the best part is the rooftop bar! Fantastic views of the city! a great way to start a night out. The concierge was very helpful arrangin our taxi to the airport.

Had a great overnight visit here with my niece. Our double-bedded room was scrupulously clean and very comfortable. The staff was very welcoming on arrival, throughout the stay and on departure as well. The only slight complaint I have is that we had a long wait for an elevator to go back up to our room one afternoon. The location was great - within blocks of many subway lines. I would definitely stay here again.

Was a fantastic day, the hotel was in a great location only 10 mins away from time square. The hotel staff were very helpful and made us feel very welcomed. Great eateries near by too which was nice due to then time we had arrived in the evening.

We stayed last weekend (two adults, one child) in a room with two double beds; it wasn't huge but by NYC standards it was more than adequate space-wise, and the bathroom was quite big. Check in and check out we're painless and quick, and the luggage storage was welcome. All of the front desk and concierge staff were friendly and informative, and special mention to Charles at the front desk who went above and beyond to make our stay great. It was most appreciated! The hotel was in a great location, very close to convenient subway lines and about 8 minutes tops from Penn Station. We easily walked all over Manhattan with the hotel as our home base. The breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant was adequate and tasty and had enough choices for everyone, and the relatively long hours for the buffet were great. Beds were comfy, water pressure was good, zero complaints -- and we're picky! Very happy with this hotel.

The room was quite small...as expected but the bed as very comfortable and the room was clean. There is a rooftop bar with an AMAZING NYC view...one of the best I've seen. The hotel is located close to a subway stop and there is tons of tourist-y things to do around this area.

We had a wonderful time celebrating a birthday on the Rooftop! With a sliding glass roof, you needn't worry about the weather. Great drinks, awesome music, with a fun vibe! Put it on your list, if you are in the area!

I book this hotel because 4 star hotel, but it is not 4 star like others.I book two double bed(they don't have queen double) one blanket has horrible sweet smell, room is small and staff was not kind enough like other 4 star hotel.My wife and daughter sleep without blanket .The thermal state cannot control. So, we sleep with cold temperature.I don.t understand how this hotel get 4 star and Hilton family.

Stayed yesterday on the 11th floor of the Hilton. Front desk was awesome - was able to check in early which is always nice when you are traveling. We got to the RARE rooftop bar early -right at opening and was able to sit- soon after it got crowded but drinks and food were good. Room was clean. Overall great stay!

The worst Hilton I've ever stayed in. Bed was horrible, room was never vacuumed, internet was slow or didn't work at all, maid service was substandard. Only benefit was the location. Do not select this property, even for the price.

Convenience to shops, restaurants, FedEx Kinko's (color or b/w printing using your DropBox account available + great & helpful staff), Whole Foods, Pret a Manger (1 within a block and another one on the second block), Starbucks (plenty on 6th and 7th Avenue). Easy to catch UberPool going Uptown or Downtown by walking a few steps to 6th or 7th Avenue. Only guests can access elevators to the rooms. Hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner and soaps are all top! WSJ & USA Today newspapers available for guest plus daily water bottle per guest. Smiling and efficient staff awaits you! Great & relaxed stay! Thank you!

Wanted to stay away from Times Square and stay somewhere a little less her, but central and with lots of good stuff locally. When looking, the roof bar seemed a really good idea as there was a group of us going, and be nice to have somewhere local to chill out before heading out for an evening.The bedrooms are a good size, especially by NYC standards, close to subway stations, hotel clean, plenty of amenities and friendly staff.Next time i go to NYC, i'll be staying here again, great location, lots of local bars and eateries.

We spent the weekend of June 30th to July 2nd at the Hilton Fashion District. Location of this hotel is excellent – easy access to the Subway, walking distance to many attractions and restaurants in the Chelsea district.Check-in was quick, got the higher floor king-bed room I had requested and as a bonus we were able to do an early check-in (around noon). Room as quite large by NYC standards. Relatively modern look but the furniture was starting to show some age. For the price I paid, I could not ask for better.Room was cleaned early during our stay, concierge and front-desk were very helpful. We really enjoyed our stay and this property will definitely be on our list if it is in our price range for future visits to NYC.

The hotel had nice rooms with comfortable bed and enough space in the room for a short visit. The roof top bar is a nice place for a night cap with some good views. If my travels take me to this part of town again, I would certainly stay here.

This is my second time there and the hotel is great, the rooms are not that small, and it is very well located, a walking distance to the Chelsea market and Meatpacking. The metro station is also a two blocks away.

I had not been to NYC in many years, I mainly was looking for a Hilton property where I could use my points and a hotel that had a rooftop bar. So lucky I found the Hilton NY Fashion District. My husband and I loved the location, convenient to tourist attractions without being in the middle of them, easy access to the subway. The rooms were nicely appointed. The rooftop bar was wonderful the views were amazing (I would have liked to had some regular domestic beer options). Our room faced 26th St. and had a nice view of the Empire State Building but there is a lot of activity and you can hear the street noise. Our flight got cancelled and we had to come back to the hotel for another night, this room was on the back of the building it was very quiet, but the view was of another building. If you are not wanting to be in the middle of everything this is a great place

Spent 3 nights at the Hilton. Check-in was very easy, room 1104. First mistake after entering room, should have changed room! The room had an odor which I noticed immediately, but I assumed that it would dissipate once the AC was running. I really only spent the evenings there, but should have requested a change. Bed was not very comfortable. On the plus side, bathroom was roomy with a nice stall shower.Probably would not stay here again!

I enjoyed my one night stay at this hotel. The hotel is fairly new, location was perfect for our visit to the flatiron district and herald square without the hustle and bustle. The room was a bit small but probably standard size for nyc. I key word searched "breakfast" here on tripadvisor and read that the breakfast for hilton gold/platinum guests were below standards. Having experienced the unsatisfying breakfast myself as a hilton honor gold member, I can understand the poor ratings. Hotel Management should read and find ways to improve. My only other complaint is the bed is very close by the air conditioning unit, which was very noisy. I had a hard time sleeping because if the noise.The rooftop bar is great. If given the opportunity, I would stay again.

This hotel offers an incredible convenient location in the heart on Manhattan where Times Square,Broadway,Herald Square and the Flatiron building are nearby.The hotel has a modern and trendy look,well appointed rooms, extremely comfortable beds and the shower has an excellent water pressure (always an important point in Manhattan!)The bistro restaurant offers quality cuisine, I particularly enjoyed the spicy calamari.Overall it was a very pleasant stay and the price range offers value for your money.
user_name:
Heresi
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice place to stay Staff is good, clean rooms, elevators are activated by room keyRoof top bar and one in lobby Front desk staff is helpfulSmall business centre is also located in lobby, you can get ur printouts and all from thereI enjoyed the stay* try to get room at higher floor and ull get view of empire estate- good but not amazing view

Great stay. This hotel far exceeds NYC expectations in every sense, comfort, room, quality, service, etc. The location is super convenient to NYC attractions, like Penn Station, Time Square, shopping, dining, and much more.

The Hilton Garden Inn fashion district is a little more hip than your standard HGI property, but it still provides a reliable and enjoyable experience. I found the front desk staff to be very friendly, the elevators were quick, and my room was comfortable will all of the expected amenities -- desk and good chair for working, lots of power outlets, pretty decent sized bathroom, climate control that I could set, and a very comfortable bed. The location (near Madison Square Garden) is ideal for going up to Times Square or down toward the village. The only downside I encountered was the incredibly expensive breakfast. I paid $35 for Eggs Benedict with fruit, and when I asked if I could sub the fruit for the home-fried potatoes that came with it, I was told "No". HHonors gold status members don't get many options either, and unfortunately there aren't many other breakfast options nearby.

Second stay at this hotel-- I requested it from our business travel dept. Not extraordinary, but very, very serviceable. Clean room, nicely decorated, small (though reasonable by NY standards). Arrived on a late (2 a.m.) train into NYPenn station, and was very comfortable walking down 7th to get to the hotel by myself. Front desk graciously found me a room on a high floor on the back of the building-- one of the rare times I heard nothing from the street in NY.

Our stay was short but we were quite pleased with the service and the efficiency, cleanliness of the room, as well as the ability to check-in early. Staff were pleasant and friendly. Just overall a great experience. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Great example of a well run Hilton property from the staff, the rooms, the cleanliness and the overall experience. The only negatives were the water pressure in the shower was more like a power washer. May want to adjust that. Also, the room is pretty dark, so a brighter hall light would be nice by the coffee maker and the closet. Other than that, it's convenient, clean, comfortable and the bed was a dream!

I choose this property due to its price. For my purposes, the hotel was good, but except for the comfort of the bed, nothing stood out. If you are looking for a place to rest your head while exploring NYC,
user_name:
douglasbH1964QB
New York City, United States

review_body: Fantastic hotel - clean, spacious and very well located. The staff are very helpful and the restaurant serves the most delicious steak!! Can highly recommend this hotel and will be back to stay next time I am in NYC!

We have stayed here several times and never had a bad stay. The hotel is excellent and in a really good location . The staff are really nice and helpful and the hotel is really clean with really good rooms . I strongly recommend this hotel.

When we checked into the hotel the front desk was so nice and accommodating.We were so surprised. Then again when we checked out they were very nice again. We were not expecting this in New York. It was so nice. I would definitely stay there again.

Walking Distance from the Penn Station. Very clean Hotel, Great Roof Top Bar, Great Restaurant. Great Service. We ask to get the room early as possible and indeed we've got it at ~10:00am. We visit every night the roof top bar and it's really great (amazing view of the empire state building and great experience)

This hotel is located in the Fashion District. It is close to a number of subway lines and far enough away from Times Square so you don't have the crazy crowds. Rooms are on the smaller side. There is a very popular rooftop bar, the food in the restaurant is better than expected. You can easily walk to this hotel from Penn Station.

Good hotel for short stay. We were in town for a function at St Francis Cathedral & the location was great. It was just a few blocks to walk. The room was clean, bed was comfortable. No issues from our end. I would stay there again. Only complaint would be that it was on the pricey side.

The Hilton Fashion district is a really good location on 18th just off 7th ave. Very nice clean modern rooms some with viewa other no. Decent little gum in basement. Good breakfast. Has a very cool roof top bar with great views. But call to check if open. Shuts down many times for private events. The hotel has restaurant called Rare with excellent food. Especially burgers and steaks! Really priced well under $30 steak dinners in NYC

Spent a comfortable few days at the Hilton Fashion District. We had a room at the back of the Hotel [not facing 26th Street] and it was amazingly quiet. The room is a fair size by New York standards and the bathrooms are functional but small. Lots of restaurants around the Hotel and walking distance to Time square and Union Square. The hotel staff were super friendly and the housekeeping service was particularly efficient and good. My only gripe was that it was half the price on a travel site so missed booking it on my honors program.

The service at the Hilton Fashion District is superb!! It's nice that the front desk staff know me and make me feel so welcome! You can't go wrong with the location and friendly staff who want to make sure you have a great stay! there is also a rooftop bar that has fantastic views of the city!

Stayed over the Hilton Fashion district this past weekend and just loved it! It was centrally located and our room was much bigger than most NYC hotel accommodations. The gym had even better grade equipment than the one back at home and the rooftop bar was a great bonus! As a Hilton Gold member, we also got the choice of free breakfast or an extra 1000 points. Awesome, awesome awesome!Prices are totally reasonable for what you get. Would totally recommend!

I went to NYC for my birthday with family. All of the staff were so friendly and wonderful. Special shout outs to Milly at front desk, who checked us in, and Sid who helped when i realized I forgot my toothbrush. The staff at the rooftop bar and the bar on the first floor were also great as was the waiter at breakfast and the nice staff person who held our bags. I cannot say enough about the staff. The room was a great use of space. I would definitely return.

My husband and I spent our honeymoon here at Hilton Fashion District. Check in was breezy! When we arrived in our room, we smelled something really weird and called the Front Desk right away. They apologized and immediately the cleaning lady arrived to find where the smell was coming from. A few minutes later, the manager came up with Nick, the engineer/technician to help out find the weird smell. Nick graciously offered us free drinks at Rare Bar after finding out that were on a honeymoon. He also hooked us up for free buffet breakfast. He offered that we can ask for a change of room if the smell persists, but my husband and I decided we'd just stay since we didnt want to pack our stuff again.We felt like we were staying at a friend's house. They were warm and helpful.

We are currently staying at the Hilton Fashion District, checked in yesterday. Some of the negative reviews had me skeptical, but let me say the rooms are nice. Check-in was great. Mariena (I think that's her name, I'm not good with names. She was excellent and friendly . They were a bit busy and yes they are having elevator issues, but they are handling it well, getting guest to their rooms quickly as possible. The bathroom and rooms are clean complementary waters. This is a gift for my husband's birthday, and he loves the hotel and location. This is our first time trying Hilton so this may become a favorite.

My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a week for my niece's college graduation. I had never stayed in this neighborhood before. I chose the hotel because they seemed to be the only of the big chains that didn't jack the room rates to the sky during the week.  It was about 1/3 the cost to stay at this hotel compared to Times Square or the Financial District. The rooms are small, but no smaller than any other Manhattan hotel. It's in a great location, a short walk to 2 subway stations and Penn Station. It's also a short walk to the High Line. The hotel is on a lightly traveled side street so getting a taxi can be a chore, you're better off walking out to 6th or 7th avenues. The bellman has access to a car service so getting to the airport is easy and the rates are competitive with cab fare to LaGuardia. Dining options in the immediate neighborhood are little limited. The front desk staff was very friendly and always helpful. We had a problem with the water pressure in our sink and they sent an engineer up right away.A couple of things that need improvement. Hilton has a Digital Key system where you can check in before you get to the hotel and use the Hilton Honors smartphone application as a room key. But if you don't select that option before checking in at the desk, it can't be added. Additionally, the hotel charged my credit card for an extra $50 per day for incidentals. That wasn't disclosed in any of the reservation information. I expected a hold when I checked in but the charge was put through the night before I arrived. Despite the hold, charges from the restaurant and bar were also put through on my card over the course of the week. It all settled correctly at the end, but if you're close to your limit, you might have a problem.Much is made about their rooftop bar. Despite staying on the 22nd floor, right below the bar, we had to go all the way down to the lobby to get on the dedicated elevator to the bar. When we got to the bar, the open areas on both ends were reserved for private parties, the only area available to hotel guests was in the middle of the bar, which is under a roof and not open like the ends are. If the hotel is going to advertise the bar as a hotel amenity, it should be more accessible to guests than it is.

From the moment I arrived early (11 AM), this staff was accommodating. I overplanned the day by scheduling a 2 PM Broadway show, and I was concerned I wouldn't get to drop my stuff and refresh before the show, but they put me right into a room.When I was in the elevator, a staff member asked me how my stay was, and he sincerely wanted to know. The housekeeping staff was also warm and friendly. I worked out in the gym, and I heard them in the next room. It sounded like they were having a morning staff meeting or something. Whatever it was, they were clearly a happy team. Then, I saw them in the hall. There was lots of laughter, but they took the time to include me by offering me water.The rooftop bar is not to be missed. GREAT views and again...warm, friendly, efficient staff.It's not the most convenient for walking to Broadway shows, but I purposefully chose it to stay away from the craziness of the theater district but still have easy access.The gym is very small, but you can get a workout done if you know what you are doing. Lots of smart choices were made by the designers in terms of space usage.The rooms are NYC size (small), but it's well-decorated and in good shape and are clean.

Hotel was in a great location, it was very clean. The room was small but comfortable. The staff was very nice. Parking a little bit expensive, but it was located close to the hotel. My only issue was I was charged twice for my deposit and they couldn't figure out why and I had to wait a couple of days before it was returned. All in all a nice stay!!

Elevators only worked some of the time. Of 3 elevators 1 was out , 1 was restricted to only the rooftop restaurant leaving one for everyone else. Also, ice had to come via room service. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Amazing location! Second time staying at this hotel and it doesn't disappoint. At check in, I was offered two room choices: upfront near the elevators or perhaps a quieter room in the back. I picked the first option and would encourage people not to shy away from that option! The only noise was from people getting off the elevator late at night and my recommendation there is that if you're going out drinking at night, please be considerate of your neighbors when you get off the elevator. Compact rooms but you get all you need, comfy bed, a nice desk and good sized bathroom. The restaurant is delicious. I would stay here again in a heartbeat...clean with friendly staff and a funky vibe.

Arrived for a client event and they let us check in a bit earlier than usual so we could go explore New York. Staff friendly. I left my phone charger battery pack in the restaurant, the restaurant staff delivered to the front desk for them to ship back. Don't have it yet but will update when I receive.

The hotel is updated and the restaurant is excellent. The roof top bar is pricey but the view is good. You can walk to Times Square and Madison Square Garden as well as a number of nice restaurants...

Really enjoyed our recent stay here on the 17th floor. It's just a few blocks from the Flatiron area, 5th avenue shopping, tons of restaurants etc. Walking the opposite direction takes you to Chelsea Market. We had a King corner room and also another room with double beds. The King room had a decent view, with a very comfortable bed and pillows. I had requested a mini frig because they don't come in the rooms and I like to keep a few drinks cold. It was brought to the room upon check in. The double room had a very close up view of an office building in an alley. The plus to this is you don't hear any street noise. Everything was very clean. For some reason the A/C in the hallways was extremely cold during our stay. If you don't like Keurig coffee, there are lots of places to get great coffee nearby, Seven Grams, Toby's Estate, Perpetuum Cafe and more. If you are looking to not be in the middle of the insane crowds of Times Square, this is a great spot. The staff is very nice, in particular Noel was extremely welcoming and kind. We enjoyed our stay

This fashion district Hilton is not very fashionable and needs some mending. Lots of little things were broken or worn out: The buffet breakfast was minimal and not even as good as Hampton Inn servers up; The shades in the room were shabby and did not close properly. letting in the morning sun; The elevator took forever to arrive; The room key card maker was broken; There were discarded beer caps under my bed; The TV did not get all the channels; The magnifying mirror in the bathroom had no illumination; The room had a view of the next door office building.....I will not stay here again when I'm in New York, because this does not live up to Hilton standards and is not worth the high price.

Well located and kept, this is my favorite place to stay at when need to be in the Chelsea/Flatiron area. Rooms are smaller than other Hiltons, but are cozy, clean, well maintained and sooo comfortable. Restaurant has great burgers and the roof top bar is great for a drink and relax after a busy day. But what really keeps me going back to this hotel, is service. EXCELLENT SERVICE! Zoribel, Martha and especially Marian Rock, will make you feel at home, every time. They really make an effort to ensure you are treated as the most important guest. Keep it up!!Thank you for a great stay, again!

This was a fun weekend stay in NYC with my daughter. This hotel was clean and the staff was nice. The location was a little farther walking from our activities than I realized (5th ave area shopping, 30 Rock, etc), but once we started to learn our way around, it didn't feel quite as far as it had at first. The restaurant breakfast was lacking, as the menu was verbal and limited (3 or 4 items) and didn't open until 7:30 or 8:00. Further compounding this, there was no hospitality in the form of immediate access to coffee or tea in the lobby (I don't care for Keurig coffee - there was a Keurig machine in our room). On the other hand, the beds were very comfortable! The mattresses felt newer and the pillows were great. I'm not typically someone who sleeps well, and I slept well both nights. I'd say my overall suggestion to this hotel is to start providing coffee or tea, around the clock, somewhere in this hotel! I think the lack of this, or a coffee shop across the street, tends to add to the feeling that this location isn't as convenient as a tourist would want.
user_name:
angelasW1475RT
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Overall, it was a good stay. Great location and I had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. Diamond status was recognized and front desk at check in made sure I was accommodated well. He gave extra water bottles as my friends came with me to go to the rooftop bar. He even proactively offered three drink vouchers on Hilton to make me feel very welcomed, so I can share it with my friends. He did explain that the rooftop bar was not operated and owned by Hilton, so it is not Hilton's fault if it seems that many people come and go and wait on line to go to the bar. It is opened to everyone as it is by Rare Restaurant. Rooftop bar experience was great. Beautiful view of the city and good house wine. Breakfast was great actually. Huge portions and lots of choices on offer served by Rare. Service here at the hotel and restaurant were all quite nice and friendly. The room was fine and the bed was comfortable. Loved the amount of towels and pillows they provided. I appreciate that and even the set up was elegant. Although, the maid did not clean up some soap residue in the shower area, but the room was clean and good besides that. Loved the Keurig coffee machine and so easy to use and the instructions and reminders were a neat touch. I learned how to use Nespresso, now, but this machine was much easier to use and in a way it a bit more high-tech. I do wish they had an executive lounge for their gold and diamond members. Also, I do wish they were more proactive and accommodating to allow complimentary late check out for its gold and diamond members even if it is by an hour or two. A little gesture can go a long way. Other than that, thank you very much. I had a much better stay here than my two previous Hilton stays. This Hilton is quite good and I really appreciate it!

My family recently stayed a couple of nights at this hotel.Pros: The room with two double beds was a decent size.The hotel has a little driveway to pull into which is much better than parking on the street.The rooms were well decorated and clean.The staff was friendly.There was a rooftop bar (we never made it up there).There is a good restaurant across the street and a good pizza place about a block away.It was fairly easy to get there.Cons:I had a kind of weird reservation. I had two rooms for two nights and 4 reservations. I had to explain this to the front desk on 4 different occasions. It would have been nice if the first person was able to make a note or change in their computer systems so I didn't have to do this. I understand that it was my fault for making the weird reservations, but 4 times explaining it was a little much.Parking is super expensive, but it was nice to have my car valeted and not have to worry about it.There is a mini bar and the drinks were ridiculous. $4.25 for a soda. The rooftop bar was not open due to a special event on the one night we were able to get up there.There is not a ton of stuff to do around there. I would not say it's walking distance to any of the main touristy areas.Overall, I would recommend this hotel. It was a pleasant stay. I felt safe there and that's important when staying in a big city.

Having come there from a similarly priced full service hotel where I hace equal status, the depressing nature of the small and crowded lobby and small and modest room were striking. The staff were pleasant enough but they don't have much to work with given the hotel's layout.

The hotel is excellently situated within easy walking distance of Madison Square Gardens, Times Square and Fifth Avenue. It was kept very clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful, I would stay again.

We had a good 2 night stay at the hotel whilst on a business trip to NYC. Location was excellent, nice area with lots to do in the evening. Rooms clean and well appointed. Service and staff friendly. Definitely recommended

I travel to NYC once a month for business, staying somewhere between 3 to 5 nights. I've staying in this particular hotel twice now this year, and possibly even reviewed it on here. I am a Diamond HHonors member.I took the option to pay extra for a "high floor". This is a 22 floor hotel, so given I was paying extra was expecting floors 19+. I got 16 (room 1611 to be precise).I have 2 reasons for wanting a high floor - in NYC the higher you are, the quieter it is. You also have some chance of not looking straight across into someone else's room. This was singularly the noisiest hotel room I have ever had the misfortune of staying in. I arrived on a Saturday and the noise from the street below was extraordinary. From groups of people in the early hours (most likely spilling out of the hotel's rooftop bar) to the garbage truck every morning between 2 and 4am the amount of noise coming in the obviously cheap and not-soundproof glass was extraordinary.On top of that 1611 seems to be opposite some sort of linen closet where the staff felt the need to slam the door every 20 minutes all night. In the course of a 4 night stay I estimate I slept no more than 2 to 3 hours each night.To add to this the toilet obviously had an issue with a valve as water ran through that all night - this was mostly drowned out by the AC but on top of everything else it didn't help.The next issue was breakfast. In all my experiences in HHonors hotels the Gold/Diamond members get access to the full breakfast buffet. This was also the case in my previous visit earlier this year, but by this visit it had changed. We are now offered a very limited option of 4 or 5 a-la carte options and not allowed access to the buffet. The options are poor. On the first morning I had a croissant with bacon/cheese - it was terrible and took 45 minutes to be delivered. One of the reasons I like the hhonors hotels is because I can get a quick buffet breakfast before going to meetings. I don't have time for an hour round trip (due to elevators - see below) from my room for a greasy croissant. Downgrading the breakfast like this is cheap. I was paying $400+ a night for this stay, don't save yourself $2. I gave up going for breakfast an instead picked up something on my way to the office. My wife went for breakfast one more time to give it a try and see if it improved - it was a hot morning and she was refused any cold drinks - only tea and coffee were offered. Simply abysmal way to treat customers.The next issue was the elevators (or lack of). This is a general issue in NYC but normally a hotel like this with 3 elevators can be relatively efficient. This isn't the case when one of the elevators is blocked from guest use so it can be exclusively used to ferry non-guests to the rooftop bar. This confirmed the elevator was working, but still during the day it was locked off from guest use leading to some VERY long waits. This was exacerbated on my final evening when they had delared this elevator broken, and decided to still reserve one of the elevators for non-guests to get to the rooftop bar. This meant a single elevator served the entire hotel. I waited 25+ minutes to get down to street level. For over $400 bucks a night, you must be joking!A very bad experience - I did somewhat raise some of these issues with the staff, but after my attempt at explaining why the breakfast was no good I didn't see the point pushing it further, I will just remove my custom from the group instead. I see you value your rooftop bar customers higher than hhonors guests.

Great little hotel to stay in. Small rooms but very clean and cozy. The Wifi connectivity was strong and consistent. The overall location is convenient given the location within the city. The Roof Top Bar was a great bonus!

No hot water on the morning of June 22nd. Ok, accidents and mishaps occur, but my disappointment was the blasé attitude from the front desk when I told them about it at 6:30am. "Oh yes, we know", she said. As I checked out an hour later I was asked: "did you enjoy your stay?". "Not really, I said, there was no hot water for me to shower this morning. . ". No response, the lady was already heads down sorting through receipts. She didn't care. Breakfast was also poor. It took 20 minutes for my check to arrive after I asked for it. I even reminded 2 waiters. The place was not even busy (7:20am). And I'd love to see the box that the "fresh squeezed orange juice" is poured from. The granola I paid $8 for was almost certainly made from Honey Crunch granola bars being broken apart - I even had a corner piece on my plate. And it's true that the elevators can take a long time. On the plus side, room was comfortable. However, there are so many other choices that I would never stay here again.

The hotel staff was very friendly. I liked my room. It was quiet but contained the amenities.There were no problems at all with my stay. I was staying near friends before a surgery. I would go back to this hotel. The fashion district area was fun to visit.

Poor Service, inability to solve problems, no items on the breakfast buffet, only 1 working elevator to roof top bar on a Friday night. Took our guest over 30 minutes to arrive and us longer to leave because on the one elevator. Computers were out in the dining area, which made it impossible to order off the menu. On Saturday a.m. breakfast only one server working the entire floor. Stay at another Hilton or Hampton..

We recently stayed at the Hilton Fashion District during our family vacation to NY. The hotel was in a great location, an easy walk to the Flat Iron District to visit Eataly and the famous Flat Iron building seen in so many TV shows. There staff is very welcoming and friendly. They were always happy to answer the tourist type questions we had and they provided many recommendations on the easiest way to get from point A to point B, places to eat, which tour bus company to use etc. if you are flying in from the West Coasting a red eye- be sure to join the Hilton Honors program and use the option for early check in! The option allows members to pay $25 dollars and have their room available before the 3pm check in, subject to availability of course. If the room isnt ready you don't pay the fee. This was a life saver for us! We were able to check in at approx 9am EST, take a quick nap, get cleaned up and head out on our adventure without the worry of what to do with our luggage or stopping what we were doing to return to the hotel and check in. I really enjoyed my stay here and will stay again when we return to NY.

Small rooms in a good location, only high floor privilege for Hhonors Diamond, except breakfast (that by the way is just acceptable)Gym, Rare restaurant as well as the roof top bar also just acceptable by Hilton standards.But the location is good and the service and personal nice and quite efficient.Very nice restaurants and stores near by.

Never thought I would give a place a one star, but I came REALLY CLOSE. Read the reviews before booking about the elevator issue but thought it was being over blown....It WAS NOTPros are many. Very modern and updated (so updated that were laying new carpet on our floor as we arrived) Good location to midtown, Madison Square Garden, Empire State building and walkable to Times Square. Front desk staff were pleasant and attentive. A functionality issue with the room was quickly addressed and remedied. BUT>>>>> The elevators are very slow, small and few in number. AND to add insult to it, We returned one evening at Midnight, got on an available elevator and WAS TOLD WE HAD TO GET OFF SINCE IT WAS ONLY FOR PEOPLE GOING TO THE ROOF TOP BAR. Yep, you got it. Doesn't matter if you are a first time guest of Hilton or a Diamond level Hilton Honors, they will not let you on the elevator, you have to wait for another, just in case someone wants to go to the rooftop bar....and the roof top bar is not that special. (Actually its small and overpriced) So there you stand, waiting for one of the few remaining elevators to come to the lobby while an empty and available elevator waits empty just in case someone comes and wants to go to the roof top bar.The management here puts the patrons of the bar above the guests of the hotel!Went for breakfast Sunday morning, ordered, and after nearly 40 min, manager says to multiple, patrons "sorry, tickets not printing in the kitchen. You can wait for your order or go to the buffet". Since we were pressed for time, we chose the buffet. Few choices, poorly stocked as several of the pans were near empty. Limited cold or warm choices AND was more expensive than the made to order breakfast. Breakfast buffet should have at least been comped for the wait. In short, nice building, good location, Management more concerned with the patrons of the bar then guests of the hotel...... SHAME ON YOU HILTON!PLENTY of options in NYC in this area.

As a frequent Hilton guest at various Hilton properties in NYC, I still have mixed feelings about this particular property. Surely the room is a bit larger than other properties, but not also not particularly impressive. There are some pros with the hotel, such as a real premium high speed internet and a driveway for car services to drop off passengers. The service was okay, but then I still feel that it is more like an upscaled Hilton Garden Inn, rather than a proper Hilton property. The location is okay, as it is closed to the Red and yellow line, about ten minutes walk from Penn Station, and plenty of restaurants around the hotel. I am not sure if I consider a fan of the hotel. I have no problem staying here again, but possibly prefer other Hilton properties in the city.

Although centrally located, this hotel has several issues. Reception staff is not particularly friendly and helpful. For example, upon checkout I consider it standard practice to see the check before my card is charged. The receptionist seemed baffled that I actually wanted to have a look at it to check whether any unwanted items were added. Moreover, the Honors breakfast is a bummer.
