It's a long time that I have eaten such an uninspired French toast. I don't quite understand why they don't let those guests have the buffet without, say, the hot items. I wasn't impressed by the cleanliness either. Particularly the common areas were not clean. My room was also missing a coffee maker. I had assumed it was out for replacement but throughout my four night stay it didn't arrive back. One night I woke up because there was construction noise somewhere below my room. It lasted for quite some time and the next morning you could see that some works had been undertaken. There was never a notice for this. Lastly, their roof top bar has a nice view but is outrageously expensive and poor quality. I probably had one of the worst Mojitos I ever had for 15$. So, bottom line, I think this hotel needs to fix a couple of things before it's worth paying 300$ a night.

Just the perfect location to Times Square and Wall Street. Hotel had a fantastic rooftop bar where you can relax, have a drive or two, and a view of Empire State building. My room was clean and comfortable. Customer service was superb from check-in to bar tenders and the Mr. Elevator man. I would definitely go back and stay at this hotel.

Great hotel near 28th street. Couple of blocks to subway. Convenient but not noisy and crowded like mid-town. I was able to get to Time Square by train in less than 10min. Breakfast as a Gold member was just ok. Selection was not much and the omelette they make for you was kind of tiny.

I am am regularly in this area for business, and have shopped several Hilton hotels. I think I finally found the right place to stay.The rooms are more spacious than many hotels in midtown. The view rooms are worth it. The third elevator helps a lot during busy times. While the restaurant Raw isn't my favorite, it's nice to have it onsite. And the rooftop bar is a nice option for a nightcap.Two quirks I didn't care for:1. Cool water in the shower. It might be hot for part of the shower, but not the duration.2. Diamond Hilton members get a breakfast voucher, yes, but it's good for only two dining options. Strange. Just give us "$15" or whatever toward breakfast, so we can choose our options.

this was a purchase from the old wyndham hotel, so whatever you are expecting from a hilton, dont expect it here. no room upgrade available, no extended check out available either. there are no slipper or bathrobe or water in room. When asked for water at the lobby. their response was rude and said you can only have two per room, they cant give you the whole case. the lobby is a mess as there is a roof top bar, the elevator takes forever and if someone comes back from 4am partying on saturday night, you will be awaken by it and hear every single detail of their conversation.

Great stay, great location and really great staff. Would recommend to others and will stay there again. The bathroom was nice, the room was just big enough and the staff was great. i was very pleased with my stay!

The elevator wait times were the worst I have ever experienced at any hotel anywhere. And, when one of the 3 elevators was not working, the staff prioritized people waiting to go to the rooftop bar over the paying guests who were waiting to get to our rooms! I'm pretty sure I was generating more revenue for the hotel during my stay then the bar guests. I frequently had to wait over 15 minutes to go up to my room, or to go down to the lobby. The staff joked about the elevator not working, that they frequently break, and that they should have installed a better brand of elevator. It took over 2 days for the elevator to be fixed! During one breakfast, we found pieces of plastic floating in the container of milk that we were served. When we showed it to our server, they were very nonchalant about it and simply gave us another -- no apology, nothing. I have never had a worse experience at a hotel (or a motel for that matter!)

We stayed one night and our room was clean and comfortable. My only real complains are that the in-room coffee was terrible and my shower was not as hot as I would like. We stayed on the 16th floor and could see the top of the empire state building. We did not go up to the rooftop bar, but I hear it's nice. The restaurant in the lobby level - Rare - was good.

Very average hotel. It felt like a Hilton Garden Inn, not a full service Hilton. First the good - very small reception desk, but they were very efficient in checking people in / out. Minimal wait time. Decent bathroom size. When I checked in they told me my room rate included breakfast, but if I chose not to eat breakfast they will offer 2000 additional pointsThe poor - no doorman / bell-person at the door to help with bags when you arrive in a cab. Poor sound-proofing - I was in the 17th floor but still could hear all the street noises like horns, ambulance sirens, etc. The rooftop bar was closed by 11pm on the night I was there. The air-conditioning unit in my room kept turning off even through I had the unit on High (and not Auto) so it could drown out street noise, but that obviously didn't work.
user_name:
mcsc-squared
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a nice hotel. I was there on business. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Little touches like Keurig coffee in the rooms is a nice touch! Nice bar, restaurant and a rooftop bar. Will go there again.

Very close to Time Square, 5th Avenue Shopping, public transport and Theatres.Bar and snacks, friendly helpful staff and little traffic noise. Close to plenty of eating in Hells Kitchen...check out Spoonfed on West 51st

Stayed here for one night with visitors from overseas while sightseeing. Hotel was good value for money. Fairly central without the madness and noise of midtown. Rooms were on the larger side for NYC.

I stayed at this hotel for three nights, and couldn't be more impressed. From the cleanliness of the hotel to the friendliness of the staff, everything was great! I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

We stayed at the Hilton for a wedding. The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The hallways were freezing and that is our only complaint. We had drinks & nibbles at the restaurant where the waitress was very friendly.

My family stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for a long weekend right before the holidays and it was great overall. The standard room was fairly large and roomy for NYC, well appointed and comfortable. The hotel location is really great, and was easily accessible to a couple of subway stops or attractions on foot; we used Uber only a couple of times because walking or taking the subway was so convenient. The only challenging part of our stay was checking out, which took at least 20 minutes since there were only 2 representatives and a long line of people leaving. Once we finally checked out, while we were waiting for our Uber, I noticed that we were charged double the nightly rate quoted on our reservation. Once we went back inside and showed our confirmation email to the manager, we were refunded the difference, but I'm not sure how challenging that could have been if we hadn't noticed until we had already left. Since it was handled so easily, I would still stay here again - it's a great option based on the price and location!

The Hilton Fashion District hotel is an excellent hotel for a quick business trip to New York City. It is convenient to the Javits Center and mid-town Manhattan businesses and the subway to lower Manhattan. Good restaurants are nearby. The staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but new and modern. The cost is less than many larger mid-town hotels of the same class.

I was torn between booking the Conrad (great room at a further location) or this Hilton (prime location for me but with a much smaller room). When I first walked into the boutique-style hotel and went into the room, my first thought was "I should have booked at the Conrad"... however, that thought quickly went away.Yes, the rooms are small, but for New York standards, they were actually pretty sizable. I stayed in a two double bed room with plenty of room for me and my best friend. Great sized television, bathroom with hot running water at all times (these days, sometimes that's not a given, even at high brand hotels!), decent sized bathroom and great sized shower.Pros: internet speed was fast and reliable, and loved that I did not have to sign in every night. Also, as mentioned, room size was a pro (although, warning for non-new yorkers, rooms are very small compared to, say, a Hilton or even a Hampton in the west and around Texas... think of room sizes similar to London). Plenty of lifts and never had to wait for more than a minute or two. Easy access to taxis and Ubers always showed up within 3 minutes. And the beds! Probably one of the most comfortable beds I've had in a while in a hotel. Also, air conditioning works great!Cons: in the 14th floor and little to no mobile phone service (but thankfully, wifi was reliable and T-Mobile as free wifi calling which worked great! However, this may be an issue for other travelers). Also, it can get very loud in the lobby area at night due to rowdy parties, but thankfully it's quiet in the rooms! My room didn't have a great view (a brick wall), but this was not a big issue for me, but may be for others. Still plenty of light coming inside. Rooms can be a bit darker, even with all lights on, but nothing too terrible.Overall, a pleasant stay. For the location, the size of the rooms and the price can't be beat! Hilton diamond member and had great service from the staffPlease be advised: diamonds, there is no lounge at this hotel. But honestly, given that I was out and about the entire day, I later admitted to myself that I would not have even had time to enjoy the lounge. However, might be a decision maker for business users.Traveling with my best friend for three nights.

I stayed for three nights this Memorial Day weekend. I paid for a upgraded "high floor" view. They put me on the 22nd floor, which they said was their highest. The room had a beautiful view of the empire state building, but the noise ... They told me beforehand that the room was right below their rooftop bar and that I might hear "a little" noise. Little was an understatement. Listen, I love to have fun and don't mind a little noise - I don't book hotels in NYC Memorial Day weekend for a "quiet stay" but the constant thud of base from above from about 12 pm to 1 am Friday, Saturday, and Sunday was just a bit much. I really couldn't stay in my room during the day just to chill and relax - you have to turn up the TV loud to drown out the noise. At least one night I was trying to go to sleep before 1 AM - not happening with all that music. By the end of it I had bags under my eyes. For the amount of money I was paying per night to stay there, I don't expect that level of noise nightly - ya'll need that sound proofing asap.Also - the breakfast buffet was a little weak. Their process for seating is a little strange, they have a perfectly good back area to seat buffet guests but instead go through this off greeting process which takes unnecessary time. The food was mediocre for a what I would expect from a Hilton brand. There weren't many people at all at the restaurant yet the staff seemed to be hustling. They weren't very attentive to the buffet, food ran out and was not replaced speedily. Fruit was kinda stale - bananas were days old and had brown/black parts throughout when I tried to eat it. Bacon was fine though. Potatoes were a average. All around rather low quality for a Hilton imo.The rooftop bar itself though is pretty awesome and convenient for a fun time if you're staying at the hotel. Also the hotel's location and proximity to other NYC things to do is good.So, in sum ... PROs - location, rooftop bar, clean room, nice view on high floors. CONs - noise level on high floors interferes with sleep, breakfast is meh. Between the noise and and the sub-par breakfast I can't say I recommend you stay here unless there's some sort of special. For the amount I paid, I wasn't completely satisfied, especially about the noise. If you ARE going to stay here, request a floor with a view but DO NOT accept the 22nd floor, or bring some earplugs.

We just stayed at the hotel one night this past weekend. I booked it using Groupon so got a great deal. We loved the location and how friendly and helpful the staff was. We valeted our bags since we arrived early in the day. A very nice service and no charge to guests. When we checked in Charles at the front desk gave us cards for a comp'd breakfast which was really nice. I am not sure if that is because I am honors member or because he is just a great guy. Either way we totally enjoyed talking to him and truly appreciated the great customer service. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a great size and very bright. We heard very little noise from the street, a complete surprise being in the city and even though we were across from the elevator we heard no noise. We enjoyed grabbing a cocktail on at the rooftop bar. Mine was called Up for it? and it was so delicious. Though the weather was not the best the views were still very nice. We would definitely stay here again. Being below Times Square is much quieter and we also were able to take advantage of walking from both uptown and downtown. There is a subway stop very close to the hotel if you decide to take the subway. We walked and used the subway during out 2 days.

We booked this hotel because the reviews were good and the prices were the best we could find for the holiday weekend. The location is good; subways are easily accessible and uber rides are cheap. We paid for a high floor room with a view. We were given the 17th floor (of 22 I believe?) without much of a view at all. Normally I would have returned to the front desk but due to traffic we arrived much later than planned and only had less than 45 minutes to get ready for a broadway show. The room sizes are good for the city. The bed was super comfortable and the bathroom clean. We had read previous reviews about no refrigerator so we had previously called to request one and found it in our room upon arrival. They do not have an ice machine which is odd but did bring a bucket filled with ice up to us when we inquired. Overall we were pleased with the location and quality of this hotel and will consider it in the future!

Arrived at Times Square and no queues at front desk. Directed to room which was clean and comfortable. Breakfast a little disappointing. General manager personally looked up train times for us and gave us helpful info for our onward journey.

Reserved the hotel room with hhonors points. Called them a day before to ask for a complementary Diamond member upgrade and I was told to call the morning of the day I check-in. When I did that, I was told that I will be given the room on the top floor with a view of Empire State. While checking in they tell me that the room was given to some one else for some reason and they put me on 15th floor with literally no view at all. This, to me, amounts to cheating. I will be cutting short my stay to just one night and will never ever considering staying here again. A very bad way to start a trip to celebrate wedding anniversary.

Modern and convenient hotel for the New York fashion district. Rooms are small but workable. Facilities are adequate and a nice roof garden for a drink with an excellent view. Internet is excellent and staff friendly. Many things to do including walking in the high line

Good hotel in a good location. Staff lovely, very helpful and friendly. Nice and clean. Rooms small for price. Nice location out of the hustle and bustle. Not far from Madison square and Macy's etc. Only 20 mins walk from Times Square.

We ALWAYS stay at the NYC Fashion District Hilton in Chelsea. It's very close to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, and lots of restaurants and shopping. The staff is always friendly and accomodating. There is a great restaurant called RARE. There is also a rooftop lounge that gives an incredible view of the city. The rooms are always clean and the elevators work great. Rates are usually reasonable for NYC. We have been staying there for 8 years and continue to have positive and enjoyable experiences.
user_name:
Gigi G
Ft. Lauderdale, United States

review_body: This is mid range hotel in New York where rooms are tiny and expensive so this hotel was a good option for us over christmas and new years eve. The hotel has good location, staff was very nice and helpful. It was clean, rooms are small but that's expected in NY. Overall I was pretty happy and it was exactly as expected.

This is my second stay at the Hilton New York Fashon District.Sure will stay again at this wonderful hotel. Very clean rooms, helpful staff, tasty breakfast. Near to everything. You can do a lot of shopping, many good shops around the area.

Stayed here for a business trip and found the staff and hotel very good. Everyone was friendly from front desk staff to housekeeping. Rooms are adequate and clean. I would recommend this hotel for leisure or business trips.

We were up on a getaway weekend and usually avoid the chains preferring the smaller hotels. We stayed at the Hilton largely because of the price (about $60 less a night then most boutique hotels we checked.) Very happy with the choice. The room was huge for NYC. Everything was well maintained and the staff was super pleasant and helpful. This hotel claims great views from their rooms and it certainly was true from ours. Its the tallest building in the area so I expect most rooms have equally terrific views. This is a good bet and only a half dozens blocks from Penn Station.

Great location - nice front desk folks - clean room. For the $ - hard to beat! Roof top bar was OK - waiters and waitresses all very nice. What they lack in trendiness they make up with Hospitality. Hey, southern- it goes a long way with me. Even if they talk funny.

The pictures shown on the Hilton New York Fashion District website are “absolutely” not what we were given! We paid a premium to stay in the Hilton New York Fashion District “Ultra-modern, boutique-style hotel” which is a joke – the website pictures are from twenty (20) years ago! I requested connecting rooms which I agreed to pay $80.00 – these were not available and never made available King size bed room was TOO SMALL HVAC system (air conditioner) was located right at the head of the King size bed and one of the two (2) double beds Cold air blowing across the head of bed caused us to have to shut OFF the HVAC system at night – it was too much air velocity even on low fan setting, cold and/or on & off all night We heard every toilet flush and/or door slam with the HVAC system turned off King room toilet seat was loose and slipped around when you sat down – it was like that from the very beginning of our reservation but after two (2) days of putting up with the slippery seat I called the front desk and asked them to fix it which they did that afternoon – the key point here is that I should NOT have had to ask for the repair! As expensive as these rooms are it PISSED me off that the room refrigerator is full of liquids / liquor that I will have to pay for if the door is opened – I had to ask for an empty refrigerator, the room was already too small – this refrigerator is NOT mentioned on the website - Hilton $$$ maker at my expense There is NOT an Ice machine anywhere – it took one (1) hour for them to deliver ICE!
user_name:
X9243WHtomd
Manhattan New York, United States

review_body: Very nice hotel, rooms a little small but it is NYC, staff was excellent , rooftop bar was fun, piano bar across the street was a lot of fun with good staffPrice was reasonable Parking was pricey but again it's the city Would definitely stay again Short walk to penn station so nice location to get around the city

Stayed here on a quick overnight business trip and was shocked that I didn't previously know about it given how many business trips I take to NYC via Amtrak. It's only a short walk from the train station and centrally located close to most mid town West side attractions. The accommodations and staff are very good. Burger I ordered from room service was good too. You will enjoy your stay.
user_name:
Maya R
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I been the top of the Hilton Honors program since 1988, so I know my Hilton's. Also, lived in New York for 68 years. This is a great hotel if you are coming to New York City on Amtrack, N. J. or the LIRR. Only a few safe block walk south. The down side was the shower in our room, you had to reach in to turn it on and there was a glass wall for about 1 1/2 feet, so it got hit with cold water. If you are coming to New York City to see the World, you would be better around 42nd street, more subway lines north and south, also one west to east, with free transfers. Plus many of the sites are north of 42nd street. Also, nice spot down stairs for breakfast. always look for a hotel that you don't need a subway to keep getting to the areas, you want to see, it gets expensive.

New hotel. Good location close to subway. Clean room and comfortable bed. No noise issues. Friendly service. I didn't try the restaurant or bar as I was only staying overnight. There are lots of restaurants nearby.

We've spent five nights at this hotel. The location is great, with all the subway lines 2-3 blocks away, lots of places to eat around the hotel and Times Square is a mile away, The Village is also within walking distance, and so is the High Line.The staff was kind and helpful, and helped us with information regarding all our requests. (hotel transfer, Broadway tickets, and so on). The rooftop bar is also a nice touch. We had a King room on the 11th floor. It was clean, spacious and quiet, facing the street, with a relatively generous bathroom and decent WiFi.I would not hesitate booking the same hotel on my next NY visit.

We picked a hotel for location but it turned out the service succeeded beyond our expectation. the staff were super friendly and has a really cool roof bar and obviously easy to walk to everywhere. ++
user_name:
Catherine L
Bradley Airport- Windsor, United States

review_body: Spacious room, great staff and a perfect Location. We stay for four days with my husband, the Hotel counts with a rooftop but is a shame that they do not have a special rate for guests. Just crossing the street is a quiet place to drink beers and enjoy a snack (fish and chips are ver good). Definitly we will come back.

We stayed here as guests of a wedding nearby, and it really was ideal. The room was small but comfortable and very clean. There was a coffee maker, safe, iron/ironing board and mini-bar (which we avoided at all costs). There is apparently a roof-top bar/restaurant but we didn't have time to go.

I didn't expect this place to be so economical, because it's a Hilton. I sort of expected it to be half under construction or something to explain the good price. But I was so surprised- great service, great room, great location, great price. I'll watch for this one again!

The front desk women and men made this Hilton hotel an absolute pleasure for me. Led by the charming and helpful manager, Sam, they catered for all my needs during my stay from April 27 to May 6 and always with a smile

This was the second trip in 18 months to NYC for my wife and I.we booked the hotel via Tripadvisor (redirected to Hotels.com) about 10 days prior to departure managing to obtain a great prepaid rate of just over £215 per night for 7 nights.We arrived via Taxi from JFK around 9.30pm on a Saturday night.the lobby was busy with people coming and going from the hotel bar and waiting for the dedicated elevator to the rooftop bar, however we were given a warm welcome by the reception desk and able to check in under 2 mins.We were allocated a king size bed room on a high floor (18th, room 1815).the room was spacious by NYC standards.clean and with all the amenities you need e.g iron and board, hairdryer and plenty of fresh towels.The view wasnt picture postcard however we did look onto the adjacent building roofs with the typical new york water towers and fire escapes and you could see the top portion of the world trade centre.this did also mean there was no street noise so no issues getting to sleep.Our room was situated behind the elevators however you only heard the occassional whooshing sound in the morning with increased traffic of people going for breakfast or leaving the hotel.aircon was great (much needed during our stay with temperatures around 74f) with an easy to use control panel on the wall by the tv.The bed was extremely comfortable so much so we are going to replace our memoryfoam mattress at home as the sleep we had on the hotel bed surpassed this.the hotel restaurant - Rare - is a much underated gem.We had dinner in here one night.portions were huge and delicious as was the wine.i had the new york strip which was cooked to a perfect medium rare and was more like a chateaubriand for 2 to share.the price of our meal here was less than half we had in the various restaurants we dined at around the city but surpassed a few of them in quality.The rooftop bar was ok.the cocktail menu was limited on our visit but the views were spectacular.it did seem to get busier during our visit with an afterwork local crowd and therefore not as touristy as say 230 fifth.The location of the hotel for us was the real highlight.situated closer to the corner of 7th avenue and 2 mins walk to the corner of 6th, you are spoilt for choice with local bars, restaurants and landmarks as well as having several subway lines within a block or 2.having previously stayed on 53rd st in midtown; being situated in chelsea made travelling downtown and to brooklyn that must faster and less crowded as getting the subway from 28th or 23rd st meant most tourists would get off by 34th st.The location also felt more like the real New York (compared to the madness of Times Square).you knew the option was there if you wanted it - go to the corner of 7th and look north and you can see the billboards - but there is a high concentration of apartment blocks so you feel you are more in an actual neighbourhood.We are already planning a return trip for later in the year and this hotel is certainly top of our list for our stay.I would say provided there is a clean comfortable bed and hot shower that is all you need as a base to explore NYC, however this hotel goes above and beyond in so many respects.

While I was only in for a quick trip for business, the staff at this hotel was great. The agents were friendly and outgoing from the moment I checked-in. After speaking with the agent that I was in for business and would be spending most of the night working, he even gave me a complimentary upgrade on my internet speed, helping me speed things along with my work. I had a wonderful room with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. Next time I am in New York, this will be my go-to hotel.

I love the location of this hotel. A one mile walk north or south covers a lot of great restaurants, bars and relevant businesses and tourist sites. The rooms are small, but big enough. The staff is pleasant and helpful. They have a pretty nice rooftop bar that really makes this an attractive spot as well. I did, however, have a bit of a hot water issue in the shower over a couple days, but it wasn't a huge deal. This place has what it must and the location is great.

Very convenient location. Room is very small, but read this is standard for New York. Walking distance to main attractions, or easily reachable by taxi or subway. Did not try the restaurant or the rooftop bar, but saw the line of people waiting to go up everyday. Very nice and friendly staff, from front desk to housekeeping.

I was very impressed with my recent stay at the Hilton in the Fashion District in the Chelsea area in NY. The staff was professional, efficient and friendly. The room was large, beautifully appointed and clean. I especially enjoyed the choice of pillows and the bed which was very comfortable. We were on a high floor and enjoyed the views of NY and the window that opened. The location is very convenient to everything. I will definitely be returning.
user_name:
debran105
Raleigh, North Carolina, United States

review_body: So many hotels to choose from in NYC, but I would stay here again if the price was right. Rooms are a little on the small side, even after upgrading to a high floor, king room. The view was nice. I found it very hard to believe they did not have a microwave avaliable for the room. There was a perfect, empty space for it above the coffee maker. They would rather leave it empty it would seem. If you stay here, do not stay on the top floor, 22. They have a rooftop bar/lounge that's open until 1am. We could hear the thumping music in our room until it closed. Floor 21 or under would have been better.

Excellent location, clean and friendly staff. Rooms are modern and includes free internet service which was fast. Request of high floor facing street was honored. Great value for price paid. Stay here- you wont be disappointed!

It's not the most exciting Hilton you've ever stayed at but it's functional. Pros: The rooms were updated and clean, housekeeping did what I asked daily (left a note with a tip), and the staff was friendly and helpful. Front desk assisted me in selecting a quiet room upon check in; helpful with directions; hailing a cab. Cons: Limited room service menu (restaurant attached is "Rare Bar and Grill" -- all meat -- and that's where food comes from); breakfast disappointing spread (although staff accommodating), small lobby, no quiet place to sit or get a drink, room is small.I would stay again if price was right.

This was a small hotel and off the beaten path, but overall good experience. The room was small, but was up high so we could see the city buildings. It was quiet and we got a good sleep every night. The shower was nice and I liked having the Keurig. There was a walk to Times Square, but if you are willing to hike it, is doable. The staff was nice and always helped guide us where we wanted to go.

The hotel is somewhat average, good location but if you're looking for a hotel experience this ain't it. Generally functional, the rooms are average, gym tiny, some staff helpful but a number just grumpy and with an attitude.

We checked in late night and got room quickly. Room was little congusted but ut was clean and i liked the bathroom cleanness too. Next timr when i visit newyork in couple of months i will definitely stay in this hotel

I appreciate hotels in large cities are not always what you would wish for, but apart from Concierge who was fantastic, friendly helpful and knowledgeable, everything about this hotel was average at best. The rooms are small, the hotel noisy, the location unbelievably noisy..... if you book here go with the expectation of not much sleep. Breakfast was not great, very 'processed' if you don't have breakfast included in your stay I would recommend eating out. Front desk was not great it was a bit like you were doing them a favour staying there. It is a good location, with easy walking to the subway and uptown. But as a Diamond Member with Hilton, I can honestly say there are far far better hotels in NYC to stay at.

Just around the corner of Madison Square Garden, this Hotel is a perfect option to discover Manhattan. Value for Money (Manhattan Style) is given. Nice rooftop bar/restauran with great views of the Empire State Building, even in Winter.

friendly and helpful staff. I would suggest taking advantage of the the view from the roof top. The location of the Hotel is very close to restaurants and shopping places. I enjoyed my early morning walk exploring the city. I will visit again, thank you for making my visit a pleasant time.

As Hilton's go, this one is pretty average and surprisingly in major need of a facelift given how relatively young this hotel is. Where do I begin!The only saving grace of this room is the size. It's pretty big for NY standards but there is not much alternative seating besides just sitting on the bed. There are "chairs" but not anything I would sit in for longer than a minute. The bed itself was saggy and the hotel desperately needs to put in new mattresses. I could barely sleep on it. All the furniture looked tired and worn and the wear and tear is most notable in the bathroom. The wood part of the sink was warped and the neon overhead light looked like it was about to fall off. There is absolutely no counterspace to put your stuff. As other reviewers mentioned, water will leak out from the shower to the outer floor, the door is no use in keeping the water inside. Only plus here is the shower pressure, provided you are able to get hot water.Forget the service. First morning, no hot water out of the shower. I called the front desk and they said the entire building has an issue and it was being fixed. Nothing offered to compensate for the trouble like a free breakfast. Second night, fire alarm goes off at 3am. After complaining to the front desk about this plus the hot water issue, someone finally offered to provide me some extra Hilton points. Do not expect this hotel to go out of their way to help you.I only stayed here because I was there with work colleagues who were also staying at this hotel. I would only stay here if the location works out for your needs. Otherwise look elsewhere.

This Hilton location is ideal if you need to be in Chelsea or NoMad neighborhoods. You also can walk easily from Penn Station. In addition, the hotel is close to a number of really good restaurants--all walking distance (e.g., A Voce or Eataly). And you are 2 short blocks from the 28th Street subway entrance.

I booked this hotel as part of a package with BA (not super expensive but certainly not cheap!!) Having previously stayed uptown we wanted to stay in a new area when visiting with our two children (aged 12 and 9.) I had been attracted to the roof top bar and then I realised under 21s are not even allowed in a bar so I emailed the hotel to see if we could get a room overlooking the ESB as the kids would not be able to see the view - unfortunately didn't not get a reply from the hotel.When we arrived hotel staff were very friendly and welcoming. We were told all family rooms were at the back of the hotel. As we opened our door we were met with perhaps the most underwhelming view ever - a brick wall!! As a result the room was so dark and we had to have all the lights on at all times.The pictures of trip advisor are not a true reflection of the room we stayed in. On the plus side the room was clean and functional and the beds were comfy. The bathroom was nice and the shower was lovely. The room was also quiet - brick walls don't make much noise at night!! The hotel is nicely located and we enjoyed spending time around the Flatiron building. It's also well placed for a walk uptown or downtown.The three star review is not really a criticism rather an indication of how underwhelming the hotel was for us as a party. If you are travelling without minors and pay for a room at the front overlooking the ESB and are able to use the roof top bar it may be a very different experience.

This hotel is way overpriced and has no problem overcharging you. The mattresses were also extremely uncomfortable. If this hotel had been half the price, I wouldn't complain. But for this price, I would expect a much more comfortable and organized experience.

My company booked me here for 4 nights. Very clean & nice staff. I loved the location as it was a nice walk to lots of attractions & easy to get in/out. The neighborhood is good so never felt worried about my surroundings. I think my room had a ghost (pleasant one) as odd things would happen while in my room. Maybe it was just all the smokers getting to my head! Nice rooftop bar too!

The room was a bit small, but not too small to be an issue. Great view of the Empire State Building... especially at night. We were on the top floor and literally felt like we could touch the building

My overall experience was great I just wish there was a pool and an ice machine and a fridge in my room. I had some juice and water to put away since I came from out of town. And I wanted to go swimming.

This hotel is located in the middle of the Fashion District and is a fairly short walk from Penn Station. There are a lot of restaurant choices around the hotel and it is close to a Metro station that can help get you to the rest of the city. The staff are friendly and efficient. Although the rooms are small but they are functional and clean. This is one of my favorite hotel in NYC.

This Hilton is located in the Fashion District and a fairly short walk from Penn Station. The staff are efficient and friendly and the rooms are clean and efficient. There are good food choices around the hotel. It is also located very close to the Metro and easy to get around the city.

If a hotel delivers all that it says it will then it has to get full marks - even if it doesn't set the heart racing..We were looking for a reasonably priced, modern hotel in a centralish location with room for 2 adults and an 11 year old. Tick.The staff were pleasant and helpful, the hotel was clean and well maintained and there is an excellent roof top bar with great views over the city.The location is good for walking to the Chelsea Market, High Line, Hudson River Park and for the excellent and highly recommended Malibu Diner on 23rd (breakfast). It feels like somewhere where people live rather than a tourist ghetto. We took the subway, cabs and bus to get around - all of which are easily accessible.The room had x2 double beds with some room around them and a reasonably sized bathroom - small by Texas standards but perfectly adequate. The air con worked well and the beds were comfortable. WiFi was complimentary and high speed.If you are looking for a well run, blandly comfortable hotel in a blameless location then this could well fit the bill.We stayed for 4 nights over the Easter weekend.

I have stayed at this hotel numerous times - always great experience. Love the location. Helpful knowledgeable staff. Pleasant rooms. Nice bar and good restaurant - makes it easy to get a drink or easy meal. Recommend you try it

The Hilton New York Fashion District is located in a great centralized location in Manhattan. As a guest you have fairly easy access to the subway system for longer trips up to the Bronx or down to Lower Manhattan and there is plenty to walk to within a 15-20 minute stroll from the hotel. The room pricing for this location was quite reasonable - at least during our stay and we found the room to be more comfortable and more spacious than other properties we have stayed in on previous visits. The room itself and the lobby and other public areas that we saw were clean and well maintained and the hotel staff were efficient and helpful. The rooftop bar offers some interesting cocktails and great views of the Manhattan skyline. We will definitely consider this hotel again the next time we are looking to stay in this part of Manhattan.

Short, 5-day vacation with my wife to NYC- we chose this Hilton hotel because of the location... two days before checking in I got an email from Sashika McDonald, the Assistant Front Office Manager, thanking me for choosing their hotel and offering any assistance we could require. I answered that I understood only two days before arriving may have been too late for this, but that due to a medication I have to take, I really could use a mini fridge (because this particular medication must be refrigerated 24/7). I had planned on using an ice bucket and filling it up with new ice 2-3x a day to keep everything cool, but the mini fridge would make everything easier and less stressful. Turns out two days before checking in wasn't too late for this Hilton hotel! When we checked in, they not only knew about the request at the front desk, but my mini fridge was in my room, connected and already cool when we arrived! This sounds ridiculous, but it really made the difference for a perfect, stress-free vacation because we didn't have to think at all about the medication and whether or not it was at the right temperature... The hotel staff was as friendly as can be, everyone from the front-desk to the cleaning and maintenance team. We met the lady that would clean our room 4 out of the 6 days we were there, and they were always helpful and asked if we found everything to our liking and offered any extra help we could need. The last day, she even offered to help with our bags when checking out... they really went the extra mile.On top of everything, the hotel has the perfect location in Fashion District, walking distance from great restaurants, across the street from Whole Foods, two blocks away from a subway entrance, etc. I can't recommend this hotel enough, and I really guarantee that I won't ever book a different hotel in NYC. This became my go-to hotel for trips to this city! Thank you!!
user_name:
Roberto A
New York City, New York

review_body: The room we had was not large, but it was large enough for 2 people on a weekend trip. Comfortable furniture and modern decor. The elevators are very fast. This hotel has a rooftop bar with great views. It is very convenient to Penn Station and a reasonable walk or short Uber to many attractions. The Irish ale house across the street is cool

I was worried about my stay as I had had a terrible experience dealing with Hilton regarding my reservation. I reached out to the property directly in hopes of help, but they never got back to me like they had said. I arrived on a Friday beating terrible weather that caused major air delays. I arrived around 11am and front desk held my bag. Went across the street where a chipotle and Dunkin' Donuts are located and had a little breakfast and some lunch. Came back and asked how I could access the gym, they told me it was unlocked downstairs. So I headed down and was about to hit my first set, and my phone rings. My room is ready! Awesome, I go grab my bag and hit the room. It was NYC small, but just fine. I went to set up my devices on wifi and to charge while I went to the gym, but the internet is down. Oh no, here we go.... called front desk and they sent a maintenance guy, "Nick". He identified and fixed the problem quickly, was super friendly and even provided some recommendations while he was fixing the router. This guy is a great asset to the property and was very helpful. His actions caused me to disregard the earlier issues I had experienced prior to arrival and consider this a 5 star stay.

Great hotel, clean rooms, fantastic breakfast, staff understands your needs before you even have a chance to ask for it. Only hotel I stay when in NYC despite the price. Fits for both my business and family stay.

My wife and I loved staying at this hotel. People at the front desk were amazing! They were extremely helpful and accomodating. Also, the location was perfect for us. Great restaurants and coffee shops. Overall, highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel is located in a good location with ease of access to subway. The rooms look nice, are clean, and are relatively spacious for NYC. With all that said, the rooms are noisy. Noise from the street easily enters the room with closed windows. Additionally, we were woken up every day at 8AM by the construction occurring on the floor above.

This hotel is well located, an easy walk from Penn Station. The room was big by New York City standards. The room and the common areas were clean. There are lots of excellent places to eat in the vicinity. What's not to like?

This is my ‘go to’ hotel for work as it’s close to the office, when staying in the city. It’s really well located, on 26th Street, between 7th & 6th Ave. Easy walking distance to Penn Station/MSG and handy for the 1 & 9 (Red) metro line.I love the clever cotton reel Mondrian in reception. The fresh flowers in the lobby are always spectacular. Check in is always efficient and friendly and I’ve many times been allowed to check in early on arrival in the morning, if my room is available. They have a great driver service to JFK. It’s always pretty easy to get a taxi outside.You need a key to go up in the elevators – so it feels safe. This hotel is very good about not giving out room numbers. My colleague and I always test them as we check in on different days. They will dial a room for you, but won’t give the number out.The restaurant located downstairs is good and has a nice ambience. I really like the breakfast. Rooftop bar nice too, when warm enough.The size of bedroom is dependent on it’s placing. Rooms at the back of the hotel, with no view, appear to be larger. Suits me … I’d trade the view for a larger quieter room with no road noise! Black out blinds are great. The room has air con that works.The rooms are perhaps not the brightest, the décor is quite dark at times, but the white bedding brightens it up. I don’t love the dark blue carpet and won’t be sorry when they change this. There’s a Keurig coffee machine in the room which is also a bonus. The bedroom is an ok size and the bathroom clean, modern and usually a descent size. There’s a full shower unit, I’ve never seen a bath in any of the rooms I’ve stayed in – just a glass shower. The bathroom has a light that automatically turns on and off at night which is handy. The bathrooms vary, again dependent on your location, some have a larger counter vanity area and others just a small one. Normally plenty of towels. The hotel photos on the Trip Advisor site are representative of what you get – minus the fresh flowers in the room!Price wise, I think due to it’s location, this hotel can often be a bit more expensive than other similar properties in it’s category. Will definitely be staying here again. Great hotel for a quick trip.

This Hilton property is a hidden gem. A few blocks from Times Square and very convenient. The food is great here and the roof top bar is an unexpected bonus. If you want to step away from the crowds and still have it all, look no further.

So as a small family, our child is not allowed in the hotel bar?? That's poor. Also got booking wrong +or agent did) and tried to charge us an additional £760 for the same room just to add me onto the booking. Just a joke.

This was a 4 day family vacation stay. Our room was modern and clean, although pretty basic. It was small for 4 people, but we spent little time in the room. The safe is in a bad location to see into. We were on the top floor, at the back of the hotel, and had an average city view. There was a noise that we determined was coming from the roof that was noticeable but not enough to keep you awake. The hotel is 2 - 3 blocks from metro subway stops so it is easy to get around the city. No real attractions near the hotel, but that was not a concern for us. We enjoyed being in a neighborhood, not a tourist zone. There are plenty of reasonable dining options close by. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant. We experienced a problem with our tv one night, but they fixed it promptly. For what we paid, we felt the hotel was a good value.

Surrounded by the vibrancy of this remarkable city. Can be a little noisy due to the commotions in the streets, experienced mostly on a Saturday night. Friendly and helpful staff. Enjoyed staying here and would definitely stay again.

Recently stayed here for 3 nights for a work conference.LOCATION:The location was OK, although not the best I've stayed at before. The metro/subway stations are not that close to the hotel (about 2-3 blocks) so it all depends on what your agenda is and where your business is taking place. ROOMS:The room was actually very very small. The lighting was poor and it was impossible to see/operate the safe (in the closet) without a flashlight as there is no light in the closet and you can't see anything without a flashlight. If you left the drapes opened, there was zero privacy so everyone in the building across the street could you inside your room. There were no sheers behind the drapes. The bathroom was OK, although there was no counter space to put your things on...so they had to be left on the top of the dresser in the room. Not very convenient to say the least. The toiletries were very small but replenished every day so that was OK.There was a Keurig coffee machine which was nice but no mini fridge to put anything in. You have to request one to be brought up in the room. The bed was OK as were the pillows. The room was very clean. If you are a light sleeper, you hear everything in the hallway. We were at the end of the corridor as far away from the elevators you can be and still heard them and all the doors opening/closing, not the best insulation. We had a room facing the front of the hotel on the 9th floor and could hear the cars honking & the trucks going by all night....a higher floor at the back of the hotel would be much better (we requested one upon check-in but were told that due to renos taking place there were none available).The service was very very good, nothing to complain about. They were very accomodating on all levels. Given the amount of money you spend per night, we expected a bit better given we've had better and in better locations in NY for the same price. That being said, if your business is taking place close by, you should be fine.

Hotel was very clean and nicely located away from the hustle and bustle of Time Square, yet close enough if wish to go there. the room was small, typical boutique, but was perfect because we spent little time there.Located in Chelsa, it is blocks away Flatiron and Eataly. The staff was courteous and it was very easy to find. This hotel is a steal when rates are low to midrange.Thanks.

My best friend and I had the most incredible stay at this hotel thanks to wonderful service from Marian, Zoribel, and Charles!! Looking forward to our next stay! This incredible staff will make your stay here truly a magical experience.

Nice hotel in a great, centralized location. Super friendly staff that helped make my birthday special. Got a room with a view of the Empire State Building! Regret that we only stayed the weekend. Wish it was longer!

Booked via Expedia and arrived at 9:30am in the morning - didn't expect for our room to be ready but it was clear that they had our booking and we left our cases there. After an exhausting day of sightseeing we arrived back at 7:30pm only to be told they were over booked ! Expedia eventually found us another (better) hotel (Innside) just a block away but we could have done without the hassle tired and jet lagged as we were! Watch out we were told they regularly overbook especially in summer.

Good quality hotel that gives great view of the Empire State - if you're on the right side! The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The Hotel is in a great position close to the attractions yet quite enough to enjoy. The roof top bar is a great escape looking right at the Empire State Building an absolutely amazing sight the first time you see it. Great staff, very attentive and helpful. Recommended
user_name:
Sussexwoman
Brighton and Hove, United Kingdom

review_body: I've been to this hotel with my husband sometimes and with my business partner sometimes and I'm always treated with respect, kindness and the staff are always professional. I've never had a bad experience. I love the rooms and love the view - either side. It works for me. But I have to give a shout-out to Zoribel Torres who works at the front desk. She is beyond wonderful and really goes the extra mile for me. I'm going to be sad when they someday promote her and I won't be seeing her anymore at the front desk. The Hilton is lucky to have her!

Check in and out, effortless, knew my preferences and made it easy for me to get on with my hectic activities - was very understanding on emergency change of plans. Staff was very interested in my comfort and their service. Thanks!

I visit Manhattan approx 5-6 times a year on business going back 7-8 years--and am a die hard hilton customer--this has been my goto hotel for awhile now...convienent location in Midtown..showed up on a cold day in March--boilers for heat/hot water out...got them going while I was trying to get a room card (had checked in online for check-in/digital key---digital key did not work--had to wade thru angry customers to get to front desk to get my room key--have a seat at the bar--ask to bill my tab to room--never an issue before--they want my drivers license to hold my tab--After verifying that I am staying--showed my room key as well--not acceptable--not leaving my DL with anyone--after that conversations--some of the worst service I have seen at the bat--left a full glass on the bar. i don't just post scathing reviews like this --but this is the most unwelcome I have felt at a Hilton location--ever. Will look elsewhere in NYC moving forward

I am excited to write this review. My stay at the Hilton was beyond perfect. A friend recommended this hotel to my husband and I and I was not disappointed at all. Upon check in, Sashika was a gem. Her quality of customer service made us feel cared for and valued as Hilton Members. She was informative, funny and very caring. Great characteristics for a manger. Throughout my stay she was attentive and fantastic. She accommodated my every request even when I didn't ask it of her. I will definitely be staying here again and it is because of Sashika. She is a ray of sunlight.

My second time back at this hotel and it was as good as the first. Roof top bar is a cool place, clean rooms, great staff, great location. Shasika was awesome just like our first time here. she helped me the last time around and was helpful on this second trip as well. she is truly an asset to your hotel. see ya next time.

Great location...not far from the Empire State Building!! Restaurant offers a tasty and wide variety of food. We ordered room service the first night we arrived as we were so tired from travelling and it was definitely the best I've ever tasted!! Rooms are spacious and clean. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Roof top bar offers amazing views of the hotels surroundings.

Had very high expectations for our stay at the Hilton but was surprised by how basic it felt, especially when compared to other leading hotel chains. Location is excellent - very close to Madison Square Garden. The staff are friendly and pleasant and the hotel is kept clean. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Basic hotel in excellent location. Not a property for Hilton Honors Diamond guest. Poor room choice, No lounge for Honors Guests. Room very small. TV reception interrupted numerous times with No Signal. Good for very basic in good location.

I have not yet stayed at this hotel but it's already been a nightmare. First, even calling to try to make my reservation a couple of months ago was a disaster. For some odd reason that I cannot comprehend, I couldn't get through. It was as if something was wrong with their phone system. I tried literally dozens of times to get through. I would have given up after just a couple of tries, but this was a reservation as part of a wedding block so I was feeling a bit committed to this hotel. Then I had problems with the block, such as availability (when we were still well within the window), pricing was off, and minimum nights stay was incorrect. Basically a disaster. Finally we got the reservation locked in, after a million calls and much wasted time. Then, nightmare part 2, which I'm still suffering through. My plans have changed and I need to change my arrival date. Over the past 2 days, I have been trying to contact the hotel at their main number and I literally cannot get through. Many many times, it has just rung and rung and rung and then I get a beeping noise and disconnected. Finally last night I was able to get in contact with someone at main guest services and tried to change my reservation. After 25 min of trying, they were unable to get into the system to change my reservation. They suggested I try back AGAIN this morning, which I did. So...again this morning I had to try several times to even get through. After getting through to someone at guest services, SAME THING. She was unable to change my reservation in the system. Said the reservation system was down. She also couldn't get through directly to the hotel, and SHE IS IN GUEST SERVICES!! Even she was blown away and couldn't understand what was going on. If it was just a one-off thing, I'd say whatever...the system goes down every now and then. But this - I have never seen anything like it. I do A LOT of travel for work, and have called hotels a million times. The difficulty I have had with this hotel has been unrivaled. I don't even want to call them again, but I'm forced because I need to change my reservation. Something is seriously wrong here. I hope once I get there, the hotel doesn't suck, but I'm so aggravated already and I haven't even gotten there yet. Not looking good. Good luck staying there if you can actually make an accurate reservation and get through to someone.

Visited early march with family, good hotel, friendly staff, great location, allowed us to check in early. Would recommend checking out Rare restaurant attached to the hotel, very good food. Rooms clean and comfy.

No complaints. I found the elevator bank confusing. 1 for bar, 1 for conference room, 2 regular were not marked. All in all, great experience. Ate at the restaurant several times and it was very good.
user_name:
cathy s
East Quogue, New York

review_body: The fire manager is very rude and rudeness is not acceptable by any one .... Period When a hotel has rude staff its should not get visitors to spend money with them !!! Dont waste your time to stay at this location
user_name:
DM0619
New York City, New York

review_body: Amazing Place in Chelsea This is like a gem in Manhattan. I love the clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, and not to mention the service. If you are ever in Chelsea, check this place out. The staff is amazing!!!!
user_name:
sm2016945
New York City, New York

review_body: THe hotel location is good. That's about all the good i can say about it. I did not have a good experience and neither did my family. Hotel not represented as it actually is. Lobby open to outside, staff unresponsive to requests for towels, lack of hot water. Food in dining room is good quality but is cold due to dining are open to outside temp due to construction. Promised rooms which it does not have. Concerns are not passed to senior management. sometimes very noisy during the night as party atmosphere is allowed in room adjoining families. Hotel is not as ads represent. I would NEVER stay there again.

Nick was great. Came and fixed our ac and tv. Our ac didn't work and tv had no sound but he came and fixed it. Real cool guy. The hotel overall is nice. Restaurant is good. Great location. Front desk staff was nice. Room was clean and comfortable.

It started off on a bad foot as the hotel said that they never received my reservation from booking.com. And since this is NYC, my original room selected was no longer available. Not only did this slow down the check-in process, but we were left with rooms on lower floors. The reception did provide us complimentary breakfast that was appreciated, but I would rather have had the rooms that the original reservation was made. There was also construction during the stay which triggered a fire alarm and evacuation of the hotel. The room was nice and clean and the design of the bathroom was nice.

I hate writing a bad review but this hotel needs to be bought into the 21st century! The Hilton chain loves brown decor, so 70s. When I checked in I had 2 cases plus hand luggage, I was not asked if I needed help with my bags plus had to struggle into the hotel from the taxi.The room is small and dull and sorry to say not well cleaned. Every day for two weeks I had dust on the tissue box in the bathroom and around the coffee making area just as one example. I didn't want to complain as I didn't want somebody to get into trouble! Some of the bedding had holes in it and the towels were hard.The Hilton group need to look at what Asian hotels do so well and look after their customers. The hotel isn't a cheap NYC hotel and we were there for 21 days! Our room was at the front of the hotel and the noise from the street (garbage collection) was excessive!The complementary water had to be collected at reception it was not placed in the room and WiFi was only complimentary if you are a Hilton Honors member.Now the good thing - room service was prompt and efficient with a good selection of food that was at a reasonable price.

Hotel location is very convenient,close to Subway and many tourist attractions. We got the room up on the 15th floor. Room was clean and spacious, bed was very comfy ( I slept like a baby ) and complimentary wifi. Would be nice if they had an ice machine and/or vending machine on each floor. Over all, I have no complaint since we were out all day and (almost) all night. I can only give 4 stars because when we checked out and wanted to leave bags at the reception, the staff (bellman) was very rude to us he didnt even bother to come help I was left standing for a long time and he also looked so pissed off to see we had 4 small backpacks. When we came back to get the bags I tipped him, guess what? all are good in the world again, he was all smiling and asking if we needed a cab. Unbelievable!

Staff is very pleasant and very responsive. I did not use many of the accommodations as I was very busy during my stay. Valet parking and regular parking are a bit pricey perhaps its expected based on the location. My room seemed a little cramped but was very nice.

There are many hotels in NY to stay in. We stayed here in particular because it was close to Time Square which is where an event was that we drove down for. We stayed here and payed extra for a room with a view and a roof top view of the city located at the roof top bar which says nothing about being closed on Saturdays or in the winter season nor to the fact that we would not even have access to that floor. These things were important to me because this was my friends first time in NY. The room was on the 17th in a corner no view, the room was ridiculously small, the office chair in the room looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months there were so many food crumbs inside the side cracks, there was construction above that started at 9 in the morning with spackeling and sanding then at 930 the smoke alarms go off. Let me remind you we were out all night the night before for an event and had every intention of sleeping as late as possible. The alarms were so loud because the room was so small we were forced to check out early at 930 and had to walk down 17 flights of steps because the alarms began giving my guest a panic attack. FYI the rooms are supposed to equipped with flashing smoke alarms for the Deaf and hard of hearing. Our room did not have a working alarm for someone with those limitations if it had one apt all.I doubt we would be staying at another Hilton when we come back in May

Decent hotel, didn't really stand out one way or the other. Carpeted room, I prefer hardwood or tile since it is much easier to keep clean. Tile in shower could have been cleaner, and one one morning, had to take a cold shower at 7:00. For some reason the water never warmed up. To be fair, I didn't notify the staff, as I had to get to the office, and it only happened once. Limited interaction with staff, but all interaction was positive. Provided bottled water at check in, however, no way to keep it cold, since the refrigerator is used for the honor bar.

Very clean hotel. Very helpful staff. The hotel is at center of walking distance to Madison square garden, Empire State Building, FIT, Chelsea market,... will stay here next visit if the price is right.

People in room next door were smoking pot and the hotel didn't make them stop just moved our rooms. At one in the morning. Not cool. My daughter and I checked in late on Friday, March 3rd. We were so tired. In the hall of the 5th floor, the location of our original room, there was a strong smell of pot. When we got to our room, we noticed that smoke was coming from under the door. The smell and smoke were terrible. I put a towel under the door to try and stop it. I could plainly hear the girl next door coughing and arguing with a man. My 17 year old daughter finally told me that we needed to call the front desk. I did and they sent "security" up to check it out. This amounted to a man knocking on their door asking them if they were smoking. The man next door said "Is there no smoking allowed?" (All through the closed door). The security man said that no, smoking wasn't permitted. The man in the room shouted that he was in the shower and to go away. The security guy left and the people next door sprayed cologne that smelled really bad in an effort to cover up the smell of pot. The front desk called and asked if I wanted them to spray neutralizer in the room and I said I would prefer to move rooms. Because of the late hour, we got moved but to a smaller, handicap accessible room with no counter space in the bathroom and a smaller bed. I was happy to move but when we got up early the next morning for her college visit, we were very tired.I was disappointed to know that when a guest breaks a hotel rule as well as the laws of New York State, absolutely nothing happens to them. We were inconvenienced and they got stoned. Somehow I failed to see this as equitable.

Loved the location being close to Times Square, Broadway and all center city activities. Plus it is near residential towers so there are plenty of off the track restaurants and bars nearby. Excellent services....nice view of the street and people.

Great hotel in a great location! Very clean and king size bed was very comfortable. Staff was helpful and friendly. Martha, Christine and Moses wonderful service! Offered to keep our bags after check out. Car was there on time to take us back to airport.

First and foremost, the folks who checked me in, were fabulous! I felt welcomed from the moment I walked in. I stay at many Hilton properties when in New York City for business, this was my first time at this location, and now my favorite! Marion and Charles, who work the front desk, recommended a great place for dinner and for dessert. They're recommendations were spot on and I was not disappointed. The location is great....close enough to Penn Station that I walked to hotel once my train arrived. There are plenty of great restaurants and bars close by. I walked outside at night, and felt very safe .

We are native New Yorkers who decided to stay in the big city after a Billy Joel concert. We checked in with Marian Rock....she was very pleasant, hospitable and knowledgeable. Her "welcoming way" set the stage for a comfortable, relaxing and pleasant stay. Altho' natives, we had a few questions about "after concert" venues. She was most helpful in sharing her expertise with us. Altho' our room was small, it was spotless and had ALL the amenities we needed.
user_name:
atengold
New York City, New York

review_body: I was pretty impressed with my stay here. It was my fourth visit to NYC, and I wanted to explore a little more of the "local" NYC rather than the touristy stuff, so I decided to head south of all the tourist traps but still be central enough to see it all. Hilton Fashion District was the perfect choice.A fresh feeling place that was clean and well appointed, I was lucky enough to score the high-floor room I'd requested, and had a great view of the Empire State Building. The room was small, but there was plenty of room for bags and to spread out comfortably. The wifi was fast, the room was clean, and satisfied all my needs. There was only a shower in the bathroom, rather than a bath, in following with the compact nature of the room, but this was also fine. The decor was a bit funky, and the view was suitably damped by block-out blinds so I could rest in the mornings after some very, very late NYC party nights!The hotel is in a great spot, being walking distance to Madison Square Gardens, and to Madison Square Park too. There are plenty of shops close by, and a good selection of bars and food spots just further up 26th past 6th Ave. The onsite bar and grill is also very good, certainly a step up from the usual middle-of-the-road type places you get in hotels, plus they have a rooftop bar too! The rooftop bar was cool, but you could only get snacks and the beer selection was a little small, but nonetheless, it's a great place to start the night. The hotel is also within walking distance (if you like walking) to the usual tourist spots around Times Square, Central Park, and in the other direction, Little Italy and the East Village are far but walkable (about 20 mins or so). So it's a perfect location!Staff were always very pleasant, and very willing to help with any needs (tickets, rides to the airport, requests, and the like). I was pretty pleased with my stay. The hotel is not a big flashy place like some of the other Hiltons, and the rooms are smaller, but it is still definitely worthy of the brand, and has a more local feel than a touristy feel. I'd stay here again, no question!

Positives:- Nice room decor & good amenities, excellent room heating, speedy elevator, powerful shower- Friendly front desk staff- Great location(We only stayed one day/one night)Negatives:- Room was a tad small

Was disappointed with this stay and the service. From lack of acknowledgement as a gold honors member to the false alarm in the middle of the night that the staff didn't bother to advise guests was a false alarm.

Not family friendly. Club atmosphere in the lobby as you have to weave through crowds of non-hotel guests and wait a long time for an elevator. No pride in exterior. Trash, litter clobbering the street and sidewalk. Moses was very professional and one of the only bright spots. Room rates exceed quality and experience. Do not recommend this location.

My first thing when I come to hotel of course like anyone else is price, the price was good, but most of all the cleanliness of the rooms. The hotel staff was also extremely friendly :) I have been coming here for YEARS and once again my first thing after price is cleanliness and this is the hotel, it is not very fancy, but as long as it is clean that is what matters to me :)

We stayed at the Hilton Fashion District NY on Feb 2017 and was extremely impressed with the service that Ms. Chavale Madison in the RARE restaurant gave us. As a manager myself, I noticed that she went out of her way to make sure her guests were taken care off and resolving any problems on hand. We had an incident happen in the restaurant and she was able to resolve immediately with her professional disposition and smile which showed through her attention to detail and communication. The restaurant is extremely lucky to have her as she shows real respect for her customerss. We visit the Hilton each year staying at the hotel. We hope to see her next year; however, she is so efficient in her position I'm sure she will be picked up by another establishment. I'm surprised that the Hilton hasn't given her a promotion as of yet, if not...they will lose someone with excellent customer service.Front Desk -- We had an incident happen early in the morning around 5am on Saturday with the bellhop pounding our door accidentally off course with a customer's suitcases with the trolley. My husband had to get up from bed and open the door to let the bellhop know that when he puts the suitcase on the trolley it hits the other room's door. I think it was just to close to the door for this to happen. We brought it to the attention to Sashika at the front desk, very pleasant individual and she fixed the problem immediately. That was really appreciated. We noticed that the hotel resolves problems and ensures that the customer is happy when they leave, which is smart as customers will return. This hotel definitely knows what CUSTOMER SERVICE means. These two individuals should be given praise for how they took care off us. We will definitely be back and hopefully Chavale and Sashika will be there for our next visit.

Used the Best Price Guarantee and got a great price for my 6 nights. Very happy with my room, 2004, that was very quiet. The breakfast was OK. Asked for a mini fridge for my room and got that. The room start to show some wear and tear, but nothing too bad yet.The premium Wi-Fi worked great. Missed some tv-channels (Foodnetwork and HGTV for example).Close to a lot of different subway stations. Overall, a very good location and I'll come back if the price is right.

Unless you need to be in this particular area I would not recommend this hotel. The room is very small even for New York. Very small closet. Giving it 3 stars because it was clean and had necessary amenities but hallway was narrow and not decorated at all. The room had no charm at all. Bed was comfortable and bathroom adequate. Not sure security was up to par even though you needed hotel key to operate elevators.

Clean, comfortable bed, easy walk from Penn Station. Restaurants nearby,. easy walk to several subway lines. Comfortable bed. Nice desk area and good TV. Elevators not overly busy. I would stay here again

After spending a significant amount of time looking for a good hotel in NYC, my partner and I chose to stay at the Hilton New York Fashion District. We were both very happy with the hotel.The location is excellent - just a short walk from the subway. The main attractions of Midtown are all accessible by foot - we walked to 5th Avenue and up to Times Square.The front desk staff were all helpful and friendly, on a day that it rained we were able to borrow an umbrella from the hotel.After reading many reviews, I expected the rooms to be small however I was very happy with the size of the room - with plenty of space to store luggage and for two people to move around in. Toiletries were replenished daily. I would suggest adding more wardrobe space in the room, the single closet was rather limited - and there is plenty of room to add another one next to the bathroom.The bed was comfortable and I was able to get a good night sleep for the 3 nights we stayed in the hotel. Being on the 19th floor, we didn't hear any traffic outside. And the additional perk is we had a clear view across to the Empire State Building from our room.The coffee machine worked great. The only thing I'd suggest is providing more coffee pods. We were given two regular coffee pods and two decaf. We didn't drink the decaf, but would've appreciated another two regular coffee pods. Although I'm sure if we had requested this at the hotel at the time, it wouldn't have been an issue.There is so much to do in NYC that we didn't get an opportunity to enjoy the rooftop bar - but it'll be something to add to the list when we return.Definitely book this hotel if you're looking for somewhere to stay in NYC.

This boutique hotel is comfortable, clean, and perfect for my frequent trips to NYC. The staff is friendly and helpful and security seemed good. I like this particular Hilton Hotel better than other Hilton Hotels I have stayed in (probably helped by being new, having opened in 2010).

Great staff. Fast elevators! Wonderful bar and restaurant! For me personally, the location is perfect and you can ALWAYS catch a cab out front! Experience the roof top bar, it seems to always be hopping!

This hotel is extremely well-staffed, comfortable, and wonderfully located. The hotel facilities are standard for large chain hotels--clean and functional. The hotel infrastructure is modern, so windows are quiet and plumbing works well. The staff sets this Hilton apart--everyone I encountered was super pleasant and helpful--they all appear to really enjoy their jobs. Housekeeping even left me an extra Keurig pod when they noticed I had used both the previous day. My only small piece of feedback is that the doors are a bit loud when they close--as with many hotels. I know they have to self-close but would be great if someone would invent the soft-close drawer equivalent for hotel rooms!

Wonderful staff, cheerful and super helpful. Giant snow storm and the young woman at reception directed me to get my snow boot near by. Saved my life.Lady at restaurant was incredible polite. So nice to see people like that in a big city. Carina the maid was super sweet. Beds were very confortable. Rooms are very nice and clean.I would stay there again anytime.Location is stellar.

Highly Recommended. Great Hotel Experience. Fantastic Staff. Excellent Food. Beautiful Lobby. Perfect Location. Ideal Room with amazing view. Easy to get to. Great value and room price. Love Hilton Honors Program.

We stayed here for four nights over new year. The hotel is ideally located on 26th Street, making it a 15-30 minute walk from most of the major sights to see in Manhattan. The rooms were small but wel designed and spotlessly clean. The check-in / check-out was seamless.There was also a restaurant at the hotel which offered good food at a reasonable price. One very small issue is that there were only 3 lifts to the main floors and at busy times you could be waiting for 3-4 minutes for a lift. Overall we would definitely recommend this hotel for a short break in New York.

Excellent service, comfortable room,good location for Manhattan visitor. I recommend this hotel for anyone that go to NY area. Guest service very quickly. The bar on the top of the building i like so much. Good prices.

We booked this Hilton for it's location and amazingly cheap rates and we were pleasantly surprised! It was a nice hotel, super nice people working there, great location, elevators worked very efficiently - great value!

Traveled to NYC for family visit, the location of Fashion District is great for visiting Chelsea area...Walking distance of Madison Square Garden Room and bathroom tidy but small but that's standard for any hotel room in NYC Staff attentive and approachable

Great location within walking distance to a lot of attractions. It was our first trip to NY and concierge were friendly and helpful. Like most NY hotels the rooms are small but had everything we needed and was clean and modern. Rooftop bar was a great place to have a drink after a day of sight seeing. would definitely recommend. Stayed in a high level room for 12 nights.

This is my second time to stay at this Hilton. It's perfectly located near FIT and within walking distance of everything on this end of the City. Staff of friendly and helpful. Rooms are current, clean and classically Hilton. If you frequent Hilton hotels, you'll feel right at home. While I didn't eat in the hotel restaurant on this stay, I have before and found it an excellent choice.

I have stayed in many Hiltons over the years and is my go to choice when traveling and looking for a moderate priced hotel. Rarely have I ever been disappointed and the Hilton New York Fashion District was a no exception. Overall the hotel is nice. Small rooms, tiny bathrooms. This is to be expected with NY Real Estate. RARE the restaurant and bar are wonderful.
user_name:
Travelguide13
New York City, New York
