review_body: We enjoyed our stay ~ the neighborhood is fun with a great Buffalo Exchange right down the street. The staff were very kind, bright & helpful. The bed was nice, so we slept well. The shower was nice, the hotel was clean.

The staff seemed new, they lacked warmth and personality and perhaps training. many other Hilton hotels the staff greet you especially if your are a points member. I arrived after 10pm to a quite reception, but there was a lack of staff, the following morning the main waitress at breakfast asked me twice if I had a voucher, odd.The room was small like many in NYC, the food was average as was the service.This was a business trip, I would not recommend for couples. The location is OK but in a business area so its noisy.

My husband and I spent New Year here and it was ok, pleasant. I expected more from a Hilton hotel but only felt average. The food was average too. The location was amazing, and it was very easy to get to everywhere. The lady at the tickets stall in the Lobby was amazing, she helped us locate tickets for a Broadway's show and we managed to get amazing seats - thank you! Considering we were out all day sight seeing, it was a good enough room to sleep in - not necessarily spend time in.

This Hilton is in a perfect location. Close to all of the major subway lines and walking distance from great restaurants. I stayed there last week and the room was clean with a comfortable bed. The front desk and breakfast staff were nice and helpful. I would stay here again.

Fashion Hilton is a great place. Close to Madison avenue, and Penn Station makes it ideal location. Rooftop bar in Summer is ideal. Room are clean, Staff is friendly. This is my preferred Hilton property in the area. Great food in restaurant also. Sometimes difficult to make a reservation due to high demand.

I would definitely choose this hotel again. Clean and friendly staff. Extremely accommodating. Great location within walking distance to shops and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

The outstanding feature of this hotel is its friendly and helpful staff. There is parking on the same block and it is easy to drive to. But, the main reason that I recommend this hotel is its great staff.

Hotel is very well located, near to Penn Station which was very convenient for us since took Amtrak to the city to visit with our son. We had stayed in the hotel once before when he was attending FIT and so thought of the hotel again. Our room was in the back of the building so we didn't have a view out the window, but since we weren't intending to spend very much time in the hotel, that was fine. Hotel staff was attentive to our needs, my husband likes the room cold so when we asked the front desk to take care of it, they did right away, same with the lock box when I couldn't get into it, they sent maintenance up right away. I'd stay in the hotel again, I think I would just ask for a room in the front the next time.

I only stayed one night here, but enjoyed my stay. The room was a good size for NYC and the bed was comfortable. The noise from outside wasn't too bad, as I was on a high floor - the noise between rooms was a little worse - but not totally out of the norm. I didn't interact with the staff much, but to the extent that I did, they were very pleasant and helpful. I really liked the location - close to Chelsea galleries and restaurants and the nearby subway made all other attractions easily accessible as well. I easily walked to Penn Station, with carry-on luggage, on my last day. The one design flaw was the light in the bathroom. It was on a motion sensor, so when I went in to the bathroom in the middle of the night, the light went on. Normally if I use the bathroom in the middle of the night, I won't turn on the light, as that more fully wakes me up and makes it harder for me to get back to sleep. It also took about 5 minutes after leaving the bathroom for the light to switch off. This pretty significantly impacted my sleep - but this might not be a huge issue for other people. Anyway, I enjoyed my stay, and would recommend the hotel to other people. I am sure there must be a way to rig the bathroom light situation! :)
user_name:
sdbt50
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It's NYC, so expect it to be a little raucous outside, but nearly every other element in this hotel worked perfectly for me. The elevators are fast, the room is just the right size and you could flush a Volkswagon down the toilet. Highly recommended. Don't forget to bring the Volkswagon. And a clock. They didn't have one of those.

Great price and great location. Within walking distance to Madison Square garden and Macy's. Good convemient places to eat. Would definitely stay again. Also drugstores and grocery stores close. Rooms were very nicely decorated.

The honest review is that the staff is great in this hotel and the location is good. There are lots of things that are walkable to this hotel. On the flip side the rooms are very small and you don't get much space around the bed, the HVAC was loud and smelled and the fridge had no space for you to chill anything...because it was a little vending machine that charged you if you touched it. So all in all it is a good place to sleep, but I would recommend a place with personality for the same money.

I had an amazing stay here. Nice rooms. Very friendly front desk. Very good breakfast. So if Chelsea is your neighborhood, this hotel is certainly a good option for you. Fast wifi. Some rooms overlook the Empire State Building.

Nice property, clean. Of course the rooms are on the smaller side but that is expected in New York City.The bed was was extremely comfortable and Peter Thomas Roth products are provided in the bathroom. A nice plus!

The staff was very nice; the rooms were small; extremely small bathroom, no counter space; no ice machines, had to ask room service for ice; limited choices of wine at the bar, ran out of Cabernet; didn't offer Cabernet at the rooftop bar.

If your not looking for ultimate luxury but want to come close- stay here. It is trendy yet quiet. It can be a quaint hotel for you or a fun party hotel. It is in a great location, close to the N and R so you can go downtown or uptown very easily. The staff is very helpful and accomodating. They seem to go out of their way for you which is nice.
user_name:
karen r
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is very nice. Modern decor. Very friendly welcoming staff. The rooms are average size for Manhattan. Beds are vey comfortable. There is a nice bar and restaurant in the hotel named Rare. Food was excellent. Hotel offers valet parking at $55 per day.

It was our first trip to New York during the last week in Sept 2016. We booked to stay in Hilton New York Fashion District for four nights and were fortunate enough to get a room on high floor. The room was quite big and comfortable. We had two double beds which were more than sufficient for all three of us. The staffs in the Reception and House Keeping were polite, nice and helpful. The Duty Manager was very nice and he permitted us to check in two hours earlier than the normal check in time and allowed us stay an hour later than the normal check out time. Room and baths were spotlessly clean and all the linen and bath towels changed daily. Rooms, cleanliness and services are second to none, excellent.We really enjoyed staying in the hotel because it is very conveniently located closer to places of interest. The Times Square, Penn Station, Madison Square garden, Broadway theatres and all famous shopping malls in 5th avenue and around are easily accessible by walking. The hotel room rate was cheap compared to the other hotels in the vicinity and we have no hesitation at all in recommending this hotel to our friends and family members who intend to visit New York in the future.

Efficient check-in and check-out. No surprises on bill. Room was bright, clean, and modern. Ample amenities. Good location for Chelsea attractions in that they are within walking distance. Penn Station and Madison Square Garden close as well.

Repeat customer at this hotel. Great value, great location, really nice Housekeeping staff, clean and well maintained rooms, and usually at a great price for NYC. DO check out the view from the rooftop bar.

This location was within walking distance of the conference I was attending. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The room was well maintained and the cleaning staff did an excellent job every day. It snowed while I was there and the staff kept the property safe and free of ice/snow hazards. I never had to wait a long time for an elevator and the halls were quiet. Loved the security! You had to have a room key to get on the elevator and onto a floor. Nice if you are a women traveling alone. Called downstairs for extra coffee and supplies and they were delivered to my room in less than 10 minutes. I would stay at this location again

For a NY hotel, price was very good, rooms were clean but very small. Staff was fine, and restaurant was really good. Had the Filet for $22, and it was one of the best I have had. I will definitely order it again on my next NY visit.

We stayed her on New Year's Eve for two nights. Was one of the cheapest hotels we could find for New Years. It was about a 10minute walk from Penn Station and a $10 cab ride near times square. Very clean and pretty spacious. Staff was very friendly. The restaurant downstairs was ok, not my favorite but convenient. Would definitely stay here again!

Not bad hotel, but not excellent as well. Typical New York hilton. Rooms are pretty small, no business lounge. Saw many hiltons that are much better... Located at Mid-Town not far from Times Square (about 15 mins walk).

I was booked to spend 3 nights at this property with my whole family over Thanksgiving for the Macy's Day Parade. This was a surprise for my wife's birthday. There were 3 couples, 3 rooms reserved for 3 nights. This was booked on line and we were all excited. Unfortunately a medical issue required me to cancel in July with cancellation confirmation# issued. In December I saw a no show charge on my credit card. I immediately called the hotel and the management said there was a 4th room reserved for one night that was not cancelled. What I said. Why would I book that? Long and short they said tough. No refund. Insane. I have stayed at 100's of Hilton properties and never been treated so rudely. Mark Hilton off future travel plans.

Great location, great staff, great accommodations Very gracious and courteous staff - knew my name Very secure - to board elevator, you need the room card WSJ and USA TODAY newspapers available daily Free Internet in the room worked very well Bottles of water free during stay

Well located in NYC, great value, rooms small but very modern and staff was excellent. Good, free business center off lobby. The staff was most helpful in securing cabs, and other issues. It was snowing and staff handled this well.

Quiet hotel, quite centrally located for accessing all touristy areas and nearby to subways. Disappointed that the Rooftop Bar, although advertised as being open, was not actually accessible to us. When asked, we were told that this was not owned by the Hotel. This was a feature we were looking forward to and relaxing in the evening over a few drinks after a day on our feet. We spent our evenings in the Crompton Alehouse directly across the road which was very friendly and inviting.

a sleep and go place, I stayed there for business, nothing special to remember, small and old fashion room with standard equipment: tv, coffee. place to be picked as a good deal, otherwise I would suggest to go a few blocks up

The hotel is fairly close to the center of city.They have kept it well maintained, clean, and quiet (back side of the Bldg).There is a great seafood restaurant at the hotel that serves food at the bar too.The staff are friendly and helpful.I enjoyed my stay.

This was my second time staying at this hotel & much like the first time, everything was great. When we got there our room was equipped with a shower only but my wife & I really wanted a bath tub, all we had to do was call down to the front desk & they had no problem switching us over to a room with a bath tub. They also sent up a mini fridge upon request. Overall, great experience & a great location. There are several restaurants within walking distance & Times Square is only about a 5-10 min drive away!

Only stayed here for a short night after a very delayed flight from Europe. Location is very good, right in the centre of things to do and see. Room was quite small and very basic but still pretty much okay. Small and basic lobby. I kind of felt that this property looked more like a Hilton Garden Inn than a Hilton. Sorry I did not have the time to experience the roof top bar. However, all in all this hotel offers good value for money and I would gladly stay here again. Recommended!

My family stayed at the Hilton in the Fashion District of New York for 5 nights. We had a great stay. The breakfast is excellent - the oatmeal, pork sausages and fresh fruit were the highlights. The room was clean and well taken care of. The room we stayed in had two beds - one was good the other not so good. We loved the care the staff put into our stay.

Have just spent 3 nights in the Hilton Fashion District. Quite a nice hotel. Great views of the empire state building & in the perfect location. Located on West 26th Street you're just 10 blocks from all the tourist attractions in mid town & just 10 blocks from the meat packing district if you're interested in going to some great bars & restaurants.Can't really think of anything negative to be honest, other than the beds are a bit too bouncy for my liking. If you're sleeping as a couple, if one person moves it often wakes the other up as the mattress bounces around so much.

would not go back or recommend this hotel to any of my family and friends. Especially during New Years. I am even embarrassed to say that we stayed there. Over priced for the boxed room we got. I m asking for a refund.

This hotel is in an amazing location, it's very central. The in house bar has a great drink selection, and great staff. My only suggestion would be to request a high level room. We were on the third floor and I quickly realized why they call New York the city that new sleeps.....

Sam provided great customer service. He was very knowledgeable regarding the hotels systems and reservations policies and was able to help clear up a computer discrepancy that took place between two competing reservation applications.

Stayed with my wife to spend last day of year 2016.The location was great. Close to stumptown coffee at Ace hotel, Eataly and Empire state building.Room was big enough for us in NYC standard. Very chic decoration with fashion related objects. We had breakfast buffet on the first floor which was nice. Various items to choose.Not disappointed.Very kindly staff as well.If I have to choose, I will stay again.

We went to NY for a quick trip. The room was adequate although my diamond status didn't get me any sort of upgrade, except a higher floor. View was nothing spectacular. The bed was comfy and the pillows were nice. The breakfast in the AM was in the restaurant on the property, although they did give you the option of getting a coupon for a local place.

This is my preferred Hilton in NYC whenever I travel there for business, partly because of its location and I have never had a bad experience staying there.This Hilton is great compared to those in mid towns because of a number of reasons:1. Mid-town is getting too crowded with tourist and traffic is usually bad there.2. There are more restaurant options for quick, delicious cheap meals and even takeaway.3. Whole food market is just around the corner, you can grab fruits, salad, ready made sushi, etc. Perfect for business travellers when you just want to grab something healthy and work from your room. The only advice I would give is to ask for room away from the road, traffic noise could be bad from room facing the front.

very clean , well kept rooms. great bargain for staying right in the middle of the city. i would totally stay again. views of empire state bldg from our room. breakfast restaurant was a little pricey, but so is everything in NYC.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hilton in the Fashion District of Manhattan for New Year's. The entire experience was wonderful. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. On the 12th floor, we were out of the way of the worst of the city noise. The online check-in was very easy to use and made arriving and leaving the hotel very easy. The staff was pleasant and helpful.
user_name:
megand440
New York City, United States

review_body: Very nice hotel, well priced for a Hilton Property, very clean, excellent bar and restaurant, wonderful accessible location. The staff were some of the friendliest we have encountered with Hilton. Highly recommend!!

The staff was always friendly when you walked into the hotel. They were also very accommodating when you called down to the lobby for something. Clean and comfortable rooms. Great restaurant for breakfast.

Hotel was very clean, All the staff were super. Disappointed that the Rooftop bar was not open - second time we have stayed here that it was not open with no explanation as to why it was not open. Restaurant food was delicious. Very quiet hotel.

We spent two nights in NYC for Christmas. Booked Hilton based on its trusted brand and our past great experience in SC and Jamaica. It turned out to be a huge disappointment.Arrived on Christmas Eve afternoon. Hotel lobby was decked out in full holiday festivity. Staffs were courteous and attentive. Room 901 was given. We were impressed upon entering our room. Spacious room. Everything seemed to be newly renovated and well kept. Even the tile grout in the bathroom were toothpaste white. Room was pin dropping quiet despite it’s right behind elevator shaft. Everything seemed to be perfect.We returned the room after a fun night and great feast in the city. Once we laid in the bed, it became one of those “WTH” moment. If blindfolded and not seeing all the nice details we had been seeing, we would think we were laying in a bed inside a cheap road side no brand no star motel. It sank, wobbled, and offered no support whatsoever. Besides its bed linens was clean and no signs of bed bugs, we don’t even have HALF of a good word about it. But it’s late and it’s Christmas Eve, so we took it all in and decided to rough it out for a night then deal with it next day.Woke up the next morning after a whole night of tossing and turning, I ended up with the worst back pain in years on Christmas. Before leaving the hotel, I went down and explained nicely about our mattress problem to a front desk staff. Staff was nice and sympathetic. She offered to change our room to 1701. We took her offer. Before leaving 901, I decided to take the bed linens off and take some photos of the mattress. Not too surprised, the mattress was deformed to a degree that should’ve never be seen in a hotel such as Hilton (or any hotel that charges $150+/night). It’s a disgraceful sight.Moved into 1701. Like 901, same clean, quiet, new room. But we got smart this time, so we lift the linens to check the mattress beneath it first. Same brand of mattress. Although it’s only slightly, the mattress is still deformed. Now, we were not that impressed anymore.Before leaving the hotel, I expressed my concern to the same front desk staff again. She promised they would have someone look into it and maybe fix it. Didn’t know how you can “fix” a deformed mattress besides switching it out, but we decided to leave it to the professionals and left the hotel. Because the pain was so bad, we made a trip to Flushing for back massage before we could even start feel like a person again.Returned to Hilton at night. Manager left a voicemail saying they had the mattress problem fixed. Out of curiosity, we lifted the bed linens again to see how they did it. Well, it’s the same mattress. So what’s the “fix” that the manager was talking about? Turned out, the “fix” was that they put a wood board in between the mattress and box spring (see photo).It proved that the “fix” didn’t fix anything at all next morning. We still woke up with back pain and feeling exhausted. Didn’t believe complaining it again to hotel staff would do any good, we simply checked out and left. It would be awhile for us to book another Hilton in the future.
user_name:
Max L
King of Prussia, Pennsylvania

review_body: Small boutique hotel. Room very small but clean. Hotel staff was great. Rooftop bar closed which was disappointing. They said because of holiday which was already over. Work out area small but ok. Bedding very comfortable.
user_name:
debmolly
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the Hilton fashion district over our Christmas vacation. Could not have been more happy! This was just what you would expect from a Hilton which is why we chose it in the first place. Fabulous location close to everything. Clean and updated. Would definitely stay here again!

We stayed here for a couples getaway. Reasonable priced for Manhattan. Loved that it was not infested with tourists. Quiet and calm. Close to subway. The rooftop bar had good drinks and amazing views. Good place for anyone looking to stay away from madness of times square.

This hotel and its staff were absolutely wonderful! So helpful and caring. Made our visit to New York just right. Nothing was a problem. Thank you all. Reception staff and room steward were all so good at looking after visitors.

This hotel is definitely starting to show its age. The furniture and carpet are worn out. The room had an odd smell. Unless you are getting a great deal there are better options in the area. The location is great and it is very easy to access the subway and major transit line from the hotel.

I stayed in this hotel December 15-19th, 2016.We checked in pretty late, around 11:30pm... check in was quick and friendly. We asked to get put in "the best room" ... and ended up getting a decent view on the 19th floor and could see the top of the Empire State!The room isn't huge, but it is very clean. Bed is very comfortable and so are pillows... my pillows suck at home so take that into consideration (but seriously, the pillows are good!) There is a Keurig Coffee machine in the room - so if you have some K-Cups at home, you can bring them with you and make your own coffee. There is also a mini-bar, with various odds and ends in it (for $$)Shower heats up FAST and has great pressure. Nice decor. There are various representations of thread spools everywhere (fashion district).Free standard WIFI for all guests for as many devices as you want. There is also a 24/7 fitness center on Level C-2. The fitness center has a few pieces of cardio equipment, dumbbells to ... I believe 30lbs and a free motion cable cross but only has one set of handles (no other implement attachments).Dunkin donuts is around the corner, a Duane Real Drug store is about .1 miles away. There are a number of breakfast stops around the area as well. There is a Laundromat across the street, so if you are say, stopping in NYC for 3-4 days and then off to EUROPE for a week - you could limit your clothing and wash/dry your clothes before you left to Europe. :) Macy's is just a few blocks away... Penn Station is about a 10 minute walk-ish.All in all - I liked this hotel. It's good, clean and was several hundred dollars cheaper than hotels in Times Square which wouldn't be as nice... a short walk or jump on the Metro ... and you're there!

Sammy, the manger, helped me book a room for my trip first trip to NY. He went above and beyond what I expected from a customer service standpoint. Sammy and the Hilton definitely made me feel like I've been a loyal customer for years. Excellent rooms and great facility.

We were surprised by the view of Empire State Building, 18th Floor was just great!I stayed in NY before and thought, that every Hotel is just basic but the Hilton proved me wrong. Chelsea is a nice neighborhood, a few minutes to Penn Station...great place.

The location of this hotel -- at first -- put me off, but I booked because I got a stellar rate the weekend before Christmas. Figured it was worth a shot, right?Truly - from arrival to departure, this Hilton property is the best in the City. Super clean. Efficient, friendly checkin. FREE holding of luggage after checkout (Hey - Doubletree Metropolitan - lookee here!!! A service that should be free is actually... FREE!). Excellent rooftop bar - but you have to go to the lobby to access the facility (it's the far-right elevator as you face the elevator bank). They shut down this elevator when the rooftop bar is open, so only two elevators service the remaining floors. When you leave the rooftop bar, tell the elevator operator to stop on your floor.We had checked in via the app for a front/corner room on the 7th floor, but it wasn't ready when we arrived, so the desk agent "upgraded" us to a king room on the 18th floor. She did warn us that it didn't have a street view. .We took it. It was BEHIND THE ELEVATORS which gave me great pause. However - we rarely heard elevator noise, we had a king bed, and we had a great view of the awesome NYC fire escapes. If we'd been a couple of floors higher we could have seen the Freedom Tower.Super clean room and THE most comfortable hotel bed we've ever had. Back to the location: on 26th, between 6th & 7th. Superb! Two blocks from two different subway lines. A fabulous HUGE grocery store around the corner. Whole Foods a block away. Duane Read a block east & north. Great pub across the street. Absolutely fantastic all the way around.I asked and got a fairly good answer about rooms that face the street, but I'm attaching a photo of the 18th floor plan so you can see room numbers/locations when you check in.We were in 1801.

Great location close to a couple of train stops and convenient to get around the city. Room was not very clean and someone had been smoking in it prior to our arrival. We had some requests that went ignored as well. Overall wasn't a bad stay but it wasn't great by any means.

Good location, very close to the metro station and Madison Square Garden. Small rooms though, old carpet on the hallway and an incredibly unprepared reception staff. At first, they couldn't seem to "find" my reservation, then they sent us to a room for 2 guests, when the room I booked was for 3 guests. Next time in NY, I will not stay at this hotel again.

Room was spacious enough for NYC, tidy, modern, good shower, location was excellent - a short walk from Penn Station. We did JFK -> Jamaica -> Penn. Took about 45 mins in all.Lovely welcome platter of cheese and wine as we were on our second honeymoon. Room was on 20th floor and had an amazing view of the Empire State Building.Within walking distance of Madison Square Garden, Times Square, Empire State, Rockefeller etc.Would definitely recommend.

Hilton New York Fashion District was a fabulous experience. The entire staff were so friendly & extremely helpful. Rooms were comfortable and most importantly clean. Fun restaurant w/ good food. Roof top bar area was cool. When I go back I will stay there again!!

The staff at this hotel went above and beyond to ensure my stay was memorable! The front desk staff was more than accommodating as I had a long day with many delays from the airport. My guest room, overlooking the Empire State Building, was such an amazing sight to come back to after a long day of work. The guest rooms were very clean & the housekeeping staff was great about brining me extra towels upon my request. I know there are lots of choices to stay at when I come into the city, however this is TRULY the best hotel!

I have stayed at this hotel multiple times and the staff is always great. The rooms are comfortable and most recently I was provided with a room that faced an interior courtyard so the outside noise level was minimal.

My husband’s employer booked our stay at this hotel. I found the location to be convenient to restaurants, shopping and metro stops. It is a short walk to Herald Square and Fifth Avenue. There is a restaurant/bar (Rare) on the ground floor and a rooftop bar. However, the rooftop bar was closed during our stay in December. Our room was small, but this is New York City and real estate space is prime! There were a few challenges I found with the room. The closet in our room was configured in a way that my dresses and our long coats could not hang without crumbling at the bottom. I had to improvise using the door security hooks and towel hooks in the bathroom. The lighting was not great for applying makeup. I was glad I traveled with a magnifying mirror with a suction cup as I could not get a close-up look in the mirror. I attached this travel to the bathroom wall under a ceiling light. Typically these items would not be an issue, but we were in town for corporate social engagements and not sightseeing. The room was nicely appointed, had plenty of electrical outlets and a coffee maker which are more of the deal breakers for me.One other item to mention-ice had to be ordered from room service. I had a frustrating search of the room looking for the ice bucket and finally phoned front desk to inquire about ice. They informed me that ice is ordered from room service and placed the order for me. Delivery of ice each night was impressively quick!I would be happy to stay here again. The minor inconveniences did not negatively impact our stay and we were able to find solutions to the hanging clothes and mirror issue. Hopefully, the hotel staff will read this feedback and look into better solutions for its guests.

I am a HIlton lady & this hotel treated me as such. From the moment I walked through the doors of this very elegant hotel I was treated like a queen. The staff rolled out the red carpet the room was beautiful & spacious. I can not wait to return to this hotel again. I didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel it's NYC after all. I appreciated the umbrella they had for me & my guest because it was raining that day. I was also given a bottle of red wine which I enjoyed as well.
user_name:
CyndieNYC726
New York City, New York

review_body: The property never fails to welcome me by name and make me feel welcome every time I enter the lobby. Even the restaurant hostess calls me by name. I am truly treated like a valued guest. The hotel has a modern vibe and is newly decorated. A definite recommend!
user_name:
William B
Louisville, KY, United States

review_body: Between the quality and location of this hotel, I will definitely stay here again and highly recommend it. The room was spotless, bed was extremely comfortable, bathroom large enough for two at the mirror, and it has a nice restaurant. It's very close to Penn Station and subways, as well as a short walk to Union Square where I had dinner. Broadway theaters are about 20 blocks away, so easily walkable for those who are able.

The hotel has a warm and friendly staff and a wonderful location. The breakfast was a great value and the internet was complimentary. The room was rather small and typical of most manhattan hotel rooms.

We stayed with my daughter and grand daughter to enjoy New York at Christmas and had a fabulous time. The Hotel was in a great location and Hilton delivered as usual The value at Hilton for helpfulness and friendliness is always there and they did not disappoint. We asked for late check out and this was not a problem. Would recommend this hotel to others.

Check in was a breeze - appreciated the quick service. Room was on the small-ish size (which is to be expected in NY). Beds / pillows were very comfortable. However, the a/c and heat in my room seemed to go from one extreme to the other all night. I was either too hot or too cold. Couldn't find a happy medium. Otherwise, this hotel was fine for a quick stay.

We're staying at the Hotel whilst visiting New York to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary. I have to say that the hotel is in a great location, our room is spacious & clean & the view from the Rooftop Bar is a must see at night. The staff are very attentive & helpful. They made our stay perfect. I'd certainly recommend this hotel.

We enjoyed our stay at this Hilton located in a great part of NY with lots of restaurants and bars nearby. You can walk to lots of great areas from here. The rooms were clean, quiet, and comfortable although slightly small (to be somewhat expected in NYC). We peaked in at the rooftop bar which had great views and a good atmosphere. I'd definitely stay here again!

High floor rooms offer great skyline views to the south, WiFi is OK and staff is very young but professional. Hilton continues to provide amenities only for one person in double rooms. Quiet and good location for the fashion district or the village.

This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and very happy with the accomendations and the staff. This time I was not happy with the restaurant, the food and service was okay but the problem was my bill came to 10.15 and I gave the server a 20 and she gave me 9.00 back when I ask for the change I was told they round to the nearest dollor, there is notification of this procedure and the server should of given me back 10.00 not 9.00. I went to the front desk of the hotel and they quickly went to the restaurant and resolved my issue.

Good location with restaurants, bars, pharmacy and whole foods nearby. Staff were professional. Otherwise the room was a little dated but ok. View was nice, although a bit obscured by a water tower. All in all there were no serious issues and I had a pleasant stay.

I like everything.The location is good. The staff were great and helpful The room is not big but for Manhattan its good and anyway its not small.the Wifi is free and very goodthe room is modern and i find every thing i need.there is a minibar but you can not use it to cool your things but it possible to get a small refrigerator without any charge. behind the corner of 7th Ave there is a great and big super market with fresh and also organic products.the parking is expensive like everywhere in Manhattan but usually they are fast for Manhattan hotelsI stayed for 4 nights the price changed every day between 150 - 350$ per night. the 5th night i moved because the price was more than 500$ per night

You cannot beat this hotel for location, cost, and staff....excellent each and everyone. Room was spacious and clean. The reception staff were engaging and professional. Would highly recommend staying here.

Was a difficult stay. First day, early AM, water (probably gray) ran down the wall and over floor and night stand, edge of bed. No other rooms available. Gave us breakfast, 3+ hr wait for room. Tried to get some sleep as appointments afternoon evening. No room cleaning until third day as slept to 10. On fourth day, ate breakfast, back to get bags and check out-room was locked. Our keys not work. Took time to get in and get this straightened out. All together a real bummer

Great location and value. Close proximity to the parade. Staff was outstanding as well. Very helpful with info on how to get to places. Rooftop bar was a good place to unwind after a day out in the city.

I had a very pleasant stay here for my birthday weekend. The hotel was exceptionally clean, and the staff was completely accommodating. Rooms were very large given its NYC and everything was in good condition. Most attractions are within a reasonable walking distance and would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here from 20th November till 23rd November , staff were helpful and friendly , especially when our shuttle company had put our pick up down for the wrong day , the staff were so helpful, they contacted and arranged a private taxi to pick us up within 10 minutes, so we could get to the airport on time to get our flight back to the uk . The hotel is in walking distance of many places to visit , i would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Before starting, I should mention that this two night stay was a prize from a Hilton competition. I don't believe that has effected my review, but it should be noted.Firstly, location. It is very close to many things. I was attending a show at Madison Square Garden, which was just a short walk away. Many other places, like Times Square, Empire State Building and the High Line are also an easy walk away.If going further afield then there are also subway stations nearby.The hotel itself was very nice. My room was comfortable and the breakfast was good. Due to honors level, I got a continental breakfast included and this can be upgraded to an excellent full buffet for a reasonable fee. I tried both and they were good.I also had lunch in the restaurant one day and it was pretty good as well.The rooftop bar was quite nice. It is a little bit of a pain to get there, having to go down to the lobby and then present ID to be allowed into the lift up to the top. Nothing major, but it did feel a little awkward.Overall, I had a great stay. The location alone means I am likely to return in the future.

Loved the location of this hotel however, please note that there is no microwave offered in the room. We were also a bit disappointed that the roof top bar closed at 9pm. We would definately consider this location again for the purposes of 5th Ave shopping and events at Madison Square.

Hotel is nicely located and is clean and exclusive though rates are a little high. You need to make sure you know about the hidden fees for your hotel bill and to get a clear understanding of the price for your room.

Recently visited for a four night stay, room was clean and staff at reception were great. We were on a higher floor so the noise wasn't too bad and we also had a great view of the empire state. It is a short walk from the subway but nothing unmanageable.
user_location: East Riding of Yorkshire, United Kingdom
user_name:
ILHowarth
East Riding of Yorkshire, United Kingdom

review_body: Good hotel but nothing special. Rooftop bar was closed Monday and Tuesday. They offer breakfast (for Gold customer, skip the vouchers for the nearby shop) but there are so many good diners in the city. Rooms are ok, clean. I was in the upper floor. The gym is very, very small with no windows (the manager told me about an option with a gym around the corner, maybe next time). Hotel is a good location if you have seen the city already and want to explore midtown or downtown. There are many small restaurants and bars (Flat Iron room if you are after something special) in the area.

Well I don't usually give a terrible review about Hilton chain however I have not much to say about this stay and experience at the Hotel, from Check in to Check out the staff have been absolutely appauling, rude and no help at all. Everything is too much trouble. Rooms very small and dark no more than 2 people in a room and one bag fit into the room. So when I come back NYC this will not be the hotel of choice. Please consider before booking at this Hotel if more than a party of one.

This was my second stay at a Hilton property. The staff is friendly, courteous, and professional. Our room smelled fresh and the bathroom was clean and upscale. The accommodations were nice. We look forward to our next stay.

We stayed here for Thanksgiving while visiting family in the city. It is simply a well run clean and quiet place in the middle of town. The room was average size for the city but very adequate. the staff was friendly and helpful and the price was right. Good place to stay.

Our luggage that we checked on day of departure was left on a dolly unattended and when we went to pick it up no one even noticed us taking the bags. Also had to ask for enough towels for people every day.

Great experience in the heart of the city. Very accommodating staff helping us check-in early and check-out late. They made navigating the city great as well with help on transportation and advice for walking.

I travel to NYC to attend trainings/workshops and yoga classes at Yoga Shanti. The location of this Hilton is perfect! Not far from train station- Eataly- yoga studio and shopping:) Easy to valet park as well!

The hotel is in a great location. Staff is friendly. Rooms are big and for being in the city, it was quiet at night. The restaurant was ok but there are many within walking distance. You are convenient located to any type of transportation and can get just about anywhere. convenient for business on the fashion district.

Love the location. Great service ... friendly staff. This property has a terrific roof top bar that serves great drinks and appetizers. The views are beautiful. This is definately our favorite place to stay.

I normally travel on business to New York a couple of times a month. This is the first time we stay at the Hilton Fashion District, and it really was a great experience. Not only it's close to our clients, but it also offers a lot of cool features, like the rooftop bar, the Rare restaurant among others. We will certainly include the Hilton in our plans in the near future!

I enjoyed the property very much. A great location, nice room and the staff was terrific. I also had breakfast in the restaurant and enjoyed it as well. I had no complaints and would stay there again.

I've stayed at Hilton Fashion district several times. While I'll also consider other hotels in the city, this one is my go to hotel. The front desk staff is always welcoming and very efficient. The rooms are clean and modern. The restaurant downstairs is very convenient and has good food and service. But there are many many other dining options within walking distance. The 1 train is just 2 blocks away. Thanks Mily

Great location for a bit less noise and sweet ambience. Room was NYC tiny but covered off on all the basics. Two very minor complaints - adjoining room allowed me to hear early morning call of my neighbor and bathroom vanity left little room for personals. Otherwise great spot at a decent price. Lyft promptly picked up and I got around town to various meetings quickly.

As usual, the stuff is kind and available, the property is really nice and in a terrific location, far enough from the crazyness of midtown, close to the multitude of restaurants and shops in chelsea, and within reach of the Village as well. The hotel has a very nice and welcoming rooftop bar. I am a diamond member and was upgraded to a room on the 16th floor, definitely much larger than the average room you can expect in manhattan, and very clean too. Only disappointment in the room was the very small closet entirely taken over by the safe and the ironing board. We used the hotel restaurant for breakfast, which is ok, although not exceptional. Staff is very welcoming and quick though, which makes it a perfect solution if one is looking for a fast breakfast on their way to work.

I've stayed at the Hilton Fashion District several times since it opened in 2010. But my last stay was at least three years ago. I like the hotel's central midtown location--near trains, away from Times Square, walking distance from many neighborhoods. The hotel was never luxury but always a solid 4-star stay for the price. Unfortunately, the hotel has slipped and is on the down slide toward shabby in several respects. The overall cleanliness of the room was acceptable (no bugs, clean sheets and towels, basically clean bathroom), but not up to the standard that I prefer. I was not happy with the grout, which is definitely starting to look grimy. Wood throughout the room was scratched up (furniture, headboard, bathroom vanity). The bottom of our window curtain was dirty, lamp shades looked a bit dusty. Our a/c unit was loud and did not turn on and off properly with the thermostat. Since I've stayed here many times, I knew as soon as I walked into the room that no updates have been made. While the bed sheets were clean, the pillows did not smell fresh.It's still okay in a pinch. For whatever reason, the NY hotel availability was very tight for the dates of my last stay and prices were very elevated. I managed to find a good rate on Hilton.com and because I was very familiar with this property, I went for it and crossed my fingers that things had been well maintained. I was disappointed but not so much that it ruined my time in NYC. But I travel to NY frequently, and have stayed at numerous hotels in the city that have been fabulous. There is too much competition for the Hilton to just let this property languish and expect people to return. Many of the problems I encountered are easy fixes.I am a Hilton Honors member. I did not like being solicited by a Vacation Club representative during my stay.

My wife and I spent the weekend there. Right near the corner of 7th Avenue so convenient for subway and cabs and easy walk to various attractions. Great rooftop bar with fantastic view. Room was very clean and comfortable (but could use more/better lighting). Valet parking is nice, but you have to call at least 30 minutes in advance when you leave so plan accordingly.

This area is expensive and you get very small rooms for the same amount. And that is where this hotel is better than others. Good sized room for the same amount that you would pay elsewhere.Plus, the location is perfect. Walkable distance from times square, Penn station, and Chelsea.Rooms are good but do not offer a good view. Rooms have a coffee maker where only coffee/tea with hotel supplied packages can be made. (You cannot make coffee/tea with tea bags etc.). A minus point for people like me who drink green tea etc. The minibar can dispense bottles and cannot be put back so think twice before experimenting. minibar cannot be used as a refrigerator.Bathrooms are spacious. Service is excellent!! I stayed for two weeks and they met all my demands with a smile. Food: Rare is the only restaurant in the hotel so not too many options. But there is plethora of restaurants around. To sum up: Horribly expensive per se but worth it considering the others in the area are as or more expensive.

Really enjoyed our stay here we were close to so much and not in all the hustle and bustle of Time Square. In walking distance to great Resturaunts and shopping. The only downfall is there are no ice machines - we had to order from the front desk and it took a little bit to get it.

This hotel is a bit smaller than I was expecting - only 8 or so rooms on each floor - but was very well maintained, and staff very helpful. Breakfast was nice (down one floor) and the rooftop bar is gorgeous with a view overlooking the Empire State building.

I really was not expecting the amazing experience I had recently at this hotel. It's a beautiful hotel, but more importantly the staff was amazing, especially Sami the Front Desk Director. He was attentive and very helpful; he went above and beyond what was necessary which is what really stood out to us. Thanks to Sami we ended up eating at the hotel restaurant, Rare, and as a die hard foodie I have to say I was extremely satisfied. The burgers were delicious, but my favorite was the french fry tasting basket. Three different types of fries (sweet potato, hand cut and cottage) with 3 different types of sauce. Pure heaven! With so many options in NY I can honestly say I'd still come back to this hotel!
user_name:
chanceuxj
New York City, New York

review_body: First I must say that every staff member that I communicated with was extremely knowledgeable and accommodating. Thank you all! The rooms are modern, clean and quite comfortable. The rooftop bar is a nice added amenity. The hotel location is in Midtown, a few blocks from Penn Station, with lots of interesting shopping and dining. This was my second stay there and I have already booked a future visit! A special shout out to Marian and Sam....thanks for being so efficient!

We highly recommend the Hilton Fashion District. Customer service from front desk, house keeping, restaurant staff is fantastic. Don't be fooled be the "Fashion District" location and think you will experience some expectation of needing to fit that demographic. These people are so nice and accommodating. I recommend the higher floor Empire State Building views. They are stunning.

Stayed one night for a business trip. Front desk was accommodated my request for a quiet room facing the back. The room was clean and comfortable. Room size is small but adequate for one person. Would be 5 stars except for two issues:* Walls are extremely thin. Person in next room took an early AM shower and it sounded as if I was there too* Bathroom uses a sensor to turn light off. It has a manual control but was broken so could not stop the auto on providing far too much light in the dead of night.Otherwise, a good place to stay.

Very nice stay at this hotel! Clean, comfortable room, larger than we expected for the location. Very quiet room on the 3rd floor. Staff was very pleasant and accommodating when my 2 year old got into the minibar.

No better place to stay than the Hilton NY fashion district hotel! This was my 6 time with them and you can't go wrong! First off the rooms are nice and the views can't be beat! You are so close to subways but also there are so many amazing places that are just blocks away! The best part about this hotel is the customer service. Everyone is so friendly and accommodating! Especially Christine, Martha, Zoribel, Mariana, Jhon, and Angel! Always with a smile and always greeted me with my name! I never wanted for anything. You truly won't go wrong with this hotel!

I loved my tiny little room with a big view in a great part of the city. Hotel location makes easy access to all parts of town. Walk to the Flatiron, SoHo, the Village, Penn Station, Times Square...etc 2 blocks from the flower market....tons of restaurants, bars, laundry, Whole Foods, coffee, etc etc..and of course the subway.
user_name:
Audrey F
Santa Monica, United States

review_body: We were in town to cheer on friends running the NYC marathon. This hotel was such a pleasnt surprise. The woman who checked us in was so friendly and efficient, in fact the staff were across the board, amazing. The roof top bar was great, with wonderful views. The rooms were so much bigger than I was expecting. We were in a room 906 and it was a Street facing room, if you use the AC/heater or a white noise app it is enough to drown out any noise from the street- really not much of a concern at all. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean and the hotel location is perfect for getting out and about!! Would highly recommend!

We live in NYC and wanted a night away from our kids. This was perfect. Reasonable pricing, comfortable, great service. And right off 5th Ave in a cool neighborhood surrounded by great restaurants and my favorite park - Madison Sq Park! We will come back.
user_name:
franceso655
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel in a great location. Very clean, comfy bed, and good size room. It's unfortunate that the windows don't provide any sound insulation. At one point I got out of bed to check if the window was closed (which it was). We were on the 16th floor but might as well have been on the first.

Staff were helpful and everything was clean, however rooms are small and you can hear noise from adjacent rooms and from the street. I stay in NYC frequently so I'm aware there can often be street noise but the sound insulation seemed poor.

Nothing to complain about but also nothing exceptional. There is no common area except for a rather depressing restaurant on the ground floor and basement which is large and very empty so not much ambiance.The rooftop bar is great though.I would not hurry to return..... it on the other hand the hotels in NYC are very expensive so maybe this is a good find. I have not been enough to comment.Staff very helpful

The Hilton Fashion District is in a Pleasant, safe location in Manhattan.We walked around quite a bit and always felt safe. It is on 26th Street and 7th ave. 5 blocks from Penn Station. and 16 blocks from Times Square. It is close to a Subway stop. We liked it because it is not in the crazy part of Manahttan (42nd Street) but close enough to get there quickly. The hotel is clean as you would expect from a Hilton. It was not cheap but it was good. Nice bar on top of the building and a nice restaurant. The people were very nice, especially Moises and Santiago- the guys in front of the hotel who help with bags and getting you taxis.

Great location ., great staff., great value for NYC.. Near Highline .. Midtown and great restaurants .. Would stay again .. Comfortable beds and great coffee machines in room .. Friendly helpful staff

The standard of this Hilton is high and the staff are universally pleasant and responsive. The immediate area is not the nicest in the world, but a great location for where I needed to be in terms of work. Easy to get both Uptown and Downtown from here, too, and very close to the theatre district.

This hotel was such a pleasant surprise. We stayed here for 4 nights last week. I have visited New York before and was keen to find a hotel away from the really hectic tourist areas, but still close to everything. This was perfect for that.Staff were so friendly on check in. It was late and we were tired but felt really welcomed. I had emailed ahead to say we were celebrating my fiancee's birthday on this trip and they even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine to take to our room. Nice touch.Having read some reviews on here for this hotel, I was also expecting wifi to be at an extra charge, but was delighted when they said this was free. It also worked well in our room and we were able to connect two devices without issue.We ordered room service on our first morning and portion sizes were good and the food was very fresh. Yes, it was on the expensive side but we needed something quick and convenient and it did the job. Only two (minor) negative points. Hot water was turned off for some essential maintenance on our first day from 9-5. This was communicated by a letter left in our room, but it would have perhaps been nice if this was mentioned when we checked in the night before. No biggie though. Also we were on the 10th floor and did experience quite a bit of street noise, but this is New York after all and we were still able to get some great sleep in an extremely comfortable bed! Would definitely recommend.

Hilton NY Fashion District is a delightful little property tucked into the fashion district. The staff was SUPER welcoming, friendly, helpful, responsive, etc. They are all pretty young, so there is a little bit of a casual feel...so they seem free to be "real people". Everyone from the GM, Yaniv, the assistant front office manager Skylar....down to the housekeepers and security guards...were just wonderful, like a family (granted I did stay there for a couple of weeks). The rooms are small, but clean and modern....view from my bed was the Empire State Building....especially beautiful lit up at night. Shower is a tiny bit small, but the water pressure was AMAZING. The only thing that could use improvement in the room is it could use some more lights at night.Location is FANTASTIC. You can walk 2 blocks to the subway, a couple of blocks to the Flatiron building and EATALLY and Madison Sq Park (home of the original Shake Shack) You are really in the center of the city, you can walk anywhere.....a few blocks to Penn Station, 34th St shopping, 5th Ave, Soho, Greenwich Village.... Whole Foods is 2 blocks away, as is the Flower District...on 28th between 6th & 7th...and there are numerous coffee shops, Starbucks and independents, bars, bodegas, restaurants, shoe makers, laundry, etc, etc.......a very vibrant part of town.

The staff at the hotel was very welcoming, and the room was more than adequate. The bed comfortable, the room was clean, and the amenities were A+. My only negative was the limited channels of TV available (it was a very rainy, windy 4 days we were there and we stayed in more than we usually would).

Arrived here after being in Washington. Narrow hotel and room small but clean and staff were very friendly. The only disappointing thing about the hotel was it has a roof top bar which we didn't visit as it is strictly over 21 year olds and we had a 16 year old with us who you would not leave in a room on their own in New York. If this had been advertised we would have been geared up for it rather than being disappointed

Everything is all wonderful here as long as you don't stay on a floor near the top where it can get somewhat loud from the music and socializing in the evening from the bar. Other than that every amenity that I needed I found here. Very close to Madison square garden that I needed to attend. Breakfast was good downstairs before I checked out. Facility was very clean.

I started staying at this hotel back in 2012 and enjoyed my stays there through 2014. I returned there at the end of 2015 and had a really bad experience. The room we were assigned was in the most deplorable condition than I have experienced at any hotel. We were moved to another room that was not much better ( it was dirty with a scratched up vanity and head board). I have never seen a scratched head board. In inquiring about the change in quality of this hotel, a waiter at the hotel advised that there way a change in ownership. Nevertheless, this should not affect the quality of a hotel. Sadly, we have now lost what used to be our go to hotel in NYC.

My wife and I visited our daughter at FIT then caught the 1 train to 42nd street to see a play. Perfect location to so many things in NYC. Does Hilton mail me free drink coupons for this review? How about a free breakfast coupon for my next visit? Just give me one. My wife doesn't need to know. I mean if you guys have two great but if not, it will be our secret.

It's not often that I've found an affordable hotel in the city, let alone a hotel I really liked. This Hilton ticked both boxes. I didn't get to the Hilton until about 10pm, and all I was really after was comfort and quiet. I got both. I had a room on the 21st floor with an awesome view, and I didn't get any street noise before 8am, and even then it was minimal. I'd say the room was above average size for NY and the bathroom was really big. The location is very central so you can come in to Penn Station and get to this hotel (or anywhere in NY) easily. With the value, room quality, and friendly staff, this Hilton is definitely a keeper.

I stayed in this hotel while sightseeing with my daughter who was in from out of town. The rooms were a little small but that's where any negativity ends. They were clean, the beds were fine, the staff was super; friendly, courteous, professional. This hotel was located on West 26th between 6th and 7th not far from Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, the Empire State Building. Plenty of restaurants nearby including right on 26th! I'd definitely stay again.
user_name:
Robert M
Suffolk County, NY, United States

review_body: Nice hotel! Clean, comfortable bed and nice shower! The rooftop bar was fun as well! Great location next to Penn Station. Would have liked turn down service. We did not have fresh towels in the morning.

Well positioned, pleasant hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. Easy walkinto central New York. Great roof Bar. Lots of Good restaurants nearby. Will most definitely stay at this hotel again when visiting New York again.

Being a HiltonHonors member has it's perks. I was traveling to NYC overnight and I have never stayed in this part of the city before. So I went through with booking it and got a discount because of the HH program. The day before check-in Hilton sent me a link to electronically check in to my hotel room. With that, you can choose exactly which room you would like. I chose the highest floor and it did not disappoint. Once I got to the hotel and approached the concierge they thanked me for being a member and they gave me the keys to my room. The room was on the 22nd floor and the view was amazing. The room was really modern and very clean and comfy. After check out the next day, I was reminded on Facebook to leave a review following my recent check in here. I then left a review in which the Hilton page commented on it and thanked me once again for being a member. Then a few days later I received a personal email form the hotel manager herself thanking me for the lovely review and really making me feel appreciated. This will be my go-to hotel for staying in NYC from now on. This hotel has been my best Hilton experience ever!!

Got it on Hotel-Tonight for a bargain price for one night. Everything was clean and comfortable. Concierge service was helpful. The location is perfect in midtown with subway stations very near. Receptionists were very nice and didn't charge us for a little mini bar mistake (it's automatic, and charges right when you take something out).Would definitely be glad to come back.

This hotel was the icing on the cake for a girls weekend getaway. Our flight was 76.00 r/t and the Hilton is always a good deal. The lobby was warm and stylish. The front desk staff were welcoming and accommodating. Our rooms were clean, modern and had ample space for 3 guest. The room service was fast and friendly. We visited the rooftop and took in the beautiful of the city before heading out for the evening. I only missed the perks of staying on the Executive floors offered at most other Hiltons. Overall, our stay was fantastic!

Stayed here for 3 nights with the family, took 2 rooms, adjacent. Asked for an upgrade to a higher floor with a view of Empire State, said none was available. Staff very friendly and accommodating, helpful with directions and recommendations of restaurants (we were looking for a good pizza place). The rooms were average by NY standards, very simply decorated. We went up to the Roof Bar, nice views, bar food and drinks, pretty good. We also tried RARE their restaurant, for lunch, the food was very good, but it took a long time to get the food. We weren't in a hurry so that was not a big deal, but we were the only ones in the restaurant, wonder why it took so long (20 minutes for a couple of burgers, some fries and a salad). Bathrooms unfortunately was filthy, in fact, toilet was backed up and on the verge of overflowing. Reported it, not sure if someone took care of it right away. All in all, we liked the location very much, away from the noise/lights/people of Time Square, but walking distance to subway stops and Penn Station, also within walking range to Time Square, and easy walk to the High Line, which of course was wonderful, and a nice Sunday stroll to the Whitney Museum, at the end of High Line. We will stay again next time we go to NYC.

My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights recently. This is a modern hotel with descent sized rooms that appear to have been recently updated. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They switched my room to accommodate early check in. The lobby is quite small and is very crowded at peak times. The hotel restaurant "RARE" is only OK.

Enjoyed staying here. Previously I've stayed in midtown and uptown, but I really liked staying a bit closer to Chelsea. The hotel is conveniently located - a short walk from Times Square, Penn Station (good for us since we took the train), and Chelsea. As a rewards member I got 2 free bottles of water at check-in which was nice. Hilton has stepped up their game - I got to check-in online the day before and could select my room. I could even have ordered drinks and snacks to be ready on arrival! We had a King room on the 12th floor. I noticed many guests are saying rooms are small. Maybe they haven't stayed in NYC much, but these rooms are very good sized for NYC and the bathroom was HUGE! We were on the street side and it was a bit noisy with horns, but it's NYC so to be expected. This is a solid conveniently located choice for a hotel.
user_name:
skaballet
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The room block was reserved at the hotel by the bride and groom. It was perfectly adequate, but not special. Morning breakfast in the hotel restaurant was delicious. I found the room and feel of the hotel rather claustrophobic, however staff was considerate and the in house dining was very nice.

Overall we had a very good experience. There was a flood on one of the floors above us and it knocked out the tv cable service for our entire stay. The hotel allowed for a 25% cut on our daily room rate.

Stayed with friends in September for three nights. The rooms are clean, functional and well located in NYC. I would be happy to return. The roof top bar was tremendous with great views of the city. Breakfast was included but we were also given vouchers for a cafe around the corner - in fact we were told that this was a better option than eating at the hotel which proved to be correct.We stayed on the night of the bombing in NYC and the roads were blocked off by police around the hotel so it was extremely difficult to return to our room that night. Of course this was not the hotels fault and the police were doing a great job. On reflection, however, we had no communication from management regarding the bombings or any safety procedures that we should follow.

New York is expensive and busy right, but hey that's part of the deal!Very handy to shopping, dinning and subways to every which way, this little gem is on the cheaper end of the good hotels. The staff are super friendly to us out-of-towners and nothing is too much trouble.If you don't like the horns, pay a bit extra and go for an upper floor.Rooms are small

Pretty standard Hilton property. I had no real issues with it but it also didn't excel in any areas. 2 bottles of water in arrival for Hilton honors members is nice, but why not place them in the room? Why make me carry them up with all my other luggage? Rooms are small but that is standard for Manhattan. Some peeling wallpaper, leaky shower door, and one day there was no hot water in shower, but other than that no issues.

First rate hospitality from the staff, and in particular General Manager, Yaniv, and Asst Front Office Manager Skylar. On our first morning I was downstairs asking for good coffee shop recommendations, and Yaniv did not verbally give directions, but walked with me outside the hotel and around the block to show me the way to the coffee shop around the corner. Upon finding out we were in NYC to celebrate my girlfriends birthday, Yaniv made sure to have a bottle of wine and chocolate sent to the room that evening. There was an issue with the TV's being out on Friday night and Saturday apparently due to a busted pipe in the hotel. The staff did everything to accommodate the inconvenience and offered a credit to the restaurant in the hotel, which I felt was more than fair. Yaniv, Skylar, and the rest of the staff at the hotel were extremely personable and insured that the next time I'm planning a trip to the city, this hotel will be at the top of my list.

This was my first visit to this hotel and I was extremely satisfied. The front desk staff is excellent and ready to help always with a smile. the room was very comfortable and perfect size for a solo traveler or a couple.

My parents are staying at the Hilton Fashion District next weekend, where my mother will be celebrating her birthday. I called to buy a gift basket for the hotel to surprise my mom with. Sam at the front desk arranged for a complimentary basket of wine and chocolates to be sent to the room AND upgraded their room free of charge. Some of the best service I have ever received!

This hotel was a great place to stay on our long week-end to NY. The location was ideal to places we were going to see. We had a upgrade to high level,which was really good to eliminate street sound.The room seemed larger than most which was a nice surprise. The shower was the best I had in any Hotel. Had a wonderful stay,thanks to Skylar who really made our stay so easy. He is a real asset to this hotel. The Rare Restaurant in the hotel was great and convenient. The buffet had a nice selection of breakfast items. Coffee was wonderful. Could not have asked for more.

We booked two rooms for a three night family mini-vacation that could not have been better! First and foremost (o.k.... second only to the great staff and unbelievably helpful assistant front office manager, Skylar!) ... this hotel has the hands down BEST SHOWER in New York City!! OMG.... after 9 hours of walking around the city, doing all the things that tourists do, coming back to the room to a hot, full force shower was such a gift!! Our room was spacious by NYC standards (300 sq. foot King) with plenty of room to unpack and settle in. It was great to have fresh brewed coffee first thing in the morning without having to leave the room, and then not having to leave the hotel to hunt for a place to have a really good breakfast was perfect.... the buffet at Rare, just downstairs, was great.Skylar was so very helpful in getting us booked and making sure everything was as we needed it (high floor, rooms just down the hall from one another, fridge for medications... you name it, he made it happen!). The entire front desk staff (it didn't matter who you spoke to, they were great) helped us work out the best way to get around the city on any given day.... subway and/or taxi/ and/or walk.... and each suggestion was spot on! We were lucky to have perfect weather, but the hotel you choose can make or break a visit to the big apple, and we chose wisely. Thank you SO much Skylar for all your help in making our stay just perfect!!
user_name:
B C
Miller Place, New York

review_body: Excellent hotel with an attentive and friendly staff. Room service was great...you must get the Greek Salad with the Lamb Chops! Great value for the money in a prime NYC location. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.
user_name:
Diane H
Asbury Park, United States

review_body: Service, when used, was fine. The rooftop bar was a major disappointment. You'll love the rooftop bar if your idea of a good experience is a loud techno party with poorly made overpriced drinks and limited views. Rooms were small like the rest of NY hotels. Location was good in Chelsea but doubt I would stay here again. Too many better options to choose from.

My husband and I checked into this hotel for our anniversary on a Saturday night. As soon as we walked to the front desk we received a wonderful welcome and they even gave us a bag of two bottled water. For my husband that was a plus because we usually have to buy bottled water whenever we stay out. After walking into our room we saw such a sweet and caring surprise, we mentioned when booked the hotel that it was our Anniversary and Sami from the front desk was kind enough to remember and leave us a note thanking us for choosing their hotel and also bottle of champagne. Small details like that makes a huge difference when staying at a hotel and we lucky enough to stay at such a friendly hotel. Usually this doesn't happen in an NYC hotel. We would know we've stayed at a couple of hotels in the city. Our room was a really decent size over looking the Empire State Building which was beautiful during the sunset. The best part of the stay for me was there bed. OMG the best sleep of our lives we did not want to get out of bed. I'm not sure if it was the comforter or the pillows or the mattress but whatever there secret was believe me it works! I would come back just to be able to sleep on that bed again. The combination of everything worked so perfectly. Again we loved this hotel for the amazing service and overall the quality of there products. Sami I thank you and your entire front desk staff again, keep up the great work! Thank you for a great stay!

I convinced two other friends to also book rooms in this hotel for the weekend of Oct. 14th and 15th 2016. I'm sorry I did. No TV or cable service in all three rooms for the entire stay in 3 rooms. Staff was helpful but still could not solve the TV problem.

Stayed for 2 nights (1st part of US/Canada visit) in September 2016 and was primarily chosen as I am an HHoners member. Location is fine, with choice of 3 subway lines within close proximity. Reception staff were friendly and gave us a room on the 22nd floor with view of Empire State Building. Room was a bit on the small size, but nicely decorated and adequate for the limited time we spent in it. Lovely large bed and super comfy. Had dinner in the Rare restaurant on the 1st night, but slightly disappointed. It was ok but nothing wonderful, so we wandered out and about for our other meals.

This hotel is a great location for a weekend getaway. It is within walking distance to the flatiron area for shopping. The high line Chelsea Market, and the Whitney are within walking distance. The subway is close by to travel as well.

I must say the room was ok, comfortable and clean, the hot water for showers and sinks was scolding hot, now I don't understand why the billing is so out of whack here, I prepaid room but when checked in they charged me again, they did fix the mistake but I'm still currently waiting for the hold to come off my CC account.. the front desk agents were not super happy to be there working, I was shocked there was never a door man or bellman during my 3 day stay..

We stayed in this hotel mainly because I'm a Hilton Honours member but we weren't disappointed. The hotel was clean with friendly staff, our room was plenty big enough, the little fitness room was well equipped and the hotel was well located for all the main attractions; walking distance from Times Square and very close to a subway station for everything else.

I contacted the hotel about a couple of minor things before our stay, by phone and email, and got immediate and great service. Then at checkin I also had an issue that was handled VERY well (i.e. I saved a lot of money) in no time! Thanks for all the great service!The facility itself is fine, not special - rooms are bigger than what's typical for NYC. The location is great. But it's the service that makes me want to come back next time I'm in the city. Thank you!

I spent 5 nights here in Oct. Have stayed here before as well. Good location away from midtown if like me you've had it with fighting off the Times Square tourists. Smallish but adequate clean functional rooms albeit a bit dark. Plusses were a bureau with drawers ( becoming a rare thing in smaller rooms) and easily accessible electric outlets. Internet works fine. Biggest complaint was the TV . Very limited channel selection and terrible interface with a remote control that has seen way too many hands on it to not be replaced NOW. Last night of my stay the TV was out due altogether as was the wireless. Compensation offered was 5,000 Hilton points. Not adequate Nice willing staff, good bar area. All in all I recommend it but those TV's really need a tech and channel update

The staff at the Hilton Fashion District NYC did an outstanding job of looking after us while staying with them. The hotel is clean, friendly, and well run. Suggest you stay here whenever your travels take you to mid-town manhattan.

I visited this Hilton last month (finally getting around to writing about it!) and the hotel is really nice. Lobby and rooms are clean and the front desk staff was super helpful, especially Sami! We had dinner at Rare the restaurant on site and really enjoyed it! The burgers were delicious and the drinks were strong! Definitely try the "Pearsuation" (I hope that's spelled correctly) if you get a chance! We also made a pit stop at the rooftop bar and the DJ was playing the perfect old school jams (90's pop and hip hop at the time) Will definitely come back!

In chelsea so easy to get to midtown or downtown. Great staff restaurant is good, small almost boutique hotel experience but a Hilton. Stay there a lot for business and have stayed in several properties in the area this one is my favorite.

Came here for my birthday for just the 1 night and it was very nice. No complaints. Everyone was friendly and I'm happy they allowed us to check in earlier than should have. Didn't like how much the drinks at the bar were, but it's New York City, I guess that's expected. And wished that the rooftop bar was open later.

Stayed 5 night for business.Service was ok. Fast check out etc.Some misunderstandings in roomservice.Breakfast buffet was not very well prepared (dry eggs, rock hard bacon etc).Room was average, nothing that stand out, no design. Pick a room on high floor to avoid traffic noise and to get some view.Coffemaker in room was a nice feature.The rooftop bar was closed /booked all nights.Location ok but not very exciting, close to Penn station from Newark.Next time I would pick a hotel with better rating on TripAdvisor, this one was around place 150 when I (my employer) booked.

I stayed here for business. The staff members were very courteous, friendly, and knowledgeable, from the front desk upon check-in to the restaurant. The restaurant was good for hamburgers (unique and scrumptious offerings here); not so much for breakfast items, although a buffet was offered. Those items were standard fare, and not very tasty. The rooms were clean and comfortable but small. The location was excellent for me, as I was attending a meeting a few doors down for 2 days. It poured rain the 2nd day, and the front desk offered the use of umbrellas. That was important for me as I did not have mine!!

Stayed here three nights. The staff are great, but the hotel itself comes across as budget. The rooms are very basic. The bathroom has a light sensor which comes on/goes off to save electric which is quite novel, but isn't so good when you are actually taking a shower! We felt uncomfortable when partaking in buffet breakfast (The buffet is in a different room to where you are dining) and someone stands there watching what you select each day. The hotel rooftop bar is worth a visit.

I looked at many options for NYC hotels for a weekend stay and found that this one was very reasonably priced. The hotel was very clean and we had a nice size room. The staff was very friendly and the location was great! I would definitely go back and recommend to a friend.

Our stay would have been very nice, but two exceptional Hilton employees, Sashika and Skylar, made it unforgettable. Sashika took care of a special request, prior to arriving and Skylar make us feel welcome and gave us great advice about a lunch option and the breakfast options at the hotel.

The hotel concierge, Aliyyah, was TERRIFIC! She went out of her way to ensure that I always got the directions I needed. Most professional, thoughtful, and a breath of fresh air! I depended on her for alot and she always came through!

The customer service was excellent. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel & room was extremely clean. Which is important to me being raised by military parents. The night time view from our room and the roof top bar is amazing. It definitely sums up ur daily visit in New York.
user_name:
Michilli Aontra... W
New Orleans, Louisiana

review_body: I choose this hotel when I travel to NY for work on Amtrak. You can get off at Penn Station and walk to this hotel in less than ten minutes. Always clean, bright and safe.
