Rooms are extremely small!!! Rooftop bar offers great views, but mediocre food and cocktails. Basement steak restaurant was disappointing for breakfast. Overall a great location if you're coming from Penn Station.
user_name:
breaellis
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Did a 2 night weekday stay here recently and was very pleased. The location is great and rooftop bar and view was awesome. The front desk staff was very accommodating. Lots of food and drink locations close. The room was nice, clean and bed was comfy. Gym was ok not great. I stayed on the 19th floor with great view of Empire State Building. I would stay on the higher floors if possible for the view.

It was so nice to be greeted with a smile by Christine after the long drive up from VA. She was really wonderful and I believed it when she told my wife and I to call if there was anything at all we needed. Everything else in the hotel was great too. Room was clean and good sized for NYC. Lots of subway stops nearby, union square is a quick walk away, etc. Great stay in a nice hotel with wonderful staff!
user_name:
Jake B
Virginia Beach, United States

review_body: The location is incredibly convenient for pretty much anywhere you might be going, the rooms are small by outside NYC standards, but good sized for Manhattan at a really great rate. They were clean, had plenty of outlets and good wifi signal. The bathroom was smaller than I would have liked, but again you just expect that in New York. I only stayed one night so I can't speak to the restaurant or rooftop bar, but they looked nice.
user_name:
Amy H
New York City, New York

review_body: Loved our stay. The Hilton was perfect. Front desk accommodated every request fully. Nice neighborhood was friendly. New York welcomed our California with open arms. Elevators were quick, Bellhops were very efficient when hailing cabs for guests.

This hotel takes all the stress out of finding a place in NYC. Good price, interesting décor, clean rooms and staff that treat you like you are a special guest! So comfortable and casual. No matter who I talked to, I got assistance and attention right away. Perfect location in a quiet area near trendy neighborhoods like Soho and Greenwich village but still close to times Square and Theatre. I never thought much about the fashion district but twice I have enjoyed FREE exhibits at Fashion Institute museum ,practically right next door! I was happy to see Skylar, the assistant front office manager again and if I could I would give him a raise for his attention and kindness.Extra bonus is being only a few blocks from Kleinfelds (as in Say Yes to the dress!) if you need to choose a Wedding gown or return for a fitting!

We stayed here for one night recently. Even though we booked only the day before, we found the rate to be fair for a NYC hotel. While the rooms are small, they are well laid out and very comfortable. The beds were nice and the bathroom had nice shower with great water pressure. Only thing that we would've liked in the room is a small refrigerator. We stayed when it was over 100 degrees out and the A/C worked very well and kept the room cool. Our room was right near the elevator but was nice and quiet. The location of this hotel is perfect. It was a quick walk from Penn Station and in a very nice area. We had no problem grabbing a cab right outside to get to our dinner reservation. Our only issue was that our room was ready late..more than an hour after check in time and there is really not anywhere in the small lobby to wait so we were back out in the heat to kill time. They did store our bag for us so that was convenient. All staff we encountered were very nice and professional. We would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
NYFLORIDIAN
New York City, New York

review_body: A really good experience that my wife and I feel is the style of New York today. The staff were well trained and very helpful and the location was perfect. Certainly this will be a facility we will consider for our future trips

I have stayed at this hotel a number of times for business purposes and it always provides a great experience and if there is an issue the staff always seems more than happy to fix it. It is in a great part of the city and very convenient to many restaurants. It is situated between 6th and 7th streets and is always easy to catch a cab if you aren't in the mood for walking. The rooms are a nice size, especially for a big city, I have always had a room with a King Bed so I can't comment on rooms with other size beds. The bed is comfortable and the rooms are nicely appointed, however they can be a bit dark even with all the lights on in the room. The bathroom is of adequate size and I have only ever had a room with a shower so I am unsure if they have rooms with bathtubs. The bathroom is nicely appointed with light tile and a bright light. If you are sensitive to noise or light I would recommend asking for a room on a high floor or on the back of the hotel. The back of the hotel is close to another building which appears to be office space. The front of the building faces 26th street so if you are on a lower floor the traffic noise and garbage trucks in the morning can be a bit annoying.

Great stay! Neat, tidy and a great location for my appointments. I was in for the New York Table Top Show. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. I have repeatedly stayed here and always am happy with the experience.
user_name:
Vicki Y
San Diego, United States

review_body: We walked over to hotel from Penn Station, after arriving on red-eye flight.The hotel has nice curb appeal and the lobby is snug and comfortable. Way too early for checking the front desk staff took the lead by confirming our echeckin, storing our bags, assisting with breakfast options and contacted me by phone informing me our room was ready.We head up to our room and it was equal to the guest service. The spaces are snug, hey...it's NYC, but comfortable, well appointed and clean.The beds were crazy-comfortable and the bathroom was clean and good size. Even on a high floor the water pressure in the shower will knock your toupee off! Also, the location was amazing...I walked to most of my planned destinations. So, if you realize Hilton is a great brand, you like location, service, facility and comfortable experience...this is the place for you! Oh yeah, rooftop bar is a huge bonus!Join HHONORS and book direct, too!

Our one night stay in New York City found us very warmly welcomed at this Hilton hotel.Conveniently situated in the fashion district on 26th street, attentive service and a kind staff enhanced our stay.We were enroute to France for three weeks and will stay at the hotel on our return. What we wanted was a clean, quiet hotel. What we got was that and more - including bag storage and a comfortable town car to JFK. This was handled on the spot by the Front Desk.We would highly recommend this Hilton for ant New York visit.

I had to make changes in my reservation and Sam, the front desk manager, was very helpful in taking care of my case. Hilton Hotels continue to be my go-to hotel when I am travelling, especially for business.

We had a function in Manhattan this past weekend and had to book a room and so it was a no brainer that I called this Hilton hotel. We have stayed here before and I have to say that this place rocks! From the minute we arrived, I receive a very warm welcome with a huge smile, AND a greeting from one of the many front desk people, her name is Sashika, that said, "Welcome back Wendy, we're so glad to see you again"! She actually remembered me AND my first name. That was impressive by itself. The rooms at this hotel may be a tad smaller than an average hotel room but I have to say, for a New York hotel room, the size is perfect. I've also been to Boutique hotels where the rooms are only as big as the BEDS in the rooms, NOT so with this hotel. There's plenty of room to walk in the room and the rooms are handsomely decorated, believe me, I'm very picky about how a room looks in a hotel. We were on the 20th floor and our view looked out onto the Empire State Building and had a really nice citiscape view. The beds in the rooms are totally comfortable. I melt into their mattress and I always sleep well when I'm here. The three best things that I love in these rooms are the shower, the air conditioning and the Keurig Coffee Machine. The bathroom has been totally renovated and it has the most wonderful shower with clear glass doors, (at least mine did) very modern looking with marble. As far as the air conditioning is, I can't think of another hotel that has an air conditioner that works so freaking well that we always freeze in the room, because it works so well that we wind up making it a little warmer in the room. How many hotels do you know that the air is nice and cold the minute you walk into the room, this is during the summer months (and September) that I am referring to. And, how many hotels GIVE you a Keurig Coffee Maker IN YOUR ROOM? HELLO???? We enjoyed going up to the rooftop where there is a trendy bar and they make "mean" drinks there! Yummy!!! It gets very crowded (that's a good thing) so I recommend going up a little early to obtain seating. The service that the front desk provides,(I dealt with Sashika most of the time) is nothing short of a FOUR STAR hotel, I'm not kidding. They are at your service all of the time, and with a great big smile! Whenever I came downstairs into the lobby, Sashika was right there and would always ask me how I was doing and if there was anything that I needed. All of the front desk people were all trained very well in my opinion, which is probably a reflection on the management of the hotel. Sashika engaged with me throughout my stay, not just when I first arrived. Another person who I have dealt with in the past, and this last booking, who definitely deserves mentioning is Skylar. He is extremely professional and he really takes the "edge" off of making a reservation at a hotel and takes care of all of the other minutia for me. I just love pretty much everything about this place, trust me, I'm not an easy person to please but, hands down, you definitely get a bang for your buck here, make no mistake, just book it, you will wonder why you never booked here before...

This was a very pleasant experience, with great location, friendly and helpful staff and better than average room. Not spacious, but not the usual cracker box. I would suggest that you try to get a room not facing the street. This spot on 26th has a lot of night deliveries and it can be noisy. Easy walk to Empire State Bldg, all the activities at Madison Park and other spots to visit. For business travelers, there is always a cab handy and the wifi is good. See my review for "Rare", the onsite restaurant. It's good.

Overall my stay was pleasant. Very friendly staff and decent gym. Nice room, however quite small, although that is what should be expected at a New York hotel. Location is nice if you are not interested in staying in the touristy area, but want to be nearby.

A very serviceable hotel in a great location. Service was very good. In general the hotel works well. There is a bar and restaurant with a rooftop bar as well. The staff made every effort to be helpful. The rooms were clean but small. TV and Internet could be better.

A very chic hotel but unfortunately in a somewhat smelly area of the city. And no breakfast at this cost? Not the best value really. Otherwise a very nice room, bar, restaurant and roof bar, when you are allowed to go into it.

This hotel as an excellent location on corner 26th street and 7th Avenue, Easy to walk to all major areas time square / broadway 15 minutes away. but this area is a lot quieter away from hustle and bustle. Less than 5 minutes to 28th street subway station. We had an 11h floor room at front of hotel no problem with noise at night.Staff all very friendly and professional. Let them book you taxi back to Airports cheaper than Yellow cab and a lot more comfortable. This was the weekend of the bombings in chelsea, so took the gleam of our stay but not the hotels fault. The restaurant attached to the hotel is call Rare and produced an excellent steak at reasonable costs. the roof top bar had fantastic views but drinks were over priced 2 beers and 1 vodka over $40 with tip.I would highly recommend staying here if you want a central location and clean comfortable room away from all noise and lights of Times Square. Free internet was provided by hotel fast enough to surf and receive emails nice little bonus

First, let me say the hotel itself is great. Well located and decent size rooms for NYC. However, due to the events on Saturday night, the area around the hotel was blocked and I could not get back to my room. I know that was beyond Hilton's control, however, the hotel made no effort to help me find other accommodations. After many calls to the front desk who didn't seem interested in helping I was transferred to the main Hilton reservation line who told me that the computers were down and my best bet was to walk to the Hilton or Hampton Inn in Times Square and hope they had rooms. So at 2am, I did just that and they did not have any rooms. I finally managed to get a hold of a friend willing to let me sleep on their couch at 3am. I am disappointed that as a guest, Hilton was not more helpful making sure that I wasn't wandering around a crime scene at 2am trying to find a place to sleep.

I have stayed at this hotel a number if times now and have NEVER been disappointed. In fact, each time i stay there the staff exceeds my high expectations. Mily, Jhon,Martha, Christine and Skylar are standouts but everyone there is professional, efficient, accommodating, helpful, cheerful and go over and above what you want good staff to be.When issues arise , and let's be honest, they arise everywhere, the staff here deal with them prompt;y and to your satisfaction. That is good service! The hotel is just a few years old so all the rooms are in excellent shape and the amenities couldn't be better. Beautiful showers and bathrooms, fluffy towels, THE most comfortable beds, in-room safes that work, excellent wifi and the food at Rare, the restaurant is outstanding. The Vegetable Meltsation is a must to have for dinner.And, I love that the hotel is in a neighborhood and not a tourist section like Times Square. Macy's is 8 short blocks away, subways are 2 blocks away, Sunac on 6th is a great place for breakfast and VERY reasonable OR wander to Las Maison de Macaron on 23rd between 6th and 7th for he best French pastries in NYC.Rooms are quiet and cozy (as are all hotel rooms in NYC and in other large cities.)The Hilton New York Fashion District is THE best value for the money and I wouldn't waste my money on something "cheaper" - unless you like scratchy towels, surly staff, tiny bathrooms, wifi you have to renew everyday, a location far from any subways, in-room safes that take ages to figure out how to work, slow elevators, noisy neighbours and disappointing food - if these cheaper options appeal to you, then you have plenty of hotels to choose from in NYC, but the Hilton New York Fashion District isn't one of them!

Stayed here to access the high line. Was close to where the bomb went off 9/16. Hotel was good with info. Really made us feel better. Found some decent places to eat nearby. Loved the high line. Close to theatre district & shopping

Really cool place in the Fashion District between 6th and 7th Avenues. Plenty of cool eateries around the area and easy to get around town from the hotel. Rooms are nice and up to Hilton standards. Staff is awesome. Mily, Martha and Skyler were super helpful and very friendly. In fact, all the staff was nice and always greeted you with a smile and hello. The only downside is that the rooftop bar is a bit confusing to get to. You have to go down to the lobby and switch elevators. That's a minor complaint though.

Check in was smooth, the guy at the desk knew how many nights we were staying as soon as I gave him our name.Room was clean and nice, except we asked for 2 additional pillows the night we checked in on 9/8. We went to Ground Zero at 9am on the 9th. Got back to the room at 3:45 pm and much to our dismay, not only weren't the pillows there, but the room hadn't been cleaned. I called downstairs and the girl told they "have " until 6pm to clean the room. I told them that was completely unacceptable to me. They still had 4 pillows when I stopped at the desk before going to a show. When we came back...the were 8 pillows??? Somebody either can't count or doesn't pay attention.The last thing that REALLY pissed me off was when we left I asked the bellman for a cab to the airport which having come from JFK on the way in, knew was a flat fare of $61. He sells me on a private driver and tells us the fare is $68 ALL IN, including any taxes, tolls, and tip if I pay cash, $73 if I use a credit card. Since we wouldv't tipped the driver, it sounded about the same, so we chose that route. Guy drives us there in a Camry, speaks no English at all. I give him $68 cash for the ride, and he tells me it DOESN'T INCLUDE THE TOLL. I told him Hilton said it did.....and he gets all pissed off, basically throws my luggage on the curb, and slams the door!!I think you need to do a way better job giving your customers accurate info and knowing who you are referring your guests to. It left a real bad taste in my mouth, and its not the $8...I soent $2500 in the city all in for 3 nights...its the principle!!I doubt I would stay there again and Im a HH Gold member. Went to Embassy Suites Centennial Park in Atlanta the next day...and it was seamless:)

With so many places to chose from in NY, it was a relief to know that we decided on the right place. Not sure where to begin.... Well for starters the staff at the hotel were friendly, professional and very courteous. The room was a nice size, very immaculate, and well appointed. I'm normally not a thrilled with the soaps provided in the hotels, but their body soap was amazing! The locations was perfect for us, and close to all the things we needed -- TJMaxx, Marshalls, flower shop, pizza shops and great bars. Its also close to many city attractions, like the Flat Iron building, 42nd street and the Empire State building. So the biggest surprise to us was their fantastic rooftop bar and their restaurant called "Rare" on the main level. The rooftop bar was incredible and offered spectacular reviews. The restaurant/bar on the main level "Rare" was amazing too. Again, amazing staff, drinks and food. After a couple of days of running around the city, it was such a pleasure to have "From Scratch Daily" chicken soup and a sparkling wine. Just thrilled with this place. So much so, I had to thank the folks at the front desk before I left. If I'm ever in a need of a hotel in NYC again, that will be the place.

Staff was extremely hepful. They went out their way to help my wife, who is disabled. Food service was also first class. Room was small but what we expected for mid town Manhattan. Overall great experience.

The Hilton Fashion District was a great choice for our Labor Day trip to the city! The rooms were average size for NY, small, but functional. I never felt cramped. The location of this hotel is what is sells it! While in the middle of things, it was so quiet. There is a train station on 28th and 7th, so it was just quick 2 blocks to catch the train. There is a Duane Reade about a block away for anything you might need. The beds were heavenly after a long day of walking through the city! The bathroom was spacious, as well. I would highly recommend this hotel if you looking for a nice, affordable hotel with a great location!

It's about what you would expect from a mid-level chain in Manhattan. Rooms are clean, but very small. Closet could hang four items, so don't plan on spending more time than that. Also, bugs in the bar.

Tiny room but clean. The kicker is the service; Sashkia is amazing. She went out of her way to take care of us and ensure we had a great stay. I truly felt like an asset to the hotel. Very professional.

We chose this hotel for the view from the rooftop. It was a Thursday night that we tried to go to the rooftop to find out that they closed it early due to being a slow night. Very disappointed the rooftop was closed. The room was very clean. The bartender at the bar off the lobby was very polite.

Average hotel, annoying bed covers, expensive drink prices. The location is great, with lots within walking distance. We had to change rooms due to the first one stinking of smoke. OK hotel if you can get a cheap deal.

The location of the hotel is very good. You are close enough to 5th avenue, times square, Empire State Building, the flat iron building, subway stations, lots of places for breakfast, dinner, markets (on the fashion ave). The whole food market is on the corner. The hotel itself is good. The room was clean and spacious. There might be 2 disadvantages about this hotel - there is a night bar in the hotel and sometimes it might be noisy in the night and the other is that it's very cold in the hotel. Even if you turn off the AC in your own room it's still cold :) Outside temperature was about 30-33 C and in the hotel was about 16-18 C. After all we are happy with the hotel and we can recommend it.

I visited this property back in May of this year. My family and I stayed here again for Labor Day weekend for the US OPEN tennis tournament. I must say, this place is the only place I will stay when visiting NYC. I called a couple days before my family and I arrived to speak with the front desk representative, Christine. Surprisingly, she remembered me and even remembered my room number I stayed in in May. She is a gem and such a pleasant person to interact with. I had three rooms booked and wanted to make sure all three rooms weren't side by side. I was traveling with my mom, dad and aunt. I love them dearly, but did not want them right next door. Christine, told me not to worry and that she would make sure the rooms aren't adjoining. I also asked for all three rooms to have a street view. She obliged and went as far as to upgrade our rooms without me asking her to and doing it for the same price as our original room. Her customer service skills are unparalleled. My parents had a GREAT time at the roof top bar and they couldn't stop talking about the breath taking views from the roof top bar. Whenever I needed additional towels, someone was knocking at the door within minutes delivering them. There are plenty taxis in front of the hotel. We chose to use Uber as the taxis were a bit more expensive. There is a 24 hour CVS right up the street and lots of places to eat in close proximity. If you're looking for a nice, clean , spacious room with some of the most pleasant people at the front desk, then look no further than this property. My pleasant experiences with the staff at this hotel will keep me coming back to this Hilton for as long as I visit NYC.

The hotel was easy to find and clean. The gym was small but that's my only complaint. The rooftop bar is awesome and the watermelon mojito is great! Worth the $15! Overall would recommend, definitely!

We arrived here at the end of the day and the staff could not have been more helpful. They had a great attitude and nothing was too much trouble, especially Sid who recommended the bar across the road for drinks and joined us at the end of his shift. The room was comfortable with good views, it wasn't overly large but good enough for our needs. It was only a 10 minute walk to Times Square with a subway station 5 minutes away allowing us to move around quite easily. New York is a great city and I'll be staying here again on my next visit.

Just need a comfortable place for a layover in NY. Easy walking from Penn Station, easy check-in and a comfortable room facing the court yard. There's everything you can ask for in a room for that price, it was clean and the linen was nice. Easy check-out. Didn't try their breakfast, because there're lots of options in the vicinity.

Stayed in 1403 in early August.Room 1403 was in the back facing the alley, so it was significantly quieter than the one facing the street. That being said, there was still plenty of door banging as people leave/enter their rooms. Small bathroom, though plenty of counter space for my toiletry. My double bed was slightly saggy and sqeaky.Gym was a little small, but I was able to get what I needed done.No issue with the wifi

Hilton is always a solid choice- clean rooms, comfortable beds, good water pressure, good customer service. I booked 2 nights directly through Hilton.com and paid their premium for high floor. Initially assigned to room 1703 with views of next building (see pictures). I asked for different room and Shanika from front desk said high floors are 14th and up and all their "doubles" room are the back of hotel with same views. We were moved to room 2004 the next night with not so spectacular views (see pictures).

Always walking when you visit NYC and this Hilton put us very central to everything we needed to access. Quick walk to subway, PATH, GCT and Penn. Perfect spot. Staff was amazing too. Front desk, room service and both bars were all over the top. Will definitely stay here again

staff were perfect every time i meet them. They genuinely loved serving their guest. the room could be a bit better. the windows didnt block much of the street noise and the walls were thin enough to hear people speak and walk by. the roof bar was great as it offered great views of the city and the atomsphere was buzzing but it does get busy

Overall great service, very reasonable pricing for New York, clean and comfortable rooms. Awesome Tiki bar on the roof. Other good dining options. Central location. Highly recommended. Noise on the street side less on the back.

My wife and I chose to stay at this hotel to celebrate our 15-year wedding anniversary in NYC due to our loyalty to the Hilton brand. As always, the Hilton brand never disappoints me with their top notch customer service and comfortable/beautiful hotel room. On this most recent experience, Skylar Siminovsky made our most recent stay very memorable (see pic). This type of gesture along with other reasons are why we remain committed to the Hilton brand. Based on this most recent hotel experience, my wife and I recommend anybody to stay at this hotel. Their rooftop bar is amazing and their location is an ideal spot for anyone who loves to walk in NYC!

We picked this hotel due to its proximity to Penn Station. There are multiple subway stations nearby. It is close enough to many restaurants. It is within walking distance of the High Line, also. Great rooftop bar with uptown view. If you request a high floor room, you can get a great view uptown or downtown.

From the moment that we checked in the service was great. We called down to the front desk a few times requesting things and they were quickly brought to our room each time. Aliyyah, the concierge, called around to gather ticket information for us for a Broadway show ( that evening!). She made all of the arrangements and gave us a great recommendation for dinner!

I recently stayed at the Hilton on 26th street, as a surprise from some friends to celebrate my birthday. The room was impeccable and the service was great. My favorite part was visiting the roof top bar - the view was absolutely breathtaking. I can't wait to come back here in the future. Thank you Christine for helping my stay be so enjoyable!

Hotel is situated in the heart of the Fashion District within comfortable walking distance of Penn Station and MSG and of course FIT. Hotel staff was very pleasant and nice and the rooms were clean. Front Desk Manager Skylar is simply the most customer service oriented person we have ever met. there was nothing he wouldn't do for us and made us feel like we were the most important guests in the property.

This was my first time in New York, so I didn't know what to expect as far as a descent average hotel. It was very very small. It seemed kind of old and retro. Not a fan. Did I mention how small it was? The view, was non existent. The window was obviously super tiny. It wasn't the cheapest either, so I think there are better options. The location was alright. It wasn't in the middle of everything but the walk was a bit. Again, not having been there before I had higher expectations. The restaurant downstairs was good. Nothing crazy special but for when you are tired and need to eat something, its convenient.

Stayed one night before an early morning train journey the next morning. The hotel is in a really great location for Penn Station and restaurants. The rooms are small, which is expected for New York City, but pretty well appointed. I appreciated that the gentleman checking us in at the front desk made it a point to say that their goal was for us to be one hundred percent satisfied! In the end, we were only there for a short period of time, and it was a comfortable, if unremarkable, stay.

Great location. Chelsea. Walking distance to Penn Station. Hotel room was lovely & very clean & bed was very comfortable. All the staff were very pleasant & helpful. We enjoyed "happy hour" drinks in the rooftop bar with its great views! I highly recommend this hotel.

The Hilton in Chelsea is located close to our favorite areas of NYC, everything within walking distance. We booked the day before with the Hotel Tonight app, with that you get the room the hotel still has vacant. For us not too bad this time, 6th floor. Check-in and out were efficient. The rooms are big enough, and at a first glance clean. I'm not so sure anymore after seeing the water bucket of the cleaners this morning (see picture). In the city that never sleeps, the doors of the rooms are to noisy , waking us up every time a neighboring just came or left. The valid parking is a good and needed service for hotel downtown. At a rate of 75 USD per day for a SUV in line with the standard, I would say.The rooftop Terra's is great. Service is perfect and the view amazing. Go there on time for cocktails. We went up around 5:30 and still had a nice seat, a bit later that is a challenge.

My experience upon arrival and during my weekend stay was excellent. The staff was helpful and friendly. The service was good as well as roof top bar. The location was convenient with decent restaurants nearby

Very nice hotel within striking distance of mid-town. Loved the decor, and ground and roof bars.Staff was friendly and food was well presented. Rooms were updated, including having a beverage/snack refrigerator. I do wish the refrigerator had space for a bottle of water. Would stay here again.

Arrived late Sunday night. Staff was very welcoming. Next day we stayed out most of the day. We stopped at the front desk to ask for ice for our room. The lady at the front desk was back on duty and recognized us immediately. She knew our name!!! Very impressed. The room was very clean, the air conditioning worked well. There was coffee/tea in the room for the morning. Lots of towels. Very quiet. We stayed 3 nights and will definitely stay again when we go to NYC.

Exactly where I wanted and needed to be when I stay in NYC. The hotel is nice. My bathroom had a walk in shower rather than the tub shower combo like so many other hotels do in NYC. The Roof Top Bar has great views but terrible service. Make sure you bring your ID....they ID everybody even if you are a hotel guest.

We always stay at Hilton property when we travel for your outstanding services and the hosts always go out of their way welcome and make us feel very special. Special thanks to Skylar for your help with our special request for high floor looking out to The Empire State building. This hotel is within walking distance to many well known places in NY. We walked to the Empire State Building, Korea Town one day and took the Metro to China Town and Little Italy the next day and finish the day with an amazing sunset view on Brooklyn Bridge.
user_name:
Toha N
Phoenix, AZ, United States

review_body: Excellent customer service. No hassles. Quiet, clean, comfortable room. Will definitely stay here again. Staff went above & beyond for us. Location was perfect. Great neighborhood. Thanks for everything!

We had a great 5 night stay here at the NY Hilton in the Fashion District, the room was very well appointed, clean & spacious. The location is exceptional, close to some really cool cafe's, restaurants & bars, all walking distance & the subway is only a block away.They also have a roof top bar that has brilliant views of the city skyline, especially on a summers afternoon, be sure to check it out!We would be happy to stay here again, friendly & accomodating staff, great value!

Great location of the beaten path. Nice area. Close to where you want to go. Service was great and a cool roof top bar. Only negative was lackOf towel hooks in the bathroom. Close to Chelsea market and the highline.

It's a great location, close to lots of fun things, shops, and restaurants! Actually, the bar and restaurant are also quite good if you prefer to stay in or it is raining. Ask for a room with a view of the Empire State Building. Note - the rooftop bar is open during the summer so be aware that the noise drifts down. If you're an early to bed, early to rise kind of person that might be a problem - book a room on a lower floor. I suggest joining the crowd and enjoy the drinks and view! Highly recommend this hotel if you want a really nice hotel but don't to spend all your $$ on a room. Save it for shopping instead!
user_name:
Janet W
North Charleston, South Carolina

review_body: I believe I had bedbugs in room 1008. I found black pepper like stuff all over my sheets after feeling itchy trying to sleep. I brushed the "stuff" off and pulled up top sheet and slept on top of that. In the morning I found more on the top sheet and my son had a bite on his leg after sitting on the bed watching a movie. I would be very cautious and fully inspect your room if staying here.

Just spend this days in this unique boutique Hilton hotel.Upscale service , very confortable rooms, good ambiance , quiet rooms, good air conditioning and bathroom.Excellent location for FIT admission week. Rooftop very niceRare restaurant better than expected. Try the Cobb Salad and the Hamburgers. Not expensive!!

From beginning to end my experience at this location was extraordinary! Smiling faces everywhere and all inquiries and requests were handled politely and positively. Particularly friendly and helpful were front desk personnel, including but not limited to, Caroline and Martha, who welcomed me on August 18. The gentlemen at the front desk were also wonderful, but I did not learn their names. And there was one other female who assisted me in the morning on August 19 who was as helpful and efficient as all of the others. One woman from the Housekeeping department saw me dressed in my exercise clothes and immediately directed me to the awesome Fitness Center. Everything was extremely clean and in perfect working condition in my room and in the Fitness Room and throughout the hotel. We often stay in hotels in Ithaca, NY for the exact same rate as this luxury hotel in the beautiful Chelsea area of Manhattan. I'll return again and again!

Stayed in town for a few days for business. The room service was very fairly priced in my opinion, so I took advantage of it and everything I got was great! Went to the rooftop bar with a friend and it was a great view with reasonably priced drinks for NY.Basic (low level) internet was free/included, which served my needs great. The air conditioning was on point! The hallways were frigid, and I actually turned down the air conditioning when I got to the room, which is very rare I think, and shows they don't want you to walk into a dank, stuffy room. My room was on a lower floor/no view and that was fine with me. The reason I took off a star is because I put out the Do Not Disturb sign and when I came back it was gone and someone had entered the room. :(

Overall I had an amazing experience with the hotel. They have helpful staff and thoughtful front desk agent who gave me a bottle of wine upon check in and a room upgrade with an amazing view for my birthday! It was fantastic! The rooms were cozy clean and comfortable and was located in a great location close to many shops restaurants. Steps away from the Flatiron which had an amazing restaurant called Eataly and Chloe as well as Murrays Bagels, Chelsea market and the highland park! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others looking for an affordable stay in a great location! Thanks for a great birthday trip!!

Stayed here overnight and had a great time. Good price. Room was a comfortable size compared to other hotels in NYC. Bathroom was very clean with Peter Thomas Roth toiletries. Bed was very comfortable, perfect after a long day of walking. Very cool A/C. Close to various subway stations. Will recommend and hope to return.

Attended a wedding, block of rooms available at this Hilton. The staff was great. The view from there rooftop bar was spectacular. It is an easy walk to Penn Station. There were a lot of restaurants in their neighborhood. Not as upscale as some areas of NY, and a subway or $10+ ride to Central Park etc., but close to Madison Square Garden, Empire State building, Chelsea Pier and the high line for walking. Seemed like a real NY neighborhood. Would certainly return.

Great location near subways. Access to everywhere in Manhattan. It's a classy NY hotel with a rooftop bar that seems cool. They should allow guests entry without questions. The young ladies at the front desk were so informative about local favorite spots for food, drink, and more.

Nice area awesome roof top bar front desk staff Zorebell makes your stay.. Housekeeper was rude and never cleaned our room even after mentioning it three times ... Front desk workers most of all friendly but Zorebell goes above and beyond Great location pretty view nice beds

First time staying in this hotel and was impressed by service, rooms and general atmosphere in the hotel. I was recognised by status as a Hilton Diamond and although not given an upgraded room I was given a couple of bottles of water and vouchers to use at the deli around the corner for breakfast. I would recommend the hotel to anyone. IT's within a fe minute walk of the subway and easy walking distance to Flatiron area and Chelsea Market. We will likely consider this hotel first on our next visit to the city.

I cannot emphasize how friendly and accommodating this staff is! And the rooftop bar was beautiful. The view is amazing, and the restaurant downstairs has amazing food and great prices. If you're planning a trip to NY or Staycation, book this hotel.

We spent one night at the NY Hilton Fashion District. What impressed me most was the quality of the soundproofing -- an unusually quiet room for NYC. Otherwise the room was undistinguished, but in a good way -- bland corporate furnishings, comfortable bed, small bathroom but with decent linens and toiletries.The one negative experience that we had related to the bar: We were staying at the hotel in connection with attending a Rangers game at Madison Sq. Garden, which is relatively close-by. When we returned right about 11:00 pm, we asked the front desk if food was still available; they informed us that the restaurant was closed but that the bar served food until midnight. However, when we arrived at the bar at about 11:05, the host told us that the kitchen was closed. I am fairly confident this was a matter of demographic stereotyping; I think that he took one look at our age (older) and the clothes that we were wearing (for a hockey game, including Rangers apparel and dad/mom jeans) and decided that we did not fit into the fashion "hip" vibe that the bar tries to project. No matter; we walked across the street to a Pub where we enjoyed a very nice late night dinner and some gastro-beers -- probably at far less cost than we would have spent at the Hilton.

The hotel staff from front desk to housekeeping were absolutely awesome. They went out of their way to make you feel special and to enjoy your stay. 5 Star service for sure and a great place to stay in NYC.

Stayed here for a short trip to the city over the weekend and I was pretty much only there to sleep. The location is great and the bed was very comfortable so those two things made the place great for me. Check in was smooth and quick plus what was amazing was that they had my room ready around noon when I reached. The staff was friendly and welcoming as well. Another great thing was the AC, cooled the room to freezing temperatures super fast which was lovely as NYC was hot as hell during my visit. Oh I also got a view of the World Trade Centre from my room, the windows were nice and big. iPod doc in the room was also appreciated. Now onto the bad. Noise levels were terrible as the walls were paper thin. I often felt someone had walked into my room when it was probably into the room next door! That was quite alarming. I could also hear loud conversation for a few hours from the neighbouring room around 2am which interrupted my sleep. Other than that there was no fridge in the room and also no ice machine in the hotel, ice could only be obtained through room service for a charge which is terrible in the summer. The decor of the hotel also felt more like a 3 star hotel than a 4 star one, that being said everything was super clean so no issues there. Overall, if you find a good price for a stay go for this hotel!

Very convenient to so much in New York - especially liked a quick 3 block walk to the HIgh LIne for morning exercise. Staff very friendly - sorry I didn't remember names, but all smiley and helpful - concierge was very helpful. Quiet, great air conditions. Convenient to subway. Visit New York about once a year, but usually haven't found a place that I felt a need to go back to. That has changed. Price was right also - got HHonors free wifi.

Generally ok good location and fair size room by New York standards . Fast check in helpful staff . Very clean as expected for the price as not cheap but it is New York . Only one fault very limited Tea and coffee provided and no fridge to keep drinks cool .

The hotel itself was fine, but the housekeeping staff wanted us up and out very early and we were visiting our family and I was recovering from recent surgery and wanted to sleep in. They would prop each door up and down the hall open with the security locks and the let the doors slam against the locks repeatedly beginning at about 7:30 AM. We asked the front desk to have them please not do this and the following morning it was quiet until about 9:30. The banging commenced again the morning after and again the morning after that. Ice is not available unless you request it, and even if you do you might to receive it. Not everyone staying here is here on business and the housekeeping staff needs to respect the DO NOT DISTURB signs and allow guests to sleep.

I loved it here! Reasonable sized rooms (for NYC), clean, icy air conditioning, restaurant for breakfast, lunch or dinner, a cocktail bar on the first floor and a rooftop bar with a great view of the Empire State Building! Our room did not have a view but it was quiet. The staff was friendly, check in and out was quick and they are close to both Penn Station and Chelsea. The rate was on par for the area ($240 for a Friday night; 2 beds).

This is my second time staying here for business and had a great stay. Comfy room and easy for me to get to my office in the meatpacking district. The best part of the stay was the front desk associate Sashika. When I arrived she checked me in with a big smile and at the end of our interaction let me know that she was there to help win anything I needed. During my stay I witnessed another interaction she had with a guest with the same enthusiasm and commitment to making the guests stay as good as she could. Will definitely stay here again!

You will not go wrong with the Hilton Fashion district hotel. The rooms are comfortable and the service is impeccable! Whether you are working with the front desk or the sales office you will always feel like you are a Queen. I travel to NYC about 4 times a year and this is the one and only hotel I will stay in. You also can't go wrong with the roof top bar.

The Hilton New York Fashion District on West 26 st, offers a great location , value and service.Skylar Siminovsky and his entire staff are welcoming friendly and helpful with suggestions of what to do, where to go and how to get there.Do enjoy a cocktail , view and people watching at the rooftop bar.When making reservations mention if you are celebrating a special event, a surprise might await you.Be sure to become a loyalty member [free] for future points and perks.

We are traveling as a family together almost 3 weeks already in the USA, the hotel is located near to the main tourists attractions of the city Walking distance from Times Square. The rooms are clean the staff are polite and attentive, willing to answer any questions and willing to offer assistance

Definitely a 'tight' space -- hotel room is essentially just large enough for a bed. If you are traveling with multiple pieces of luggage it could be tough. Location is easily accessible and entrance on 26th is easy to get in and out of - particularly for NYC - I found it a breeze.Staff was delightful -- room was 'upgraded' with my loyalty status but I think that just moved me up a few floors.I'd definitely stay here again.

Was not really value for money, we were also in the impression of a better view for the upgrade.Also garbage in front of the hotel for two continuous days was not a good sight!The size of the room was good for one queen bed not two!

I stayed over for 9 nights, over all my experience was satisfactory with regards of hotel location, staff, cleanliness, internet speed and food. No open buffet for breakfast or dinner only room service, would suggest room service staff to be more friendly and this is not a one time experience, I've ordered room service more than 6 times and the same experience was received.

Our room was so small there wasn't space to put up the folding suitcase rack so I had to put the cases on the bed to get things out. It was so dark we had to have all the lights on all the time and the window was filthy on the outside. When we asked to be moved, even if it meant paying more, we were met with a shrug of indifference and were told that all the rooms were the same. The photographer who did the pictures for the website was creative, to say the least!We had read a lot about the fantastic roof-top bar and restaurant but were not allowed to even go up and see it, never mind eat there! The reason? Our son isn't 21(he's 18). When we said we just wanted to go & look and would come straight down again we were told there was no way we could. This was in the morning when the restaurant wasn't even open!The lid for the hot water in the coffee machine in our room had a tendency to pop open as the water began to heat & I had to hold it down if I didn't want half a cup of cold coffee. Not a desperate problem, but I left a note in the room asking them to see if it could be fixed. The staff left a curt reply telling me that the machine worked fine and I could ask reception to show me how to use it!Not at all what we've come to expect from Hiltons.

The hotel is placed in a very good area near to The fashion area and very closed to The Meatpacking district where there are lots of beautiful restaurant and cocktail bar. The room was very clean and quite, the staff kindly and helpful. There is a rooftop where IT is possible to spend an enjoyable night! Very recommended!

I travel for business at least two times a month. I try to stay at a Hilton property to maintain my status. This is by far the best Hilton Hotel I have ever stayed in for business. The staff is always welcoming and friendly, Christine at the front desk consistently over delivers. The location is great for me as it's close to the clients I normally visit and away from most of the tourist noise. The roof top bar is a good place to unwind after a long day and the food is above average. The room size is bigger than what you might find in other NYC hotels. I have and will continue to recommend this location.

This is a well run hotel, in a great location...with quite a cool 20 floor bar. It lacks any great character, but the service is very good and the rooms very adequate and clean. Good rates and lots of subway connections within easy walking. If you like running, not too far to get to the water and the running route around Manhattan. Very good breakfast menu also. Good option in a nice part of town.

I stayed with my boyfriend at Hilton Fashion district and The staff was warm, welcoming and very helpful especially Sashkia, which and made our stay even better. The rooms are clean and the hotel is convenient to everything in NYC.

Hidden down on W26th Street the Hilton New York Fashion District provides great position to explore New York away from the main tourist hub of Times Square. Nicely positioned between Central Park and Battery Park, close to Macy's and associated shopping district. An easy 2 block walk to 28th Street subway which will take you uptown or downtown. Great rooftop bar gets pretty noisy and crowded late in the week but great views. Rare restaurant was also great for breakfast or a burger for dinner. Nice size rooms and good Hilton amenities as always.

Unfortunately the room they assigned to me was in the second floor just above the lobby.You have no other option than accept at 11pm when you arrive tired and plenty of bags. They said don't have other room available, I requested since my booking a high floor but was in vain.The room has a cigarette smell, the bed was a king size but half with a decent mattress but the other half was an slider. I went alone but if i were with someone definitely one of us had a very bad night.The room was very small and the remote of the tv was "greasy".In general terms the room was clean, I know maybe this hotel is not perfect but was under a decent "average"

Great location at Chelsea.Many dining options around.Close to subway of few lines.Very good service of staff.Wonderful bar at rooftop.Good size rooms, modern bathrooms.Fast and reliable wifi.I find this hotel good value for money as long as it's offered in a price ranging $200 per night.

This is a small hotel, as far as Hilton properties go, however, it was not small on service. The rooms are modern and clean and about average in size for a NYC hotel. My room was on the 19th floor with a view of the Empire State Building, which was awesome. Fairly centrally located with easy walking to Madison Park and the Flatiron district, as well as Madison Square Garden and a bit further to Times Square. Front desk was very helpful and courteous, giving good recommendations for nearby restaurants, as well as helping to arrange for taxis and limos. Would definitely stay at this property again. Loved the atmosphere, rooms, and staff.

I've trying different hilton chain hotel in the Big Apple and I have to say that this is is at this the one hidden jewel. Location is great, people very polite and rooms are awesome (specially if you get one of the upper floors and with street view). Rooms are big, bed is very comfy, bathroom very very big!. I would definitely come back to this one!

We've been staying at this hotel 4-5 times a year for the last 5 years and its always a pleasure. Perfect location, nice facility, and the people are wonderful. We've never had a bad experience and everyone goes out of their way to make our stay the best.

Great hotel with superb location. Room has all what is expected with good quality stuff. Hotel staff are friendly, helpful. Also it is located conveniently to either Penn Station or 14th Street Station with 10 minutes walk either way. Did not opt for breakfast hence can not comment on that.
user_name:
Sunil S
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We stayed here for two nights. I called a couple of times for special requests before arriving and twice got Mily on the phone. She was so friendly and helpful. Coincidently she's the one who checked us in, and again was excellent. She made recommendations for us & made sure our room was ready quickly. The other folks at the front desk were also helpful and friendly throughout our stay. The room was spacious, quiet and very clean - I alway do my own "cleaning" when I'm at a hotel and this one got the white glove test!

Nice hotel in a good location with a cool rooftop bar! Unfortunately the staff is not going to do ANYTHING to show courtesy and accommodation. The attitude is more along the lines of "your are LUCKY to be here" vs. "How can we make it right?" as Hilton would like to claim. This is my impression from the front desk staff (even the manager) and also the waitress upstairs on the rooftop bar.

Our stay at the Hilton Fashion District was wonderful. The location was perfect for us as we helped our son move into his apartment. We were close to so many stores and all the great restaurants that Chelsea & Flatiron have to offer. The staff was outstanding and the room was very comfortable and quite spacious for NYC! I will definitely be selecting this hotel on all my future NYC visits.
user_name:
Kirsten A
Las Vegas, United States

review_body: We paid extra for an upper floor so we could see the Freedom tower from our hotel room. The room was a bit smaller than we expected however it was comfortable. We forgot to bring toothbrushes and the front desk delivered some to our room quickly, which was nice.

I was initially hesitant because the price with my AAA card discount was SO low for NYC. But this hotel, though small, is a mighty fine choice. Polite friendly staff. Clean small but well appointed room. Fast elevator service. Great location. Bar in lobby plus excellent view from rooftop. Valet service was drop it and check in, and pick up was just as fast with NO TIP required as there was no one to deal with but front desk. We immediately cancelled our W Union Square reservations for August and switched to Hilton Fashion District again. No reason not to stay here again and again. Even close to MSG!!!

Awesome hotel which located in downtown Manhattan. Very good service and no disturbing unless it is really needed. Room is cleaning. Generally my overall experience is awesome! The only 2 things I'm not sure are: (1) no teapot there and I had to either bring water outside or bought water from the refrigerator (2) no one-time tooth paste/tooth brush/tomb in the bath room.

When we come to New York City we often stay at this hotel. This hotel is in a great location easy access to all the sites. The staff is so accommodating the rooms are clean and extremely comfortable. I highly recommend!
user_name:
Jean H
New York City, New York

review_body: So, I recently stayed for Men's fashion week and was forced to stay at the Hilton, because of the lack of availability at my usual hotels. When I first arrived, no one asked to help with my bags or anything. After lugging my bags into the hotel, I was fortunately greeted by a front desk employee who was very nice and helpful. After going up to my room (Room 2011), the bathroom smelled like fish. I tried to settled, but both of the shades in the room were broken. It took a while, but finally someone came and fixed them (they had to literally rip them down - the shades were extremely raggedy and needed to be replaced). Although this was a short stay, I was very disappointed with the hotel itself. The location, however, was great. A poor hotel room for $766 a night was extremely disappointing. Think twice before visiting this hotel.

Tiny rooms, a lot of noise if you are in a connecting room to someone. People running in the hallways at 3 am. Not the best Hilton experience I have had. Staff were mostly polite, but the fitness center is too small, no fridge in the room, no ice maker on the floor. Depending on what you need for a stay in the city, just be aware.

We stayed here during a recent visit to New York. Position is great - it is walking distance from Penn Station and close to a number of subway options. The local area is very good with many shops and food options and other areas of Manhattan are in easy reach. Staff were friendly and helpful.Rooms are modern and well maintained and ours had a great view of the Empire State Building. Great rooftop bar too.

I have stayed a few times at this hotel and never had a problem but this last time was much different. First of all I had 2 reservations and one of them was placed by my employer and one was placed by myself. I did not know about the one placed by my employer and when I reached the hotel and tried to cancel it I was told I couldn't and had to call the Hilton Honors desk. They told me that the hotel had to cancel it so I asked again and was denied. I in turn was charged over $300 for a one night stay as a no show. I am working with Hilton to try and get it refunded but so far nothing. I thought there would be advantages being a Hilton Honors member but not this time.We also stay as a group and one of the nice features about the hotel is the roof top bar. We stayed for 3 nights and the bar was unavailable all 3 nights. We should have at least been notified beforehand that it would not be available. Another night they only had one elevator available to get upstairs to my room. The lobby was absolutely packed with unhappy people. It took over a half an hour of waiting before we were able to get an elevator up to the 12th floor with my bags.. All in all not a great visit

If you ever book this hotel, go through Skylar. She was so courteous, was willing to help with room upgrades and any inquiries that I had. She was prompt with email correspondence and overall just so generous. On top of it all, the hotel stay was great and hospitable. I've stayed at plenty of Hiltons around the country and this is now one of my favorites. I definitely will be looking at this and the Millenium Hilton for most of my stays in New York. As an aside, I'd just like to personally thank Skylar again because her service was incredible and unmatched.

Subway and train were very close, so this was very convenient. Hotel is just off 7th Avenue, so if someone wanted to walk he city, they could and not easily get lost. With some effort someone could walk to river for some great parks. Try and go to the nearby Brooklyn Bagel....Great bagels.

What a great experience. First off, I had reserved a room with 1 queen bed because of the lower price compared to the price for 2 beds. Because I was traveling with my son, we were going to look into getting a cot. When we arrived, the clerk offered me a room with 2 beds, without my even asking! GREAT!!Next, location location location... We took a MegaBus to get into the city from Massachusetts. The bus stop was right around the corner! Subways (of course) easily accessible. Walking distance (I believe in walking NYC) to Times Square, Broadway, The High Line, The Hudson, and so much more!Finally - security. The hotel offers luggage storage for free while you roam the streets. The elevator only operated with the use of the room key. There is a rooftop bar, but they have their own elevator. There was mention of a noise issue on the upper floors due to the bar, but we were on the 6th floor and didn't hear a peep from anywhere.The room was clean. The bathroom and shower were clean. The air conditioner was excellent in the 104 temps. Free wi-fi was very convenient and there were lots of sockets for charging all our devices. The bed was comfortable.

I planned this trip as a surprise for my husband’s 40th birthday. I made sure to call the hotel a couple of weeks before our arrival to let them know that I had to make 2 separate reservations as I was using HHonors points for 3 of the nights and paying 1 in cash and I did not want to have to move rooms after the first night. The person I spoke to said to just let the person know when we were checking in as it shouldn't be a problem. I had hoped they would put a note in our reservation but didn't want to force the issue as I trusted that they knew the hotel better than I do. When we arrived, the front desk agent was not aware that we had 2 reservations and had to spend quite a while rearranging things so we would not have to move rooms. She mentioned a couple of times that she was having difficulty because there was a "regular" guest arriving and she could not move his room. A couple of times she went to (who I assume was) the manager to seek assistance. He seemed very dismissive and made no effort to welcome us or even acknowledge us as we stood there while she tried to figure it out. It just came off as a little bit discourteous. There was no verbal recognition of our status as HHonors members, nor the fact that it was my husband's birthday (I made sure to note that when I made the reservation online). As an HHonors Gold member, room upgrades are given based on availability. Again, no mention was made of our HHonors status or what kind of room we were being given. About 5 minutes into the check-in process while she was trying to figure out the room, I had to ask if there was a room available on a high floor. She said she was trying, but had to accommodate the regular guest. I realize the value of a regular guest, but I also know the great amount of effort that I put into saving and planning for this trip, including agonizing which hotel to stay in and choosing this one based on the reviews of good customer service. The agent did come knock on our door shortly after we got in the room to bring a bottle of wine and a birthday card that had apparently been placed in the room we were previously assigned, which was very nice. Again, I really wasn't expecting a huge over-the-top welcome, but a simple "Happy Birthday" or "we see you are a Gold member so let me see if there is an available upgrade" would have gone a long way. It just wasn’t the warm welcome I had been expecting. Other than the check in experience, the front desk agent was very nice and helpful. She very quickly sent up a bucket of ice upon our request and also quickly had a mini-fridge sent up to our room at our request. The room was great, very clean and in good condition. Bathroom was pristine with no signs of water damage or wear and tear. The housekeeping service was impeccable. The hallways upstairs appeared a little worn and the lighting in there is WAY too bright. We were offered vouchers for the continental breakfast or vouchers to a little deli around the corner. If you are offered this, DEFINITELY take the vouchers for the deli! Great food and quick service. You can eat there or take it to go. They have all kinds of prepared and made-to order foods, plus a little market. The checkout experience was not great really, the woman working the front desk was not very friendly and the gentlemen storing our luggage (who also hailed our cab) was quite unfriendly and barely spoke to us or looked at us. And yes, we did tip him. Not sure what the problem was. Overall, I was satisfied with the stay. There were some very positive experiences and a few negative as I previously mentioned. I guess I would rate my overall experience as average. While nothing was horribly wrong, I definitely felt like we were just another guest (other than the bottle of wine and the card) based on our interactions with some of the staff and the check-in experience. Overall, I would consider staying at this property again. However, I would not work so hard to save up HHonors points in order to stay at this property because of some of the experiences we had. I would come back due to the location and neighborhood.

This is a very nice hotel, very close to subway and quite close to many stores and tourist attractions. The bathroom could use a tiny bit of help but otherwise is all nice. The room was quiet as was on a side of the building, not a spectacular view, but can't have them all. Starbucks coffee right around the corner.

My family and I stayed at the Hilton Fashion District over the Fourth of July weekend. We had two rooms on the 16th floor and we were happy with both. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated, a little on the small side but that is typical for this part of NYC. The front desk staff was wonderful, they were very helpful and pleasant at check-in and even offered us an upgrade for both rooms. This hotel also has a rooftop bar with great views of the Empire State Building and the city. If you're looking for a nice hotel in the Chelsea area, the Hilton Fashion District is the place to be!

The rooms are clean and modern but very small. I was on the top floor and had a beautiful view. The major thing for me was that the service was lacking - there are no ice machines and I had to call the front desk who said all ice needed to me sent up through room service. After an hour of waiting, still no ice. My requests for additional pillows and towels were also very delayed. They did not have the text message system for requests like other Hilton hotels do in major cities across the county. Again, okay but not great.

On 26th St. between 6th and 7th Avenues. Good location for uptown and downtown activities. Excellent and helpful staff. Room worth the money. CitiBike station 1 block away; subway 2 blocks away. Good neighborhood restaurants. No breakfast served for HHonors but $12.50 voucher for Sunac café, deli, bakery around the corner. More than worth it and prices reasonable. Fresh fruit and vegies, buffet style hot and cold entrees, deli and bakery. Very complete little deli, grocery. Plenty of local bars as well. Rooftop bar and restaurant in Hilton but not operated by Hilton. Great view from the rooftop. We enjoyed our stay!!!

The location for the hotel is great. We were in the fashion district near FIT. However, our room was very small, we could hear when the people upstairs would flush the toilet and we could hear the people in the hallway and in the room next door.
user_name:
Giselle F
Washington, DC, United States

review_body: Stayed for four nights over a weekend.Hotel is new; nicely decorated; comfortable rooms.Diamond Hilton free breakfast was small; paid extra to get the full breakfast which was excellent.I really liked the location; convenient subway access; fashionable shops around.

I enjoyed my stay, very clean rooms, excellent staff, great location, indoor parking located very close. I would recommend this Hotel if you are looking to be near Times Square, Penn Station, or Madison Square Gardens.

Three night stay Fourth of July weekend for $460 total (inclusive of taxes and fees), which was a great deal! For the money we paid, it was great. It's about 2 short blocks from a number 1 train (28th street) that will take you directly to Penn Station and Times Square in less than ten minutes, and will also take you downtown to Chambers Street, where you can do the 9/11 memorial/One World Observatory, Statue of Liberty, etc. The hotel also has a great rooftop bar with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. This hotel is best suited for a young couple or friends, as it really doesn't have all the standard hotel amenities. The rooms are very small. Our room didn't even have a closet, so no hangers for clothes. There were no ice buckets/ice machines either, but room service will bring some up for you if you ask (it will take about 20-25 minutes). All and all everything was clean and it was a good deal, but not worth $200+ per night!

My room was beautiful and I wanted to bring my bed home! The staff was exceptional. For my first time in the City they made it a memorable and wonderful experience. I was able to see a lot of the iconic views from the roof top bar. The ambiance and overall warmth of the staff is something I plan to come back for.

Modern hotel and easy to love. Check in prompt and friendly. Self service paid parking only a few blocks away. Room is high floor is preferred and room size not bad for NY city. Very clean and comfortable. Fitness room is small but sufficient. Continental breakfast very good and service is prompt. Hotel is located in good area and you can walk to many places.

Enjoyed my stay at the Hilton Fashion District, but not sure if I would stay again. The location was ideal for us, but the hotel offered minimal amenities for a Hilton. As a gold member, I stay at a lot of hotels and this was the least impressive I've stayed at. Typical small room (it is NYC after all), gym was awful, breakfast offering was minimal - so we took the daily voucher for the deli around the corner (which turned out to be terrific). For what I paid, I expect more.

This small hotel is jam packed with amenities and a staff that is well trained to provide excellent customer service. Front desk staff is warm and welcoming. The location is excellent; walkable to shopping and broadway shows, as well as subways and train stations. It is clean and well run.
user_name:
mommabuck
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The attentive service and great location meant that the smallish rooms were less of an issue. Thin walls mean that you can hear all conversations in the hallway and sounds from the next door room. Lots of restaurants within walking distance including Eatally which is worth the 10 minute walk for the whole experience of Italian food and all things Italy.

Good hotel, had everything you need in room although walls were very thin so could hear everything that was going on next door. Restaurant good although a little expensive. Good location. Make sure you tell the cab driver the correct Hilton as we were dropped off at the wrong one even though we said fashion district.

Tiny yet comfortable and clean. This hotel is located right in the smack of Manhattan, so if you are exploring the city, you can chose which direction to go. It is cute and clean, we loved going down stairs in the basement for the stylish breakfast area. We had a great stay, and will definitely return!

From our arrival, we were warmly created by Marian and Skylar who made us feel very comfortable and told us about the neighborhood. The location is near the Chelsea Galleries and hip Meatpacking district. And an easy subway ride to midtown. Although we walked most of the time. And wasn't as isolated as I feared. This hotel was selected for my husband's fraternity reunion and I had been very skeptical about the location and quality of the hotel. The room was like the pictures and was comfortable with a modern bathroom (great shower). It didn't feel as small as some NY hotel rooms. They let us have a late check out and then when we forgot to check out they did it by phone and didn't charge us extra. If we wanted to be just outside midtown...we'd stay here again.

Good location that is fairly close to many activities in NYC, but also slightly secluded from the dense tourist areas. Good location if you are trying to avoid the crowds of Times Square. Hotel is in good shape and staff is good. All rooms are basically the same with the exception of the view. I think a high floor above the 19th floor would provide decent views. Hilton Hhonors benefits are lacking at this property. Gold/Diamond members will be disappointed that there is no executive lounge and breakfast vouchers only get you a basic continental breakfast. Most Hhonors guests will find it is best to use the voucher for a coffee and/or juice and to go out and grab a bagel at a local shop. The rooms do not have a fridge for guests and be careful not to pull items out of mini-bar fridge unless you want it (automatically charged unless you call lobby and return item to them). There is a rooftop bar, which is available to the public and being a guest does not provide any benefit (i.e. you don't need to stay at the hotel to be able to go to the rooftop bar). The bar was closed both nights for private events, but staff did let us go up and see the view during the day for a few minutes. Fitness center is adequate for a short stay as it is pretty small. The fitness center is a little larger than a hotel room (including the bathroom) and it is has treadmills, elliptical, free weights (up to 30 lbs.), and a universal cable machine. They did a decent job with the layout to get most items in a fitness center that you would expect at a Hilton flagged hotel. However, if multiple people (3) are in the fitness center it will be cramped and you may need to wait to use the equipment.

We flew from Miami into JFK and then took the least expensive mode of transport into the city: AirTran. For $5 Airtran picks you up in the terminal and takes you to a subway stop in Queens at which point we transferred onto the E train (another $2.50) and got off 25 minutes later at 23rd Street & 8th avenue. After a brief walk, we were checking in less than 10 minutes later! The hotel looks brand new and from the moment we walked in the staff was very welcoming and gracious. Caroline checked us in and she was very professional yet sweet. Based on other TA reviews, I requested a room on a high floor and towards the back. We were given room 1401 and while I was nervous that it was close to the elevator, we never heard it. The room was nicely decorated but it being in NYC on the smallish side. The shower had great water pressure! We ordered room service one night and it was bought up quickly and it was delicious. We had a fantastic time at the rooftop bar on a Saturday night. A deejay spun great tunes and the setting is AMAZING! On one side is a view of the Empire State Building on the other side is a view of downtown and One WTC. A special shout out to Skylar, one of the managers, he went out of his way to help try and get a relative a room in the hotel when their room in the Hotel Pennsylvania wasn't habitable. He gave my grandfather a tour of the handicapped accessible room and was super accommodating. If my travel plans ever take me back to NYC I would stay at this property again in a heartbeat!

I was in town on business and enjoyed 2 nights at this Hilton. My flight got in early and I was very pleased when they let me check in at 11:15am.The room was modern and clean. The glass shower was a nice touch.I was able to walk to several attractions / restaurants and the subway was just blocks away.

This location was perfect for our trip, with easy access to midtown Manhattan. We walked to several location including MSG, the High Line, Eataly, and other restaurants. The room was very clean, but a bit small. The fan did not work in the bathroom and there was no hair dryer. The AC was great on during a hot NYC weekend. The staff were very nice. We were able to check our bags both before check-in and after check-out. (Though it would have been nice if they brought them to our room when it was assigned.)
user_name:
Daniel B
Reading, MA, United States

review_body: This hotel is very well located. You can walk everywhere from times square to Soho. We parked our car and walked all four days everywhere. We went to times square every day. We also walked to Soho and union square. We did not take the cab at all.

Had a great experience here. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel is is a safe location, close to subway lines. Room was larger than expected and very quiet. Checkout the rooftop bar for great views!

We were at this Hilton for a nights stay due to a visit to the doctor. He conducted tests on my husband which required that he have more space due to a device he had to wear for 24 hours. The room was very small with no table and chaos for us to relax in. We could not go to restaurants so the room was too confined to feel comfortable.
user_name:
maryann j
Beach Haven, New Jersey

review_body: Too bad after long day job could not get a good sleep after to check out as early as possible next day. The flow of traffic during overnight was too bad. Couldn't get a good rest for next day journey t

This hotel is a good location to all of midtown Manhattan and it has a good restraunt with a rooftop bar.Clean and has all the amenitiesI am a repeat customer and find it totally fits any business travelers needsClose to public transportation so as a seasoned traveler it was great that all expectations were meet

I usually don't stay at chain hotels, but this hotel is a lovely ,clean , well situated hotel and I think it's a really good value for NYC. The Chelsea location is perfect if you are coming in to the city by train as it's an easy walk from Penn Station and I found it was easy to get to all the sites we were interested in visiting.

We returned to this property for my 40th birthday trip having stayed here before. The location is perfect. But, we were on the 22 floor under the rooftop bar and the noise was disruptive to the point it was hard to go to sleep. I called the front desk and was told they tell everyone on the 22nd floor about the possibility of noise - implying we knew what we were getting into and that we needed to accept it. We requested a change of room on our first night's stay and were told to pack our bags and have the ready the following morning and they'd be moved to a new room while we were out for the day. We were up early the following morning, packed our bags as we were told and went out for the day. We returned just before lunch to find our room had not been relocated, so we changed clothes, repacked again and were told we'd be in a new room that evening. It was understandable as the check out time had just passed so it made sense to us. We returned after being out with friends for my birthday dinner only to find we had not been moved - we were told our request had been cancelled - and the rooftop bar was busy and loud again. They told us this would be the last night it would be loud as there was no DJ on Sundays so we stayed. We love the Hilton brand and had stayed at this property before and intentionally chose to stay here again because of the level of service and the location we had experienced during our first stay at this property 3.5 years ago. However, this was quite a departure from the level of service and professionalism we've grown accustomed to within the Hilton family. I would stay here again but would warn against accepting the 'upgrade' to the 22 floor as it ended up feeling like a downgrade. The room was clean but we wasted precious time during our time in NYC dealing with packing/repacking for nought.

Spent Friday night in the Hilton New York Fashion District. The front desk made it very easy to check in. The Hotel room was ready when we arrived and clean. The Hotel is located in a great spot in Midtown. The Empire State building is within walking distance. Hilton fashion district is one of the few hotels that has a rooftop patio. Definitely worth the time to check it out. I would stay here again.

Once a month I should stay on hotel for couple days from my job! So many hotel there sometime just make lost to find a good one. Hiltons in New York every location is awesome. Nice decor , clean room , friendly staffs and convenience location are all in one of Hilton hotel.Never have Hassle for balance when I check out! Inside the room every details were so organized!

After 3 nights at Hilton Club Midtown we checked in at Hilton Fashion District to stay 4 nights. The room was on a high floor facing Empire State Building, it was clean and the bathroom was ok.
