As we explored south parts of NYC the whole days we never visited the restaurant or the rooftop bar. The only negative thing is that at lot of noise from the outside was sometimes disturbing (Hilton Club was totally silent). The staff was very service minded and friendly. Very good location for exploring south parts of NYC.If they have more quiet rooms we would come back.

Let's call him "Brutus." Brutus must have been a former night club bouncer, and he's now moving upscale to hotel employee. The problem is that he still believes he's in the business of making folks feel unwelcome. Mission accomplished. We tried to go up to the rooftop bar, and were very gruffly told that the bar closed at 8:30. I pointed to my atomic watch and said "It's 8:27, and we just want to get a quick view of the city at dusk." Brutus said "It's 8:30." and wouldn't let us catch our glimpse, putting a severe damper on the evening. It's time for him to get an accurate grasp of time and hotel customer service, or go back to bouncing at the club, a job to which he is obviously much better suited.

Always great service and location. Gym, coffee shop (Seven Grams), and laundromat all close by. You are 5 minutes from Flatiron, 10 mins from the village. The restaurant downstairs and bar are great and rooftop bar has great views of the city. Probably my favourite hotel.

I was traveling with two other friends and called the Hilton the day of check in to see if we could upgrade from a room with one KIng to a room with double beds for the same price. I figured it was worth a shot! I spoke with Zorbia who was super nice and helpful. She basically said "No problem, all set." It made our trip more enjoyable. I would stay here again because of the staff!

Good location. Friendly staff. Clean. Everything you need. Bathroom tile could be updated, but not a show-stopper. ..room is a little dark with black carpet and dark furniture................ Cafe on the corner. Taxis easy to get with hotel help. ......

The Hilton NYFD is another mid-block hotel (slightly wider than others) where if you get great service you get the elusive Hilton "10" (or 9.5 when you discount for the somewhat disappointing tv channel selection). Well, the service at the front desk was a definite "10", very friendly and efficient check-in. Likewise, the lady who seated me for breakfast was a "10", also very friendly and brought me a newspaper. Sadly, neither the service nor the quality of the complimentary continental breakfast was close to a "10". Rare is a great place to eat lunch or dinner, but I would have been better off skipping the indifferent service and food at breakfast

I visited the Hilton New York Fashion District for a week in June. It is a good hotel for business with comfy beds, good standards of housekeeping, an on-site restaurant/ efficient room service and nice touches e.g. bottles of water upon check-in. The rooms are a bit on the small side and the hotel is by no means modern. The rooms on the lower floors of the street side are quite noisy. Also, some of the rooms do not have blackout blinds which is not ideal if you're a light sleeper/ dealing with jetlag.There were some small issues e.g. shower leaked and the iron was stuck in the holder. I called reception and both issues were solved quickly.The gym is very small. I managed to get a guest pass from Crunch Gym (about 5mins walk away) which is a fantastic facility.Beware the late check out charges. I messed up my check out date and, when I realised, they charged me $228 for checking out 4 hours late. I thought that this was a little steep. If reception had contacted me (my mobile number was provided with the booking) to let me know I would have considered this excellent customer service.I would stay again for business, but choose somewhere else for leisure.

We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights as a base for hanging out in NYC. The location was within walking distance to Times Square, restaurants, subway entrances etc. There was also a cool rooftop bar on top of the hotel with fun views that really gives you a true NYC experience. The hotel was clean and surprisingly quiet for being in NYC. I would definitely choose this hotel again for another NYC trip.

We spent three nights in New York City. This hotel was in a great location for us. It is very clean and our room was quiet. The room was located in the rear. We were able to walk to a variety of places for breakfast. It is also close to the Empire State Building. We walked to the Hilton from Grand Central. It was under a mile, We would stay there again. It is a good idea to become a Hilton Honor guest then internet is free.

Great location service was pleasant ok facilities. Room was small. Would of liked to have a bigger workout facility but better than nothing. Loved that there were tons of restaurants, bars, shops in the area.

Staff was friendly, great service, offered to help. Felt like I knew the staff, easy to ask questions, and get information I needed. New York is a tough city to be in, It was nice to have a safe place to be.

We were in the city for my daughter's wedding dress fitting at Kleinfeld's and were looking for a hotel close by. This hotel was only 6 blocks from Kleinfeld's, so perfect location. We have already booked this hotel for our return to the city in three weeks for the final fitting. We booked two rooms, a king room, and a double room. The rooms were small, but we were only there to sleep, so no big deal. There was a great deal of noise from the street in front of the hotel the first night there, so much difficulty falling asleep. It was better the second night. The staff was friendly, and overall the hotel was fine for what we needed,

Before we even checked in, they upgraded us to a high floor room for being a HHonors member. I was thrilled as it definitely avoids any traffic noise in the mornings. The room itself was very clean and was plenty of space for the two of us. We requested a fridge and one was brought up to us. We ate dinner at the RARE restaurant downstairs and it was phenomenal! Here's the only downside. It was Game 2 of the NBA Finals and their TV service was down for the channel for ABC. We were assured that it would be fixed but we had to go elsewhere to watch it in the meantime. We came back an hour later and it was working but I can't know how long the fix took. Besides that, the staff and all the amenities were perfect for our needs. I would definitely stay here again. The location is very close to Penn station and has some great restaurants nearby.

This is one of the "smaller" Hiltons, but that doesn't mean that it has less service or luxury.It is located VERY central in Manhattan. The rooms are big and the beds are as you would expect in a hotel. The service staff are professionel, fast, and helpful.Overall a great experience if you want to be downtown Manhattan for a few nights.

Hotel staff was very friendly and provided excellent customer service. Raquel Ledesma was a highlight. Very professional and helpful which was refreshing after a long travel day. Room was clean and the location was convenient.
user_name:
DCTraveling1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We had a great time there, close enough to Times Square to walk and also nice places to eat close by. We had great burgers at the hotel restaurant...!!! Our rooms were pretty small but very neat and clean, I would really go back and stay there. Madison square garden is also close walking distance

I liked this hotel. Pros: It is very convenient to Times Square, Macys Herald Square, Empire State Building, Chelsea Market and more. It was clean. Rooms very nicely appointed. Typical size for NYC. Cons:The first night the bed made noise all night long. The front desk quickly fixed the issue when we made them aware of the problem. On the front side of the hotel it can get noisy at night with the trash pickup going on outside. It didn't bother me but my husband is a light sleeper so if you are I would recommend the back side of the hotel. Overall, I had a good experience and have recommended this hotel to friends.

The staff are warm and welcoming. Quick to greet you, even if just passing through the lobby. My favorite hotel in New York City! The décor is modern and smart. The baths are modern with excellent light.
user_name:
William B
Louisville, KY, United States

review_body: Staff was amazingRooms are a bit dark not enough lightingBeds were OK could be betterWas in two rooms due to water on carpet coming from bathroom on 3rd floor seemed the shower was leakingHowever we were moved yo another roomThey reacted fast, would have been nice to have been compensated for it maybe Hilton honor points nice gesture

Lovely views from upper floor. Great mid town location. Clean rooms with excellent coffee machines Very popular rooftop bar bit of a stange setup as you can only access it from reception via a bouncer even though the buttons are in the lift Nice rooms. No bath/flexible showerhead in my room (pet hate as someone with long hair who does not want to wash it every day). Nice food in downstairs bar. Taxi did struggle to find it but excellent location just off 7th 26th chelsea Walk to high-line. Empire state times square. Macys/victoria secrets. Did also walk downtown and uptown from here. Very safe location not too noisy

Should be more of a double tree than a hilton, elevator great ( they are super fast and there were 4 of them), bed and pillows good, bad breakfast, friendly staff. The location of this hotel is the best thing, you can walk to a lot of subway stations and it's away from the tourists. There's a nice little coffee place on the corner too. They also have a roof top bar, I didn't get to go, it was raining and freezing when I was there. They were kind and gave us an umbrella, but no water. I would advise to ask for a high floor. The lighting in our room was not good and it was dark already from being so low.

This is our fifth stay at this hotel and we always have a great experience. The hotel is centrally located, helpful staff and has clean, modern rooms. Easy walking distance to shopping and Times Square but it is nice to get away to a quieter location in Chelsea after a busy day in the city to unwind. The area restaurants are great and an early morning jog on the Hi-Line is the best

Excellent. From the moment we arrived the staff were amazing, friendly, professional and funSkylar was accommodating and very helpful. His friendly and professional demeanor was most appreciated on a long hot travel dayWe will be back !!

Hotel does not look like the Hilton.com photos. Run down hallways. Grungy carpeting. Small rooms, even for NYC. I also had the pleasure of having a room near what must have been a housekeeping supply room because there were frequent arguments among housekeeping staff right outside my door and much slamming of doors. HVAC control was defective and HVAC unit in room was old and loud. Had to turn the heat up to 74 to avoid the room from being freezing. I was glad to only be there one night. Yes, I tried it out for variety - but never again. Many better options. Not completely awful, but not what you expect from a Hilton. Unless you get a great rate and are not there for business give this place a pass.

We only stayed here one day, one of three hotels on our visit to New York. The hotel was wonderful, clean and friendly. Wish we could have stayed here the entire time. Close to subway. Will definitely stay here again when we come back to New York.

I spend around 10 days over there and it was just great you can tell the years of experience in the business I definitely coming back. Service is outstanding. Despite the fact that there are thousand of travelers every day they make you feel at home.

During our six day stay at the Hilton New York Fashion District Hotel, we had an absolutely great housekeeper during our stay. Her name is Chitra and she went way beyond the call of duty. She and the rest of the hotel staff did a spectacular job!!!

Room was a good size and had all the required amenities. The Free wifi was fast enough to stream Netflix. Front desk staff, especially Lily, were very helpful and pleasant. Even offered me an upgrade despite booking through a third party website. Good location and excellent value for money. Will stay again.

Good Hotel in a GREAT location. The bar and restaurant closed a little early for our liking, but in NYC there are plenty of alternatives. Price was fair and the room was good to lay our heads down. No problem with transportation.

When one discovers a precious gem by accident, there is a tendency to jealously guard and hoard it. So I almost talked myself out of writing this review. But then I realized that sharing wonderful things with the universe is an act of good karma that will hopefully circle back to me someday. So here goes: When I am in NYC, I sort of expect to be treated brusquely at best, if not downright ignored. So imagine my surprise upon first walking into this establishment and finding pleasant, happy people eager to assist me and my husband after our long, tiring flight. Shout out especially to the sweet, pregnant girl who checked us in (ashamed I didn't ask her name). This eagerness to assure our good stay was evident everywhere - from the doormen who greeted us every time we left and every time we returned, to the elevator attendants to housekeeping - and even to the staff at the on-site restaurant Rare, where we ate dinner on night two. The host saw me attempt to descend the stairs (did I mention my foot was broken?) and guided us to the elevator that led to the restaurant's lower level entrance. We told the waiters we had a show to catch and they managed to be not just prompt, but courteous and engaging. Food was delicious, too! And then there are the rooms: Scrupulously clean. Decor was very chic and updated, but also comfortable and inviting. Yes, the room was small, but it was intelligently designed. We had plenty of surfaces to store our things. Bed was luscious and comfortable.Bathrooms are brand-spanking new. What a relief! No tired water stains, rusty faucets or musty/moldy smells from leaky pipes. New upscale fixtures and counters, big roomy shower with new fixtures, heavenly water pressure and endless hot water. Soooo important! Equally important are the little details that are usually missing in other hotels, like Q-tips and cotton balls in a nifty stainless holder and a tray for my sundries from home. The final too-good-to-be-true aspect of our stay: It was quiet. Yes, really. I always bring earplugs when I am in town because of the inevitable fire engine at 3 a.m. or noisy adjacent guest returning after a night of revelry. Amazingly, I didn't need them. We requested (and paid a little extra for) a high floor (worth it!). Our room faced an apartment building/alley and not the main street. It was a wondrous surprise to wake up only once, and only when our alarm went off after a good night's sleep. Location is good too - between 6th and 7th Ave. We are evangelical about mass transit, and the subways are very accessible from here. Station for the 1, 2, 3 trains is right around the corner at 7th and 28th and 7th and 23rd, while the B,D,F, and M are on 6th Ave. and 23rd. It is also very easy to walk to Penn Station, which we did one night for an express ride to Yankee Stadium. Whole Foods and Duane Reade are on 7th. Walking distance to the High Line (fun afternoon!). Plenty of restaurants and bars in the nabe, although we patronized the friendly Crompton Ale House across the street for late-night snacks and tasty adult beverages. The neighborhood is more busy New Yorkers/ FIT students, less pushy, frenetic tourists. Thank goodness. Listen, the staff had me at "hello" - literally. All the rest summed up to an amazing, yes, perfect - stay. Highly recommend.

Located in chelsea....close to madison park, subway, penn station. Rooms are very clean. Has a great restaurant, Rare, that we dine at everytime we stay at this hotel. Also has a really nice rooftop bar which is great when the weather is nice. Rooms are relatively quiet...don't hear too much of the crazy city below!
user_name:
Gigi G
Ft. Lauderdale, United States

review_body: Visiting Chelsea for our daughters birthday...very close to her apartment. The hotel is clean, comfortable and a great value. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I was able to find street parking for free which was a huge bonus!!!

location was ideal. rooms were so clean and well equipped. beds were pristine and comfortable. staff were wonderful and knew guest service. i'm in the industry and we are the hardest to please and the first to notice something off.....i had a wonderful experience with no complaints at all. the little signs in the room were charming. Be Well and then a quote about sewing. perfect for the fashion district connection!

I was surprised for a weekend getaway by my husband and I loved that he picked the Hilton New York Fashion District for us to stay in. Milly welcomed us and set the tone for what would be an amazing experience. Her knowledge of what everything to do in the area was exceptional. The rooms were great and I loved my bed! It was so comfy that it was hard to leave and explore. I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone interested in visiting this area of New York City.

I love staying at the Hilton New York Fashion District. This is my second time around and it served as a great place for a stay cation. The rooms are clean and the location is excellent but most importantly I love the customer service I received from all of the staff with Milly always going above and beyond to make me feel welcomed.
user_name:
Mio0111
New York City, New York

review_body: The Hilton in Chelsea never disappoints every time I come to NY! It's centrally located, great rooms and fantastic staff! It was great to see a familiar face at the front desk, Mily!Once again, she did a great job with taking care of all our needs! Will definitely be back again!

After a long day travelling we were greeted by Mily at check in, who gave us the warmest welcome to New York and we couldn't be happier, a true asset to the hotel and company. Can't wait to explore New York from such a great location. After checking in to our gorgeous, clean, room we headed to the rooftop bar for a Manhattan in Manhattan. Perfect.

Great hotel if you need to be in Chelsea or Fashion District. One block from the FIT. Within walking distance to Flat Iron and Union Square. Many great restaurants near the hotel, as well as, many interesting shopping options. You can also walk straight down 26th St. To gain entry to the High Line, an activity I strongly recommend!

This is on the BEST places to stay in NYC! When I arrived, I was greeted by Christine. She was pleasant and extremely welcoming. The HUGE SMILE on her face as she greeted me, made me feel like we were good friends who hadn't seen each other in a very long time. I arrived at the hotel around 1 p.m. not expecting to have a room available. She gave me 3 room options and told me that a room was available for me. As she checked me in we exchanged pleasantries and I mentioned to her that I was spending my anniversary at the property. She told me, "Congratulations," handed me my room key and told me to have a GREAT STAY. I went to park my car at the garage down the street as it is cheaper to park at the garage than having valet park the car. The only minor issue was that there is no In and Out parking if you use the garage. After I parked the car, I went upstairs to the room. The room she assigned had a street view and I loved it. I stood at the window whenever I was in the room and people watched. The area is bustling and has every store, restaurant and pharmacy either across the street or around the corner. The room was surprisingly spacious and VERY CLEAN. The bathroom was a nice size and the bed was clean and comfortable. I was in the room for an hour before I realized that Christine sent a bottle of wine, 2 bottles of water and a greeting card to me for my anniversary. The fact that she did that shows that she will go above and beyond to make your stay special. Thanks Christine. I called down to have food delivered to the room and within 20 minutes someone from the hotel delivered my piping hot meal. I actually ordered the kid's (don't judge me) chicken tender meal. I couldn't believe how large the portion was. I'm a BIG GUY and I couldn't finish the meal. The following morning I went down stairs and was greeted by Caroline. She was just as friendly as Christine and it felt like I've known these ladies for years. I asked for a nice breakfast place in the area. Caroline suggested, "Malibu Diner!" The food there is unbelievable. Breakfast, lunch and dinner was AMAZING! If you go there, you have to buy a slice of cheesecake. It's the BEST DARN CHEESCAKE I've ever tasted.If you're looking for a hotel that's in walking distance to Time Square, Restaurants, pharmacies, banks then look no further than this hotel. The maintenance, customer service, location are unparalleled. Trust me, you won't be disappointed if you choose this property.Also I got a good rate on this hotel by joining Hilton Honors. It took about 3 minutes and it will automatically give you the discount once you hit the "submit" button. It doesn't require a credit card and you accumulate points. Thanks a Million CHRISTINE AND CAROLINE! YOU LADIES ROCK! Mr. Smith :)

This was my first time staying in the Chelsea area and while my room was fine and clean, we had an awful view of the back of a building. In all fairness, it's not a particularly nice looking area so views might be a problem. The hotel staff were pleasant and courteous and while I have no complaints in particular. I think there needs to be visible help at the front of the hotel. I had to ask for someone to help me and while they did and were pleasant....it just wasn't that New York experience that I like. I wanted to check out the roof top bar but we were travelling with my 11 yr old so understand that wasn't permitted. I understood that places that served food permitted children but maybe there are different rules if they are deemed nightclubs. I think I would come back and I have nothing negative to say about this place but it is just not my favourite part of Manhattan.

While I enjoy larger footprint rooms and quiet locations for personal travel, while on business, in meetings all day, this is a great hotel for smooth, hassle free experience, friendly & attentive staff, and reasonable cost. Services and amenities are solid to great, lobby restaurant is good, and location is handy.
user_name:
Christian D
New York, United States

review_body: This hotel is in a great location central to many tourist attractions. The area felt safe and well populated. The staff all seemed polite and helpful. My only downside was the room itself the size was adequate for what we needed and travelling with two teenage boys makes the largest room seem tiny. The full length window was in two parts with the lower window having a crack right across. Also the voile curtain that covered the window was stained and this wouldn't have been hard to replace. Noise from the hotel was minimal with the only problem being a Friday night when the whole floor was occupied by a wedding party so you can image the noise at 3am in the morning.

Close to basically all the transportation you need be it Subway, Penn or Grand Central. Clean tidy rooms with everything you need. AC was a little noisy and I don't often eat at hotel restaurants in NYC, but I hear ok things.

I have traveled quite extensively in my life checking in and out of hotels don't often give reviews on the local stays but couldn't help myself this time. I wanted to publicly thank the front receptionist Mily, who made my check-in absolutely amazing. My best friend and I were on a girlfriends weekend without our husbands and we arrived early exhausted from travel hoping to get an early check-in so we could nap before meeting friends.. With Milys help we were able to get into a room early and we were very grateful. Her manner was friendly and she really overextended herself to help us. The room was wonderful large extremely clean!! Our sleep was quiet and restful without noises from the street.

Perfect location for me. Close to my NYC office, Penn Station, subways, and Path to NJ if needed. The roof top bar is a nice place to relax, and Rare has some very interesting drinks at night as well. This is my go to hotel for NYC.The rooms are small, but it is NYC - and they are comfortable and well maintained.

Very nice hotel, perfect location with a great restaurant attached. We had 24 people dining in a private room with excellent wait staff. Located in the Fashion district close to many stores and restaurants.

This hotel was close to everything and is a great choice is you are not from the area. You can walk to the shopping area, experience great view of the city at night, or go on the rooftop to see the whole city at night. Overall great experience.

Hotel was clean and comfortable - beds were AMAZING and super soft snuggy pillows. Perfectly situated right by Madison Square Gardens and Macy's, only a short walk into Times Square. Roof top bar was a little disappointing as nothing like the pictures!!

For NYC, this hotel has really quiet rooms that allow you to get a great night's sleep. The rooms were very comfortable and in my opinion, spacious for NYC. The front desk was extremely friendly and efficient, as were the bellman. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a comfortable, friendly, convenient and quiet NYC experience.

Overall, we were pleased with the hotel. It was bright, clean, and the desk staff was efficient and courteous. Our room was a very comfortable place to relax in our down-time. Our only disappointment was that they didn't serve breakfast in the restaurant. The brochure in the room led us to believe we could get a nice meal. After being turned away there, we found that a nice breakfast/brunch place was not nearby. We ended up going to a little convenience store, getting breakfast platters, and eating there. Not bad, but not what we had in mind and it did dim the glow of the event a little.

We loved our stay at this hotel. For our purpose, it was ideally located. We had a great view of the Empire State Building from our room. Our bed was so comfortable and it had the best pillows!! Super quick elevators too!

Stayed for a few nights before a conference in the area. Good breakfast service, comfortable bed and nice room service. Not to add the perfect location for down town manhattan, close the both the empire state building, times square and the village.

I couldn't believe how clean my room was when I came back to it. And Mily at the front desk was a pleasure to check out with. This was the second time I've stayed here, and I would welcome the opportunity to stay here again.

I enjoyed staying at this hotel. The decor is beautiful and rooms are very modern. The staff is excellent and helpful. I was made to feel very welcome. Rooms are spotless and pristine. Views on the upper floors are breath taking. The rooftop bar has amazing views of the city. I look forward to staying here again.

Arrived at Noon and they had a room ready for us, always a plus. Upgrade to king bed but no view. Valet parking extremely easy and convenient.On the 1,2,3 so an easy subway ride to Central Park or south street seaport if you don't want to walk. ( and to Times Square if it's raining).4 blocks from High Line, 3 from Eataly. Fun location -- a change for us, as we usually stay uptown, but the price was right, staff friendly, bath and shower good!BIG PLUS: Keurig in the room!! iHome radio so we could listen to our own tunes. Not huge but room was a good size -- rooftop bar is cool. All in all a good choice for a weekend in NYC.

We went to mark the occasion of our 35th Wedding Anniversary, it was our first visit to NYC and we certainly made the right choice when booking this hotel. The room was a good size with a nice coffee machine and good wi-fi, the bathroom was spacious and had good quality toiletries, it was very clean on arrival and made so each morning. Moving on now with some comments about the Hotel Service, from first point of introduction to the end of our stay everything was excellent, all the Staff were most helpful and professional throughout, nothing was any trouble and any guidance sought was responded to in a most courteous and friendly manner. We would like to make special mention of Jonathan Suazo and Marian Rock they were brilliant and if the hotel has an employee of the month award it should go to one of these two. To the General Manager Mr Pakin we would like to say a big well done, you run a great hotel.

We stayed here for a short week during the Christmas holidays.We enjoyed our room, which was large enough for 2 and nice and clean.The location is ok, close to the metro and lots of convenient stores. If you plan on staying here, i would ask for a room that is not on the 'street side' as there was allot of noise in the morning (from dumptrucks) around 6am!We (as tourists) would probably try to get a hotel either closer to central park of much further away in a quieter area (such as Wall Street). This hotel is fine, clean and service is great. Especially if you need a hotel in this specific area, this hotel is fine.For us it was a bit noisy in the morning.

We stayed here for four nights in April. Our room faced world trade centre but if you ask in advance you may grab a room with a view of the Empire State Building. Rooms were smallish as you would expect in New York. The bathroom was surprisingly roomy with very good quality complimentary lotions and potions. Service was unobtrusive and acceptable when we required it. Restaurant was great for dinner but don't bother with breakfast. Free wifi only available in the lobby. Awesome, awesome location. I would stay here again.

The windows in this hotel provide little or no isolation from street noise. I had the misfortune of staying on the street side (12th fl) on a Thursday night, and there was a trash pickup operation across the street that went for almost 2 hrs from about midnight to 2am. Felt like we were in an echo chamber, with periodic clanging and banging of dumpsters etc., plus the loud noise of the garbage-truck(s) engine and compaction system. Seemed like they were emptying out the entire contents of the building across the street. And in the morning at 6:30am, another team came and spent a while doing the same on our own side of the street!As Hilton promises, the staff "made it right" the next morning and gave us a room on the alley side, and it was unbelievably quiet by comparison, for the next three nights. But we got only 4 hrs sleep the first night, and that was fitful, always waiting for the next "gotcha" (and it did come at 6:30am). The new room and experience was close to 4 stars; some nits but without the noise this would have been a hotel I'd return to.I don't know if the trash pickup is only on Thursday nights, or if this occasion with an almost 2-hr pickup was special, but I would never stay in a street-side room in this hotel again.Perhaps the saddest thing is that their automated check-in the day before offered me a large selection of "upgraded" rooms on both sides of the hotel, and **I** picked what looked like a good room with a view, on the street side. Turned out it wasn't high enough to have a view (12th fl), and my original room was on the quiet side!

Ask about parking before you arrive. We had an unpleasant surprise with few options. Expensive overnight parking with no option. You can't park on the street and there are not many garages in the neighborhood.

We are guests at this Hilton at least once a month. The rooms are all generally the same size so even though you are a diamond you will not really get an upgrade other than to a higher floor and the view of the gorgeous Empire State Building. I prefer rooms in the 09 line since I can see it from bed even though Corner Room 11 are considered the most requested. The staff is wonderful breakfast at rare in the morning is delicious. I do think today charging $8 extra for full Buffet is a little crazy but I guess they need to recover some costs. It is great for a weekend getaway the location can't be beat.

As I chatted and checked in with a very personable Christine, it felt like home already. I was in town to see my Dr. and have eye surgery. Upon my return to my room there was a very kind note stating " Hope you feel better" and a box of very satisfying chocolates. Conrad Nicholson Hilton would have been very pleased with this scenario and is smiling down upon you now. Thank you for taking that extra step in making my visit so much easier and more pleasant. Please thank Christine and the rest of your excellent staff. I look forward to future visits. Rick Killeen

This is a practical place to stay in Midtown, close to the Subway. Small, but nice rooms. Roof top bar. Lobby restaurant. Quiet. Room view enclosed - can't expect so much in NYC. Friendly staff. Free water bottles in the reception. Extra to stay on top floors as we did.

The service at this hotel is outstanding and it all starts with the wonderful professionalism of Caroline. Thank you for such great service and attention to detail.The hotel is clean, comfortable and the beds!!!! Wow! The staff is great. A+

I've been staying here since it opened. Fantastic accommodations and a very courteous, friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are always spotless and comfortable. Prices fluctuate depending on demand and NYC events, so book early. The only thing missing is the Fess Parker Chardonnay!!!! PLEASE BRING THAT BACK! Enjoy!!! Jack
user_name:
jackrotolo
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of April 2016. Unfortunately I booked a king sized room as this long weekend was going to be just my wife & I but we decided to bring my two boys (just under 4 & 2 years old respectively) with us and I forgot to alter the hotel reservation. They front desk staff noticed the two little ones and apologized that she could not provide me with a room with 2 queen beds but the hotel had cribs. I mentioned that we would crush together and be alright as I wasn't sure I'd want my smallest one in a communal crib. She urged me to take a look at them as they appeared clean to her and are barely utilized. We agreed she would send one up and it was actually a nice pack/play. My son wouldn't sleep in it but I would have felt comfortable if had wanted to do so for the evenings. Naps were a challenge as the room we had was on the 20th floor tucked around an immediate corner so the elevator shaft was on the other side of the wall. (My HHonors profile requests away from the elevator but it being a small hotel I didn't think there would be many options for switching rooms.) It being NYC it was a very small room and the bed was sub-par. They also don't have any bath tubs which led to 2 very interesting showers for the boys. As my wife said...the view we had was of "rustic turn of the century water towers." These water towers are on top of most buildings in SOHO--unique. The best part of our stay in my opinion was the coupons they gave us for being a gold member for a deli around the corner. They gave me 2 $12.50 vouchers per day and it sure did stretch -- not to mention, the breakfast was phenomenal. We ordered 3 full breakfasts (boys sharing), beverages, and a banana for the road which amounted to just under $12.50. This left me we another $12.50 to spend on random supplies we took with us for our day in the city. The deli had everything you would expect from your local grocery store and some international candy. Although the price for the made to order breakfast was extremely reasonable the rest of the store was premium NY pricing. I am usually pretty bummed when a Hilton doesn't have a lounge or the hours are limited--I did not feel that way here. The restaurant on top of the hotel does not seem affiliated at all other than clogging up an elevator each evening. If you plan on going to an event I would suggest printing your tickets before arriving. We had hockey tickets for a playoff game down at the Barclay Center but the 2 hotel computers could not open Adobe through ticketmaster. The pleasant front desk assistant took a look at the computer and couldn't figure it out either. She was nice enough to have me transfer her the tickets and she printed them at the check in desk. In the end it was adequate for three nights but I'd only come back if the price is right compared to the other NYC Hilton family of hotel locations.

We stayed at the Hilton Fashion Disctrict for a weekend getaway and it worked out great. Easy access to Subways, good midtown location, very clean/nice hotel. Would definitely recommend to anyone who plans to stay in Midtown. Our favorite part was that it's very close to the High Line!

When I arrive, check in with extremely quick and efficient. I was welcomed as a Hilton honors yes, and given a pretty bag of complementary waters. The clerk offered to move my room further away from the elevator, as that was a big game going on, and evidently books were in celebratory mode in the hotel. I had no issues with noise whatsoever. I ordered room service for dinner, and the steak au poive was fabulous. Nice selection of wines by the glass.

The location of this HIlton is its biggest selling point. Easy access to subways that will take you any place in town. Nice roof bar. Rooms are small, but its NYC. Lobby is a bit congested in the early evening because of traffic to the roof bar. I have stayed here several times and the price is better than some other Hilton locations. Nice to be away from Times Square but easy to get to the theater and to the Village.

We got back from our stay at the Hilton this morning, we had an amazing time in New York, the hotel is in a good location, really clean and great amenities, roof top bar has great views across the city. The staff are so very very helpful, I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in New York City.

Very small rooms. Booked a delux on a high floor and for the extra money we paid I didn't expect to get a tiny room that was bombarded with noise from the rooftop bar every night preventing any sleep at a reasonable hour. Very bad to be told by the receptionist when after putting up with it for two nights I asked if the bar could be asked to turn it down that she 'could try but that it was only early for them'. My feeling is that this is a hotel not a night club and therefore anytime is the wrong time if music is pounding loudly!!! I wouldn't stay here again or recommend it to anyone. I've stayed in NYC 3 times but chose the Hilton this time as it signifies quality but this one definitely doesn't!!!

Had a great stay during a 3-day work trip. Staff was extremely nice and happy to help at every turn, and the rooms are above-average for similarly priced NYC hotels. The location is fantastic with plenty to walk to and subway options close by. The bed was comfy, but the gym was a bit small with only 2 treads, 1 bike and 1 elliptical. Restaurant for breakfast is pretty efficient, and the hhonors continental breakfast is good for light eaters. (Only $7 to upgrade to full buffet, though it is pretty average.)Based on my experience, I'm moving this up to the top of my NY Hilton list and will try to stay here whenever my expense policy allows!!

Location in chelsea area is perfect. Room was modern with all amenities. Room was quiet and staff friendly. All three elevators were quick. Internet was free and fast. Room was ready for early check in. Would definitely stay again.

The most cooperative staff, flexible prices, always take it easy on breakfast , good quality of breakfast, and most of the times big Rooms, are qualifications that always takes me back to Hiltons. I booked the Hilton in Ankara Turkey for my parents a few months ago, now my dad has that memory as the best hotel he has ever been in, and he is 77 years old.

Terrific place in a great location with rooms of above size for NYC. Close to hot spots in Chelsea and an easy jog to the Highline you cant go too wrong here. With the hidden gem of a rooftop bar as well have a a serious look at this place! !

It is a Hilton, minimum standards are there for you. If you need to be in the fashion district, here you are.If you need to run to New Jersey good location.Don't expect too much.Shower is decent , rooms are not bad and the air conditioning is a typical old new york kind of brown train machine working all night long.Breakfast was decent and people at the front desk are top notchIf you are in vacations, pick another Hilton.

Spent two nights here while exploring NY. Location is walkable to the theater district, High Line, Union Square and Madison Square parks, and convenient to red line subway stops. Price was good for quality. Ask for upper floors for view of Empire State Building. Bar and lobby can get busy and loud but noise didn't carry. We decided to have a drink at the rooftop bar Sunday about 6:00 before a dinner reservation. It is nice, partially enclosed so stays warm. But the music was way too loud to enjoy for that time of day. I wish they had coffee in the lobby rather than the room units. Even the Hampton inns have that.

The check in was quick, the room was clean and comfortable. The bed and shower were excellent. I really like the location, on 26th St between 6th and 7th Aves. This hotel is really a great choice for NYC.

I chose this hotel for the location between The New School and The St James Theater. Do not pay extra for the high floor rooms - your view is only of the brick building next door. Do not pay extra for the early check in, we gained access 1 hour before regular check in and had to pay an extra $25.

I stayed here with my 2 friends for a week while we were seeing the sights of the Big Apple. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect location, a 5 minute walk to Penn Station and 2 blocks from a subway so you can get all over Manhattan without any issues.3 of us were in a room with 2 double beds, I was expecting quite a small room but there was plenty of room for all 3 of us as well as all our massive cases. Our room was on the 8th floor which did look out on to some offices. But our room was so quiet that you couldn't hear a single bit of traffic. We also ventured up to the roof top bar on a couple of occasions, and that view never gets boring... None of us were smokers but make sure and go to the smoking area just for the view... The view of lower Manhattan is amazing. The drinks were very nice, but a bit expensive, but i definitely found that it was worth the money. The bar staff were always friendly.We only went in to Rare on our last day to grab a quick bite to eat before we headed home. All we ordered was a sharing platter of fries and there was honestly so much and it tasted really good.All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to see the sights. We thought the price we paid for the hotel was also very reasonable for what we got. I would go back to this hotel and NYC in a heartbeat if I could.:: but I will definitely be back

This is a great location to FIT and the flatiron district. The hotel was comfortable and the staff was friendly. The view from my room was stellar. I loved seeing the Empire State building lit up at night.

The team make the hotel enjoyable here. Jonathan and his team are well put together and provide a tailored level of service. Stayed for 3 nights on business, always on hand to answer any questions and assist with getting around or any requests. Would recommend for short stays.

I was in New York for a family wedding. The bride and groom had a block of rooms at this hotel saved for family and friends. The room was nice though small. It was clean and the bathrooms very nice and quite modern. The restaurant in the hotel had good food and great drinks. The roof top bar was very loud but the patrons all seemed to be having a good time. The staff were all very nice and the consirtge knew all about the things to see and places to go to.

This hotel is in a great location, a bit overpriced for the area on a Sunday night. However, I'd like to call out Johnathan S. whom works at front desk, he was very patient waiting for me while I waited 30 minutes on hold to fix my reservation through HotelTonight. He even upgraded my room to make up for the poor customer service through HotelTonight. I would gladly stay here again knowing there is such excellent staff like Johnathan.

I stayed here at the recommendation of my company. We are located next to the fashion institute. For location it cannot be beat. The lobby is impressive and the restaurant is great with nice atmosphere. The staff leaves a bit to be desired though. I would return only if my company sets it up for me

I've had occasion to stay at New York City's Hilton Fashion District hotel twice in the past 3 months. Each time, I have enjoyed a combination of the hotel's facilities and service, and have emerged a very happy customer.First, there's the facility. Hilton's website says the hotel was built in 2010 -- and it certainly feels new. Every room I've stayed in has been in top shape -- clean, efficiently designed, well-organized, and stocked with a few office supplies and a minibar. The hotel rooms and overall facility appear well-maintained. I've not seen stains, tears, holes, worn materials -- any of the indicators of a poorly maintained hotel.Some have commented that the rooms are small -- my response to that is, you're in a building that probably maintained the footprint of its predecessor in a row of buildings dating back multiple hundreds of years -- you shouldn't expect anything else. I would also suggest that most travelers using this hotel are doing so for a business visit to the Fashion District -- so hanging out in a large, airy room for long periods of time is likely not a priority.The other highlights of the facility (for me) were the Rare bar/restaurant and its rooftop extension. The food at Rare (I had lunch there twice) was excellent, as were the cocktails.I also REALLY enjoyed the service. When I checked in and out, regardless of whether it was 2 in afternoon or 1 in the morning, staff was on hand at the desk, and they were, to a person, quick, competent, friendly, and courteous -- even in the middle of the night when I arrived after a delayed flight. They stored my luggage, hailed me a cab, arranged a car service -- all efficiently and with a smile. The bartender and waiters/waitresses at Rare were awesome -- friendly, talkative, quick, competent, thoughtful are adjectives that come to mind.The Hilton is also just a few short minutes' walk south of Herald Square (about 8 blocks), a few minutes' more walk north to Times Square (it really is an easy walk, and you're motivated by the fact that you can see Times Square from many blocks away, so it feels close while you're walking), and is located near several decent restaurants (Friedman's for breakfast, Smithfield for lunch, Flatiron Grill for dinner/drinks, etc.).Overall, I enjoyed my stay thoroughly, and I recommend the Hilton highly to any travels to NYC -- be they for business in the Fashion District or while on vacation.
user_name:
Brian C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is pretty good. however they don't have continental breakfast and breakfast cannot be ordered before 0730. And there are no microwaves in the bedrooms. SO we ordered breakfast the night before, they brought up a refridgerator and we kept our breakfast there overngiht. The next morning, we took our breakfast tot he the kitchen to warm up.

I stayed here 4 years ago with my mom, we had five days there. The hotel was great, clean tidy and staff very very helpful. The rooftop however had a charge to eat there which was a let down, but the place itself was great and in a fabulous location, going back in may next year.

I choosed this hitel due to my prior experience with Hilton. In this case, since I went for a coemrcial shoot, i needed good value for the money. Client was coming with us. So it needed to be also classy. Location was also important. I did not need downtown. I needed a central place with less traffic so i could move easily with the production vans. The property excelled all expectations. And overall, hotel personnel from top to bottom was perfect. Recruiting is doing a great job there.

No offense to the good Hampton’s out there, but this property just doesn’t live up to Hilton qualities. There were goods: the front desk folks were nice and helpful. Housekeeping did a great job. That said, there are just too many negatives. I am a Diamond Hilton member and I have stayed here twice, and just didn’t feel any effort to “take care of me”; no upgrades, nothing. The free breakfast that Diamond members get is not on property despite a great restaurant in the lobby. Somehow, Hilton can’t make a deal with the on-site place, so they give you a coupon and you can walk 1 block (2 mornings in the rain for me), to get take out food (the food was good though). The lobby is always a mess; there are always suitcases all over the lobby, which gives the hotel an unprofessional look. The concierge is a joke; the only thing they know how to do is to point to someone else and tell you to go see them. My last stay here was OK, but with off site breakfast, and some other issues, I think I will have to find a different hotel for NYC. I cannot recommend this hotel.

Our stay at the Hilton/Fashion District was perfect - the hotel was very nice, staff very helpful, location was perfect. The room was spacious for New York, amenities were spot on, beds were comfortable, room was quiet - great location for a good time and a good night's sleep.
user_name:
Joe M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We really like the Hilton brand and we chose this location because of its proximity to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. The staff was friendly and helpful; Millie was able to provide an early check-in for us which we really appreciated. The room and bathroom were very clean, well maintained and well stocked with bathroom amenities and a proper coffee/tea service. The rooftop bar is a treat. I would stay here again and I highly recommend this property.

The staff was so efficient that all our needs were met quickly. though the room is on the small side, this location makes up for that with big hospitality and special amenities like a really fun rooftop bar, RARE View.

Stayed one night and paid 150 for a 2 double room on a high floor. Hotel was clean and basic. I would compare it to a Courtyard Marriott. Central location near subway so it is easy to get uptown or downtown. No complaints but nothing to rave about either.

Stayed here a few times now and a very good value. Hotel is clean. Front desk staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Location is excellent too. Its in an OK neighborhood though - its is NOT Times Square but lots of night life and restaurant choices. Roof top bar is nice too. Security is noticeable and only one elevator working to go to bar.

My wife and I had a great stay in this hotel and really enjoyed our 4 night stay. My only surprise was the front of house reception staff who did out check in and check out. She did not really seem generally interested in us and I was disappointed in her customer service. I was not even asked how my stay went, just presented with the bill! I have to say, I was impressed with all the other staff I met which included, cleaners, bar & restaurant staff. They all were friendly and helpful.

We were going to an event nearby and came upon this hilton online. we like to stay at hiltons, and picked this one based on location and a competitive price. The manager, skylar, was terrific! he was so nice and customer service oriented which is such a pleasure when you are traveling!! the location was good. The room was on the small side, but clean and comfortable. over all, a good find, and very pleasant place to stay. we ate lunch in the restaurant and I had a good salmon salad and my daughter said her eggs were good. the front desk was also helpful in providing a car service to the airport. very pleasant stay.

Excellent on all counts. Staff at reception desk extremely helpful. Our only complaint is the restaurant opening time of 630am is never honored. Breakfast at that time is never available. We are served finally at about 650am and have to wolf down our meal to be at work by 730am. Not acceptable even with vouchers.
user_name:
Myron P
Princeton, NJ, United States

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here for 6 nights over the Easter weekend. The room was clean, quiet and well maintained. The staff were all extremely helpful and check-in was very straightforward. The hotel is in a good location, on a relatively quiet street but within a couple of minutes walk to the subway and about 10 minutes from Macy's and the Empire State. We also ate in Rare where the food and service was excellent. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely return.

Lovely clean hotel in a fab location for all the top tourist attractions in new york. 2 mins from the subway station which is just two stops from times sq but also only a 15ish minute walk. The roof top bar is lovely and does good cocktails with a wonderful view. Did experience some noise from the streets outside and noisy guests during the night but phoned reception and security came and saw to this asap. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend. We stayed as a party of three women and felt very safe here. Wifi connection in rooms was very good.

This is an excellent hotel. The rooms are beautiful. The staff is friendly and efficient. The hotel is in a terrific neighborhood, within walking distance of Madison Square Garden, and the Empire State Building. The neighborhood is less touristy than the location of other hotels; Times Square, for example. There are great restaurants and clubs in the area. Also, subway lines which run to all major museums, Rockefeller Center, the World Trade Center site. You can't miss with this hotel. Great value.
user_name:
Nancy E M
Albany New York, United States

review_body: Although not your typical Hilton (looks like it was built by and purchased from another hotelier), this location offers the exceptional service that is Hilton-typical. Rooms are small, but beautifully furnished and impeccably maintained. Staff members are friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and professional. It's just a few blocks from the location of a weekend workshop I was attending, and was the perfect spot for this event. An easy walk from Penn Station too -- important for those of us who arrive by train. Although right in the middle of everything, it's also remarkably quiet, being on a small side street between 6th & 7th. Lots of great places to eat and shop nearby. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it highly for NYC visitors looking for a nice little room in a convenient spot.

Upon arrival checkin was efficient and I took elevator (just steps from reception in the small Libby) to room. Many rooms are immediately across from elevators and although I requested quiet room and was on 17th floor I could hear lots of noises albeit not loud.Room was small and average level of decor, cleanliness, maintenance for a Hilton. Mattress was a bit soft and TV initially difficult to get working with the remote. Room service did not open until 6:30 for breakfast and order placed at 0600 arrived at 0645.There is a "rare" burger/bar on ground floor which I know from previous visit serves good food, good atmosphere and service.The location is great with lots of food choices in streets around the hotel and a fabulous whole foods close by.

Rooms very comfortable and clean and of a reasonable size. Serviced every day. Hotel location is great, everything you could possibly need is a few minutes walk away. I found the staff friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurant was really good and reasonably priced. I would have no hesitation staying here again.

Price was right, property was clean, and location was excellent in that it was very close to major subway lines. As someone else said, very solid hotel - nothing flashy but everything you could want in a clean reasonably priced hotel.
user_name:
TravelingLee
New York City, New York

review_body: I was totally happy with my stay at Hilton Fashion District. Great location - subway right around the corner and walking distance to many attractions, restaurants and not in the thick of Times Sq. Happy for choosing Hilton - and they tweet out to you upon your check in.

I've stayed here several times in the past year. There are a few reasons why. First, the location. A short, 10 minute walk from Penn; right around the corner from a Whole Foods (which, as weary travelers know, sells good / healthy prepared food); several blocks from entertainment and shopping; 1km from the Hudson Greenway, where I like to run. Second, the price. On a "good day" you can find a very competitive rate for the area. Third, quality. This is (or feels like) a newer hotel and feels fresh and crisp. I like that. Overall, the design is great and the staff is decent—though I occasionally struggle with the brusque NYC service style. Probably my only complaint is with the in-room coffee. Weak as water! Mosey one block down to Bean&Bean at 8 Ave and 26th for the real deal. In all, after many stays, I can say this is a solid Manhattan hotel.

Hotel was very well appointed, great feel and look. Staff was very courteous and amenities were of high quality. Plus the location in upper Chelsea was very convenient for our MSG experience, and use of Amtrak at Penn Station.

Fantastic location, 10 mins walk to Macy's, 15-20 min walk to times sq.Lovely rooms, comfy bed, fab shower.Staff are friendly and restaurant do a variety of food. Opt for a high room, roof top bar looked amazing but unfortunately my daughter was not old enough even to have a look so did not use. Would stay here again.

Had a 6 night stay in this excellent hotel. We've been to NYC before and this is the best hotel we've stayed in Manhattan. It's in a perfect, relatively quiet location. There is some noise during the night from the small amount of traffic, but this is very common for most hotels in Manhattan. The staff are very friendly and helpful - they genuinely want you to enjoy your stay. It has a vibrant roof top bar if you want a drink with a view. Excellent wifi connection.We would certainly book this hotel again on our next visit.

I am sure we had a bad experience but there were a number of issues The location is not so good if you are a tourist as there is nothing really that close - so you need to take a taxi or subway to get to anything

We stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for one night while in the city to see a Rangers game. The hotel was very well-priced (through the Hilton website), is conveniently located (less than a 10 minute walk from MSG), and is remarkably quiet for a NYC hotel. The hotel appears to be have been built fairly recently (certainly not a renovated older building). Rooms are on the small side, but are fine for a night or two -- you might feel cramped with two people in a king room for longer. The bathroom was very modern, and was a good size (for NYC); it had a decent sized walk-in shower. On the down side, we were unable to connect to the internet from our room (the network never appeared on any of several of our devices). Staff were very efficient. I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel has nice rooms & easy to get in & out. Bigger hotels have issues with how long it takes to get elevators. Very good service & attached to a nice bar/restaurant with a roof top bar. Good stay without a bunch of frills for business.

Really nice hotel which is in a great location. Didn't really spend much time in the hotel.as busy out and about. We were given.a.free upgrade as it was our wedding anniversary which was fantastic .....though I was also promised a little.something special would be sent up to the room but nothing was....which was a shame, we were too busy to get round to mentioning anything to the reception staff, so shouldn't moan really. Definetly recommend this hotel

4 star Hotel Very nice hotel, clean, nice size rooms, very good front desk clerks they always take care of the customers, the rate is good They have a nice restaurant with good prices,and food, everything you need is around, the hotel is next to many restaurants, and walking distance to shopping stores.

The location of the hotel was great - it was minutes walking to the flat iron building and was what felt like a very short walk to the high line and Washington Square Park. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a rooftop bar that was stunning and I was very happy that it was enclosed and had a heater for the winter time. Room service was great and the food was tasty. The coffee maker in my room was positioned too high - it was very difficult to make my coffee in the morning. The coffee cups and actual coffee were replenished each morning, but the stirrer and sugar were not. I did not complain nor ask for more, however, because I'm always running late. When I first got to the room, the TV remote was missing. Guest Services was very helpful and delivered one to me quickly, however the remote wasn't very responsive and the volume only works in increments of 3 - so it was always either too loud or too soft. The gym was fine enough - it was very small, but all I used it for was to run on the treadmill which was in very good working order. If I were to try and use weights, I probably would have been dissatisfied. Overall, my issues were pretty minor and I would still probably stay here again.

An absolute fantastic stay at the Hilton..Beautiful rooms, fantastic location, roof bar a must for the views. We visited for our daughters 18th birthday.. Skylar and Jose along with all the staff were all very helpful, nothing was too much trouble.. We will stay here again when visiting NYC !

Great location, rooms tidy and almost new. Roof top bar is awesome, a must when station at this hotel. Awesome view from the roof top bar. Walking distance to main locations. Service excellent and friendly staff. Suggest this hotel more for singles and couples and not quite for a family

Excellent hotel in a great location. Easy walk to Penn Station, a 2-3 block walk to two subway lines and with the added bonus of a Whole Foods right around the corner. Very clean room and we had a perfect view of the Freedom Tower from our 22nd floor room. Desk told us we may hear noise from the rooftop bar but we heard nothing. The only flaw was there were no ice machine and you had to order ice from room service. We passed on that. Book early as it fills quickly on weekends.

Convenient location in the Fashion District. My colleagues from New York didn't even know it was there. A short walk to Eataly, well worth the visit. Rooms are showing a bit of wear but remain at Hilton standards. A respectable choice.

There are tons of hotels to choose from in NYC and I have stayed in a bunch of them. The Hilton Fashion District will stay on the list of "stay again." The hotel is in Chelsea and is convenient to much of Manhattan either walking, by taxi or by subway. There are tons of restaurants and shopping options close by. Although it is several blocks from Time Square, it is a nice walk on a nice day. The rooms are well appointed with all the amenities needed. The room size is typical for NYC hotels. We had a room with a king bed and still had plenty of room. Besides, who goes to the Big Apple to sit in the room? We did not use the hotel restaurant or any other facilities. However, the front desk staff is outstanding. We will stay here again.

More positives than negatives - let's be clear. Location is good. Near good food and the rooftop bar is pretty nice. Great views of an iconic skyline. Lots of young people after work, so it wasn't my scene, but I enjoyed a beer and the skyline.The room I had must have been a smoking room or floor at one time. It was okay, but then it was there. The room was small. The furniture dated. Nice bed. Nice bath. Very small shower.I also tried the fitness centre, which was more like a room with a few things in it. I got my run in, so I beat back the crazy for a while.At several hundred dollars a night I just would have expected nicer rooms.Service was good. It was okay.

Stayed 2 nights in December 2015. On par with other Hilton properties. Clean and comfortable. Well appointed. Rooms are decent sized for NYC (had a one king room). Staff were fantastic! Accomodating to all of our requests. The attached restaurant and rooftop bar are great (bonus is they're right on property). Room service available through the restaurant Rare. We plan on staying again when we return to NYC this summer.

Great place to stay on the edge of all the fashion and glamour of NYC. Easy access to shopping, theater and local favorites. Staff extremely dedicated to ensuring satisfaction and a comfortable stay. The rooftop bar is fun and full of the NYC vibe. Great slider platter.

Stayed with a friend on a Tuesday night to attend the Wendy Williams show on Wednesday morning. Beautiful room, two queen beds with comfy linens. It was my birthday and the hotel gifted us with a bottle of wine and a birthday card in the room, as well as two complementary drinks in the lounge. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The show is a quick walk a block away. After the show, we had time to change, check out and stored our luggage while we spent a lovely spring afternoon sightseeing in the city. The hotel validates parking in nearby garage which was a big savings too!

I stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for a conference in NYC. It's a clean, nice hotel. Front desk staff is helpful and knowledgeable. The location is great, easy to walk to sights or take a cab, it's in Chelsea so a little off crazy Time Square. My only negative was the room was very noisy. I'm not talking street/city noise, I mean I could hear all my neighbors flushing their toilets . Or if people were in the hall I could hear their conversations perfectly, it did make it difficult to sleep without earplugs or white noise. I could actually here the guests next door chatting in their room as well, clearly there isn't much soundproofing or insulation between the rooms.I had room service, it was excellent.This overall is a good hotel, had it been better sound proofed it would have been excellent. I'd say here again with earplugs

This is a great hotel in a wonderful location in NYC! The staff is wonderful! Very quite and the resturant in the hotel has wonderful food. The hotel is located in the middle of what is happening. Far enough away form Times Square yet close enough to walk. Great location to subway!

We have been visiting New York for over 15 years.This is the first hotel we have stayed in that the stale smell of cigarettes is not lingering in the room.Thank you !!!!!Clean, comfortable bed, pillows, nice size room and bathroom. Enjoyed the complimentary Keurig maker in the room, thoughtful touch.I would suggest you try to get a room on the 10th floor or higher due to traffic noise below.It would suggest having brighter lights in the rooms, especially the entrance. I understand the security reasons behind the key and the elevator, it was a bit of a pain.We will be back.

Wow, this hotel staff went out of their way to make me feel welcome right from the get-go; heck, before I even arrived, I got an individualized welcome email from Assistant Front Office Manager Skylar Siminovsky, who, upon my short notice response, quickly worked with Front Office Supervisor Christine Drumgoole and Carolina Torres to have my room ready for check-in by 12:30. Heck, not only did they have my room ready for early check-in, they even recognized my Hilton HHonors Gold Member status by giving me an upgraded room, Room 2009 with a NICE big queen bed, large dresser, and super clean and well-stocked, luxurious bathroom.Upon arrival, Caroline and Martha at the Front Desk were super-welcoming and efficient with my check-in, Jhon was great with my baggage assistance both at check-in and check-out, Grigorio and David were excellent breakfast servers at the Rare basement restaurant, Lanny, Abbie, and Robin at the rooftop bar (Rooftop Rare?) were top-notch servers (Lanny mixed my Bombay Sapphire martini just right), Andrea at the Concierge Desk took "service with a smile" to a whole new level, and kudos to Joe (the elevator guard for the rooftop bar) and Jose as well. The breakfast buffet was quite tasty (my HHonors Gold membership got me a discount), the hot wings at the rooftop bar were strong and tasty.The gym was a bit on the small side but clean and well-equipped for its size. The dry-cleaning service was timely.All-in-all, world-class service all the way, as I have come to expect from Hilton-branded hotels, and a big reason why this NYC trip went waaaaaaayyyyyyy better than my last trip to the city 20 years earlier. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. My thanks to all of the above-named hotel staff as well as the ones whose names I've forgotten (my apologies to those folks).

Friendly staff, not one issue. Great location just 10 minute walk from Penn station. Lots of local bars, restaurants and takeaways. The roof top bar has an amazing view. The rooms are spotless and modern.

We had a nice stay at the Hilton, thaw staff a very helpful and friendly , rooms are nice and well equipped, a few items needed replacing on arrival which was done as soon as we reported them. It's quite central and there is a nice bar across the road and a great view from the roof bar. In all we had a pleasant stay.

For those of you aren't sure if you should stay here.....TRUST ME....this is a great location and has everything you need for the Singles and Couples. If you are having a bad day or heck even a bad week....Hilton Fashion District has a answer for that....Great Roof Top Bar to relax and just sit back to enjoy all the beautiful views. Now how many hotels have a Roof Top Bar....that's a Rare!By the way speaking of Rare...lets say you and your husband is hungry and you don't want to go out of the hotel...... Whelp Hilton Fashion District has an answer for that too....there's a very awesome grill call Rare downstairs. Great food....great host!And since we're talking about host....Skylar, Zoribel, and Martha are the best group of people to work with. Skylar is the best manager I have seen who works well getting you everything you need. Zoribel is the most dedicated employee I've ever seen. Who treats you like her own family in making you feel at home. And Martha goes above and beyond the call of duty in customer excellence. Thank you Martha again for helping me scan all of my expense receipts. That save me a whole lot of time having to find a Kinkos, walking for like another 15 -20 minutes,etc. So I'm Forever greatful and humble for this team of people. When you choose Hilton Fashion District.....you choose Eastern Hospitality....WELCOME HOME!

Ive just returned form a 6 night stay at this hotel and i can't praise the place enough. I had the most wonderful stay, the staff were so helpful in anything and everything that i needed. The reception staff were welcoming and very efficient we were checked in and into our room with in 5mins! The room was cleaned every day and clean towels given, room was spacious and had everything we need. With a safe and was provided free of charge.As this was my first time in New York all advice was greatly received so a quick mention to their concierge she was the most lovely lady and nothing was too much trouble! She helped us get our City Passes and booked us our transfers back to the airport which was a life saver. This was all done in 15mins and everything ran like clock work for us following the quick chat.The location was exactly what we needed, far enough out so that we could get some sleep away from all the nosy but close enough to enjoy New York in all it glory! Its a 10min walk from Madison Square Garden and Pen station which is perfect if youre getting the train in from the airport. It's about 20min walk from Time Square so its all manageable, also the Empire State Building is only 10mins around the corner. You will need to take a taxi down to the 9/11 memorial but it only costs $15.We ate at the Hotel restaurant one evening and had a lovely meal the staff were every friendly and food to a very high standard at a reasonable price, so i suggest you try it at least once. We also went to the rooftop bar for one drink and im telling you its a must!! It's the place to be, the views are amazing and was full with in 10mins of opening so definitely go check it out even if only for one drink.I don't have a single complaint about this hotel it was the perfect stay and i would recommend it to everyone.

There aren't many hotels south of Times Square so when you find a good one it is worth checking out. This hotel is a short walk south from Penn Station so you don't have to bother with the subway or a taxi if you're coming from there. It is located right by the Fashion Institute of Technology, which may be important to some. There are tons of great restaurants right near by and also a subway stop.There is a rooftop bar that is open all year round that is awesome. They serve some tiny snacks and great cocktails. It's a nice atmosphere and I want to come back in the summer when they have it opened up. You can charge your drinks to the hotel room, but this is more than a hotel bar, it would be worth visiting as a non-hotel guest.As a Hilton diamond, we received 2 coupons for $12.50 off at a nearby shop or continental breakfast coupons. We did the continental breakfast one morning and we received a bowl of cereal and a wonderful basket of some breads and danishes, very tasty. Not sure if it would be worth upgrading to full breakfast because we weren't interested that morning (lots of brunch options nearby).The rooms we received was kind of tiny, especially the bathroom, but that is normal for New York. I'm not sure what the suite options are for this property, but might be worth asking if you need more square feet. The hallways can be kind of noisy because the doors close very loudly (and it's not rude guests, it's just the heavy doors). You can hear some noise from neighbors as well, but nothing worth complaining about when we were staying (possibly make sure not to get a room that can be connected if you are worried about that). Unfortunately, the mini-fridge was completely filled with drinks and snacks to be bought, no room for us to even put a water bottle.The one other odd thing is there was no doorman. There is a concierge so I don't have any complaints there, it's just odd not having a doorman to say hello to or ask a quick question about best bar to go to or something like that. Anyway, a very minor detail. I would stay here again and just try to get a slightly bigger room and ask about the refrigerator situation.

This Florida girl decided to celebrate her 35th birthday in Ny. I decided to stay at the Hilton because of its location. I'm in the beauty industry and there was an international beauty trade show the same weekend as my Bday minutes away from the Hilton. The hotel is georous and the service was exceptional! Jose at the front desk is amazing and assisted me when I lost my wallet and all of my Vaca money. Although I lost over $600 in cash :( the hotel staff were great in helping me the remainder of my trip! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, and we'll definitely be back!

I really liked this hotel. In the Chelsea area. Decent sized room (for NYC). Seemed newly refurbished. Comfy bed. Good sized bathroom with great water pressure. I was on the 20th floor with a good view of the Empire State Building. Convenient to several subway stops. Lots of great restaurants and diners around. Good central location convenient to many sites. Some reviewers complained about the elevators. They were very fast and convenient for me. No problem at all. I used my AAA membership to get a great price.

Perfect location for an overnight biz trip! Close to transportation, walking distance to the West Village, Chelsea Market, the Meatpacking district, the High Line. Seamless check in. The hotel has some edgy decor that ties it to the Fashion District. Yes, room was small but adequate. Bathroom in good condition, and very clean. The room had a keurig machine. I don't think I've seen that before in a Hilton! The room key is needed to access the elevator -- a great security feature. Don't miss the rooftop bar -- nice view, low key and comfortable setting. Limited menu. Breakfast was fine -- fresh items, pleasant and competent service. I would certainly recommend this property and I would stay here again.
user_name:
LuckyTraveler18
New York City, New York

review_body: Clean well appointed room, small (it NYC!) but functional, nice staff, lovely roof top bar (but closed too early), great location. If the price is right and it's where you need to be stay here, but don't go out of your way, not worth compromising with so many other options in the City.

The hotel is very well located, comfortable and clean. The staff is nice, but unfortunately not as good as usually at Hilton. The rooms are not very big, but enough for two :) We were lucky to be upgraded to a room with a view on lower Manhattan, very nice!

Stayed here on a shopping trip to the city. Perfect location on 26th street. The staff are excellent and check-in was very efficient and timely. Great security feature in that the room key also allows elevators access. Our room was on an upper level and was immaculate. Bedding was pristine as well as the rug and the bathroom was immaculate. In addition to the cleanliness it was quite large with a walk in shower. Just love those Peter Thomas Roth toiletries. Being that the day started at -9 the room was so nice and toasty/no drafts. Beds and pillows so comfortable too. In addition to the accommodations there are restaurants on the premises. Don't hesitate to stay here.

As a frequent visitor of this hotel my daughter and I always have a wonderful experience. Caroline at the front desk even arranged for the return of my phone left in a cab. Even during the Storm of the Century the hotel kept all their staff active and the hotel stayed up and running with good food and good pleasant service.

Stayed for a quick business trip. King high floor. Rooms are New York small although adequate. Bathroom is reasonably sized. Comfortable bed. The only chair in the room is the desk chair.Rates do change based on occupancy. I checked 2 days before checkin and the rate had dropped by $20.

I always stay at the Hilton Fashion District when I am in Manhattan. Skylar, Elan and their staff make sure that my favorite room is ready for me and check in is effortless. If you like personalized service and exceptional surroundings than this is the Hotel for you!
user_name:
Ford F
North Brunswick, NJ, United States

review_body: I stayed for 5 nights in February and could not fault this place. Check in was quick and easy and the reception staff were very helpful. The rooms were spotless and the beds were very comfortable.
