I stayed in a room with 2 double beds and as this was a corner room on the 10th floor there was no street noise and no noise from the lifts either. I slept like a log each night. Location wise, 3 the hotel is close to a subway, and is only a 10 minute walk from Madison Square Garden. It's hard to find many words when you can't find fault, but the best endorsement I can give is that I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Great location when working in New York. Walkable to some lovely bars, restaurants and even the sites (Empire State 15 mins, Times Square 10 Mins) Very attentive staff who really go out of there way to make your stay enjoyable. My room had a great view of the New York skyline including the Empire State!The hotel offers optional vouchers for a local delicatessen rather than their own breakfast buffet (if your rate is inclusive of breakfast). I opted to take the vouchers and enjoyed the walk early doors!Would certainly stay again either with work or on holiday.

If you like to sleep in +70 degrees then you are all set- book here! Great location, nice accommodations, BUT if you like to sleep cold don't even consider this hotel. The maintenance man,while sweating, tells me "the hotel Does not have the air conditioning on at this time of year. Maybe open the window(an inch-not joking) and I'll have housekeeping bring a fan up" AM I PAYING +200/night for a lousy nights sleep because the hotel chooses to not turn the air conditioning on??? I guess this genius is because I'm awake at 2:50 AM typing this review. Will be trying to make other arrangements in the morning even though I I will have to pack up my stuff, but a good nights sleep in an air conditioned room will be worth it. WHERE AM I?? New York or a third world country (exaggerating here but I hate sleeping in temps above 70) HOT!!! even with the little fan that was provided. Suggestion-PROVIDE A/C!!

I stay here once a year, a full week, for NYC Toy Fair and have for several years.Clean and spacious rooms, courteous and helpful staff that go out of the way to accommodate. Great restaurant in the hotel and in the neighborhood. Note this is a neighborhood and even given this is NYC quiet by comparison to others. Beds are great, shower is good and bathrooms are big. Can you tell I am a fan?

This property is a perfect fit for my business trips to NYC - walking distance to Penn Station and a few blocks from my office off Madison Square Park. The room is efficiently small but I felt comfortable - enough room in the closet for a few days clothes and able to maneuver around the bathroom without feeling like I was in the bedroom still (as I've felt at other NYC hotels). Your room key card gives you access to only your floor in the elevator, so I felt safe. There is a club at the hotel too with a security person for that elevator, so I felt safe in general in the lobby as well. Order in dinner as well as breakfast - very fast and very good. Recommend the Greek Salad with Lamb Chops!

My experience at Hilton in chelsea was average. It was a small hotel with very basic features and accommodations. The guest rooms were clean, however our room was very cold. The staff helped us by changing our room to a better room, on a higher floor. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.
user_name:
carolkV2617NN
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here at the end of January 2016. Initial impressions were good and it was easy to find being almost on the corner of West 26th and 7th Avenue and 6 blocks from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. One of the smaller hotels but very good nonetheless. Not being used to New York the noise from outside came as a surprise - sirens, taxi horns, refuse trucks et al all day and night! However, we were 'only' on the 10th floor and at the front so no surprise really. Despite only being 5 years old,I had to check the window was shut due to the amount of noise coming in. It was a poor design really for a relatively new hotel.Anyway, the room was a reasonable size, bed was comfortable, bathroom good but lighting poorly planned in the actual room. No proper cups - paper take away style - which makes sense since they don't have to wash up!A nice touch was the bottle of wine given to me as I had just celebrated a notable birthday - thank you! A downside ? Well we wanted to have a couple of proper glasses 'No problem Sir, we'll get them brought up' which they did. Except they wanted to charge 6 dollars just for doing so! A shock when used to UK hotels who just do that sort of thing and really unacceptable. We declined them as we thought they should be in the room like any normal hotel. Overall a nice place to stay, very central - well we thought so - and easy to find. Just watch the 'add ons'! Oh and go to the roof terrace for fantastic views across New York while having a drink!

The rooms are very clean and the staff is very friendly. I have been staying here for years! I will continue to stay here when I come to New York, the location is perfect it is close to so many things even the train station.

We came for a day in the city and a following day of theatre. Walked all day and looked forward to a little tv at night We did get a little room, but it's NYC. However, our bathroom light would not turn off and our TV was not working. Engineer tried fixing tv but after an hour, we asked that he just leave.

Room was clean but very tiny. Staff was very nice and helpful. Wish the restaurant attached had earlier dinner hours. Made it hard to eat and run to MSG in time for a game with out rushing. The only complaint is the room had a strong floral perfume sent that made it hard to breath when entering,if you have asthma you know what I mean. Even my son complained of the scent.

I travel a ton for work, and have been here this week for a conference nearby. Overall, it's a nice looking hotel, with good amenities and better than average restaurant. Easy to walk to many areas too. Rooms are a good size for New York as well. You may be used to larger if you don't visit big cities often. Staff is adequate, but front desk is always talking amongst themselves and are really informal. I hate being asked for my room number, any good hotel has trained their staff for security reasons to not do this. Their room service staff is almost hostile, they say nothing and are super abrupt with you. The people who deliver your food want nothing to do with you either.It's been a frustrating experience as a whole. Ice cold water in the morning means starting your day with an awful shower. Water doesn't warm up after 20+ minutes. Shower is poorly designed as well, you have to drench yourself while reaching in to turn on the water.Heat is difficult to control, the room is never a comfortable temperature. I actually had to have my heat on and window open one night as the thermostat didn't seem to do anything.Blackout drapes don't work. I've spent way too long each night trying to lower them without breaking them, but they get stuck as they're on a chain. Housekeeping will open them in the morning, so you get to repeat in the evening when you just want to go to bed.I wouldn't come back myself, the cold shower and poor heating and cooling is enough for me, when you travel frequently it's a deal breaker unfortunately.

I'd never stayed at this location and I actually really enjoyed the proximity to so many things. It's quieter than the one just a few blocks up near MSG. Front Desk staff was super, super friendly. I had some technical difficulties, like the battery to the key mechanism to the room had died and I was locked out. They fixed it really quickly. Had some other things go wrong, but none particularly dire or "I'm never staying here again and they should burn it down," you know? However, when I filled out the survey from Hilton after my stay, I was really honest about what they could have done. I then spent a few days corresponding with the Asst. Front Desk Manager Skylar. The authentic concern for my issues that Skylar expressed was truly impressive. He showed a genuine interest in understanding my experience and how he could make it better for next time. It was really nice to have that kind of acknowledgment, despite my issues being relatively minor (compared to illness, or like, lack of food...). He worked with me to come to a resolution quickly and in a generous way. It was also done in a way that wasn't just "Here is a bunch of stuff, don't be mad!" Our conversation (via email) was really great. I love Hilton Hotels, honestly. I've stayed with Hilton on a few different occasions, and this was the first time I've had problems. The way it was handled was really impressive and professional. In terms of other stuff - the room was clean, the right sized bed, new and modern, etc. All the stuff you'd want from a hotel in NYC. I only stayed the night (because I live here in NY), but I would totally have a friend stay here for a week or two.

Hotel is located near fashion district and downtown attractions. The rooms were so small. Price of the rooms were reasonable compared other brand in nearby area.It has a nice restaurand on basement with good food. there is pub across the street where you can pop in and drink something.

Without asking, they put me on the top floor in a large room. We got a bottle of red wine at check, too. The only negative was temperature. The room was either too cold (A/C on), or stuffy with the A/C off. (It was a very warm XMAS). Overall, between the front desk service, and convenience, we are sold on this hotel.

The hotel is chic, great location, rooms nice but very small.Rare is a terrific restaurant for brunch and dinner--given the sub zero temperatures--it was a surprising quality restaurant. Look for Timothy--he is sunshine in a service body and he makes a meal energetic and fun.A VERY SPECIAL shout out t Concierge Dwayne Wilson. We went to the lobby to get a map and ride the elevator to the rooftop lounge to check out the view. We watched him work with a couple in front of us as he worked through several logistics and possibilities, in a very focused and clear way. They very much appreciated the advice. When he turned his attention to us, he gave us a map, asked what we were done that evening and we said sunset viewing and dinner at Rare, He then asked us if we like Ballet. Happens we love Ballet but did not get tix on this trip. With a twinkle in his eye, he offered us to tickets to the New Your City Ballet that evening. A client had booked wrong date, so due to his generosity, we were in 6th row Orchestra seats ninety minutes later. More special in that my sister's first trip to NYC--so thank you, Dwayne Wilson. You rock!

The hotel position was great for my stay: 20 minutes from the office, 10 minutes from customer office. This was the reason why we all booked this hotel. Food at the Rare is good, hotel service meets the expectation being an Hilton. Room was comfortable even if air conditioning needs a minor fix.

This hotel has great views both North to Empire State Building and South to World Trade Center. The location is close to Penn Station, subway and bus lines. Limited breakfast menu however there are some great reasonably priced places to eat less than a block away, Skylar at the property was a joy to work with! Thanks to you and also to your great front desk staff who gutted it out in the cold temperatures this past week.

EVERYTHING was absolutely wonderful!! The staff was extremely friendly, the breakfast buffet awesome, the room was clean and comfortable (not a huge room but it is NY, and it was perfect for my cousin and I), location was perfect in relation to the trains, Dunkin Doughnut, Starbucks, Subway Sandwiches and Time Square!! A must stay location!!!

We stayed at the Hilton Fashion District during the month of february and our overall experience was excellent. It is a much smaller Hotel compared to other Hilton Hotels in New York and it makes every detail more personal. It is in a very nice neighborhood, away from Times Square but close enough to go over for a walk. Excellent front desk and concierge service. We will definitely return.

I stayed here for 3 nights in February 2016 along with a group. We occupied 8 rooms in total. Before arriving I did enquire at the hotel about getting rooms on the same floor. However, due to the configuration of the rooms and the relative size of each floor, then this was not possible. When we arrived at the hotel, check in was fairly swift considering the number of rooms and I was sorting these out for everybody in the group. The majority of the rooms were double doubles. These were fine, although did seem a little small and access around the beds was a little tight. Perhaps my judgement is clouded slightly due to the cost of each room, especially as other nights nearby where about half the price at sub $100 compared to what we paid at $200 per room per night.The rooms were clean and tidy and the bathroom was of good size with plenty of towels. However, there was no baths and after a long day of walking around NYC a bath would be just what is needed.I used the onsite restaurant for breakfast as I had free continental breakfast. This was a fairly basic affair and I would have prefered a more substantial offering but this was not to be without paying for it in addition.Check out was again rather painless, although the lifts seemed to be a little slow at that time of the morning, although the lobby did not seem particularly busy. We stored our luggage for the day and the porter took this away on two carts. However, when we came to collect it he simply wheeled the carts out to where we were and left them for us to unload. The result was that i did not offer a tip. If you want tipping then at least make an attempt to offer some form of service.Overall the hotel was good, but i think I would probably look elsewhere next time, if only to have larger rooms, especially if sharing with others.The location itself was great as it offered easy access to the subway and not too far to walk to Empire State Building and on to Times Square.

In town on a stopover for 2 nights on our way to Ireland with family, celebrating my 60th year. My daughter shared this with the staff before we arrived and they all went out of their way to ensure I (we) had a great time. The rooms are the usual NYC type in this category; on the small side but clean, well appointed and with a good comfortable bed.We ate dinner and breakfast at the restaurant, once for each. The dinner was okay, the breakfast not so good. The roof-top bar was superb. Along with the main hotel staff, the bar and restaurant staff were excellent. This hotel is in a convenient and central location for Manhattan sightseeing. In our view this and the staff make it the place we will stay on future visits.

This hotel has a great location on 6th Avenue just below Macy's and Times Square! Rooms are well equipped and clean - although they were smaller than the ones I stayed in in NYC last year. Just one note - in your jet lagged state - at 10.00pm having been up since 3.00am for flights from the UK here; make sure your shower head has been left pointing inside the shower by the people servicing the rooms - this will save you a lengthy mopping up exercise and building a dam of towels when you can barely keep your eyes open! Staff are friendly and helpful - used the Rare grill a couple of times which is OK and used the left luggage service for keeping bags before the red eye back to London Heathrow!!! Altogether successful stay in NYC!!!!!

Had zero complaints with my recent weekend stay at the Hilton Fashion District. Rooms were a great size by NYC standards, and very clean. Service was very good and the location was ideal. Really enjoyed the restaurant and rooftop bar..great service, good food, and tasty drinks!

I stayed in that hotel for 4 nights. The location was very convenient for me. 15 minutes walk to customer and company offices.The checkin on Sunday evening was very fast. I got room 1611. The room itself has a nice shower but it is very small. What was missing is shower gel. There was shampoo but no shower gel. I had to explicitly ask after I finished my own one.As I came from Europe I was very tired and went to bed early. During the night it became then very noisy. Even on 16th floor I hear clear and loudly the trucks taking care about the garbage.So I asked next morning 06:00 am for a new room. I relocated to room 1701 which was really quite but of the same small size.I can't judge breakfast I took it at several places outside. What I haven't seen is a lounge. In the Europe / Africa Hiltons I got in most of the time access to it.Checkout was ok.To summarize it was good not great and I will go back again.

Friendly staff, clean room, tasty dinner on an exhausting and grueling business trip where every day was a hassle-filled adventure. The experience at the hotel helped to wash away the insanity of the rest of the days I spent there for work. Being able to come back to a clean, quiet hotel where there was great food and friendly, helpful staff was a great relief! What more could I ask for?

I traveled through New York City for a last minute trip and had no idea what to expect from staying in the fashion District Hilton. I am a Hilton fan but some are more different than others. This Hilton went above and beyond my expectations. The room was impeccable and check-in was a breeze. Polite and kind staff that were able to advise me on locations in the area that were great to eat at and grab a tasty cup of coffee. The hotel is nestled into a nice part of New York that was like a visit in the movies during the winter months. Great view from my room that overlooked all the roof tops and provided a birds eye view of the Patriot Tower.The last outstanding comment belongs to the manager Elan Bielski. A consummate professional. I spoke with him regarding a matter and he not only assisted me with by providing the proper guidance but did it in a kind and proficient manner. He also found time in his schedule weeks later to follow up with me and ensure I was taken care of. Based on my experience with the staff, the clean room and the excellent food/bar, the fashion district Hilton will always be my choice when I am in New York. Thank You Crew.

Felt right at home pitching my line while staying here! The atmosphere is ideal for fashion artists with the lobby and room decor. Also right in the heart of Chelsea so I was close to everything. I got some great work done and felt inspire while doing so!

I was a guest of the Hilton Fashion District two Fridays in a row primarily as a result of the excellent reception I received from Skylar and his willingness to see to my satisfaction as a first time and also repeat guest. The room was spotless and looked as though I was the first guest using it. This hotel is right in the middle of the city and offers easy access to anything you may want to see or do. I stay in the city frequently and would not think of staying anywhere else.

Great location for MY needs! Friendly staff and the rooms totally accomadate my needs. LOVE Rare, the Restaurant and the Bar is a personal favorite with good service and great drinks! The restaurant and a very friendly and attentive bar staff!

Got in late on Friday Night (2-5-16), hotel staff attentive, especially Zoribel at front desk who quickly, efficiently, happily checked us in. Room was exceptional, clean and beautiful view of Empire State building.

I had a short and sweet 2 night stay at this Hilton for a business trip, but nothing short of a great experience in customer service. Upon arrival I was greeted by Mily at the front desk. She was very helpful as I was checking in late after my flight was delayed due to the weather. She arranged for my luggage to be taken up to my room while I checked in to make the process as smooth as possible. As I hadn't eaten, Mily pointed out some places that would be open for me to get food and also took the care to ask me if I'd like her to order food to be delivered to the hotel so that I wouldn't have to wait long for my food to arrive once I settled in my room.As a frequent traveler for business I had thought the days of customer service such as the one I received were long gone, until my stay at this Hilton! I will definitely be returning!

I had a wonderful visit and the helpfulness of the hotel staff was exceptional. I specially want to thank Zoribell for all her assistance and helpful tips on local activities. I look forward to returning later this year with other friends and family and will be sure to look for this gem of a hotel. Thank you all again.

We arrived at 11:30am and Martha not only had a room ready but proceeded to upgrade us as well. The team at the front desk are wonderful. Don't hesitate to comment or ask for anything, they are all very accommodating. Martha, Angelica and the front end manager made our stay most pleasant. Rooms are clean and quiet, location is fabulous and personnel are pleasant and helpful. We will be be back soon. Thanks !

After a day of travel with my fiance from Aberdeen, Scotland we arrived in NYC. Tired but excited Zoribel checked us in and made us immediately feel welcomed and at home. The room we received is beautiful and modernist with a really good set of toilettries and a brill hairdryer! The bed is very comfy and considering you are bang in NYC we heard no noise and slept soundly. I will definitely come back next time we are in New York.

I've never stay at a hotel where the front desk treated me so nice!! And is so friendly... Ms. Zoribel was excellent, she gave us an upgrade to a higher floor when we arrived to the hotel and because we were celebrating my friends birthday she also gave us a bottle of wine. I must say Ms. Zoribel knows how to treat her guests.

First time here and enjoying every bit of it, definitely coming back. Very friendly staff, excellent location, and great customer service. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families visiting NYC
user_name:
Stephon N
New York City, New York

review_body: I have been coming to this location every year and very pleased to be welcomed by Mily at the front desk. She is a breathe off fresh air, she makes you feel like you have never left home. This is the reason we always come to this Hilton NYC. The total experience from check in to the amenities are always world class. It is like a home away from home. It all starts with exceptional service from Mily. She is definitely a superstar a treasure for the Hilton. Thank you so much for our visits Mily. Alicia

Best. Welcome. Ever.After a 12 hour trip from Aberdeen we arrived in Manhattan to a lovely, warm welcome from Zoribel at reception.After hearing we were here for our anniversary, she upgraded us to a high-rise floor with stunning views of the Empire State Building.The room itself is incredibly spacious for Manhattan with comfy bed, welcomed black out blinds and lots of nice extras.Expecting to have a great stay here this weekend :)

I tried to make this my go to hotel in NY. it's location works for my business needs. But I have had some kind of problem with the staff every time I stay here. This time, my assistant got locked out other room at 2am, the front desk hassled her for no reason. Last time house keeping disregarded the Do Not Disturb sign on our room, stood outside of our room making noise because she wanted to clean the room. She actually argued with us about our schedule that day, we were holding her up apparently. Both times I complained and the staff seemed indifferent and bewildered. I probably wont stay here again.

This was our first trip to the US and after reading reviews on trip adviser we decided to book the Hilton New York Fashion District. So glad we did!After shopping around we found this hotel to be a great price for a queen room with private bathroom. Rooms were clean and tidy with room for our luggage (people mentioned how small NY hotel rooms are, but I thought the size of our room was fine). Bathroom was perfect and Bed super comfy. We found it to be pretty quiet too (18th floor) Staff were always friendly and ready to help and give suggestions.We arrived early and were grateful for the staff to arrange for our room to be cleaned first so we could check in sooner - thank you!!Restaurant next door 'Rare grill' is a must... amazing food and service.Roof top bar is also a must do - it was only open till around 11 - 11.30pm but well worth it for the views and cocktails - delicious!Only negative was there was no free WIFI in the room which was disappointing. We ate at the restaurants a few times so managed to just use it then... not a deal breaker.We have travelled a fair bit and like to walk everywhere - this hotel was in a great location for a few reasons.- It was close to not one but two starbucks (hello free WIFI). Always our first stop in the morning :) - It was only about a 10 min walk to Madison Square garden and about a 20 min walk to Times Square. Very convenient for hop on and hop off bus tours- Right across the street from subway so super easy to get around to other areas- We were coming back later at night every night and always felt safe Will definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends and family and anyone who wants a reasonably priced hotel in a good location

My fiancé and I stayed here for our anniversary weekend. Our room was facing the Empire State Building (it doesn’t get better than that), we both loved the location but mainly the great service that was provided to us by Zoribel. Thank you Zoribel for making our anniversary and unforgettable one and for accommodating all our needs.
user_name:
KATHERINE A
Staten Island, New York

review_body: I thought that the cleanliness of this room surpassed expectations but was very disappointed that the room had no refrigerator other than the one that charged to take anything from and had no place to put/get ice. I have never been to a hotel that didn't provide ice or an ice bucket for its patrons.

I stayed at the Hilton for two nights on a business trip recently. The hotel is well located and if you are used to walking, its an easy walk to Penn Station 5th Ave, Broadway, etc. The front desk staff were fun and made the checking in process a breeze. What I should have done was taken the offer to upgrade to a higher floor as each night that I was there (on the 5th floor) I was woken up at 3:30 by the delivery truck, etc outside in the loading zones - its amazing how loud they were each night. I literally just got up at 4:00 and went to the hotel gym because there was no getting back to sleep.The gym is tiny, but it did the trick - the treadmils (2) were very good condition and there was an eliptical and a stationary bike as well as a free standing full body weight/resistance machine. That is all there is room for - its a tiny room. There was a yoga mat there, but it was so dirty and gross that I almost threw it away for the the hotel - they could use to invest in a couple more of those and toss that nasty one.The bathroom in the hotel room is large, with plenty of room for toiletries, curling iron, etc, but the bathroom is a bit dated, and there is absolutely no way of turning on the shower without getting assaulted with cold water - as you have to be fully in the shower to access the fixture, this a design flaw, and aggravating. Overall it was a fine stay at a good price, but the street noise was a killer.

I love this place! The location is perfect.. I was there during the big snow storm and I couldn't ask for a better staff to be stuck with. The supervisor at the front desk helped me with my extended stay. She kept me up to date with my flight and I'm pretty sure she gave me a good rate. Look for her when you come here! I think her name started with a Z. Zori- something... Next time I'm in the city I will not look anywhere else to stay.

I just spent a week staying at the Hotel. It was very clean, a great location. The staff were amazing. Especially Christine Drumgoole and Caroline at the front desk. There customer service was outstanding. I've been a Hilton Diamond and Gold for many years and I'm going to make the Hilton New York Fashion District my NY home away from home.

I was here for a weekend visit. I was very happy with the hotel location and the easy access to the transportation in the area. I stayed in a clean room, nice size room with my buddy. The staff was very friendly and Zoribel was able to call me a cab as I was running late for a business meeting. I was very impressed with the customer service and will definitely visit again.

I'm truly happy I chose this hotel for my visit to the big apple. The staff was exceptional and I was greeted by Zoribel who accommodated me and made my visit truly amazing. I will definitely book again :)The hotel is in a great location and I was able to easily access all the touristic attractions that I was interested in.

Whenever my colleagues and I travel to New York on business, as Hilton HHonors members our preference is always to stay at the Hilton New York Fashion District.The rates are always competitive and the hotel offers a great restaurant and lobby bar (Rare Bar & Grill) and have one of New Yorks best rooftop bars. The rooms are clean and modern and have all the amenities that one would come to expect such as coffee maker, mini-bar, high speed internet and comfortable beds.On my last trip I had to organise a complex delivery of a package to the hotel during my limited stay and the manager Skylar Siminovsky went out of his way to coordinate this on my behalf in an efficient, professional and courteous manner. The service from all the other front desk staff was second to none with them always going the extra mile to ensure our stay was memorable and hassle free.Even during the chaos of "Blizzard 2016" where a lot of staff were stranded at the hotel, the staff still continued to provide a happy and worry free experience for us at the hotel.The location of the hotel on W 26th is also very central meaning you can easily walk in one direction to visit West Village and SoHo and equal distance in the other direction to get to the theatre district and central park.I highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in New York for either work or pleasure.

Clean, modern rooms, friendly staff. Great hotel with an attentive staff. I needed an extra room to practice in (I am a classical musician in the city on business) and the front desk clerk, Milly went above and beyond to make sure I had the space I needed. I would definitely stay here again!

Stayed at this hotel with family in 2 seperate rooms, as it was my birthday we were very kindly upgraded to floor 20 we had a great view towards the Empire State building, we also received a complementary bottle of wine and a platter of fresh fruit as a birthday treat the staff where absolutely amazing very friendly and helpful. A very greatfull thankyou to Shelley who tried very hard to get our airport transport sorted out for us (we did arrive on time for our flight).The hotel is in a great location within a short walk to Times Square, subway, MSG to name just a few placesFood and drinks from the bar were reasonably priced again with great service.Due to the difficult blizzard conditions the staff appeared to cope very well Thankyou all for a fantastic experience

The hotel was great and was in a great location on 26th street. It's a 2 minute walk to the subway for access to rest of Manhattan. The room was ok, there was 3 of us in a room with 2 double beds and it was a bit of a tight squeeze. The room was supposed to be suitable for 3. When we booked on booking.com the price seemed very good, however when we paid it turned out to be over $100 more for 4 nights due to taxes and charges. That wasn't made overly clearly when we booked. The rare restaurant attached to the hotel was amazing. Food was so good. It was my friends birthday and they made a real fuss over her which was nice! Hotel will give you complimentary water also if you ask.

We booked this hotel because it was close to the Convention Center. I was not expecting much, but I was surprised. First the staff, it was very nice and polite...going out of their way to help. The bar is good and the staff there was very nice and helpful. I understand that NYC has so many options to eat, but some of our colleagues did not want to go out, and the food was good....not only people from the hotel, a lot of locals eating and drinking in there as well, which in my book is a good sign. The rooms are clean and NYC spacious...I liked, I will go back, and I do recommend.

I had a great time at this Hilton hotel during my family's visit to NY! Its located in a central part of the city, which made it so easy to get around. the service was also superb! Milly at the front desk was very accommodating of me and my family's needs when finding a room for us. we will definitely stay here again when we make a trip back!

The place gets rave reviews but it is nothing close to a 4 star hotel. The room was decent and being an HHonors member we were 'upgraded' to a room on a higher floor. Unfortunately it was till at the back of the building and cheek by jowl with the next s being higher up didn't make a damn bit of difference. The place was only built in 2010 and although the rooms aren't a bad size, the bathrooms are like postage stamps - no space, nowhere to put anything, nowhere to hang anything up, and tiny showers so badly designed - you have to put your arm through the hot or cold water to access the taps - stupid and dangerous. The soundproofing is poor - no traffic noise but the neighbours and the housekeeping staff were very noisy. The desk staff are friendly enough but look like the B team. The hotel has no lounge or seating area so there is nowhere to sit when the weather is bad except in your room. The bar/restaurant is a private concession and while the staff are really nice and the food isn't bad, it has constant loud TV or really bad music blaring all the time, and it's dark even in the middle of the day. Other things? Hands up who doesn't hate those stupid minibar fridges favored by Hilton? Finally, can someone please teach the housekeeping staff that the "do not disturb' sign means we actually DON'T WANT TO BE DISTURBED? I mean, fancy that - guest who really wants some peace and quiet...

I stayed here to visit a friend and see Hamilton - great location a quick walk from the train station and clean, nice room. The huge snow storm hit the east coast and I needed to leave early. When I went to check out early Caroline was fantastic and sorted it all out for me at no additional charge for the early departure. WOW - I did not expect that level of service. Thanks, Caroline!

Hotel was a great experience, very friendly service, good location, excellent food at the restaurant. They could use an ice machine on each floor but outside of that it was perfect. The front desk check in was very friendly. Try the online check in to find your room.

I was very please with my stay at the Hilton New York Fashion District. I was greeted by the friendly staff as soon as I walked in. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very attentive. After a long flight, I needed a place to relax and enjoy myself. Luckily, the hotel had a rooftop bar with the most amazing views and tasty cocktail drinks. I cannot stress enough how great the staff was. I forgot my charger and Zoribel at the front desk was kind enough to charge my phone for me. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and I look forward to staying there again when I am back in New York.

I checked in on Thursday and asked for an upgrade, since I am an Honors member. My room on the 19th floor was small. I did not receive a drink (usually bottled water on arrival). The heater didn't work but engineering came immediately and fixed it. The shade on the window didn't close at night, but that was addressed in a friendly and prompt way as well. The mini bar didn't open but I let that go as I was exhausted from travel. The good news was that due to the Blizzard I had to check out the next morning instead of staying to Sunday. The hotel courteously did not charge me for the unused nights and I am assuming they credited my charge card accordingly. The room service from RARE was excellent. Best BBQ brisket Po' Boy I ever had. NY cheesecake with strawberries was outstanding.

When we visited NYC, me and my family decided to say in Hilton fashion. We are so happy we did. We loved the attention and service we got. They definitely have great service and help you without hesitation. Zoribel one of the workers there gave us information about the restaurants and where to go in the city. We are very grateful for her help.We are definitely recommending this hotel to anyone who comes to NYC and needs a place to stay.

Nice clean hotel. Modern decor, very comfortable beds, valet parking available. Ask for an inside facing room to lower the level if street noise. The staff was accommodating and very friendly. I would stay here again.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton New York Fashion Industry and was so impressed with the service I received. The hotel is clean, the location is excellent and you are in close proximity to the train if you want to leave the immediate area but honestly if the weather is nice walking around the area is great. Millie provided me with great customer service and I took all her suggesitons into things that I inquired. I love staying at the Hilton hotels and this was no exception.
user_name:
Mio0111
New York City, New York

review_body: Fabulous hotel and motivated staff. All of them are eager to assist. The bar in the hotel Rare is a great way to spend some time and if the rooftop is open its a nice tiki bar feel with a view. Great location and local to the Javits Center.

I was having a rough day. My flight was delayed, I hit my big toe with my luggage, and I was hungry. I just wanted to get to my room and lay down. A nap and a meal was all I was looking forward to. When I arrived to the hotel I wasn't in the best of moods. Mily assisted me while I was checking in. She was amazing! Her aura is contagious. She greeted me with a big smile and it made me want to smile too. She was efficient and swift with the process and offered more accommodations than I expected. My spirits were lifted. I ended up going to the room changing and going out to eat with some friends. My stay at the Hilton was a lot more enjoyable because of Mily's assistance. I hope to encounter more employees like her on my next business trip.

I was planning to go to New York this weekend but there is a blizzard about to hit. I called the hotel to cancel and they said they couldn't because I had a no-cancellation rate. The only way they would cancel was if my train was cancelled. But AMTRAK won't cancel the trains until after the storm hits and I didn't want to get stuck in New York. I called the hotel back and spoke with Elon. He was so understanding and cancelled it immediately with no penalty. It was customer service the way it should be!

Have stayed here multiple times in the past 3 years for work under the Corp rate. Sometimes the prices are very good. Comfortable room, clean. Reception was cold on occasion. Last stay the motion sensor light broke in the bathroom - sometime between my departure in the morning and my return after work. By the looks of it, I presume it got the end of a mop by accident. In checking out the next day, reported it and the person at the desk was borderline accusatory (as in - you sure you didn't break it?). I thought she might be kidding but then realized she wasn't. No worries, still a nice stay. Also, for longer stays - there is a Whole Foods around the corner.

I was in New York for a week to help my daughter move back to the South. I chose this Hilton as it was convenient to the things that I wanted to do during my stay. We stayed there one time before and did not realize how convenient everything really is. It is nice to be near Times Square and shopping, but away from the noise and crowds. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay that includes shopping and visits to anything in the Midtown area.

Great staff with great customer service. Hotel was in a safe area with plenty of things to do nearby. My room was ready, clean, and inviting. The front desk staff were very welcoming and let me know of a few things I could do in the area, as well as some taxi advice. I had a box shipped to the hotel from myself (because I couldn't fly with it) and they had it ready for me when I arrived. The elevators were actually pretty quick and reliable which is sometimes an issue for taller buildings.

Quiet rooms! Almost a 5 star rating for that alone. Easy access, great location in the fashion district. The staff was freindly and you cannot beat the food and atmosphere of RARE, the attached restaurant. Everything in the room was updated and clean which is not always a common discovery in middle tier business class hotels in the area. We'll be back.
user_name:
Michael R
St. Louis, United States

review_body: Stayed 2nd time at Hilton Fashion District. Staff very friendly, hotel is chic and upbeat. Room size is typical Manhattan small, but they manage to get everything you need into the space available. Next time I would stay higher than the 4th floor to be further from street noises. Only nit was the climate control. Heat worked, but would shut off, get cold, and I would have to turn it up another degree. The bathroom was colder than the bedroom. Saw a radiator heater in bathroom but was afraid to turn it on because it is too close to hanging toilet paper and possibly fire hazard.If the price is right and I need to stay in Manhattan again, this property is definitely to be considered once more.

We stayed for 7 nights over New Year, hotel was clean and in a good location to explore uptown or down. It is really focused on short stay business guests but was adequate as we spent as much time out as possible. As other guests have mentioned all rooms are affected by the street noise but this is Manhattan and that's what it's so about. No where to hang a weeks clothes or dressing gowns in rooms as advertised staff all friendly. If you want a budget hotel this could fit the bill.
user_name:
Karen C
Lyndhurst, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Rooms were standard cramped for New York so nothing to add there. No real service experience to be wowed by, and it really was the location that made sense to me. It was clean and comfortable and did the job. Thats about it.

My partner and i visited for 7 nights for my 21st birthday. They placed us on the 21st floor in a large room with a very comfortable bed. Check in was okay although the requested we left a $50 per night deposit for any extra charges we occurred- Which we did not bring a extra $350 to spare. The receptionist agreed to take $200 which was still a inconvenience but we had no choice?! Room was very big for NYC standards and they left a bottle of wine and chocolates in the room for my birthday as my partner had emailed in advance to inform them that we were celebrating a birthday- We ended up leaving the wine. Restaurant was lovely, service was hit and miss- they always added on 20% tip onto bill even when you had to order own food and drinks at the bar! The man at the bag storage was rude and unprofessional-rolled his eyes at us as we wanted to store 4 bags and then expected a tip. Roof top bar is lovely and not too badly priced. overall lovely hotel wouldn't stay again.

Perfect location for me. Close to my NYC office, Penn Station, subways, and Path to NJ if needed. The outdoor bar is a nice place to relax, and Rare has some very interesting drinks at night as well. This is my go to hotel for NYC.

I love the location central to all restaurants and has Path access to NJ, the bar and restaurant are very good. There is an outdoor upstairs bar that is cool and an Irish bar across the street that I love. Worst part for me is the Internet very slow

Stayed here for 16 nights between December 22nd - January 7th on the 22nd floor. Good location. Easy to walk most places. About a 20 minute walk to Times Square. Subways located close by. Good size room. Clean. King size bed was comfy. Lighting in room was terrible at night. Shower leaked so ended up with a puddle on the floor & a saturated towel after every shower. A little bit of noise from neighbors in other rooms & sirens but I think you would hear them at any level. Staff were friendly but not overly helpful. Had a hiccup with payment - they held to much money which left us without cash for a few days which was very frustrating but the staff did help as much as they could to rectify the situation calling my bank multiple times in Australia. Would recommend but would prepay next time to make sure there were no issues with money again.

Stayed here for 5 nights from 1st-5th January. The location is great and we had a very pleasant stay. There were a few minor issues with our room, but nothing to complain about or majorly bother is. The lighting in the room isn't very good, there are plenty of lights but in poor locations so the room always feels dull. We couldn't open the blinds fully as our room was the second floor on the 26th street so New York City would have seen us getting dressed - and I don't think they would want that misfortune! Haha. It would have been nice to have a bath not just a shower, and our shower door wasn't sealed well enough so when we used it the floor would get a mini flood, we had to use the bath mat to soak up the water. Our bed was also only a double which is small for American standards, wish we had either two or a king size. There is a massive desk which would have been nice to have a mirror infront of to do your hair infront of/make up. There is only 2 mirrors, 1 in the bathroom & 1 on the bathroom door but it was awkward to straighten my hair there as had to move a chair over and my partner had to knock when he wanted to leave the bathroom so he didn't hit me with the door. The positives of this hotel majorly outweigh the very few negatives. The location is spot on, right in the centre of the city and close to many shops/restaurants. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had no noise or trouble our entire stay, we only heard sirens and car horns, nothing else. On our first night we were knackered so ordered room service from the restaurant rare where I have also left a review, the food was delicious, quite pricey but you get what you pay for, and for the convenience of it being brought straight to our room within 20 minutes was well worth the money. The bed was amazing, so so comfy, and after a long day that's what you want. Aslong as the room is tidy and the bed is comfy, what more do you really need? I would stay here again in a heart beat. The hotel also provide a service where you can leave your luggage until you leave which was handy for us as we had to check out by 12, but our flight was 9.35pm. Small tweekings could be made to improve this hotel even more but overall very good.

Great location. Decent rooms. Badly disorganized. Stayed there for a leisurely NYC visit. We were twice woken up by house-keeping even though we were checking out that morning. Then it took them about 20 minutes to find our luggage which we had left for the afternoon after checking out.

A truly welcoming and hospitable hotel stay from arrival/check-in where I was greeted by attentive and engaging staff throughout the entire stay and upon departure. The entire staff seemed committed to ensuring guests have a great stay. The hotel is conveniently located, features comfortable contemporary décor, with onsite conveniences and amenities.

I stayed to the Hilton, located in the Fashion district, only once with my girlfriend. We reserved a room the same night, and I remember the view from the room was incredible... from the 16th floor you will be able to enjoy the view of the Empire state building during the night... impressed. The room was cozy and the bed comfortable, the bathroom too.

Proximity to Madison Square Garden is perfect. Lots of area amenities and subways. Staff was courteous and polite / informative. A perfect location to round out my stay. Will def be staying at this Hilton hotel again.
user_name:
Ronald D
Long Branch, United States

review_body: Staff was very accommodating and the view could not be beat! I had to make several extra requests which the front desk gladly accommodated. Room was extremely clean and the view of the empire state building was fantastic. Bed was comfortable and the noise level was very low.
user_name:
Thomas B
New York, United States

review_body: I reviewed this previously and have requested it be removed so I'm hoping TripAdvisor have sorted that for me. The reason being that we had an issue with some of our deposit being taken that we had agreed should be waived with a manager. Initially response wasn't very good, but we contacted the manager directly and this has since been resolved. I'm glad I can now write a review of this place that's reflective of the standard of the hotel and not a slightly prolonged financial mix up. (I will check to see if the initial review has been removed but if it hasn't, please consider this my actual review.)Prior to travelling we spoke with Johnathon, the manager, a lot and he was exceedingly helpful in explaining required deposits and even offered us an upgrade free of charge. The room itself was very spacious, clean, and we'll equipped for our stay. We were there for 11 nights and couldn't find a fault with the place. Cleaners were regular and efficient, beds were the comfiest I've ever experienced, location of the hotel is perfect in that it is central and yet still very quiet. The attached steakhouse serves brilliant food, we didn't actually do the roof terrace as the weather was never suitable for it but I also heard good things about that. My second stay in New York and by far the better of the two, only reason I haven't awarded full marks is because of the issue mentioned previously.Less the hotel and more the city itself: go for Thanksgiving and the early holidays. Best experience of my life.

My husband brought me tickets to New York for my 30th Birthday and this was the hotel we chose to stay at for our trip at the end of November 2015 as it was fairly close to some of the big attractions in New York.We arrived in the evening and checked in with no problems. We were required to leave a $200 deposit via a credit card upon check in, which we were not aware of prior to arriving but that was fine. The check in lady wasn't the happiest/chattiest but it wasn't a big deal.Our room was on the 7th floor, it was nice and clean, spacious and just as we had expected from a Hilton. There wasn't much of a view but that was fine we would get views elsewhere. We managed to use the free wifi when in the hotel room to download pics, Facebook etc. We weren't at all disturbed by any noise from the street or the roof bar.We stayed 5 days and our room was cleaned each day which was lovely. We used the safe to store passports and money and there was no issue with this.We didn't use the roof top bar or restaurant on our stay but we did use the lobby bar on our last evening. The drinks were fine, normal hotel prices an the atmosphere was nice. The lobby seemed to have security at all hours (the first morning we left at 5am due to time differences) and this made you feel safe, they were also very friendly always saying hello and goodbye.We were allowed to leave our luggage in a store room by the front desk on the last day as our flight was late in the evening. This worked well for us, we didn't have to pay for a late check out & our cases were safe.The price was good, location was good and the room was just what we wanted. The next time we go to New York we will stay a little closer to the action but this was great for the budget we had.

I've stayed at this Hilton at least four times for both business and pleasure. It's a great location in Chelsea just off 7th Ave, within a walk, short cab ride or fast subway ride anywhere between the Village and Midtown. The rooms are tiny, even for NYC standards, and the hotel itself is average with regard to decor, etc. The fitness room is just that - a small room with some equipment that is serviceable but just barely. The room doors are solid and safe (for those who like that sort of thing) but you're going to hear the other doors close a lock with the force of a bank safe. I'll probably stay there again but pay extra for a larger room unless you're traveling alone.
user_name:
Jim P
Herndon, Virginia, United States

review_body: A friend and I wanted to go to the city and decided to look for a hotel last minute-Thankfully, we found Hilton New York Fashion District! The location and the pricing was fabulous for a last minute trip as I waited to book the room 24 hours prior our arrival. The hotel is located near Times Square with plenty of restaurants, stores, and bars for a great night out. Our room also included comedy tickets, but we opted to go to the show since my friend I were tired from all the traveling. When we arrived to the hotel we were greeted by Mily. She was really friendly and upgraded our room at no additional charge. I truly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Time Square as I know I will!
user_name:
Mireya L
New York City, New York

review_body: The front desk staff was knowledgable and professional. The rooms were small but clean. Bathrooms were a good size and well done for a small layout. The hotel is within walking distance to Penn Station.

Stayed for a one night getaway and the hotel is clean, friendly, and a perfect location. You can walk to Penn station and subways are close. I always enjoy a hotel that does not accept pets.... Sometimes a pet friendly hotel smells. This hotel was clean and all needs were met. I didn't hear any noise from other rooms as in previous reviews. Keurig coffee maker in room is a nice touch.

Very Nice Budget Friendly Hotel with 5* cleanliness and service. Rooms were on the small side but rather large for Manhattan standards and the very reasonable price..under $200 per night! Area, Chelsea, very accessible by walking to most points of interest: Empire State, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Lower West Side, and Lower East Side, Greenwich village and points south. Upper East and West Sides also accessible if you love walking...and we do. Outstanding was the Night Front Desk Lady (didn't get the name) but was there nights of December 25-28.Rooms are a bit dated if you have a very detailed eye but very clean. Again, for the price this was wonderful.

My family and I went to NYC for my wife's birthday. We got 2 rooms, 1 for us and 1 for the kids. We walked to several sites and had easy access to the subway. The hotel held our luggage in the morning so that we could site see. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful, especially Mila at the front desk. Nice clean room, I would consider staying at this hotel again.

I've stayed at the Hilton New York Fashion District on multiple occasions when in town for business. I've had rooms on the 2nd floor, 7th floor and the 21st floor. Although the elevators can be a bit slow, I still recommend a higher floor to avoid street noise I encountered on the 2nd floor. The hotel is clean and comfortable, with an on-site restaurant, Rare. There are also several restaurants within easy walking distance. It is a couple of blocks from the F/M train stop at 23rd street and 6th Ave or a couple of blocks the other direction to the 1/2 train stop at 23rd and 7th Ave, making the location convenient for accessing the city by public transportation.As a Gold Honors member, I've enjoyed complimentary standard wifi which has always been satisfactory and I've never seen the need to pay for the upgraded speed.I will not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Very good hotel, close enough to Madison square garden - only a 7 minute walk! Very practical hotel and the staff were fantastic. Not an ideal location with regards to hailing a cab because it's on a side street, however I wouldn't let that put you off. 4 out of 5

I've been in this hotel for one week. The staff is very helpfull and nice. They received all my packages before I had arrived and I didn't have to pay any tax for this.Around the hotel there are many restaurants and the subway station is just 2 blocks.The room is a little small for 4 people (2 adults and 2 children), but it was ok! Our room was 2112 (you can choose this when you are doing the checkin before arriving in the hotel, online) and it has a great view to One World Trade Center.

This hotel is well located in Chelsea. Several subway stops are close by, the High Line, Grammercy Park, Chelsea Market, Penn Station and Times Square are all easy to walk to from the hotel. The rooms are nice, as is the staff. Some rooms have an Empire State Bldg view. Also the hotel is pretty quiet, which I really like. We stayed here a few years ago and I would stay here again.

This hotel, located at 26th and 7th Avenue, right in the middle of the fashion district, is an easy walk to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Times Sq. and Broadway, Chelsea, the High Line, etc. In choosing a room, the odd-number rooms are on the front, the even--numbered on the back side. Decent views from higher floors. All the employees from the front desk, to bell men, to room staff are friendly, helpful and courteous. The rooms are comfortable and modern. Good place to stay.

We have stayed here quite a few times now and it is perfectly fine if traveling with couples! I would not stay here with my kids though, they prefer to stay in mid town. We enjoy the proximity to lower manhatten and its environs when we stay here.

Location was perfect for a business trip I had recently. Easy walking distance to 6th and 7th avenues. Longer walking distance but reasonable to Empire State Building. Rooms were clean and updated, but not high end. At $560/night was definitely expecting a higher quality accommodation.

First off Christine Drumgoole and Martha who were working the front desk were so attentive and responsive but probably most important so nice and frtiendly. The hotel just has an excellent vibe. The rooftop bar was delightful and the drinks were perfect. The room was fantastic and I have never had a better shower experience in all my years of traveling!

2 joining good value for money rooms just a short stroll from TQ and easy to get downtown in cab to one tower. good tv and coffee/tea making machines. nice breakfast area and bar.Didn't get to experience roof top bar as closed on Mondays and early on Sundays.

Come on this is meant to be a Hilton hotel, didn't even acknowledge I was a Hilton honours member although fairly new so had to ask for points to be added, no info on wifi just basic check in that I'd expect at a two star. The youngish lady with mad hair was excellent though when we dealt with her, the rest of the staff are uninterested, same s the door guys and staff that deal with the roof top bar, more interested in chatting to each other.The rooms are OK would expect a little better from a Hilton, more holiday inn than Hilton, cleaner is excellent The roof top bar has a great view and that's it, again rubbish staff and the cocktails are simply appalling, never known a mojito without sugar in my lifeReally disappointed overall

Stayed here on a business trip this week to Manhattan. Good area. Safe to walk around. Cabs easy to find.The lobby is small, but kind of neat with a wall decoration behind the front desk made of spools of thread (it IS in the fashion district) and tactile decorations. Elevator was fast. Security was good with the elevator buttons keyed off the room keys.The Room was small. Real small. But it had a King size bed (though a bit firm for my tastes and creaky), desk with chair, large screen TV, and tasteful decor. Perfect for a solo business trip with just an overnight bag.Bathroom decent sized. Clean. Glassed in shower stall with good products. Shower a bit tight, but maybe that's just me.View nothing special -- the office building across the street. Noise was OK. I could hear my neighbors flush their toilets. The toilets are fairly loud. But no voices. TIP: When you are taking a cab, make sure you specify which Hilton in Manhattan you are going to. There are a few, and at least one of them looks similar to this one. (found out the hard way!)So overall, it was good. I'd go again.

We spent one night here and found a fairly new property near Chelsea. Check-in was efficient and the room was small but comfortable, and a decent size for New York. The room was quiet with no street noise. There was no Hilton Honors floor, so we might try another Hilton property next time.

I had an enjoyable stay here, it was a good hotel in a very convenient location. My only criticism is that the soundproofing between rooms could be better - I could hear the couple in the room next to mine when they were being noisy.

I visited NYC for the first time in 13 years this last week. Due to location I chose to stay in the Hilton in the Fashion District. It turned out to be a good choice. Good, clean hotel with plenty of room. Very close to the Toy buildings on 5th and Broadway and good local eats and drinks, i.e. Crompton Street Bar and Maysville. Good NY feel to it.

I was very surprised at the problems in my room: the safe was in the locked position, the privacy window shades were torn and non-functional, the towels were a wreck -- not what I expected from a Hilton. I was in town to support a friend in Hospice, and this did nothing to help my mood. I took the towels down to the front desk, told them about all the problems and made it clear I did not want to be disturbed that night but that these issues needed to be corrected. The desk manager could not have been more embarrassed. The next morning, I found one more problem, told them at the front desk and when I returned to my room that afternoon, everything was made right. They kept asking me if there was something they could do to make up for it -- I almost ask them if they meant they would paint my house! I asked them for suggestions and they gave comp'ed my breakfast. Later I asked them to remove the upgrade fee for the first night (I am a Hilton Honors member, so it was not a lot of money) and they did that, too. Despite all the problems on the first day, I was very pleased with the reaction of the staff and their real sense of embarrassment.

Stayed at the Hilton NY Fashion District which is near the Chelsea district of NYC (midtown) for 5 nights October half term week. We had twin double high rise room which was fine for two adults and two kids. There wasn't much of a view from our room, but I don't think that would have made much of a difference from any room. Location was handy for the subway downtown (9/11 museum, one world trade ctre, Statue of Liberty, wall st, Brooklyn bridge and uptown; Central Park, museums, TheRock, 5th av, Broadway. We had room service once which was fried everything/cheese with everything. A healthier option is the brilliant 'Wholefoods' store two blocks away for bagels/croissants and more for breakfast and salads and even warm food to go for dinner. Get a metro card if you're going to stick with the subway for travel, kids go free. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't use the concierge but the bar is nice for an evening drink. All in all a great trip to NYC and the hotel provided all we needed, clean, comfy and quiet.

This is a beautiful hotel. It is very well located, not too far to time square, not to far to wall street but a little bit of walk is required or you can take the metro which is well connected. Some of the rooms have views on the empire state building which is really nice. Yes the hotel is not cheap but it is worth it!

Good central location in Manhattan. Check in & out was easy and pleasant. Like most other reviews - the room is quite small, but the bed is quite comfortable. They definitely should have spent more in the refurbishment in the way of soundproofing the rooms! We could hear every time our neighbor flushed the toilet or took a shower, hall noises as well. Our view was a building next door - had to keep the blackout shades drawn when the lights were on. If you need a large closet, forget it. I think it was about 12 inches of space available. There is a cafe on the corner serving good coffee, breakfast and lunch items (turn right when you leave the hotel - other side of the street - 2 minute walk).

I've stayed at a lot of NYC hotels on business and I was pleasantly surprised with my stay at the Hilton Fashion District. The hotel is extremely clean (I think it is pretty new), quiet (never heard a peep in my room from traffic or other guests), and the restaurant in the hotel is really good. The beds are super comfy and they have Peter Thomas Roth bath products which is impressive. Location is great. Close to lots of great restaurants as well as shopping on 5th Ave. My one complaint was the female concierge who I found to be unhelpful (she couldn't tell me which direction 6th Ave was or help me find someone to hail a cab to the airport). Other than that, great stay and I will definitely return soon.

I stayed here because I have been traveling to NYC almost every week this year and have been trying to find "my" hotel. I do Hilton hotels but I prefer a boutique hotel that is super nice in the city. Like all business travelers, it's what in it for me, so I try to stick to one hotel chain. I have been staying at the Hilton Times Square but because I needed to be in SoHo early one morning and be back in the Penn Station area later in the day, I stayed at the Fashion District Hilton. The staff was super nice, the room was clean, the a/c was blasting (it was 35 degrees outside), so I had to have the maintenance come up and fix it. Being a women traveling alone, I really don't like having the staff in my room, so didn't love this. He was kind and fixed the problem just fine. The hotel itself is old though and unimpressive. I will just be sticking the Hilton Times Square from now on though because it's newer.

The rooms are small but hey it's NY and there's no open space to build! The hotel is clean the staff friendly, and the location convenient to all of NY City. Lots of restaurants clsoe by as well as conveninece stores, and you can see the top of the empire state building out your window.
user_name:
Patrick M
saint cloud, United States

review_body: The lighting inside the room near the door is dim. The closet is tiny and was stuffed with ironing board and other material. Sound insulation was nearly nonexistent so we could hear people talking and cavorting in the hallway throughout the night. The phone system was mediocre with poor instructions and inadequate confirmation of requests of a wake up call. I had to call the front desk to make sure my wake up call was indeed in the system. Surprise! There was no wake up call in the morning! Luckily, my wife had risen up early so we did not have to skip breakfast to catch our transportation. Check in and check out experience was great but over-the-phone help rendered by the front desk was mediocre. On the plus side, the room was comfortable. The bath room was meticulously clean. One drawback however was the lack of a lid for the toilet seat. a situation which caused us to be extremely apprehensive about dropping stuff accidentally in the toilet. If it were not for these issues, the hotel would have received a much better rating from me.

Spent a wonderful 10 days with my family in rooms on the 21st floor with great views. We were given a lovely welcome at check-in by Marian and from then on every member of staff at reception, bar, restaurant, concierge and housekeeping were so nice and very customer focused. The location of the hotel is fantastic within walking distance of many attractions and very close to metro stations. We had an amazing holiday and would definitely return to the hotel again!

Before we arrived my wife emailed the hotel and asked for a room with a view as we had travelled from the UK they said they would try their best. When we arrived we were blown away with the view from our room! Thank you Hilton! :-)Other positives are the room was always cleaned everyday and the hotel staff were really friendly and nothing troubled them.We booked room only as we were travelling from the UK so we wanted to try other cafes for breakfast.We went to Rare restaurant once and again the service was excellent with the waitress recommending what the best burgers were and also recommending the best cocktails to my wife.Thanks again Hilton you really made our trip special! :-)

I and my wife where staying at Hilton during 5 days. And I have to say that the experience there was great. We receive a great support from the employees there specially from Mily that helped us greatly during our last days. We will definitely go back!

Mily and Zoribe are awesome and made me feel welcome when they checked me in! They started talking to me as if i was one of their friends. I highly recommend staying at the Hilton New York Fashion District.
user_name:
mark m
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Nice hotel, good location and nice rooms. Lots of road noise at night and small rooms. I expect this is the norm in NYC, but it is my only experience there. We enjoyed the location as it was close to lots of good shopping and coffee shops, also walking distance to the Highline Park. Close to metro stops as well that will take you to pretty much any where in the city.

After checking in at outr original hotel and it being a disgrace I booked this through last minute and left where we were.When we arrived check in was amazing. After telling Mily, the receptionist, our ordeal she checked us in no problem and even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine to cheer us up. She really just wanted us to have better memories of New York. The room is amazing! Modern, clean, just beautiful. My mom and I got a twin room with two double beds. The bathrooms are beautiful and we are now just so happy!Thank you Hilton for saving the day!

This place is very subpar. For three days, they didn't have umbrellas so i bought one and donated it upon departure. The walls are very thin. For instance, I can hear conversations and showers next door. The in-room dining (breakfast) was one of the worst I've had, including but not limited to an embarrassing continental breakfast. My room looked directly into offices across the alley. I think i made some friends. The gym is tiny but a gym. There is no CNBC. My room was clean so if you are concerned about that, i wouldn't worry. Most other things can be improved upon.

I had a bad experience at a hotel a couple of blocks away, and was looking for a room with two beds for my sister and I. We made a reservation at the hotel and were actually upgraded to a higher floor by Mily. It was a pleasant surprise along with a complimentary bottle of wine. I will definitely be stopping by to book a hotel room whenever I'm in the city!

If all you want is a comfortable room and modern clean facilities, then this is the place to stay. Restaurant ok but better within a few blocks. Staff variable, sometimes happy to help and other times are dismissive or rude. Breakfast $22 for basic buffet, so much, much better within a few blocks for half the price.If you are UK side, never forget that EVERYTHING you buy, including hotel rooms is subject to tax and local area charges, which put $90 on top of the quoted room rate for our 4 nights stay. Overall a pretty standard 4*, clean and modern hotel but nothing out of the ordinary, although as on a side street, it was slightly quieter than other hotels in the city and extremely central to ALL attractions and the subway.

Caroline of the New York Hilton graciously took us upstairs to see a hotel room. We had walked two blocks over from the Hampton Inn on 24th St, hoping to move because the Hampton room felt cramped, unfurnished (formica table instead of desk/ wood blocked around wallpaper instead of headboard/bedspread type cover doubling as blanket- Hampton staff was very nice though and tried). . Caroline kindly took us to see the room, checked availability and gave us her card to assist in anyway she could. Long story short, we moved to the Hilton and were much happier. We ended up booking through hotels.com (which had our hampton reservation)- even changing from a king to queen, the room was still much nicer (carpeting/glassed shower/fluffy towels) and more than a hundred dollars less for 3 nights. We did not get breakfast but you really don't need it included in NYC with all of the food options easily available for a quick tasty breakfast in NYC.

If I can't stay in my normal hotel in NYC, the Hilton Fashion District is my next choice. The staff goes out of their way to make sure you have a wonderful stay; the rooms are clean and nice; and my goodness the room service is AMAZING. Literally the best room service of anywhere I've ever stayed. The location is also great. It's very close to several subway lines and there are TONS of great restaurants within walking distance if you don't decided to just stay in and have room service every night like some people I know...

This is our second time in New York and after staying in a substandard hotel last time I wasn't expecting much. I was pleasantly surprised. From the moment we checked in, we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Our room was a good side and extremely clean; at last we had a room that resembled the photos on the hotel website!From a security point of view, there is a safe which is free to use in each room and your keycard only allows you access to your allocated floor.The roof terrace is amazing for nighttime views of the city and the food served is fabulous. This hotel is ideally placed midtown so you can explore all that the city has to offer.

This hotel have the friendliest staff and the yummiest in-dining food! They are so helpful and extremely efficient! Room service comes within 10mins of ordering!! The only thing I would say is, the lighting in the rooms aren't great, it was very hard to look into our safe as there was no light in the cupboard. The bathroom/shower was great! They put good movies on in the evening! The staff are extremely friendly! I would defo come back

We wanted to stay in the fashion district so chose this hotel. I imagined that everything in the fashion district would be fancy and posh. I was very surprised to see that the entire area looked grubby and old. The hotel was no different, good to spend a night in, nothing special and nothing was that good in that area anyway. The best part was the service offered by the waitress in their restaurant, she was awesome.

I’d like to echo other reviewers’ points that the space is slightly tight for a Hilton; however, the front desk staff are very friendly & helpful.I’d also like to point out to the GM that a guest’s experience starts with the booking until s/he leaves. Specifically, I spoke with Jenny @ (212) 858-5888 on 11/18 regarding my request, all the impression that I got was either she was unable or unwilling to step up to the plate, which was rather disappointing given the Hilton brand. That being said, Elan at the front desk was able to identify a solution & remediate, which I really appreciate.As far as the actual stay is concerned, below is a list of my pros vs cons:Pros:• Location• Staff• Gym• Rooftop bar• Complimentary wifi• Comfy bed & pillows• Nice view of the ESB from my roomCons:• Although I was on the 19th floor, there seemed to be a lot of traffic noise & sirens at night. Additionally, I seemed to hear a lot of door banging as people leave/enter their rooms and the dumpster pick up at 5 am. So sound proof, or lack thereof, is an issue. If you’re a light sleeper, be forewarned.• The wifi was rather slow when I tried to watch a video• One of my rocks glasses was chipped. Housekeeper didn’t seem to notice.• I did not see separate recycle bin, the housekeeper could potentially commingling everything with the general garbage. • The Rooftop bar would close early if they’re not busy, but they won’t post any signs in the elevator or lobby.• The long 1970s florescent bulb in the bathroom has got to go!All in all, it was a decent stay despite some minor setbacks, but would consider staying here again if the management can close the aforementioned gaps.

Had a nice and quiet room on 11th floor, facing backwards to the yard. Room was spacious and comfortable - very nice stay! Very friendly staff - especially Martha from reception who was very helpful!Absolutely recommendable; looking forward to returning here!
user_name:
Jan Hendrik V
Freiburg im Breisgau, Germany

review_body: Staff was extremely helpful and very professional. Great hotel for a business trip. Needed help with some missing receipts and staff was great in tracking them down. Would also consider hotel for vacation as well. Great location and room prices very reasonable.

The first room we got did smell like smoke and was a bit on the smaller side, but Marleen ( not sure of spelling ) was extremely helpful and accommodating, found us the perfect room. Everyone at the hotel was very, very nice. The hotel is in the perfect location, easy to get everywhere. We had a wonderful stay !

Perfect walking distance to everything, welcoming staff and one of the best nights sleep I've ever had in a hotel. We're in NYC once a month and this will be a place for us to return to next time!The restaurant is another story. We've eaten at Rare before and liked it. This time we waited 25 minutes after being seated and no one ever waited on us!Parking was a challenge to: it look an hour to have our car brought around by the valet

This hotel is in the fashion district, subway near Penn Station in walking distance a ton of great restaurants also in walking distance great rooftop bar kind of a young hip hotel rooms are small but adequate staff knowledgeable

From the start of the trip all the way past check out the staff was extremely helpful all around. Although we walked from the subway station the valet team still insisted on helping us with our bags. Arriving late after a flight delay the front desk staff was quick in getting us checked in. In addition to the speedy check in, they were extremely knowledgeable on the area helping us with directions and recommendations for places to eat, things to do, and even a place for my girlfriend to get her hair done while in town. Hands down I cannot wait for our next reason to visit NYC and stay here.
user_name:
Adam B
Deerfield Beach Fl, United States

review_body: This is an excellent hotel in the heart of the fashion district, within easy walking distance of so many interesting places to visit in NY. Service was great, hotel is clean and I would recommend you look no further. I also thought it was priced very well.

Our room had a view of the Empire State Building, it doesn't get much better than that.In addition to the great views, this hotel has a great central location, nice new and clean rooms, and a great staff! The entire front desk staff was very helpful whenever I had a question, especially the gentleman who checked us in, I believe was name was Elan.I would definitely come back here again.
