We booked this hotel on late rooms and it was an excellent find.It is in downtown New York set back from the road and first impression was how did we get this so cheap. It was in excellent condition and looked great.The staff were so friendly, our room was not ready as we were early so they gave us a room with two double beds. It was very clean, tidy and quite big for New York.It had a great little bar and a very popular and reasonably priced restaurant called Rare.When we left they allowed us an extra hour in the room and then stored the cases for us until we were ready to leave. They also organised us a limousine to the airport at a fixed price of $62.We would recommend this to anyone.

Had a great time at this hotel. Most accommodating staff I have ever encountered. Fantastic location in the heart of the city. Kudo's to Martha, Christine and Caroline for making our stay wonderful! We will definitely return again.

Extremely friendly front desk. Clean and spacious room - after a 12 hour flight from Europe - I couldn't have asked for better! Upon check-out the team even thought to ask/confirm my membership in the Hilton rewards program - so that I could start racking up points during repeated visits. Great job!
user_name:
Nick S
San Francisco, United States

review_body: greeted very warmly ...offered water and asked if we needed anything. our requests were met ahead of time. when we needed ice to our room we were accomodated immediately. we went to the top at night to see views and were given a personal tour of where to see things out the window. Could not have been treated kinder.

I stayed here for four nights on business. Nice size room for New York with a very comfortable bed and a great shower. We were surrounded by a number of great bars and restaurants, Time Square is only a 15 minute stroll and a few different metro stations around us. You'll hear a few scare stories about the metro but I always find it a great way to travel.Also ate in the bar restaurant which was nice.Finally the reception staff are first class, welcoming, efficient, friendly and so helpful.

Rooms are small but comfortable. More importantly they are clean and well maintained. The staff are really friendly and helpful. Trust me, I can tell a faker, but all if the interactions I had were professional and genuine. Really nice job, Hilton. Only complaint I would have is the ability to fully open the room window. I have two toddlers and was concerned that they could reach and open it. Oh, and the 'mini-bar' that charges you if the flap is pulled. Turned out those toddlers made it there obsession. Better that than the window though, I suppose.

Stayed for a business trip in November. Standard Hilton hotel. Higher floor rooms have reasonable views (above 17). Gym is currently out of action. Annoyingly, they didn't tell me before I arrived. There is another gym 7-8 min walk away that you can use, but if it's cold and raining then it's not much fun. Beware of their laundry. I used the service 3 times and each time there was some damage or something they messed up. They gave some points to compensate, but would rather they got it right first time round.

We booked this on a whim as we typically stay in mid-town, but wanted to experience Chelsea and environs. We could not have been more surprised. Hilton hotels typically aren't mentioned in the same breath as hip, but this one has been completely changed. The lobby is fashionable, the RARE restaurant and bar are inviting, and the rooftop bar is AWESOME! The rooms were functional, but the odd-numbers especially higher floors have great views of midtown including the Empire State Building. We would stay here again!

I travel nearly 100 nights a year for work. NYC is a city I frequent for work, and while I'm forced to stay at other properties "sometimes", Hilton Fashion is always my home away from home. The staff is fantastic and are 10/10 all the time. I've never had to complain, room is always clean, staff know your name and smile. I've become very fond of Mily during my stays... She goes beyond to to give her 100%. I always try to find a way to thank the staff at the end of my travel season, and this year, more than ever, I thank them wholeheartedly and with complete appreciation for this entire Hilton team... I can't wait to surprise them tomorrow! They should really be traveling to train other hotel staff on what hospitality means. Keep nailing it Hilton Fashion... And I'll be back soon! xoxo
user_name:
TravelDoc716
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It was our first time traveling from Canada to NYC. From the moment we checked-in, Mily went to great lengths to make us feel important and like we were the only guests in the hotel. Without being prompted, she recommended several personally endorsed restaurants and drink spots to check out. She helped us pick a room and reserve a spot for our friends who were arriving the following day. Mily them went the extra mile by giving us a gift card for a drink on the rooftop where we had our first Manhattan in Manhattan. Moreover, she helped us hook up to wifi so we could share our experiences via FaceTime with our family back home. We would recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York and tell them to talk to Mily. She was a gracious host and gave us an excellent start to our trip. Thanks Mily!

The bed was so comfortable I didn't want to leave.But hey your in NYC.No time to sleep.Plus it was only 100 bucks a night booked through Expedia.Beautiful Hotel with a restaurant downstairs.Value for your money.I was looking kind of rough and not smelling the best when i got there from flight delays but wasn't judged in the least but the front desked.

The Hilton on W26th Street in NY is in a prime location if the intention is to spend time walking the High Line. The hotel is clean, quiet and undistinguished. We used Priceline, so it wasn't our choice but the price was right.

Stayed with my wife and 1 year old girl in a 2 x double room. Staff were very accommodating and helpful which makes all the difference. Used the gym every morning which is pretty well equipped. Would stay again if visiting.

Perfect location for business and pleasure. On a relatively quite street to allow for grat sleep. Rooms have been recently updated and are quite comfortable and make excellent use of space. While not a lot of square feet, the layout feels spacious. Service was helpful and friendly. Would stay here again without hesitation

This hotel was in a great location. Walk to many parts of Manhattan; Whole Foods just across street. Hotel was clean and staff very friendly. Some previous patrons complained rooms were small. Really didn't bother me as I only stayed in the room for sleeping purposes.

This hotel has a great location for exploring Manhattan. Within walking distance to Madison Sq Gardens, Times Square and Empire State Building (if you are a good walker all the way to Central Park is reasonable). Rooms and service was great, will definitely stay here again.

As far as Hilton';s go, this one has to make do with a relatively small floor space, so the guest rooms are less generous than in other locations/cities. Otherwise, I found the Hilton on W26th Street very nice for my holiday visit.The room was always clean and the beds were very very nice. The bathroom was good too, and the coffee maker made very nice coffee.We stayed in room &12 , which has a drawback oif not being street facing, instead it faces other buildings at the back of the hotel, so is pretty much just a light-well. You can see right into the offices outside the windows - and I sure they can see what you are doing just as easily!There is also an aircon unit that takes up floor space in what is already a cramped room, and it is NOISY! But sadly in October we still needed it on.Reception was friendly, and the location is really good, near to more than one Subway station and very central for walking to a lot of mid and downtown Manhattan. So all in all, a good choice for central Manhattan, if you want somewhere that is decent and clean.

This is a comfortable hotel in a nice location. Room service prices are reasonable and the food was good. The Rare Bar and Grill also fine. Bedding like most Hiltons - great. The bathroom was efficient and seemed new and modern. I was originally booked on floor 10, but at checkin I asked if a higher floor was available, and got moved to floor 21 in a quiet corner. This was a complimentary upgrade to a room with 2 beds vs 1 king. Fine with me! The staff are all friendly. I also had to extend my reservation from 2-4 nights, and this was not a problem. I would come again.
user_name:
Beverly L
Canaston Bridge, United Kingdom

review_body: I was in the city on a very quick business stay. The hotel was extremely clean and staff friendly. The floor I was on was pretty loud, but I realize that can't always be helped. Overall, the location was perfect for my meetings and the accommodations were great!
user_name:
Katherine A J
West Bloomfield, United States

review_body: Excellent hotel -- super location for any business on the Avene of the Americas. Very clean, safe, and modern. Hilton does it again. So proud to be a Diamond member at Hilton. All staff members were very attentive. While NYC is very expensive overall, the value for the investment exceeded my expectations. I will most definitely stay here again!
user_name:
Laci L
New York City, United States

review_body: This was our second stay at this hotel as we liked it first time around. The bits that are 5/5 and the reason we returned are the location and the spotless rooms. You can pretty much walk to all of the main areas from this hotel, uptown and downtown, which is a huge plus. There are also many bars and restaurants close by covering more options that you could ever need. The rooms are spotless and well equipped and were serviced immaculately every day. The less than 5/5 was the breakfast. I am a HH Diamond (have lifetime status) so was given vouchers for complimentary breakfast. On our last stay this was great but this time around the complimentary breakfast had been downgraded to a pretty poor continental offering. If we wanted any hot options we had to pay an upgrade charge - you couldn't even have toast with the continental option! This apart, we enjoyed our stay and would return - we would just find somewhere better to have breakfast.

The room was small but clean. The staff behind the desk were fine. The room phone did not work and the TV stopped working on our last day (maybe it was the cable). We dealt with two concierges, the first was a young lady, she was not at all helpful. Just appeared to go through the motions. Did not provide any recommendations other than reading from her computer. Dwayne on the other hand was wonderful. Gave us excellent recommendations for things to do and where to eat. He was a wealth of information and didn't even have to look at the computer. Only wish he was at the concierge desk more during our stay. All and all, it was just ok, especially given the price. As my Mom says when she doesn't like something...."I think you can do better".

I only stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for one night, but the hotel was clean, the rooms were quiet and the location was pretty centrally located. The staff was very helpful when I arrived, making sure that I was happy with my choice of room. The room itself was on the small side, but since it was just me, it wasn't a big issue. It was a little tough to catch a cab in the morning, so I ended up using Uber, All-in-all a decent experience.

Would not return to this hotel. Not worth the money - Dealt with a great deal of attitude and disrespect from the staff. Outdated and worn down atmosphere. Serious issues with even temporary parking. Take your money elsewhere.

Friendly staff, clean rooms and a great location. Walking distance to many attractions like the High Line and Madison Square Park. The rooms are on the small side. Not bad for NYC standards. We had no problem with noise from the street - but I would suggest a room higher up, if you are a light sleeper. Would certainly stay here again if the price is right.

I was pleasantly surprised by my first stay at this hotel. I liked the location close to 7th Ave on 26th Street, easy walking distance either to the East Village or to Times Square. However, my room faced onto 26th Street which was very noisy on the Friday night and moderately noisy on the Saturday night. The room was decorated in corporate style, but was a decent size for NYC. The bed was a little softer than I would have liked but the pillows were good quality and comfortable. The bathroom was above average in size and well equipped with a very large counter top and good lighting, plus lighted mirror. Everything worked flawlessly in the room and I particularly liked the electrical outlets right next to my bed, perfect for computer and charging the phone. I did not interact much with the staff but they were pleasant and efficient. The only negative is the elevators - only 3 elevators, clearly not a sufficient number for the size of the hotel. At peak times, your wait may be quite a long time to get aboard. The elevators do have the nice security feature of not operating unless you scan your room key card.

We stayed here for 4 nights during our trip of the US. Surprisingly it's quite close to Times Square, walking distance to it, to the subway and lots of local eateries. The rooms were small, however we were hardly in them, the rooms were clean, modern, bathroom was the same. We were on the 22nd floor which overlooked offices/apartments and faced the street which was good. We are both light sleepers and had no dramas at all with noise. Staff were friendly and helpful and we would stay again!

This is an OK place to stay The rooms are small - two people can't stand side by side between the end of the bed and the "closet" - but clean. Our room looked out at the office building next door. A family member who had a room on the front had to deal with street noise in the very early morning hours so maybe our room in the back was a better one. If your room comes with a breakfast be sure to have your receipt with you. We had to make waaaaay too many trips to the front desk to get the proper vouchers required for our full breakfast buffet. First we were told that our room did not come with a free breakfast. My husband had to go back to the room to get the receipt, and then we were given vouchers for the continental breakfast instead of the full breakfast buffet. Some staff members were helpful in dealing with the situation, others not so much. Just know that you need a voucher and be sure you have the right one.

This Hilton Hotel is ideally located in New York City. We stayed in May 2015 for three nights and were pleasantly surprised by how quiet the hotel was. The street it is located on is not subject to heavy traffic and we were asked if we would like a room in the back of hotel. Yes please. Okay my view was of a fire escape and people smoking from the next building but there was no noise of traffic. Upon arrival the staff were friendly and very efficient and quickly offered my wife and I a cold bottle of water each. After reading about the small rooms in the hotels of New York City I was surprised how big our room was. The bathroom had all the necessary essentials that you would expect and plenty of hot water whatever time of day. My only complaint with the room was the lighting. The room itself was quite dark and trying to operate the safe was a challenge. The location of the hotel is great for seeing the sights. We were about 10 minutes from the Empire State Building and maybe 15 or 20 minutes from Times Square.

We stay here on occasion to be near the West Village (where the hotels are few and very expensive). There are quite a few mid-level hotels between the West Village and Penn Station and this one is a cut above. Desk staff are great and they hand you bottles of water as soon as you check in. The rooms aren't big but they are bigger than others I've stayed at in the same vicinity. Beds are very comfortable and there are lots of outlets for charging electronics. Not much closet space but bathrooms are a decent size. On our latest stay, bathroom had a large walk in shower -- much better than the typical bathtub configuration. Convenient location for just about anywhere in Manhattan. Not much in the way of views, certainly not on lower floors.

We booked a view room at extra cost but the only view we got was the side of the building opposite. We were on the 18th floor, so you would need to be on the 20th to get a view.The room was nicely furnished but very small - I haven't seen a room this small in North America before. There was barely enough room to squeeze our two suitcases in around the king bed.I'm pretty sure if you select a two queen room, you will get a larger room since it would be impossible to get another bed in the room we had.There is also a nightclub on the roof that takes over one of the elevators in the evenings - it's annoying to be waiting for an elevator and have one locked out. At least we didn't hear the nightclub from our room.The staff was friendly and did refund us the upcharge for the (non) view room after I complained.

We stayed here in September, the staff were very helpful and friendly but we were disappointed with the room itself. It had a piece of paper hanging from the ceiling, sink surround in the bathroom had been previously water damaged and no tea making facilities (a kettle would have been nice). We felt that the room could do with a makeover, seemed a bit tired, we had a lovely view of the city and had a fantastic time and the hotel was within walking distance of lots of sightseeing attractions. As this was our first trip to New York we thoroughly enjoyed it but the room was disappointing.

One of the most techy hotel I've ever been too. The front lobby is evert pretty and really busy with guest coming in a going out because of the restaurant and rooftop lounge that's located in the hotel, which makes for fun and not having to go anywhere. Once checked and in the elevator I then learn that the elevator won't go up without the scan of your room key. I loved it because it made me feel a lot more safer! Comfy bed, lot of space, great big window and huge bathroom! Also there is a lot to do and have fun not far from the hotel of you plan on going out!

It is dark and dingy in the common areas, imagine colors of aqua, dark brown, black and grey....just awful. The restaurant "Rare" is also dark and dingy and has a very limited menu consisting of meat. The bartender was barely available, the service was pretty terrible. The breakfast room in the morning is basically in the basement, and again, very dark and dingy with mediocre food. Do not be misled by "Fashion District", there is no retail shopping nearby...this is the district with the workrooms for people sewing garments...it's a working neighborhood. The sleeping rooms are small, as is typical if New York.

I do not even know where to begin. My sister and I randomly decided to take a trip to New York for a weekend and we were very hesitant about the first hotel we had chosen. Looking at all the reviews, every hotel in the area has a bad case of bed bugs and roaches. I actually stumbled across this hotel and found it to be much more reasonable than the one I had already booked. My sisters birthday was actually the week prier and I had mentioned that to the hotel when i asked for a special request of a city view. Not only did they upgrade our room so that my sister and I had to sleep in the same bed but they even gave her a little birthday gift! I have to give a shout out to Sid at the front desk! He was so amazing and so amazingly friendly! He definitely made our stay at the hotel so amazing! When we go back to New York, We will definitely be staying there again!!!

Could be the friendliest staff I have ever encountered! After a very long travel day I arrived only to discover I had screwed up my reservation. Not only did Mily (thank you, Mily!) fix it perfectly on the spot, she did it with grace and diplomacy. I thought perhaps I was just lucky with Mily, but when I checked out, the front desk staff was equally as delightful! Thank you! Thank you!The room was well appointed. It had everything I needed and a little extra room to spare. The water pressure in the shower was excellent. Everything worked well. One caution on the mini-bar - do not open a drawer unless you want the item! It's well marked on the mini-bar itself, but once the drawer is opened, even partially, the only way to close it is to remove the item (and thus be charged for it) first!The room was quiet and the shades create a complete blackout.Parking is cheaper than in other lots and the rate includes 24 hours. There's a small driveway in front of the hotel so I didn't have to load/unload on the street.The location is an easy walk to lots of things New York - including the subway (1).I would gladly stay here again!

My girlfriend and I stayed in Room 2007 for two nights last week, and here is my review on our stay:Pros: this hotel was in a very good location, close to great neighborhoods and NYC attractions such as restaurants, MSG, Penn Station, etcSound insulation was outstanding, and our room was very cleanEmployees were very friendly and helpfulRooftop bar is for the younger crowd, but very good atmosphere and staffWifi worked great Cons:We felt the hotel bars closed a bit early, but not a big dealPrice: not the best value, but we did like this hotelRooms: very small, but not unlike many other Manhattan hotels

This hotel is very nicely located and the front desk staff could not have been more welcoming, friendly and professional. The rooms are large and quiet and the beds heavenly. There is a nice bar on the roof that has a great view of the city. There is a DJ and lots of people enjoying the inside and outside parts of the bar. There is a great deal of security to get up to the bar, but everyone is really friendly and appreciative.

I recently went to New York for a business trip and I must say that I had truly mixed emotions...The rooms are extremely clean, on the smaller side but plenty of room to fit (2 people may get a bit tight but should be fine), very stylish and the beds were very comfy. The sound insulation was very nice for the most part as my room was right next to the elevator and I didn't a ton of noise (Luckily). But the fact that I was there on business and a new customer to Hilton, not the way to make a first impression. The rooftop bar has amazing views and is beautiful but guests have to go to the lobby to then access the bar. Not a big deal, but just annoying seeing as you have to scan your room key to even get the elevator moving.The Staff was hit or miss. When I first checked in, I had an issue with my card and asked if I could split it over two days (Forgot to call my bank and let them know I was traveling and they lowered my daily limit for security reasons). I apologized and explained the situation. You might of thought that I had asked them to give me the room for free. They were very standoffish and treated me like I was a second class citizen. Sorry, but I don't believe in credit cards and prefer to pay with my debit card. That is just my thing. There was a female associate behind the desk that was helping the woman check me in; she was very nice and pleasant, but alas, for the most part, I was stuck with the woman that was behind the computer. I asked the woman checking me in if I could have a room on a higher floor and she snapped back and said that the room she is giving me is the best she has (Mind you my associate, who checked in later, got a much higher room that didn't face an office building). Then she told me to come down to the front desk in the morning and take care of the rest of the bill. (Don't know why she said this as they charged my card the remaining funds the following morning before I even woke up). I thought it was humorous because after this crazy episode, the associate who was very pleasant, tried to convince me to join the Hilton Honors program. Not if this is the service I am going to receive. Like I said, I gave this hotel a 3 because of the service experience. The staff seem to be a pretty mixed personality group. Some are extremely snobby and rude, and others are extremely pleasant and kind. But a few bad apples, unfortunately can spoil the bunch. But the rooms are nice and quaint. So if you use a credit card and have no issues paying for the room, I am pretty sure you will have a decent experience. Just try not to interact with too many staff members.

Great location. Central to everything. Small rooms with odd layout. But the elevators are a nightmare. You have to use your key to get them to operate and they don't always work. Three elevators, they used two for hotel business leaving one for guests. Found myself waiting and frustrated several times to just get to my room. Rooftop bar has great view. I was comfortable but would likely look for another hotel for future trips.

I have stayed here twice for business and loved the location and facilities. The rooftop bar is a must in good weather. Rooms are immaculate, functional and small but who goes to NYC to stay in their room?! If you're there for work, grab a drink, connect to the WiFi and work on your email on the roof with the Empire State Building in the background.

The gentleman by the name Elan at the front desk was very helpful on all my needs. I had to make some changes on a reservation and I could not have ask for more from Elan. He made the changes and also made great suggestions. I stay in a lot of hotels for business and when I am in NYC I stay at this hotel.

Lower quality Hilton line hotel. Staff are very good but rooms are very small and poorly laid out in terms of doors interfering with each other and poor lighting. Good drawer space though. Parking is more than half a block away.
user_name:
Leonard J B
New York City, United States

review_body: I've stayed in many Hiltons in NYC. This is a nice one for the following reasons: the location is great (close to Tribeca, SoHo and Meatpacking), the rooftop bar is awesome (great views, go up there) and there's a nice restaurant attached. The downside is the rooms are small. But that's so common in the city. I was pleased with the service and my overall experience and I will stay here again.

I spent 5 or so days at the Hilton New York Fashion District last week and was pleasantly surprised. Check in was a breeze and I was on my way up to my room very quickly. My room was nicely appointed and was immediately happy with the situation. I had plenty of space in the room to place my bags and the such. The bathroom was completely functional with a nice shower that did what I needed it to do. The internet was very efficient and posed no problems throughout my stay. This is very rare. I was able to get a lot of my work done in an efficient manner. One of my only complaints was that there were no ice machines available to guests. I often ordered it from Room Service and normally it was delivered in a timely fashion. A few times I walked down to the bar and they re-filled my bucket. One of the main problems was that the room was very noisy. You could hear everything that was going on in the hallways. A couple of times I was in my room in the afternoon relaxing and could not nod off due to the chitter chatter of the employees working in the hall. I was woken up in the morning as well each time a door opened or people headed out of their rooms. All of the staff were very friendly and seemed to be happy. The location is super great. Just far enough from Times Square to get you out of most of the hubbub of Manhattan. Super bonus.

Stayed here last year, the room size felt like I was in a box with a small window, but the bathrooms were a good size. The bar on top is also a very nice touch and something you should go to check out.Did not try the resteraunt, but there are tons of options all around the place. Ok business hotel. Staying for vacation I would stay away.

The hotel itself is ok for business travel, the room was clean and very decent size for NYC standards, a room was available for us for early check in and the front desk staff was very courteous. However, there was a few bumps. The bill was available under the doorstep in the morning for fast check out, however , it featured a charge for a glass of wine which i had paid cash the night before. To get the bill corrected, i had to run after the restaurant manager and ask him to go to the front desk to sort that out. The issue only got solved after a second request from my side a few hours later. The second hickup happened at the hotel restaurant where i sat from 8:15 to 9:00 without anyone taking my order.when my group of colleagues arrived around 9, it took the waiters another 10 minutes to come take our order and the 25 minutes wait for the food were apparently cause by my ordering of a hard boiled egg (which should have been extremely overcooked if that were the case). Also we were told that breakfast was not included in the room, i now see that it was probably supposed to be when i visit the hotel website. One last thing is i am missing an envelope with cash as well as my blackberry charger which were hidden at the bottom of my suitcase together with my passport and other important stuff i did not want to carry with me on the street while walking around in the afternoon. I always thought it was safer to leave those importan belongings with the hotel staff while already checked out but not leaving town until later, i guess it was naive of me to think this way. I'll make sure to find another solution in the future. In conclusion, it's a good hotel but staff needs to be managed better because they lack discipline and efficiency.

Very clean room and staff was attentive. I would stay here again. The rooftop bar was not very busy but great view of Empire State Bldg. There are several bars adjacent to the hotel. Easy walk to Subway, Time Square, and Broadway Avenue.

I stayed in this hotel for two nights. I disliked the hotel very much. First, the location of the hotel seems to be on the dirtiest and smelliest street in NY (Not their fault, i know). Second, The rooms were super small and outdated. Third, the noise from the street was unavoidable. Finally, the rooftop bar was a joke!!! Small, ugly, and no views. For the price I paid, I expected a much better experience. Sorry to say that I won't recommend this hotel to anyone.

My husband and I chose the Hilton New York Fashion District based on TripAdvisor reviews. The hotel was very nice and a great location for shopping, walking, buses, subway, dining, and close to Penn Station. We arrived via NJ Transit at Penn Station, and used NJ Transit to get to Newark Airport. The staff was professional and friendly, and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable, and even had a view of the street. One night we went to the roof top lounge and were delighted with the view.

The hotel is walking distance to many bars/restaurants and very close to the subway for getting around manhattan. Rooms are decent size and bathrooms modern and also good sized. There is a restaurant in the below ground level that has a good breakfast buffet for $22 ($7 with a hilton voucher depending on your hilton level). The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Say hi to the very pleasant Mily at the check in desk.

I stayed here with my husband during a short visit to NYC. We needed some orientation on the places to visit, so we decided to consult the reception staff. They were very friendly and helped us make a great plan for our short vacations. I want to give special thanks to Mily (I forgot her last name) and the entire front desk staff. I always love when the hotel staff cares about their guests.
user_name:
MR6905
New York City, New York

review_body: I had the best time, and a great place to be while here. Great are and Sid was the best part #SidIsAwesome. Thank you so much for the great experience. Close to everything I wanted to be near. Nothing but an impeccable experience and one more shout out to Sid for his help.

This is my second time staying at the Hilton Hotel. I booked a room for the night in order to celebrate my birthday in the city. It was such a pleasure upon my arrival when Mily greeted me and my guests. She gave me an upgrade and a complimentary bottle of wine to begin my night. I really appreciate this lovely gesture and the great service provided. I would definitely be coming back again and referring friends and family members to this hotel. Thank you guys!

Had an excellent stay. Staff went above and beyond to make me comfortable. Thanks again to everyone for your help and your time! The Rare Bar staff was also friendly and the drinks were pretty good. Didn't eat, but the food smelled delicious. It was my pleasure to have spent my time with you all. I wish everyone greatness and great luck! Hope to see you guys soon!

My maid of honor booked a room for a makeup trial and a night of pampering for myself and my bridal party a few weeks prior to my wedding. Our room was immaculate and the facility was phenomenal. The staff was extremely professional and attentive to our every need, especially Mily! Thank you so much for accommodating our every need!

My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. I told them it was our anniversary when I made the reservation and there was a bottle of red wine in our room when we checked in. In addition we had an amazing room with an amazing view of mid-town and empire state building, on the 21st floor. The location in Chelsea cannot be beat, this is one of our favorite areas in the city. The redline is less than a block. The hotel has an amazing bar/club that is on the roof and has an unmatched view of mid-town. This was by far one of my best hotel experiences in NYC. I will be back for sure.

I know it's UN time in New York but $500 a night for a postage stamp sized room is gouging. The mattress was soft and lumpy - obviously needs replacement. Finally, when I asked about upgrades at check-in (none was offered) the front desk agent told me that if I were staying longer than two nights he could move me to a higher floor (presumably with a view), but because I was checked in for only two nights (at a cost of $1,000) he couldn't give me a higher room. The logic is bizarre and the service very disappointing.

If you're looking for a good hotel away from too many tourist, this is a place to go. The location is quite well, very near the Chelsea District. It's off 26th and 7th ave. The only complaint I would have is the rooms are quite small and they don't have suites available. The cool this is there is a rooftop bar, so if you're there around summer/fall you can enjoy a drink with a nice view of the city.

I travel often and have seen all kinds of service. This hotel was on there game when it came from me having a bad day. They went above and beyond to make sure my day got better. I would like to thank the front desk for doing an amazing job! The room was perfect and so clean. Housekeeping was very friendly. I loved the roof top bar. Great place to relax and have a drink. Thank you and I will now always stay here!!!Scott

My party had a fantastic stay. Thanks to Amena,Mily, Martha who showed us great hospitality. Close to all the bars, restaurants, and attractions of the city. Very nice rooftop bar with a view of the Empire State Building. Nice hotel in a perfect location. I highly recommend!

I had an incident where I left all the cash I had in the safe box at my room and left to DC. The staff was so helpful making sure the money is transfered to me especially Raquel Ledesma -the director of rooms, who had to go to Western Union 3 times to do it.

This hotel, which I conveniently located is slipping somewhat in quality. I have stayed here often but this last time I got a bed with a too-soft mattress and ordered breakfast which was not edible. The front staff is very helpful and the bar on the roof is nice, though when they have an event, the best areas of the bar are off limits to you. Free coffee and hot water in the lobby would be nice.

The location of the hotel is very good (plenty of bars-pubs and metro stations within a walking distance), and far enough from the Times Sq. buzzing. If you need anything of the concierge look for Amena, she was very efficient and helpful.

This hotel is so so nice and romantic, i love it. Its got a great location and great views from the roof top bar. I loved staying here, its so convienent. The staff are so helpful , really good place to stay although a little expensive.

Did not love this hotel, it wasCrazy loud and not good for families! I don't this would be good for a family to visit the city. There was a bar on the top of the hotel and you weren't aloud to go into a certain elevator. This made the other two elevators have a very long waiting time.

thank you to the wonderful staff at the Hilton Fashion district. This hotel was so wonderfully located: a few blocks from Penn station and easy walking to everything I needed. Caroline and the front desk staff saved me from a booking error that I made and smoothed everything out. The hotel was clean and nicely appointed.

our stay was fine. The hotel staff were great. The restaurant was great. The bar staff were great. My wife and I were getting dressed at 9:20 am on 9/20 when a lady from house keeping walked in without knocking. She did not even say Im sorry she just closed the door. I do not expect this from a $100 motel never mind a Hilton
user_name:
Walter B
Farmingdale N.Y., United States

review_body: 2 nights here for business meetings. Great location, nice room, great service. Christine Drumgoole and Luidin De Los Santos provide the best customer service and experience. The staff here makes every stay a great stay. I'll be back again next month! The only thing I would change is bring back the ice buckets in the rooms. I'm probably one of the only guests that actually get ice from the ice machine. So with no ice bucket and no ice machines, I have to get ice from room service. I always tip room service staff, so ice now costs me $2 a bucket. And I'd love a fridge in my room instead of the high priced, stocked minibar. Minor inconveniences at a great property.

My check in was at 1 am because a delay on mi flight, the reception was cold and the only person who helped me was just doing the minimum effort to give me the room that again didn't like me. I ordered at expedia a high level room and the hotel give away my room and placed me on a room that seem like a box. My bath was very small, you cant get a shower without hurting your elbows, and about the room the bed is very nice but again a very small room. Probably I had another expectation on a Hilton, but the hotel was just fine for sleep. You don´t want to spend time in the hotel. If you are planning only to get some sleep at NYC this hotel is just fine.

It is off the tourist track, but close to many attractions. I found my room to be clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and overall good service. The one area this hotel needs to improve are their fitness facility. I used the stationary bicycle and it would intermittently lose the tension on the spin, in addition I watched someone on the treadmill get quite frustrated because it would stop for no apparent reason. If you don't plan on using the fitness room, but like the location, this is a nice hotel.

Nice quite hotel. I sleept on 11th floor, with a view to the back side. This in combination with a nice bed gave me the best sleep I have had on a hotel in years. (I am still happy to get to my own bed :-) ) The only trouble is the very noisy aircondition, which must be turned off when sleeping.
user_name:
Michelr S
New York, United States

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay here for a business trip. Room was reasonable size for Manhattan, staff were very friendly and couldn't have been more helpful. Downstairs bar has lovely cocktails and a great atmosphere, upstairs bar with roof terrace is fabulous with outside seating and a great view of downtown. Breakfast and room service both good and bathroom was particularly good - spacious wet room with lots of counter space. I found it a great location overall for where I needed to be for meetings about evenly spread between downtown and around Rockefeller centre but it is a little out of the way depending on what you are doing and where you want to go - it's not the best placed for sightseeing or nightlife. But it was great for what I needed and I would definitely go back.

Nice hotel, found it expensive but then again its New York. Room was clean but not much light. Did not like the look of the restaurant so did not eat there. Found the reception staff not that helpful.

I've just completed my 5th stay at the Hilton Fashion District for this year and continue to really enjoy my stay. Staff across the board are very helpful, early check in is usually possible (don't think my status matters here) and rooms have always been clean and bright. I favor the corner rooms (xx11 lines) with view of the Empire State Building. Rooms are OK sized for NYC. There is a bare burger bar in the lobby (status breakfast will be served here) - and a pretty busy bar on the roof top. It's walking distance to Times Square. I wish they had a lounge - and the 'gym' really is a small Cardio room. If you want to work out or use weights, you won't be happy here. I've recommended this hotel to clients and coworkers and definitely will continue to go back when Midtown business brings me to NYC.

The hotel was clean, the service was good. Most importantly, the price was fair! The most satisfied hotel I've ever booked. One thing was not as great was the house keeping lost my shirt which I put in the room. They agreed to get the same shirt for me later on. Besides that I think it's a pretty good place to consider!

Great location that allows you to stay outside the annoying crowds of Times Square, but close enough to walk there or south to Greenwich Village in 20 minutes or so. Hotel staff hit most of the notes for a great stay, offering a room upgrade to us as Gold members, but missed on other benefits expected for Gold members. Bed was comfortable, WiFi strong. Rooftop bar offers a nice view at night. Breakfast could improve at the restaurant. Buffet was uninspired, food lacked flavor. We've been to many Hiltons worldwide and they always wowed us at breakfast, was not the case here.

Generally good, front desk staff were very friendly and efficient. Was disappointed with aspects of the room. No in room fridge which is a bit limiting for a 3 night stay, bathroom linens are in need of review or replacement as several towels and facecloths had stains or holes, iPhone dock radio was old so only took up to an iPhone 4 - perhaps time to replace these, and most annoying of all - I had left an item behind in my room and despite several attempts to contact the hotel to ask after it I have received no response. Not great. So for a hotel that isn't particularly cheap these are a few things that I think could have been done better.On the plus side, the view from the rooftop bar was amazing and the staff really are extremely nice.So in summary I would recommend to travels as the room was clean and hotel was nice but don't expect luxury.

Great hotel , but just like in most hotels in general staff kinda doesn't get it:) rooms were nice, also very quiet. Internet WiFi slow speed you would think New York City should have a decent Internet WiFi, well here this is definitely not the case.The Restaurant in the hotel, food was great, service was only ok though. I would come back probably come back and give them another go:)

We stayed at this hotel during a recent trip to NYC for the US Open. We chose it due to its location within walking distance of Penn Station. The hotel was great! The staff was friendly and accommodating, the room was clean and larger than most New York hotel rooms. There's a happy hour in the bar every day and the bartenders were terrific! There are restaurants and pubs nearby. What's not to like?!

I stayed at the Hilton New York Fashion District for one night, with a last minute booking. The hotel is beautiful, and in a perfect location for going out and seeing the town. Front desk was super helpful and professional, and room was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom looked brand new and even the room service was pretty delicious. Thumbs up!

When I'm not staying with a friend in NY I tend to stay here. The pricing is less that other comparable hotels, the location is great, and the service is always solid. It's not luxury, but it's never disappointed me. If you're taking the train, it's a short few block to Penn station so that's a nice bonus too.

My husband and I stayed for the weekend coming into town for a sporting event at Madison Square Garden. We got a decent rate, given the location and prices for hotels in NYC. The room was a little on the small side (also expected for NYC), so given the price and the size, just a little disappointed. We enjoyed the rooftop bar and service was great.

I cannot rave enough about this property, which is perfectly located in the Chelsea neighborhood in New York. I called them ahead of time to ensure that our room was facing the street and was on a high floor and they secured that. We were traveling with our friends, and they made sure that we had adjacent rooms, and I had not even requested this in advance.The room was spacious by New York standards. I have paid way more and stayed at way smaller rooms in New York. The room was very clean and stylish, we had free Wi-Fi, which was strong and reliable. The hotel lobby is stylish with a cool vibe, and has innovative artwork that uses spools of thread all in different colors, it's a seemingly simple idea with a stunning effect. There is an amazing roof deck in the hotel, and it is very famous in the City, so locals go there as well. The roof deck offers great views of New York.Again, the location of the hotel is ideal, and places you within walking distance of many famous sights in New York. We even easily walked to the High Line from this hotel, granted it was a few blocks, but totally walkable.Overall, my husband and I decided that this is great hotel that we could come back to over and over again.

Had a great stay here. I have stayed here before when it was a different brand and I think the hotel is well served by Hilton.Front desk was great at check in, noting my Hilton Status and checking me in very quickly. Room was standard Hilton and very comfortable. I had the continental breakfast every morning (part of Gold perks) and service was great. Another nice perk was the free wifi for Golds. Worked well in the room and the restaurant.One improvement since my last stay is that the rooftop bar is no longer the hotspot it once was and accessing the elevator on a Friday or Saturday night wasn't the slog it was back then.Another big thumbs up is just hours after I filled out a Hilton internal e-mail asking about my stay, the manager sent a note to me asking me about a detail I noted and vowing to take care of it.Would stay here again!

Don't expect much about Hilton Fashion District. Hotel is just ok on an average perspective. Small rooms, good location but nothing else. Hotel doesn't offer a warming and cozy atmosphere, including staff.For the price they charge I would say that there are better otpions in the city. And for a little bit more, less than USD100, even better otpions will appear.

Having booked this only a day before arrival I was astounded at getting such a great rate, booked using my AAA membership. I wasn't expecting too much service wise having dropped 6 months earlier from Hilton Diamond to Hilton Silver however I was pleasantly surprised on checking in to receive a friendly welcome and be given my room 1 hour prior to official check-in.Location for me was great, less than a 10 minute walk to Times Square if you so desire..... but more importantly only a 5 minute or so walk from Penn Station, Manhattan Mall and Macy's.The room was a good size I thought for NYC, the shower worked well and the air con was fantastic. I decided to walk to Chinatown from here, onto the Brooklyn Bridge etc. and felt it was well situated for exploring Manhattan on foot from there, ranging up to Times Square and even Central Park should you feel so inclined (I didn't on this trip).All in all, a very comfortable hotel with a nice bed, bathroom and decent space. I would quite happily stay here again.

Very nice hotel in NYC. Rooms are very clean (but small). Bed very, very comfortable. The hotel staff very friendly. Good location. I would say centrally located, but all depends where you need to go in NYC. Easy walking distance to Empire State Building.

My husband and I stayed here for three nights on a weekend. I read that the rooms were small but they are really small. I felt like with two big suitcases and the two of us, it made it a little cramped but no big deal. I didn't think the staff was overly friendly either when we asked a few questions. My biggest tip though is that if they give you the free vouchers for continental breakfast at the hotel ask them if you can exchange it for the vouchers for Sunac which is the deli around the corner. We did the continental breakfast the first day and it was terrible, orange juice and dry pastries. After that I remembered reading that you could exchange your vouchers so we did that for the rest of the trip. Sunac offers made to order breakfast, a coffee bar, juice bar and a lot more. It's way more bang for your voucher. Also don't forget to go to the roof top bar, the views are amazing, we had their nachos and they were yummy. My only complaint is that they said they didn't have the stuff to make bloody Mary's! I think we would probably return to this hotel next time.

I was quite pleased with the brightness of the room and the hallways. SUPER water pressure and really hot water. Bed was comfy and good sound control. Pleasant staff. Each person coming onto the elevator from the lobby has to use their room key to activate the elevator stopping on their floor--nice security touch.

We have been to NYC many times, always love trying different places. Since we were taking the train and needed to be near Penn Station, I went "in search of" - I found this fabulous place! Easy walking distance, safe neighborhood with nice restaurants and shopping. However, the best thing about this hotel: the staff! This is the friendliest place we have ever stayed. Elan at the front desk made our stay so special - a bottle of wine and a beautiful view of Downtown from our 22nd floor room. We never had to wait for elevators, staff was actually right in the lobby always monitoring and pushing buttons for us. We were always greeted with a smile and hello. The room was impeccably clean, and a nice size for NYC. We ate at the restaurant within the hotel and it was delicious. You will not go wrong at this hotel, it was a wonderful stay.

We decided to stay somewhere outside of the Times Square bustle for this trip. We were very pleased with this hotel. The front desk staff were very friendly and even allowed us to check into our room at 12pm! The room was updated with modern decorations, clean and a VERY comfortable bed/linens. My favorite part was the rooftop bar. Huge casual rooftop bar with great music, string lights, and amazing views of the Empire State Building. I don't understand the negative reviews is the rooftop bar - could not have asked for a better night cap!

Like the three bears, this hotel is not too large and not too small, just right. Modern, sleek looking rooms. Very comfortable. Excellent restaurant on street level and rooftop bar. Excellent service and staff. Can walk to everything; few blocks from Penn station and MSG. Think it will be our base for future trips to NYC,
user_name:
Chinapjs
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: *Great Location, lots of eating places and shopping around, but away from the hussle and bussle.*Staff was very attentive.*Hotel is modern and welcoming and well kept up, not too outdated (except for bathroom vanities)*Great Valet of car, no problems,but your typical $65 a day charge for an SUV.*RARE restaurant attached to hotel had awesome food. YUM, try it. Great for the end of the day meal.*Roof top bar, was like nothing else Ive seen. Such an awesome feel, cozy with couches and tropical plants and lights and TV's and a huge bar, very nice space up high with a view. A must see. Drinks ran about $8.Areas around the block.2 Brothers Pizza, stick with the 2 slices and a can of soda for $2.99There is a farm Market grocery store that is HUGE and has everything you could ever want, I was surpised by the size of it.Also a Whole Foods and Trader Joes near by. And many little restaurant in just a 2 block radius.Chelsea market is a must see, loved it. Only a few blocks away, completely walkable. Highline park is also a great sight to see, how cool it is just to talk a nice walk through such an enjoyable park.Love Battery park, although its all the way down by statue of liberty, it was an $18 Uber ride and with 4 people in the car, that sure beats the subway and got us there in about 8 to 10 min. Traffic was light that day.**Bedding, loved it, new , comfy, pillows were great.Bathroom, love the shower with the seamless glass and NO TUB, only thing I was very disappointed about was the vanity, we had two rooms at this hotel and I am extremely picky about staying at a clean updated hotel, Im a hotel snob. :) But the vanities are so very worn out, and appears to be water like damage and very ugly. Hilton this is the only place your disappointed me, therefore I would certainly recommend this hotel. We got it for $153 a night end of August, what a steal.**We got our early check in as requested.**You can ask for a fridge for your room when you get there, and got one immediately, because the fridge in your room is stocked with stuff you must purchase, just ask for a fridge and they will bring you one.*** Requested xtra pillows and towels through an email request, and they were there in the room when we arrived. ! Awesome Hilton. **Elevators ran very well. no problems.** Keurig with free coffee in every room.**Rooms are super tiny, but I guess all of NYC is like this, my entire kitchen is bigger, but I live more in the country setting in larger homes.

Arrived by metro from JFK airport. Short walk from 23st. Great location for exploring Chelsea and its surrounding area.We arrived too early to use our room but the staff were very welcoming, and offered to take our bags so we could go and explore and to call us when our room was ready.On our return Marion dealt with our checkin, she was extremely friendly and welcoming. She was able to meet our request to have two beds.We were in a room on the top floor, giving us great views of the NYC skyline. Beds and pillows were amazingly comfortable, and we had great sleep quality.Everything we needed was in the room, including iron, hairdryer, toiletries, free wifi and a great coffee pod machine.Upon check out we were immediately asked if we wanted our bags stored, which was very helpful as we were not leaving until later that afternoon.The only negative for me was the hotel roof bar, which was a little tired looking and lacked atmosphere.Would definitely stay here again if in the area.

This was our 3rd stay at this property and not our last. The rooms are spacious for NY, very clean and comfortable. The staff goes out of their way, whether it be restaurant suggestions, getting around or making sure everything in your room is functioning properly. Our daughter attends FIT and this location is convenient when we travel to move her in/out, or just for a visit. The rooftop bar has great views and a good place to relax at the end of the day.

I had the best experience ever from the time of arrival to departure. Everyone was friendly and efficient. I'm short and all the safes were above my head and I couldn't use them. They were so accommodating and put me in a accessible room--showed it to me first to make sure it was fine with me. Marian was the front staff member who helped me and she was the nicest front desk person I've ever experienced. Just turned 70 and have travelled extensively. The concierge, all front desk staff, bellman, etc. were helpful with all my needs--from taxis, town cars, NY advice, etc. The beds were comfortable and I never heard any street or hotel noise in corridors. I ate at Rare--the restaurant many times and whether it was breakfast or a late night snack all the staff was very attentive to all our requests. I would definitely stay there for another visit.

The midtown location is great - equal distances from shopping in Soho to the south and Central Park to the north. Times square is very close by, as are lots of great restaurants.As far as the hotel itself goes, it's good but not one you'd visit just for the hotel experience. Rooms are clean and functional but very small. There is a gym but no pool. The restaurant is decent but in no way a "must do". All in all, decent, functional, great location, but not a luxury experience.

We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Fashion District. Very comfortable and newly updated rooms. We got a great deal through travel zoo. Would give 5 stars if it were not for a bad room service experience - they got our breakfast wrong twice and argued with me about not honoring the menu they told me was the current one in our room. I wouldn't waste money on room service, other than that our experience was great! The restaurant/bar downstairs has great burgers, drinks, and service.

Great place with a great staff. Martha was very helpful as was the rest of the front desk staff. Room was clean with great stuff to do in the area. RareView has a nice rooftop bar upstairs with great drinks. The waitress Kate is awesome! What a great personality. Great drinks.

Although the rooms are small, hotel has a very good standard. Burgers at Rare(lobby sports bar) are great and the bar at the roof top has great service and views. Best of the hotel is the friendly and very efficient front desk staff, especially Marion Rock!!Thanks for a great stay.

The hotel was of similar quality to the lower level Hilton brands. As a Gold member, I asked for a room with a view and was given a room in the back of the hotel facing another building about 10 feet away with busy workers - there was absolutely no privacy, so I had to keep the blinds drawn. The room itself was quite dark to begin with. The full length mirror was terribly placed by the entrance with a low light overhead, which made visibility impossible. The room and bathroom were very small, similar to other sliver hotels in the area. The in-room safe was extremely high, so unless, you are seven feet tall, you cannot see the contents without standing on something. Whoever designed the room didn't do a good job. The hallway noise was annoying with doors slamming throughout the night. One of the three elevators was dedicated to the rooftop restaurant which made the wait for an elevator excessive. Overall, this was not an enjoyable stay. For the same price, I could have stayed somewhere better.
user_name:
meanchat
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at this Hilton over a long weekend and quite enjoyed it!THE GOODGreat Location! Easy access to the subway and walking distance to the night life of Chelsea.Great Staff! Everyone from the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff were very courteous and went out their way to be helpful.Nice Rooms! Very trendy and newer designed hotel rooms that were actually larger than expected and that's a nice surprise for NYC.WI-FI! Worked fast and it was free.THE BADElevator key card that would only would allow access to your floor. This was particularly annoying for us because we had friends on another floor.The shower configuration was not the best design. You had to reach all the way inside of the shower to turn the water on which means you got a blast of cold water all over you. It was definitely tricky and didn't allow you to turn the shower on without being exposed to the initial water.I definitely recommend this hotel to other travelers and I would return here for the right price.
user_name:
ATLtoEUR767
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel has all of the ammenities that you would expect from the Hilton brand (except a breakfast buffet). Most of all, my room on the 18th floor was QUIET! Guests must use their pass key in the elevator, otherwise pushing the floor button will not work. This can be a hassle when your hands are full, so be prepared before you enter the lobby. WARNING TO DRIVERS: Do NOT valet park your vehicle! Take the time to park it yourself. My valet parking experience was horrid! Had we not gone to the garage ourselves and TOLD THEM how to retreive our car, they would have kept telling us "There's nothing we can do." Save yourself the hassle (and outrageous fee) avoid this service like the plague.

To me this is probably the best hotel in New York for the money. The location is simply fantastic. You can head downtown or uptown and you are close to everything. On this trip we had tickets for an event at MSG and walked there in about 10 minutes.In addition, the roof top never disappoints.

I've been to NY quite a few times and stay in a different hotel each stay. This hotel is definitely one of the best that I've stayed in. That atmosphere of the hotel was great and the staff was very nice and accommodating. The room was small but if you only plan to sleep there like me then it won't matter. Besides it's NY and it comes with the territory. It's location is GREAT and a short walking distance from many subways stations. If you are looking to go to Times Square will love it because it's in walking distance from the hotel. If anyone is coming to NY and planning on going to the Wendy Williams or Rachel Ray Show I suggest you stay at this hotel. You can stand outside and see the studios where the shows are taped. Just a couple of minutes walk. I would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.

It was great except for the rooftop bar. Way overpriced (even for NY), smokey, crowded. The concierge was very very very helpful in locating and advising. Everything else (staff,room, food in the restaurant) was top shelf!!!!!

I was surprised at the nice room that was waiting for us. Very comfortable and even though small it didn't feel cramped. The bed is comfy and the bathroom nice. Linens are great!The rooftop bar is also really nice and has great views and drinks.

I've stayed at this hotel several times for business. I love how the hotel is tucked into the neighborhood and feels like a smaller European hotel, not a giant chain. Great rates for NYC or even suburban NJ. I drive in with an SUV and the parking access, service, and rates for self-park are good. The parking garage is so close you really don't need valet unless you have a significant amount of luggage. Front desk staff are always very friendly, personable, and go the extra mile to accommodate you. The rooms are good sized for the price in Manhattan. I don't understand what other reviewers are complaining about regarding room size. Room service food quality is excellent. I go to the roof bar every time I've stayed there and enjoy it. The only downside is that there is no bathtub (or at least no tubs in the rooms my travel budget can manage). Starbucks is about a block away, and great walk in the morning down 27th street after getting coffee, as it is the "floral" district. After I get my coffee, I walk around and literally smell the roses, as opposed to pee first thing in the morning. A definite bonus.

Hotel is clean. It's quiet. The rooms are nice and it's great to be able to sit down and have a drink at rare. The service is friendly and our room has always been just as one would expect of a hilton. Classy. Clean. Crisp. Well done.
user_name:
conniet07
New York City, New York

review_body: Ran into an issue last time where the front desk staff did not add my wife's name to the reservation, so she could not get into the room for some time. This time, everything went very smoothly.The rooms are clean, quiet, comfortable, and nice sized for the area (I have also stayed at the Hilton properties on 28th and 29th where they can be a tad small.Service was spot on, and the roof top bar is a nice place to relax after work and get some fresh air and have a drink. I will probably try to stay here from now on when I am in the area...

Most of my NYC visits I'm forced to stay in the touristy area, this time tried a hotel little off beaten path. really enjoyed being in a quieter area with not so crazy hotel.. even though hotel was sold out, it didn't feel like I had a mob to get through in the lobby. restaurant attached is nice for quick meal, lots of great restaurants close by, activities within walking distance, never had to take a taxi any where. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful, I did have to move my room once, first one was behind the elevator and between that and staring at the building too close by, it was too much for long stay. request a room facing the front of the building, higher floors are quieter.. not too bad of street noise even on lower floors for NYC.. Great bathroom amenities.. Peter Thomas Roth products are great, rarely do I use hotel amenities, this one I had to try out.

Another pleasurable stay at the Hilton Fashion District hotel.I travel 30 weeks year and always look forward to visiting this hotel when I'm in NYC.The front desk staff is fantastic and make the experience special as they go out of their way to help make you feel at home.Thanks to Christine and staff- I will be back soon.Thanks!Chris

very good stay, easy to get a cab and get around , staff very helpful, rooms clean. reasonably priced for NYC. roof top bar with great views. food very good at Rare restaurant. walk to Time Square and many other attractions

I think for most, if you get a sub $250 rate then you'll think it's good for the money in NY.But, based on big city Hilton's I think it's just average.There's nothing terribly wrong, it just doesn't impress. Struggled in with multiple large cases and nobody came to help. The Hilton diamond 'upgrade' consisted of the smallest queen bedded room the hotel has, but "On a higher floor" = UPGRADE.The complimentary (Hilton Diamond) continental breakfast is pretty poor and you can no longer use the coupon and pay extra for a la carte offerings. They do have a 'secret' alternative that you have to ask for, where they give you a $12.50 coupon for the Sunac deli around the corner (a MUCH better alternative).Note : The foot print of this hotel is VERY small. The 14+ rooms per floor are all very close to each other, so you will hear the lifts, house keeping and the comings and goings of other guests on your floor.

The Hotel is in the middle of Manhattan, some metro station uptown the time square is reachable, some downtown the financial district and the Brooklyn Bridge.The Hotel has different categories of room, we had a room in the upper level(19zh floor). We were surprised how was the room, bright, fancy, not small, nice shower etc. The room has as well a coffee machine, like Nespresso, with different coffee flavors available to choose in the morning.WiFi was availible and a easy connection.The view from the window is, as usual in Manattan, not spectacular, but the sun came in to bright up the roomThe Hotel has as well a roof top bar, which we didn’t visit, but according to the line in the lobby, it should be nice.We can recommend this Hotel for Manhattan.

Little away from the hustle and bustle of broaway but a great little hotel that is easy walking or cab anywhere in the cityGreat staff great rooftop bar this is my 4th visit here and will be backPlenty of parking in the area 1/2 hr to EWR

Comfortable and friendly. The lobby is on the small side and not too impressive, but the rooms especially well-decorated for this "fashion district" place. The staff I dealt with were all very friendly and helpful. Hilton still wants to charge for wi-fi, which is an attitude they need to get over pretty quickly, but since I am an honors member it was complimentary. Still--in 2015 you need to provide the wi-fi just like you provide the towels, Hilton!

My husband and I recently stayed there and had a great experience. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very nice and helpful. The value was excellent, which was a big reason why we selected this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised at how spacious the rooms were. I would definitely stay there again!
user_name:
LisaG591
New York City, New York

review_body: I was unsure when I booked this property but would recommend this location to anyone wanting to stay on the West Side.The Roof-Top bar and restaurant are both a must.The rooms are small but very functional and the staff were very goodWill stay here again and I am usually a East Side mid-town guyYou won't be disappointed

The Hilton Hotel - Fashion District is an awesome hotel! We were very impressed! The service is consistently 5 star and the rooms are immaculately clean, well appointed and maintained. Marion, at the front desk, was especially helpful making sure we were comfortable and easily handled every request or question we had. And, don't miss the roof top bar (amazing views!). Our stay was excellent. We highly recommend the Hilton Hotel - Fashion District and will be staying again.

This property is located right in the center of the design district close to Central Park and great restaurants. Walking distance from 41 Madison. The hotel is very modern and updated with nice nice rooms that are very clean and comfortable. Safety is observed with having to introduce your key in the elevators in order to access the floors. Good wifi too. The staff is extremely welcoming and make you feel right at home. Highly recommend this hotel as a top one in NYC. Kudos to you.

Currently staying at hotel. Arrived early, so room was not available. Certainly understood. Was told they would call cell when room was available. No call. Had pre ordered wine and water for room. When I arrived in room - nothing was there. I called to complain - and never really got an explanation - only a mild apology. Arrived back to the room this evening - the room key did not work. After getting the third version of the room key - and kind of a condescending tutorial on how they work, the key did access the room. I am quite an experienced traveler - and found the comments insulting. I am only a Gold preferred member of Hilton Honors (previous Diamond). After deciding to leave my Platinum status as Starwood to re-achieve Diamond - am very much second guessing my decision (3 out of my last 4 stays at Hilton properties have been far below the standard).

My wife and I came to NYC to pick up our daughter from a summer program at NYU. We chose this hotel because it was between the Village and Times Square. We have a nice room, but it's the staff that is so impressive. They are so friendly and helpful. Mily and her team are so sweet. Their kindness makes me want to come back and stay here again next time!

I was very surprised by the affordable price, friendly staff and excellence of this Hilton.Great view of the Empire State Building and a wonderful opportunity to meet new individuals while I was in town on business.I will definitely stay here again!

We stayed here for my 50th birthday and the staff could not have been nicer. Milly and the staff who checked us in were great. We were given a beautiful room on the 22nd floor facing the Empire State Building, which made it hard to leave the room due to the view. The room was larger than we expected for NY; very clean and modern. Everyone we met in the hotel (with the exception of some of the rooftop bar staff, who are not employees of the hotel we later found out) went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. The female bartender who worked Sunday July 26th was about as rude and immature as I've ever encountered.....the only negative experience of our stay. The subways were close by, the neighborhood was clean and we felt very safe. We'd come back and stay here in a NY minute; it is that nice of a hotel.

First, let me tell readers that I travel a lot. No, wait, rather I travel a WHOLE LOT for work. And, my company policy requires me to find reasonable accommodations wherever I go. This means that the Plaza and Four Seasons are a no-go on my expense account. This also means that it is challenging to find a NYC hotel that meets my expectations for cleanliness, convenience, and comfort due to A) Prices in the city, and B) Horrendously low standards for NYC hotels. Even brands I am comfortable with everywhere else can be dingy, rude, and poorly appointed in this city. Finding a great room and a reasonable price near my venue and in a neighborhood that is relatively "safe" is not easy. THIS PROPERTY WAS GREAT on all counts. Stay here and stop surfing booking sites now. * Comfortable beds and fluffy pillows* Keurig coffee pot in room* Decent brand of soap/shampoo provided* Security nice with room keys required to use elevators* Friendly and welcoming service throughout property* Interesting and affordable on-property restaurant/bar that also has rooftop bar (see "Rare" reviews elsewhere)* Room service prompt and priced same/similar to restaurant (Rare menu, essentially)* In-room Wifi had working signal (free premium for Hyatt elite status guests)* Room was very clean, spotless you might even say* Location is nice and was walking distance to my meetings in Chelsea as well as a Whole Foods if you want to keep some healthy snacks in your room.* High floor room was quiet except for notable (but rare) sound from room across from me when they slammed their door. * TV has many channels and an on screen TV listings guide so you can avoid the annoying clicking through 15 different sports channels to see if there might possibly be shows on that are of interest. I didn't try it, but the TV also had places to plug in devices so you may be able to do more there than just watch their free channels.Note that I opted for a quiet room and didn't care about the view (which you will note is awesome by others who reviewed the same property). I had room 2002, which is on the "back" side away from the street and had its own little side hallway and this GREATLY reduced noises from other guests and employees. I heard nothing but the door from the one other room that shared my little hallway. I pulled the shades upon entering and left them there for privacy as my "view" was directly into offices across from me. If you want a view of the city, don't book on this side. My room, 2002, was great for one person. As I said, it was quiet and comfortable. But, if there were two of us, the tight quarters and small bathroom countertop would have created a bit of a strategy to share the space peacefully. And, if a view is important to you, this isn't your room. The desk folks were helpful and happy to help, so be sure to ask about this if you are traveling with another person.Negative hotel could easily fix:- Towels were in need of replacement as they have become thin/dingy/rough and are not up to the standards of Hyatt. I travel to NYC for work only under duress, as it is a pain to get to Manhattan from the western states and hard to move about once in the city for business meetings. As a result, I start getting anxiety about my travel there as soon as I am told I need to show up. Thanks to this property's wonderful attributes, one BIG part of my stress is now gone. Yay! Bottom line: Stay here. Book now.

This was our 4th stay at this Hilton. We love the area and we love this hotel. This latest visit we stayed in room 2002. It was supposed to be an upgrade, but this was not my favorite room. It was smaller than some of the other rooms we've had at this Hilton, and had a weird orientation and an ugly view. We accepted an upgrade from a corner room on the 7th floor, but we should have kept the 7th floor room. The higher rooms are considered premium because of the street noise, but on the 20th floor you start to get noise from the rooftop bar. In the room, which was very small, it's showing some signs of wear. The wooden vanity in the bathroom looks like it's gotten wet too many times and the veneer is peeling. The water pressure was great on the 20th floor tho!One thing we don't love about this hotel is that the mini-fridge is stocked with so much stuff, you can't squeeze in anything of your own. We like to stash a water bottle or maybe some restaurant leftovers, but the mini-fridges here are stocked like vending machines. We called and asked if we could borrow or rent a mini fridge. They said possibly, but then never got back to us and never brought anything.These are all very minor issues though and we will definitely be back.

We visited the Hilton in June for both myself and my partners birthday. We were greeted with a warm and friendly smile from Millie as well as the front desk manager at the time- - - forgive me for not remembering her name. Not only were we given a great rate but, we were treated with a drink at the bar and Millie appeared at our room with a cake! It doesn't get better than this! I'm a hotel snob I only do five star. I usually stay at the Ritz or the Mandarin. However the service that I received from Millie and the staff rivaled that of any five star hotel. I look forward to going back again- - - we can't stop talking about how great our birthday weekend was. BTW.. the room was very nice did bathroom was stellar! No mold in sight! Very modern and very well and tastefully done. Thank you so much really - - - you are the absolute best!
user_name:
Swamee
New York City, New York

review_body: The room was a great size for NYC. We were conveniently about 2 blocks from Starbucks and the 1 on 28th/7th Ave, which we took most of the time. Service was good & we loved the rooftop bar. My room was missing an ironing board, and when I called down to get one, they never sent it up, so I had to ask again. Not a big deal, but worth mentioning. We were in a corner room- 1611, and it was pretty quiet.

Well. I never thought I would ever give a Hilton 5 out of 5, for anything. However, the Hilton in Chelsea deserved it. The hotel was modern, boutique like, with 5 star service from a 4 star hotel. The deluxe room with the King size bed was spacious and the wall in shower, large enough for two people, was clean and beautiful. The wifi worked very fast and was given it for FREE (otherwise, $15 per day.) Plenty of cable Tv shows. The hotel is positioned in Chelsea, which makes it a 10 minute walk to Empire State building and other classic tourist areas, like Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. Though, away from all the touristy crowds. Plus, it sits near Koreatown, which has a great selection of food. The service, is some of the best anywhere; Keishawn (not sure how to spell it), the front entrance attendant was polite, engaging, and ready to help with any questions you may have about NY; give this man a promotion. P.S.: the subway was easy to use, safe, but HOT! There was no air conditioning in the subway, it was pushing triple digits in heat, so bring water with you.
