Otherwise, the sub-car is air conditioned.

I stayed here over the weekend with my fiance and we had an amazing experience. The location was so convenient for us to visit. The hotel was extremely clean and welcoming.The front desk agent Zoribel was very kind, attentive, and accommodating to our needs. She went out of her way to help us pick a good restaurant that fit our tastes and style. I would definitely recommend this Hilton location to all of my friends and family.

Great room! A bit small but is in a great location. The hotel staff were excellent. Clean . The subway stops were a block away. Shops and food were all close by. Also the hotel rooftop bar was nice as well. Would come back!

Great for our overnight needs to attend our daughters performance at NYC Steinhardt .... Enjoyed the restaurant and rooftop bar - trendy and fun ,,, Rooms were small but clean ... front desk staff courteous was helpful ....
user_name:
Nanette W
Charleston, South Carolina, United States

review_body: We visited the Hilton in June for both myself and my partners birthday. We were greeted with a warm and friendly smile from Millie as well as the front desk manager at the time- - - forgive me for not remembering her name. Not only were we given a great rate but, we were treated with a drink at the bar and Millie appeared at our room with a cake! It doesn't get better than this! I'm a hotel snob I only do five star. I usually stay at the Ritz or the Mandarin. However the service that I received from Millie and the staff rivaled that of any five star hotel. I look forward to going back again- - - we can't stop talking about how great our birthday weekend was. Thank you so much really - - - you are the absolute best!
user_name:
Swamee
New York City, New York

review_body: Good hotel. Great and fast Service, good location and quality.The receptionists was very professionals. We will return soon and advise to ours friends about the good experience that we have had. Regards.

Really enjoyed the hotel experience and the location is spot on....close to everything. Friendly staff, housekeeping was so accommodating and kind and room service brought us hot water and lemon (summer flu) at no charge. I travel a great deal both professionally and personally and this Hilton was amongst the best experiences I have had. The true measure of a good establishment is how quickly and efficiently it deal with any issue that may inevitably occur. Élan Bielski, Director Front Desk was beyond professional, efficient, understanding and extremely personable. He promptly dealt with our issue, which I want to point out had nothing to do with the hotel, which made us appreciate him even more. In the end everything worked out perfectly and this was thanks to him. So I highly recommend when staying in NYC...this is the place to stay. We will definitely be going back next year without a doubt

Its well run and modern hotel and close to 5th avenue with plenty of places to eat cheaply nearbyIts close to where Mega Bus stops and the subway is 3 minutes awayThe basement has a rather cool trendy restaurant if you like a bit of noise combined with good burgersI only had one minor issue which was resolved by the Front Office supervisor promptly. I would definitely stay here again.

Welcome at front desk was very friendly, quick and helpful. Location is perfect for getting around the city as can fares won't be that high from here. The rooftop bar had a good view and was pretty comfortable. We had great weather and it was nice l having a drink. The rooms were standard rooms. Well kept.

Staff were amazing. Gave me free internet, room was quiet, when I asked for ice, it came immediately, and all the staff were friendly, seeking to be helpful, and reassuring when I didn't know where I was supposed to be.
user_name:
Sophie S
Concord, NH, United States

review_body: If you want a hotel known for it's view, or it's Famous chef restaurant don't stay here. If you want a hotel that offers friendly staff, modern baths, and great sleep quality and sq footage at a very reasonable price for NYC - this is your place. Second time that I've stayed here for personal trip - and I've stayed at a lot of NYC hotels on business. Staff are professional and friendly, building is safe and secure, location is easy walk from Penn Station and easy walk to Times Sq, Flat Iron, Highline and most importantly - sleep quality is fantastic! I've had many terrible night's sleep in NYC due to hallway or street noise - other than the door across from mine slamming a couple times - did not hear a peep. Bathrooms are modern and clean and we ate in restaurant once for breakfast which was very good. Roof top bar is cool too. Weekend pricing is SUPER reasonable at $340 for a 2 beds.
user_name:
Kathy I
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We recently stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for three nights. The location of the hotel is perfect and central to everything. There is also a fabulous roof top bar with great views of the city. After the night we had some technical difficulties with our room and were changed to a nicer room. Jonathan (front desk assistant manager)was awesome in assisting us with this even offering us some complimentary rooftop drinks while we waited for our room. Top notch customer service ;)

I contacted the hotel prior to arrival to see if I could arrange in advance to have something sent to another friend's room. I explained it was a celebratory girl's weekend for a friend of mine who'd beaten cancer and was heading off to do humanitarian work in the developing world. The staff insisted they would handle the arrangements themselves, and went above and beyond to make her feel special and honored. Mily at the front reception went to great lengths to put together a welcome gift for her. It set the tone for a wonderful weekend. AMAZING STAFF!!

I stayed at the Hilton New York Fashion District July 7 - 10. This was my third time staying here. This is a wonderful hotel. I stayed in a room with King bed which I was upgraded to without asking. The rooms are "roomy" by NYC standards. The room is modern and well outfitted. The halls are a kind of narrow but I didn't spend time in the halls! The hotel is in an excellent location in the Chelsea section of Manhattan. There are a lot of choices for eating, nightlife, etc. Its also a block away from subway station. The hotel has a rooftop bar, which I didn't care for because it was way to hot up there! And the crowd way to cliqueish. I didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, but I did get a drink. $15 for a bourbon and coke is kinda crazy but it is what is. The bar across the street is much more reasonable. The staff at the hotel is top notch. They treat you with courtesy and respect from the time you hit the door to when you leave. I want to especially acknowledge Zoribel! She is as nice and professional as she is beautiful. I appreciate the courtesy she showed me when I arrived at the hotel from LGA very early. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for the business traveler. Its my first choice when I have business in Manhattan or leisure.

This hotel was excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful. I phoned before hand and they reserved rooms with connecting doors. They also helped arrange taxis and advised on airport transfers.The rooms are small, but large enough and we fitted five people into two rooms.It is within easy walk of the Empire State building and Macy's, near restaurants, and very near a metro stop. There is a great roof top bar overlooking the Empire State.I would stay here again.

We booked a wedding block at this hotel for 4 days. This review is for Jose and his co- worker who helped us with our bags. They both were amazing and very willing to assist. On the day we left, we arrived in the lobby with our bags and checked out at the desk. We both then walked out to catch a taxi. Jose asked us if we needed assistance and we replied that we were heading to the airport and needed a taxi. Jose proceeded to inform us that transportation to the airport was complimentary since we had our wedding party staying at the hotel. He then got a black car to take us to the airport. He even informed us of the tipping custom, which we truly appreciated. Jose and his co-worker made this part of our trip most enjoyable.

I'm a regular here, and have been coming back due to the service, quality of the hotel & friendliness of the staff. It's an easy walk to /from Penn Station. Being in the Chelsea neighborhood opens you up to 1000's of amazing restaurants too
user_name:
Jeffrey S
Potomac, MD, United States

review_body: First time in new york, best night sleep in a long long time! Perfect location for everything my dtr and i wanted to do shop and eat and people watch. Special thanks to Elan for saying yes to anything i asked even before i was able to finish my question! Rare restaurant staff amazing and food great. When we couldn't decide what to eat she helped us pick out a great meal and desert. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting! Would give 10 stars if i could!!!!!!!

I was in New York City for a 3 day stay for a wedding and stayed at this Hotel. The front desk receptionist Mily and Zoribel were very kind and professional as well as the other staff. Rooms nice sized and clean. I really liked the Rares rooftop bar and club with great view of Manhattan skyline. Hotels location is in safe neighborhood and is near a subway stop located at 28th and 7th Ave. Surrounded by clubs, bars and restaurants but room was very quiet. One complaint, our room did not have a view of the skyline and faced apartment building but this was expected due the nature of life in congested Manhattan. However, if you want room with view of skyline you will need to get room that faces north and is on floor 14 and higher. Rares restaurant was affordable and good was good.

Though the rooms were smaller than many other cities, I had to remind myself that this was NY and space is costly everywhere! The staff was friendly and always helpful. Beds were clean and comfy. I searched a good bit for a hotel near FIT and though the price seems high for the room size, I feel confident that I would not have found a bigger room in another hotel with a staff this nice. Though I never made it to the rooftop bar (which apparently is a big draw), I did enjoy the restaurant downstairs... great brisket quesadillas!

Was surprised with early check-in, free upgrade to king size, and all this before the desk found out we were celebrating our 26th Anniversary!!! Which they then gave us a bottle wine to help celebrate. Rooftop bar was fun. Had a great time. Staff was always helpful . The only down side was breakfast in bed. Not great, but overall experience Fantastic.

... back for another stay and again (surprising that they can do this consistently) the staff has met and exceeded my expectations. Kudos to the front desk staff - Christing, Caroline and Angelica, all harmonizing with each other to make sure no detail is left out. Really, I ask myself "how do they do it and do it so well when the more expensive properties don't do 40% and want more money"?

I stayed here awhile back, this review is a bit overdue I'm afraid. This was my "transition" hotel, from a vacation back to reality and work. The front of the house staff was absolutely excellent. Marian, Jose, Katherine and Martha really made me feel welcome and valued. The rooms were clean and comfortable; I want to say they were a little small but it's NYC and they were reasonably priced so really they were bigger than I expected. Room service was prompt and delicious and the hotel bar in the Spring was a real pleasure.

Zoribel at the front desk was incredibly helpful and gave me excellent service. She gave me great directions to many attractions. Also, housekeeping on Floor 2 were also a huge help as well! They helped me get ice even though that wasn't there job!

Just stayed 12 nights at the Hilton New York Fashion District while in New York for work. The staff, especially front office manager Johnathan Suazo, were most accommodating and the room was new and clean. I enjoyed the view of the Empire State Building at night. I'll be returning next week.

Good location, although not in a very nice street. Sometimes good prices or promotions.Rooms tend to be really small. Wifi goodHard to get a taxi. Staff not so pleasant but OK for a business hotel.Breakfast just OK, the breakfast location is in the basement/lower side of the hotel

I stay in NYC quite often, generally at Hiltons or Marriotts for point accumulation....the Hilton Fashion District is definitely my favorite in the Chelsea area, and is fast becoming my favorite anywhere in the city. I stayed here last night for a dinner on the upper east side - the hospitality and welcoming nature of the staff make the short cab ride worthwhile. Jose at the front entrance is phenomenal, always making me happy I chose this property. He and Élan even made sure I had a welcoming gift in my room! Bonus! BTW - the rooms are very nice and large by NYC standards. And Rare is a cool little hotel bar.I'll be back!

Thought we were back in our youth with a lumpy bed at a third-rate hotel. Service was friendly, and room was clean with great access to the Fashion District and High Line nearby. If you like lumpy beds....
user_name:
David M
New YOrk, United States

review_body: I am an HHonors diamond member with around 100 nights in Hilton family properties over the past 1 1/2 years. I stayed at this property for two nights in April 2015.This property is older, but nicely appointed with interesting decor. Rooms are a bit on the small side, even for a big city hotel room, but are very clean. Furnishings are older, but in decent shape. In-room internet is a bit on the slow side, and tv reception is a bit fuzzy on some channels. The elevators are slower than average.Staff was friendly enough, although not as welcoming as the staff I encounter at most other Hilton properties. Service was average - no complaints, but nothing to write home about. My room was located directly across from the elevators - something that I have not had to contend with since reaching diamond status. I had forgotten how noisy rooms this close to the elevators can be.The restaurant is a refreshing departure from typical hotel restaurants, and is above average from Hilton properties. The restaurant layout is a bit odd (main dining room in the basement), but the overall atmosphere is very pleasant. Dinner was fresh and tasty, although service was a bit on the slow side. Breakfast is far above average for Hilton properties.

Had a great time and really good value for money. great location, great stuff. used the MVP rate to get a nice deal with cancellation option and the staff was very welcoming. would defiantly recommend this hotel to friends

We stayed here over NYC Pride and it was the perfect choice.The location couldn't have been better. The staff was great, an incredible view of the city from the roof top bar, room was clean, bed could have been a little more firmer for me but I slept well. My only complaint is you could hear doors slamming and people talking in the hallway. I would definitely recommend this hotel if your planning a weekend in NYC .

I travel to New York about once a month. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at this hotel. It used to by a Wyndham and Hilton took it over and updated it. They did a fantastic job. It is clean, sleek, and very nice. The rooms are a bit tight (I couldn't quite figure out where to put my suitcase.) but the furnishings were very nice. The bed was so comfortable. The bathroom was large with an enclosed glass shower. I needed to confirm a very late arrival and their desk attendant Marian was a rock star. Helped me Thank you Marian. I will be back.

This hotel was in a great spot right in the fashion district. Close to shopping & good food. Roof Top Bar had great views! We were greeted with a bottle of wine for being a Hilton Honors member which was a nice unexpected treat! We visited FIT while there as well which was conveniently located one block away

The service i received at this hotel was prompt and very courteous, staff at the check-in desk was definitely helpful. I was there to celebrate my girl friend's birthday and expressed this to one of the young ladies at the front desk, and was plesantly surprised when when a beverage and a snack was delivered to my room compliments of Hilton that was awesome.

This hotel was excellent we stayed here for 2 days to attend the Wendy Williams show which was literally a block down the street. The hotel bell man and valet parking attendant (Jose M.) took care of my family by offering us excellent customer service throughout our 2 day stay. The hotel is clean and the food in the restaurant downstairs is excellent. I recommend trying the lobster burgers. The burger was delicious and the side salad was delicious and refreshing. Also the rooftop bar is has a great view of the Empire State Building and it is a nice place to wind down after a busy day. The only downside was that our room was a bit smaller than normal and our view was not that great. We had a standard room, but I am sure you can upgrade to a bigger and better room if these are major issues for you during your stay.

Wow…where do I begin? I had originally booked a different hotel for our two night stay in NY via Expedia, but I had a gut feeling that I should cancel that reservation due to that hotel’s recent negative reviews. I am so glad that I did! Our stay at The Hilton Fashion District was perfect in many ways. To me, top notch customer service skills are a necessity in ensuring that guests enjoy their stay, will return in the future and will recommend to others. Many hotels have not yet figured out how important this is. The hotel staff delivered outstanding customer service from the moment we walked up to the front desk (Caroline and Zenibel ?) and throughout our entire stay. We arrived around noon, far earlier than the official check-in time. I was not expecting our room to be ready and if it were a king room it would have been, but we were a party of three booked in a two bed double room. The cheerful front desk clerk took my cell number and called about two hours later to let us know our room was available. We were able to turn our luggage over to the courteous bellman for holding so that we could start our city exploring. We returned to the hotel around 9pm that night to check-in to our room. Room #1803 was a decent sized room for the city, comfortable for our party of three. The room, including the bathroom appeared to be tidy and clean, though some of the wood furnishings had some minor worn areas. The beds, double in size, were quite comfortable and the pillows were firm, yet soft, perfect for good sleeping. The bathroom was better lit than most, with an added bonus of a lighted magnifying mirror if you desire to see facial imperfections you never knew you had. The bath linens were bright white and thick. I do wish more hotels had exhaust fans in the bathroom to get rid of the steam after a hot shower, this hotel did not. The vanity space was large enough to hold the toiletries of three females. There was a stocked mini-fridge with the usual outrageous prices. Sleeping in a hotel I need to keep the fan running overnight for decent sleep. We had ours on in the room, but it cut off and on all night which was a tad annoying. Our first night there was a bit of noise from the elevators late at night, but the remainder of the stay things were quieter. I assumed there was a little mini market on the premises to buy bottled waters, but told by the front desk there was not. They graciously handed me three waters without a charge. Oddly, we never saw any of the housekeeping staff, but had no issues in that department at all. On our last night we headed up to the roof top bar to check out the city lights at night and have a cocktail. The setting and view both perfect. Upon check-out on our departure day, the bellman once again took our luggage and stored it until we returned hours later. It was a scorching day outside and without asking the kind male front desk clerk handed us three bottled waters once again. When returning to New York, you can bet if the rates are decent I will be booking this hotel. You can't beat the location away from the madness of Times Square, but the subway stop is right around the block and walking to most everywhere is easy. Service was outstanding from all staff. Another perk, the RARE rooftop bar.
user_name:
kribbean
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We arrived to NYC around 10am and only had to wait about 30 minutes for a room. It might have helped that my partner has Hilton Diamond Status. Our room was cute and clean. We had to call room service for ice, as there were no ice machines. We actually had a surprisingly nice view of the Empire State Building. The dish we had at RARE was delectable. It wasn't a prime location for the Macy's 4th of July Fireworks viewing, but it is definitely in walking distance (if you're in shape). We would stay here again.

Good location, view of the Empire State Building from our room, very nice rooftop lounge/bar. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast included was decent but nothing special. Rates in all of Manhattan are exhorbitant.

My wife and I booked a last-minute getaway to NYC. Nice room - clean, comfy, and quiet. The location is convenient to the subway, Empire State Building, Penn Station, Times Square, etc. Rooftop bar was fun too.

Stayed there for 9 nights for my business trip to NYC. The office being at Chelsea Market, it was very convenient for me to walk down or reach in a jiffy. Plenty of nearby restaurants to dine in. Pros and cons:Pros: The customer service is really good and the staff tries to do as much as possible for the guests starting from helping with late check out to accpeting late night requests for food. Have a good cafe / restaurant in the hotel.Cons: The rooms are average and small (probably by New York standard that is how it is). $350 a night is costly comparing with other options near by.G

Amazing customer service by Kiyshaun Grant the hotel concierge. I was asking questions at front desk and i needed reservations and was sent to his desk. He was able to answer all my questions and, he repeated things and made it easy for me to understand. Wonderful hotel.

The location of this Hilton couldn't be more perfect. The room was impeccably clean and the service was extremely friendly. Zoribel at the front desk made our trip even more pleasurable. She was helpful and super friendly. I would go back to the same hotel for the location, amenities and Zoribel.

My stay was for two nights, and all-in-all felt this was an average NYC hotel. The staff was very nice, above average for the city. The hotel restaurant, Rare, was very good. I "rarely" have that feedback for hotel restaurants - so this is high praise. The common areas were NYC small, lobby etc., but fair for the location and well kept. They could benefit from an up-haul in comparison to other flagships nearby.The room was average, and despite a few problems such as lighting being in disrepair - met the need. AC was a bit finicky, but err'd on the cool side of the equation for summer - so I take that every day of the week. Overall, given cost, and location, this was an average stay. No complaints - and even if there were, the staff would have made up the difference.

Many thanks to Elan, Director of Front Office! Rough travel day and Elan went out of his way to help. It's customer service like this that makes me recommend this particular hotel. Highly recommend this location.

The Chelsea Fashion Center Hilton is always my first choice when travelling to NYC. It has a great location and convenient to Mid-Town, Theatre District and Chelsea / Village areas (all walkable). Good proximity to the High-Line Park and other attractions.

Spent three nights over July 4th weekend, our first time at this hotel. I let the hotel know we'd be a late arrival, after 10:00 p.m., which was not an issue. Front desk was helpful, courteous, and accommodating. Was asked if we preferred a view (street side) or not. We opted for an inside room expecting it to be quieter than facing the street. Our view was of another building, but the room was very quiet (6th floor), even though the elevators shared a wall with our room - we never heard them. King room was bigger than expected, very comfy bed and pillows, super clean bedroom and bathroom. A/C worked perfectly. Bathroom is a bit tight, but no real issues - a little bit more counter space would be a bonus.The rooftop bar was a nice surprise and a great place to enjoy wine or a cocktail while taking in the view - great view of the Empire State Building and lower Manhattan. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, only because of existing dinner plans.If you're considering this hotel, note that 26th street is not exactly the prettiest street in town. However, by staying here you do benefit from being very close to the 8th Ave and 7th Ave subways, and the Broadway subway at Madison Square. It's an easy 10-15 min. walk to the Highline (an entrance is at 26th St) and the Chelsea galleries. FIT is at the corner, the famous Flatiron Building is also in walking distance.Nearby on 7th is a Starbucks, Pret A Manger, and Whole Foods, always nice to have around. The Flatiron Room is a block away, and the NoMad Hotel is a 5-10 min. walk, both great places for dinner, cocktails and music.We considered other hotels - more 'boutique', more 'trendy', more 'designed' (and all more expensive) - but have no regrets choosing Hilton Fashion District.

Stayed at this hotel for the last two times we were in NYC. The location is great, it is a couple of blocks away from Penn station, Madison Square Garden and shopping areas.The customer service is very good. The staff are friendly and accommodating.The food very good. The elevator sucks. It's slow and sometimes the lobby can get crowded with drunk party people going in/out, up/down the rooftop bar:

If you are looking for a good location, near subways or walking distance to many areas, clean, great great staff, small room that is very comfortable, and a reasonable price, take this hotel Nothing super fancy, but for the price, it is worth what you pay for. The roof top bar is fun, but the music was a bit too loud. More for the young crowd but some relaxing spots for the old set also.

This is actually the 3rd time and not the last time I stay at this location. Nice size rooms,clean,updated,modern and great staff...especially Milly ;)Love that everything is walking distance ( being a NYer,it's the best way to get around...subways,Eataly,parks,HighLine,restaurants etc.)

We were visiting NYC over the July 4th weekend. We arrived to the hotel around 3:30 and our room was not ready yet. However, the staff were very accommodating and let us have a snack and drink at the Rare bar on the house. We stayed on the 22nd floor which had a beautiful view facing north (Empire State Building was right there!) The room and bathroom weren't exactly spacious, but for New York, I thought it was plenty of room. The furniture and layout made the most of the space. We did briefly check out the rooftop bar.. incredible views! It would be a great place on a warm evening to enjoy a drink and the views. As a Hilton Diamond member, we received breakfast vouchers for a hot breakfast. They had a buffet or you could order from the menu. It was definitely on par with other Hilton properties I have stayed at (however we felt that we should venture out for breakfast the next day, since we were in New York!).

From 4 days traveling and staying in different hotels, this one was excellent, sad that was only there for a night since I had to catch a flight early. But starting with the valet guy to hotel staff? They were excellent, clean rooms and bathroom awesome...

This hotel is located in the center of the Fashion District. Lots of things to do within a few steps! The service was top notch throughout our whole stay. The room was well appointed and very clean. It was a little small for the price paid but Manhattan hotels are often smaller than most. The bed was perfect and extremely comfortable. The only issue we had was that the street noise on the 14th floor was louder than normal and kept my wife up most of the night. She is a light sleeper while I slept until morning! I would highly recommend this hotel.

I have stayed at this hotel twice within the past year. Both stays were great. Rooms are small, but the furnishings are very nice. Location is within a few blocks of multiple subway stops. Staff is very accommodating. They did reduce the complimentary breakfast available to Hilton honors members. It used to be a hot breakfast. Now it is just continental. A bit cheap on their part when we are talking about a $300 per night room. Rooftop bar has awesome views in the evening.

We recently returned from New York HILTON Fashion District Hotel and can't wait to go back next week for a Roof Top night Party!We have stayed at a lot of hotels and this was one of the best when it came to service!We were met with two nice drinks upon arrival and greeted by a number of staff members who made us feel so welcomed and excited for our upcoming stay.Jonathan checked us in and since our room wasn't ready so he gave us one of the best rooms in the 22nd (last floor) with an amazing view on New York city and the Empire State!Being a new hotel all the amenities were in pristine condition and the Interior decoration was very contemporary.The service was the best! All I can say is that I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a special hotel experience right in the center of NYC!Definitely coming again!

We enjoyed a three night stay over the Fourth of July weekend. The hotel is close to several major subway lines, making transit throughout the city easy, and the neighborhood is relatively quiet. Short walk (< 1/2 mile) to the High Line trail, a fairly new must-see oasis above the city (get there early in the morning- it gets very crowded after 10:00 a.m or so). The High Line basically takes you to the doorstep of the new Whitney Museum.We stayed on the 21st floor, considered a premium room and larger than rooms on lower floors, though still small by most standards in the US. Closet very small (there is a safe in the closet). The desk area is very functional. The bed was extremely comfortable and the blackout shades on the windows actually did the job. Everything was very clean; wireless worked fine, and there are easily reachable A/C and USB ports in several locations. I've stayed here several times before, and the vibe is consistent: everyone working at the hotel is relaxed and still very professional. I've never had a problem before and this trip was no different. I read a prior review that said they were not "allowed" on the rooftop bar even though they were hotel guests. That would be so unacceptable, so I had to check that out. We had no problem at all, and it was a busy holiday weekend. FYI: there are great views of the Empire State Building, it's sort of small, and it's a 20s 30s crowd.We didn't visit the fitness center. We had breakfast in the hotel, and while the buffet was pretty standard, the 'maintenance' was not. The buffet was fully stocked and clean every single day, thanks to an employee who monitored it constantly. Seriously. Have brunch here and then splurge on dinner. The buffet is $22.If that's a little out of reach, there is a Whole Foods market 2 blocks away.One caveat: The rooftop bar is right above the 22nd floor. We were on the 21st floor. We heard the noise quite clearly every night, so if you want a quiet room, call and ask about proximity to the bar. I think any room below 18 or so, and not directly below, should be fine. Also, the bar (or the noise) closed down pretty early, around midnight, so not a big problem for us.So bottom line-- we'll be back.

First time at this location in Manhattan and would give them a ten. Nice room, great restaurant/bar and outstanding service. I will definitely stay there when I am in the city. Location is convenient and just a short subway trip to Brooklyn.

I am a frequent traveler and a Hilton property regular. This was my first visit to the Hilton NY Fashion District. I had a very nice stay and wanted to point out Marion as a great representative of the hotel. Marion helped me with an issue with my reservation (my mistake) before arrival and remembered me at check in. She was very concerned to be sure I had what I needed. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff is very pleasant, rooms were very nice and the hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of Penn Station and many restaurants. It is also not a bad walk to the Javits Center.

What really made this hotel enjoyable was the staff. Christine, Caroline ,Zoribel, Jose, Jhon, and Sid were especially helpful and courteous. They had all the answers from directions to recommendations to skip this or that. Even when hotel was bust they handled everything with ease. It was a plus that they always seemed to have 4 or 5 staff working. Nothing is more frustrating than 5 or 6 guest trying to get assistance from 1 or 2 stressed out hotel associates. The room was nice...a little small but most in NYC are. The only complaint I would have is the roof top bar, although fabulous with a spectacular view, had a private party both nights we were there. They had a very large area that was roped off for the private party and it was very crowded because of this. I really feel that the rooftop bar should be for the pleasure of the paying guest that are actually staying at the hotel.

Stayed here from June 25th for 4 nights. Good location, good quality hotel, would definitely stay here again. Room was well furnished, bathroom was very clean. 10 minute walk to nearest subway. Roof bar had a great atmosphere, even though it was very busy service was very quick.

I had the best 50th birthday celebration ever in New York! The Hilton played a huge role by providing the best customer service ever. First, one guest arrived early and needed early check-in. They explained how they could accommodate this situation and I was pleased by their customer service. Secondly, when I arrived and check-in, I casually mentioned it was my 50th and I wanted to celebrate in New York. I requested a room with a view, they explained their room views which was just fine for me, not the best view but good. Lastly, I went out on the town, only to return to my room and find balloons, cake, birthday party favors, etc. I WAS BLOWN AWAY. How throughtful and kind. I would always stay at this Hilton.

This hotel is a gem in the city of New York. The staff was very accommodating, especially Jonathon, who went out of his way to make sure that my reservation was perfect. I will be staying here again. The price and value are excellent.

My daughter attended the Fashion Institute of Technology and we stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Excellent location for FIT and close to the Flat Iron District for shopping. The bedding is great and Élan Zoribel did an excellent job taking care of us all week. The staff was very friendly. Would absolutely return!

Our stay here was amazing and the staff made us feel welcomed. Zoribel and Mily were warm and friendly even though we didn't share our coffees :). We were in the heart of the city which meant short walks to everything. The food service and rooftop were also spectacular.

We walked into the hotel with no reservation and were greeted by about 4 employees all with smiles. The last minute room was only $200 including taxes and fees. They didnt even charge us for valet parking and they gave us two complementary bottles of wine. Two blocks away from the Wendy Williams studio. The room and bathroom were clean. We had a view of another building but thats pretty much everywhere in NYC. Would definitely stay there again. Free Wi-Fi.
user_name:
LDYBGTravels
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We moved to this hotel 1 day in our stay in NYC after a horrible experience at the Courtyard Marriott Chelsea. Martha happily greeted us. We gave her a brief description of our horror at the Marriott and Martha generously gave us an upgrade, drink coupons next door and a bottle of wine. The hotel was chic, clean and the rooms bigger than most NYC rooms. Each of the staff we came in contact with were friendly and amazing. Highly recommend this hotel.

This is my first review on Tripadvisor although i read them faithfully before traveling.I just stayed 4 nights at this hotel and I have officially found my new NYC hotel for whenever I visit. Excellent customer relations ESPECIALLY from Elan, Caroline and Christine. Any question/need was immediately addressed and they really deserve kudos for their customer care.Also I love the size of the hotel-felt more like a boutique feel which is wonderful and cozy. On a quiet street yet right in the middle of all the action with easy subway locations.I will truly not stay anywhere else from now on! Thank you for an incredible experience.

Stayed for a long weekend. Hotel is pleasant, nice and comfortable rooms (not very large, but this is NYC). Staff is very friendly. Had very good wifi (free because of HH-Honors, but very good AT&T hotspot connected). Did not use restaurant (so many places to eat). Really loved location, bit away from the tourists craze, close to Flatiron area, to Union Square, Chelsea and High Line. Has cool rooftop bar. Access security very good. Had a very nice stay

We stayed in room 1902. When we checked in at 4pm, we were greeted by a very nice woman named Angelica. Unfortunately, our room wasn't ready. We were given free drink vouchers and went to the bar for drinks and a snack. After about 1/2 hour, Angelica came in apologizing for the delay... and gave us breakfast vouchers for the inconvenience. When we got up to our room, it was discovered that my pre-ordered beer, wine, and cheese platter were not in place. Calling down to the front desk, it was further discovered that a computer error had occurred and room service was not aware of the order... even though the front desk was able to view it. AGAIN Angelica to the rescue comping glasses of wine and beer for us.All in all, the beginning of the stay can best be described as a 'comedy of errors'. It was through the singular efforts of Angelica that it remained a 'comedy' and ended being a delightful experience.

My advice is not to pay extra for a higher room. I did and we were on the 17th floor. I assume that we would have a better view of the city. Instead, we were facing a building and had NO view. Why would I pay more for a higher room? We only had to ride the elevator to a higher floor.

I've stayed here numerous times. It is one of my favorites. The rooms are nice, the service is always good with a helpful staff and it is well maintained. I love the location, and the restaurant is very nice too. They do a breakfast buffet, but I prefer to order off the menu. The Eggs Benedict are my favorite and the service is always quick, so no need to worry about getting a slow start in the morning.

Stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights, service really good for the most part, some housekeepers better than others. Very quiet hotel for being in the middle of the city. An abundance of restaurants nearby and the hotel restaurant was cool. Definitely check out the rooftop bar but get there early due to limited seating. The positive thing is they give priority to hotel guests. Would definitely stay there again.

I stayed at several Hotels in NYC (Waldorf, Hugo, all three W's in Manhattan, Mandarin, Standard East Village, Novotel, Hyatt Regency and the Gramercy) and I was really happy with the Hilton Fashion District Hotel. Standard rooms are way bigger than rooms at the W and are clean, well decorated and have everything you need for a really great price. Would def. come back.

The hotel room was lovely & cleN but VERY small!! We could only just walk round the bed & if I had been over 6ft tall & fat I wouldn't have been able to sit on the toilet or have a shower! On the other hand we didn't go to new york to spend time in our room so for what we wanted it for was just fine.
user_name:
Laura W
Derby, England, United Kingdom

review_body: The amazing staff at this hotel was absolutely amazing. It's well worth getting the Hilton Honors card and get some great perks. Will certainly stay here again should I find myself in the NYC area.. Great location, low noise for a busy city and super friendly New Yorkers!

this hotel has very nice rooms and quite large for NYC. the location is excellent and the service was very good. The roof top bar is a great spot to start the evening. A special thank you goes to Jonathan from the front desk, awesome service!

Love the hotel, clean friendly and great location to Madison square garden and walking to Times Square. Pricey hotel for the size of the room and the view, well no view at all except for the street and the other buildings. The rooftop bar was always full of nightlife and a nice view up there. The restaurant had a great breakfast buffet, also pricey but good food. The parking is very expensive but I had read that in advance and was prepared. You are also charged for going in and out as well. Overall it was a nice stay and I would definitely stay there again for location, location, location. Close to my office, close to my aunt and close to drive over to Jersey.

We booked the hotel because of the ideal location in midtown on Westside of Manhattan. However, the homeless and panhandlers were all over the place as of 730am in morning. the room was clean but shower door leaked water after each shower. Thanks goodness for towels.

While this is not a luxury hotel, it is very clean. Bathrooms and room itself. I stay here about 20 to 30 times a year, I am EXTREMELY picky on room cleanness and these rooms are spotless :) I have been staying at this particular hotel for about 3 to four years

I love this hotel and always stay here when I'm in NYC. The location is great, the service is top notch and the hotel is high quality. The Internet bandwidth was good and the check in and check out process was seamless.

We booked a last minute trip to New York to see The Audience before it closed. The hotel was packaged with the airfare. We were very pleased by the hotel put into the package. The staff was very, very nice and attentive. The room was clean, and large enough for one or two, with a nice bathroom and a good shower with plenty of water pressure and hot water. Bed was very comfortable.We went up to the rooftop bar on Sunday night, and enjoyed a drink. We also ate at the hotel restaurant on Sunday - it was good on a night we were just over being out or walking.The hotel itself is very close to the Empire State Building, the 1,2,3 lines, and just a 5 minute walk to the 4,5,6 lines. It was my first trip to NYC, and I would consider this hotel again in the future.

This is a wonderful hotel. The staff is very helpful and efficient, and this is a busy New York City Hotel. The hotel is short walk from Penn Station, and has easy access to all New York City attractions: Empire State Building, World Trade Center Memorial, High Line, Whitney Museum, Broadway theater district; and subway stops to anywhere you might want to go. In addition, neighborhood has restaurants, interesting architecture (near Flat Iron district). The room was spacious and clean and really comfortable in terms of amenities and layout.
user_name:
Nancy E M
Albany New York, United States

review_body: As an IBMer working at Astor Place for a period of time, this location is perfect, with a less than 10 min ride to the office. The value is great, the staff at this hotel is very nice and helpful, the rooms are nice, wifi works great. Rooftop bar has great views to go up and have a drink. the Restaurant onsite has delicious burgers.

Stayed here around the new year the food was the best in NYC ! The staff were very nice and helpful .The rooms are nice but not too safe. I opened the window one morning to film the snowfall outside when the whole top rail came crashing down on top off me giving me a nasty cut and a big shock . Manger was very helpfull after this incident. So just beware !!

It's a nice hotel. It's location in Chelsea is the best, with all the good quality that hilton has to offer. from my window I could see the empire state building. Breakfast are nice and at the rooftop is a cool bar with an awesome view.

Arrived in reception that was so busy it was chaos! Room was good size, quiet but AWFUL bed, the most uncomfortable I've had in a long while. Won't come back I'm afraid as CRAZY priced for what it is.

Great location, Staff is very friendly! We had a quick 2 night stay and the beds were very comfortable and the room was very spacious for NYC. It is a very small hotel in regards of lobby, nothing fancy, but very clean and perfect for a fun weekend in the city. Would definitely stay again

I would like to mention how impressed I am with the spectacular service I received during my stay at this Hilton hotel and especially from Marian Rock, Moises, and Luidin. They have so exceeded anything I have ever experienced in a hotel in service that I would come back just for that. /besides its a lovely hotel and the room service is great. they made me feel special and taken care of instead of the usual "you're just another traveler impersonally" that I usually experience when I travel. The going out of their way to make me happy without my hardly asking has just quite made my day and my stay. I couldn't recommend this hotel more.

I really enjoyed my stay here at the Hilton Fashion District. All of the staff were very nice and helpful, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. I did not hear any street noise, just the doors closing of people coming and going in the hallway, but this was very minimal.

First of all this hotel is all about the location - few minutes walk from 5th Ave and Empire State Building. Hotel facilities are good. Rooms are a bit tiny, but this is standard in expensive Manhattan. Breakfast selection was poor and room in a basement wasn't very pleasant. Reception staff is not very friendly. There was nothing particularly negative, but you don't have a feeling you're special as a guest, even though I'm Hilton Honors Diamond member.

Awesome sevice!!!! I didnt like the view from my room so they change it with out any hesitation. Special thanks to Martha and the front desk staff for helping me celebrated my Birthday weekend in the city.

I love Hilton hotels, but this was not one of my favorite locations in the city, it’s not great. I chose this so my husband and I could enjoy the rooftop bar. We were on the top floor the 22nd with a great view of the Empire State building and right above us was the bar. You could hear the music from the room. When we decided to go up and check it out we discovered that our elevator does not take us there even though it has a rooftop bar option. Instead you ride down to the lobby. When I asked why I can't get there they said I had to make a long line they had that was to get into the bar. They also said it’s going to be a wait cause at the moment they are full to capacity. I was told by the doorman/elevator man that hotel guest do not have a priority and that they rent out the space from Hilton. I went over to the front desk to ask how is it possible that my room is right under the bar and I’m staying at the hotel as a paid customer but I have no priority over people that came from the street to get into the bar and I have to make a line behind them in hopes of getting in. The only thing the hotel desk told me was that they rent out the space and that there are other great bars in the area I can go to. The guy even recommended a rooftop bar that’s in another hotel. So Hilton did nothing to help. When we walked back toward elevator to head back to our room the nice doorman of the rooftop bar (that does not work for the Hilton) asked me if I still wanted to go up and let us go ahead with the next group without having to make line. So No thanks to Hilton employees, I was able to get up there. So if you are looking to stay here for location don’t, unless you are doing things Midtown and around Madison Square Garden. Hilton has better hotels in the area. If you are looking to stay here to enjoy the bar just know you don’t have priority as a hotel guest and be prepared to wait a long line. I do want to give props to the cleaning crew the room was clean and very comfortable every day.

Good location between Chelsea and Midtown. Upscale restaurant -- the burgers really are yummy. Clean, modern rooms. There is a fun rooftop bar. But the best part is the attentiveness and friendliness of the staff -- Martha and the rest at the front desk as well as all the folks (security, bar tenders, etc) helping in the lobby and downstairs bar makes the place as close to home as one can get in a hotel.

I stayed first time in May for 2 nights - pleasantly surprised, great location, close to everything from my office in Chelsea to the event location in midtown. It's a little gem close to FIT. This time I went and recommended the same place to several colleagues. Unfortunately no one could find my reservation but the way the hotel resolved the hiccup was first class service. The front desk contact gave me her direct email address and took great care to ensure that I did not leave the property with any grievance. The king size beds are very comfortable. The hotel is well maintained and there is a friendly, upbeat flavor to the property and the staff.The value for money is really excellent. But overall the professionalism of the team there will make me return again and again.
user_name:
Julie P
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: Nice rooms, great view from upper floors. Rooms are clean and efficiently organized for a small space. Fitness center is small/basic. Roof bar is very nice with relaxed, open space overlooking the city.

My daughter and I stayed for two nights at the Hilton Fashion District. We've stayed at the midtown Hilton before and now much prefer this location. The front desk staff is extraordinary. I am used to be treated with perfunctory indulgence, palpable boredom, or at best, brisk efficiency but this was not the case here. Marion, to whom I'd like to give a special thanks, welcomed us in and helped us change our reservation from one night to two without much difficulty. She was friendly, efficient, personable, and a pleasure to deal with. She started the experience on a very positive note. The room (two double beds) while fairly standard, was clean, quiet and comfortable.This is a four star hotel with a five star staff.

I just spent the last two nights at this Hilton and the staff was amazing, the location in the city was great, and our room was clean and modern! Milly was not only helpful and professional but also so welcoming and kind that I can honestly say I felt like I had a "home" in the city. If you go to NYC you can't beat the value and location so I will be telling my friends to stay here when they visit :)

Definitely one of the best Hiltons I have stayed in. Rooms were fresh & spacious by NY standards, staff were very friendly and helpful and the Hotel is located is a great area. The Hotel also has a great rooftop bar which is widely popular with people around the area with food drinks and plenty of screens for watching various sports. The Steak restaurant called Rare is located in the lobby of the hotel and also has a great reputation with people in the area and definitely worth having a dinner or two in there. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and again.

Upon arrival service was great. Attentive staff and security, casual but professional. My room was quiet and I liked the size. large halls so no bagging into anything with my bags and an ice machine tucked away in it's own room. How lovely!  Having never stayed at an actual *Hilton before, this was a nice surprise and now I see where they get their reputation from.

We stayed this weekend at the Hilton Fashion District (on 26th St in Manhattan). On Friday we RE-BOOKED our room four (4) times as the price dropped on the Hilton web-site from $229/night (original booking) to $178/night !!! It actually dropped to $171/night on the day of the stay. Rooms are CLEAN and good-sized for NY. Very personable main desk crew. Checkout was very simple. We'll stay there again if the price is right !
user_name:
Ed S
New York, NY, United States

review_body: Rooms are clean and modern. Hotel is convenient to everything. But it's the staff that earned my 5-star review. Friendly from the front desk to the restaurant. One particular standout is Elan Bielski, the director of front office. Long story, short: we had an ipad go missing. Turns out it went missing on Amtrak -- not the hotel (and we got it back). However, Elan went above and beyond to help us track it down. He is kind, professional, and thorough. A true class act and exactly who should be running a business and interfacing w guests/clients.
user_name:
Matthew D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The staff was particularly helpful to us and accommodating to our needs!!! In particular, Jonathan and Milly went above and beyond and we are so thankful they were there!! Great experience with them!!
user_name:
m g
New York City, New York

review_body: I wanted to extend my sincere thanks for your never ending guidance, support and knowledge during my stay(s) at the Hilton Fashion District. I appreciate all that has been accommodated – most especially the refrigerator due to my diet restrictions since my jaw surgery. You and other staff members make it so much easier for me to be out of town and away from my family – the friendly staff and the nature of your “spoiling” is unmatched.Thank-you for helping with my up and coming trip to NYC with my family. I was unsettled at an alternate hotel given my connection to you and your staff and the amenities offered. I appreciate the package that you put together for our trip the week of June 29th – especially the buffet breakfast inclusion for my husband (Jason, Jr.) and 2 children (Emily and Jason, III). It is with great comfort that I have chosen your hotel and I have referred my entire staff the same as we work with The Fashion Institute of Technology throughout the remainder of the year and possibly into the new year.I am especially grateful to Raquel, Brandon, Keith, Maurice and Luidin. A great group of helpful, pleasant, informative and friendly team members. I will only choose this hotel when I visit NYC both for business and for pleasure.

Enjoyed a wonderful three day stay here over the weekend - attentive staff, clean room, and wonderful inside tips on nice places to visit. Caroline and Christine manage a great team. Absolutely intend to stay here again when I'm in the city.

The front desk employees were extremely accommodating! Generosity goes a long way in this city! Johnathan and Mily were pleasant to deal with and helped us out when most places would have given little effort. Thanks again!

I don't think I could afford to use this for a private visit, but for business this is well located and a friendly hotel. Its close to Penn Plaza and is reasonably quiet although it is in the centre of New York of course.

This hilton is pretty nice for a NY hotel - rooms are updated and quiet (at least mine was). The front desk staff - well - let me share my experience. I arrived just before 11pm having flown in from SF - so I was hungry. As I checked in I asked about room service. Mily was on deck - she said they were closing, it might be too late but she would call them. She called and convinced them to bring me a salad and even provided me with a bit of wine - so much appreciated I can tell you. And I had not really finished checking in! Jonathan was on hand a few days later when I saw Mily and thanked her - he also lent a hand in enhancing the experience.Lastly, my trip ended with food poisoning - less than lovely. I got quite sick, to the point of calling for help from the front desk. I do not remember who did this (Wednesday 6/3 night for room 1111) but they sent me a small care package and even had someone go out to buy me immodium AD. These folks go above and beyond and I hope they all get nice bonuses - they deserve them!

We arrived early, our room was not ready, so they held our luggage while my daughter and I went to the Statue of Liberty. There are no vending machines, so in order to get one coke out of the refreigerator in your room, you will be charged $4. So be prepared! The service by Johnathan was exceptional!! He brought us a gift bag (wine and chocolate) and coupons for free breakfasts, one dinner meal, wine and chocolates. It rained one day and I asked for the nearest place to get an umbrella and "Johnathan" gave us an umbrella to use. Upon our departure,he walked out on the street to wave a taxi down for us in the rain (in his suit) which took him at least 15 minutes to get. While we were waiting, he came back in to let us know he was doing his best but traffic was heavy. He could run this hotel on his own!!! Comfortable Room. Ok location. Most of the staff were amazing with the exception of a girl at the Concierge...she seemed bothered to have to give us directions and then they were incorrect! It seemed to me that the guys went out of their way to help while the ladies would just transfer you or just charge you for minimal things. Will definitely go back, as long as Johnathan is there!

Excellent location. comfortable and well furnished room, super staff.All front desk staff were very helpful and made us feel most welcomed.The property will be our NYC home away from home on our future visits to NYC each year.Anita and Steve EichlerAventura, Florida

Being a hotel in the Garment District automatically qualifies you to step it up, on multiple levels. Not to mention being in the city that never sleeps. From the moment we entered the hotel, we were treated the best by all the staff, especially the valet. The valet, doing multiple jobs that day due to staffing, with a smile, who we are convinced will be running the place by morning, no joke.We openly voice this to him, and he laughs.The rooms were clean, service friendly, and a staff who were professional, even in the face of a challenging guest (I witnessed this first hand).Our service for the room cleaning was remarkable.

Very small lobby and small rooms. Front desk is solid. Rooms are clean, but uninviting. Air conditioning is loud and street noise could be a problem depending on room location. There are more stylish, pleasant options for the money.

Christine & Caroline at the front desk made check in and room selection a breeze. Very helpful and want to say thanks to them.Of course, finding the right room can be a challenge at any hotel. Overall, this is a solid option right in the heart of Chelsea with a rooftop and a low key bar/restaurant on the first floor. Walkable to everything including Whole Foods a block away.

Visited for 3 nights from Fri-Mon. I researched both Starwood and Hilton properties for this stay, with points to burn, but opted not to since the value wasn't there. I booked at the AAA rate, and got a great deal. It paid to continue to monitor rates as I got closer to my arrival date.On top of the rate, I was upgraded upon check-in to a higher floor room. Bonus view of Empire St bldg was appreciated since my girlfriend had only visited NYC one previous time. The overall feel of the hotel was contemporary and very stylish...so glad we stayed here over HGI's or Hampton Inn's, which tend to be more functional properties. We stayed on the 17th floor, which helped with street noise. However, this is NYC, you're still going to hear some level of noise. Property has 22 floors. The king bed was comfortable. Shower water pressure was awesome!For our needs, excellent location with several subway stations closeby. Penn Station is a mere 5 blocks away. With all the food choices in the city, we opted not to use our breakfast vouchers. At other properties, I'm used to full continental breakfasts, with made to order eggs, etc...not the case here. Voucher is good for only muffins, danish, croissant, strawberry jam, cereal, juice, and coffee.Overall, a great stay. Friendly staff and excellent customer service for the duration of our trip.

My stay at the Hilton New York Fashion District was for business purposes. The rooms were very clean and great facilities including the roof top bar with amazing views of the New York skyline. Location is great with walking distance to all major retail in the area. We had an issue on our floor with the hot water on one morning but the exceptional customer service resolved the issue in a prompt and professional way. The manager reached out to me directly and issued an apology which was beyond what I would have expected. Would recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Manhattan.

Left my passport and checkbook in safe, and housekeeping reached out to figure out a way to get it back to me. Very thoughtful and attentive, really appreciated it. Thanks Rosaura!!Also, great location, easy access to everything.

Just come back from NY and after years in staying in average at best accommodation finally I have found a hotel that was very good in both value and quality. All the staff were friendly and very professional. The roof top bar was excellent and the restaurant downstairs was good as well. Will use again for sure. Also I am a real fan of the Chelsea area - a lot less busy than other parts of NY but extremely convenient to walk everywhere.

We came in after a delay in LGA. The hotel staff was excellent - especially Johnathan, Elan & Luidin. You could tell they really cared. Hilton's are always great & this one is at the top of my list! We also visited the bar/restaurant. Nice vibe & good food!

Stayed there for a few nights and enjoyed my stay very much. The rooms where clean and we got upgraded to a King rooms wich was a nice. Location was good and the noise from the street was minimal. Jonathan, Elan and Luidin in the lobby made the stay even better.

More of a boutique stay than a typical Hilton in the heart of the Chelsea area. Excellent staff, smaller footprint than being in MidTown and an overall wonderful experience for me and my wife celebrating an anniversary. The rooftop bar was excellent with a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. The only downside I witnessed was a great bartender seriously overworked at the rooftop bar. Highly recommend for anyone staying the in Chelsea area.

Hilton is supposed to be a good hotel, but we were so disgusted by very rude receptionist. We made a reservation two bedroom online and already paid for it. When we checked in, the receptionist abruptly asked me "Do you want to have dinner or breakfast?", I just replied "No, we already had dinner and I am not sure for breakfast, since we may chack out early tomorrow morning. Why?". She said "we do not have two bedroom today, the only roon you can stay is one bedroom", What????? I certainly made a reservation and paid for that, I did not understand. I claimed I paid for two bed room already and four family member can not stay in one bedroom, but she just replies, "No, we do not have the two bedroom anymore, you just can choose free dinner or breakfast". She even declined to offer the extra couch or small bed.Because of no choice for us, then I had to choose to have complimentary breakfast and stay on one king bed for four people. We handled with it just because my kids are still young, though, this receptionist is very rude and the service is very dissapointing. We would never stay here again.

The staff at the concierge desk, especially Christine and Anjelica were extremely helpful with us during check in after our long day of travel. They were immediately available for assistance even allowing us to check in early despite our awkward arrival time. Will recommend and props to the 2 ladies!

The staff was very helpful, the room clean and litle street noise. The restaurant attached to it was delicious. My husband really liked the location, not in noisy midtown and very close to good restaurants and FIT.
user_name:
Coremari
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here for a work event recently which I was surprised how much I liked this hotel. The staff really goes out of their way to make sure you have a great stay, which on top of a great location and onsite roof top really makes this hotel wonderful. If you go to NY often you know hotels are hit or miss, I've stayed in some terrible ones, but happy to say this one is a hit!Pros:- Walk everywhere, lots of great bars and restaurants a short walk away- Rocking Roof Top Bar - It's super hip, great view and it's a short elevator ride away- Rooms are quiet (I was on the 15th floor and couldn't hear any noise of the city)- Good size rooms, for NY the rooms are spacious. - Staff is fantastic - There was an issue with the hot water that only lasted 30 minutes, I called downstairs about it and the person I spoke to was genuinely apologetic and informed me that the issue was resolved and hot water would be just 15-30 minutes away, then her boss emailed me a personal apology and waived my wifi charge! It's not often you see a hotel go out of their way for a small issue like this. Cons:- Unless you have status you have to pay for wifi If I'm in the neighborhood again I'll be looking to book here.

After a long long days travel topped of with 3hrs in NY traffic we arrived at the Hilton NYFD in a foul mood which was instantly eased by the greeting from this New York angel !!! The room we are in is far better than we paid for with a fantastic view across the city and a "super" king bed ! I'll be honest I booked this hotel for the price, but the service has been priceless thanks Mily .

In the busiest city in the world I am pleased to say your hotel offers outstanding service! One person in particular Katherine at the front reception area is exceptional! Her professionalism and kindness in dealing with a mixup through Expedia was extremely appreciated. I am a Hilton rewards member and it service like this that will keep me coming back to Hilton and especially this hotel in New York City . Bravo!

Check in was fast and friendly, just the way I like it. I was handed a Hilton labeled brown paper bag with two bottles of water in it and one voucher for a continental breakfast as my Elite Member benefits. I was told I had been upgraded to a higher floor room because of my status. The room was very basic but clean. Street noise is quite pronounced but it's NYC so quiet isn't what I expect. The bed and linens were comfortable. The bathroom had a few bottles of "designer" shampoos and other amenities but other than that there was nothing special. The room was small but again pretty typical of NYC. The view of 26th street was nothing special. You could see (barely) the very top of the Empire State Building. I was looking forward to visiting the rooftop bar but it only opens for the evening and during my short stay there always seemed to be a private party going on that overtook the small space. In addition, there was always a lengthy line to get onto the one elevator which is allowed to bring guests to the roof. You cannot access the rooftop without having to go back down to the lobby and go back up...very inconvenient and given that the rooftop bar is the one special amenity guests may see as separating this hotel from nearby competitor hotels, it was disappointing that it seems to be used more as a revenue source for outside parties rather than an amenity guests can use without hassle. The downstairs bar is rather blah with TV's turned up so loudly you cannot hear yourself talk. I ordered a glass of wine and ended up taking it to my room.Weekend breakfast begins at 730am so if you are an early riser, you'll need to use the horrid in room coffee maker or go around the corner to the Dunkin Donuts or Starbucks which opens at 6am. There was no coffee available in the lobby for hotel guests. Upon entering breakfast I was told I could upgrade to the buffet from my elite continental breakfast for only $7. I thought that was a very generous deal so I accepted. I was then told that my room companion would need to pay full price for the buffet since I only had one breakfast voucher. I told her I was familiar with the Hilton elite program and breakfast was for two people. She looked somewhat perplexed and frustrated. It seems the front desk should have given me two vouchers but only gave me one. After that matter was settled, the breakfast buffet was less than impressive: overcooked scrambled eggs, limp bacon, boring pastries. The fruit and juice were fresh. Smoked salmon was the only item that made you think this wasn't just any other buffet at any roadside motel. I'm glad I didn't pay more than $7. Decor seems to hint that the hotel wants to be a bit more trendy and less stoic than other Hilton hotels. And I appreciate that the cookie cutter formal was left behind. It's just that the middle level hotels in the Hilton brand (and Starwood and Marriott for that matter) don't do much to distinguish themselves from their less pricey sister hotels. There's really not much here that you couldn't find at a Hampton Inn. I certainly wouldn't mind staying at the Hilton Fashion District again but I wouldn't pay a premium over other competitor hotels like the Four Points Sheraton one block away.

Great staff! Roof top bar view is cool but with a 2nd tier crowd and very noisy. Elevator wait times were ridiculous and resulted in over crowding on the lift. Fitness center is entry level at best. The price point was reasonable for Midtown if they would update the fitness center and fix the lifts.

I stayed one night here for business, and while I can't go out of my way to say it's an amazing place, I've stayed in much more spartan locations in New York for business travel in the past, and the bed was comfortable.The furnishings are beginning to show their age, and I wasn't able to press my clothes myself due to the broken ironing board, but the bathroom was spacious and clean with great lighting, and I was on a high enough floor to see over the buildings across the street. It has a mini-bar, coffee maker, and more than enough space to stretch out after a long day.Not a bad option if you need a place to stay in NYC. I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here for pleasure-oriented travel, but for business it's a solid bet.

Once we arrived to the hotel we were greeted by a very sweet front desk attendant. Mily quickly got us checked in and on our way. We also appreciated the water bottles for our room. Once we got to our room, we saw our beautiful view of the Empire State Building. Such a fun treat for our visit to New York. Thank you Mily, Miriam, and Jonathon for our great accommodations. We look forward to going up to the rooftop bar to see more views of the city and enjoy our first night in New York.

I'm so happy to have celebrated my 23rd birthday here! The hotel was beautiful; the rooms were spacious and they had an awesome rooftop bar/grill! Oh and staff was wonderful. Elan, Jonathan, and Luidin sang happy birthday to me! It was so cute!!! I'll definitely go back.

We had a great time at the Hilton! Elan, Luidin, and Jonathan were very helpful! They made our stay extremely special and they really helped us navigate the city. Rare is the name of the restruant in the hotel. It to was fantastic. I'm very impressed with our experience! We will be back!!

Stayed for holiday and was impressed from the moment we stepped foot into the lobby. Clean, smart and simply appointed. Staff was friendly, helpful and attentive at all levels. Great recommendation for breakfast. Rooms were simple, but well done. Enough space for two and quite pleasant for a prime NYC property. There's a bit of street noise, but nothing unexpected for NYC. Did not dine with the hotel although the attached restaurant, Rare, looked like it had a good menu and they sport a rooftop deck - a rarity in the city.Superb location for our purposes. Easy walking everywhere. We'd not hesitate to stay here again.

The service at this hotel was excellent! Everyone in the lobby was very friendly and welcoming, especially Katherine at the Front Desk. My stay was amazing. In summary, this is a beautiful hotel with great service. I've stayed at quite a few other hotels in New York City...many of which I also really enjoyed...but the Hilton Fashion District was unquestionably the best! I will definitely recommend and return to this hotel!

A perfect end to our stay in New York. In the middle of everything. Beautiful and cozy hotel with nice clean rooms with an explicit, smiling and friendly staff. Elan, Caroline, Santiago, José and Zoribel where very helpfull when we needed advice around our returnflight.Make sure to visit Rare View bar on the rooftop. Amazing view.

We had a wonderful stay at Hilton Fashion District. What a nice view from our room straight to Empire State. A quiet room with all that you need. Thanks for making our stay such a pleasure Santiago, Caroline, Jose, Zoribel and Elan :)We will get back later.

Although this Hilton is fairly central to most attractions it is also very expensive for the rooms offered and certainly a disappointment considering the room price.Staff service was very good however the rooms are very small.The passage leading to them led you to think that maybe you were walking in to a high rise housing estate.Slippers,robes etc were only available on request and the coffee machine is sub standard.No welcoming bottle of water either. I know that I'm being very picky but I do expect more for a $5,000+ USD hotel bill.Very limited storage space as well. The shower had mould in the corners and tiles were cracked on the wall.Housekeeping also did a very basic job of cleaning the rooms also.Yes it's in a convenient spot but thats it as far as I'm concerned.Maybe I expect to much because we normally stay in Doubletree if there is no Waldorf available.I am not able to comment on the meals because we didn't eat there. There is also a night club on the top floor,and although I am a very light sleeper I didn't hear any noise.If you are not very fussy and manage to get a room here at a great rate I would look elsewhere.As an added note, if you do stay here just have a look under the bed.I found that there was all kinds of rubbish from tissues to plastic cups.Guess you can judge by this just how well they do clean the rooms eh! Sorry I can't give this a better rating but I don't do cheap (in quality) hotels very well.

Selected this hotel for a Business trip to NYC need to be in Chelsea area. good location nothing out of the ordinary, standard room, clean, but front door staff too pre-occupied with their cell phones to call cab or help with luggage upon arrival. A no frills hotel with a nice roof top bar,

Great location and the staff could not have been better. Sid was exceptionally helpful and friendly when we checked in. Rooms were cute and clean and hotel was trendy. Price was wonderful for NYC. Would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NYC. Great stay from beginning to end.

Spend a couple nights at the Hilton Fashion District recently on a business trip and walked away very pleased with my experience. Luidin, the front desk manager, took it upon himself to ensure my stay was exceeded my expectations. I will definitely be back on my next trip to NYC. My only suggestion would be to have a bottle of two of complimentary water in the room.

I have stayed at many hotels and this hotel blows them all away. There is nothing better then amazing customer service. From the moment I arrived I was treated like family. I mentioned to them it was my bf birthday they made sure to arrange chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of wine when we arrived to the room. I can't thank you all enough for making my stay so special and welcoming. A special thanks to Luidin, Johnathan, Élan, Christine and Zoribel for making this all happen. This by far is an experience I will never forget.

I really enjoyed my stay here. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean, with modern appliances, and was very quiet. The location in Chelsea is very convenient to most parts of the city. The only thing I didn't love about the property is that there's really no "lobby", and what space there is is used at night as a line for the bar on the roof. The hotel is definitely "trendier" than the average Hilton, though didn't seem to have a ton of full service amenities (no pool, spa, etc.). As a HH gold member, I thought that the "continental breakfast voucher", which was not even for a buffet, just a few pieces of bread and coffee, was pretty weak. We stayed for 2 nights and didn't use the breakfast either day, so the front desk gave us vouchers to a nearby deli which was actually quite good, so I was happy with that.

The hotel is perfectly located; close enough to Times Square and to the neighborhoods like SOHO, Chelsea, Village. The employees here are very helpful; I even got complimentary water upon check in and the hotel is new and in good shape. Second stay here and I will be back.

My first stay at Hilton Fashion District began on a Sunday night and lasted through Wednesday. Check in was fast and easy and I found a very nice room with a 9th floor view of the busy street (26th) out front. Bottled water was available from the desk and they jotted down the wifi password for me as well. Keurig in the room was well stocked and the room was so spacious that there was even a small sitting area near the closet. Desk was perfect for work, shades/drapes quite adequate, AC worked great, not terribly loud for a street-facing room. I will book again the next time I'm in the city for business - but also would pick this for a family weekend stay, as it's in a great neighborhood and close to many things to do. The central location makes many destinations walkable. I didn't make it up to the rooftop bar, but I suspect it's a nice addition if you're looking for views and cocktails.The service was absolutely stellar. I contacted the front desk a few times for different things (ice, more coffee) and they were always fast and accommodating. Thanks, Hilton! (And, thanks to Elan at the front desk as well!)

Located just 2-3 blocks from Madison Square Garden / Penn Station, the hotel has probably one of the best locations in Chelsea / Manhattan. There are very good restaurants / bars around and the area is always buzzing. The rooms were quiet nice and the lift is very very fast.We didn't get to try the food here and the service was standard. We stayed only the night so didn't get to experience the facilities.Overall, a decent hotel - 4 stars

Super friendly staff. Caroline, Christine, Angelica and Brandon were really helpful and super nice. The hotel is clean, fresh and in a perfect spot for my daughter and myself on our short trip to NYC.

best service I have ever received! my friend book our room for the wrong date (one that had already passed) and Kathy at the front desk helped us not only look for more rooms to stay at but managed to find us a room in their hotel!!
