Everyone was super helpful and sweet, definitely booking this hotel for my next stay in NYC

I accidentally booked my room for March instead of May. It was for my birthday weekend, and not having a hotel room would have really ruined the night. Kathy and Johnathan made my week by finding a last minute room for me. It was a great birthday thanks to them! I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel!!!!

I have stayed at this hotel several times, and it's comfortable and everything runs smoothly. But this time, I got sent from work elsewhere. I did some online shopping and got it sent to this hotel by mistake. And that's when the real magic began. Johnathan Suazo and Rosaura Suarez really went out of their way to help me get my package. They were so nice they even delivered it on foot to the hotel they sent me to from work, just to make sure I got it on time. If this hotel made me happy before, it has just become one of my favorites. The people who work here are amazing!

The 23rd station subway is only about 3blks away making this a great location for getting around town via Penn Station.The rooms are nice and new with the staff accommodating. I didn't try the restaurant but it looked nice...I would stay here again for sure.

i spent three days here for work and knew the hotel would be good but the staff were really professional and helpful. everyone was great and i even remember a few names - mily, katherine, and jonathan.
user_name:
Andy H
New York City, New York

review_body: We have just returned from a 5* stay at Hilton FD & I couldn't recommend it enough.Check in was swift & easy & we were delighted to hear that We had been upgraded to a King Room with a splendid view of the Empire State Building! (Thank you Jonathan) they were also kind enough to leave me a cake & a bottle Red as I was celebrating my 30th birthday!The hotel is situated in an ideal spot nearby to a couple of subways which is definitely the quickest way of getting around this amazing city.We will definitely enquire into this hotel again should we visit NYC next year! Thanks again!

Seriously, they have seriously one of the best services I have ever experienced, especially for the price that is really affordable in Manhattan. Their assistant office manager Johnathan took the initiative to email me if I have any need. I requested a crib and out of their own initiative they offered me a fridge as well to store baby formula if needed. They also offer me a free upgrade to a room that has the view of the Empire State building. The location of this hotel is great as well who do not want to miss out all the actions in Manhattan. For one, it's very close to Time Square and Broadway theaters. Best of all, it is within 5 minute of walking distance from Megabus' drop-off location. I will definitely consider this hotel on my next visit to NYC, especially Manhattan.

This was the perfect hotel for my sister and I. It was easy to get in and out of and in a great location. Also, the room was clean and had everything that we needed. Also, the rate was very reasonable for NYC. Will definitely consider it again if we need a place to stay in NYC!

Weary from travel and bag schlepping and dodging hundreds of fellow earthlings along often rugged pavement, the Fab Five entered the smallish lobby of Hilton New York Fashion District at 10:00 A.M. on a Sunday morning hoping for the best and expecting the worst. What we got was the best and our experience with an exceptional human being set the tone for our whole visit. Katherine Ortega was the gal who welcomed us to Chelsea, and she handled everything with the courtesy, expertise and kindness that Hilton execs should be looking for in all their employees.Five lifelong friends visiting NYC 52 years after their previous trip together as high school seniors wanted two rooms close to each other. Is that possible? Check. Five friends wanted to pay separately, dividing the bill evenly five ways. No rolled eyes. No sigh of exasperation. What we got from Ms. Ortega was, "No problem." Check. We were well ahead of check in time but could we leave our bags? Check. "I'll text you when I can put you in a room. Now what else can I help you with?" asked our smiling soft-voiced angel. We wanted brunch and the on-site restaurant was not opening for another hour. "Try Malibu Diner. Down three blocks and to the left."The Fab Five wandered out into the glare of Sunday morning dazed and even a bit goofy with delight. As we walked to the diner, everyone expressed complete surprise over our wonderful experience. We had just finished our brunch when the text arrived that we could get into one of the rooms. We walked back to the hotel excitedly, heading toward the bellhop for our bags only to find they were already inside our room! Arriving on the twenty-third floor, we quickly found our room and stepped inside only to discover nice little treats and a welcoming HANDWRITTEN note from Katherine Ortega. I cannot tell you how thrilled we were that she had gone to such lengths to make us feel welcome and special.  Our rooms were spacious and immaculate. We loved the Keurig, the toiletries, the fluffy towels. We ADORED the comfortable beds! We were very happy campers. This hotel is located close to everything you need, and we really liked the area. We travel to NYC about three times a year and I will be returning to this hotel based on this visit. A fine experience all around. Thanks, Katherine, for setting the tone. You made our visit very special!

I enjoyed my one night stay at Hilton. It was very clean, staff were professional and helpful. A nice size room, lovely decor. My only complaint is that the mattress was hard and you can hear the squeeks of the spring board underneath the mattress as you turn positions throughout the night. Staff were tentative, great location of the hotel, speedy check in and out process.

Very nice hotel! Very good location, penn station is very close by. Macy's is just a few minutes walk. The room was nice, not too big but that's ok! The staff was very helpfull. I would like to thank Mily for helping me out with several things, she is a big help!

Our stay here was wonderful. Very clean, perfect location, and staff very friendly. They let us check in hours early and brought us up ice when we asked for it, Would stay here again anytime! Walking distance to many restaurants, bars, and sightseeing!

This was our second stay at this hotel this year. Our daughter is attending two semesters at FIT and this location with valet parking worked out perfectly when we had to move her in & out of her apartment. The room is spacious for New York, as well as clean and comfortable. The front desk staff is courteous and accommodating, making great restaurant suggestions to fit our needs. Concierge and valet attendants are also polite and accommodating. We dined at Rare, the hotel restaurant, on both visits. The wait staff is professional and the food is great. On our recent visit, we stopped in the rooftop bar for a cocktail. The view of the Empire State Building is spectacular, and the atmosphere & service was great. This hotel will certainly be on the top of our list for our return visit to NY in the fall.

Katherine at the reception desk was so helpful and friendly all weekend long from checking us in, to advising us on where to go and even selling us stamps. She was delightful. We loved the boutique style hotel and the locations.

Hotel appears to be new or refurbished.Hotel does have a nice rooftop bar,opens at 4 pm.Rooms are a little small but very functional .There also is a lobby bar and restaurant ,mainly burgers and such.The subway #1 line is two blocks away along with Whole Foods.Enjoy!

Located a short walk away from Madison Square Park. The room was comfortable and the roofdeck bar/lounge is very comfortable and offers great views. Staff were all very helpful and would definitely stay here again

We recently stayed at the Hilton fashion District hotel and found it a great place to stay , it was a great location, but quiet in comparison to other areas, approximately 20 minutes walk from Times Square and 10 minutes to Empire State building.We were very impressed with the staff especially Luidin , who was very helpful after we requested a room change due to the noise of the nearby lift , he upgraded us to a King suite and was of great assistance and always helpful (all of the staff were so friendly ).The rooftop bar is nice if you don't want to have to go out for drinks, it is expensive but has a lovely view of the Empire State Building nearby. (Music gets loud on Saturday night though )I would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay.

This is not my first time staying at this hotel, but as usual, they exceeded my expectations. Everyone was so helpful and willing to make our stay as best as possible. Their service is impeccable and I will absolutely continue to choose this hotel when in NYC.

I consider myself a savvy, "consummate-consumer," with a formal degree in Hospitality as well. I have had the good fortune to stay in some of the best 5-star, Michelin rated hotels throughout the world. I know the difference between decent customer service and customer service that goes the extra mile. I can't say enough wonderful things about the staff at the Hilton N.Y. Fashion Dist. Hotel. I had arrived from L.A. just days after having had a car accident. I notified the hotel in advance that I would need a little help with turning down my bed for that evening because of my injuries. When I arrived at my room l was greeted with a lovely get-well card and a bouquet of flowers; Talk about making me feel cared for and special!!! The entire staff, especially Luidin, Angelica, Marian, and Santiago were just amazing from start to finish. This will be my hotel of choice whenever I am in NYC.

I went to visit New York for the first time and decided to stay at the Hilton New York Fashion district. The rooms were nice and cozy, but nothing out of the ordinary. However, the service was amazing. As soon as we walked in we were greeted. We arrived a little early, but the front desk made arrangements so that we were able to get to the room within 10 minutes. While we waited we were offered a free bottle of water. I was especially pleased with Zoribel and her genuine desire to make our stay there special.
user_name:
jm252015
New York City, New York

review_body: I've stayed at lots of hotels in New York and the Hilton Fashion District had one the best customer service. They really value you as a customer and take the extra mile to ensure that you have a great stay. The Front Office Management team - Luidin, Elan and Johnathan have been wonderful to work with. They made sure that my desired room was available and ready for when I arrived, and provided the extra personal care that you don't get in most hotels, especially in New York. I would highly recommend staying at the Hilton NY Fashion District.

I've stayed at Hilton NY Fashion District regularly on business for years...even when they were an independent boutique hotel before Hilton bought them. I've always been really happy with their customer service. Front desk staff is friendly, rooms are perfect for a work trip, well-located, and it is quiet. There are sometimes glitches, like with all hotels, but they always try to fix the problem and make sure that their customer is satisfied.This time, however, they went the extra mile. Like many people, I was scrambling to get home after the Amtrak derailment. One problem after another and it looked like I might not get home after all after a 5 day trip. Racquel and her team went *way* above and beyond the call of duty to help me out in a tough situation. They've earned my loyalty when I stay in NYC.
user_name:
W0rkerbee
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I was iffy at first about trying this hotel but I was blown away by the service. Mily, the front desk receptionist, was amazing. She was very welcoming and made me feel at home and she catered to my every need. I was here on a business trip and the room I was given was perfect in every sense of the word. I was also offered a wifi pass which was a plus! I can't want to make another trip to New York just to stay here again!

Me and my wife stayed there for a weekend (friday and saturday) and we got a rate of U$200,00 plus taxes. Great value. The building is new. The front desk staff was very friendrily (specially Mr De Los Santos). The room was clean but the air conditioning was noisy. Nice bed. Close to the subway. Would stay there again for sure.

Our "flats r us" Upper East Side apartment was canceled out from under us while we were in the air on the way to NYC. They substituted a really horrible flat that happened to be across the street from this hotel. When we refused to stay in the windowless, horrible substitution property and with our party of 12 coming in from all across the US, we decided to walk across the street and try the Hilton. Mily was working reception and she was a godsend. Her temperament was sweet and welcoming, and she tackled our problem with gusto. Multiple rooms - some for 2 nights, some for 3, some for 4, etc. She handled it with ease, and provided a level of customer service that we want to rave about! The hotel even arranged a rooftop bar area for us to host our gathering, and Michelle managed that beautifully. We had a REALLY memorable stay thanks to these two lovely ladies and the terrific, well-located Hilton New York Fashion District. BTW, the rooms were comfy, clean, and affordable. I'll definitely stay with them whenever I have the chance. They helped us salvage a trip that was going kaput, but instead turned into a five star event for all of us involved!

We used this for a getaway weekend. The staff were very friendly and helpful including a maid in elevator who helped us find our way around. Yes, the room is small but comfortable. We put our two small suitcases on the desk area but there was also enough room for another large suitcase on the floor in front of the door to connect to adjoining room. The bed was very comfortable. The shower worked well even for very short person. The safe is on an upper shelf in the closet (see photo) which meant feeling for its contents since I couldn't see them. I didn't see any directions for safe but it worked like the most of those I have used in the past. We had a room on the back side of the hotel facing some offices and there was no significant noise. This hotel is on a cross street so mostly the area was quiet except for construction across the street from its entrance. It is very easy to drive past hotel because it is set back from street but that accommodates the half-circle drive where you can load and unload without double-parking. We used the 'official' parking garage in the same block and got the reduced hotel rate. Make sure your parking claim is validated by the hotel and that you tell the parking attendant that you are staying at the hotel. The parking garage was very full and I think the only reason they took our car was because we were hotel guests. As always in a city, allow time for them to retrieve your car when you go to pick it up. They are constantly moving around the cars within the garage and you will need to leave your ignition key. I used my 'valet' key after locking the glove compartment and trunk with my regular key. There were plenty of cabs in the area and the subway stop is nearby. There is always plenty to see and do in Manhattan so just get out and walk in any direction!

My husband and I stayed here on April 3-6, 2015. We were greeted by Katherine Ortega at the front desk and oh my goodness!!! Katherine was just amazing, hospitable, and sweet. I was dreading having to pay for wi-fi or hang out in the lobby just for it but she actually gave us a complimentary wi-fi access card!!! It made our stay all the better including the service. We had clean beds every night and new towels. We also checked out the bar on the rooftop which has an amazing view at night. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who is planning on staying in NYC for a few days. I wish the hotel had a pool which I know is unlikely for NYC but it would be nice. Other than that, I have no complaints. Thanks for making our stay a very pleasant experience! Thank you!

Christine M. at the front desk is just the best and so helpful! And everything about the hotel is great. The location is great and the rooms are BIG!!! But the front desk staff is the best in town and so great!!!

I am supporting a sales team business group in town this week at our NY office and everyone is staying at the Hilton NY Fashion District Hotel. This review is for the CONCIERGE only, as I have a whole DIFFERENT review for their sales team (and not in a good way). The Concierge was extremely helpful in working with me to try to get last minute show tickets (which didn't work out) but then also helped me out a lot for getting restaurant reservations close to our offices. Christopher Cepeda was AWESOME! He was pleasant and really HEARD my requests. I would highly recommend Chris if you want excellent concierge service especially at the Hilton NY Fashion District.

We just returned from a three night stay at the Hilton Fashion District. After researching every hotel in Chelsea and reading dozens of tripadvisor reviews I chose this property and I am glad I did! It met or exceeded all of my expectations. It is clear why this property has risen so quickly on the tripadvisor rankings for NYC.Room: The rooms are larger than average for NYC. They are impeccably clean with updated furnishings. The bathrooms have abundant storage (which I find to be highly unusual for NYC) with excellent products and great water pressure.Location: Centrally located and convenient to shopping, restaurants, theatres, sights and subway. It's close enough to the hub of activity yet away from the noise and crazyness of times square/theatre district. Service: Now for the best part! The thing that really sets the Hilton Fashion District apart from the competiton is the incredible staff. General Manager, Yaniv Packin, has assembled an all star team. I am certain that they are the reason for the rise up the tripadvisor rankings. My positive experience began long before we arrived in NYC. Elan Bielski, the front office manager, personally saw that every request we made was granted. His professional yet personal attention to our visit was the primary reason I chose this property over the many others in the area. He is a tremendous asset to this property and an excellent representative of the Hilton brand to the public.Upon arrival we were welcomed warmly by Katherine who made sure that every aspect of our stay was perfect. She went above and beyond to ensure that our visit was everything we hoped it would be. It's employees like her who make all the difference and keep guests coming back. Every staff member we encountered were friendly, professional and eager to help.Overall: We have been to New York many times and stayed at many properties in a variety of locations. In my opinion the Hilton Fashion District cannot be beat for quality, value, location and especially service. (One last thing - don't miss the amzing views from the rooftop bar!)

We arrived late and to be honest did not expect a great deal of warmth from New York staff based on past experience. From the minute we arrived, Sid o nthe front desk made us feel completley at home. He took great pleasure in pointing us in all the right direction during our stay so we not only had a comfortable and convenient base, but authentic NYC experiences. Sid really made our stay, he is fantastic! The rooftop bar was a great place to enjoy the views without feeling like you were intruding on a scene - nice tunes and freindly staff.

Johnathan, Elan and Luidin were awesome and made sure my stay was the best possible. When it was time to go, I was in a rush but had a box to ship. Johnathan saved me time and shipped it for me. Now that is service!

A small Hotel by Hilton, made to be slightly funky with casual rooftop bar (good views) and cellar grill/breakfast (limited menu). Good service in all facetsRoom was bigger than expected for NYC standards and the 26th St side had very little traffic which was refreshingly quiet (with the exception of semi regular garbage trucks servicing the opposite building sometimes from 430am - so higher floor is better). Bed very comfortable Location is central to both Union square and midtown - excellent - but being in the slightly grubby 'garment district' this hotel comes without the premium location price of eitherDownsides are small but not what I'd expect for the price - no free bottled water, electronic minibar so you can't chill your own water bought outside, shower pressure/temp below par and leaked everywhere, dry cleaning prices outrageous (us$11 + tax per shirt!), not sure if wifi is free or not, and lobby sports bar is a bit on the grim side. None of them deal breakers

Short business stay at the Hilton Fashion District Hotel.Hotel is located centrally not far from 34th Street and the Flatiron district.Overall hotel was quite good. Room is compact but equipped with all the amenities. It's modern with a huge flat screen tv. Great bathroom and shower as well.Bed was good, although mine seemed to be a bit saggy on one side. The only thing I found was the walls are a thin. I could hear my neighbour's TV quite clearly. You are in NYC, so the rooms are small. Good for 1-2 people, but not with a small child. You would need a big room. Also, quite expensive, so be prepared to pay for the location.Wifi is $14/per day. Would recommend because it's central and safe.

I was looking for a Hilton hotel in NY and found this hotel. The pictures on the hotel site were nice. However, I was not impressed with the hotel rooms, especially for the price. The hotel room did not have much personality for it to be in the fashion district and the room was so small and drab. I know the rooms in NY are generally small, but this was crazy. Being a Gold Hilton Honors Member, I thought I would have gotten a better room, but that was not the case. I will never stay here again.

Stayed here for four nights on vacation. The lady who checked us in, whose name I think was Marian, was super nice, and put is in a quiet room facing away from the street, as requested. It's nice to be greeted by someone pleasant when you've had a long journey.The room was quite spacious for a Manhattan hotel, and the decor is modern and tasteful. My only complaint is the bed - if you're sharing, you will feel your half of the bed move every time your companion moves. It wasn't the most restful sleep for me due to the mattress. A mattress that isolates movement is better for a king bed.Location is close to the 23rd St. PATH station, and also handy for the 1 train. There are several other subway lines close by. Madison Square Park is a short walk, as is the High Line.The people working in the restaurant for breakfast were helpful, and the buffet was only $7 if you have HHonors status. Quality of the food was good.I would absolutely stay at this hotel again for a vacation. It would also be quite suitable for business travel.
user_name:
Brendan O
Memphis, Tennessee, United States

review_body: I had the opportunity to experience a sincere commitment to customer satisfaction from a very dedicated representative named Mily. Her patience and execution of the ultimate display of perfection was incomparable. She should be a trainer. She definitely got it!
user_name:
alphonzo T
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My daughter was in desperate need of a hotel when she returned to New York from modeling in Shanghai as her model apartment that she was living in was moved to a very undesirable location and was not suitable for her to stay in. The hotel manager, Elan Bielski and front desk agent, Kathryn were very helpful in getting her a decent rate on her room and were very accommodating in every way to make the experience of being stranded in New York a decent one for my daughter. Thanks Elan & Kathryn!

Very clean and comfortable room. Efficient, courteous service.Room service was punctual, food was hot. Concierge helped with recommendations for shopping, restaurants etc. Location was great with Whole Foods and entertainment closeby...Would definitely return and highly recommend!Geri B - PB, FL

First of all the roof bar is a must see! Especially at sunset! Awesome view of the empire state building. The upgrade to room with a view, it is totally worth it, in my opinion. The room was small but met my needs, the bed was comfy and I slept well. The staff was all very friendly and helpful.

Price is about average or even cheaper than comparable hotels in the area. Rooms were nice (albeit small - but aren't they all in NYC?). My partner woke up a couple of times in the night and I'm surprised I didn't - the traffic can definitely be heard, but then again we were on the 3rd floor. My only beef would be how we were treated by the security guard/bouncer (at 5PM). Condescending, rude, and anything but helpful. No one explained the elevators and using the room keys to get to the floors but we figured it out soon after (another guest commented he did the exact same thing). We tried going to rooftop bar from our floor but it wouldn't work with our key and it took us to the lobby. This is when the security guard demanded to see our IDs, belittled us, and began interrogating us (we are 27 and 28 and were just wanting to look at the bar to see if it interested us).Overall - I don't recommend it but I also won't discourage others despite my bad experience. I won't be back though.

We spend a 3 day in this hotel and are very happy to have chosen this hotel, which is ideally located (close to the empire state building and times square).The staff is kind and helpful; we mentioned the fact that we were celebrating our first year anniversary and we were offered a quiet room at a high floor with a very kind gift waiting for us in the room. This was very much appreciated, thank you very much to the staff. Kind regards from Paris.

the Hotel is amazing and located at the prime location in NewYork city. All the great landmarks time square, Empire State are at walking distance.Moreover my spouse had requested the hotel to decorate the room with roses for our anniversary And believe me the sight i got to see once i entered the room was unbelievable. A path was made with roses, a splendid choc cake with a bottle of wine and 2 assorted chocolates. Zoribel was the person who made all the arrangement and WE thank her a lot for this. the hotel also has a roof top bar with an amazing view to Manhattan.

Wonderfully friendly staff, great position in Midtown, being a short stroll to 5th Ave in the are of the Empire State Building, Penn Station etc. Our room was very comfortable and remarkably quiet at the badk.

The front desk staff was always extremely friendly and helpful as was the wait staff in the lobby bar. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. Great updated bathroom with nice provided toiletries. Room service was reasonably priced and was VERY quick!

We stayed at this hotel during a recent business trip to NYC. As a Hilton Honors member, I usually choose a Hilton property when I travel. We stayed on the 17th floor of this Hilton and had a nice view that included several rooftops and the top of the Empire State Building. Noise from the street below was faint (except during the Freddie Gray protest that marched by one night).If you're not used to staying in big city hotels, the rooms in this hotel are small when compared to rooms you'll find at similar hotels in smaller markets. We stayed in a room (not a suite) with one king bed. There was a very nice shower, but no bathtub. The room was clean, and the bed comfortable. The nature of our trip was such that we didn't spend much time in our room, so it was more than adequate for our stay.If you like thrift stores, the Buffalo Exchange is on the same block as this hotel and is not to be missed. The restaurant in the hotel -- Rare -- is good, but there are lots of other restaurants and a grocery store (Fairway) within easy walking distance.I would stay here again, or try another Hilton in mid-town Manhattan next time.

Firstly - Sid - - you're awesome. Thanks for making us feel at home in NYC. He was great help and wonderfully (authentically) friendly. Great hospitality and suggestions (we have to come back to see the places he suggested in Queens :) The location of the hotel is fantastic and the room was very comfortable and sleek. Highly recommended. Thanks!

I stay in Hilton hotels frequently for work and am in NYC a handful of times per year. The location of this hotel is excellent, but what made this stay special was the help of Luidin, the assistant manager. Luidin reached out ahead of time, provided a direct line of contact for my stay and alerted me to workout classes they hosted in the morning. Because my flight was arriving so late, Luidin reserved me a specific room on a higher floor (important in NYC) and made sure the staff knew I would be arriving late. When I walked in that night, I was greeted by name before I even got to the front desk. The little things make a difference.

We were treated so special. The room was clean and well lit. The bathrooms were clean and well stocked. The food was delicious and the wait staff was wonderful. Zoribel was so accommodating, she helped us take fabulous pictures. The hostess in the restaurant who looks like "Bobbi" in General Hospital was friendly and so cheerful. We had stayed in Chelsea the week before and did not find that hotel nearly as classy as this Hilton.

Loved it here easy check in and out. So clean comfy bed with clean white fluffy bedding. Great location for what we needed. Free fridge. Staff friendly and not phony. Comp. store your bags just give a tip. Will stay here again.

Upon arrival the front desk was extremely helpful and knowledgeable.Caroline with her charming smile came around the desk with a toy cart and offer my son a toy, this absolutely made my day. Also Ms.Christine and Zoribel were very helpful while making sure we got a room available for our early arrival. Thank you ladys and the bellman john for such a great service we will defenetly be back.

Convenient location, clean, nice sized rooms and great customer service. The Assistant Manager, Jonathan Suaza, was incredibly accommodating and helpful! Very pleasant experience. Will definitely visit again soon.

Just thought I would write my first tripadvisor review as I was really impressed by this hotel. Sandwiched in what looks like not the best area (but I was wrong) was this lovely hotel. None of the grandeur of some I have visted (that normally dissapoint) this is a fairy new looking hotel and the rooms were perfect, modern and you didnt hit the floor when you sat on the bed. 5 mins walk from Macy's and another 5 from Times square (didnt use the metro too much as like to see life not tunnels). Staff were very attentive and a great bar in the evening (though did smell a little damp) with amazing views of the Empire State Building. All in all if I go back to NYC I will stay here.

The Hilton Fashion District staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was enjoyable! Dean and Élan anticipated our every need and we were well taken care of. As a Diamond HHonors member I stay at a lot of Hilton properties and none exceed the service of this property! Thank you for a fabulous stay!

I always stay in the same place in NYC but this time I was traveling on business and this was located near my meeting. The room was a decent size, a view of a building--which means this is great for people who aren't sitting in their room in NYC. The bathroom was a nice size. The hotel was clean and the staff was very nice--really nice, polite, helpful and all that. The rooftop bar seems to be very popular with locals which gave the hotel a nice energy.

Great property, location, room, shower, restaurant, roof top bar and people! So many things make this my new hotel of choice in NYC! good sized and comfortable rooms are just the added bonus on top of the great staff. particularly Jonathon and Brandon at the front desk and the office manager, Elan.well done all. i will be back many times!.

Not my first time in NY but my first time staying in this hotel. Definitely different from all the other hotels I have stayed in as far as service. I was greeted by Katherine who was at the front desk and just made me feel welcomed. She also gave me free Wi-Fi which saved me money. Thank you, Kathy, it is my pleasure to write this review for you!

The NY Hilton Fashion District is well located, clean, quiet, comfortable and well appointed. All things I look for in a great hotel. What makes it one of my homes away from home (and I travel a lot...) is the extraordinary warmth, professionalism and caring of its 5 star staff. Thank you Elan Bielski, Milly, Zoribel, Festus and Moises (and the rest of your amazing team -- too many to mention) for always welcoming me so warmly, making sure the little details are handled so well and treating me like a friend. If you stay at this property, and meet this extraordinary team, you are in for a real treat!

This was the second time I have had the pleasure to stay at the Hilton New York Fashion District. Once again all the staff went above and beyond to assure my stay was nothing less the Excellent! The Staff at the front desk were outstanding. Rare the restaurant attached to the Hotel provides great food, service and convinience. If you are looking for a reasonably priced very clean modern Hotel with Exceptional

Stayed three nights and was very disappointed in this hotel and confirms for me that Hilton is losing out to similar chains. Not full service hotel by any means.. Asked for newspaper, told to go to 7th ave to get one. No lobby to speak of. Room much smaller than 300 ft advertised. I preselected room, but when i got there at check-in time, it wasn't available so given a different one, next to elevator with alot of late night activity. If room not available at check in then why does it show as option to choose? If they know you preselected, then why didn't they ready that room instead of others? No maid service day two, so hard to come back after long day with no soap and one towel. Check-out on TV didn't work. Worst of all, could not lock room from either outside or inside, which I didn't discover until day of checkout. Fortunately no one came in but could have easily made off with my Ipad and cash. Hilton should not brand these as full service Hiltons with such poor standards. I travel a lot, but am giving up on Hiltons. Never know what you'll get.

The hotel and service is fantastic; it's a convenient few blocks from Penn Station and Madison Sq. Garden. The one and only negative is the free breakfast coupon if you are a frequent traveler (Gold or Diamond status - Hilton). It recently changed to coffee and carbs (cereal, muffin, toast, croissant). Plan to spend $$ to get eggs, fruit, etc.
user_name:
Alison T
Northeast US, United States

review_body: The room was great and the mattress even better. Had the best sleep ever! I got the name of their mattresses and am going to buy one. I couldn’t get the closet door open and they sent someone immediately who was very polite when it turned out that I was trying to use the handle when all you had to do was pull on the thing! I was so embarrassed, but the guy was very cool about it. A nice woman at the desk gave us a cool map of Manhattan which helped a lot--we thought we would use our phones--BAD! They got us a cab very quickly when we left and the cab driver was so nice, he took us on a little tour on the way to the airport, so I think they know how to get good cabs! One guy, Jonathan, I think, was extra helpful and went out of his way to make us feel less like rubes from Wisconsin and like proper New Yorkers. The bar up on the roof is pretty nice too and had great staff as well. Also the WiFi was great, fast, and very easy to connect to--that’s such a blessing!
user_name:
Janet C
Milwaukee, Wisconsin, United States

review_body: These guys understand hospitality. Early check in...no problem. Watch your luggage...no problem. Proper directions, throughout the town...no problem. Need a bottle opener or a bucket of ice...you guessed it...no problem. (The chicken noodle soup did have a bit too much dill, if I do have to find a complaint).Screw Marriott. Stay here.

There are a lot of choices in the area that all seem very similar; I will say for the price point you cannot do much better than this Hilton. Check in was a breeze, room was very clean, bathroom was nicely updated and bed was very comfortable. I was on the 10th floor and did not hear any street noise. The room was also a decent size for Manhattan. No complaints.

Be careful when booking room with view, because even though it is at a high floor, there is no view and i have paid more. The view was a brick wall and windows. Overall great staffs at the reception, they did all the possible to make their guests happy.

What makes this hotel even better is its staff members. Mily from the front desk is extremely helpful and makes you feel right at home from the moment you walk in. It's nice to stay in a hotel that takes pride in providing excellent customer service! Thank you!
user_location: Santiago de los Caballeros, Dominican Republic
user_name:
TravelHopper21
Santiago de los Caballeros, Dominican Republic

review_body: Pros:- Convenient location in the Chelsea area, right near FIT, easy walk to Penn StationCons:- Room was small (probably not unusual in Manhattan)- No closet in room- No personal refrigerator, just a special device designed to sell you drinks if you so much as touch it- WiFi costs extra- Annoying keycard system** You have to touch your key to a pad in the elevator before it will let you push the button for your floor. I appreciate security features most of the time, but this was a huge nuisance. First, if you're on one of the bottom floors, you better be first in the elevator, or someone else will have entered a higher floor and taken off past your own stop long before you can get the right buttons pressed. In a crowded elevator, or even just having your hands full, nobody else can hit the button for you, so you have to jostle around people and objects trying to get everything keyed in before things start moving. And the keypads don't seem to always register the card taps well (indicated only by a microscopic little blinking light nearby), making it even easier to miss your floor.

Stayed at this hotel last week and i must say from The moment i walked in to the moment i walked out service was impecable.. Every hotel should have a Staff Like the one at The Hilton Fashion District. Wanted to say Thank you to Mily for all Your help AND for going beyond your way to help me have a better stay.. I will deffinetly be back AND highly recommed this hotel to anyone.

I hate morning flights but they are essential. I hate taking expensive cabs from the airport that take close to an hour to get to where you're staying. I hate having to wait to get checked in when all I want, nay, need to do is to get to computer to do more work. So that being said, coming to the Hilton for the first time, I was resigned to write it off as another lame corporate hotels that don't care when the front desk said that I wasn't able to check in without my counterpart. But Mily really stepped to the plate and helped me out when I explained the situation and provided proper verification. She made sure that I got into my room and had everything I needed to make this trip run seamlessly. That is the kind of service that frequent travelers look forward to and makes them come back. So thanks Mily!

I love this hotel. I love the look and the people were very nice and easy going. Katherine was extremely helpful and welcoming. I will definitely book a room here again.I love the roof top it was very nice.

What a wonderful hotel. Greeted by beautiful reception staff on arrival. Checked into our room earlier than expected and what a lovely thought to be offered a bottle of water each, Room was so cosy and comfortable. Excellent coffee maker and good bathroom facilities and toiletries. Amazing view of the Empire State Building. Right where you need to be by Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Several restaurants and hotels in close proximity. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Luidin, Asst Mgr, did a superb job of handling my special request. Made me feel welcome. Saw to it that I had an outstanding view and assured that my entrance to NYC was first rate. They make the Hilton brand proud.

We were only able to spend one night at this Hilton, but I highly recommend it. The location is excellent. Walking distance to many attractions. The rooms were a nice size and very comfortable. The front desk and concierge were exceptionally helpful and friendly. We went to the rooftop bar - lovely view! A bit of a younger crowd - 20's - they were having fun! We did not stay for a drink, however. Based on location, service, and comfort - this hotel is a definite yes. (I just wish WiFi was included at Hiltons)

Taking the megabus? Going to see Wendy Williams or Rachel Ray? This hotel was SO delightful to stay in. Clean and pleasing appearance of everything, including lobby, room, bar, and other areas. Staff gets a 110% from my mother and me. They were very nice and accommodating and went above and beyond to make our experience great. Jonathan and Milly were great to us during the check in and check out process.

I love the Hilton Fashion District Hotel: great location, clean, silent, comfortable rooms with a stunning view on the Empire State Building. (and also great steaks). Already recommended to many people I know.

Amazing first time experience! Beautiful clean rooms, accommodating and attentive staff! Always greeted with a smile! Prime location for NYC seekers! All around and incredible stay! Thank you Hilton!! Can't wait for my next overnight stay!

Excellent first time experience at the Hilton FD. I was immediately tended to by the hotel's welcoming front office team, and upgraded without ask for my loyalty to the Hilton brand. Kathy was especially helpful, to which her courtesy, resourcefulness and overall pleasant demeanor only added to the positive experience of my stay. Following my stay, I received a timely follow-up by the hotel's assistant front office manager, Johnathan, checking in to make sure my stay was everything I expected it to be.The hotel is updated and conveys a modern/trendy feel. It's rooftop bar is spectacular and is highly sought-after. I'll be frequenting this hotel going fwd.
user_name:
Jay5200
New York City, New York

review_body: I had an amazing romantic weekend with my boyfriend at the end of February. I checked in at the front desk with Milly, I let her know I was surprising my boyfriend with a late Valetines day stay. She then helped me set the room with rose petals and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine. Thanks to her we had an amazing stay!

This is my top choice whenever visiting NYC. This Hilton is great for almost any kind of trip. This past week I had a business trip. I was unhappy with the room I had originally booked was behind the elevator,so I went downstairs to the reception and Mily upgraded my room to an even better view with the Empire State Building. She even recommended I go upstairs to the bar and try the fashionista! Loved it. Thanks Mily!!! :)

Stayed two nights here. The room was a little worn and the bed could have been more comfortable. You had to be a member of Hilton Honors to get free wi-fi. It was clean. In the morning you could hear other door rooms closing which kept us awake. Best part was the rooftop bar with a great view. We went on Sun. so it wasn't crowded. There was a line to get up there on Sat. evening. Using the room key to get to your room took some getting used to.The staff was friendly.

I arrived to NYC for a business trip over the weekend and I did not know what to expect from the Hilton fashion district. I have stood at many hotels around Manhattan but none of them were as welcoming and helpful as the front desk at this location. When I arrived Katherine was friendly and warm and willing to help me find local restaurants in the area (I have a weakness for Italian). My company didn't approve any room amenities but Katherine was nice enough to give me WiFi for free! I couldn't have asked for a better experience. The bellman were eager to help me get a taxi and grab my luggage. Over all I would recommend this location to anyone looking to stay at a great hotel with amazing service.

Hilton Fashion District has plenty of onsite amenities, but is well located for venturing off campus. Just a ten minute walk from Penn Station and a panoply of restaurants, bars, and sights.Moreover the staff was exceptionally pleasant and willing to assist to ensure my friend had a fantastic 30th birthday. Will definitely stay here again, and check out the Empire-facing king rooms!

I had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton New York Fashion District Hotel and will return any and every time I plan on staying in the Manhattan. The Hotel is beautiful and clean. I could not believe how spacious the rooms were. The location is convenient. The service was outstanding, with every staff member being polite and very accommodating. Room service was fast and I just couldn't ask for a more pleasant stay. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to stay in the citySusan G

From start to finish, nothing but an incredible time! I dealt with Elan from the beginning of planning my friends bachelorette weekend. He was so accommodating and helped me to fulfill all of my requests! Dean and Moises were friendly, helpful and informative!! Room was spacious, immaculate and comfortable! Beds were comfy and cozy! Can't wait to stay at the Hilton for my next city getaway! What a pleasant and amazing weekend in the city!

Jonathan Suazo - Asst Front desk mgr and his crew Kathy, Mily and Miriam were AWESOME!!! they took a booking nightmare thru Travelzoo and turned it into a belle at the ball fantasy come true!! Kudos to Jonathan and his team!

I've booked this hotel several times for business for several reasons....Its in the center of NYC and makes traveling around super easy. There are tons off cool bars/restaurants near by , But the main reason ....The service is amazing there !!! One time I was there during my birthday and the woman at the front desk, Katherine, surprised me with a basket of yummy goodies and a bottle of champagne in my room. I was far from home and it really made my day and warmed my heart. The next time I booked this hotel, not only did she remember my name, she also remembered what I liked around the area....service like that is extremly RARE( like the restaurant onsite lol) I ALWAYS recommend this hotel to my friends whenever they are in the NYC area.

This Hilton was a bit of a surprise. It is tucked away just off 7 Ave (Fashion Dist) and is actually a really nice place. Like most NYC hotels it has a small but functional room with a decent to good shower. The best part was the attached restaurant called RARE which I review in a separate review. Having the attached Bar and restaurant made it easy to eat and have a few drinks without having to wonder out into the craziness that is NYC. Great Value for the area. Would be nice if WIFI was included however for that amount of money. Being only a Silver HH I don't get it for free unlike with Marriott it is free to all.

My first trip to NYC was everything and more than I expected. I was a bit overwhelmed but Zoribel was so friendly and helpful with directions on the subway. I can't wait to come back and visit thank you for a wonderful experience.

I had to return a second time since the first was so well spent. The first time I was there I was helped by probably the best customer service person I have encountered. I wish I would of remembered her full name...... I was lucky enough to be helped by Katherine the second time around but this time she wasn't pregnant ha ha. The hotel was super clean, i was scared that the location could be a little distant from all the action but little did i know that there were so many clubs and bars in that area. I truly enjoyed my stay.

I have stayed here multiple times for business. The staff is very friendly and accommodating...from front desk to the resturant to the cleaning crew..smiles all around. The organic burger at Rave is top notch, a whole foods around the corner, killer pizza & good coffee/tea, in house gym or fitness classes nearby...can't go wrong. Walk to times square...Empire state. I will be back.

Working for a popular entertainment company where "The show must go on!", I am faced with booking large groups at the last minute, whenever there is a snow storm that can affect morning commuting travel. This is my "go to" hotel and first choice when it comes to finding accommodations for our staff and crew. It was quick to book, easy to check in, and a delightful overnight experience. Just what I need, a stress free experience on a stressful messy day. Very clean for New York, and located in a great area. Lots of options in the neighbor. The sales staff and hotel staff were very accommodating despite the complexity associated with booking 20+ rooms with the clock ticking and the snow falling. Overall, I'll certainly be back there again when the need were to arise.
user_name:
Jayson B
New York City, New York

review_body: Came to New York for a week with friends.We were happy with the hotel since the moment we came- all the way to checkout.Accommodating service, very nice staff, the rooms are very clean.We felt Vip.
user_name:
Itai A
New York City, New York

review_body: I had to take a red eye from Seattle to NY today and by the time I arrived to the hotel, I was exhausted. Thankfully Caroline, Zoribel, and Christine met me at the front desk and helped me get settled in. The early check-in and wifi upgrade made my afternoon far less hectic than expected allowing me time to rest up before my 8-9 hour CPE presentation. Reps like these are why our software company continues to book our reservations with Hitlon.
user_name:
Stefan K
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed for 2 nights 2-4th over the Easter break as a base to explore New York before heading on to Washington to visit friends. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location with some great places to explore within a few minutes walk and easy to walk or take the Metro to other sights.The hotel room was a good size, spotlessly clean and an added bonus was that as requested my room was on an upper level with views of the Empire State Building...The girls on the front desk were really helpful, down to earth, welcoming and friendly which was reassuring as my first visit to the States and travelling alone. Would definitely recommend as a base from which to explore the City and would stay on a return visit.

Great location between 6th and 7th avenue, easy to get anywhere from there. Very convenient, we were in room 1910 (19th floor) , got upgraded thanks to Diamond status- it was very silent and had a nice view on the Empire State building. I hate NY huge hotels where you need too long to get to your room, so this one is suitable for people who seek efficiency while not compromising on comfort. Rooms are a bit small (especially the closets) but the staff is very nice and wouldn't hesitate to go the extra mile to answer your requests.. Special thanks to Marian : always serious & dedicated: she made her real best to grant us late check out.

Seems like the hotel had a recent facelift. The room was clean, it was a decent size with large bathroom. We stayed at a corner room far from the elevators and any other traffic and it was very quiet.It is a short walk from the High Line, Meat packing district and many other places worth visiting. A couple of blocks away from the nearest subway station and a short walk to Penn station.Much cheaper than many other hotels I stayed at in NYC and a great value for the price.

I stayed here the other night for one night, on a Friday. The hotel is gorgeous and the staff were all really friendly. The room was a nice size for New York City, and was also very clean. The hotel has parking that you have to walk to for $43 or you can valet for 24 hours for $55. If you check out, the bellman will hold your belongings until you come back. The next morning the concierge recommended the Malibu Diner for breakfast, just a short walk; I will post a review there also. Overall I loved the hotel, Mariam, was awesome!
user_name:
Alexis A
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I was visiting NY for an overnight-er, had a chance to visit the city to go to a Brooklyn Nets game, and hopefully see a few sights. I check into the Hilton NY Fashion District, nice place with the perfect location. They checked me in early (had rooms available) yes! they offered me late check out..yes! middle of the week travels.. The hotel was nice and clean... I will go back.. OH! the front desk staff was GREAT, help me get around, YES, I took the subway to the GAME, it was a blast.. Thank you! ZORIBEL.. she gave excellent directions and made my trip more than I imagined. She helped us get around I really appreciate it.. Made my trip one of the best, and I travel a lot..You will see more of me!Eunice E.

Only individual business travelers should consider this hotel. Your family will not fit! The rooms are tiny -- just large enough for a bed and narrow walkway around it. The closets have less than 18 inches of usable hanging space. The shower is only 24 inches wide. These dimensions are all seriously sub-standard. The lobby is hideous. The restaurant is mediocre. I recommend the Hilton brand name be removed from this property.
user_name:
KandMNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: Staying at the Hilton New York Fashion District was one of the best hotel experiences I have had in New York City. The Staff was extremely polite and accomodatng, in particular Kathy at the Front Desk. She was very helpful and friendly. Again the staff, was very impressive including Milly and we cannot wait to come back.

Even though you're located between the financial district (think World Trade Center) and Midtown (Times Square, Central Park) this hotel is in a good location. The rooms were average sized for NYC and were updated and clean. Best of all was the price. I typically can't find a good hotel room in NYC for less than $250 (before tax), but this was $100 less than that when I stayed. I highly recommend this hotel for the value. Great variety in restaurants located within walking distance. Additionally, if you don't like eating out, you're within three blocks of multiple grocery stores. I will definitely be staying here when I return to the city.

I wanted to write to express my gratitude, my experience at this hotel was amazing and the staff was great especially Kathy and mily who were a great help and extremely nice made my stay very pleasant. I will definitely be choosing to stay here again and to recommend this hotel to others.

I arrived early and Zuribel the receptionist was able to get me in a room right away. She was very kind and efficient. The room was nice and the hotel was is a central location for the activities I wanted to check out

The team at the front desk, led by Caroline, and the bell staff led by Jose, are amazing. They go out of their way to be helpful and quickly deal with any issues that arise. I would recommend this hotel highly to any business travelers in the area.

Good hotel in the fashion district, walking distance to Meatpacking and midtown. Rooms are spacious and clean. Quiet at night and good mattress. Service is ok. Gym has enough equipment to keep in form during a short stay.

I travel to New York all the time and I have stayed in several hotels and this one is by far the one that keeps me coming back. I just have to point out a few things, the rooms are not that big but cozy and those beds are everything I normally have to ask for late checkout which I normally get because I just can't get up. The staff is superb!!! Extremely helpful and always ready to help. On my last visit I didn't get to book a room on time but the front desk girls Milly and Kathy helped me get a nice room with an amazing view. I will continue to come back as many times as I can.

The Fashion District Hilton is hands down my favorite NYC property in the Hilton portfolio. The hotel is not so big as to feel impersonal -- in large part because of the attentive and welcoming staff. The location is convenient whether business or leisure travel takes you to New York.

... So I say a 5 star experience, let me explain because this is not the Ritz, but I consider it a 5 star because it is always extremely clean and well kept, the front desk is exceptional on efficiency and courtesy (liked it so make I spent 32 of my 140 nights last year in this property) and its onsite restaurant "Rare" really very delicious and reasonable. I mean I look for these things in a city property more than glitz, I want promptness, professionalism, reliability, clean, safe, this property has all of the above and consistently....

New Hilton hotel perfectly located in Midtown. Awesome rooftop bar area with great views of Manhattan. Rare restaurant is excellent for breakfast, lunch and dinner as well. Close to very nice restaurants (Tre Dici is one hidden gem). Great staff always helpful and willing to go out of their way.

My son and I had a wonderful stay at the Hilton New York Fashion District Hotel while in New York for 5 days. The atmosphere was hip and chic however very kid friendly. Walking distance from Times Square and 5th Avenue. I will definitely stay here again. Mr. Hilton your management team was superb in handling and taking care of my needs.

I visited this hotel before it became a Hilton, when it was a Wyndham hotel. In October 2010 From the moment we stepped inside, we were welcomed and made to feel at ease. My sister and I booked this hotel from Australia and after the disastrous experience on our first stop in Los angeles, we were relieved and surprised this hotel was so beautiful. The room was on the small side but had everything we needed. He iPod dock came in handy for our sleepless nights trying to get in to New York time, (apologies to the neighbours, hope u all like bon jovi lol). I am heading bavk over to New York in 2019 and will be staying at this hotel for sure!

I stayed here for 6 nights on business; the staff gave me a great welcome, a nice room on a high floor, and a free Wifi code (although the fact that they charge for Wifi in the first place is bizarre).The rooms are medium-sized and comfortable, with a good minibar and Keurig coffee machine. The shower was a little disappointing, with a very narrow waterstream. The Peter Thomas Roth bath products were pretty nice.

went for a weekend, wife and I. Room was spacious, clean, amenities all available. Hotel staff very helpful from arrival to discharge. Close to Chelsea market, Madison square park, Restaurants. Rate very appropriate . Would go there again in a heart beat

This hotel is in the perfect location in the heart of Chelsea. The staff went above and beyond to take care of every little thing we needed throughout our stay. The restaurant rare was good however the service leaves something to be desired. Everything else was perfect though and we can't wait to return.

Everything was absolutely perfect! Great location, clean room, but the best part was the staff. Special shout out to the manager elan who took care of everything from start to finish. Can't wait to come back!

I haven't stayed in a Hilton Hotel in quite some time as my past experiences had not been the most favorable, but I decided to take a chance on the New Hilton Hotel in the Fashion District of New York City. The price was right, in was in the area I wanted to be and I knew it was indeed NEW.Did I change my mind? Yes, from the moment I walked in and was greeted by Zoribel at the front desk. Such a delight, I immediately felt I had made a connection, that she cared about my having a good stay and was eager to help in any way she could. She is real, sincere and professionally accommodating. I told her that I had personalbusiness and that was why I was early. She suggested I leave my bags and finish my registration upon my return at which point she could better grant my request for a room on a high floor with a view. I followed her suggestion, however upon my return Zoribel was no longer at the desk as her shift had ended but Mily and Kathy had been well informed by Zoribel about my request and both were eager to please. Such pleasant friendly engaging fun loving personalties. Who says New Yorkers and not Friendly! I was given a bottle of water, completed a short discussion on what is hot and not so hot theater wise in NYC, had my bags delivered to my room. I got my room on a high floor with a view thanks to the efforts of Zoribel, Mily and Kathy. My room was immaculate, the bed comfortable, the shower hot and pressure excellent. The soap made me feel like I was in a spa and overall it relaxed me to enjoy a wonderful evening in this fabulous city. Will I come back to this hotel; you bet I will in large part because of the efforts of the dynamic trio Zoribel, Mily and Kathy. They are such assets to this hotel that when I think of Hilton I think of them. People you encounter make the difference and they definitely helped to change my mind about Hilton Hotels. I will be back and who knows I may even try another Hilton in another city very soon. Thanks ladies, you made my trip memorable!E Johnson

I travel a lot and have stayed at several NYC hotels, this was by far the best stay. The staff was very friendly and the room was great. My room is super modern and clean. The location is great a few minute walk to Time Square or to the Village.

I've stayed many times, and always a good hotel, with great consistency. Rooms are clean, service is good, location is great. The hotel is good for both a business or personal traveler. The main floor lounge is also a great place to relax for drinks or informal dining or bar food. The lollipop chicken wings are great!

Until recently, I stayed with family in the village when I came to NYC on business. I begrudgingly made a reservation here and prepared to join the ranks of those who truly are just visitors, expecting to be underwhelmed.I had a great stay! I appreciated that the hotel had valet parking at a rate that I thought was reasonable for the city. The property was clean and modern, and staff in the lobby kept a watchful eye on the comings and goings. The elevator requires that you swipe your room key, but I still appreciated the added security (and friendly greetings..unlike some security staff, these guys were very personable). It's a good neighborhood in any case, and convenient to many of the sights in midtown. The room was comfortable and well-insulated from street noise.The on-site restaurant, Rare, was good- I had breakfast there during my stay and also one dinner. The waitstaff are a bit slow, but pleasant. Not a bad choice at all.I will definitely stay at this property again!

No towel racks, minimal counter space in bathroom. Inconvenient toilet paper holder, no hand rails in shower.Otherwise nice room. fair price, good breakfast. Location great for us, near Fashion Institute of Technology.

Clean, modern room, great location, and my first choice in NYC. Excellent service from staff. I've paid twice as much and the customer service wasn't as good. Front desk was more than knowledgeable about local sites.
user_name:
Travis H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I needed some R&R&R (relaxation, restoration and rejuvenation) so I was treated to a mini getaway from my home one borough away. The hotel is a cute chic hotel - the room was very tastefully decorated and reflected a polished high end look which I thoroughly appreciated. The bed and the comforter were the most important to me so I was quite pleased at how quickly I snuggled in to my comfortable relaxation mode. The shower intensity also contributed to achieving one of the above-mentioned "R's" that I was hoping for.Surprisingly the wifi is not free in the room which is standard in many hotels so while it did not impact me personally, I did take notice as it should come standard in the rooms.The hiccup I had was with the billing. Without getting too specific there was a complete error made since there were two individuals booked on same day with the same name resulting in too much time spent after trying to sort things out. The staff though was very apologetic and immediately addressed the concerns raised and corrected the matter so I applaud them for that.
user_name:
Evette E
Long Island City, New York

review_body: Great value! Based on the price alone, my fiancé and I didn’t have particularly high expectations. We were very pleasantly surprised with the entire experience. To begin, the hotel is only a 5 blocks south of Penn Station which makes it very convenient for those coming to the city via train. We didn’t have to deal with the lengthy taxi line at Penn Station, or have to squeeze our way onto the subway. However, it is far enough away that we didn’t feel overwhelmed by the crowds near Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. The hotel is actually in Chelsea and was very conveniently located.When we arrived, we received a warm welcome from Mily, who was incredibly helpful! Check-in was seamless thanks to Mily!The room itself was on the smaller side (though not bad at all for NYC standards), but was comfortable and immaculately clean. Extra points for great shower pressure.I would definitely stay here again!
user_name:
AGH524
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel with our daughters because we were visiting FIT. The location of this hotel could not be better. We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is very nice, clean, and the rooms are very nice as well. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We would definitely go back!

Well, first and foremost I need to give a shout out to the Concierge services, namely Mary. Wonderfully accommodating and informative and super friendly. Each recommendation Mary gave us was absolutely splendid and she really went above and beyond for us, at the very least, she deserves a mention of my wonderful experience and I promise I will be calling to see if she heard!The quality of the room, rooftop bar and restaurant were top notch, and every service in between created a seamless experience.The location was amazing, nearby to great shopping, mind blowing restaurants and my personal favorite, LATE NIGHT DOLLAR PIZZA SLICES!I do have a complaint. The wifi. It's silly, but I've stayed at many, many hotels, most of which were of lower price, lower quality, and lower resources than the Hilton that offer free wifi. It's a small request and I was lucky to be in a situation where I didn't really need wifi at all, but for something that can be given at no real cost to the hotel, it's a silly service to deny people in this day and age. I visited several restaurants, stores and other establishments that were offering free wifi, so I personally think it cheapens the Hilton name to be one of the few that didn't offer it. I stayed at a Holiday inn over the summer that gave free wifi, is Hilton really trying to make or save a buck in saying it's not in the same class as the Holiday inn? Sorry if this was a bit of a rant, but if that simple little thing could have been excluded, it would have been a perfect and wantless experience.
user_name:
Jeff V
Middle Island, New York

review_body: Had to travel back to NY for business for one night. This is a small but good hotel. SUPER friendly desk staff. They were always smiling (and not in a fake way). Small - the entrance/foyer area is small and the rooms are small......it's NEW YORK! Using every square foot. BUT, it's not so small that it's uncomfortable. My room faced the street/front of the hotel. The beds were comfortable and bathroom was clean. The shower was "awkward" in that the door opened INTO the shower (would have been better if it was on sliders). So you jump in to cut the water on and JUMP back out to let it get warm (otherwise you are under cold water). Also, don't get a room in the front: the garbage trucks and traffic honk horns ALL NIGHT. I used earplugs to sleep. The HVAC system location (see pictures). It was COLD in NY the night I stayed and the HVAC system went from HOT to drafty (when it cut off). I realized that there was a draft around the HVAC system location, though the control/sensor was on the opposite wall. So, once the room became "of temp", it took a while for that draft/colder temps to reach the wall. This bothered me and I didn't get a a good night's sleep because of the fluctuating temps because of cold draft vs heat. Luckily, I was only staying one night or I would have asked to switch rooms. This hotel is located right between 7th and Ave of Americas (between 23rd and 28th street subway stops). GREAT location and because it's in the center of it all, it can be a little noisy. Lastly, MAD because I had to PAY for wi-fi (though I am an HHonors member) and it was SUPER/DEATHLY slow. Too bad because this hotel is in a great location, but I can't say I'd rush to go back and stay at it due to the fluctuating temps, slow wi-fi and noise.

Stayed here March 20 - 23, 2015, for an adults (2 of us) only get-away to New York City. The snow just began to fall as we arrived at the hotel, which may have made our stay that much better (as Floridians). I did online check in (for which you need the Hilton app), and so when we got to the front desk we were all set. With online check in I was able to select my room, and 1911 was a great choice! Nice size room, clean and comfortable. Nice view if the top of the Empire State Building. King size bed, desk, tv, mini bar, AC/heat and a window that opened about two inches, nice size bathroom (great hair dryer!). Only issue with the bathroom is that you get wet turning on the shower no matter what. Brr. Hotel is centrally located in the city, a couple blocks from Penn Station and not far from nice bakeries and restaurants. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and I will definitely be returning!

I am really enjoying my stay at the Hilton Fashion District! The whole experience has been great. My room is super modern and clean. Elan at the front desk was incredibly hospitable. I will definetly come back to stay here!

I stayed here for business, then a few days more for fun. Great location, nearby excellent restaurants, landmarks, and shopping! The lobby is clean and contemporary, the staff-warm and inviting! Thank you for the complimentary room upgrade! Super cute room- contemporary, clean, comfy bed, with consistent Hilton amenities. Room service was prompt! Great food! Courteous staff! Business services had exactly what I needed. Highly recommended for both business and / or pleasure!

We had a room adjacent to construction site and crew worked odd late hours, thus very noisy. We requested a change to quieter room and front desk was very helpful. Area is fabulous for access to everything. Would have liked to have gone to rooftop bar but it's seasonal. Would stay here again!

Wonderful place to stay. Clean and great location to food and subway. Staff was professional and accommodating. Me and my travel companion were treated with respect. I will always use this hotel when in New York!

My friend and I stayed at the Hilton Fashion District on a Tuesday night, and the staff was courteous and friendly. The buffet breakfast was quite good as well: scrambled eggs, oatmeal, bacon, smoked salmon, fruit, etc. The room with two beds was a bit tight, but it is NY after all, and the location is good. An easy walk to Penn Station on 33rd and 7th from 26th.

We stayed at the Hilton so our daughter could visit FIT, a block away from FIT. The hotel is not big, but it was nice, clean and modern. The staff was very nice and helpful. The food at the Rare Bar & Grill, which is accessible from the hotel lobby, was good and family friendly. If you want to be in the Fashion District, I recommend this hotel and Rare B&G.

WOW. From the moment I entered the hotel, I was in awe of the great hospitality and hotel cleanliness. The staff could not have been more accommodating and welcoming. The room was just as I saw it online, if not better. Being that I am from out of town and frequently go on business trips to the NYC area, I am familiar with other nearby hotels and after staying at this Hilton I will NEVER book anywhere else but here- mark my words. Highly recommend this property!!!!

Very nice hotel. No thrills but very clean and the staff was very nice and accommodating. Great location to subway stations and easy walk to lots of sites. Room was quite small but you don't spend much time in your room in NYC!

We stayed here for 2 nights and it turned out to be perfect. Everything is accessible from car parking garage to subway stations and restaurants. The room is very nice and clean. It is small but it's normal when your in NYC and we didn't really care for the size of the room though. They have friendly staffs and they were able to checked us in and out fast.. they have a bar and grill if you dont want to go outside to eat,they have a very reasonable price. I would definitely recommend for you guys to stay here and i am sure you will never regret booking at this hotel.

Very clean hotel. Staff was prompt and friendly when making request or asking for assistance. Martha, Mily, and Zoribel were the best!Security seems to be a priority for this Hilton Location, which is very much appreciated. Will book here again.

This hotel (rebranded form a Wyndham Garden Inn) leaves a lot to be desired. The two biggest problems are it's keycard system and it's antiquated tiny elevators. I travel quite a bit and have for over 25 years and I have never experienced as wonky a keycard system as this hotel has. I had to swap out my keycards 4 seperate times in a 24 hour period! It all started when I got on the elevator and had to swipe my card for access to my room. Since it didn't register, the elevator, full because of it's tiny size, zipped right past my floor and stopped at several floors on it's way to the top before descending, in which it stopped at many floors. After the first few floors, it was already full but it kept stopping, despite the fact that nobody could get on. When it finally arrived at my floor on the way down, I exited the elevator (about 10 minutes after I entered...no lie!). This is when the fun began as my keycards did not work on my door. After spending about 5 minutes trying as best as I can to get into my room, but to no avail, I finally located a hall phone to call the front desk. They asked me to return to the lobby to get a new key. As I had my luggage with me and knowing the crowded elevator situation, I declined and insisted that they send someone up to let me in my room. After waiting another 15 minutes, I called the front desk and repeated my request. Finally, someone arrived with new keys. After initially working, those keys also didn't work. At this point, I just pleaded with him to get me in my room so I could drop my luggage and freshen up as I was already 20 minutes late for a meeting. On the way out, I had to deal with the crowded elevators again and had to let two pass by before I could get on one that had room. Before I left the hotel, I got a new set of keycards. However, upon returning to the hotel that night, they still didn't work. Exasperated at this point, I returned to the lobby and firmly asked for another set of keycards. One my second night, I had to get new keycards once more. So, long story short...do not stay here unless you like wasting time and don't mind being inconvenienced.

As far as location goes, you can't really beat it... easy cab ride for most nightlife in the city and a quick walk to awesome shopping. I've stayed here now 3 or 4 times, and the hotel itself I've always found to be very clean and the front dest staff is extremely friendly. The rooms are nice, probably reno'd in the last few years, you can request Empire SB views if available. As with ANY hotel in NYC, request a high floor, it's worth a couple extra $$.The restaurant downstairs, Rare, is good for a casual lunch or a drink before heading out. Valet is expensive but great service, I've found walking distance garages in the area can fill sometimes which is a pain. But for a weekend getaway, I'll spring a few extra for valet.

I really enjoyed this hotel. I felt like it was well located, the staff was very helpful, the price was right, and the amenities were nice. The food in the bar/restaurant was really good. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

Over the top customer support, they went above and beyond to store my luggage and purchases while in NYC, had immediate assistance if needed too, very kind and supportive staff in general, thank you very much!!!!!

I have been to NYC on many occasions, staying everywhere from the upper west side to the business district. Lately, I've been staying in Hell's Kitchen and around the fashion district. I have stayed at other Hiltons, but have been underwhelmed. This was totally different.From the time I stepped into the lobby, the attention I received was excellent. The front desk staff always went out of there way to greet me, offer assistance, and someone was always there to call the elevator. When I asked about the wi-fi code, they politely explained that there was a charge, but that they would comp it to me as a favor.The shower was always hot, the view out my window was into a garment design shop, which was pretty cool to watch. The location was perfect, and not loud at all. I will definitely stay there again!

We stayed here for two nights on a weekend in February. We chose the hotel because it was the closest Hilton to the friends we were visiting but would seek it out in the future for any activity in NYC. When we checked in, we were told that we were receiving a complementary upgrade because of our gold Hilton Honors status. When we got to our room on the 20th floor, we could not figure out how it was upgraded. The view was not great and the room seemed like the tiny rooms so typical of NYC. The room was well appointed with a comfortable king-size bed and nice (small) bath with a nice tile and glass shower. However, it appeared that it was actually smaller than the rooms on the front side of the hotel (based on the map on the back of the door). In the middle of the night, we realized that the upgrade may have been that we were put on the quiet side of the hotel. My memory of every hotel in which I have ever stayed in NYC is hearing car horns all night long. In this hotel, it was quiet. This results from the placement of the hotel, on 26th street behind a larger building on 7th Avenue that shields the hotel from noise from 7th. By being on the back, we also avoided the noise from the front of the hotel. We both agreed that we would ask for one of these rooms again. I suggest that other visitors do the same (unless you find car horns romantic).
