I was nervous walking into the hotel seeing how busy it was I could feel myself getting a headache already. Katherine Ortega greeted me promptly and got me checked in. My room wasn't ready yet but she was able to take my bags and give me a time it would be ready. I came back a little bit early and she let me know my room was ready and I was able to go upstairs. There needs to be more people like Katherine. She made it such a smooth and enjoyable process, all while keeping a smile on her face. The room was beautiful and I'm glad I choose to spend my birthday weekend at the Hilton.

Lovely hotel. Perfect in every way. Clean, tidy. Great location if your looking to be shopping and seeing the sites. The staff make this hotel. So friendly and welcoming. Especially the girl at the front desk who checked us in (mily). She set a great first impression and greeted us with a lovely smile. And all the other lobby staff. So helpful. Thank you. I will be staying here again on my return in the near future.

Many years ago, before boutique hotels became the rage and travel reviews were a dime a dozen, staying at a Hilton would have meant class, service and quality. After my recent stay at the Hilton Fashion District, I would declare that era well over for the Hilton. This particular one has rooms that are starting to show their age and wear, despite probably being new now that long ago; the Hilton isn't about appearances anymore. But worse yet is the service, particularly cleaning services:- Dirty towels left on the floor were hung up for me to re-use- Bed barely made- No clean glasses in the room replaced the next day- Calls to the front desk that promised quick fixes and delivered nothing- Indifferent front desk staffAs a longtime Hilton honors member, I'm walking away from this chain. Their lack of interest in service leaves them in the dustAnd who charges $14.95 USD for wifi anymore?Stay at the Archer Hotel on 38th - it's amazing, cool, great service, gorgeous rooms and free wifi (is that not the norm in 2015?). It's competitively priced and offers better deals than the HiltonWant to spend a bit more? Check out the chic Refinery hotelPass on this hotel - so much better to choose from in NYC

I often stay at the Hilton Fashion when in NYC. Always a nice room, friendly staff and reasonably priced. Location is exactly where I need to be for business, but easy access to entertainment, and restaurants.
user_name:
Lee A C
Valencia, United States

review_body: Fantastic location close to all the hot spots in Manhattan. The hotel and its staff were all extremely helpful and it made for a great stay. I would recommend this hotel and definitely return in the future

Everything went fantastically well. I was very pleased with the room, always clean and tidy, well furnished with almost everything you can think of. Breakfast was ok with many good things to taste.I must mention how friendly and helpful the staff were especially the Front Office Manager Katherine Ortega. She makes people feel at home.

King sized bed on 18th floor with the Empire State Building framed in my window ... I'm happy. Great location, as well. Just blocks from Penn Station and shopping (Macy's) in one direction and great food at Eataly in another direction. All that on a quite Chelsea street.

I just checked out of the Hilton New York Fashion District. I must say that this was a very prime location. It was only a 15 minute walk from the Meatpacking District, which had a lot of nightlife and great food. It was also walking distance to the Empire State Building. Penn Station is even closer for those who travel via Amtrak. This hotel is very modern hotel, which was to my taste. I must say I really enjoyed my time here. I had a few issues with my reservations, but the front desk did their best. Elan, was the staff that stood out the most to me. He stopped and chatted with me about my stay, and even told me to reach out to him for my next stay! Also, this hotel has a rooftop bar, which during the summer will be awesome! I can imagine coming back here with a few friends and having a few drinks, relaxing in the sun.

I go to NYC every other month on average and I always try to stay at the Hilton New York Fashion District. It's in a quiet area, convienient to everywhere and has a great rooftop bar. There are places to eat nearby or in the hotel. My favorite wine store is across the street. Why stay anywhere else?

There are many things that easily recommend this hotel, and it has become my go-to choice when visiting NYC, whether on business or for pleasure It's great midtown location on 26th between 6th and 7th Ave, provides for easy access uptown and downtown by foot, subway, bus or taxi. After discovering it about two years or so ago, I've stayed there over 40 times, often twice a month.While it offers the amenities that you would expect from the Hilton brand, its boutique-feel, outstanding staff (who are always friendly and welcoming) and excellent in-house restaurant - Rare (burgers, grilled items, salads and apps), has made it my home-away-from-home. Be sure to check out the rooftop bar if you're looking for a change of scene and don't feel like venturing too far from the hotel. Also, if you're a HHonors Gold/Diamond member, the Rare restaurant serves one of the better complementary breakfasts I've had at a Hilton or otherwise, whether in NYC or other cities I've travelled, with several menu options and a full breakfast buffet. Excellent service there as well.Looking forward to my next visit to NYC and staying at the Hilton New York Fashion District!

A great hotel for business trips. The room was well appointed but without the bells and whistles you would expect from a boutique hotel. It was a reasonable size for NYC standard but definitely cosy. Very clean and the housekeeping standard was excellent. The onsite bar/restaurant is worth a visit. Located in walking distance for Chelsea, Union Sq etc. All-in all very good

This is a good choice among the reasonably priced New York City hotels.The location is very good - easy walking distance to at least two Metro stations and to Penn Station, several coffee shops in the surrounding area and quite a nice rooftop bar.The room was small, but still adequate for two persons, the bathroom a bit too small and too basic, I think. The shower water pressure was good, though.We upgraded to an Empire State View room - which is not recommended. The view towards the Empire State Building was quite nice - but it came with a lot of street noise, which was not as nice. I'd recommend a quiet room towards the back.The elevators are very small and the corridors are really small. In the mornings the cleaning crew made quite a lot of noise outside, which made it difficult to sleep late...However, I wouldn't mind staying here again (if the price is right).

Modern hotel with a decent bar inside. The rooms were very typically New York, incredibly small with a boutique feel. However, the walls were paper thin - we could hear our neighbors TV and the elevator ping every time it came to our floor. The fridge in the room was packed with items to purchase, so don't bank on keeping perishable food in your room. The bed was fantastically comfortable!

Excellent and truly helpful staff. From checking us in early to helping us navigate the metro, to taking & retrieving my car - I was more than pleasantly surprised. The room was small, but we are in a city. Amenities were wonderful, hairdryer in room. Bellmen were great. Everyone very friendly and polite. I would stay here again in NYC.
user_name:
Kelly S
South Deerfield, United States

review_body: Had a great time staying here and the location was perfect. A few blocks east and you're at the highline, which is by far my favorite place to visit. A few blocks south and you're surrounded by great restaurants. The hotel itself was spotless and the service was impeccable. Will definitely stay here again.

They had a great location and the room was clean and quiet. Everything went very smoothly. I have nothing negative to say! The room was a good size for New York and the staff is very friendly. Close to lots of places for breakfast.

Due to recent flight cancellations because of the weather, this visit was unplanned. However, beginning with arrival to departure, I can't say enough how much I enjoyed the visit. Everyone at the hotel, no matter their role, was extremely helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

I really enjoyed my stay here. The hotel is small enough to have a boutique feel to it, and there are nice fashion-related decorative details throughout (like button-themed door number signs). The room is cozy and well-designed. I especially loved my view of the Empire State Building out the window. It made for a great home base for enjoying New York for a few days. I would definitely return.

Stay here mostly for business. Recall it being a little noisy from the street outside. There must be some sort of nightclub on the top floors because there's usually a line formed by the elevator in the lobby at night. The restaurant/bar will do in a pinch for a burger but it's nothing special.

great location if you are working in the garment district. Easy to walk around to great shopping and restaurants. Fair size rooms, clean and comfortable. Had a few issues with my room location but Christine M. Drumgoole at the front desk went above and beyond to make sure i was happy. I think she worked 24 hours a day for the 6 days i was there.

This is my favorite NYC hotel. The hotel itself if clean and neat. The hotel is close to Penn station - an easy walk! The staff is friendly and nice. I have stayed here a number of times - in the winter and summer and I am looking forward to my next stay already!

Stayed here for 4 nights. Upgraded to king, high floor, empire state view. Rare bar and grill serves good - reasonably priced food. Staff excellent - hotel reception staff a g8 bunch whoever you dealt with. Roof top bar ok. Previous reviews have mentioned noise issues - we stayed in 2008 - right outside elevators. We had no issues at all with any noise. (I'm a light sleeper! but slept well). Lots of nice places nearby to eat. Close to subway stations. I would stay at this hotel again.

I couldn't have asked for better service or a better stay. I enjoyed all of the amenities and the great location. I would definitely recommed to a friend because i had a wonderful time and i have absolutely no complaints about anything. Every employee was eve smiling the entire time i was there!

Quality and service, exactly what you would expect when in NYC. There were no disappointments here, the rooms, food and staff were all on top form. This Hilton is now my spot when in the big apple. Recommended to all!

We have recently returned from our stay at the New York Fashion District Hilton and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Check in upon arrival was quick with complimentary water, which after a long journey was a little gesture that was much appreciated. The lobby was very stylish and the staff were always ready to assist. I'd read reviews that commented on how small the rooms were and how loud the hotel was in general but I didn't find this to be the case at all. Our room was a good size with a large bed and plenty of storage and the bathroom was fantastic. A very large double shower, a great sized vanity with great lighting and some really nice toiletries. The flush on the toilet was probably one of the loudest i've ever encountered, it made me jump every time, but even having said that you could only very occasionally hear it from other rooms. The noise from other floors in general was minimal, as was the noise from the street - other than what is expected from a busy Manhattan street. The hotel offers complimentary wifi in both the rooms and the lobby, which for us was essential having no other internet access. The neighbourhood itself was great, with lots of really nice places to eat and close to two great subway stations. I'd really recommend this hotel if you're looking for a base in New York!

I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member and have stayed in this hotel at numerous occasions. I originally chose the hotel for its location on walking distance from the art galleries in Chelsea and I come back for the same reason.A part from the location it is difficult to find other reasons for choosing to stay here when there are so many other/better options in New York.Sure, the staff is nice, I appreciate the smaller boutique feeling of the hotel and like the bar at lobby level but that is about it. The rooms come small, even by New York standards, and boosts nothing but the minimum expected although the beds are very comfortable. I can not imagine staying in the room I got this week if I was not travelling alone. The small size of the bathroom works when travelling alone but not otherwise. There is no space at all to unpack your toiletries and the shower is tiny.I also noticed that they hotel has reduced the benefits for loyal Hilton guests such as myself. I used to get a much-appreciated voucher for the breakfast buffet. Instead, this time, I was given a voucher for "breakfast" consisting of "Muffins, danish, croissant, cereal" and drinks (juice and coffee). Clearly not a part of a healthy diet (fat and sugar only and ZERO protein or nutrition from veg/fruit)! Having to pay for the buffet breakfast means I will instead choose to go outside of the hotel for breakfast. It will also weigh negatively on the hotel when choosing where to stay next time I come to New York.

We want to send a sincere "thank you" to you and your staff for going out of their way to make our stay both enjoyable and special. The staff did a remarkable job of keeping our valentine's day surprise package a secret and special for both of us! The staff surprisingly orchestrated a dozen roses, chocolates, and a handwritten note in our room. The staff did a great job of keeping it a surprise from me and reassured my husband that everything was taken care of. My husband and I find it remarkable that the hotel staff went out of their way to do this. Your staff is amazing and especially the following ladies made everything possible: Zoribel, Martha, Kathy, Mily, and Melissa...they helped make our first trip to New York one to remember! The hotel rooms and bathrooms were extremely clean while the beds were comfortable. The hotel is in a perfect location to walk anywhere for good food, drinks, shopping, take the train, or catch a cab for a few minutes. Thank you for a great experience and we can't wait for our next visit!
user_name:
T T
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: If you need a great deal in Chelsea, nice, helpful staff, comfy, clean room, book here. Don't expect a huge room, it's NYC, but it was clean and offered a mini bar plus complimentary coffee/Keurig. Definitely try Tre Dici-- a restaurant on the same street. Great coffee at 7 Grams.

I had not stayed at a Hilton hotel in NYC since my schooldays at the Midtown Hilton in 1966 and 1967. I chose the Fashion District Hilton as being smaller and and in an area I had not much familiarity with. I thought the hotel and its staff charming and most attractive. I liked the décor; simple and chic. Also Moises, the doorman helped me by volunteering to go out in dreadful weather! I thought the restaurant and bar really pretty and done in appealing colors and shapes. I liked the food very much, simple and honest as tastey. The staff were uniformly 'up' and pleasant and helpful. I liked the concierges, they were uniformly competent and nice. I am 72 years of age and have travelled a lot in US and in Europe so I have comparisons and I thought the hotel and room and environment etc were all swell. Keep up the good work. The room by the way, despite the terrible weather was always totally comfortable, and the heat system was perfect in my view
user_name:
Dana H
Grass Valley CA, United States

review_body: while everyone has their own review some can say things are better then others say. One of my MAIN things is how clean the rooms and bathroom are that is a deal breaker for me I can stay in a small room, but it must be clean and this hotel is extremely clean and I am xxxx picky

Had a great trip with my friends for a weekend birthday. Received complimentary wine and fruit. Rooms were wonderful (super comfy beds) and staff very helpful and attentive. Enjoyed our stay and would recommend to all who come and visit.

I open by understanding it's new York and the standards are so much lower and prices inflated..This is why it's a 3, taking that away it's a disastrous 1.Is like to start by saying the customer service I received by Marion was absolutely great and she did her best, however she could not redeem the short falls..When I walked into the room I was shocked, it said 30m2 online however we had 6 inches either side of bed and that's it.I asked at reception if that was biggest room to be told yes although some are shaped better to appear bigger.Next it's the noise, shocking, road bad however nothing like within the hotel, walls paper thin, you can hear your your neighbor what ever they choose to do, Inc pass wind, use toilet, use shower, make use of the bed etc.!!Then it's the lifts, you can hear the arrival ding from 4 floors away.I had ear plugs as a light sleeper and was still awake from 6 every day.No gowns in room, no slippers, no pens and no shower gel I would like to add.Breakfast, wow, not the norm.Given a menu at entry, dare to order from menu and all other buffet options taken away..Want fried eggs, that's it, not allowed anything else.Choose buffet option, unlimited, although unlimited not a lot nous..No muesli available.Just poor buffet with most missing.I really do understand I'm in new York however I do not accept what I received for the price when the Hilton Conrad is priced similarly but 100 times better apart from location, however the tube ride away each day is the far better option.I always ask myself at the end of every review, would I stay here again and the answer is a resounding NO. Not even if I was given it free.I'd rather pay and stay at the Conrad, effectively this hotel ruined my holiday, constantly tired due to noise, aggrieved at being over priced, hungry all day due to poor breakfast.No gown, no slippers etc etc etc etc. Well situated though, no over redeeming features I can think of.In new York and looking forward to going home, shame to say it

You can't beat New York city for a quick 3 day trip. This Hilton is in a great Chelsea location. It is within walking distance to many restaurants and touristy locations. The restaurant in the hotel is pretty cool.

This solid hotel property is located near 26th Street and 8th Avenue, perfect to hop on the A, C or E trains to Times Square or elsewhere. Early check in is a treat as is bag check should you check out early but have a late flight/train. Like most NYC hotels, many rooms have a view of the next building ten feet away, so don't be surprised. Rooms have showers, not baths, though the shower is large and the complimentary toiletries are high quality. Beds are super comfortable, cuddly and piled high with pillows. In-room Keurig coffee service is convenient. The mini refrigerator is a mini bar and is full, so it cannot be used for other purposes. The room key card must be swiped to press your elevator floor - so keep it handy - an added security feature so folks can only go to their own floor. There is an adjoining restaurant, but there are so many options right out the door.Nearby QQ Nails & Spa is professional and reasonable if you want a short-notice quality mani/pedi. There are loads of nearby restaurants as typical in Manhattan, but heading to Chelsea Market is a treat, especially when the weather isn't nice, as it is like a mini-mall but excellent artwork, shoppes, restaurants, wine stores and more! My favorite new find is Chalk Point restaurant, not right in Chelsea but walkable.

I am currently staying at the hotel. You couldn't have asked for an easier check-in process. I was able to check in online before our arrival, so when we arrived our room was ready (even though it was noon) and all I had to do was collect the key. We came for the NBA All Star weekend - so a room with a view was not important. It was wiell with walking distance of Madison Square Garden, and there are sufficent restaurants and a whole foods nearby. There's a Subway across the street, a Dunkin Donuts and Brgr and Chipotle around the corner. Our room is clean, and whilst not huge, is plenty big enough for 2 of us (we had 2 double beds). Our bathroom was a shower only room. The housekeepers can come at a specific time if you request it,. And I have to compliment the Front desk staff - I had 2 fed ex packages delivered and the were promptly delivered to my room. It's been a great stay.

I was meeting friends in the city for a last minute trip and was able to book a great package with Hilton. The only negative comment to add is the extra money spent for a high level room got us a view of the next brick building.

Booked this room based on proximity to the garments district seeing as I was in town to buy fabric and trim. Based off location this hotel is great and close to everything you need fashion-wise. My boyfriend was told by staff that parking on the street was fine as long as the meter is paid for so we paid for 2 hours, but we ended up with a ticket after waiting to check in and coming back out to get our luggage. Turns out it is commercial parking only according to the meter maid we spoke to that explained the confusing street sign. We ended up parking at the garage down the street. Now, we did come 15 minutes before check in and were told we had to wait until check in actually started to get a room. So we came back 20 minutes later and there was no one waiting to check in but we had to stand for a good 10 minutes to finally try to check in. They took my credit card and ID with no problem only to tell me that my room was not ready. We waited almost 2 hours after that to finally get our room keys. We showed up to the room which ended up being a double, one bed was useless because it was squeaky and the window faced what looked like a designer or artist's studio and some fire escapes. Check out took a while too, there were lots of people checking out so that was more understandable but most places I have expedited check out where you just mention what room you stayed in and leave, here it took longer. The room itself was quiet and like I said the location is convenient if you are visiting FIT or Parsons or shopping in the garment district but I do not think I would rebook here because of the inconvenience of waiting so long to check in and out. Other hotels in this area are quicker and more efficient than whatever was going on the day that I stayed.

The facilities are very good. Very good rooms, clean and quiet and the restaurant service at dinner very good quality and excellent service. The hotel staff was very helpful and attentive, very recommended. The location is very good in the fashion district easily to get to the subway. No doubt I'll be back to stay at this Hotel
user_name:
Jose P
Puerto Rico, United States

review_body: Friendly and efficient staff. We enjoyed three nights b &b for a reasonable nyc rate. The room was fresh and clean with a great view of the Empire State building from our 20th floor room. The breakfast spread was well presented and delicious.

We love staying here when we come for work at Javitz center. There is a Whole Foods across the street and some great dining in the neighborhood. The rooms are clean and the one we stayed in was very quiet (although I imagine the ones not facing the building next door are not quiet). The hotel itself is great...there are a few members of the staff that were very unhelpful during our week-long stay. We had a rush package delivered and they could not located it and send it to our room until 2 days after it arrived. The lobby staff didn't have great knowledge of the neighborhood and could not recommend good places to eat....sad in NYC where there are so many good options. Here is my list: Brooklyn Bagel, John Dory, Breslin, Hill Co. BBQ, Co., Whole Foods, any Korean BBQ. They also gave us mis-information on a car they scheduled to take us to the airport saying tip was included when it was not. They most likely also took a cut of the fare too as I compared prices after the fact with other car services from the city to JFK

Clean nice hotel great location great staff hotel renovated hip and comfortable. Comfey beds great door people would definitely stay again. Convenient to everything. We are in our forties and just went with another couple we all had a great stay. No comp about anything we had a awesome time at this place in our favorite city in the world

got a good price on the hotel tonite app, but regardless, it would have been a lovely hotel to stay at full price (nyc full price, that is!) we had one double bed- good size room with good amenities and a WONDERFUL view of the world trade center. would also be a great summer hotel as i hear they have a rooftop bar,

Our stay at the Hilton NY Fashion District was superb from start to finish. We were warmly greeted, treated to an upgrade which had a view of the Empire State Building, and loved the room we were given. Dining at RARE, the hotel's restaurant, was amazing every time, and we chose to eat in-house every meal of the visit: It was that good! Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. My friend requires a wheelchair, and they assisted in getting us cabs and helping us into them, which is no easy feat. Thank you, all. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, and if we're ever back in the city, this is where we'll stay!

I have returned to this hotel because the facilities are lovely and the staff could not be more agreeable. It''s a perfect location for Art Fairs in the Meat Packing District. The rooms are small but comfortable although it was impossible not to get soaked when turning on the shower in my room.Rare Restaurant has very good food if you stick to lighter fare like burgers, vegetarian sandwiches, or salads. The roof top bar offers a stunning view of the city and the staff there are welcoming and very friendly.

I stayed here as part of a business trip. The room was small, as are most rooms in NY hotels at this price, and clean and had an awesome view of the Empire State building. I had jet lag so woke up to see dawn across the city skyline - absolutely sensational.Customer service was excellent, our coffee machine wasn't working when we arrived but was promptly replaced. While waiting to go the airport to fly back to the UK I sat downstairs in the bar and had a drink and some food. The staff were polite and the food was good and reasonably priced.My only gripe is the wifi access. Why only offer free wifi in the communal areas? This just seems outdated, and slightly irritating, to me.

This is the second time I have stayed at this Hilton property. Both times was for business and the location was the primary reason I selected it. While this hotel staff is amazing, the rooms are teeny tiny. You really cannot move in any direction without running into a wall, a window or a piece of furniture. Bathroom is equally small with not much room to place things.The noise from the hallway and/or the guests partying in a nearby room kept me up a good part of the night. Great location and restaurants nearby. Breakfast buffet is nice and if you order off the menu the wait is very long. Coffee is 'meh' which is a big issue for this coffee lover!

Excellent place to stay. Room small, but that's true of just about any New York City hotel. Cheery greeting from front desk staff. Check-in easy and fast. From our 20th-floor room, we had a clear full-on view of the Empire State Building and fell asleep watching the colors change in the very cool light show. Ten-minute walk from Penn Station. Twenty minutes across 26th Street to Park Avenue. Two blocks from the 28th Street stop on the #1 subway line, which takes you uptown or downtown, with connections to anywhere you want to go -- Central Park, Chelsea or Soho, the Village, the East Side, Brooklyn.... Nice amenities in the bathroom. Big TV screen, if you care about that. Comfortable bed, big snuggling duvet, lots of pillows. Definitely will stay there again.

My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights during a northeast college tour. It was a good location for us, as we wanted to be between Penn Station and Chelsea, and we're familiar enough with the subway system so that we could get around easily to other parts of Manhattan. This hotel is trendy, and everything was clean and fresh. I also appreciated that anyone wanting to use the elvator had to swipe their room card to get to their floor. There was always plenty of hotel personnel in the lobby ready to help or answer questions. Although we had reserved a single queen room, the friendly lady at the check-in desk upgraded us to 2 double beds, which was great. The room and bathroom were a decent size for NYC. The best part was the comfy beds and the quiet. Our room was on the backside of the hotel, so our view was of a building separated by an alley, but that made the room nice and quiet for a good night's sleep, which we needed, since we had days jam-packed with college visits. There are plenty of restaurants within immediate walking distance. Would definitely stay here again.

We booked this room for a birthday treat for my mother who had never been to the states. The hotel is close to penn station and a small walk to it. The room was large with great amenities, a large bathroom with great products in it! The restaurant and bars are also great too. It what made the difference was staffs great friendly attitudes the waiters to the front office director.i would throughly recommend this hotel and am looking forward to using this hotel again in the summer months hopefully.

A short walk up 7th Avenue to this hotel. Kind of pricey given the small size of our room. Lighting was also low in the room. No bathtub, which always is a disappointment to me at a hotel. Bathroom small and cramped. Hotel restaurant coffee could be better. Ok, the good stuff besides convenience to rail. Very nice staff. Front desk and restaurant staff exceptionally friendly. Elevators very fast.

The strongest point of this Hilton hotel is its location. And although the staff at the reception desk is both friendly and helpfull, the hotel does not meet the standard that I expected from "the Hilton". The room -whitout a view- was very small and noicy.

very nice, clean hotel. very friendly and helpful staff great location and food in restaraunt is terrific. Front desk staff and very helpful and informative. They were willing to meet all of your needs.

Loved how close to the Path train this hotel was. Absolutely perfect location for me. Clean rooms. Great heating. Nice bathrooms. Also close to good restaurants. I am planning to stay here for all my business trips to NYC.

My husband and I stayed here for my birthday, and overall, we were very happy. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean and spacious, and it had a great view of the Empire State building. Our room was right in front of the elevators, so it was noisy. We could hear every word of every conversation of other guests as they were coming and going. It was enough to wake us up in the middle of the night a couple of times. And I'm sure they could hear us too. The street noise was also surprisingly loud. In the middle of Manhattan, I expect to hear some noise, but it sounded like there was a piece of paper between us and the street. I would stay here again, especially for the price, but I would be sure to ask for a room away from the elevators. Oh, we also went to the roof bar, Rare View, and the drinks were good but the service was awful, and it wasn't even busy. Our server spent the night standing against a wall 12 feet away, playing on her phone. When we were able to get her attention to order new drinks, she wasn't at all friendly. The DJ was good though!
user_name:
Sarah Z
Belmont, MA, United States

review_body: But it is not good that they have no complimentary breakfast service unlike other Hilton hotels. Other than that, the location was good and also hotel itself was really quiet and great. The size of room was big enough too.
user_name:
Hyeonji L
New york, United States

review_body: I stayed here in summer 2014 and again in January 2015. It's a nice property walking distance from Penn Station NY. It is quite new and although the hotel does not have full Hilton facilities (e.g. no club lounge) it is good for a short stay in NYC and often the rates are affordable (though like all NY properties, rates change weekly or even daily based on demand and events).

I use to enjoy this property. Still a great location but their treatment of diamonds has really gone downhill.I stay at Hilton's over 100 nights a year normally and have been diamond for at least five years. Was there with other friends who got their own room and are gold through a credit card and only stay at Hilton's a few times a year.I asked for a 4 p.m. checkout and was told they could only give me until 2. My friend who has status only through a credit card was given 2. I mentioned it to the front desk and they acted like Gold and Diamond were the same thing.I realize part of this is Hilton corporates fault and they should require properties to give diamond's a 2 p.m. check out, but this property should give diamond's a later checkout than they do Gold's who have status via a credit card. I was told I'd have to pay for an extra half day for a 4 p.m. checkout.The only difference in the treatment between gold's and diamond's at this property is an additional 25% bonus points which aren't worth much with Hilton's recent deval.If you are gold or no status with Hilton, this is a good choice. If you are diamond with Hilton don't expect any special treatment.I receive a 4 p.m. checkout at Hyatt's being a diamond there and a 4 p.m. checkout at SPG's with no status at all by being a Delta diamond. And this property wasn't even that busy this weekend.

Very conveniently located within walking distance of Penn Station, Flatiron and most of Midtown. Rooms are on the small side, but that's to be expected in NYC. Front desk and rest of staff are very helpful.

I just spent one week at this hotel and really enjoyed my stay. The location was perfect, close to several subway lines and easy to go uptown or downtown. I worked from the room while my partner was in a class during the day. I usually get frustrated with internet speed in hotels but found this property to have great internet. The rooms are typical size for NYC. I liked the bathrooms, especially the shower. The staff was very friendly. I'm a little surprised that this property is a Hilton as it seemed a little more like a Hilton Garden Inn. But regardless of the brand, it was a great stay at a great price. If you are Hilton HHonors member, you can also check in online one day in advance and pick your room. I really liked that feature as we were able to pick a corner room with only one shared wall. I would easily recommend it to others.

Small full-service Hilton Hotel conveniently located in the heart of NYC Chelsea neighborhood. Full amenities without the hoopla of a big midtown hotel. Very easy access to the #1 NYC subway line. Easy walking distance to many of NYC's top attractions. Rooms are small, but amply furnished. Bathroom is big in comparison to the size of the bedroom.
user_name:
Donald B
Fort Lauderdale, United States

review_body: Stayed for at the hotel for 7 nights on a business stay and overall it was a comfortable experience. Many of my colleagues and I stayed here as it was only a few blocks away from where we were working on Avenue of the Americas. The hotel lobby and rooms were modern and had a nice modern art deco....chic. My room was one away from the top floor and the view was ok. I must admit this is one of the smaller rooms I have stayed in over my overall travel experience however apparently this is quite normal in NYC. The room, bed and bathroom were very clean and the coffee machine helped every morning. The staff at the hotel are very efficient and friendly to help you get settled in or show you where to go. Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby however be prepared to walk a reasonable distance should you want to get to areas such as the Empire State Building, Shopping District, Rockefeller Centre just to name a few. But from the hotel these places are only usually a $7-$10 cab ride away. And also an added bonus......the internet was free :)

I stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for four nights with my daughter during a VERY cold week in January. The hotel is well located for shopping and shows if you don't mind a fifteen minute or more walk - I welcome them! If not, taxis were always available and of course Uber was never a problem. Comfortable beds, spotless rooms, courteous staff and a roof top bar that had a fantastic view of the Empire State Bldg. The Whole Foods around the corner was a godsend - filling up on fresh fruit for an in room breakfast. I'd certainly return.

Stayed for two weeks over Christmas and new Year. Check in was quick and very welcoming. Our room was a little small and the view was not really what we had expected being on a high floor. The next morning we spoke to reception to ask if we could change rooms with a better view and a different layout. They gladly did this for us by lunchtime the same day. Our new room had an amazing view of the Empire State Building and gave us a little more room too. Our room was cleaned daily to a high standard with plenty of coffee and amenities. Everyone we came across within the hotel were always very friendly and always asked if we were having a good stay. The hotel was central for all our needs with easy walking to shops, bars and restaurants. Getting a cab was easy outside the hotel. We used the hotel bar just off the lobby which had again, excellent friendly staff and a good ambiance. Rare, the roof top bar has excellent views of the city , good beer deals on football days, good music and again good staff. Yes on our return to new York we will defiantly say here again. Felt completely at home..Thanks to all staff for making our stay a great one!

Stayed in this hotel late December just before Christmas. The hotel is really modern and clean, although our bedroom could've been a bit bigger, we paid extra for a queen room, but found there wasn't much space. Check in/out was fast and efficient, and the staff were lovely and helpful.The bellman was always willing to go outside and flag a cab for us, and was helpful when we checked out in storing our bags, arranging a car to the airport etc.The concierge was also lovely and had some great recommendations for dinner. Make sure you visit the rooftop bar, the views of the empire state are fabulous!!
user_name:
Lucy M
Milton Keynes, United Kingdom

review_body: The staff at this hotel are excellent at making me feel welcome. They ask about my family and truly care. The property is very nice and the rooms are smartly furnished. Conveniently located near Penn Station, Chelsea, and the Flatiron.
user_name:
William B
Louisville, KY, United States

review_body: My girlfriend had surprised me for my birthday for a day and night out in NYC with the help of her father and being a diamond club member. They had called ahead and requested a bottle of wine and a cupcake to be there once we had arrived. Once we entered the hotel they said hello any welcome and proceeded to say happy birthday to myself, not thinking anything of it being that I was parking the car while she checked us in. As we entered the room w the great view of the Empire State Building, there was a ballon a bottle of Riesling (our choice of wine), a ballon, and a personal little cake not cupcake-which was delicious, and two breakfast buffet tix for the next morning. As we later found out they had no cupcake or Riesling, and went out of there way to go and purchase the cake and bottle to make is as special of a day as possible. No hotel has ever done that for me, us, or even close to it for anyone I know. To go out the way like they had, I could probably say the same for everyone that is reading this. Stay here.Period. No ifs ands or buts. Great service, clean and nice romantic rooms w NYC views, restaurant below, close to the Times Square, bars down either end of the streets. Nice rooftop bar that in the summer is open w a gorgeous view of the ESB. Couldn't thank them enough upon leaving the next morning but couldn't of had a better hotel experience or great things to say about this hotel durning my stay.

We have stayed at this hotel 4-5 times a year for the past 4 years and are also pleased. It has become our "home" in NYC. As Diamond Hilton members we are always upgraded to an upper floor, receive free internet and free breakfasts. All of the employees at the front desk, bellman, valet, restaurant etc. are top notch and always so accommodating. Its also in a perfect location to F.I.T, Argo Tea, Shopping, Empire State Bldg, etc.

As Hiltons go, this one looks fantastic. Very modern and hip, with dark woods and shiny metals. There's no way you can mistake it for a Garden Inn or a Hampton Inn: this hotel attempts a boutique look, and in large part succeeds. While small, the room had everything we needed -- including four (4!) K-cups for coffee in the morning -- was very modern (though not overly trendy), and seemed spotlessly clean. Very impressive!However, overall, I'd say it was "average" for a main-brand Hilton. Here's why: the front-desk and lobby service was gruff if not downright unpleasant from the get-go (not at all what I expected); the gym equipment (bike) was not functioning properly (screen didn't work); we could easily hear everything happening next door; our room's window screen wouldn't go all the way down -- allowing a bright glow into the room all night. Chock it up to being in NY, I guess....(**Really** wanted this to be a "4," but after writing, couldn't justify more than a "3".... hopefully I can give it another try....)

Excellent amenities, spacious room, generous wifi access, good gym equipment, clean environment, great parking, wonderful location, friendly staff and great restaurant. They even have access to washing machines, a fridge in the room and so on- but if you want a cosy, comfortable sleep, walk with your own blanket. Sleeping between cotton sheets in winter is not pleasant. We really missed our comfy bed and wondered for the four nights we stayed there, why they were so stingy with blankets and bedspreads.Compared to the numerous hotels I have stayed at this hotel was unusually poor with respect to sleep quality.

this hotel located near station, about 8minutes by walk from Hotel, room is not big , but facilities is good, have free wifi in room only need you log in on the first floor; bed is comfortable; Especially i want to metion their Housekeeping Manager who named Michael R.Schiller, i lost my credit card in the hotel, after 2days later i phoned the hotel, he helped to check and send to me from New York to Washington just the time i left the hotel; i am very grateful to him and thanks for this best servise;

Currently staying at this Hilton, which is probably the most mediocre Hilton I've ever stayed in. That being said, the last Hilton I stayed in before this one was the Beverly Hilton in LA, which is awesome. But, still, this hotel isn't a 'Hilton Garden Inn' or a Hampton Inn or something - it carries the same Hilton brand as the Beverly Hilton. The only problem there is that it feels like the beds of the two places were made in two different universes. And, yes, I know this one is in Manhattan. I used to live in New York. I'm well aware of how small apartments and hotels are in New York. My king size bed room was amazingly small even for New York standards, and definitely by Hilton standards. Just a very mediocre experience overall and certainly not worthy of the Hilton brand. That said, is it conveniently located to do lots of stuff in Manhattan and are there plenty of restaurants and grocery stores, etc. nearby? Sure. Was the staff friendly enough? Sure. It's...fine. It's just OK. Oh, and the fitness room is incredibly small (a recurring theme here). When the heaviest weight is 25lbs, you don't really have a gym. You have a closet with an elliptical machine. Boo.
user_name:
Socrateslunchbox
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We've stayed here a few times in the past and have always been pleased we picked it - this time it was for six nights over Christmas. The hotel always met expectations. The front desk did a quick checkin and housekeeping always had the room cleaned up by 10 with a fresh supply of towels and shampoos. We had our late night munchies cured by room service twice - the service was quick and the food was well prepared and piping hot. The lower-midtown location puts you close to Macy's and an array of mid level eateries. Not fancy but a super clean and secure place to bed down for your visit. One caution - the rooms only have showers so if your wife wants a bubble bath after a day of shopping and sightseeing, she'll be out of luck here. Also, no vending machines on property so you'll need to step across the street to Subway if you want a Coke. We will be back.

I enjoyed my 3 night stay at this hotel. Its not fancy but was super clean had all of the basics. We had a double room shared by 3 people and it felt dark and cramped. We ended up putting luggage on top the desk under the TV because there wasn't enough room on the floor. Our room was on the 10th floor at the end of the hall and while we had no view, it was really quiet. The rooftop bar was pretty cool, the views are great. We took advantage of the proximity to the subway, but the general vicinity of the hotel didn't have much to offer. I also stayed 3 nights at the Hilton Garden Inn - Midtown East and enjoyed that stay a lot more. They had complimentary water and coffee in the lobby, 2 queen beds, and larger rooms with a fridge and microwave. Things I appreciate when vacationing with family. Overall, Hilton Fashion District is a nice hotel, but it didn't have anything that would make me return.

Excellent hotel, with outstanding service from all the staff !! Wonderful breakfast options !This hotel a good brisk walk from Times Square, plus it is only a couple of blocks from the subway to locations that can take you anywhere in the city.

Great location. You can get anywhere in New York from here. It is very close to Penn Station. Easy to get a cab. But best of all , close to subways, which are so easy to use in New York. Food is significantly above average for a hotel. The menu is small, leans toward meat, but has some variety.The rooms are clean and modern. Nothing New York scary about them. Book with confidence. My only room "complaint" is the lighting on the coffee making area which has a single serve Keurig machine, is dim. The very highest floor can be loud in good weather due to the bar on the roof. Never been to the bar, but it appears to be quite possible. While not my favorite New York hotel, I stay here the most

My husband and I stayed here in December and overall thought the room was much larger than other hotels I have stayed in the past which was a nice surprise. The room was clean, provided a closet and all the things you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The location is perfect for those who want to visit Greenwich Village, Chelsea and some of the other neighbourhoods and close enough to Time Square if that is more your thing. The hotel will check your bags early so you can explore the city if your room is not available upon arrival. It is also located on a quieter street and a nice contrast to staying in Times Square where I stayed during my last visit. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Hilton to anyone travelling to New York. The size of the room, cleanliness of the hotel, location and price can't be beat!!!

This is a fab hotel, in a great location, and while a bit pricey it is in line with new York prices. We were there over Christmas, and took up four rooms. The main negative I have was our room on check in, which we did at 3.30pm was not ready, it wasn't ready till after 7pm which was a bit ridiculous. This was because we had requested a specific floor where everyone could be together. However this request was made 6 months in advance and really should have been prepared for. As an apology we were given two bottles of wine which was a lovely gesture which was appreciated. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel, which does the room service, which arrived very timely and was really hot which was great. All in all a great stay, just wish they would fix checkin time, also the rooftop bar while a brilliant extra is ambit damp smelling, wish they would fix the roof!!!!

Stayed earlier this week with my young daughter on her first trip to NYC- in a nicely modern decorated lobby we were greeted by warm, friendly & helpful staff which started our stay off on a great note. Loved our high floor room (19th) with a superb view of Empire State Building as I had requested. (Twin bed rooms are at back of hotel so we opted for double with the ESB view- SO worth paying the $20/30 extra for). Very clean room and bathroom, not huge but bigger than other NYC hotels I've stayed in. Shop around- I got a good deal on travelzoo.Location is excellent as >5min walk to red line subway to nip north to Times Square & beyond or south to South Ferry for Statue of Liberty. But also a short walk from Penn st & bus terminals- so if you are arriving by bus/train like we did it was so handy to drop our luggage off early morning and spend the day sightseeing.They also happily stored our luggage for free for us to collect in the evening before departure. We had planned to dine out but after long day sightseeing we opted to dine in- so glad we did- Rare restaurant on the lower level floor served us one of the best steaks I've ever had, and my daughter claimed the same for her burger. Decent selection of wine too.I would have given a 5 star review but my only gripe is the Roof terrace bar was closed both nights we were there (Mon/Tues). Whilst we couldn't have eaten there as over 21s only (my daughter is 8) I was looking forward to checking out the view and taking skyline photos -but when I asked if I could just go to take photos I was told by the restaurant manager no as it was locked up and closed Mondays in winter...when I asked again on Tues eve just before we left she then added it was also closed Tuesdays in winter (grrrr!) i was very disappointed given this was the busy Christmas week.I suspect it is closed a lot more than that in winter so if this is a big thing for you, check in advance. To be fair, when I queried at hotel reception they were very sympathetic- but the RARE restaurant & enclosed roof terrace bar is not owned by Hilton and 3rd party managed. I did stress that the enclosed roof terrace restaurant/ bar was one of the reasons why I chose this hotel and they really should stress on website if it closed often in winter.....even the flier in reception for it lists "enclosed year round ski chalet"and refers to "happy hours Monday- Friday".That gripe asides, for location, friendly staff, impressive room view, cleanliness, decor & great steaks I would highly recommend this hotel. I look forward to returning with friends in late Spring when (hopefully!) the roof terrace bar will be open.

My husband and I were back again to the Hilton Fashion District Hotel in November. The staff of this hotel is exemplary, especially Zoribel. She's my go-to gal when I make a reservation there. She is kind, professional, and goes out of her way for me and whomever comes with me to the hotel - my husband, my business partner, our daughter. Zoribel is the reason I keep coming back to this Hilton. She's a breath of fresh air!

My wife and I returned to the Hilton Fashion District because of its location and a good experience in 2013. The hotel is new and the rooms are comfortable and clean. The service staff was attentive and responsive. We would recommend this hotel.

We came for a small shopping trip as a retirement treat. We stayed here on recommendation. My wife loved it all. The rooms are a brilliant size and for an incredibly loud city, we slept soundly. We shall be returning to explore more of the city and once again enjoy the hotel.

Enjoyed my stay at the Hilton Fashion District. Everyone was helpful and pleasant. The food was excellent and room service was delivered promptly. The hotel location was within walking distance to shopping and other locations of interest. In addition the hotel contacted me when a room was available for early check-in and they helped secure a cab for me when I departed very early in the morning. It is an excellent hotel at which to stay when visiting New York City.

the room was very clean and very well done up and the property is very centrally located, the front office maintainence and housekeeping staff were very helpful, the property is very close to a lot of restauraunts,whole foods and the subways and bus terminals

Close to NY Penn station and subways. Walk to other tourist areas, Chelsea Market, High Line. Perfect for visitors to FIT. Very friendly and helpful staff. The Rare Bar and restaurant has good food. Small but sufficient gym and equipment for a quick workout.

Great Stay at Hilton New York Fashion District! Perfect location. I had some trouble with the rate I booked and the manager on duty was more than accommodating and ensured I was charged the rate I booked at! Great property and even better staff!

i stayed here for only one night - the rooms aren't that small for NYC hotels. I think i was upgraded to a king bed.I liked the available HD channels, I loved the bed, the shower and the breakfast. The location is really good too!It's the first US hotel I've ever been to that serves tomatoes and smoked salmon and a great variety of other items for brekafast - Bagels, muffins, quality yoghurts, potatoes, and wonderful fresh fruit.There's nothing negative i can say about this place! If you can get a good deal, than TAKE IT!

This is a great place. We go here every year to do the "New York at Christmas" stuff. The location can't be beat, and it's a smallish hotel without the high boutique hotel price. In addition, the people who work there successfully make it all into a friendly experience in the middle of the big busy city. I enjoyed the breakfast package each day, it made a nice start to the morning. I think the rooms in the rear of the hotel (on the elevator side) might be a tad smaller, but they are also a bit quieter-- not that the front rooms are so noisy that it's a deal-breaker. I and members of my family have stayed there five or six times in the last three years, so this isn't a one-time impression. Last December (2013) when I checked out, I stupidly left a favorite sweater (not cheap, plus it was brought back as a gift to me from Norway) in one of the drawers in the room. A day after I got home I discovered my error and three days later my sweater arrived at my home in a FedEx box. They just couldn't be more caring or conscientious. I'm sold on this hotel!

Saddened to report that this location fails in every aspect to meet the standards of what a true Hilton location should be. We stayed here for 4 days this past week, and from the minute we checked in, we knew we were in trouble. As a Hilton Honors member, I like to be greeted as I normally am, in the Hilton way. There was no smile, no Hilton bag, no how can I help you, just a simple next, hand me your credit card, and here is your key. We checked in to our room in the 19th floor, and were fine with the size, considering it is NYC, however, we were annoyed by the lack of light in the hallway, making it impossible to look at yourself in the huge mirror, totally defeating the purpose. The room is way dated, and needs work, however, the worst part is that housekeeping failed to clean our room the next day, leaving us without clean towels, and other bathroom accessories. When we called the front desk, the response was unprofessional and nothing done to accommodate. We figured that by leaving the room by 8am and returning by 4:15pm, that the room would be clean, that was not the case. Front desk and restaurant staff, totally unprofessional. There seems to be alot of horsing around, but no real customer service focus. There is no accommodating on anything, and there is zero organization on baggage handling if you are checking out and your flight is late. As for the lobby, the guest bathroom in the actual restaurant takes the price for the most unhealthy and disturbing part. While waiting for our cab to the airport, in the lobby, we needed to use the ladies room. The young lady with long black hair and glasses that sits near the restaurant and lobby stated that we could use that bathroom. Upon entering, the smell of urine and the sight of urine was most disturbing. There was no way that I could use either toilet, for fear of catching something. When I notified the young lady, she made zero effort to call housekeeping, or provide any options. I had to wait until arriving to the airport to use the bathroom. This is really a bummer, I love Hilton and take pride in being a Hilton member, obviously, they do not.I give it one star, for location and accessibility to FIT, and the water pressure and for the partial view of the Empire State Bulding.P.S This location is extremely loud, you will hear the dumpster pick up after 1am.

Clean hotel and great location. However, I requested a King Bed and upon check in, I was told that they only had two doubles. If the beds were not available, I should not have had the opportunity to select a King Bed room.
user_name:
Nichole K
New York, United States

review_body: A quick trip to NYC and a rather new 4 yr old Hilton on 26th st. The rooms are very small but very comfortable.Great shower and really hot water. Comfortable bed and good lighting. Absolutely no street noise during the night and no hallway noise.Front Desk Staff were very friendly.No ice but a call gets a bucket in a quick response as did a call for an iron.Valet parking available, but if you drive a little farther, there is a parking garage on the right.

The entire staff from the front desk, bellhop, wait staff to our housekeeper were all wonderful as very accommodating! Everyone was very professional and courteous during the entire stay. Without a doubt, based on my experience, I would highly recommend this location! They have excellent customer service/people skills which makes them all assets to the Hilton team. Thank you.My only issue-I would have preferred a refrigerator instead of a not needed mini-bar, except for the water.

Stayed here for 3 days seeing some Broadway shows. The staff were very accommodating, the check-in/check-out flawless, and the bed was very comfortable. Like many better value hotels in NYC the room was tiny, but very nicely decorated. My only gripe is the mini-bar. We never use them but do make use of the refrigeration sometimes. You can't with this one - if you open anything it gets charged automatically. I just wish every hotel would recognize that customers want to use a small refrigerator without trying to sell overpriced, unwanted goods.

Did not care for the location of this Hilton and the staff was just ok. The rooms were spotless and the beds very comfortable. Also decent size bathroom and shower for N.Y.C. and also spotless! We also received a great price for the room. However at night around 3 or 4 in the morning trash collectors or something were outside the room, both nights, and it was very loud! But we were on the 3rd floor so maybe that was a factor with the noise level. I would not stay at this Hilton again only because of the location. I would stay at the Hilton we stayed at a couple of years ago right across the street from Macy's I believe it was on 34th street or real close to that.
user_name:
Christine R
Canal Fulton, United States

review_body: Rare bar is great .. Get the fry plate ... Truffle fries are gorgeous ....Service is awesome ... Rooms here are consistently clean, breakfast is fast and good ... and I love the location it's just a fab central hoppin hotel !!!!

Spent 2 nights there on business. Nice clean hotel, good location. Breakfast is not included in the room rate although there is a restaurant in the lobby. Good friendly staff. The one issue I had you have to pay for Wifi and cell phone reception in the rooms is not the best.

I was very satisfied with this Hilton property. I would definitely return. The room and bed were larger than the typical NYC hotel. The location was convenient to shopping, all transportation, restaurants and sightseeing. You can not beat the value, I shopped around before selecting this property.
user_name:
Bernadette J
New York, United States

review_body: Wonderful property with great service. Loved being a bit away from Times Square noise and traffic. There are local restaurants and shopping. If you want the hoopla, it is a short cab ride away. Service and staff are excellent.

Walkable to/from Penn Station, Times Square. Clean and nice lobby and rooms. Typical NYC small size. I paid more than double what some colleagues paid, and when we compared, we had three different rates among us. One had called the hotel after booking, and that's how he got a rate that was half of mine. When I took his confirmation to the front desk, they wouldn't do anything - told me that it would had have to been changed before staying. Upon check-in, hotel front desk gave a silver member colleague free wifi password, but told me it was only free for gold members. No one around to help you hail a taxi, night or day.

We stayed here for a night in July. The rooms are small but comfortable, clean, and quiet. The location is walkable to Times Square/theatre district. We booked it to stay in the city to see a show and walked to the show. For the price, it was a great find. They have a rooftop bar we didn't make it up to. Its also close to the High Line which is a great place to visit. I would recommend if you are looking for a good price and a basic hotel room.

My room was on a high floor and had great views of the Empire State Building. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable and not overly noisy. It's close to all the galleries around Chelsea and not far from Penn Station. It's away from the madness of Midtown yet close enough to walk there in about 20 mins or so. There's plenty of good restaurants and cafes nearby, Cookshop & Tre Dici to name a couple. It's worth checking out the rooftop bar for a cocktail and a better view of the skyline. Service was great from the front desk, housekeeping and the porters. I originally booked through booking.com but got a better price using the hilton website.

My wife and I recently took a quick weekend trip to NYC and found a terrific deal at the Hilton Fashion District. It is not in a traditionally "hot" area like Times Square or Rockefeller Center however it is just a short walk from Penn Station located at 26th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues. The room rates are also less than those above mentioned areas. Everything about the place was terrific. It was clean, modern and had a wonderfully welcoming staff. We were able to check in early and made our limited time in the city so much better. In addition to Penn Station there are many subway routes and taxi transportation options nearby. We were easily able to get to Midtown, the Village and Little Italy with no issues. The room service was extremely efficient and wonderful. The security in the hotel is top notch with both security in lobby and restricted card access to the floors. The views from the upper floors and the Rare Rooftop bar were great and fun to see the area from a different angle. The visit was absolutely great and we will return to our new find.

Great staff are on standby at the front desk when you arrive and to help with suitcases. Rooms are small but that seems to be the norm in New York. The beds are fantastic, so comfortable! My room was on the 19th floor and occassionally you could hear noise at night from the street and you could hear music from the rooftop bar. Something to keep in mind if you're staying on level 20. Great location, close to all the Chelsea galleries and an easy walk to the Village or Midtown. Wholefoods around the corner is a bonus.

This is more of a Hampton Suites than a Hilton - no exec lounge but you get a coupon for free breakfasts and a welcome bottle of water. Rooms are petite, high floors offer nice views of the city and Empire State. Service varies. For the price, I'd recommend shopping around.

Our first trip to NYC, with a recommendation from a work colleague, we decided to stay at the Hilton Fashion District. Great location, close to the Whole Food Market supermarket, subway and walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go.

It is a good, clean and well located hotel. The wow factor is not there. Our room was very confortable with all the accomodations but you can hear everything that is going on outside the room. The restaurant and bar closes too early. There is no place to work confortably and take a coffee at the lobby level. The only free internet is in the lobby. Otherwise ir is 14,95$ per day per room for free internet access. For the price and location I would go there again. Finally park your car yourself in a commercial parking. there is plenty around and it will be less costly than the parking provided by the hotel.

Just checked in. Acknowledged my Diamond status, but no upgrade. Best rate I could get was $351/night. Ouch. I'm here for a business conference, so I didn't have any cheapter Hilton choices the today and tomorrow night. Room is nice enough. NYC small. Smallest closet I've ever seen. Desk is very worn out, should be replaced. No ice on any floor, no ice bucket. Room service delivers it. I read enough on TA to get a room in the middle so you don't hear the noise from the street or be kept awake by the music from the bar at the top. So I've got 1209, right across from the elevator. Lots of good food within walking distance, good location.

This Fashion District Hotel is located on 26th street beween 6th and 7th Avenue in the Chelsea Area of New York. This area is quiet, with mostly locals living here. The HIlton was very comfy and clean, with no issues to speak of. The rooms are a bit small but that is to be expected in Manhatten. Very convenient to the 1 subway but a little far from the NQR, which was the one I needed. I would recommend this hotel to those who don't want to be in the hustle and bustle of Times Square, but still be in a safe friendly neighborhood with lots of restaurants, markets,and flower shops. Love Chelsea, and plan to stay in this area for all future trips to New York.

Overall, pleasant hotel with comfortable bed. Benefits from Hilton's consistency in room amenities, bedding, furnishings, etc. Rooms are small. We had the largest king room with "a view" was not large (no room even for small sitting area). If there are rooms with a view, they must be over the 11th floor, as our room looked directly into the building across the street. Rooms a few levels above ours may be able to see over the building across the street. Our room was not ready until 3:30-400, even though we were told we would be guaranteed check in by 3 pm. The heat was difficult to regulate and we often found ourselves too hot or too cold. In spite of the foregoing, the hotel was clean and quiet and centrally located at a very reasonable rate. For the price, I would definitely stay there again.

I stay here frequently while travelling to NYC on business, and also frequent it for personal stays. It is an easy walk south from Penn station and is far enough away from the hustle and bustle just a few blocks north to be much quieter. Easy access to cabs crossing the island as well as walking distance to Chelsea Pier and the High Line. Management is always courteous and professional and the rooftop bar has great views of mid-town. The rooms are on the small side but always clean. All rooms are along a central north-south corridor that runs parallel to the street and the clientele are usually professional travellers so I've never had a problem with unruly fellow guests or loud neighbors. The bar in the hotel always has a nice tap selection and my food favorite is the lobster burger. Breakfast is served in the Rare dining room downstairs and has a nice selection of buffet and other plated options. Overall, this is a great place to stay in the City.
user_name:
saltmountain
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Reception is extremely friendly, courteous and helpful...making check-in and check-out smooth as glass. I had a great night's sleep in my quiet room. The breakfast buffet downstairs from the lobby is great, too.If coming to New York, this is a very centrally located property with subway access to several lines along 23rd Street, all of 3-4 blocks away, depending on the line you want to get on. Also, the PATH 23rd Street station with access to New Jersey (Hoboken and Jersey City business centres and shopping - tax-free clothes shopping!) nearby on 6th Avenue/23rd Street.Also, you're in the heart of trendy Chelsea and within walking distance of Herald Square (Macy's the world's largest department store) and Times Square,

My sister and I stayed with our 5 daughters at this great hotel! The service was wonderful and the rooms were very clean! We were also impressed by the location, in the middle of everything - close to theatre, shops, and restaurants. We found a delicious breakfast place around the corner on 7th ave - that had everything! I would highly recommend this hotel! And when I come into the city, I will definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Angie L
Larchmont, New York, United States

review_body: I stayed here for one night whilst visiting a friend and has a room facing the street. The location of the hotel is great if you are going out in Midtown. The staff were really friendly. The only downside of my stay was the noise from the street from early in the morning. I could hear sirens, car horns, rubbish trucks.

Excellent location with quick access to downtown-midtown areas of Manhattan. Hotel staff was exceptionally pleasant and responsive. Rooms are a bit small but clean and comfortable. We had an excellent rate!

My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a long weekend away about month ago (Oct 23-26) to celebrate my birthday. At first we were impressed with the location and the cleanliness of the hotel, but soon after we checked our favorable impression quickly began to wane. In fact, by the end of our stay I was so infuriated with our experience that I needed to wait awhile to write my review to see if I gained some perspective. Unfortunately, my perspective has not changed . . . . As other people have mentioned, this hotel is noisy. Most of the rooms are right in front of elevators, and the street noise, even on the 20th floor, is quite loud. There were elevator bells ringing and doors slamming all night. You could hear the garbage trucks below around 4 or 5 in the morning. These were things I was willing to overlook because we loved the location so much. However, on the third night of our stay, our last night, the rooftop bar had a DJ. We arrived back at our room early, around 9 that night because we had a long day walking around the city and were to meet friends the next morning for breakfast. As soon as I entered the room, I could hear the base line of every song coming from the rooftop bar. Certain that a hotel would not let this continue past 11, I held my complaint in the hope that I would be able to retire around 11 or 11:30, but when the music was still blaring well past 11, I decided it was time to say something. I complained no less than 4 times in 2 hours, one time getting back in my clothes and going to the front desk, around 11:50. We were told they would ask the bar to turn down the music and that it would stop at 12, then after 12 it became 12:30, and yet at 1:15 am, the music was still blaring. The only reason the music stopped at 1:15, was because my husband went down to the elevator that took you to the bar and held it open until the bouncer escorting people out promised to stop the music. I began asking for compensation for the night after my 3rd complaint. I was given the run around, something about 10,000 Hilton points, and that it was not their bar and they couldn't control it. They offered to move my room, but I wasn't packing to move, only to repack first thing again in the morning for our departure. I shouldn't have to do that. I had security come to my room to verify the music could be heard, and he did indeed verify it. I told those at the front desk I would be speaking with management in the morning, and that since I wasn't given the service I was paying for, I expected to be compensated in full for the night. The manager did speak to us as we were checking out, and while his tone of voice was nice, I found it condescending. He lowered his voice, in the hope that we would whisper as well, so the other occupants in the lobby would not hear. We inquired about whether or not they owned the bar, and in contrast to what we were told the night before, they do indeed own the bar, and consciously allowed the music to blare because there were people staying at the hotel specifically for bar and they had to service them as well (we saw everyone being escorted out of the lobby, btw). He inquired why we asked for the upgrade to the upper floors if we knew there was a bar . . . Well, we had to inform him we asked for no such upgrade, were not told we were being upgraded, we thought there would be less street noise on the 20th floor, and were already checked in before we even realized there was a rooftop bar, which was 3 floors above ours. He pretty much admitted they chose to sell drinks over serving their hotel occupants wishes. I feel as a hotel, the occupants should come first, and that if they want to have a loud bar and occupants, the bar needs to be soundproofed. He did ask us what we wanted to "make this better," and we had to say, yet again, that we wanted comped for the night. He then tried to offer us a free room in any Hilton hotel instead, rather than comping us for the room. We declined, because we have no clue when or where we will have the opportunity to stay in a Hilton again, and likely we would not get our money's worth for what we were paying to stay in this overpriced hotel. We insisted, and in the end did get compensated for the night, but we had to push, and I felt like after the wretched service we received, that we shouldn't have had to ask, and perhaps even been offered a free night in another Hilton in addition to being comped for the night. It is a shame, as Hilton Honors members who think this hotel is in a great location of a city we love and visit frequently, that we will never stay at this hotel again. Two stars are given only because of it's location and because the manager came through with comping us for the night. If you are a heavy sleeper and are not bothered by noise, or are a night owl, this may be the place for you, but if you like a good night's sleep, I suggest you look elsewhere.

We stayed here from 11/26/14-11/29 for the first time. Room was clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. Staff were friendly and gladly answered all our questions. We had dinner in the restaurant and food was very good and staff friendly. The subway is right across the street--very convenient. Very close to Penn Station, They have a rooftop bar lounge that has a great view of the skyline and Empire State bldg. This is a great place if you want to avoid the massive crowds at Times Square area.
user_name:
Michael E
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is a place my parents stayed at while visiting me in NYC. The staff is good and very responsive to their needs. Very friendly. I chose this place as it is close to where I live. It is located in a great part of NYC. Easy to get to things. In the central part of NYC.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Paul M
New York, New York, United States

review_body: great location. walking distance to penn station, madisson square garden, Chelsea market etc. Enterprise rent a car was just 1 block away. Good size rooms per NYC standard. Front desk super accommodating

We stayed here for 4 nights in November 2014, it was my first trip to NYC and I have to say this hotel was a great choice! It is more like a boutique hotel than a traditional Hilton and has a nice cozy feel to it as well as being modern. We were greeted by a lovely lady at the front desk, in fact all of the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean and our room was spotless. We stayed on the 21st floor, our room was an okay size. We had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. It was very clean and the bed was so comfy! The only negative I have is that the rooftop bar was 2 floors above us and the noise filtered down to our room. It did go off around midnight on the Thursday and Friday nights but on the Saturday I had to phone reception shortly before 1am as it woke me up and I couldn't get back to sleep.... The guy at reception was very nice and the noise stopped shortly after. I definitely think some more sound proofing is needed though!We ate in the hotel restaurant on our second night, we had burgers followed by an Oreo sundae. the food was fantastic and not expensive at all. We didn't eat here again as the female who met us and showed us to our table was really quite rude and it seemed to be an issue that we wanted a table at 10pm (it's open til 11pm) so that put us off but the food was tasty. The hotel is in a good location. About 10 - 15 minutes walk from Times Square. It is about an hours walk from Wall Street, the 9/11 memorial etc. We walked there on Sunday morning through Greenwich Village and it was a lovely walk and didn't seem like an hour. We also walked up to 5th avenue for shopping that took about 45 minutes but again didn't seem as long.Overall we had a lovely stay here and I will definitely stay again!

Quality of sleep 10/10 Location 10/10 Hilton standard! 10 minute walk to Macy's as well as meatpacking where all the action is. Definitely recommend the location and super friendly staff. Marian at the front desk was a real ROCKSTAR! she helped me out with everything, from planning my stay, places to visit. I had a big shopping list and was clueless as to where to go, she guided me really well and I was able to finish shopping within 3 hours so I had more time to do what I wanted. She was super super helpful and every time I thanked her, she went like "this is our job", I mean I understand it is, but its rare to find someone so helpful and knowledgeable. Additionally, I checked out late and Angelica let me stay for an additional 2 hours which was really appreciated. Loved the baggage drop facility too.

Stayed here on a short solo trip to NYC in November 2014. Location on 26th Street near 7th Avenue is perfect for a short trip when you have to maximise your time in the city.
