It's a 10 minute walk from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station, which has great rail connections to the major airports. It's also around 20 minutes walk from Times Square.The hotel itself is nicely appointed. I've definitely stayed in larger and more modern rooms, but it was more than sufficient for my needs. Staff were attentive, friendly and helpful. I would definitely return here if I have another short trip to New York City planned.

Check in was great (as always), room was great (as always) and if it was warmer weather you would have found me at the bar on the roof (RARE). My only complaint (and I have complained about this on multiple occasions) is that the TV on the only elliptical machine does not work. I don't think it's too much to ask for that considering the price per night that is charged. I like to workout especially since my business trips are usually adventures in high caloric intake.

My girlfriend and I decided to go to NYC for our anniversary. Originally we only booked one night, but due to travel problems we arrived later than planned, and had no problems with the front desk adding an additional night when we checked in. The hotel is very clean, which was most important to us. The rooms are smaller, but more than enough room for just us two. We ate at the restaurant which was good, and the rooftop bar had a great view and atmosphere, although pricey. We plan on coming back again, and I am sure we will stay at the Hilton.

This hotel does not resemble your traditional Hilton. It's more like a boutique hotel. The room was a decent size for NYC and the price was reasonable, but it was missing almost all of the traditional Hilton amenities/feel.

It was really horrible night when i'm staying last week. during whole night even early in the morning, there was crazy noise & i couldn't sleep. furthermore, bathroom light was out in the even, I couldn't midnight to fix that.

Nice, clean, comfy bed. Nothing fancy. The room is kinda tiny but who cares if you are in NYC. The bathroom towels could use some bleach, as they were kinda grayish not white. 4,5 dollars for a little evin bottle is crazy! Location s good, close to the subway and most of the attractions.

The Hilton Fashion District is a great choice in this neighborhood. It was clean with a nicely appointed room, although on the small size. Nice bathroom, good closet space, flat screen tv and coffee making facilities. Staff was lovely and welcoming. The price was right, ask for the AAA discount!

I recently made a reservation for a special occasion...it was a birthday weekend. I wanted to have a bottle of wine in the room upon arrival. The particular wine I requested was not available. The front desk manager I was working with (Melissa) indicated that someone from the staff would be happy to go to the local liquor store and purchase the wine so it would be in the room upon arrival. Not only was the wine on ice, a balloon and cake was also included! I stay at Hiltons frequently and the service is always acceptable, however the attention to detail and willingness to go the extra mile by this team was stellar to say the least. Great hotel, great staff, great location...thanks for helping this be a memorable weekend.

We normally stay in mid-town and welcomed the opportunity to explore a new neighborhood. We got a great rate on Hilton's website.Hilton staff was very welcoming and gave it a "boutique" feel. We were given a room on the 11th floor and had a nice view looking up. Next time I might ask for a higher floor to have an even better view.Rooms were comfortable. Valet had car ready in less than 10 minutes - a NY record!Many nice restaurants in the area including Eataly and lots of BBQ choices.

I've stayed here a couple of times over the last few years and the trips combine business and leisure, for me this hotel is perfectly positioned.Rooms: small (but average by NY standards) but perfectly formed, it delivers exactly what I expect from a Hilton, good amenities & a very comfortable bed. Restaurant - Rare: they serve breakfast here - good selection of hot options - and the rest of the day it is a steak restaurant. Can highly recommend the lunch menu- a tasty burger, fries & a drink for approx $10. Roof Bar: Access from the lobby and attracts a young crowd on Friday/Saturday nights, DJ played a lot of R&B when I was there on a Saturday evening. Good cocktail list, comfy seating and great views across the city. Gym: In the basement, very small but has the basic equipment. I went around 7am and there were 1 or 2 others in there each time which is cosy! Staff: I've stayed a couple of times and for me this was their weakest point. They can be a bit dismissive at times which is disappointing.Location: great location, great places to eat close by - visit Eataly for fab food and atmosphere. It's walking distance to Macy's for shopping and a couple of blocks down on Broadway you'll find a lot of shops.

I always feel like home when I stay here. The ladies at the frontdesk ( Christine, Kathy and Mily ) are just awesome, they will help you with evertyhing you need. I had this great room at the 20th floor and the view was AMAZING!!!! I will come back for sure!!!!

I would not stay here again. It is very clean and chic looking but even the other Hiltons in NYC offer a MUCH better overall experience. The Hilton Diamond status really meant nothing as far as upgrades. The breakfast and bar areas really have nothing to offer for non meat eaters.

Best stay yet in Manhattan, in walking distance to Penn Station and centrally located for many attractions. The room rates were excellent, the room clean, modern and quiet. Staff was friendly and accommodating. I also liked the ROOM card security feature, elevator access is limited to card holders.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights over the weekend while we visited friends. It's on 26th and 7th, which is just a few blocks (walking distance) from Penn Station, and very close to many things. Our room was VERY quiet - we could hear absolutely no street noise at all. Room was clean, bathroom was clean, overall a perfect spot for us to call home base for a few days. We didn't check out the gym, restaurant or rooftop bar so can't comment on that. The staff was very helpful - I left my phone in the room accidentally and had been checked out for a few hours when I realized it. I returned and the front desk made a call, and was able to return my phone to me. Professional, honest, and great service. I highly recommend and would return to this hotel in the future.

Went over with som good friends for the fashion week and we just had a Lovely time. We can highly recommend this hotel; great service, staff ,restaurant, view over the city... Just supergreat and clean.

I contacted the reception by e-mail a few days before the event and asked if they couuld organise a surprise/cake for my husband, celebrating his bday during his stay @ the hotel.The receptionist was very friendly, competend and replied very quickly to my e-mail.I attached as well a letter to the e-mail and asked, if they could print it and put it in the room as well.The lady said I was all set. The day of the bday my husband contacted me; the hotel had organised some balloons and a nice cake, with a text on it " happy birthday", it locked lovely. My husband was so happy that I decided to give them my feedback, here's what I wrote them:"I'd like to say THANK YOU/ staff for the beautiful surprise you organised!It looked really pretty with the balloons, and the cake tasted great said my husband :)!Everything perfectly organised from your part!He was really overwhelmed about this great surprise, he had not expected anything like this!Again, thank you so much, great service!! "I wanted to share this with you, it was really a great service!

We stayed here for a weekend getaway and booked high floor rooms. The location can't be beat a couple blocks away from 2 subway stations and easy walking distance of lots of food. Our room had an amazing view of the Empire State Building and was clean with a comfortable bed. Shower pressure was also excellent.We went to the roof top bar one night and it's covered, which was a good thing given that it was freezing outside. Definitely one of the highlights as we had drinks with a great view of the city. Would absolutely come back to stay here!

The staff are excellent -- and the key to their success! Great location. Good restaurant. The bedding was comfortable. Catching a cab from the hotel is challenging -- plan to walk to 6th or 7th Ave. Nice value.

A central hotel in Chelsea. Close to a lot of good bars and restaurants. Rooms where clean and modern. Service was OK. The bellman was extremely service minded; especially when you compare him with the receptionists.

Rooms were clean, Staff was great. Rooftop bar was fun. Restaurant was good. Great burgers!!! Room key needed for elevator. System was squirrely and ended up on wrong floors. New cards were easy to get. No biggie

Easy subway and train station access in a great neighborhood; despite these convenient features, not too much street noise. Head a few blocks west for a run or stroll along the Hudson River; head a few blocks east for Madison Square Park, Eataly, the NoMad Hotel bar, etc. Most months of the year, a pretty good value in Manhattan.
user_name:
bridgetg882
New York City, New York

review_body: Nicely situated and affords you some flexibility. You can walk from here to mostly anywhere. The staff us friendly and the rooms are comfortable. The price is not too bad when considering New York City prices. Also around the corner is a great set if pubs and the hotel bar itself is great with a roof top bar and amazing view of the city.

This Hilton is the perfect location for lower mid-town travelers. The place is clean, rooms are an adequate size and higher floors offer nice views of the Empire SB. Toiletries are the standard Phillip Roth, which is a pretty nice brand. Breakfast was very expensive ($17.00 for two eggs and a little bacon), but that is pretty standard for hotel prices in NYC. Save money and go out to a coffee shop. I would stay here again due to the price, cleanliness, and location. Hilton pretty much always delivers. Front desk was great, and the car service to the airport beats the heck out of a stinky, over-priced cab.
user_name:
Synchro12
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stay at the Hilton Fashion District frequently for business (enough to make Hilton Gold Status 2 years running, and it's the only Hilton I stay at). I continue to stay there because the staff is excellent. Especially Kathy at the Front Desk, she greats me by name every time I walk in the door, it's like coming back to family which feels really great in a place like NYC.The hotel itself is nothing great. The views are 'meh'. The decor is dated, even worn. The beds and linens are OK, above average, but not amazing. The "gym" is tiny. Certainly other hotels in the area such as The Highline and The Americano are much hipper with much cooler rooms and decor. But, I've found the staff at those hotels, and others, to be frustratingly useless for even simple requests.Every member of the staff at the Hilton Fashion District will jump at the chance to help with any thing....which is much more useful than trendy furniture in a room you're just going to be asleep in.

This hotel is in a good location in Chelsea (if you prefer not to stay in the middle of all the tourist traffic in midtown)- which I do. Front desk and bell staff were very helpful. Breakfast was excellent. Perhaps the best french toast I have ever eaten. Service in restaurant was also excellent. Concierge service is poor. Do not expect much help on what to do in New York if you are a first time visitor so plan ahead.

We've stayed in the Hilton for 4 nights this past weekend. We really felt welcome during check in. Everyone was helpful, polite and friendly. Location of the hotel was also perfect. Breakfast is also very good. Staff is friendly.This was my first time to visit NYC but not my last time. I'LL BE BACK !Jeff JanssenBelgium

Hilton hotel is one of the best hotels in New York City.. We had an amazing time here! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Zoribel went above and beyond with us I truly appreciate it. We will be back.

Thank you for everything!!! Zoribel was amazing helping us. She is truly great. Thank you for the entire staff. Everyone was so helpful and caring. The hotel is also in a great location!!! I truly appreciate everyone... Once again thank you

Stayed here for two nights last week and it was fab. We arrived at 1am and Sid on the front desk was super efficient (and funny even for that time of tthe morning), sorting everything out in minimal time and had us in bed within 10 mins of arrival. The hotel was in a great location with cool bars and restuarants nearby. Make sure you head to the Hotel's roof bar which has an amazing view of the Empire State Building. Would definitely stay again.

I recently visited New York for my 21st birthday with my mum and stayed in the The Hilton in the Fashion District. We came across the hotel while booking through Expedia and I'm so glad we did! The greeting from the front desk staff was so welcoming after a long flight and continued every day throughout our stay. Every morning when we left the hotel we were greeted with a chorus of "Good morning!" Our bags were taken straight up to our room with no waiting around when we checked in which was wonderful as four suitcases between two of us had become a bit of a struggle. Brilliant service from every member of staff, every single one was helpful! Melissa, the front desk manager, in particular made sure my stay at the hotel was memorable! She was terribly kind and helpful throughout our stay. We needed to check into our flight home and were offered the use of computers and a printer in the lobby with no fee. WiFi is free downstairs in the lobby which was great as I wanted to contact family on my birthday. Would have to pay to use WiFi in the room which is like many other hotels and perfectly fine.The room was a perfect size for two of us. Everything was spotless, and was the same when we returned each day. A wonderful bathroom with a nice big shower, plenty of towels provided and a few little extras. Views from the rooftop bar are incredible. As we booked through Expedia we were unable to specify that we wanted a room on a high floor for the great views, I would definitely book direct with the hotel in future to get this, it would definitely be worth the extra cost! We ate in the restaurant, Rare, one evening and the brilliant service was continued there. Very attentive staff doing all they can to help. Food is a very reasonable price and great quality. We ordered a bottle of Cava and asked if we could take it to our room to finish, suddenly more than one member of staff was trying to find us a stopper for the bottle!We have visited the city previously and wanted something a bit further out from Times Square for a change, but wanted to be close enough to go there. Times Square is walkable distance and this is a perfect location for Macy's, The Empire State Building, Bryant Park etc. Also very close to the High Line. Brilliant location, outstanding customer service. The service alone makes me sure that I would return to this hotel when I next visit New York. I'd recommend it to everyone I know!!

We really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton in the Fashion District this past weekend. Everyone was polite and friendly, the décor was fun and the location was easy to walk to many attractions. If you are staying on a higher level, you could have a great view of the skyline. The breakfast offering was more than I expected. I recommend this hotel if you want to stay in a nice place with all the upgrades, but without the fussiness of high-end hotels.

I've stayed in a few hotels in Manhattan and this is one of the nicest and spacious for the price. We had a room with 2 double beds on the 6th floor. I didn’t have any issues with the room. The bathroom was very clean as was the bed and the linens was soft. My only complaint might be that our window view was a brick wall and windows of a dress maker. So, there was no view. But that was okay for us, as we weren't in the room much time.The front desk staff was very helpful in providing directions and information we needed.The fitness room, while small was very nice.The location is fantastic. It is away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square with the many tourist and loud noises. However, its only 3 blocks from the subway station so you can get anyplace you need to. There are great restaurants and of course great shopping in the area. The hotel is a couple blocks from the Empire State Building. So that is also convenient.There is a rooftop bar in the hotel as well. We didn't go up, but there was a red-velvet line to get the elevator up there. I assume its popular.This is by far one of the better hotels I have stayed in NYC for the price.

I've been staying at this property for years and have never made a review. After a bad stay at another hotel I felt that it was equally important to share the good experiences. The only time I don't stay here is when the rate gets too high for my company budget, otherwise, this is the place for me to be. This is a great location in NYC and in a trendy area. If you are like me and hate the thought of going to tourist traps, this is a good option for you. Big enough to be a full service hotel, but small enough that the level of service is high.What really makes this place special to me are the staff members. Kathy and the front desk ladies are so wonderful. If you come back, they remember you, they use your name when they see you, and they SMILE. I've watched the staff bend over backwards for me and others at the property. The bellhops are so awesome too, friendly, polite, and willing to help you out as you come and go... please tip them, they work hard. Can't say much about the security staff, they don't say much or interact with guests. I've never stayed at a property where they make you feel comfortable and welcomed. What a novel idea for those in the hospitality industry!? Fitness center is small but nice, and the breakfast options are pretty good (best I've found in NYC hotels). If you eat in the breakfast area, you will be lucky if Maurice waits on you... I ask to be seated in his section every morning. I've never seen a young man so happy to be coming to work each morning and working the breakfast and lunch shift. Rare Bar as a whole is good. Great food and unique cocktails. John, the manager, is great and always greets me during my stays in the hotel. The rooms are smaller, but so is every other room in the city. This hotel is CLEAN though, and in years of staying here, I have never, ever had any issues with housekeeping, cleanliness or anything of the sort. They bring chocolates at turn down service, so take the "do not disturb" off the door around 3pm or you will miss them! The rooms are comfortable, well decorated, and quiet at night. I don't like to stay too far up on the floors (there is a rooftop bar at the hotel), so I try to stay a few down from the top.I really can't say enough about what a wonderful property this is. I am finishing up my travel this week for the rest of the year and am planning to do something nice for the staff members at this hotel before I checkout this week. If you travel often for work, you understand that a great stay makes all the difference for your trip.I've been reluctant to say how wonderful this place is because I don't need it being sold out... but they deserve the praises. They do a great job, and embody the ideals of top notch service. I got a real kick out of people who gave this hotel poor reviews. Shame on you. Internet isn't free at any hotel unless you are gold/ elite/ platinum/ etc. This hotel is no different. If you want a family friendly hotel with a pool and activities for kids, you can probably gather that there is no pool here and I wouldn't think that taking my kid to a bar would be appropriate anyway... Things happen, problems come up, mistakes to bills are made. It's all part of travel and I'm pretty sure that front desk staff are not doing this maliciously. I don't understand the complaints about the front desk staff, but have witnessed the terrible way that "some" guests speak to hotel staff (at all hotels I'm in), and if you think that you can be nasty to someone and they continue to smile at you, well, you are misinformed and unrealistic.I see some people complaining about location. This hotel is near several trains (you should try them sometime), and it is easy to get a cab. You can walk up to 34th street and the shopping there too if that's your thing. This hotel doesn't market itself as being in Times Square (but there are Hilton properties there if being in a jam packed crowd is your definition of family fun).So, the bottom line is that this place is great and I just wanted to give thanks to the wonderful staff here. If any of the managers read this post, please do something nice for them when the opportunity presents itself! I hope you are proud of their efforts.
user_name:
TravelDoc716
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed at this hotel on a Sunday night. We walked from Penn Station to the hotel (about 8 blocks). The location is about 14 blocks from Times Square, which we were able to walk quite easily. The outside of the hotel is beautiful with lovely potted plants. The heated entranceway was a nice greeting after being in the cold November air of New York City. Checking in at the front desk took all of 5 minutes. The complimentary bottled water was a nice touch. The front desk staff was so friendly. Their smiles and efficiency made us feel so welcomed. We paid a little extra to have a higher-level room. We were on the 20th floor with a nice view of the New York skyline. We could even see the Empire State building from our window. Our room was fashionably decorated with very modern furniture, electronics and fixtures. Even the wall-mounted TV screen had a personalized welcome screen with my name on it. The two double beds were very comfortable with clean and comfortable linen. The entire room was immaculate. The mini-fridge was stocked with goodies but we didn't touch them because we were on a budget, but they looked good. The bathroom was nicely tiled with granite countertop and clean, fluffy towels. The little extras, like cotton balls and Q-tips, was well-appreciated by my daughter who needs these items when applying and removing her make-up. When we realized that we forgot to pack toothpaste, we called room service. They were up in 5 minutes with individual packages of Colgate toothpaste. After ordering pizza and the smell of garlic lingered in the room. As we were stepping out we asked a random housekeeper who was cleaning another room to spray our room, she said, "I'll take care of it." Sure enough, when we got back to our room, it smelled like a field of flowers. The customer service at this hotel is the best I have ever encountered. We visited the roof-top lounge called "The View". What a joy that was. Many different sitting areas, all with a magnificent view of the Empire State building and the NY skyline. We had nice cocktails that the bartender recommended. They were a little pricey, at $14 each, but I guess that's about average in NYC. There weren't many guests at the lounge on a Sunday night, so the place was quiet and relaxing. There is also a restaurant in the lobby that is also very beautifully decorated, but we didn't eat there. We mostly ate at a Halal place right across the street. We also bought food at our favorite grocery store, Whole Foods, which was only one block away. After we had checked out, we had to wait in the lobby for about two hours for our ride. We sat in comfortable chairs right by the front desk. The staff continued to make us feel welcomed. They offered us cookies and bottled water. When we said our last good-byes to the staff, I felt a little sad. It was like leaving family. I definitely recommend this home away from home to anyone wanting a nice hotel experience in NYC.

Had a fantastic stay at the Hilton Fashion District. Was in town for three nights, always a pleasure to return after a long day and night of work. My client toke us out to Rare where we watched the world series. Steak and service was fantastic. Thank you Hilton I'll try to make my next stay in NY with you.
user_name:
Alexandre T
San Francisco, United States

review_body: Booked a room just a few hours before my stay on a Sunday. Great price and super fast service (check in / check out), classy and spacious rooms. Great location, nearby a couple subway lines. On the Sunday I booked, it had just a tad higher price than lower quality hotels (3 stars or lower while this one I believe is 4).
user_name:
Michael S
Washington DC, United States

review_body: This hotel was a great deal for the price. It's close to the Megabus drop off location, which is a plus. It's also close to various metro lines. The staff was extremely helpful, as I was allowed to check in early (no additional cost), and they held my luggage after checkout. I'd definitely stay here again.

I stay here weekly for business. The ladies at the front desk along with Jose` always make me feel welcome and extra special. Hotel is clean, comfortable and quiet. Love the rooftop bar. Great location- close to The High Line which is a fabulous place to run or walk in the morning.

The hotel is conveniently located in walking distance to Penn Station and close to the subway on 7th Avenue. Lots of restaurants and coffee shops close by to choose from and away from the chaos of Times Square. Would definitely stay here again!

Great luxury hotel. King size room was excellent, very modern and well furnished.Service on the front desk was average and the porter staff unfortunately let the hotel down. Rooftop bar has good views of the Empire State. Did not try the Gym or the restaurant on this occasion.

We had a wedding in NYC over Halloween weekend and were very impressed with the Hilton's location, staff friendliness and overall presentation. We also loved the rooftop bar. I would recommend staying in this hotel again.

I spent 2 nights here on a business trip. I was given a quiet room on an upper level without asking for it. The staff followed up within a few minutes of having arrived in my room to check whether everything was to my satisfaction. The room was perfect, clean and had everything I needed. Location is ideal, close to Penn Station.

On my first trip to New York it was overwhelming trying to pick a hotel. We decided to stay here because of the location. Upon our arrival our room wasn't ready yet. We only had to wait about 10 minutes. They ended up giving us free wi-fi for our stay. Which is great because its normally $15 per day... Per device! One night we decided to check out the roof top bar. The hotel staff gave us a tour of the look out & bought us a drink. We had an issue we our room card and was unable to lock our door. They came promptly and had security stay outside our door till fixed. All in all great place. Clean, great location (then again NYC is very easy to get around), safe. With all said, we actually stayed here the second trip too. No issues at all.

I spent 5 nights here a little sick and working from the hotel. Good points - near Penn station, shops etc. Clean rooms (though small), friendly and fast reception and great little restaurant with speedy room service. Laundromat right arose the right if needed. However the wifi isn't free and the rooms are dark. I think it's slightly too costly especially considering that wifi and breakfast are not included in the price.

Great location...walking distance to lots of stuff from SoHo to Times Square. Cool rooftop bar. Property is clean and well-maintained. Rooms are decent sized for NYC. A little pricey but hey it's New York City.
user_name:
Michael S
York, PA, United States

review_body: NYC has high hotel prices but this Hilton was very reasonable for the brand, location and the freshness of the building. The rooms are small (most are in NYC) but they have a funky, fresh feel to them almost that of a boutique hotel. The rooms were very quiet but we were disappointed they only had a shower and not a tub/shower combo. It seems more hotels are going in this direction in the US. We arrived before 11am but they had a room for us so we could check in early which was wonderful. Great hotel for a couple or for a business traveler who doesn't intend to spend too much time in their room. It's NYC- who would!

I trael often for wrk and really enjoyed staying a this hotel. I get the big city feel with a sall town treatement.Everyhing is trendy and intriging. I really enjoyed my stay here. I felt like a VIP the whole time

Great hotel - expensive - however, all hotels in NY are expensive. Convenient location and close to major avenues such as 7th, Madison, etc. Needs 200 characters which means that I'm going to have to say yada yada yada yada yada yada yada yada - this is ridiculous that you have to type 200 characters. keeping this in mind I won't do another trip advisor survey.

Besides great location - close to main attractions in the city, what is remarkable in this hotel is the staff. They are really dedicated, helpful, polite and try to make everything so that you feel at home. The room was very clean and confortable. The only thing is that the walls do not totally isolate external sound. On my next trip to NY I'll certainlly consider to stay in this hotel again.

Very good place to stay ,as good service and good location.Good staff at all places, to start with reception, restaurant, and all places including all services.Location is perfect for city like new-york,many attraction you can go walking.

great location being at walking distance from Penn Station and Macy's.Quiet, recently refurbished, rooms are spacious even though not the best I have been. Restaurant is good and rooftop bar excellent with a great view of the Empire State Building.Meeting rooms are underground so no windows, though service and food were good.

Staff was very friendly. Room was clean. Great location because it's central and the subway is not far. The room was too dark for my taste and small. A little noisy from the hotel restaurant downstairs. If you looking for a romantic hotel, this is not the place, but if you need a clean hotel with a helpful staff, I think it's a fair price.

Stayed here early this week for the first time. Convenient location just a few walkable blocks from Penn Station. Staff at check-in and check-out were excellent and made sure everything was to my satisfaction. Nice little restaurant with a good selection of menu items for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The adjacent bar opens at 5 and the waitstaff was excellent on both of my visits there. The room size was a bit above average for NYC and verycomfortable. Large shower, kuerig coffee maker and other nice amenities. Good wi-fi.

Our visit included New York and Washington and we stayed at 3 different hotels including the Hilton Fashion District. The Hilton was the worst experience and the most expensive. I paid close to US$450 per room per night. The worst thing about this hotel is not only the very small room and that we booked a high floor and ended up looking onto some boilers and a laneway, it was that the front staff were not interested. They were must happier hiding at the back or chatting amongst themselves. This was not the work ethics I would expect from hotel staff, certainly not at this price range, as I have stayed at close to 30 different hotels around the world. The concierge was not there until 9am which was way later than when tourists would start their day. Nobody helped us with our bags and only on the last day of our 4 day stay were there anyone helping with taxis at the door. The deco was old and dated with a small lobby although clean. There were no free wifi and the fridge was locked unless taking something out which was more like a budget hotel. The only good thing going for it was the coffee machine and the bed. I would advise all to go past this hotel and don't waste your time. Our later stay in another hotel in Midtown (at a lower price even) was such a huge improvement that we were relieved that our holiday was saved.

Read 4 pages back... "What could we have done to exceed your expectations" I posted all my comments there. I do not like having to repeat myself. You can look in that section and you'll see all the strange disappointments from the room service and house keeping staff. I truly felt like the customer is not the priority there at the Fashion District Hilton.
user_name:
Mark Z
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: Room was average size for NYC, but nicely apportioned. Property seemed to be fairly new. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to assist when asked. Breakfast in the restaurant was very good as well. Location is very near two subway lines and within walking distance of Flatiron district. Overall, a very good option.

We checked into this hotel after not being happy at the affinia for double price . Wow what a difference. Not only is this hotel a nicer product the staff is extremely friendly. We had dinner at rare and the ribs are to die for. The roof top lounge offers great views and a great vibe. The drinks are quite pricey 14.00 but it's nyc so we expected that. Overall very pleased all around.

I have booked 2 rooms in this hotel based on the rating which i have seen on the website , But stay was really bad .. Basic necessities which should be in hotel are missing. No phones in bathroom, No dental kit, & No slippers . Staff are under trained . I have booked for 5 nights from 12th oct to 17th., at the hotel arrived at the reception with my pre booked and paid hotel voucher, And the lady at reception is asking me to pay for the hotel which i have already paid for which i got it resolved after discussing with them for 15 min. Reception lady didn't give me breakfast voucher which i have paid for , next day when i come for breakfast they ask for vouchers, So i go to the reception to ask for the same and she is not aware after again wasting 10 min she provides me with 4 vouchers instead of 10 vouchers she should hand over to me . Curtain is missing in one room, bed is not comfortable to sleep . Breakfast is same for 5 days with no changes to it ... scrambled eggs, bread, potato , bacon and sausage ... i guess if i come after one year also i will find the same. Mini bar was locked .. I have to call them twice to get it open. Overall experience was really bad.

I traveled with some friends and stayed there for 5 days. I am a gold member in couple of hotels chain including SPG. I stay 80 nights per year in hotels and this is by far the worst experience i have ever had1- Basic amenities are not there! complementary water, slippers... I had to call asking for dental care kit!! Really!!???2- rooms are very noisy. If your neighbor is taking a shower, the noise is as if you are sleeping in his/he shower3- same breakfast everyday. It's not a rich breakfast btw!! 4- concierge. they gave us 2 "not so good" recommendation and this wasted 1 day5- Elevators buttons don't work from the 1st click.. You have to click couple of times and hard to take the command5- Didn't try their restaurants6- location is goodfor $465 per night, i'm expecting much much more.

Fantastic weekend in the Fashion District. Stayed over the Columbus Day weekend. The hotel is located between 2 well serviced subway lines, making travelling downtown to the financial area or uptown to Times Square a breeze (or anywhere else in Manhattan). Stayed in a north facing room, which provided an amazing view of the Empire State Building. The rooftop bar also provides great views of the city. Very clean hotel and professional staff. Can't wait to return!

location is quite ... what to say, embarrassed, not near to any famous place, you need to walk for a while to find subway entrance.service is not bad, only too serious about smoker situation.view is pretty good, but remember to check to direction before make orders.

Stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel has seen some use (ie. stained little orange chair thingy in the room, some dings around the edges) but the rooms are largish, comfortable, nice bathrooms. The staff were very helpful (I complained because the first room smelled of smoke, so they gave us free internet and a higher up room - although it was right under the rooftop club so it was a bit noisy.) It is centrally located with subway, shops close by. We got a pretty good rate, so the cost to quality ratio was fairly high. Would I stay there again - probably not, unless the price was good.

I found that the staff were very pleasant and the rooms extremely clean. The decor was very trendy and modern and I felt like I was in a five star hotel. The breakfast was outstanding and the roof top bar was the highlight of your location
user_name:
Valentino D
New Jersey, United States

review_body: This is the worse hotel I have ever stayed in , in the city. As far as a Hilton there is a great restaurant , helpful staff & nice lobby. But the rooms are so small & the noise Keeps you up all night . The ac was on high all night & we couldn't turn it down .

I don't even know where to begin. I made my reservation weeks before travel at a rate of 329.00 I had to cancel one day off of my reservation and was told my rate would go to 479.00 I tried repeatedly to have Hilton customer service return my email. Nothing. When I arrived at the hotel I wanted to use the valet service for my car so I could take my car in and out and was told it would be an extra 10 dollars every time I took it out..The room was not worth it. Small, so dark you couldn't see yourself. In the bathroom when you took a shower the water leaked out of the shower door on the floor and made a flood. There was no wi-fi unless you paid for it. I was extremely disappointed in the Hilton Hotel chain. I have been a member for years. I will have to think twice before staying at one of their hotels again.

The Hilton Fashion District in NY is a beautiful hotel and staff is friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a big room, think again. Their rooms are small, I was told it was a European style hotel, and realestate is at a premium - which is what you'll pay at this hotel. But it's in a great area, and served my purpose which was a company meeting.

Here on biz and this was one of the Hotels in walking distance from the office.What a good choice!Its only a few blocks from the red line Metro at 28, less than 10 minutes to walk to the Empire State Building, Penn Street station, a longer walk to Rockefeller Centre and times square and Central Park too.The roof top bar is worth a visit, a great view and a nice breeze.Only ate at the restaurant once and if you like Burgers then you're in.I arrived early so they gave me a room on the 18th but it was opposite the lift so a little noisy.JFK was only 45 minutes away in traffic.I'd definitely stay here again!
user_name:
Rick_Yvanovich
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: I always ask my company to book me in here as for my job it is a great location.Work aside though it's still a great location if your a fan of the Chelsea, Village, TriBeCa area.Your also good walking distance to a lot of attractions or if your not a walker then the N&R lines are 2 blocks away for uptown and downtown.There are some great restaurants a short walk towards the iron building but even closer is the hotels roof top bar! It's a must, the view is amazing.I'll be back again for sure.

Stayed here for 6 nights in October. This was our 6th visit to NYC and on previous occasions had always stayed close to Times Square. This time we wanted to be a little further down town so chose the Hilton Fashion District as it met our location requirements. Check in was fast & efficient and room location on the third floor was great giving us minimum waiting time at the lifts. As a Hilton Diamond member we enjoyed a complimentary breakfast each morning in Rare and it was good. Our room (315) was extremely quiet for NYC with the only minor quibble being the a/c was fierce, but a little trial and error on the temperature controls soon sorted that out. The best feature of the hotel was the location. We were able to walk uptown and downtown to everywhere we wanted to go or jump in a cab knowing any journey was going to be reasonably short and inexpensive. There are great restaurants within easy walking distance, so much better than the ones that surround the Times Square area - we walked to Greenwich, Chelsea Market and the Flat Iron district to visit recommended establishments and never had anything but a good experience. Overall, we loved this hotel and will not hestitate to stay again next time we are in town.

The main complaint I have was the ATTITUDE of the staff at reception!!!! They acted as they were doing us a favor and very non interested!!! Your industry being a very service oriented one you should train these staff to be more accommodating and caring to the guests!!!! If the individuals are not receptive to this approach you should NOT hire them, as it gives your hotel and HILTON a very bad name!!!!!

The hotel is in a very good location for me. Rare is an excellent location. However, the value is simply not there. I came back to the hotel at 10:00 PM, and when I wanted to watch TV, the remote did not work.It Is the little things that count, especially when you are spending $500 a night. Pretty salty for a mid-level chain.

I was impressed by the name "Fashion Distict" but I soon found out that there is not much fashion around 26th street.My room was small, ovrlooking the neighbouring building that was probably at three meters distance and so I kept the blinds closed all the time, no reason to look out of the window.

Very well priced hotel, right bewteen 6th & 7th Avenue in Manhattan. About 4-6 blocks walk to Penn Station and then onto Times Sqaure.The room was very modern, and has all the ammenties including mini bar. Staff were very friendly.Rooftop bar was very impressive and offered great views of Manhattan and was very popular with locals.Probably one of the best value hotels in Manhattan.

Cleanliness is extremely important to me and our room met my standards. The size of the bathroom for the price was a plus compared to some of the other hotel descriptions I read about in the area. We had a very quiet room on the 12th floor. I would have preferred for the hotel to have an outside sitting area where we could read or chat.

Room was too dark will all lights on and mattress covered soiled, should have been obvious to housekeeping. It was only an one night stay so we really couldn't rate the entire hotel. They had a pleasant roof top bar which advertised a light fare. They only had drinks, it was a Friday night, so we closed out our tab and went to the lobby bar/grill. Food was good but would have preferred staying at the roof top bar. The staff was pleasant but gave us little information. I booked through Cheap Hotel not sure if that dictated the level of service.
user_name:
Dominick S
New York, United States

review_body: We arrived in the city early and with a smile they checked us in to our room at 11:30 am. It was great to have a rest before meeting friends for lunch. The room was very nice, spotlessly clean. The staff were very friendly.Did not love: the Keurig coffee maker; it's not very green, especially using one of those containers to make tea. The coffee was good though. The lobby is a bit compact and the restrooms behind the restaurant needed a bit of attention. Still a great experience overall at a great location. The rooms were pretty quiet except noise from people in the hall, other room doors closing seemed really loud.

I stood here for one night with a friend and was very impressed. The location is great and the hotels is beautiful. Was very tired the morning of check out and asked for a later check out by calling the desk. The guy was very understanding and extended our check out time by 2 hours no hesitation. Would stay again for sure.

We were very happy with our 4 night stay at this hotel. We have stayed at many small, mediocre hotels in the city and paid just as much as we did for the Hilton. The room was big enough for a crib and everything else that accompanies traveling with a toddler. It's very rare I don't feel the need to wipe everything down in a hotel with a Clorox wipe. But this hotel was very clean and well-maintained. The location is perfect. We will definitely stay here next time we return to NYC!

Great hotel, beautiful sized rooms, great facilities and a lovely cocktail with views of the Empire State Building on the rooftop bar, highly recommended.i would definitely return if was going back personal or business trip The rooms were reasonably priced and room service one night was perfectly delicious

This hotel was used after a 12 night cruise on the Queen Mary 2 and did not meet our expectations, 20 minute walk to Times Square, this hotel was a no frills experience. We were on a room only basis and used the roof top bar once, we did not use any other facility other than the concierge, for booking theatre tickets and the hop-on and hop-off bus, and this was inflated because uf using the services of the concierge.

If you want to make it to your room from the lobby in less than 15 minutes, don't stay here. The roof top bar is loud and the guests commandeer the elevators. Great hotel. It's a shame they let a roof top bar take priority over their guests' needs.

Hotel rooms in NYC are small. And the rooms at this Hilton weren't huge, but they were a good size, and spotlessly clean. At least mine was. Great sized bathroom with clean floor to ceiling tile and a nice shower. Big counter. My room had 2 double beds with good pillows and were really comfortable. The rooms were quiet, I couldn't hear anything going on in the hallway (I was at the end of the hall) and slept really well. Friendly staff for easy fast check-in and holding my bag on my day of check out. Lobby was updated. My only beef is that they charge $15 for internet. And the rooftop bar had amazing views!

My headline to this review is 100% truth. I'm disappointed, especially in light of the fact that I paid well over $300 plus taxes for my small room and $55 per night for valet parking. $400++I stayed here ONLY because of location, having a business appointment nearby. It was very well situated for my purpose (great location for me) and easy to locate when driving through the Lincoln tunnel. The hotel seemed cramped and crowded with narrow hallways, narrow entry to room etc. considering I was paying FIVE STAR prices almost anywhere. The elevator was stuck/ didn't work immediately with the "swipe" from key cards about 3/4 of the time we went up. I heard this verbal complaint and watched the frustration from at least four different guests who were on the elevator with me. Also, several times guests on my elevator rode up for several minutes before realizing that they had to go all the way down and get "swiped up" in order to get up to the restaurant on the 22nd floor. There were repeated elevator issues which was annoying to say the least.My room seemed clean enough. Bed was fine. My room was quiet at night unlike some other Manhattan hotels- a big plus. I checked "bed bug" reports and there were quite a few but no recent ones so the hotel seems to have eradicated this problem. Recent updates of flat screen TV. Mini fridge. I used room safe with no problem. INTERNET CONNECTION WAS AWFUL. After serious frustration I switched to my cellular network on my iPad and STILL couldn't connect- ugh. Other minor gripes- hotel needed better lighting, very cheap artwork (tacky) in my 8th floor room.I often overlook the minor stuff and very very seldom leave a negative review of a property. In this case, however, my review is fully warranted. Now for my serious and dangerous gripe. I hope Hilton takes it seriously and immediately corrects it. During my early morning shower, the bathroom suddenly went PITCH BLACK. The first time this happened I was truly shocked -my heart stopped, I got shampoo in my eyes and I groped to open the shower door. I am not exaggerating. NO LIGHT at all. I was alarmed/ frightened thinking the whole hotel had blacked out. After taking a step or two outside the shower a sensor tripped the bathroom light back on. VERY ANNOYINGLY this happened THREE MORE TIMES during the course of a regular shower. Four times altogether. Once with a razor in my hand. Each time I had to stop, open the shower door and walk out or swing my arms wildly around until the sensor tripped the light on again. NEVER EVER has this happened to me before. I'm angry about it. I am a seasoned traveller and this "green hotel" money saving BULL is way beneath Hilton- especially when I'm paying $400 for a cramped room at the very end of the 8th floor hall with a very of boxes in a warehouse window. An older or more feeble guest could well have tripped or been severely injured during the bathroom blackout. Honestly.I later saw that there was a possibility to flip another switch in the bathroom that would possibly have left a small light on in the shower. THERE SHOULD BE CLEARLY WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS ON THE BATHROOM WALL EXPLAINING THIS if they decide to not address this problem by getting rid of this ridiculous flawed "green" lighting system. Oh, and a nice hotel should be updated to include "fog free" bathroom mirrors when I pay $400 bucks. Get your act together Hilton! Just sayin'.....
user_name:
Evelyn S
Dallas, Texas and Vienna, Austria

review_body: clean rooms. has a trendy rooftop bar that gets popular on nice evenings. Rooms are modern and decently furnished. If you can get a discounted rate (350-450) on a hotels.com or similar then its a fair deal. Any more than that and you have better options around for a nicer stay in the +500 category.Location to Penn Station is fairly easy. Whole foods and Chipotle right around the corner, or eat onsite at Rare for a good burger.

Hotel is ok. Rooms are not too small, cute design and very clean. Location is good, easy access to subway and train station.On the other hand, staff is cordial but not very friendly. As a Hilton Honors members I should have been given free internet access in my room and was not. Concierge was not very knowledgeable. I was woken up at 5:30 by strange noise that lasted at least 30 minutes. Sounded like treadmill but who knows.Not the best but not a disaster.

My fiance -- and now wife -- stayed at the Hilton for three nights before and after our wedding. What a wonderful experience! Everything was bright, clean and new, and our bed was extremely comfortable. We paid for an upgrade to get a room on a higher floor -- it was well worth the price of $13/night. There was no view to speak of, but it was so quiet I couldn't believe I was in the City. If what you want is quiet, ask for Room 1501. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and I was particularly impressed by the person who took care of us when we were checking out. We asked if we could leave our luggage so we could spend a little more time out and about before heading back home. The answer was yes, and the process was so quick and seamless that we were out the door in no time. Getting our luggage out of hotel storage was just as easy and fast. If you stay here, check out the rooftop lounge. It was too noisy for my taste, and it has a sports bar atmosphere, but the views of the City from up there are beautiful. Of course, the amount of money you have to pay for hotels in NYC is absolutely obscene, but this particular hotel was less expensive than many others we considered, and we felt we got a very good deal.
user_name:
Sherry L
Port Washington, United States

review_body: We struggled to find affordable accommodation in NYC, and happened upon this property. The staff were friendly and greeted us immediately, and were helpful. The room was a little small, but as we didn't really plan to be spending a lot of time in it, we were still happy. The view wasn't much more than the walls of the neighbouring property, but there is a rooftop bar with great views.Housekeeping staff were great, but the mini bar with all its electronics was a bit tricky, as I needed to store medication in there, and was constantly worried I'd end up triggering something I didn't want to buy. It might be worth talking to the front desk if you need to keep something refrigerated, I am sure they could help. Empire State building was only a few blocks uptown, and there was some neat coffee shops just nearby that serve espresso coffee that is good and strong. There's also a wholefoods if I recall. A great steakhouse/rib joint is down the street, great barbecue.

This thing is so easy to overlook but its a great, solid property for business. Rooms are a bit small for leisure, but typical of NYC.Staff is SUPER nice, NYC has gotten better but these guys are a model. The lobby is small and not impressive, the fact that theres a drop off driveway is nice. Elevators a little beat up and guest room corridors tight and drab. Rooms are very functional, clean, and comfortable.The coolest, way coolest thing here is the rooftop bar. Wow. The views and spaciousness put Refinery to shame. The drinks, meh. Get a beer or wine.

I had forgotten a book at the hotel when I left and I called and was able to get the book shipped back to me for free within a week. Thanks Michael Schiller (housekeeping manager)! Also everything was very clean and enjoyable! The location was perfect and my family and I were able to walk to a lot of places without having to take the subway all the time (which saved us some transportation expenses too)

There was nothing really wrong with this hotel but when compared with some other Hilton properties, it was lacking. In fact, It was more like a Hampton Inn than a Hilton. The lobby was very small with no real style and the adjacent restaurant had a large sign saying, "How do you like it?" Conrad must be spinning in his grave!The room was adequate but the closet was tiny as was the gym. Everything was very clean. The staff was very nice as well.The location was good with easy access to Penn Station and subways. Certainly I would stay there again but with lowered expectations. The rating is based on other four star properties I have visited in NY. If this was a two or three star hotel, the rating would be much higher.

The Hilton Fashion District has a good location and offers good value for NYC. The restaurant downstairs serves a nice breakfast buffet. Make sure you upgrade to a room with a higher floor.Also make sure you request a room with views of the Empire star building. The rooms are small but the ones with the view have a nice airy feel. I didn't make it up to the bar on the roof but was told that its nice. The staff is helpful and it was a pleasant stay.

I had to be on the East Coast on Monday morning after being in NYC all week prior so decided to go for a more vibrant location and the Hilton didn't disappoint. It's in the heart of the Fashion District and on the edge of Chelsea so really good subway access (local not express) and plenty to do within walking distance including tons of great places to eat, drink and people watch (which is always a treat in NY).The hotel is true to the neighborhood and being that it was still fashion week, I was impressed at how decent the rate was for the weekend. The rooftop bar is also pretty good - we were there for Friday after work happy hour and it was pretty warm still so they opened up the room and you got some pretty amazing views of both midtown and downtown. The drinks are a little spendy but no more than other NY bars around.The rooms are a little tight but not terribly so (it is NYC after all) and comfortable. Only ate breakfast at the restaurant but it was fine for that. The hotel also had a decent sized workout room with all the equipment you would need. If you don't plan on spending tons of time in the room or hotel, you can't beat the location.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 night at the end of July. Not enough can be said about how well the staff treated us. Always a smile. Always "can I help you". The entire complex was spotless. the rooms were a good size - considering the typical New York hotel room size. Went up to the roof-top bar for a look. it was OK, but as usual, the music was far too loud. Over-all, top notch.

stayed in double room for 2 night over the weekend. Decent hotel for a good price. Also have a rooftop bar.the rooms are medium sized for being located in middle of Manhattan. Had a very comfortable bed.

I spent four nights here and found the location to be ideal for the adventure. The subway stop on 28th street and 7th avenue took us anywhere we needed to go. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. I'm a Hilton Honors member and breakfast was free with my membership. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate and the staff was very friendly. The rooms were smaller than what I am used to, but sufficient for my needs. I will stay here again when the need arises. That'll be next year!

Hotel is in a great location & staff are really helpful. Room was clean & well kept. But bathroom leaked water when we used shower, making the floor wet & dangerous! Also rooms at the front expect noise as you would in a city but can be annoying!

Nice hotel stay, but we had higher expectation to the standard of the facilities. Clean rooms, nice personnel and very tasty food in the restaurant. Nice walking distance to both Soho and Midtown, relatively clean area.

On our fourth stay at the Hilton Fashion District in New York City this year, we have come to realize this staff is consistently great. Excellent location if you're coming/going from Penn Station as well.

Easy central location, lovely rooms, great staff, wonderful restaurant and lobby bar, linens are great, very quiet, some of the views from the rooms are amazing, the roof bar has spectacular views. Once I found this hotel, I never stay anywhere else when I travel on business to NYC.
user_name:
Lee A C
Valencia, United States

review_body: I stayed here for one night so I could focus and finish a work project -- I'm a New Yorker -- and I really liked it. Great view from my room, very nice room, and great location to enjoy the food of Chelsea. Great find.
user_name:
wonderwandernyc
New York City, New York

review_body: I will try to keep this very basic. We arrived the bellman was so caught up in their conversation that they didn't even notice our arrival until we loaded our own bags and pushed them into the lobby and they said we are sorry let us get those for you. The attendant at the check in counter was so unprofessional, she played with other employees the entire time she was checking us in and I assume she finally took a look at the expression on my face and realized that weary travelers were not impressed with her childishness.  The room was clean......small "but that's NYC".....and very poor lighting right in front of the elevators. But most of the rooms on every floor are in front of the Elevators and the rooms are very noisy. We went to the bar PLEASE DO NOT VISIT THE LOBBY BAR the slender bartender with the semi-buzz cut is smug and rude as hell and many patrons complained that the drinks were watered down and weak so was ours. 2 cocktails a vodka tonic and seven&seven- $24 plus tax and not a hint of alcohol in them. For the price and the service that you receive I would honestly suggest that you find another hotel.
user_name:
Big T
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for a week while visiting NYC. Overall, we were satisfied. Doesn’t really wear you stay in NYC as long as you are near a subway. This Hilton was staffed by really nice people all around. The rooms and halls were a tad small, but housekeeping did a good job keeping our messy room cleaned. The two bars are great. The lobby bar is a nice chill place, but the rooftop bar has great views and they don’t kill you on prices. They have tables and couches to sit on. While we did not eat lunch or dinner in the restaurant, Rare (but the menu looked great with very nice prices), we had breakfast every morning. They have a great breakfast buffet that is always fresh. Clean and updated because Check (yup, that’s his mane) takes great care. Maurice was our waiter every morning and he was great. We enjoyed our stay here, prices are competitive and we would stay here again.

Me and my partner spent the weekend in one of the rooms on a high floor. We had a spectacular view of the Empire State Building. The rooms were very clean and had everything we needed. We did not get chance to use the hotel restaurant, yet we did spend one night on the rooftop bar which had a great DJ and was very trendy. The drinks were a little on the pricey side, but they was good. Again views of the Empire State Building and the rest of the city can be seen very clearly. We also had room service for breakfast one morning which was served with a smile and tasted delightful. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful.I would recommend this hotel to groups of friends or couples who know and want to be in or near this area of Manhattan. I would not recommend it to tourists who want to be in the absolute centre of the hustle and bustle near Times Square. I also do not think it is suitable for families with young children.

Decent sized rooms in a hotel close to MSG. Great bed, good internet service, very clean and well appointed room. Attached restaurant was very good for breakfast and dinner. Lobby is a bit active as the rooftop bar is very popular in summer evenings. The high line trail has an entrance a few blocks away, worth walking over for.

My wife and I and our four-year-old stayed here recently for two nights. We loved the modern decor in the clean rooms, and really appreciated the friendliness of all the staff members we met. We found the price reasonable for an upper floor room, which was quieter than a lower floor would have been. The neighborhood is an interesting mix of new and old, and it's walking distance to the High Line as well as Greenwich Village. Overall, this was a great home base for exploring everything from the 9/11 Memorial up to Midtown - cabs are quick to lower and midtown, and there are several subway lines within walking distance.While we'd agree with those who said the rooms are on the smaller side, and that views can be nonexistent unless you ask for a view room (water towers were out our window) - we wouldn't complain: these were pretty much expected for us in a mid-priced NYC hotel. The only real criticism we walked away with was not being able to visit the rooftop bar/deck. The rooftop was one of the reasons we booked this location - however, we found not only is it off limits to anyone under 21 during prime bar hours after 5 PM (understandable), it is also completely off limits during the day, to everyone. In other words: non-guests who are 21 can walk in the front door and go to the roof any time after 5, but families with under-21 kids can NEVER go to the roof, night or day. This felt very unfair - though the staff who told us about this policy were nice about it.We would have been so thrilled if we had been allowed to go up to the room in the morning for coffee, or for lunch, etc. - but had to tell our four-year-old we weren't allowed. This policy needs to be rethought - if we knew we'd be allowed on the roof during the day, we'd stay at this location again in a heartbeat.

Stayed for four nights! Rooms are clean and the bathrooms are a good size! I would go for a double room, kings is smaller. Front desk staff where super helpful. The rooftop bar has amazing views, but expensive drinks (even by NYC standards!). In house restaurant was good, but again expensive! There are tons of food options close to the hotel! Overall we would stay again!

We visited New York to attend a Wedding as well as to visit the City and other areas. The Hotel is centrally located and we managed to get a very good rate, via British Airways. The Hotel Lobby is small but functional. The staff were pleasant and helpful and the Rooftop was very good. Our room provided good views of the city and was well laid out. We did not eat in the Hotel but the restaurant bars were busy.A good base to explore New York.

Rooms are very small. No microwaves or fridges. No concierge room with breakfast/snacks, water, cokes, etc. For ice you have to call room service or get it from the bar (by the glass) on the way to your room. Rooms are clean, staff is efficient. The room rates are very high depending on time of year and local events. Not much offered for rate break for business travel.

I had an overnight stay at this property recently, the rooms were pleasant enough but the hotel itself was small and the facilities not great, not what I expected from the brand or the area.If you are looking for stylish hotel where you can get a great meal and a quiet nights sleep, this isn't it. all night I could hear trucks rumbling past the window and sirens, i was relived to be checking out when I did.The staff were pleasant enough and service was brisk and done with a smile, it is not a property I would wish to go back to.I finally slept on the flight home making up for a sleepless night at this hotel.

The hotel is like it's lobby, stylish but really small. The room we ordered from Hotels.com was the King Suite, they gave us a room on the second floor (possibly b/c we weren't paying premium prices) which was very close to street traffic, and all night long we could hear trucks lumbering by. The room was really small. You basically walked in, had a tasteful bathroom on the right side, and then the main room was not much bigger than the king bed that dominated it. So much so, that we had to put the crib for our baby in the area in front of the bathroom, because there was nowhere else in the room that could comfortably fit a crib! The shower was nice, the mattress good but not great. The lobby is far more stylish than the rooms, so don't judge the hotel by the lobby, except in terms of size. The price we paid through Hotels.com was great, although overnight parking for our minivan cost us $52 after tax (that was for self-park with a lot that has an agreement with the hotel.) Overall, next time I'm in the area, I will look for something else in that price point, but if I don't find anything as reasonable, I would stay there again.

This Hilton was in the perfect location in NYC with plenty of nice restaurants, easy access to transportation, and easy walking distance to Midtown and even downtown. The hotel was clean, fairly modern, rooms were large for NYC, on-site restaurant was nice (as was the roof top bar) and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again as I travel to NYC frequently for business. The only downside was the very small gym (I run every morning and need a good treadmill and weights).

We only stayed in this hotel 1 night prior to a cruise. We took the Amtrak to Manhattan and easily walked 10 minutes to the hotel. The lobby is small but welcoming and the grounds out front are very well kept. The room was small as is standard in Manhattan but it was perfect for the 2 of us. We were on the top floor facing to the south so there wasn't much of a view but it was still very nice. The check-in staff was very friendly and welcoming. Unfortunately we weren't able to make it to the roof top bar but will definitely do so the next time we stay at this hotel because we will definitely be back.

The rooms are very clean which is very important to me especially the bathrooms and the hotel in all is clean and a great staff. I stay here often and I am very picky. I will stay here again and again :)

This hotel is OK, very basic. The rooms facing the street are extremely noisy and you cannot sleep at night due to the construction going on all night in the buildings next door and in front of the hotel. The trucks and the workers noises during the night is Nonstop! Avoid this Hilton if you cannot get a quiet room facing the back of the hotel. There are other comparable hotels 1 block away from this Hilton. If you get a room facing the back of the hotel, you will have a great stay.
user_location: New York City, New York, USA
user_name:
the747guy
New York City, New York, USA

review_body: We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived after a long flight from London and what seemed like an even longer wait to get through customs. The Hotel was bright, clean and the staff were very accommodating. As an added bonus the roof top bar was a lot of fun with a delightful selection of cocktails. I would happily recommend this Hotel, especially if you are planning on hitting the tourist sites.

The bed was exceptionally comfortable and the washrooms were large. Room was small but clean and modern. Good view from 17th floor of empire state and skyline. Rooftop bar wasn't too loud, barely noticeable from the roof Friday/Saturday evenings. Staff were friendly.

I live in NYC and we booked this hotel for friends coming into town. Staff, location, hotel room, etc., was perfect. The Rare Rooftop Bar has a great view and I enjoyed the layout. I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone visiting NYC. Cynthia Otero
user_name:
CynthiaOtero
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a solid hotel. It is clean, consistent, and in a good location. It doesn't have any bells or whistles but the cleanliness is nice. The lobby kind of sucks; it only has 1 bathroom that is behind the reservationist. That was a little annoying. I wanted to check out 2 hours late and they wanted to charge me for 1/2 of a day. Every hotel has different policies. Other than that I would definitely recommend this hotel. Don't have any high expectations for it being a cool lobby or room. It is solid and clean. I gave it a "very good" rating as a 4-star hotel. It doesn't compare to 5-star hotels.
user_name:
Todd B
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed for the 3 rd time at this hotel.As any NYC hotel, it is very noisy. Can you do anything about that ? Or offer some ear plugs ?The room is not big, but clean, so is the bathroom.There is a coffee maker, which very convenient for those who are addicted to coffee.A nice kettle might be a plus for the tea addicts !In this hotel, you are no one, which might be good to stay anonymous.When you stay for the week, you might come to appreciate to be distinguished.The roof top bar is nice, even the beer selection is a bit narrow.The rare restaurant is quite nice too.The location is very convenient. All in all, nice hotel, a bit too expensive comparing to the service and quality.And of course, 15 usd per day for the wifi per device is beyond reason.No health club nearby.

The location is great, the price is reasonable, room was very clean and so is the bathroom. Check-in was fast, checkout through TV very efficient . I had a very good time I guess I'll be back when I'm in NYC

upon checking in, clerk failed to review/verify my confirmation room rate, thus charging me an astronomical charge of 4 times the room rate. this amount was preauthorized to my checking account and my funds were held for five business days. no solution was offered by this hotel location.
user_name:
Martin G
NEW YORK, United States

review_body: An excellent hotel...staff was friendly, very helpful and went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. Quiet, clean, comfortable rooms, great bar and restaurant. Great breakfast buffet....lots of choice, fast, friendly service and excellent value. No point in going out for breakfast if you stay here. Walking distance to all major sights and easy access to several subway stops. Would definitely stay here again.

great hotel ...good location.. subway friendly.. staff were excellent.. concierge service for directions were friendly and efficient.the check in personnel..the face of any hotel... one gentleman in particular was very friendly..sadly i did not catch his name but he is a man of colour who was working the day shift the week-end we were there apr-18-apr-20... ..he was very friendly and approachable...and most impressively he remembered my name at all times... a sign of a professional.. the room was a little on the small side but very clean and well appointed.. the roof top raw bar affords an excellent nighttime view of the city... i recommend this hotel without hesitation....
user_name:
Jeff B
New York City, New York

review_body: I picked this hotel for a group of my friends for a birthday celebration trip to NYC and it was a perfect choice. Very quiet, great location and service. Rooms were large and even though we weren't there to rest, we loved how comfortable the beds were. Highly recommend!

Highly recommend this property, great location, just 4 blocks from Penn Station. Looks brand new. The restaurant RARE was outstanding. The roof top bar has one of the best views in New York (Empire State building).
user_name:
Alfredo G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: At first we were a bit bumped. Even though we paid for a king room, it was quite small and disappointing, but we quickly got over it as the location really made our lives easier. It was so close to everything we wanted to see in Manhattan (walking distance - close ) and for the rest you just hopped in a metro. We will definitely book here again.Oh, and the bed was super cosy :)

I"m going to start with the negatives. The Walls are paper thin! We stayed right next to the elevator and heard it beep every time and then even better we heard everything in the hallway and they could hear us. Other than that We felt safe. Everytime you use the elevator you need to swipe your card. The staff was friendly the decor was nice, it was updated. We recommend downloading some white noise if you want a restful sleep.
user_name:
Shannon D
Florence, Kentucky, United States

review_body: This hotel is in a very convenient location. It is modern, very clean and has a great roof top bar. I thought the rooms were quite large for a NYC hotel. The only con I would say is it is not very sound proof. Can hear all the trucks at night and woke up to a jack hammer in the morning. We had left our valuables in the safe not realizing it until almost home 4 hours away. I called the hotel and the housekeeping manager, Michael Schiller, immediately went to check for us. We had a return call in about 15 minutes and all he had all our items and had them shipped to us that day. Thank you again Michael!

The hotel staff is not very hospitable. they will answer questions if you approach them, but they will not welcome you or initiate assistance. There is a rooftop bar there, so if you are coming back from touring the city at night, you just have to be mindful there may be a line at the elevator. The room is a nice size for the NYC area. However, the in room bar/refrigerator is set up that it charges you just to open the door. so you can't use it as a refrigerator. I would also say this is definately a hotel set up for solo business travel. It is not family friendly.
user_name:
Leslie Renee R
Illinois, United States

review_body: At check in personnel was busy and treated us like they were doing us a favor. The room was extremely small and a little muggy. We ordered extra sheets and it took them over an hour to get them to the room. We had to call 3 times and we even offered to pick them up ourselves. It was about 11:00 PM when we got the sheets. In general I was very dissapointed about my stay. I expected more from a renowned hotel chain as this one.

My husband and I stayed at the Hilton NY Fashion District for one night while passing through NYC last month. While the room was small, the bed was comfy, the amenities were decent and, best of all, the hotel was well-located.

Spend two nights after crossing the Atlantic on the QM2. Decent enough hotel. Rooms not the biggest - had to slide sideways to get to the window shade so very near one of the two double beds. Small but adequate and clean bathroom. Great view from the bar on the roof. Didn't spend much time at the hotel - not the type of place for work or thought. Nevertheless, nice staff (they let us check in early and were helpful), easy to get a cab or black car limo, clean, and not extra NY noisy.

Hotel good, staff very friendly and helpful, free bottled water from reception, rooms clean, good air-con. The "Rare" restaurant that is attached to the hotel is very good and has a good menu; it's also a good price and compares well to eating out in NY. We were in a party of nine and we all thought the food was good, New York strip stake was really nice, burgers were excellent (far better than the Hard Rock Cafe). Did not visit the popular roof top bar which seemed to have a small queue each evening for the lift.Only slight criticism from our daughters was that the lighting in the rooms was a bit dim and their were not enough mirrors for them to do their make-up!
user_name:
Adam B
Milton Keynes, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed at the Hilton New York Fashion District for 11 nights over Christmas and New Year 2013/2014. We stayed on the 21st floor with an amazing view of the Empire State Building! After reading so many reviews saying that NY hotel rooms were tiny, we were pleasantly surprised by how big the room was. Plenty of room to walk around the bed and a big long desk and small wardrobe for all our clothes. The coffee machine was an added bonus! We ate both breakfast and dinner at the Rare Bar and Grill on a couple of days and I would say it is one of the best burgers I have ever tasted! My husband is veggie, so not much choice for him, but what he did get was nice. The bar area was nice to sit and have a drink and watch the basketball on the TVs. Overall a great stay and I would definitely stay again.

Great location, quiet room, good value, and very cool rooftop bar with awesome views made this the perfect choice for us. This was our second stay at this hotel and both visits were excellent. We would stay here again.

I stayed at the Hilton for a week during may. The stay was fine, uneventful. Room reasonable. It was only when I left that it became a huge problem. They "mistakenly" (or on purpose?) charged my card $1,800 that they shouldn't have, nor were they authorised to do so. When I first noticed this, I called Hilton (Internationally!) who at the first 3 calls over 3 weeks to the reception desk apologised for their mistake and said it would be refunded by next working day... weeks past... Nothing. I call and speak to their accounts department, which seems to consist of just one man, Zizi. Horrible experience. After giving additional information, and trying to call back, the accounts department (Zizi) failed to call me back and email me back for weeks on end. They simply ignored me. I sent E-mails, Voice messages, and the phone rang out other times. 2 months passed and I had to final cave in and ask my bank to process an unauthorised transaction even though my bank warned me that they would cancel my card. It took 3 months, escalating to my bank and to a travel company to even come close to seeing a solution. Ultimately it took other BIG companies to get involved in order to get my money refunded.
