Ridiculous. Horrible, HORRIBLE experience. This man should lose his job, and this company should take a good hard look at is customer service. If you ever have the misfortune of staying with Hilton, be sure to check very carefully that they haven't stolen from you. Probably the worst thing of all. Their E-mail has a link to "Rate your stay!" at the bottom. They probably should have amended that from all emails they send to the people they try to screw over. cliff-notes. Took $1800 from my account without authorisation. Failed to do what they said on multiple accounts. Failed to contact me for months. Forced me to pursue the issue with my bank.Said they refunded money. Failed to issue any apology.

I've stayed at this hotel a couple of time and really enjoy it. The staff is very nice, great rooftop bar and so convenient to the High Line (turn left and walk straight!) and Eataly (turn right and you're only four blocks or so away). PENN is close by too.

This hotel was very nice, but it's a shame that we stayed when there is building work going on outside and therefore was VERY noisy throughout the night. Luckily, we were very tired and therefore managed to sleep on the whole, and thankfully we booked a king bed room. The location was perfect, with a subway station two blocks away that will take you to the main sights. The temperature in the hotel was quite cold, we tended to switch the air conditioning off in the room! We used the rooftop bar which was nice but not as amazing as advertised. The Rare restaurant was lovely, best steak I've ever had! I would stay here again but ask for a high floor and far away from any building work!

What a great property. We stay on the Hilton Club Floor a few days and love the decor, cleanliness, staff, the extras and proximity to Everything NyC we adore..... It was our 2nd stay at the property.

Stayed in a king room with magnificent views of the Empire State building. Very quiet hotel with clean, spacious rooms. Helpful & efficient staff. The rooftop bar is an excellent place to have a drink and take in the views of the city. Only issue was that we had to pay for WiFi.

Arrived at the Hilton late morning and were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was available for check-in. As reference for anyone coming in from LaGuardia, we picked up a taxi from the taxi stand. The ride to the hotel was about 30 minutes with moderate traffic at a cost of $50 including tip. The room was very clean with plenty of space. Not as big as some other hotel rooms but for NYC this was on the larger side, in my experience. We booked a "high floor king", which did have a view of the city although we were right about level with many roof top water tanks. For a one night stay, I'd not bother booking a "high floor" again as we didn't spend much time in the room anyway.We found the location convenient to several of the areas we wanted to visit, including Chelsea Market and The High Line. Both were in easy walking distance. A very short cab ride to Greenwich Village. The rooftop bar had a great view of city and a good crowd on Friday night. We just stopped in for a look and didn't stay for drinks. Breakfast was good and there was a choice of ordering from the menu or buffet. I would have no hesitation in returning to this Hilton property.

I stayed here just for one night, as I was on a plane overseas the following evening. The room was beautiful, bed was huge and very comfortable & the shower was spacious. There was one staff in particular who was wonderful, I enquired about transportation to the airport the following day, and he recommended a black car (cheaper then a cab) and even organized a pick up time for me the next day. I didn't have to do a thing. Just had to show up. The location is EXCELLENT. I will most definitely be staying here, on my next trip to NYC.

The Hilton New York Fashion District is an absolute gem of a hotel. Amazing location! Although we arrived several HOURS ahead of our check in time (early flight), we were able to check in immediately! Our room was beautiful : spacious, immaculate, with an absolutely gorgeous view of the city. The customer service is unparalleled; the entire front desk staff is so genuinely friendly and helpful. A very special Thank You goes out to Mr. Michael Schiller, Housekeeping Manager, who was so gracious in personally locating and returning my forgotten leather jacket to me. Definitely looking forward to staying at this hotel again :)

Very friendly staff upon arrival. Once checked-in and a quick ride to the 19th floor, we stumbled over a room-service tray left in the hallway near the entrance to our room. That tray did not move for 24 hours (and we saw many housekeepers as well as room service staff on that level throughout our stay). The view was pretty poor, but since we weren't in the room much, we didn't mind. When it came to turn in, we discovered that being placed near the emergency stairs was problematic as we heard the door to the stairs slamming all night. When checking out, we thought we were overcharged in valet parking. It turns out that the valet was wrong about the price and we were charged an extra $10. Internet access of $14+dollars for each device was definitely off-putting. I will likely not stay in this location again.

I visited NYC for pleasure and wanted to stay in Midtown, close to the West Village and well connected to subway ect. In terms of public transport the hotel was easy to get to, especially as I flew in via Neward from where I took the train to Penn Station. Approx 4 blocks to walk and I was in front of the hotel. The hotel is a basic but modern and clean 4 star business hotel. I was extremely happy as I had taken a high floor room with a direct view on the Empire State Building. Wuld I go back? Right away! Great value for money.

Our stay at the New York Hilton in the Fashion District was enhanced by the friendliness of the entire staff, as well as, the efficiency of the hotel's elevators (we were on the 19th floor). Our package included a full breakfast buffet in the hotel's restaurant for each of our 3 mornings. The location was only a block away from the subway and just a short walk to Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Macy's and many other desirable sightseeing locations. The hotel's staff included a concierge who helped us with Broadway tickets and general directions. The room had a coffee maker and a mini bar ( with a charge for items consumed) and a great view of the Empire State Building. We will definitely stay at this location on our next visit to New York.

I love the location of this hotel...there are great small restaurants, cute shops and neighborhoods nearby and it is outside of the craziness that is NYC. Positives included quick check-in, great room service quality & comfortable bed. On the negative side, the internet was constantly out or not able to connect which made working in the evenings very frustrating; the shower didn't drain so I would end up with a few inches of water by the time I was done; there was no conditioner in the room when I checked in and the room is TINY. If it is just one person or a couple that will not be in the room much, it is ok but compared with most hotels in large international cities, for the price, I would expect more.

This is one of many Hilton run properties in NYC and it stands out a bit for its manageable size and great location. The rooms are quiet and since there are not hundreds and hundreds of rooms, the lobby is small and easy to get through, On this repeat visit I was impressed how quick check- in was and this is one Hilton property that seems to remember to acknowledge Hilton Honors members with greeting and treat. A small gesture but nevertheless is noticed. The compact size of the hotel avoids long corridor walks and long waits for the elevator. The top floor bar/eatery has fine views of midtown including the Empire State Building. A nice find in an otherwise normal 'side street' but one with many eateries in walking distance.

Nice, modern and in a good location. Stayed only 1 night but the room was very comfortable and we even had the bonus of a $50 Bloomingdales gift card, something called the New York shopper deal, offered by hilton. WiFi was good, easy access to the subway, and whole foods is close by if you need anything.Will stay again at this hotel.

Upside: great hotel and rooms are very clean. breakfast variety/service is great as well!Downside: concierge is understaffed. lifts run slow during the evening hours and very poor gym facilities. typical New York hotel with quick guest turnaround; do little to remember repeat customers.

The Hilton hotel is really a great one. In total I would stay again there but the only problem is that elevators are too loud! Only thing what I didnt like was the neighborhood which was almost scary :)

Very nice hotel. The staff was wonderful. Very courteous and helpful. The doormen and the bell staff were great. Never had to wait for a cab! The bar lounge was wonderful and very relaxing. A great place to meet friends and just relax.The room was very clean, spacious and quiet. BONUS...the bed was very comfortable!I will visit again and would recommend to friends.

This hotel has a friendly, laid-back vibe that adds to a NYC stay. Rooms are on the small side, but comfortable and very well-equipped. Staff was friendly and accommodating across the board. There's a nice restaurant at the lobby level, and a rooftop bar with a view of the city. Location is excellent, near Chelsea and Flatiron.

I needed a hotel that was close to the lab my colleague and I were visiting. This fit the bill nicely. Everything was new and stylish. All of the staff were very friendly and accommodating. I didn't get a chance to use the gym on this trip so I have no comment on that. The breakfast was a little pricey but it is NYC. If I wasn't on a schedule I would've looked around outside of the hotel.

For the added price of a higher room (better view), the club noise kept us up. Room was also located near the elevator, so got a lot of the elevator traffic noise as well. A total of three nights stay, and the first night we had trouble with the smoke/fire alarm "chirping". So the battery needed changing... The second night we had bathroom light problems. The bulb was changed, but then went out again, but couldn't get changed until the next morning. These seem like minor inconveniences, but when added up... A trip that was meant for R&R ended up being more hassle than anything else.

Spent a few nights in times square with family in 2011. Nice hotel, whats expected of a Hilton. Had a awesome view of times square. During the visit it was still under remodeling/construction so the entrance was sorta hard to find. Other than that service and price expected from a Hilton.

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Loved the location. Walking distance to Times Square. The only negative was that the rooftop bar was closed due to an event. The bathroom shower was a plus to the room and there's a Rare restaurant inside the hotel.

I stayed one night in this hotel right now. I say one because I cancelled the remaining 4 nights and moved to another hotel.I am Hilton Honours Diamond and they did not care at all.this place was so insufficent I wrote a big complaint to Hilton Corporate afterwards.The worst reception staff ever. Of any hilton !!!!! I checked in in the morning and the girls not only showed any initiative, no they were too busy on their cellphones even to look at the HH line. I had to practically force them to work.Listlessly and rude they asked you ,not even a good morning,by the way , ""confirmation number? No i dont find you.no we don' have an executive lounge,no idea why not.this place is new" Rude, lazy and i had to come back for my free water which by the way was piling up in HH paper bags behind those unbearable receptionists.Then my suite.....an outright joke. So small at almost 400 us. So noisy, as if they were no doors at all. The lifts never ever coming, takes you like 10 loooooooong minutes everytime you want to get out. The biggest problem is the noise, you can not sleep because the walls are made of paper and the doors probably as well. The breakfast was good. That is why they got 2 not one point !!!! People there actually cared.but the overall Ambiance is just terrible. With staff like this you might run a concentration camp but not a hilton hotel......awful !!!!If you can do avoid this place !Truly Bad !!!!

Business travel can be exhausting. Having a comfortable, well-appointed room and professional hotel staff to assist makes ALL the difference when traveling. I was pleasantly surprised to find such comfort and professional service on a recent trip to New York for a business conference. Some hotels will stick you in the farthest corner when rooms are offered at "conference rates," but this was not the case at this hotel. The room was small (it was in the heart of the city) but complete; it was very comfortable,everything worked (!), very clean and the service staff were extremely accommodating. Even more important to me in the morning, the room service was prompt and the food was really good. I loved the location also: it was within walking distance to Penn Station, restaurants, Duane Reade and I even walked to the department stores on 5th.. I would definitely stay there again.

We needed to be in this area twice over the past 6 weeks. There are not as many hotel choices in this area as others in the city. The rooms are not very large but they were clean. The two things that I liked most were that the air conditioner worked very well and the water pressure in the walk-in shower was outstanding. However, be careful to turn the shower head toward the wall before you turn the water on or you will be blasted in the face with cold water. The hallways were always hot, but you don't spend much time there anyway. There was a lot of street noise so try to get a room as high up as you can (but not too high because the rooftop bar is very popular and loud.)

Stayed on business for two nights. Perfect location for where I needed to visit. Its in a quieter part of town, so be prepared to go a little way for a choice of restaurants.Its a shame wifi is not included in the room otherwise they would have got all 5 stars.

In general I liked my stay at the hotel. The location is very convenient and not too noisy. The room was good, clean and comfortable. Everything was working. However I never had the feeling I was staying at a Hilton. Not sure why it has the Hilton status. The number of elevators is limited (3) for that many floors, rooms, bar etc. The reception desk was not as friendly as I am used to at other Hilton hotels. But maybe that is just New York.

We stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for two nights during a weekend getaway. We had plans in the Meatpacking District, the Financial District, and Tribeca, so Chelsea seemed like a central location.The room was small, but this being New York, it was fine. The air conditioning was strong. The shower was fine, although I wish the shower head didn't look like a 1980s throwback. Water pressure was surprisingly good for being on the 20th floor. And our room had a view! I could see the Empire State building, which was great.The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They offered the hotel car instead of a cab when we were leaving. It was $48, which is higher than a cab to LaGuardia usually, but given the daytime traffic, we might have come out ahead using the car service.Food at the restaurant was pricy. Room service is pretty standard Hilton room service. Luckily, there is a ton of food within a block or two, so we didn't eat in the hotel other than morning coffee via the Keurig in the room.

great location very close to Penn Station and excellent service the roof top bar was relaxing after a tough meeting. One down side the ironing board was too small you could not refreshing up your clothing. Front desk staff very polite and knowledgeable
user_name:
Joseph J D
Marlton, United States

review_body: I stayed at the Hilton New York Fashion District Hotel for 2 nights during the Independence Day holiday weekend. Front desk staff were courteous and handled my check-in and check-out quickly and with a smile. The room was on a higher floor and was clean and a comfortable size for one person. I would say a couple would comfortably fit into the space too. The bath was well stocked with amenities (soap/shampoo/hair dryer) and towels. I also visited the rooftop lounge one evening and the views are wonderful and prices for a glass of wine are fair for an NYC lounge with this type of view.

The hotel is a reasonable choice and delivers the standard Hilton quality, but lacks style, unless you count the very debatable taste with which they have tried to be trendy. I didn't particularly enjoy staying here.

Hotel staff was wonderful. The helpfulness of the lobby staff and the hotel's ability to store our bags made our visit worry free. Also the restaurant staff during both of our breakfast meals were top notch. They were so polite and accommodating. We did witness other guests on the morning of July 4, 2014 that we felt were being rude to the waiter, and we hope he knows how much my husband and I appreciated his service when other personalities acted otherwise. Our room was extremely comfortable and the building is well kept. The lobby stocks subway maps with the hotel location marked to help out-of-towners like ourselves. I have already told a co-worker of this hotel and will recommend it to anyone else that tells me they plan to go to New York City. I honestly must say this is one of two of my best experiences staying at Hilton hotels, the other being a Presidential Suite for my wedding.

We spent 4 nights at the Hilton Fashion District during winter and had a wonderful time. The front desk is friendly and warm. Love the decor of the lobby, especially the paintings and the light installation. Room - The room was clean and well equipped. The size is cozy, the normal NYC standard. It has a desk and chair, great if you need to get some work done. They have a separate shelf for the mini bar where you can keep your belongings. The room decor has subtle hints of the Fashion District which is pretty cool. The bathroom was spacious, modern and stocked with great quality products.Location - You can easily walk around, obviously not walking distance to the touristy areas. I am pretty sure the metro stop is close by. Tonnes of supermarkets, restaurants, eateries, coffee shops etc. Penn Station is a 10 minute walk, so good option if you want to take a train to JFK.Food - The breakfast was great, we selected the buffet style. So the usual - fruits, oatmeal, bread, muffins, juice etc. Its nice and cozy and no one hurries you up to get done. Service - Staff is professional, friendly and very accommodating. We wanted to move to another room and the front desk was helped us with it. Definitely recommend it and would love to come back.

This hotel is in a fairly good location with MSG close and restaurants and a lot of shopping close by . Our room was somewhat small but clean with a comfortable bed. For me, the highlights were the friendly front desk staff, especially Mariam, (Gee I think that is her name but if not then the name is close) the sweet security guard Pat and the rooftop bar. The rooftop bar staff were also very friendly and the views excellent. The bathroom was spacious. Our air filter was dirty in A/C but once front desk was informed, the filter was changed out immediately. I would stay here again mostly because of kind staff, location, views and cleanliness of room. My only complaint is poor wi-fi.

Great hotel. Location in NYC is ok if you are wanting to go to south of Manhattan. Not really close to much. Will have to walk a while. Will not stay here again. Our bathroom flooded and it took them forever to get it cleaned up. We couldn't even all shower before we left.
user_name:
Prathyusha A
Florham Park, United States

review_body: The lobby may feel small with almost no place to sit and stretch. The corridors are very narrow leading up to the rooms. Now, when it comes to the rooms, they are aptly sized and cozy. Excellent location and moreover we got a very good deal. Over all the best place to stay, delivering a high value for money.

We enjoyed a one night stay at the Hilton New York Fashion District. The location was great, the room was very nice - bed and linens super comfy - bathroom very clean and spacious- very nice bath products! Roof top bar was not really "our scene" but it looked great with fantastic views. Would definitely recommend for a one or two night stay. Only one desk chair and one small stool-like chair though, would have liked a more comfy sitting place if I was staying longer. Two different subway stops nearby and convenient to just about everything.

It was very clean and in a great neighborhood, but it was rather inconvenient to not have free wi-fi in the rooms. And, not just not free, but $15/day. Even on a business trip I felt that was too expensive to get. Otherwise, room was super clean, great view, and the workout room was excellent for a hotel. The view from our room was better than the view from the rooftop bar.
user_name:
mllespear
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Had a great stay at the Hilton. The staff is friendly, rooms are clean and the view from the rooftop bar is awesome. Like most NYC hotels, the room is not very big (300 square feet) and the cost is about a dollar per square foot. The Hilton is within walking distance of many attractions, including Madison Square Garden, Broadway and Times Square. Restaurant is good and serves a fantastic burger. But the star of the show is the rooftop bar. Oustanding view of the Empire State building and the rest of the city. Prices are reasonable and food is available on weekends. Will defintely stay there again.

Stayed here on a Friday evening as a Hilton HHonors member and was absolutely delighted to be allocated a room on the top floor, with amazing views of lower Manhattan - Wall St. and Freedom Tower, etc. The room was well kept and presented, with a great shower and heavenly bed. Really great location, too - within walking distance of both Union and Times Square in either direction. Most of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful, concierge happy to book our airport shuttle. The only let-down was on check-out, I returned my key to the receptionist and was subsequently ignored - didn't ask how my stay was or if we would like to store bags, etc. This was the only downside to an otherwise really pleasant stay. The rooftop bar's view is spectacular!

My husband and I went here on our honey moon, to start we were happy at the hotel it was beautiful and very clean, but at check in arrived we were bomb shelled when they asked for $300 upfront for use of the mini bar and room service (despite if you don't want to use these services and this was not stated on any of our bookings) and had to hand over or we couldn't stay despite paying for our stay at the travel agents!! we were told we would be given the money/left over money back at check out (good job we were happy/wanting to use these services) however they need to tell future guests this before booking!. We then were taken to our room that was not ready for us after waiting at the door for 15 minutes we got moved to another clean room and as an apology offered us free wifi but we didn't have our devices for it and that was the end of that nothing else for the wait or inconvenience. This room was lovely clean and modern but the view was terrible just torn up back buildings so that wasn't nice to look at so wasn't a good start to add on to being so jet lagged!! The rare bar and grill was small but great and the deep fried oreos were amazing!!! the staff were friendly and inviting just loose the elevator guy makes you feel rather scarce than free as you go :/ would go back only to choose my own room with a nice view :)

My brother arrived at 8am in the morning. I had paid for the early check in so he was given hisroom right away. He had been on a red eye from California, it was so appreciated. Upon myarrival the staff where so helpful and took my husband's golf clubs and my large bag up to my room. The room was very clean and bed very comfortable. Thank you everyone at the Hiltonfor making our stay so enjoyable.

Stayed here for a basketball game at the Garden. It was for only one night, but what a convenient, excellent place to stay. Staff was very professional and spoke multiple languages. Very well trained and very knowledgeable about where to visit in the city. Close to just about everything you could ask for in Manhattan. Room was clean, on the 22nd floor, and very modern. Smaller than usual for Hilton, but that's what you get in the big city. I will be staying here again!

Thank you Hilton and staff for making our stay great. From the greeting at the front desk, the complementary bottle of wine for our anniversary, to accommodating late check out - the stay was wonderful. Conveniently located off the red line, walked to the high line, Chelsea, and many other spots. Would return for certain!!

Fabulous experience at this hotel. Great location, service and extremely comfortable bed. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend this hotel which we will stay at on our next NYC trip. Easy access to all areas of the city.

I stayed in the Hilton Fashion District for 4 nights in June 2014. My clean, well-equipped room was small by American standards, but perfectly in-line with my European expectations. The bathroom was small but perfectly formed, with a good selection of bath products available and also a proper hairdryer.I had some problems with the coffee machine, but these were resolved (user error) by the attentive staff in a time frame that suited me. Overall the staff were professional, courteous, well turned out, knowledgeable and present, even at odd times of the night.The room service was swift and good quality. I felt the Pinot Grigio was a little sweet and could have been colder, but I'm trying really hard to find a fault here.I was woken up at 0200 on two nights by the dustcart collecting rubbish from the restaurant. I don't think there's anything the hotel can do about that, but if your room is street side and a light sleeper, this is something to be aware of.I was unable to visit the rooftop bar as it seemed to always be booked out for private events, this was a shame, but that's life.I have no idea if my room was good value for money or not as it was pre paid for me by my company. I would definitely stay here again.

I booked this hotel at a last minute. The location was not important because I just needed a place to keep my things and sleep and shower. It's a nice Boutique hotel with just enough amenities for a short stay in the City. The roof top drinks are outrageous BUT as it is in New York, I guess it can be expected. The doorman was outstanding getting out on the street to hail a taxi for me. That is service if I've ever seen it!

I booked a room for 3 nights (Thursday - Sunday) using Priceline and paid $200 a night, inclusive of taxes and fees. For that price, I didn't have very high expectations. I was pleasantly surprised to find a clean, well-appointed room. The location is also good - just a short walk to the West Village and the High Line. One downside is that it gets loud on the weekends, but I think that's pretty standard for city hotels. The ear plugs provided in the nightstands were helpful, as was cranking the A/C for white noise. A couple of tips: We were in a handicapped-accessible room, which I think provided extra space. Also, ask for a high floor and a room facing out onto 26th Street. Also, visit the rooftop bar if time permits. The view is stunning and it doesn't get crazy crowded until late in the evening.
user_name:
Samantha L
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We spent 5 weeks travelling the US and found this hotel to be the worst, most disappointing of our trip.I know NYC hotel rooms are small and overpriced. I accept that. However, we were very let down by this hotel.We stayed for 7 nights over Christmas.Check-in was easy enough, and I was pleased to hear we'd been placed on the top floor. However, there was no offer to take our bags to our room. Normally we don't take staff up on it anyway, but after lugging them from Penn Station, it would have been nice.Upon arriving at the top floor, we were shocked and wondering if we were in the right place. There were mattresses against the walls - we could barely exit the lift. There was a desk in the hallway and there was an office chair pushed up against our room's door. Fire hazard much?!? We had to move the office chair - difficult given the hallways are narrow and were full with furniture already. We had to walk sideways and lift our heavy suitcases as the walkways were blocked and they couldn't be rolled normally.Once in the room, we called reception to ask what was going on - was this floor a storage floor? We weren't informed of the mess when we checked in, so were surprised when we arrived on the floor.Whomever we spoke to, didn't know what was going on, so put us through to someone else, who also didn't know. They then said they'd call back. We received the call back and were advised there were some renovations going on and they would be done by the evening. That's nice... How about telling guests on check in (and offering to help with the luggage if it is going to be difficult to manoeuvre). This was a very disappointing welcome to the Hilton fashion District.The room itself was small (we can live with that, it was expected) but it was so dark. It was lit by the bedside lights, two small lights on the walls, and a desk light. As the carpet and furniture was dark, the room remained the same. We were constantly loosing balck socks, scarves and beanies on the carpet - put it down and it would blend in and the light was not sufficient to be able to relocate it.Also, the airconditioning unit was so loud! Despite being December, the room became warm and stuffy and air didn't flow in the window well. We had to put the aircon unit on, but it sounded like a jet taking off. Trying to sleep with the noise was hard.The room was clean and neat, and the bathroom was nice - great shower.The other thing that surprised us was the unfriendly nature of the staff - everywhere else we stayed we were warmly welcomed by everyone we came across, be it the doorman or otherwise. Here, we never even got a smile from the doormen/security, despite saying hello/morning.The rooftop bar was nice (though it closed early a couple of times, so we were only able to visit once). Staff up there were attentive and friendly.We received a voice message on our room phone, as I have a Hilton rewards card (not with many points mind you) on the LAST day from the guest service manager, just checking if she could help with anything. This was a bit redundant.... We stayed at a Homewood by Hilton in Albany, and received the same call. However, it was within the first few hours of arriving and much more useful. An overall poor experience - you'll see from my previous reviews of places, I don't generally have a bad thing to say - but this time, I was disappointed. I'm sure there are other NYC hotels offering better service and value for money.

The best thing about this hotel is it's location, it's close enough to everything, and far enough to sleep good at night. We got there earlier than booked and everyone helped us to get confy enough to rest after our long trip from Ecuador. The rooms are neat, and the stuff is great, the only bad thing about it is that it does not offer breakfast (not accetable in a 4 stars hotel) and we had to look for it in the zone, not a problem, considering it's location. Would go back!

I did reservation via Travelpony but I realised during my stay general price level was almost same.So there was not really good price on Travelpony. The room is very avarage they are charging for internet connection officially but I asked the front office to free access some how they supply the passcode. Clean nice bed but incredibly noise rooms on street side even at 12th floor. Automatic minibar placed in the room there s no any extra space even for your pills!! Do not touch the minibar there is "no cancellation" warning" inside the door. Rooftop bar has heavy security but nothing else.. Location is very positive in two block to Brodway there is great restaurant Maysville

I came to stay at this hotel for a five night City break with my wife and we were not disappointed. The location is excellent for exploring NY with three subway lines and Penn Station just a few blocks away. We had some issues with our booking when we arrived which the staff sorted out very efficiently. I'm sure being a Diamond Hilton Honours member helped, but we were very pleased with professionalism of the staff after an eight hour flight. The hotel is fairly modern with small (like most rooms in NY), but clean and well appointed rooms with very nice bathrooms and comfortable beds. Our room on the 19th floor had a lovely view of the Empire State Building. It can be a little noisy at times but this is NY and no different to other hotels I have stayed in in the city. The hotel has a pretty good roof bar which can get quite lively on the weekend and is a good starting point for a night out. It is a little cumbersome to get in as hotel guest seed to queue with non guests but never too much of an issue. Would happily stay at this hotel again on my next visit to NY.

To me this was very centrally located to the places I needed to visit while in Manhattan. I was able to walk (if you choose to do so) to many places to eat and visit. I found that the restaurant on the premises was beyond adequate and especially my complimentary breakfast was outstanding! I ended up getting a special rate and double the points for roughly $119/night. I was not complaining about that considering it was a hilton and had a modern feel to it being that you are in the fashion district. Definitely an option when in town.

Nice stay at the Hilton for one evening. Booked through Hotels.com so figured I would get the interior closet room. Was small but well appointed. Comfortable bed. Clean. Looks to be a somewhat newer property. Convenient to Penn Station and subway close by.

It was a great experience staying at Hilton NY Fashion District. Great location, walkable distance to all the attractions in Manhattan.The rooms were clean, modern. Most of all, the staff were amazingly friendly. Here, I have to thank Michael Schiller for taking care of my ipad which I left behind after check out. I just received it via FedEx. Thank you! Definitely we will stay again.

Staff was friendly- gave great subway directions... Roof top bar was a blast... Clean rooms... Comfy bed... Quick elevators... Will hold your bags before and after check out... Love love love love this hotel

This hotel was chosen for me fo a business trip, but I would definately choose to go back there again myself.My room was on the 5th floor and looked into the centre of the surrounding buildings, so not so attractive and did make the room dark. However I wasn't in there much so it was fine, and also once the blinds were shut and the lamps on it was lovely. The room although close to the lift was also very quiet which was a nice suprise, and I had 3 great nights sleep.The room facilities were excellent - a good coffee machine, great shower, comfortable bed. The staff were friendly and helpful too.Breakfast was either from the well stocked buffet, or from the menu, all pretty good.I got to the roof top bar once, but unfortunately not at night so couldn't experience the views. The roof top bar was very busy, very noisy and the drinks were served in plastic glasses which doesn't add to a great cocktail experience. I understand the safety aspect of plastic glasses but as someone in the trade themselves I know that very good quality hard plastic glasses can be commonly found now which would give a better customer experience.WiFi was free in the lobby and $15 per day from the room.It was a great stay and I would highly recommend it.

I chose this hotel primarily because of location and I wanted a well-known branded hotel. Location was excellent with easy access uptown or downtown. Neighborhood was good. My room was on the street side and I was awakened middle of night by rowdies out on the street. But I was very pleased with how quite the hotel was overall. No slamming doors and noisy plumbing to wake me up. While I was there for business, I would definitely bring my family back here for a leisure trip.

The hotel was very clean, the hospitality was fantastic. Bar drinks were a little pricey but it's New York. The worse part, no Coors Light. Lol. The restaurant/bar food was fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
user_name:
Kim H
West Palm Beach, United States

review_body: Booked this hotel for 3 day / 2 night getaway to the big apple. The hotel has a new and modern feel. Convenient location with quite a few cafe's close by to catch a bite at anytime. Walking distance to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller. The staff was very friendly. Allowed me to use their restaurant for some work even though I did not order anything. Stored luggage for a few hours after check out time. The concierge was proactive to ask if we needed a taxi at the time of departure. The front desk happily obliged with free WiFi, to keep us connected.

I would like to say a few things about my stay at The Hilton Fashion District New York Hotel.1. The location was great.2. The room was great.3. The noise was not great.The doors at that particular hotel were very noisy. Not squeaky, but very loud when they closed. Everything there is modern and nice. Why not have the doors close quietly?4. The housekeeping staff were also noisy outside of my room where their equipment closet was. 5. When I checked in, I had two friends with me and we were hot and tired from walking. I asked my friends if they wanted some water as I stood in front of the receptionist.When they said yes, I asked the receptionist for a few bottles as there were about 50 across the desk behind her.How many bottles did she give me? One! As I passed the lonely bottle to my friend, I reached out to the receptionist for another with both arms extended. After catching her eye again, she gave me only one more bottle leaving me to share a bottle with my other friend.Really?? Did we look as if we were not deserving of a bottle each? Did I not pay enough for my stay there? Ahhh...Maybe because i wasn't wearing a suit. Nooooo....Well.... I wanted to not elevate the situation and I was there to have a good time and choose not to stay another night there. Other than that, everything was cool.
user_name:
ErikHargrove
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I've become a rather frequent Hilton Hotels guest lately (have always been an SPG aficionado), and I must say that this is one of the nicer rooms I've had in some time. A new hotel bathroom is always welcome in NYC when most hotels tend to have very outdated, cramped bathrooms. I was in town for work, but this location allowed for easy access to all that I needed.I will definitely stay here again!

The hotel was really great! Only stayed one night. Rooms were very clean. It had everything we needed. I wish the mini bar refrigerator was such that you could put items in it but it wasn't. By no means was this a make or break deal. Bed was comfy. Bathroom was great! Clean,great toiletries. Bathroom had a sensor light which I though was a nice touch as I go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. Came on automatically vs me trying to find it! My room was facing the street so it was a little nosey but that didn't bother me. The girl at the front was not very warm and welcoming. She was efficient at getting me checked in early and coordinating bag pick up just not to friendly. Again not a make or brake it. Over all GREAT value for the city. Good location away from the craziness of mid town. I will stay here again.

My stay at this hotel was very pleasant. The rooms are nice. The concierge was very knowledgeable and super friendly. He helped guide us on our adventures through the city. The subway is close. The breakfast buffet was super yummy and affordable. I would stay here again.
user_name:
Linda O
west covina, United States

review_body: Just returned from 4 day mother/daughter Memorial Day weekend trip! This was my 5th trip to NY but first time staying in the city. I usually take train from Newark hotels. Searched for NY hotel <$200/pn and found great deal on expedia. This location is between 6th and 7th avenue which is walking distance to many locales. Within it's immediate block, there isn't much but 2-4 blocks away you have Kornerstone Cafe, Argo Cafe, other eats and plenty of options just 2+ blocks over. When crossing 6th Ave on 26th Street, you can see World Trade building on clear day. Off 7th, lots of shops and some dining options. That's just what you have when you turn the corner....Tried to take advantage of rooftop bar/dining when it didn't rain on Saturday or Memorial Weekend, but it was closed due to private party. A few blocks down at 23rd Street seems to get most of the subway lines, just depends on which train dictates which Ave. to catch it on. Taxis also easy to catch here as Holiday Inn and another hotel also on 26th. RARE dining for appetizers and desserts was good. Chelsea shopping and dining near though we did not stop by (but saw how close from the taxi taken on rainy evenings). Google map how close it is to other locales. My teenager daughter and I walked all the way up to Rockerfeller even with no issue. Loved loved passing thru Madison Square a couple times, sitting on bench with either view of Flatiron or Empire State bldg. Bike rental location just off Madison Square if you are into biking thru city.Area is more low-key ("less crowded") than the Times Square area which is a plus!Room Quality:- trendy but simple decor, comfy & clean bed- standard room (for price I don't care), no view. It's NYC and a holiday weekend- rarely if ever did we hear neighboring rooms and based on door placement, we are likely very close in proximity- bathroom size decent and clean. Door to restroom just inches away from edge of the bed... that's how cozy room is.- closet is tiny, but enough to hold 8 -12 hangers. I travel 25% of year so I know how to pack clothing for multiple outfits- lobby staff... pretty bare but I'm going to NY to see the city and not be pampered by staff. Spend the $$$$ if you want that experience :)

Accessible to subway and seems like half-way to most tourist spots. Don't get me wrong, the room is tiny, but that's pretty much what you get in NYC unless you want to pay for a ridiculous price for one. Their staff is awesome as well, breath of fresh air and always helpful Gotta give a shout out to Christine and the really good looking bellhop guy. Always smiling and willing to go the extra mile. Actually, all staff we encountered did. We had a great time in the Big Apple and a fab stay. Keep it up!

We have stayed at this hotel before and it was so nice that we wanted to stay here again. This stay was just as nice as the last time. Convenient location, reasonable price, clean, nice bathroom products, comfortable bed. The staff was very nice. The lobby area is nice. We would stay here again.

I travel to New York a good deal and marvel at how much the block and the surrounding neighborhood have changed in the past 3-5 years. I began staying in this area as the Vamoose bus from DC starts about five minutes from my home and drops me off at 30th and Seventh Avenue, a two minute walk from this hotel. And, of course, this is a block or two from Penn Station, where I end up after taking the train should the bus not work. There are now a wide variety of bars and restaurants that serve local - expensively not this is NYC - so you do not need to take a taxi or subway or walk more than a few minutes for dinner or a drink. And given the proximity to the train and bus stops, you can save a bunch on taxis. I am focusing on this convenience because the hotel is just that, a hotel. Excellent service, it has a bar and breakfast and WiFi and so on. It appears to be newly renovated and was immaculate. Any downsides? The AC/heat turns on and off with some gusto, I wear earplugs on the road, you may want to take this into consideration. The room service and bar are ridiculously expensive compared to what you can walk to, as to be expected, and if you are expecting a room that is as big as the one you will get in some Tea Party state, forget it, this is New York. Oh, they charge for WiFi, turn your smart phone into a hotspot, cell service was excellent in my room. Bottom line: I will be going back.
user_name:
Michael S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Although the rooms are small, the location allowed me to walk to art fairs, film opening, Garage Flea Market, quilt show, and great restaurants. I definitely will stay here again. Next time I'll try to get an upgrade for a more spacious room.

This hotel was selected by my company's travel coordinator for this trip, as it was close to my destination. Overall the hotel met my expectations, as other guests mentioned the rooms are not big, but hey it is New York. I can confirm that the rooms are actually bigger than several other hotels of different chains in the direct area. The hotel has a great bar, restaurant and rooftop bar if you are looking for that kind of entertainment. the TV channels are a bit limited which will make a trip to the bar or rooftop an easier decision for most of us. I certainly will return to this hotel on future trips.

Booked the Hilton in Garment District for a Christmas visit. Front desk staff friendly and professional. Not a great view from our window, but that's what sightseeing is for. Room relatively small but appointed nicely and with mini-frig, roomy bath. Comfortable bed (always appreciated). Convenient location to head uptown towards Rockefeller plaza or downtown to financial district and tour boats. Eataly within walking distance - great foods, beverages, cheeses, wines, beer, and restaurants. We found a bargain rate for NYC, especially at Christmas. We'll definitely return.

Rooms are standard size for NYC, but bath surprisingly roomy in comparison to room. Hotel staff extremely accommodating and friendly. Location is convenient, within walking distance to many attractions, with a good overall feeling to the neighborhood. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip.

I booked this room through priceline, name your price, the day before and received a reasonable price. The room was larger than other NYC hotels where I have stayed. The bathroom adequate. It was located on a high floor. The elevator system is ridiculous, you are required to swipe your room card in the elevator for the elevator to operate. You are only allowed on your floor. Our roomcards did not work all the time and we didn't know so we rode the elevator with the other passengers only to find it didn't stop on our floor. We stayed for only one night and left our car and baggage after check out with no issues. The staff could be more attentive and helpful. Lots of staff loudly interacting with each other in the lobby but not with the customers. We tipped well as we usually do so I don't think that was an issue. The bellhop/car person was much better than the front desk staff.

We went to NY for a girls shopping trip and stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for 5 nights. Getting there from JFK was easy with a cab offering a flat fare. The hotel is conveniently located at 26th street and 7th avenue which is close enough to walk to Time Square but also close to the subway if you don't want to walk. Several subway entrances of different lines are within 5 to 10 mins walking distance of the hotel which makes it very easy to reach all the area's you want to go.We were on the 17th floor with a very nice view on the Empire State Building although we only discovered that the second day since it was hidden by the fog on the day of arrival. The room had a very comfortable King Size bed and a well-equipped bathroom with the needed toiletries. It was not a big room but who needs a big room when you're in New York and spend most of the day outside the hotel anyway? I guess I'm a light sleeper and not used to all the noise of the traffic and siren’s at all times of day and night so the first 2 nights I did not sleep that well. Fortunately I found some earplugs in the nightstand as a service from the hotel and slept much better the remaining nights. The breakfast served in the restaurant is plenty to keep you going well past lunch time so we were full of energy starting the day.We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel and will definitely consider this hotel for a next trip.

We loved being in Chelsea. So location is great. The rooms are somewhat small but not bad. The rooftop bar was absolutely hopping on a spring Saturday night. The view from the rooftop is quite good. Everything is clean but showing a little wear in a few places. Staff was super friendly. We did not eat in the restaurant except for breakfast but breakfast was always good with strong coffee. The restaurant staff during breakfast was super. Overall a very good stay in NYC. We will definitely stay here again. It is not cheap....but for New York City the room rate is not bad.

My first concern in a hotel is if it is clean, this hotel is VERY clean the rooms are small, but very clean. It is close to just about everything, but once again the hotel is VERY CLEAN. There is a dining area, but it is nice to get out of the hotel since everything is right at your door step.

This is a good hotel option. Standard Hilton as far as room comfort and cleanliness. The room was much smaller than what I would normally expect but that might just be NYC for you. The lobby had much more of a chic, fun, stylish feel than most Hiltons. Clean lines, trendy music, young crowd ... I felt like I was in a hip lounge, not a hotel lobby. Good location for touring NYC as it is out of the hectic Times Square neighborhood but still midtown which makes many neighborhoods accessible by foot. Loved the Peter Thomas Roth toiletries in the bathroom - nice touch. Overall, a good hotel and would stay again.

It was my second stay at Hilton New York Fashion District and both times it was a pleasant experience. The location is very convenient, close to all the sightseeing, to Broadway and to subway connections. The hotel is nice and clean. The room was decent size (for Manhattan) with very nice bathroom. Staff at the reception was friendly and helping.I will be probably staying here again when coming to Manhattan. Some points to improve:- although requested I was not in the high floor room- when I put a Privacy sign on my door I do not expect a knock on my door every half an hour.

This hotel is in a great location - convenient to Whole Foods, subway and the Village. Rooms are small but bigger than many similar hotels. Bathroom was excellent. Our coffee machine didn't work but within 15 minutes someone had taken the old one and replaced it with a new one - stellar service! The exercise room is also excellent and included in the room charge. I had a wonderful view from my room of the Empire State building too! The major irritation was the charge in room for each separate device for internet - 14.95. Very steep! And at over $300 a day seems really unnecessary. In general I'd probably stay there again unless I could find a less expensive room at a reasonable hotel.

I have stayed at most of the Hilton brand hotels in the area - as my husband is a diamond member and we travel to NY frequently. I like staying in the Chelsea area, convenient to most everything in NYC. Hotel is a typical NYC hotel, with small lobby area and rooms are on the small side. But having stayed the prior week at the Doubletree in the area, the rooms here seemed large. Enjoyed having some counter space in the bathroom and the fact that there was actually a makeup mirror in the room. Free breakfast buffet for diamond members is more then adequate, but probably wouldn't choose to pay to have breakfast at the hotel as there are so many wonderful places to eat in NYC. Rooms were quiet, clean and comfortable, staff was pleasant and helpful and location can't be beat.

There are a number of other hotels in the area, thus there are plenty of other options for places to stay in this area of the city. For this visit, the location was perfect for a business trip and the other reviews helped make me comfortable with that choice. Room was comfortable and appeared to be clean and very well maintained. The room was not huge, but certainly would be considered on the larger side for a lot of Manhattan hotels where rooms tend to be pretty small on average. The prices for some on site options such as having to pay for in-room Wi-Fi access and the mini bar was a bit over the top. When you can get decent Wi-Fi free at many average hotels, there is just no reason for this any longer. However, this was countered with the excellent on site restaurant which featured pretty reasonable prices for the area. Getting into the elevator required your room card, which I found to be a major annoyance and headache since I was always carrying things in and out due to being there on business (laptop, papers etc). Add that they basically shut off access to one of the elevators to make it available for their rooftop bar patrons, it was pretty annoying when you just want to get back to your room after a long day. But since the elevators were reasonably fast more often than not, it was not a huge problem.Pros:-Clean well maintained rooms-Good on location restaurant-Less than two blocks walking distance to two supermarkets, CVS, Starbucks, Dunkin DonutsCons:-Elevator access can be an inconvenience sometimes-Lack of included in-room WiFi ($14.95 per day / but they provide free WiFi in the lobby or restaurant)-Expensive mini-bar with no option to use any refrigerator space of your own

Arrived late Friday night the 16th May and quick but very un-personal check-in. Room very dark and small, bathroom was not clean. Coffe machine not working. Luckily I got another room on a top floor, but had to insist since 7 night stay for $399 pr night is a bit pricy from my pov. 2 nights now in new room and the maid still forgets to remove the garbage (places it on the floor) and the cleaning is overall not that efficient. Closet door is not working nor does the coffee machine - have kindly asked the reception to look into this, but has not been fixed yet. Water in shower takes a long time to get warm and the design is not functional since it has to be turned on in the shower = cold water all over the place..So too expensive for quite an average room - however the location is ok

I arrived at the hotel at 10am knowing that check in was not until much later, yet the attendant at the front desk was eager to check if there was a room available so we could check in right away, there wasn't but her attentiveness was all that mattered, we stored our bags, came back from lunch and was checked in hours before 3pm. We were given the exact room I had requested through my online reservation note, high floor and away from elevator. To my surprise the second day the manager called my room to make sure all was well and to my satisfaction. This service was consistent the three days at the hotel. Convenient location and great view from room 2212 made for a great stay.

My boyfriend and I stayed here from the 2nd - 9th May. I had emailed ahead to tell them that we were coming for my boyfriend's birthday. When we arrived, we were checked in very quickly. All staff were lovely and very receptive. We stayed in room 2109. The room was spacious, very clean and the view was excellent. We had a lovely view of the empire state building and the lights at night were amazing. Someone kindly brought up a complimentary bottle of champagne, a happy bday hat and a card for my boyfriend. A couple of minor cons were that one of the security guards looking after the lift to go to the rooftop was a bit of a jobsworth. Whilst we can understand that they don't want just anyone on the rooftop, he was a bit too dedicated towards policing the lift which was annoying at times as we just wanted to get our floor. Also, and this is down to individuals rather than the hotel, there was quite a bit of noise and someone tried to enter our room during the early hours of the first morning. I suspect these people were drunks navigating their way from the rooftop bar. Perhaps the security guard mentioned before could've better spent his time ensuring people got to their respective rooms or out of the building. However, this was raised with reception who were very sympathetic and this not an issue for the duration of our visit.With these exceptions, it was a wonderful stay at a premium location which offered easy access to Times Square and Broadway and we would definetely stay here again on our return to New York. Thanks guys :-)

When staying in the Chelsea area of New York City I've found this hotel to be a consistently positive and reliable experience. The rooms are small but quite adequate, especially for New York City. They are clean and comfortable and the staff is always friendly and helpful. There's a restaurant/bar on premises but in this area of NYC there are just so many options. The hotel is conveniently located and close to both Penn Station and the NY subway system stops. You really can't go wrong staying here. I highly recommend it.

I enjoyed the whole experience, from the friendliness of the staff, my room was available for early check-in, the view was AWESOME, easy check-in, check-out, room was bigger than I expected, clean, and checking my bag with bell service, the caps they wore added a special touch to their service. I will be back!

Excellent accommodations, staff and value in the heart of NYC! I travel to NYC on business frequently and have stayed at many hotels. Few measure up to the standards and value of this hotel. I'll definitely be back

Rooms are generous size for NYC, Hotel is centralized so it is easy to get to anywhere, Restaurant has excellent food and the roof top bar has some amazing views! The staff is very friendly and helpful.
user_name:
Terrence B
New York City, United States

review_body: Stayed here for a business trip on my own. Room was smaller than I've previously had but was comfortable enough for the little amount of time I spent there. Clean room, brand new facilities, friendly staff.

Wow, from the distant, almost robotic staff to the bland hospital-like hallway and room decor, to the boring bar, this place is about as interesting and memorable as a .....see I already forgot. Beds are a bit worn and saggy, to boot. Granted, rate was moderate for nyc in April ($260), you can do far better for the money, including the new holiday inn a few doors down.

The staff at this hotel was very friendly and helpful. We had a room on the top floor with a view of the Empire State Building. Our room was compact but well-designed to maximize the space. They have a Keurig in the room that offers both coffee and tea. There is a rooftop lounge above this fllor that blasts music, but even as a light sleeper, I didn't hear a sound when I went to bed. The room was nicely decorated and I loved the walk-in shower instead of a bathtub. The room was kept very clean. My only complaint about the room were the towels. They were a little raggedy in our room. This location is perfect! We were easily able to walk to Madison Square Garden/Penn Station or catch a cab to a Broadway show or to the Village. We would definitely stay here again.

I stayed here for one night, everything was OK, employees at check in and check out were really helpful. The room is small, but thats the way almost all hotels are in NY if you dont want to pay big cash,The only bad thing about this hotel I could tell you, is that when we got to our room there was some toilet paper in the toilet, not dirty but this is not normal. Oh and no one to help with your bags, the doorman just saw how me and my wife got our bags out of the cab.Good location in fashion district.The room wasnt noisy at all, NY can get noisy at night if you sleep in a lower floor in some hotels.The next day I stayed at the Hilton garden inn, it was cheaper and a more basic hotel, but at this Hilton they charged you for wi fi, and in Garden Inn it was free.

Stayed at the Hilton Fashion District recently for work. Hotel is fine. The staff were really excellent. Very friendly and accommodating. I had two complaints: 1) My room was a bit rundown. For a new hotel, I was surprised that things did not seem cleaner, crisper. 2) The hotel is loud. Kind of thin walls. Loud area of NYC, but it was too loud for me. Nothing bad, just a bit of an annoyance.

This a great hotel with modern rooms and nice amenities. The staff is warm and welcoming. the restaurant serves a great made-to-order breakfast. There is also a buffet. Dinners are excellent as well. I recommend it for business or family travel when in Manhattan.
user_name:
William B
Louisville, KY, United States

review_body: Great location, easy access to all of N.Y. from this location. Nice clean hotel, staff very helpful, good food and pleasant employees. Would recommend to anyone, will stay again. Nice location in the Fashion District, close to all major events and important areas of the city. It's very safe and clean hotel with staff always wanting to help. Great Red Roof lounge and view of city, nice to take pictures at night.

This is my favorite place to stay when I'm in New York. I always try this hotel first and snag it if it is available. It is pretty, clean, and has a good restaurant and a rooftop bar. The staff is friendly and helpful. I've always had a great experience, but this last trip brought it to a new level. I left my glasses behind and the staff couldn't be more helpful in finding them and getting them sent back to me quickly. A big shout-out to Michael Schiller, the Housekeeping Manager, who took the time to call me, package up my glasses so they didn't get crushed, save me money sending them back, and then followed it up with an email to let me know they were on their way. You just don't get customer service like this anymore! Michael Schiller, you are awesome!!!!!

the Hilton has fair sized rooms and bathrooms, a really comfortable bed, clean rooms, nice lobby, central location- we had a great stay overall. There is free AT&T Wi-Fi if you are an AT&T customer. No ice machines but you can call for ice to be brought to your room. Mini bar but not the kind where you can make use of the fridge.

Recent 4 night stay for business. Had also booked a (very expensive) conference room for one day of in-hotel meetings. Hotel room on 22nd floor (top floor), room we well appointed, but pretty small - more in keeping with what I expect in Europe than the US. A bit too claustrophobic if traveling with someone else. However, it was one of the quietest NY rooms I've ever stayed in. When the window was closed the sound of the city was literally blocked. I've grown used to hearing sirens all night in NY, but that was not the case at the Hilton. Room was kept immaculate by very dedicated housekeeping staff. Elevator requires room key to be swiped in order to get to your room, so you can only get to the floor you're room is on. This is a nice added security feature, but can be a bit annoying when your hands are full and you just want the elevator to take you up (and not have to fumble for your key to get it to operate). I appreciated the security, but it made me wonder if the area required this extra step. Hotel is close to Fashion Institute of Technology, area is quirky, but there is a great Italian place (Tre Dici) that hotel recommended for dinner that was great (and just a few doors down from hotel). Attendant assigned as food/beverage liason for conference room was the best (thanks George!), he was very attentive and helped me and my guests with all our requests. Had room service one night and the food was very good and was delivered quickly. All and all a nice place with excellent staff.

It was hard to believe I was in NYC or a Hilton. This property is an embarrasment to both the city and the chain. The room is one of the smallest in square footage I have ever seen, add to that the abysmal decor, the terrible lighting, the lack of any amenities ie, ice bucket etc all adds up to a place you dont want to stay. The only postive review is of the breakfast which is of relatively good quality.

My husband is a Hilton Honors Diamond member who travels extensively for business and stays almost exclusively at Hilton properties. Therefore, we accumulate a large number of Hilton points that come in handy for family vacations. We stayed at Fashion District Hilton for a short family trip to NYC, which included my husband and myself, our daughter, and my 98-year-old father. We had reserved three rooms for two nights - with one of them being a handicapped room (for my father). Although he is not disabled, we had discovered during previous trips that not all hotels have grab bars in the bathtubs; therefore we wanted to be sure my father would be safe. When we arrived at the hotel around 2:00 pm, we were told that our rooms were not ready; so we went downstairs to the restaurant for a snack. When we returned to the front desk at 4:00, we were told that two of the rooms were ready but that the handicapped room would not be ready until 7:00 p.m. as the guest in the room was ill and we would "have to wait." That was completely unacceptable. Whether or not one is a Hilton Diamond member or just a first-time guest, the rooms are supposed to be ready for occupancy by no later than 4:00 p.m. This was especially important for my 98-year-old father, as he was tired and wanted to rest. If that particular handicapped room was not available, then other arrangements should have been made; but the staff at the front desk did not even try to accommodate us. My 98-year-old father had to wait another three hours for a room; and when we complained, the young woman at the front desk raised her voice to us and did not even apologize for the delay. She just said "I told you that you would have to wait." Well,she certainly did not have the authority to make that decision and in my opinion should have been fired. To make matters worse, our room was at the end of the hall and the staff kept banging doors all night; and we ordered room service and were overcharged. The restaurant was down a steep flight of steps and had a very limited menu and poor service. My husband eventually spoke to the manager and we had all of the points used for my father's room refunded to us. We found the ultra-modern decor to be uncomfortable and unfriendly, and I would never stay there again. This location might be OK for college students and young couples, but it's not family friendly at all. Of all of the Hilton hotels we've been to over the years, the staff at this particular location was the least professional.

I stay at many hotels throughout the year due to extensive business travel and this Hilton property has the feel of a swanky boutique hotel with all extras that you get with a Hilton. Great restaurant on the ground floor and hip rooftop bar at the top. Take my word for it...never stay in Time Square...this hotel is perfectly located and is the best choice for Manhattan.

This is the second time I have stayed here when on business in this part of NYC and the hotel hasn't disappointed on either occasion. My room, while not huge, was smartly designed to make the most of the space, with a very comfortable bed.The staff - from front desk to the concierge to the bar waitress - were friendly, helpful and capable. The hotel is also centrally located near two subway lines and an easy walk to Chelsea, Union Square, Empire State building and more. I will be back the next time I'm in the area on business.

This hotel is on the newer side and modern. My room was next to to the elevator and I never heard it. The rooms were clean and had all the outlets I needed for my technology. The gym suited my needs too. It was in convenient location for me to get to Midtown meetings on foot and downtown meetings by subway. I've already booked my next stay there

First off, the place was great. Prime location, tons of stuff around the area, very central. Rooms were a good size, especially for the price.We had left a pair of shoes in the room, but didn't notice until a week later. I called up the hotel, and they had them in lost and found. The housekeeping manager, Michael Schiller, shipped them back to us and saved the day!

Rooms were in great shape. Recently redone which is great. Good size rooms.Service and cleanliness also good. Personnel were helpful and kind. Something not always found in the city of New York. Ask for Melissa!!!

For a long Easter weekend in New York City, I chose to try the Hilton New York Fashion District after lengthy researching through TripAdvisor. Since I would be using HHonors points for my stay, I wanted to make sure it would be worth it. There are obviously numerous Hilton family properties in and around NYC and the better the location in Manhattan, the more points (or dollars) the property costs. The positives: the hotel is new and as such the quality of rooms, bathrooms, furniture, etc. is excellent. The service was also top notch; I received a welcome e-mail from a real, live guest-services coordinator (perhaps because of my Hilton Gold status), but still a welcome gesture. Front desk staff, bellman, and breakfast buffet staff were all courteous, prompt, and pleasant. The location of the hotel is a plus -just three blocks from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, two blocks from a subway stop. Midtown by definition is a central place to be in NYC since you're between the financial district and the Central Park area, and this hotel is good for that. The only negative is that the rooms, even the upgraded on I had, are very small. But most hotels in NYC have small rooms, and who spends a lot of time in their room anyway in New York? I did utilize the breakfast buffet, which was complimentary with my stay, but not sure if I would pay for that. Did not check out the roof top bar, but it definitely seemed popular. I would stay here again if I needed this location in NYC. Trip Advisor reviews were accurate and helpful for this stay.

I stayed here only one night on business. The location is great, and I was able to walk to an awesome off-broadway play starring Ethan Hawke. I had an amazing dinner downstairs in their restaurant. The room was on the small side but very chic and clean. They provided ear plugs on the nightstand (which I didn't end up needing). I had purchased food at a store and found that my room did not have a refrigerator. After calling the front desk, they had one delivered to my room right away. I wish I could have stayed longer!

great hotel ...good location.. subway friendly.. staff were excellent.. concierge service for directions were friendly and efficient.the check in personnel..the face of any hotel... one gentleman in particular was very friendly..sadly i did not catch his name but he is a man of colour who was working the day shift the week-end we were there apr-18-apr-20... ..he was very friendly and approachable...and most impressively he remembered my name at all times... a sign of a professional.. the room was a little on the small side but very clean and well appointed.. the roof top raw bar affords an excellent nighttime view of the city... i recommend this hotel without hesitation....

The room is very nice and clean, a little small, but the bathroom is large. My problem is that all the double rooms are on the back of the building and the view was of a wall. I am claustrophobic and the fact that I could not see ANY sky or sunlight was really difficult for me. When I asked the lady at the desk about changing rooms, she said to come back in the morning, she thought there would be an opening on the 22nd floor. But when I asked the next day there was a different woman was at the desk; and she said that because I had booked the room through a discount website, I could not switch rooms. There is no lobby to speak of--it is mostly a restaurant. There are two computers tucked away for guests use--that was great. There are only two chairs and some padded benches for guests to hang out in--although I think that was mostly for the patrons of the restaurant. It was not a lobby that one would spend any time hanging out in, as it was cold and uncomfortable. The roof top lounge and restaurant is only for adults, we had teens and they were not allowed to go there, even just to see the view. Saturday night is a big bar night, they have a bouncer with a walki-talki manning the elevator that goes to the roof top. The trendy restaurant is packed and there is a line for the lounge. We were never allowed to see the "incredible roof-top views!" So, no view from our room and no view from the roof top.This hotel would be great if you were one or two people with a room on the front of the building it has a view of the street or a family on a high floor--which is extra. Any double rooms bought through any site besides the official Hilton site will get you a lower floor room with a view of a wall. Very prison like indeed.
user_name:
zoe c
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hotel has a great location being mid way between Times Square and Greenwich Village, Soho, and other parts of lower Manhattan. The staff are all quite friendly and accommodating and our room was fine. But, if you want a quiet bar or restaurant, look for another hotel. The lobby level bar/restaurant has booming music and only high-top tables. There is no cozy place for a drink. The rooftop bar is open in the evening and might have a great view. But when we walked out of the elevator we were assaulted by the loud, booming music. We left promptly without getting a chance to look out.

I stay in NY about 40 weeks of the year for a few nights each week. Very familair with all the different choices. Moved to this hotel last Nov. Its excellent. The service has been fantastic. Neighborhood is good. For me service is very important. I left an important book behind on one trip and was very pleased with the care and attention Michael took to make sure I received it back. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable and service oriented hotel in a great location you will love this one.

We stayed at the Hilton New York Fashion District on January 2014 and I believe it was a good choice considering cost benefit. The neighbourhood is not atractive but it is not far from more atractive areas and there's a subway station nearby. The hotel is clean, relatively new and follows the standards you would expect from this brand, but the rooms are very small and you can hear every noise in the hallways. The staff at the front desk is not very friendly but they do their job. Anyway, it is not easy to find bigger rooms and friendly staff in NY unless you are willing to pay more...

Overall I thought the hotel was just fine especially for the Chelsea area and close to relatives and things to do. The beds were very comfortable, the roof was clean if not too roomy with 2 queens and 2 sets of luggage. The closet was extremely small, almost useless (a hotel in Paris's was bigger if that tells you anything). And with 2 women in the room a real problem. The bathroom was quite nice. However we had a couple of major issues here which I have to be resolved with the hotel. The first and most important is we asked for and got a special refrigerator to store very expensive medication for my guest. The problem was one night when we got back from our outings, we discovered the fridge was open, and turned off and her medication bag (a ziplock) had been opened. also the carpet was dirty, and obviously not vacuumed. Otherwise it was fine and things made up. Nothing seemed to have been removed from the fridge, but because the medicine was warmed to room temperature it was unusable and regarded unsafe. It takes a while with this stuff to notice how you feel when you miss a dose (or 2 or 3 in my friend's case), and she now does not feel well at all. She's back home in another country now. No one ever told us even tho we asked several times who was responsible for doing this or discussed it with us again before we left. We were in such a rush to make it to the airport with President Obama having just arrived and snarling traffic, I didn't have time to get into it again with the front desk staff who honestly were not that helpful the first time. I would still like an answer and some compensation for my friend's ruined medication. The other issue was a concierge member, whose name I will not mention booked a cruise for us off Chelsea Pier which took ages to accomplish with me standing right there, all over the phone and taking my credit card, etc, which we discovered after a $13 taxi down to the pier did not exist. The ship had been out of commission for 2 weeks. Since the person the concierge booked the tour with is in Brooklyn, I would assume she would know that. so all that time lost. It took at least another hour later with another concierge member who had no idea who the other person was (what is that about? you don't know your coworkers?) to straighten it out, another lost almost half a day. Supposedly I will get my card refunded. It was just all avoidable and no compensation for the incredible inconvenience not to mention embarrassment on my part as I was acting as host. So there were things I liked fine about the place, but those 2 issues will probably prevent me from staying there again even if I am not traveling with my friend with the medication issues. I picked this hotel not only because of the location but because of the great reviews of the staff. Some were quite nice, but overall the staff experience was spotty and unprofessional and could use major coordination and improvement to make a seamless customer service experience. When there is a serious concern as in our case, I do not want to be "handled" by the staff, I need answers and assistance.

Stayed here for a weekend getaway with my daughters. Stayed here once before and glad to return. Great location with easy access to the subway. Within walking distance to the Chelsea market and High line. Many great restaurants within walking distance or a short cab ride. Rooms are not huge but none are in New York. Was on the 22nd floor with great views of the city. Beds are comfy and rooms are not too noisy. Staff was helpful in getting us a cab upon our departure. Will return again.

I got room 1502 in the back facing another building. The room was even smaller than the room at Hilton's son DoubleTree in Chelsea (West 29th). The staff was nice. The room was very clean. The bathroom has an enclosed shower which is a plus. Good size too. As another reviewer mentioned, there are no hooks for the towels.The queen bed was very comfortable as were the pillows.I do not think we will be put in a high floor just for asking.
