I think (but am not sure) it all depends on the price we pay. I paid peanuts. The room was very cheap and on top of that, I am old so I was given a reduction on top of the original reduction. What a small room. Claustrophobic. I am very short but like huge rooms. Perhaps the very, very expensive rooms are bigger but I will never know ...

This was a very pleasant experience. The staff was so friendly and helpful ... they couldn't do enough to help. The room was small (not unusual in NYC) but adequate. It was clean and the bathroom was nice. The location was good ... only two blocks from the subway. And the price was good.
user_name:
Ellen A
St. Louis, United States

review_body: It's close to restaurants, shops and subway stations. Clean room, fast internet, nice staff. We arrived on a rainy day. We asked front desk staff to borrow umbrellas and were given three - one for each of us - and told to keep them. One of the front desk receptionist was so helpful with information when she learned we were in town to visit colleges, it definitely made a nice impression! Will definitely return or recommend to others. It's also a great value - costs similar to Best Western or alike but is much nicer.

My friend and I came back from a cruise to New York City, and, like most cruises, we disembarked in the morning. Hoping that all would go well, we went directly to the hotel. And, while the room was not ready, we were treated very courteously (not the "what are you doing here?" glaze that I have come across upon occasion). Our bags were taken and safely stored, we were offered bottles of water, and got great help getting a taxi (the young man who did helped with taxis would walk over to the main avenues and hail the taxi for us so we did not have to stand out in the cold rain! Very thankful). Later, we checked in to a very clean, nicely appointed room (warning for those visiting the Big Apple and not familiar with hotel rooms there, they are small). The location may not be everyone's cup of tea (says Fashion District but a bit of a hike to Macy's or the main shopping areas). That said, it was quieter than staying in some of the busier areas.I enjoyed the breakfast at this Hilton. We were offered the choice of buffet or ordering off the menu. Our waiter was very helpful (sometimes a bit too much enthusiasm that early in the morning), and our tea came promptly. All in all, this Hilton comes recommended by a frequent traveler.

This was a good place to stay - walking distance to a lot of great attractions, eating establishments, and the subway. The room was quite and clean. The staff was very nice and delivered good service.

Have stayed at the Hilton Fashion District at least 3 times for one to three nights each stay. Can't beat the location just 5 blocks from Penn Station and 7 blocks from Macy's and the main shopping district. Many shops and restaurants right outside their door. Rooms are on the smaller side, but, generally comfortable. Well wired and lots of spots to plug in. Bathroom counter is generously-sized (most important to me). Staff is very accommodating. Smaller-scale Hilton which makes it warmer and welcoming and not overwhelming. Fitness Center is small, but, clean and equipment appeared to be in very good shape (no pun intended). Restaurant on the premises. Good options for dinner. Breakfast buffet is o.k. Staff is terrific.

The HNYFD is a terrific place to stay - great location, clean + quiet rooms, and excellent customer service. The staff are super friendly and very helpful. A great experience all the way around! I'd recommend this location as it's not in the heart of midtown, which is more touristy that we usually like.

Nice location, nice staff, nice restaurant. But a little small for the room size. No view even for high floor. No free internet. Was waked up by noises in hallway. Bed and pillow are soft and comfy. I will definitely stay here again.

Stayed at this hotel for a birthday weekend celebration. It is a great new hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. We really enjoyed our stay here and the location is great. I would recommend this hotel to people who want to stay in this part of town.

Great location. Center to NY. Short walk to SOHO or Times Square. Friendly hotel staff. Roof top bar is a must see. Great view around the city 360. The area itself is a bit quiet but thats a good thing sometimes. Easy in easy out
user_name:
Jerry L
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: My sister and I stayed here last weekend and had a wonderful experience. In particular, the staff was across the board genuinely friendly, helpful and made us feel taken care of. We especially appreciated that the Assistant Manager, Ludin, went out of his way to help us find a restaurant that was just what we had in mind for the evening. Ludin spent the time to show us the rooftop area (closed this time of year, but looks like it is a fabulous place to hang out!) and listened to the type of cuisine and atmosphere we wanted, then directed us to some options that were terrific. We also received outstanding service from Brandon, and appreciated his friendly, upbeat personality. Location was great and very accessible to the places we wanted to go. Thanks for a great stay!

We had a great stay at the Hilton Fashion District. It's close to plenty of subway lines and it's easy to walk to most locations from Time Square to Washington Square Park (and Shake Shack which is a must for any visit). The room was clean and the beds were like heaven. Heating worked well, it did get a little cold in the bed by the window, but that's to be expected. The walls were a little thin, but wasn't a huge problem.Staff were helpful and responsive to emails before arrival which was great (thanks Melissa). I would definitely stay here again

Stayed at the Hilton New York Fashion District for only one night The location was good in the heart of New York's Fashion District, band even if the room was the size of a small ship's cabin, I believe a hotel's commitment should be to cater to the comfort of it's guests!. First it was the cordless phone that that didn't work. Thanks however to assistance from the hotel techie the phone was exchanged, only to discover that the Wi-Fi hook up through the hotel's solution with AT&T was playing up too. The techie was thankfully quick in resolving this problem by hooking us up to the hotel's Wi-Fi instead at no cost for us (Hilton otherwise still charges for this "luxury"). The next obstacle proved itself to be the cold weather in New York and I were surprised how poorly our hotel room seemed to be equipped for it. The entire window frame and insulation went into deep freeze mode. The ice cold draft along the floor made it impossible to keep my feet from freezing whilst sitting at the desk, working with the follow day's presentation. Later, the need to choose between "heating on", which meant an option of either noisy hot air "conditioner" keeping us awake, or "heating off" which is usually offers a comfortable sleeping temperature, made that night's sleep less than good.It's possible this hotel is better suited for milder days, but on colder days there are probably better choices.

We arrived in NYC via the Pennsylvania Train Station and were able to easily walk the approximately 6 streets to the Hilton New York Fashion District hotel (HNYFD). And, we are in our mid 60s. Our room may have been on the small side but it was very clean, updated and had a Keurig one-cup maker in the room. Our stay didn't include breakfast and we felt the RAVE Bar and Grill on their premise was on the high end. However, we were able to find a few places nearby to satisfy our needs. Agree with the other reviews the HNYFD is convenient to subway stops and other sights.

This hotel was great. The front staff were very helpful and the arrival and departure process was quick. The rooms were nice - small, but I'm told this was average for any NYC hotel. The rooftop bar was cool - it would be awesome to experience it in the summertime. Close to Times Square, Chelsea Market, MSG, etc.

a married couple getting away now and again is now frequenting this Hilton twice monthly...yes, great locale, but the staff? Unparalleled. You will not find the stuffy attitude which has given NYC hotels a bad rap...rather, you are greeted with smiles, laughs, water bottles, and the eagerness to please. Never once, in all my years of travel, have I written a review, but felt compelled here. Michael (super manager), I am sorry this comes to you late, but we misplaced your card. I felt compelled to write, as you and your staff have now solidified this couple as a twice a month visit, just "cuz". Because you and your staff ensured the safe return of my husband's watch, one that the staff knew was of value, but no one knew the sentiment attached to it. You ensured its safe return, with no strings attached, and I would like to personally thank the house staff when we check in tomorrow...I will refresh you with the dates of our last travel when I see you. People, book here. Every hotel has its issues, this spot makes up for everything before an issue arises.BestGin and David

I have stayed at the Hilton Fashion District at least half a dozen times now and look forward to staying there whenever I can when I am in NYC for Business or Pleasure. The Hotel Staff makes me welcome all the time I stay, the rooms are the quietest in NYC, and the location is ideal!

This hotel is located in a prime location in mid Manhattan, perfect location for your stay for site seeing and subways are not too far either. I stayed four nights here when scoping out the city and I'll stay here again when I come back to Manhattan again, rooms are good as well.

got a great rate on this hotel. very close walk to penn station. was able to easily catch subways and walk to many places in manhattan. as with most nyc hotels, the rooms were a bit tiny and the windows were a little odd. you obviously heard people in the hall, but not sure what you can do about that in a hotel like this.

Took my son to NYC for a Knicks game. Stayed at the Hilton Fashion District. You can't be disappointed with this hotel, especially if you want to be close to MSG. Beautiful new/clean rooms and a super-friendly staff. Great Stay.

Found this hotel too heavily overpriced. small room. mediocre service. tiny lobby. even the wifi in the room is not free. All that I could like was the brilliant view of the Empire State Building from my room.

This Hilton is a smaller property located off of the main streets in the Fashion District. It is a much more enjoyable experience than most of the larger hotels in the center of the massive tourists zones, yet it is very close to everything in lower Midtown. It feels updated and fresh. The rooms are clean and reasonably sized by NY standards. The staff was helpful and friendly. I will stay here again.

Great hotel in a central location. Staff was exceptional, rooms were clean and comfortable. Good value -- we looked into one of the value packages and saved money. Would definitely stay there on my next visit to NYC.

This hotel was quite clean with friendly staff. Fairly new and updated, and right in the heart of Fashion District in NYC. Just across the street was a designer's atelier, and you could see people working on their fashion designs - very chic. No complaints at all but here are the reasons this gets 4 stars and not 5 - the lobby seemed a little too bustly (noisy, loud, crowded) and the rooms were small (to be expected in NYC) but not particularly "wow." No complaints about the rooms at all, but they just weren't special. Average, small side, Hilton rooms.I can't wait to go back, though, and I want to stay here again so that I can spend more time walking around the Fashion District and shopping in all the cool places that surrounded the hotel. You can't beat the location!

This hotel is in a great location for walking to either Central Park or Lower Manhattan...room was a really decent size, with a fantastic view of The Empire State Building (we were on floor 22). Friendly, helpful staff and a great in-house restaurant (Rare). Highly recommended!

The rooms here are great. Fairly modern and comes with the standard amenities. This is not a full-service Hilton, so there's no lounge, no suites, just the standard queen or king bed rooms. It's not a bad location. You're far enough from the Times Square crowd, but it's walking distance if you want to journey north. I

Hilton is always good. Service is great and helpful staff make for a pleasant experience. Hotel is in a good location. Easy walk from Penn station. I arrived early and they were very accomodating about getting me a room right away.
user_name:
Carolyn T
Washington, DC, United States

review_body: We've stayed at the Hilton for four nights end of February. Great location, easy to get around by foot, lots of cafés, restaurants around. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Room was ready upon arrival, even before check in time. Well sized room, clean, very comfy bed. Windows not very well isolated, cold air coming in. Heating system very efficient though. Cleaning service good. Bathroom clean but missing in toiletries such as tooth brush, tooth paste and shower gel which you'd expect for a 4star hotel. No free wifi apart from in the lobby, 15£/day for free wifi in the room. We tested the roof bar, it was okay, good view but drinks small and overpriced. Overall still a great stay in NY.

Stayed at the Fashion Hilton from 2/27/14 thru 03/01/14. The front desk personnel, always friendly, had the room ready at check in. The room was larger than the last room I had. They had a bible (Gideon) ready for me. The breakfast was very good, excellent service, and the RARE restaurant has a yummy Greek salad with 3 lamb chops on it-hmmm. I asked the manager to turn TVG (horseracing channel) so I could watch the Gotham and he did so immediately. Check was a breeze and the hotel prices were good.I recommend staying there, especially if you single.

My sister and I stayed here for a long weekend. I thought the room was small, but I understand from my sister that in fact it was pretty well-sized by NY standards (I had never stayed in a NY hotel before) and we had a stunning view of the Empire State building. Large-ish bathroom and great, powerful shower. The bed was big, and very comfortable. The location was good for us, as it's out of the way of the tourist crowds at Times Square and around Central Park but I guess that won't be what everyone wants, and there didn't seem to be much in the way of cool bars and restaurants in the immediate vicinity (we were priced out of the nice East Village hotels - which was the area in which we expected to spend the most time). I thought for the price the Hilton Fashion District was a good option - don't expect to be blown away, but do expect a comfortable stay in a nice, modern hotel.

I spent one night here and am a repeat customer of the Hilton NY Fashion District. Now I remember why I love this hotel so much. The staff are professional, the look is clean and crisp and modern, the bar/restaurant is cool, and the accommodations are clean and contemporary and comfortable. I had breakfast in the restaurant using a voucher given to Gold members. The server was so nice and friendly, and the oatmeal was tasty. The bellman hailed me a taxi too in the morning. This place rocks!

We have stayed at a couple of Hiltons in Manhattan and this one is fairly similar to the others, particularly in regards to the room size and the amenities offered.Check-in was easy and very efficient, we were given a room on the 21st floor.There didn't seem to be many cabs outside the hotel, but there is easy access to the subways. Also there are plenty of places for breakfast in the immediate neighborhood.If you are looking to go to FIT, it is right across the street.One downside is that this time of year they do not run the air conditioning and the rooms run hot. You can solve the problem by opening the window, but NYC is a noisy city.

Can't fault much about this hotel! Rooms were clean, staff were friendly, location was great! A few good places to eat very nearby and also a short walk from the subway!Rooms were a tad small and we were on a low floor with no view at all as a room on a high floor came at extra cost. Overall pleasant stay!

Stayed in this hotel 3 nights.Friendly, welcoming and helpful staff at the lobby, the room was in a great condition, nice, clean and comfort. the room wasn't very big, but was enough for us.I took a high floor room, but the view wasn't very good (a building too close), but the friendly staff took care of it very well to my full satisfaction.Good location (W 26th st and 7th Ave.), within walking distance from Madison Square Garden, and about 15 minutes walk from Times Square. Also close to SoHo.I will most likely stay in this hotel again if i need to be in that area.

Loved the hotel and the location, very cool design, Rare and Rare View bars were great. Superb staff on front desk, room hip and more than adequate. In fact nearly everything in the hotel met and exceeded my expectations.The let down was the awful soundproofing inside the property. Not street noise but the noise of people rattling around at all hours. I'm not even a light sleeper but a couple of times both nights I was woken up by chatter & footsteps in the corridor and noise from other rooms.If it was not for the noise, I'd happily stay there again, but after a weary couple of days, I just want somewhere where I can get a proper night's sleep.

This was my second or third time staying at this hotel. This hotel had very comfortable beds. It's in a great location. If you ever get a chance to eat at the restaurant downstairs, you have to try the deep-fried oreos!! There is also a rooftop bar that you must check out. An overall great experience.

Except for a few minor things (e.g. mineral water bottles not available in fitness center, phone transfer to room from reception, etc.), this hotel is good value for money for it's location. Hotel staff is extremely courteous and very helpful. Views are good if you choose a high floor. But remember, microwaves are not available in room and internet charges are extra. Also, the Rooftop lounge only serves drinks. If you want food, you will have to use the Grill at the lobby area.

First off, the rooms were very clean albeit small and the shower was very good. There are a couple things, however, that I struggled with as a business traveler at this hotel.Two small items that are worth noting are the fact that there are no ice machines on the floors and the ironing boards are miniature and you have to place them on a hard surface which is hard to find in such a small room. I like to have a drink when I get back to my hotel after a long day so having to wait 10-15 minutes for ice to be brought up is a bit frustrating.I’m usually a Starwood guy, but thought I would try this Hilton as it is a block from the office I work at. I do have gold status with Hilton which advertises late checkout which I assumed was 4pm like Starwood, but that’s not the case. When I went to confirm late check out with the front desk, the lady told me “I can give you until 1pm”. I told her I thought it was 4pm and she just chuckled and laughed at me. A whole hour doesn’t really seem like much of an elite benefit to me.One bright spot was the room service. I got a killer Cowboy Ribeye from the restaurant in the lobby Rare.If the price point is competitive or significantly lower than the Sheraton around the corner I will stay here again, otherwise I’ll go where I can get a 4pm checkout so I don’t have to schlep my luggage to the office before I head to the airport.

Let me first say that I'm a Hilton Honors member, so I've been fairly loyal to Hilton over the years and often choose to stay in a Hilton brand hotel on trips because I always have great service, rooms are clean and amenities are nice.My stay at this hotel, compared to other Hilton hotels, was definitely below average. Front desk staff were friendly and efficient upon arrival and throughout my stay, which I did really appreciate. My issues began when I got to my room. Upon unpacking my clothing into the dresser (I was staying for a week), I found a previous guest's vibrator. Yes, I typed that correctly. There was a vibrator in the dresser drawer! So gross! I found a hair in my bed sheets as well, which I rarely get upset about, but after the lack of dresser drawer cleaning, it was hard not to be overly sensitive about finding other cleaning mistakes.I ordered room service on my first night, which was good, but then no one came to pick up my try. It was still in the hall the following morning, and I saw this during my entire stay with dirty room service trays and dishes all over the hallways for hours and hours. Only until housekeeping came for their rounds did anything get picked up. Unacceptable.Then, to cap off my stay, when I was checking out I requested the bell staff get me a cab. They said no, that I could just hail my own. So, I stepped out onto the curb in the freezing cold and tried hailing a cab for over 10 minutes with no luck since very few cabs came down the street. Cold and frustrated, I headed back inside to ask again and they finally helped. Of course, once the cab arrived, bell staff didn't help with my bags.While I certainly don't expect Hilton to be a 5-star experience, the lack of cleanliness, lack of attention to detail and lack of service were a big miss for me. The hotel offers good rates and rooms are nice and new, but I'd rather pay more to ensure my room is appropriately cleaned and that I get better service.

Our first trip to NYC and we could not have been more pleased with our hotel choice. Newly remodeled facility, perfect location for walking, clean, safe, quiet, great hotel bar. Would recommend to friends and will definitely stay here again. Highly recommend.

Booked a last minute stay for one weekend night and got an amazing deal (double digits!).Perfect location in midtown, away from the chaos of 34th/NYP/MSG and Times Sq but a hop, skip, & jump away. Very accessible subway stops 2-3 blocks in almost every direction.Loved my walk to the hotel through the floral shops that had their plants and flowers all out on the sidewalk. It felt like spring in January.Check-in was a bit slow. There were four people standing behind the desk but only two were actually working/helping others guests out. The attendant was pleasant and straightforward, offering an amenity bag for Gold/Diamond members that included 2 bottles of water and a mixed nut snack pack which were definitely appreciated.Room was on the smaller side of what I've experienced in the City but not too bad. Would say room was more akin to a Hampton Inn or DoubleTree... didn't quite have the luxury feel that it's touted to have but above all it was clean. The fire escape plan/map behind the door still had the Wyndham Fashion26 logo on it and looking up pics from it's old self, the hotel decor didn't change much if anything at all.Breakfast buffet was one of the better spreads for a Hilton in the city with lots and lots of options which I thoroughly enjoyed as part of my Diamond benefit. Unfortunately the rooftop bar closed early at 12midnight so didn't get a chance to check it out.Overall, the room served it's purpose of offering a comfy bed and restful night's sleep. Some traffic noise audible but they supply earplugs. Even as a reincarnated hotel, the hotel still seemed fresh and clean. The management staff seems to be pretty proactive in making sure guests have a positive experience which is nice. Given the opportunity and the right price point again, I would definitely consider this property on my next weekend jaunt in the city.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. We needed to arrive early, and they graciously got us into a room as soon as it was available. This hotel is close to FIT, Fashion Institute of Technology, which has a nice museum. We hope to return there someday.
user_name:
Daniel F
Elkridge, MD, United States

review_body: I stayed the second time for two days at the Hilton. I have to say nice and friendly staff, good Food, great located......sometime very loud hotelguest on the floor.A Special Thanks to Mr. Michael Schiller - he was the founder of my lost passport in the Building. Gladly he checked the guestlist. Found out that im one of his guests and brought me the passport to my room.Thanks again Mr. Schiller.I will come back.

My husband and daughter stayed overnight recently and loved it. The staff gave them a room that I booked for them with specific requests. There was no hassle about "room requests not guaranteed". They told me it was taken care of. Kudos to Zoribel and Caroline! They loved the room. My husband and I are returning to the Hilton Fashion District next week and I am returning with my mother the week after! So that should tell you how much we like this hotel.

Stayed here with my family. Rooms a little small for 4 people but as you're out and about it wasnt too much of an issue. Why there's two sets of large drawers and only one very narrow wardrobe is bizarre. Get rid of one set of drawers and then you have spacecto put luggage. Bathroom is shower only but its a large double size. Staff are friendly. Bar downstairs is nice and rooftop bar has a great view at night although the area itself could do with updating. Looks like a swedish sauna!! All in all it was comfortable and central to what wewanted with great places to eat near by.

Clean and nice hotell which is located central in NY. The thing I don't like about the hotel is that WIFI is not included. And the fee on 14,90 $ a day per device is actually robbery in the year 2014!

As one who lives in the New York City area it is quite unusual for me to stay in a Manhattan hotel, but the coming snow and an early morning training that I was scheduled to facilitate led me to stay at the Hilton Fashion District to avoid the morning commute the following day. I was very pleased with my choice in a number of ways. The rooms were small (but not for Manhattan standards) but very clean and comfortable. I had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building and the room was very quiet. The front desk staff was pleasant and efficient and came through with a good restaurant choice on the same block. I stopped in the lounge in the lobby "Rare" after dinner and found it to be a pleasant place to relax...a glass of wine pretty standard and reasonably priced for bar wine and nice atmosphere. I was exceptionally impressed with the bartender, Sarah, who was friendly and warm, and most importantly, it seemed quite genuine as she obviously enjoyed her job and pleasant/thoughtful conversations with customers...an unusual find in any hotel lounge, but particularly in Manhattan as it wasn't the standard "I guess I have to talk to you" mode. The rate was more than reasonable for the location and the quality. Only downside was the parking garage the hotel recommends as the service when getting my car back in the morning was (exceptionally) slow and grumpy...if you are going to charge big time prices you should provide service with a good work ethic (but no reflection on the hotel staff who were fine). Frank Delao

We stayed here for 5 nights in Nov/Dec 2013 and found it absolutely superb in everyway. The hotel was located on 7th and 26th, a 10 minute walk from times square, and based extremely well right in the heart of the island. The staff were always pleasant and more than happy to help ( my wife suffers from a heart condition , when asking for decaf coffee it was only minutes before the housekeeping team arrived with our request). Rooms were impeccable, towels were changed regularly and air con was quick to act. 3 lifts which require your room key will only allow you to go to your level, ground level, or the rooftop bar which is a nice touch so you know drunks will not b able to roam the halls. All in all very happy with the hotel and staff.

The location of the hotel is okay, but the street and guests noise was very loud, so not the best/quietest night rest. The room I was in was very clean and functional. No free wi-fi access.The positives: The concierge was very helpful, and he front desk staff was exceptionally professional. Overall it was a fair experience for solo/business travel, but would not recommend for a Family visit.

NYC is a tough place to find a good, modern, and sometimes clean hotel. This place is it. It's in a nice central location and the staff make you feel right at home. The restaurant offers many options and the upstairs bar is wonderful in the summer. A+ recommendation.

I am business traveling who travels almost weekly, I was only in town for one night and left my laptop in my room. I realized this when I got to the airport and called the hotel. Michael was extremely kind and searched the room and found it. He called me back right away and shipped it PRIORITY overnight and it arrived at my office first thing in the morning in Scottsdale. Michael was so wonderful and understood how upset I was and I cannot thank him enough. And the hotel itself was fantastic! very modern, great rooms. great restaurant. Thank you again Hilton!

This is a great boutique style hotelin the fashion district. It is close to Time Square and the Midtown attractions. It was my children's first time in NYC and they had a memorable stay. The front desk staff was exceptionally professional, our room was ready when we arrived in the morning. The room was clean and functional. Our view of the back was nothing to look at but we did not spend too much time in the room. The concierge was very helpful and suggested a great diner, the Tick Tock diner on 34th street which was just what we were looking for. I had asked for a late check out, which the front desk was able to accommodate and they were very helpful with subway directions. I will most definitely make Hilton Fashion District my first choice on our next visit and would recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Location is perfect, room very clean and functional (small but who needs big in NYC). Was surprised there is no free wi-fi at a Hilton, which is so basic nowadays (any coffee shop down the road gives this service free of charge. At Hilton it's $14 per day). Good bath products. Altogether, for the right price, I'll be back. Taking into consideration I have to pay extra for internet.

Very friendly front desk. Was upgraded as a gold point member. Room had great view of Empire State Building. Restaurant attached to the hotel was really good. Great hotel for travelers. Highly recommend

Great,i thought the doubletree on stone street was bad...haaa this is even worse.top floor room ,all close to elevators.soundproofing not at all even known, earbuds in all the room...what a treat.i changed to the 16th floor...same thing.no soundproofing at all...zero. Like people on the hallways are in your room.doorbanging neanderthals the whole night. Noisy and yelling tourists and housekkeping staff. Gosh this was my last hilton in manhattan. New place? Are they kidding? No executive lounge,the keys for the lifts never working and sooooo unfriendly receptionists you really feel like enteriing a correctional facility. Up to now of my four hilton experiences in nyc this is the worst.....really zero points with a clean conscience.....dont wast your money on this one,reallyBy the way ,to be a bit cooperative the internet codes for room wifi is [---] and [---]... Have fun....what an awful ,awful hilton

Myself & my partner Marcus stayed here from 5th-12th Dec 2013 as a surprise for my 30th Birthday. And a surprise it was! When we arrived the staff wished me happy 30th Birthday and were given our room key. Upon arriving to our room I realised why they said happy birthday. Our room had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building! It was amazing! Marcus had asked the hotel for it as a surprise & they delivered! The hotel itself is fantastic. The rooms were larger than I expected. The beds are soooo comfortable & the showers were great. Our room was immaculate & was kept that way by the excellent staff. I know some people have mentioned noise. We didn't experience any. I must also say thanks to Sid on reception (I think that was his name). He greeted us when we arrived & every other night after that! He made sure we visited the rooftop bar too.The rooftop bar is also a great find. The drinks are reasonably priced & it was nice to visit for a drink after seeing the sights of New York. Again I must mention the amazing view! The hotel also has a bar & restaurant on the ground floor which are great too. My only criticism would be that the rooftop bar is not open long enough we only visited once as every other time it was either closed or being used for a function. In terms of location the location is great you are within walking distance of Times Square & plenty of underground stops. It's a great place to stay in New York. Marcus & I will definitely be visiting here again. Hopefully in the summer months to experience the outside rooftop bar! A truly memorable visit. Glad we chose here. Thanks for a very special 30th Birthday Hilton Fashion District x

This hotel is really nice- I'm pretty sure I oohed and aahed a bit at the room. I really liked the shampoo/conditioner/lotion combo and appreciated the Keurig (although why is it that they mostly give decaf in NY?) The TV is pretty cool- you turn it on and you're greeted by your name (written). You can also check out via TV, which is a first for me. Location is great- it's less than a 10 min walk to Penn Station! No need to take a taxi if you're taking the Amtrak. I asked for a higher floor since I had issues with street level noise the last time I was in NY and slept pretty well the entire week. I was at the very back of the hotel (on the south side) and it worked really well for me. Wish I had been able to visit the rooftop bar but it was closed when I was staying there. Apparently it's not open unless it's around 40 degrees or higher. Complaints:1) Elevators (technology): you're required to swipe your room key and then press your button, which is great for security but sometimes leads to frustration when the technology doesn't want to pick up whatever signal from your room key. One time, I actually just pressed for the Lobby and the elevator randomly stopped. Weird.2) Elevators (availability): there was one morning where only one of the four elevators was working for 21 floors, which meant that there was a ridiculously long wait (5+ minutes!) I waited to go downstairs, discovered I had forgotten my gloves, had to go back upstairs and then come back down. It took way longer than it should have, and I really hope that the hotel management keeps the elevator maintenance to when fewer people are trying to get to work/business/etc. 3) Shower floor: kinda looked outdated and a little bit gross to me. It didn't match at all to the rest of the room. 4) Internet!! Seeing the price of internet ($15/DEVICE/day) was like a stab to the heart (over-dramatic, yes, but you have no idea how happy I was connecting to the slow Amtrak wifi). Maybe I'm too used to free internet, but even so, I've never seen an internet that was charged per device. In this day and age, a lot of people have multiple devices so this really sucked. Alternative: the Argo Tea right at the corner of 26th St & 7th Ave offers 2 hours of free wifi with purchase, and closes at 11pm. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay but that price tag on the internet is my biggest deterrent. I've stayed at a Hampton Inn further uptown on 43rd St, and I'd honestly rather stay there for the free internet even though this Hilton is so much nicer. If internet is not your thing, this is a great place to stay!

Everything seemed to be fine until the morning to checkout with the final bill under the door when I woke up.The entire reservation and room was pre-paid through Expedia. Thinking that there would be no additional charges when I haven't used anything - no F&B and not even the toiletries/amenities of the hotel. Except for the Keurig capsules for the in-room coffee maker. The billing showed up that there was a mini-bar charge. Of what? Apparently, even if you dare to open the 'auto-dispenser' fridge in the room, it will 'automatically' run through an electronic system to post an item to your guest account. That's what the front desk agent claimed to be the system of the hotel.So advanced in hotel rooms now these days that even the mini-bar is like an auto vending machine. Wow! I'm impressed. I've debated with the agent that I didn't consume any of the mini-bar items. Where she could personally go into the room and do a final inventory count in person. Or either have housekeeping to do the refill of mini-bar if I had consumed the items daily - not to mention that there was no housekeeping service of the room the day prior to checkout. The front desk agent says: "Oh, it's an automatic system and that housekeeping has no access to the mini-bar..." Something along those lines. So, who the hell does? The F&B outlets of the hotel? The manager? The front desk? Who the hell knows...Luckily, that the agent says that the charge will be removed after a heated discussion with other hotel guests next to me at the reception.I furthered to complain with the agent that if the hotel can randomly post lines of 'mini-bar' without addressing what particular item it is of the mini-bar, you might as well please update the printed material that shows the prices of mini-bar. Because, there's no M&M's or Cashew to be found in the room. Well, at least not in my room. By the way, 'cashew' should be plural with 's'. I guess one single cashew costs $7.50.Other amazing interior (design) features of this hotel:- The carpet color is dark as a cave. Great to camouflage certain stains from wear and tear. However, as years go by - good luck figuring how clean or not the carpet is. I'd rather not taking my socks or shoes off in the room when this hotel is aged.- The shower stall is fitted with a standard shower head on a shower stall that's big enough to have a party. The shower head has no way of spraying the entire surface area of the stall. There's no handheld shower head/faucet. I'm curious how often does housekeeping clean the entire stall with diluted chlorine detergent/disinfectant? When a hotel room is high volume traffic of changing guests every so often, without a handheld shower head/faucet, how clean is the shower stall? I guess housekeeping staff brings in a bucket with a scrub every so often to do cleaning.- The bathroom lighting is like I went back to my office space. The hanging energy-saving/fluorescent tube track lighting. I suppose that's fine if you don't consider a possible hazard for guests that if one of the hanging wires fails and drops into a sink full of water. Maybe liability issues are at hand. To further with the height of the basin - don't even bother to use the sink if you have a toddler or child in the room. It's way above the standard height of a sink.Commercial grade type of design and planning is VERY different from your own home. It has a lot of other factors to consider other than: "Oh, it looks great in residential homes, why not just slap it on to commercial use." Functionality, ease of operation, durability, maintenance schedule, handicapped/disabled access - amongst the few that are crucial in the planning/construction phases of commercial buildings.
user_name:
Arnold W M
New York City, New York

review_body: I love that I can walk to any game or event at Madison Square Garden. The hotel is located less than $8.00 cab ride to all the great shopping. The rooms are quite and very clean. I will continue to stay at this Hilton on future visits to NYC.
user_name:
Thomas B
Severna Park, United States

review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed here recently for my girlfriends 21st birthday. Don't have a bad word to say about this hotel, in fact it's probably the best hotel we've stayed in. The staff were great. On hearing it was my girlfriends birthday we were upgraded to a room on the 20th floor which had an amazing view of New York City were a bottle of champagne and a birthday card signed by the staff awaited us. The room was lovely and perfect for the both of us. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the craziness that is Times Square. Would defiantly recommend this hotel, and would almost certainly stay here again when we go back!

I really like your hotel and the entire Staff, but especially the Hilton employees in the front desk/lobby area/concierge/bell boy and those assisting guests checking in and checking out.The overall experience has been positive and I just repeated my visit. Everyone has been courteous, professional and friendly and you sense they are keeping an eye out for the guest.The staff always seems upbeat, motivated and prepared and I have not observed anyone of your team members having a bad day. I’ll be backThank youRichard Rosario

Work in the city but was going to a concert and didn't want to commute back to the island late at night only to turn around the next morning and go back into city. Hotel was comfortable and clean and room service was excellent. RARE (name of hotel restaurant/bar) provides tasty room service cuisine. Really have no complaints except that this hotel is a bit on the pricey side compared to others in the area (Hilton Garden Inns seem like a better value, but they don't have in-room safes, which is something that was on my priority list).
user_name:
Michael G
Deer Park, United States

review_body: We stayed five nights here and loved the location - we love to walk to it was easy to get to shopping, museums, Eataly, many subway lines to everywhere. The rooms were small but not tiny, comfortable. The bed was great. The Keurig coffee maker was great to have - we brought our own pods . They gave us a small fridge so we could have breakfast in our room. There are so many food options in the neighborhood - you can get everything and there's even a Fairway a block away. It was quiet in the rooms too - a big plus. And the price was great. I used to stay on the Upper West Side a lot but that's gotten very pricey and it's less convenient. We will come back.And the front desk folks were great!

This was my first trip to New York City and we decided (after much debate) to stay at this hotel. I'm glad we did. It was beautiful and for the price, you really can't complain. It allowed us to spend more on attractions and dining which is very expensive. We took a plunge and bought subway passes and that was even better! took some time to figure out but once we got the hang of it we were jetting all over that city, the subway station was right around the corner from the hotel. the staff was fine, I'm pretty low maintenance and had no issues.the room was decent sized (for new York) and modern. view of the city street below, nothing to write home about. each room has a kuerig which is nice for me because I miss mine when I'm gone. the attached restaurant was great, little pricey. the roof top bar was amazing! so beautiful at night with the view. would def stay here again...

Nice folks in reception, valet and bellman. Room was clean, modern and spacious. The room that we had looked out at the Empire State Building-- lovely! I would absolutely recommend this hotel to a friend.
user_name:
Caren O
Basking Ridge, New Jersey

review_body: I've stayed in many hotels in NYC but this one is definitely a recommendation. Finally a good breakfast in the morning and that all for a very decent price.The rooftop bar is also a pre, especially the views.

I have stayed at several Hilton family hotels in Manhattan in the past, and they look pretty cookie-cutter to me. Manhattan also has very small hotel rooms -- few per floor but built up very high. I prefer those near Penn Station since I usually arrive and leave the city by train.I arrived at Hilton Fashion District Sunday night 1/19/14, and was taken by the larger than expected lobby with interesting décor. There was no line to check-in, and I was greeted professionally and with a smile. Perhaps due to my HiltonHonors Gold status, I was given a room on the highest floor (21). The location appeared to be quiet, as I did not hear any street noise at all up there.A very nice touch was a call a couple of hours into my stay asking me if everything was OK, and offering me a wake-up call, which I took them up on.Check-out the next morning was equally quick and trouble-free. I was greeted and convinced to come back again.Manhattan hotels can also fluctuate greatly in price, but I was pleased with the rate I got considering the midtown location. IF the price is right when I next stay in the city, I will definitely consider this property on the top of my list.

The service we received at this hotel was awesome! From the moment we checked in to the time we left the staff was very helpful and informative. The only issue I had was the bed was not very comfortable.

The convenience of this place depends on where you're going in NYC. It's pretty close to MSG, Korea-Town and the Fashion Institute of Technology, but not much else. On the other hand, 26th Street isn't a painfully long walk from quite a lot. In our case, we walked to and from the Port Authority without getting exhausted or taking a huge chunk out of our schedule.The neighborhood is quiet. The lobby is nice and simple, and the staff was pleasant, efficient and professional. Our room was small, but adequate to our needs. We don't really need lodgings for much beyond sleep and a shower. It was quiet, secure and clean; and all amenities and fixtures would in good repair and function.The hotel has a rooftop bar on the 20th floor that is worth checking out. Access is controlled by staff at the elevator. It is enclosed during cold or other adverse weather, but the walls and roof can open. It was quiet and not very busy during our visit. The real attraction is the view. They advertise a 360 degree view of Manhattan. With intervening walls and buildings, it's closer to 200 degrees, but the views are still pretty good, including the Empire State Building and Freedom Tower.It was nice to enjoy a drink with views without a lot of noise or a crowd.

The rooms are not big, however they are nice and new and we enjoyed our stay here. The location is a little south of time square, however convenient for dining and some speak easy locations that we like. The check in was quick and the service was what I would expect from Hilton. We would stay again.

This Hilton has a great central location; I visited NY in Thanksgiving week and I was able to walk to all the major sights. The are of town is a little "gritty" but you certainly come away feeling you've experienced a slice of New York life. A 10-minute walk to Penn Station is handy too.The staff were excellent, friendly and polite and my Diamond HHonors status was recognised and I duly received an upgraded room.The hotel itself is tired cosmetically and rooms are in need of an update. Certainly not up to the usual Hilton standard that I am accustomed. If you get a deal on price, it's worth a try, but don't pay over the odds expecting a luxury experience.
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
user_name:
I7962ZOmarkc
The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

review_body: I go to New York about 3 times a year. This was my first stay at the Hilton in the Fashion district. It was in a great location, it had good accommodations and its service was great. Clean, friendly and accessible with clean and fresh rooms. You will enjoy yourself at this property.

Rooms are very small, amenities simple, beds comfortable enough. Staff very friendly, small workout room with functioning equipment and amenities. They helped us get into a larger room after they couldn't accommodate our original reservation of 2 beds. Plenty of towels, pretty typical of a well-used, moderate quality Hilton hotel. Watch out if you want super comfy beds, this isn't your best bet. Very conveniently located.

We are in NY a few times a year and had a favorite spot on the upper west side, but needed a more central location closer to our daughter. Got a great price and tried this Hilton. I was pleasantly surprised bc this neighborhood used to be not so good. Now there are good places for coffee and brunch, it's close enough to walk from penn station, and there are a bunch of subways closer. The hotel is very nice and staff is friendly and efficient. We paid a little extra for a high floor room and we got a sweet view of the Empire St Bldg. We were across from the elevator but it was quiet. Very nice sparking clean bath. Room small but by no means cramped. We will be back. Did not try the restaurant but when the weather is warm it would be nice to try the rooftop bar.

From check in time to check out time, everything worked. Staff knows you by name and addresses you by name. Super polite. Doorman to bellman, very helpful. Only had time to have breakfast at the restaurant 2 out of 5 mornings. The other 3, prepared take out from their breakfast buffet. So many choices: bagels, toast, cream cheese, jams, butter, freshly sliced fruits (cantaloupe, honeydew, pineapple), hot oatmeal which was by the way delicious! Dannon Yogurt, Kellogg's cereal - very clean & organized. Close to manicure/pedicure, FEDEX, Staples, Whole Food Market, Starbucks, Pret a Manger. This is the only hotel in NY that we stay while in the City! Thank you!

Hotels in NYC over NYE are expensive, and hotels with a good view above the city are outside my paygrade, I'm sure.. That said, for the price point and given the time of year, this was a nice hotel choice. I also recommend the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square - both are enjoyable properties in great locations for jumping out and exploring NYC!

Everything was absolutely perfect from the people at the front desk, to upper management. I was welcomed by a nice young lady with a smile who was extremely friendly and informative. I had a minor issue with a charge, which the General Manager himself helped me to understand. He even upgraded me to a great room on the top floor!!! Unbelivable view of NYC!!! The effort made by each staff member we encountered went a long way and we both appreciated it greatly. Great hotel, even better service. Will definitely be returning!
user_name:
Drew P
Staten Island, New York

review_body: Everything about our stay was perfect in this lovely hotel located in NY's Fashion District. Staff was very accommodating! The restaurant RARE which is attached to the hotel also serves as the hotel's room service and bar. While RARE is primarily for carnivores, I'm a vegan and they were still able to feed me well. Bartenders were lovely for my nightly glass of wine! Front desk always friendly and helpful!

The hotel was clean and staff friendly. Our room accommodated 4 and we were able to secure an early check in. The hotel is located on the subway line, making it easy to travel uptown or downtown. We did have room service for breakfast one morning and it arrived quickly and was tastefully presented. Descent value for our family get-away.

The Fashion District Hilton is my home-away-from-home in New York City. I am always welcomed by name. The rooms are fresh and up-to-date. The staff makes themselves available to help in any way. I don't even consider another hotel when business or pleasure brings me to New York City!
user_name:
William B
Louisville, KY, United States

review_body: My family and I stayed at the Hilton NY Fashion District during a long weekend in early January. Rooms are attractive, clean, and comfortable (although a bit small, but then we didn't come to NY to stay in our rooms). It's location is a bit out of the way, but not far from the theater district and within walking distance of Chelsea and the Flatiron district. It's in-hotel restaurant, Rare, makes the best hamburgers and fries I've had in recent years. It's prices are not outrageous and service is excellent. This was my second stay here; I'll be coming back.

We for a couple of nights after the new years eve ball drop and the location is prime. The hotel is close (3 small blocks) to the subway. You can also walk to times square, chelsea, bryant park and other places nearby. There's a ton of great food places nearby too and a trader joes is about a 10 min walk away. The rooms are nice and clean and everything is up to date. Every room has an air condition/heater to get you nice and comfortable in your room.

Myself and 2 kids, 10 and 13 spent one night in this hotel the day before new year's eve. We couldn't afford the New Year's Eve cost of 'any' hotel so stayed this night instead. The Hilton is close to the Empire State Building, has great restaurants close by and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. I would definately stay again.

A friend and I stayed here on Christmas. Overall, it was a great hotel, with welcoming staff, clean rooms, in a decent and safe neighborhood. Good points include the hotel restaurant, Rare, and the fact that the hotel is within walking distance from Penn Station. There's also a Starbuxks, Five Guys, Panera, and drug stores within a few blocks, not to mention plentiful cabs and secure entry into the elevators. The room, albeit a bit small, was clean and comfy. Definitely a good choice for the NYC.

Great service. Good location. Better than Hilton on 53/52 ? street. There is no executive floor but the rooftop bar and lobby lounge are very good. The Rare bar and restaurant have good selection. They have a rooftop bar called View but we were too early to go there as they do not open until 5 PM. Otherwise a good place to stay. FIT is across the street and they have a free museum that changes exhibits frequently.

Second time here and highly recommend both the hotel and location. Staff are great and facilities in hotel are very good. Bar and restaurant staff extremely helpful and nothing seems to be too much trouble. I generally stay in Hilton hotels (Diamond Member) and this is one of the best.

Hi guys, be very careful when you book rooms, not only at this hotel but other Hilton Hotels. Do not purchase your room by advance. They stipulate that advance purchase will save you monies; however, it will not. We are staying at this hotel Feb. 7 - 9 paying for a room $170 a night paying in advance. We just noticed that the cancellation purchase and can be refunded is $135 a night. I could just imagine what room we get. And if we get a room that is not accommodating then they have lost my business and all of the executives I book for travel. I called Corporate Hilton and spoke to Lynn Smith which I doubt is her name. I explained to her I would like a price adjustment and she said you advanced purchased the rooms. I suggested to her, option 1 or option 2....either price adjustment which would be $70 or take my business while I book travel for the corporate for a year of $100K - $150K to other chains of hotels. She said sorry we can't do it....common sense would have said yes, we want to keep your business..but obviously they really don't care about their Hilton loyal members...therefore, why should I nor the people I book rooms for. Sorry Hilton, you have just lost business. I will see how it is when I book in on Feb. 7th.

I've stayed in the Hilton New York Fashion District three times in as many months. Twice on business, and again during the holidays with my wife. Each time, the service was excellent, with well-designed and very clean rooms, and attentive staff. From high floors on the uptown side of the hotel, the view of the Empire State Building at night is fantastic.This is my go-to hotel in NYC. Looking forward to staying there again soon.

I travel a lot to big cities, very small towns and everything in between. I know hotels and this Hilton is a great spot. For business travel or vacation, the location, amenities, size and service were excellent.

Just come back from five nights at this hotel! An excellent stay! Great size rooms, comfortable bed, fab shower and a view of the Empire State Building! On arriving our room wasn't ready and the staff were very apologetic, offered us a drink and the wifi password for free! The staff were always friendly and helpful. We never ate at the restaurant 'Rare' but had cocktails which were very strong (a good thing!) The only disappointment was when we planned to go to the roof top bar one evening and it was closes... I guess they were preparing for New Year's Eve! The hotel is a 15 min walk to times square and so close to many things such as Macys , Maddison square gardens and the Empire State! Fab hotel and would stay again!

Stayed for a week with family for 3 special occasions during our stay and we had several rooms. We did email the hotel beforehand about our booking but there was no acknowledgement. However, recommend this hotel as it’s very clean and modern. Location is very good and close to various metro stations so getting around was very easy. Rooms are fairly small but standard in New York. The only bad thing is that there is the bar on the rooftop, therefore the reception area and lifts are busy and rowdy at times, however the lifts are controlled by key access, so the room corridors are quiet. One night after 11pm, room service came which we didn't order, so we sent it away only to be bothered with a phone call. As a gold Hiltons honours member we were entitled to vouchers for free breakfast. Otherwise there are various local places around the hotel for breakfast and coffee. Overall good 4 star hotel from the Hilton in a good location.

Have stayed here many times over many years for both work and leisure. Staff is excellent and always strives to make your stay enjoyable, from hailing a cab for you, arranging airport transportation, making restaurant suggestions, or providing a map and directions. Hotel is walking distance to Madison Square Garden/Penn Station, Chelsea Market and other midtown sites. Rooms are the usual NY small but are clean and everything is in working order.

Hotel is well located and a good value for this area of Manhattan. Room was clean, comfortable and quiet, and staff was friendly and efficient. Will probably stay here again when I visit my daughter who lives in New York.

This is a new hotel in Chelsea, which was the area we wanted to stay in. It's a good location. The rooms are small (but most are in in NY). Everything was new and updated. Service was very good (which is typical of US Hilton properties). We would stay again.

Not a bad Hotel, for the most part everything went ok. For the cost, the room size could be a little bigger but that's NY. We did not eat at the restaurant, so dont know too much about it. Front desk seem to be helpful and professional. The Bell men also seem to be helpful. Overall, location is convenient you can walk to the Empire State building. Parking, well you know the answer there, no parking. The hotel website said their was parking for $25 down the street, that is not true, I think that info is outdated. You can find parking on 25th, ( I forgot the name but they watch your car all night 24/7 but you can not take your car out or you will be charged again or maybe not get a spot-we just left the car there) what NY does have is transportation, which is the best in the world. You have to appreciate this about the city. I believe, we found a place for $30 a day but it had no relationship with the hotel. It was cheaper than what the Bellman's recommended, but I dont fault them for that, again parking---that is NY. I think you could find a more reasonable hotel around that area at a discount price, if you look good enough. One last thing, the fitness center ok as well, not like Wow, but clean and bottle water inside with towels. I seem better ones with a lesser hotel rate, at various other Hilton's and non-Hiltons.
user_name:
Michael G
Fort Mill, South Carolina

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights in December. Hotel is very well located but it was first for me to find earplugs waiting for me on the bedside table - made me expect issues with noise but in the end I had no problems with noise either within the hotel or outside.I was a little disappointed that the bar is closed on Monday's and Tuesdays meaning the only option in the hotel for a drink was on the ground floor. Overall a good stay

A perfect place to stay for easy access to the theatre district but far enough away from the tourists in Time Square. Excellent service from very helpful staff. Clean and comfortable if a bit noisy especially if your neighbors keep very late or very early hours.

Spent a long weekend here after finding quite a good deal for this particular time of year. Was surprised by how nice the place was, it was clean, staff were friendly and efficent even in the "Rare" restaurant, couldnt fault them at all.The location of the hotel was pretty good. About fifteen minute walk from times square. Ten minutes from Maceys. Five minutes from Maddion Square. And it was right on top of the subway too.A small downside was that I travelled with a group of three people, due to us being located on serial floors apart we was unable to gain access to each others floor. You was only allowed to gain access to your own floor and the one above and below. So before you check in make sure your close by the people you travel with. (only if you want to see them of course otherwise its a good excuse).The wifi is not free, its only free in the lobby. Because this is becoming a fast technology world its a shame you have to pay for this when if you go places like mcdonalds its all free. Im not one to sit on my phone on holiday but I know some people are so just bear in mind that i think it was about $15 a day.All in all though this hotel is definately one I would go back to, it was a bargain.

I expected a top notch facility and rather disappointed. The lobby is very nice with many amenities. However, you have very plain room accommodations-more like for business where you aren't spending much time in room. No extras like coffee pot in room and you have to pay for internet services. Have enjoyed the Hilton Garden Inns much more and at a better value. Would not stay here again.

Obviously not inexpensive but NY and a great location. Very friendly staff and overall experience in line with a good Hilton hotel. Being in the Fashion district we were expecting some interesting decor - not sure about the barbed wire theme in the 'Rare' restaurant but what do we know!

If you can get this hotel for less than 250 a night (I paid 185 including tax) it is excellent. The check in was quick and efficient. The room excellent. Individual climate control allowed cooling during unusually warm December weather. Bathroom had walk in shower. I liked this. If you want a tub double check before booking. Location is perfect. A short walk to subway. 5 minutes to penn stationThe restaurant has excellent hamburgers for dinner but a limited selection of other things. Breakfast included because I was gold was excellent full service. The wait staff has some of that NYC cool arrogance, but if you ignore it service is ok. L

I found a great deal online ( Expedia ) for my cousin and I too stay at this hilton hotel . I emailed the reservations seat 24 hours prior to our arrival to advise them that my cousin and I was coming over to America to celebrate her 30th birthday, I requested if we could have a room with a view.I know this would be far fetched but it was worth asking, I never received a reply.Anyway, after a dreadful experience from the airport into manhattan we arrived at the hotel.We was pleasantly greeted by the receptionist's who asked who the birthday girl was! They handed over a bottle of red win and a cute Christmas duck which was a really nice gesture. They received my email and booked us on the 22nd floor with great views with no extra cost!!We arrived in our room to find another bottle if wine and a signed birthday card from everybody.The only thing I don't recommend is room service - the food was cold The front desk was very helpful in recommending places for us to visit along with booking us in for a shopping trip to Woodbury common which is also great!The staff we're always on point and always willing to help.Rooms were spotless, spacious and pleasant. I would 100% stay here again.

Nice hotel, very comfortable bed but very small rooms. Great location if you plan to spend a lot of time in the Chelsea area. Need to travel further, the subway is only one block away. Great value for under $200

Hotel is centrally located, with easy access to metro and close proximity to main attractions.New york as a crowded and fast paced city, reflects on the hotel equally.I was very pleased with my reservation process though thanks to Ms Suh, who handeled everything in a swift and professional manner.Breakfast venue offered buffet with sufficient variety and service matched the expectation of a hotel of such scale.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over Christmas and we were very happy that we chose this hotel. Slightly pricey but certainly worth it. Hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely pleasant and efficient. Location was fanastic! Away from the hustle bustle but yet walking distance to a lot of attractions. Subway/train stations just around the corner, a lot of places/cafes for food. We will definitely stay here again. The only downside is no free wi fi:( but quite a few starbucks and dunkin donuts up the road that offer wi fi. Overall it was an excellent stay!

This is a good hotel in a good location. It is at 26th and 7th ave. When we have work in lower Manhattan this is a good spot for us to stay and get to work easily. It is in the Flatiron district. The rooms are well appointed. We have stayed here many times and will probably continue to.

We stayed in this hotel for a brief two night stay before Christmas. The hotel is in midtown and times square can be walked in 10 minutes or so. The nearest metro station is three ish blocks south.The hotel is very new and the rooms are a good size for new york with space around the bed and a good sized shower and bathroom. What really differentiates this hotel is the service, reception were excellent on check in, and the manager called us to confirm everything was alright the next morning. Got an excellent rate too, so this is very worthy of 5 blobs! Merry Christmas...

I was a little skeptical about staying at a Hilton, as I feel like they can be a little sterile, but this Hilton was different. It almost felt like a boutique hotel; it had a smaller lobby and you can practically walk into an elevator once you walk in. There is a restaurant by the name of RARE to the right of the entrance. It was always busy, but I never actually went into the restaurant/bar. I did order room service twice and it was pretty darn quick and very tasty.My room was great, I was facing another building which wasn't a big deal because it was very quiet (7th floor). I forgot to ask for down alternative pillows and paid for it the first two nights, but I left a note for housekeeping and came back to find new pillows and I think a new comforter. Score! There is a Whole Foods on the corner of 25th and 6 which was great for having water and fruit in the room. Madison Square Garden is practically across the street with Macy's a few blocks down and great, great, great shopping on 5th. I kept seeing the Empire State Building when I looked up and it looked pretty close. I think the hotel could use some updating, specifically the carpets and that ottoman thingy. Also, the desk staff was not the friendliest. Sure, they were polite and went thru the motions, but not one of them ever cracked a smile. Like not once. The housekeeping staff that I would run into in the hallway or elevators were totally friendly and warm. They could not have been nicer. I think the front desk staff could use some friendly advice from them. At the end of the day, it wasn't a big deal. Would definitely stay again.

I stayed here with my wife for a 4 day trip to NYC.- Awesome location with access to all the train lines and walking distance to Penn station- Great room with both a great heater and a window that opened for fresh air.- Room is a bit small but very reasonable for NYC- Love the evening turndown service- Breakfast at RARE is actually pretty good especially for being a hotel complementary breakfast (for HIlton Gold+ members)- The staff is awesome - always asking how they can help.- On the weekends they have popcorn and cookies in the afternoon. Always have mints in teh lobby which is great.- The water pressure in the shower is a bit weak but probably more of an issue with NYC hotel regulation over the hotel itself.- TV has few standard channels which didn't bother us but could bother othersWe'd definitely stay here in a heartbeat given the location and price. Highly recommend this to others.

Stayed here on two occasions for business. Hotel has a new feel, particularly for New York. Rooms are small (as are all rooms in New York) but well equipped. Towels are ok, nothing great. Bed was good as were the linens.Request a room on the back side of the hotel (away from 26th) - much more quiet. They do provide ear plugs on the nightstand...

Spent 3 nights at the Hilton NY Fashion District. The hotel is walking distance to many places of interest. During morning and evening rush hour, traffic in that area is hectic. There are a lot of people on 7th Avenue but at night, the further down you go the more desolate and dark it becomes.If your room faces 26th St. you might hear street noise. If your room faces the back, you will not have any views and very little sunlight. Also, the lighting in the room makes the room a bit gloomy.The room furnishings are modern. The bed is very comfortable and the linens are top quality. The desk is large. The room also has a Keurig coffee machine.The bathroom has the best lighting and a sensor that turns on the light if it senses movement. The glass shower is large and the sink area has a lot of counter space. The toiletries are excellent. The only thing that seems inadequate is the tiny closet.The front desk people are very friendly and very experienced in customer service. I would stay in this hotel again.

Nice, compact if two double beds. Lacks attention to detail. Good area out of hectic streets. Close to metro stations. Great restaurant on site. (Rare) Cupboard space very small if family for a couple of days.

This hotel is good for short stay. Room was very clean, housekeeping has done excellent job. Room itself was on the small side and despite being only few years old the furniture and carpeting looked worn out and outdated. Polka dotted wall was nice touch. Everything was in working order. The bed was the best thing being extremely comfortable.

I needed to be overnight in New York on a weekend in the weeks leading up to Christmas. Generally, this is a prescription for overpriced hotels and lousy service. But then I found the Hilton Fashion District. I was amazed by the great prices for a nice, new little hotel.The rooms were typically New York Small, but the staff were pleasant, the security excellent, and the service very good.We were only 7 blocks from Madison Square Garden, and in a pretty quiet location.I would definitely use this hotel again.

My wife and I spent 5 nights at the hotel in mid December. We had previously lived in the neighborhood so the property was perfectly located for us. The hotel was clean and modern, the room was small (not for New York) but comfortable and the staff was courteous and helpful. The bed was to die for: comfortable with good quality duvet and linens. The room was a bit noisy but this is New York afterall and it was never a problem. The hotel even left earplugs on the bedside table but they were never necessary. We thought we received good value for the room rate and would/will go back there again.

Staff seemed friendly and accommodating at all times which is a huge plus! However this hotel has more in the 'cons' coloumn for us! So originally we got checked into room 1107 and after a long day travelling/jet lag etc you want a comfy, quiet, warm rested stay...boy we did NOT receive that! Very noisy room as noise from the street constantly threw the night as well as other guests coming from the lifts and guests in the next rooms laughing,talking & shouting at very early hrs of the morning-not acceptable! The 'Do not disturb' hanger for your door....doesn't stop other guests from being inconsiderate and disrespectful unfortunately!So we moved to a back room (smaller) but less noise! Both rooms we stayed in we're either boiling hot with the air on or freezing cold when it's turned off!!! The beds we found so soft and bouncy that my husband and I rolled into the middle constantly and every time one of us moved we catapulted the other!Will we stay here again?......not even if they paid us too!!!

It's a bit off the beaten path but still near Penn Station and has good subway access to a lot of different lines. It is a good option if you are coming into NYP and have business in both midtown and downtown.

The hotel and rooms are great and I don't have much to add over the already strong reviews.Unless you're a Hilton Gold or Silver member, you will pay $14.95/day for wireless internet. This is expensive, but, alas, it is NYC. What really disappointed me though, was that once I paid for the internet access, it was only good for one device. So, if I first logged-on with my laptop, then only the laptop could access the internet for the next 24 hours. Many people also have a WiFi-enabled phone and/or tablet, but you cannot connect these devices to the internet unless you pay a separate $14.95/day for each of them. Further, even if i disconnected my laptop, I could not then have my phone or tablet access the internet instead, unless of course I paid another $14.95 per device. I have never encountered this before, and it is very disappointing. I came here alone on business so I could deal with it, but if I came with my family, having to choose who's device would get connected would cause a riot. Thus, I would not stay here if there was more than one person in the room.

Traveled for work/pleasure with my wife and our 23 month old son. Miserable experience due to the constant noise from inside and outside the hotel. They give you earplugs in your room, for a reason - you need them!!!!!!!!First and foremost, the hotel staff was absolutely wonderful, professional, courteous and helpful. They should be commended for the way they treat their guest. They were always happy and willing to help and even cleaned our room after hours.The hotel is a very nice hotel, lobby is great and the bar/restaurant is very nice with a good selection of food and drinks. We enjoyed the breakfast. The rooms are nice and meet the hilton standards for furnishing and comfort.However - and it is a big however - the rooms are extremely small and cramped. The first room they gave us was on the back corner and was the size of a walk in closet. There was no room to put our suitcases. Being a diamond member I got them to move us to a room facing the street which was bigger. HUGE MISTAKE. The windows were paper thin and let in the cold air and you could hear every sound from the street as well as the hallway and the rooms next to us. We heard a car alarm go off at 3:30 in the morning like it was in our room and I could hear other rooms next to, above and below flush their toilets! I like the hotel, just wasn't able to sleep and will not return!

The front desk staff was nice with the exception of one employee at check out which seemed less than willing to help with a shuttle to the airport. The property is very nice and the room was clean. The restaurant on the rooftop is amazing!! Our server Pearl was very sweet and kept chatted with us through our seating. The wings were sooo good and the view was breathtaking!

Quiet location just minutes away from all the action. Walk to Penn Station and subway stations; Macy's and surrounding stores, and Eataly in addition to many good restaurants in the surrounding blocks. Spent a week there and can't wait to return.

Good Hotel in relatively quiet Fashion DIstrict. This is a nice Hilton and would be nice for a family hotel. Close to Madison Square Garden. Nice hotel, small lobby, not really much of a place to congregate. Our room was nice and relatively large by NYC Standards. The beds were just ok, soft and squishy but this may just be a personal preference. The bathroom was nice, small but again NYC standard. The staff was friendly and helpful with anything we needed especially tourist info and restaurant recommendations. The little gem of the rooftop bar must not be missed simply for the fantastic view. All in all a good experience, I would stay here again.

Great hotel in an area where there aren't many around. Convenient walking distance to many attractions. Room although not overly large was very comfy, had nice amenities and a good-sized bathroom. Would easily recommend.

Good hotel. Family room on 17th floor. Clean, comfortable, reasonably quiet. Excellent service at restaurant. Limited variety in menus, but good quality and extremely friendly personnel. Reception team a bit "detached". Convenient breakfast CaffeBene, KofeeCake corner quite close. BBQ at Hill Country. Felt like a safe área. Would return again.

My girlfriends and I booked a room here recently for our annual Christmas trip and we LOVED IT. The lobby was so beautiful, very modern and colorful! The location was the best part: we were walking distance to all of the shopping, Union Square, Broadway... we walked everywhere! The room was small if you're used to large suites in other cities, but this is NYC and everything is small! We got a room with a king bed, all three of us slept comforably in it (especially after a day of walking around). The amentities in the room were great though, everything was new and modern, and very clean. We had a Keurig in the room for coffee and tea, which was great after a cold day, out. Our room faced another building so we didn't have much of a view (but who cares, we didnt go there to stare out the window). The restaurant downstairs had awesome food, we went down there one night and the following morning for breakfast. For the price and location, I would definitely stay here again!

exterrior and interrior are mordern and good looking. I stayed at the room in the front of elevators. When I was sleeping at the midnight, someone speaking loudly when they are out from elevators and I got up... So noisy!

Stayed here with my husband, hotel was conviently located and took us around 15-20 mins to walk to Times Square. staff were excellent in providing maps and advice. We was located on the 3rd floor and the rooms were comfy. On leaving we used the hotels cars to take us to the airport. Driver was polite and made our journey feel safe. We would defiantly return to this hotel when revisiting NYC :-)
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
user_name:
NaTaLiEa25
The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

review_body: We were very happy with our stay at the Hilton. It's in a great location, just a few blocks from Times Square but without the hectic-ness of it. Staff were helpful (although we didn't have too much contact with them). Rooms were nice - clean, modern and great bedding.
