I note that quite a few comments have been on the size of the room - we had a standard queen room and it was fine - 'average' if you're goin by European standards!!Best things: bedding, in-room espresso machine, rooftop bar, locationNot as good things: no free wifi, no shower caps (and I know I'm being picky here!!)Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

I stayed here for a night. Location is great, away from all the Times Square touristy BS, within walking distance of SOHO and the West Village. Also it's great because it's not too big of a hotel where it takes forever to get an elevator. The rooms are small but so is every other hotel room and apt in NYC. The rooftop bar/restaurant is amazeballs. Incredible views. The staff was pretty friendly. Very clean rooms and lobby. No complaints about this hotel and will go back next time I'm in the city.

Was very satisfied with the Hilton Fashion District. The front desk service was excellent, greeted me with a warm welcome, bottled water and complimentary cookies. Was nice after a cross-country flight from the West coast. The room was exteremely clean and I enjoyed the modern look of the bathroom; the glass doors added a nice clean look as I don't really like hotel rooms with shower curtains. The only real complaints that I had was that it was a rather small room but perhaps it's average given that it is NYC and it was difficult to iron dress shirts using a small dorm-size ironing board. I'm not sure if those small ironboards are the normal for these rooms so it could slow you down if you have to iron your clothes for the work week. The workout facility has fully functional equipment though you may not have access to a lot of tv channels on the treadmills. I like how they provide bottled water and a water dispenser for you in the workout room.

The Hilton based in the fashion district on 26th and 7th in Manhattan is a good hotel, everything that you would expect from a well known branded hotel chain, however the only thing that I would draw your attention to is the $14.95 that you have to pay per 24hours for in room access to wireless.. more than a little disappointed. If you access in the common areas then it is free however as soon as you want access in your room then you have to pay…. please Hilton can this be reviewed … such a shame when the rest of my stay was a good experience ….
user_name:
Iain B
Hilton 26th and 7th Manhattan, United States

review_body: Nice Hilton. Friendly staff, good amenities. Really great location within walking to shopping, Chelsea area, near subway entrances. Nice restaurants in walking distance.Rooms slightly small but typical of area hotels.

What an amazing hotel! The service was amazing, the room was spotless! I received an upgrade which was very nice. The room was very spacious for a NYC hotel and the bathroom so so clean I felt as if we were the first to have stayed there. We had a late flight out and asked for a late check out and without hesitation we were given a 2PM checkout, which we didn't use, just asked if they could hold our luggage while we left. Everyone always had a smile on their face and always asked if there was anything they could assist with. I work in the hotel industry (actually Hilton) and know what it is like to be in guest service. Great job! I will defiantly recommend this hotel.

Came in very early and got immidiate help to store luggage with the very professional staff. They told me that they had no rooms ready which i didnt have any problems with.After strolling around in NYC we came back and as a Diamond member i got upgraded to a beautiful queen room on 22nd with views over Empire. Bed was very comfy, coffee and tea machine was great with newmans blend that tasted like real coffee. Mouthwash, shampo and all other amneties as usual in the room.I would say that the size of the room is above NYC standards. I think this will be my new favourite hotel from now on with walking distance to my office near Penn station.Breakfast vouchers also handed out to an above than avarage breakfast buffet downstairs in the restaurant. Fresh and clean, creamy eggs, cripy bacon and good slextion of breads and pastry.

Just got back from a 5-night stay at this hotel, and I have nothing but compliments for the staff, for making the hotel stay free of problems. Housekeeping was very responsive to requests for extra hangers and towels. When front desk was provided the information about the overhead bathroom light going out, the technician was there in a few minutes.Restaurant downstairs had really good food!!! Everyone at the front desk, doorman, and concierge were very helpful and pleasant. Location is great. Overall, a very pleasant stay - too bad that they had no rooms available for my return in December.

Just be aware that this hotel charges $14.95 PER DAY for Internet service unless you are Hilton Honors Gold level. It's free in lobby and bar areas. Otherwise our stay was great over Thanksgiving holiday. Try out Johnny's or Malibu for breakfast.

We stayed in a high-floor room, which had a nice view of NYC (unfortunately, we weren't on the Empire State side, but still amazing!). The room was perfect for two people, with comfy beds & a small but usable bathroom. The lobby is beautiful to walk into in the morning, or after a 'hard' day of sight seeing! The upstairs bar was a real highlight for us as, while expensive, the view when they open the roof towards the Empire State Building is something to behold! I would recommend a stay here as it is a short walk to Madison Square Garden, Time Square and tour bus pickup points.

Highly recommend the Hilton New York Fashion District. The best value in NYC. Rooms are spacious and the location is excellent. The entire staff is always friendly, attentive and helpful. Looking forward to my next stay.

I had such a pleasant stay at this hotel for a week at the end of August 2013. The room (2 Queen Beds) was a decent size and appropriately apportioned. The bathroom also was a decent size. But the real stars of the hotel were the people on staff. From the front desk to housekeeping to the bar to room service and everyone in between, the entire hotel staff aimed to please and succeeded. I spoke with the manager (whose name escapes me at the moment) and extended my appreciation to her when I left. From talking to her, you could really get a sense of why the people working at this place took pride in their jobs and that the positive attitude went from the bottom to the top of the hierarchy. The rooftop bar has an awesome view, although the wine selection at that bar is pretty abysmal, considering it's more of a beer and burger type place. The lobby bar is a bit more posh (with a ridiculously good looking bartender). The location is really central to a lot of big NYC attractions, considering that it's within walking distance to mostly every midtown attraction. Plus, being in the middle of Fashion Avenue near two of the biggest design schools, you're sure to see some interesting outfits on the students wandering about the neighborhood. You're in Chelsea, so you get a Whole Foods nearby (and a Crumbs when you're over being healthy). I would definitely stay here again!

Cathy, JT and John was very helpful! Gin-who I still think is a professional wrestler- helped with transportation to the airport and the service there did not lack from what Hilton gave me. Love the hotel, location, and most especially the staff. I recommend my family to stay there for their visit next month.

I stayed at this Hilton on last week and I must say that it is probably the service was top notch. Everyone that I dealt with in a custom facing capacity went above a beyond in terms of courtesy, and making sure my needs were met. I travel quite a bit and it has been quite awhile since I have experienced service on this level from a hotel.Bar none, this was probably the best hilton experience that I have had in all of my travels. Exceptional!Don C.

Standard room size for New York. Hotel was clean. The biggest complaint we had with the room was the bed. While it was extremely the mattress was not supportive on one side and sloped off - this made it slightly uncomfortable. Otherwise it is a fairly standard Hilton.

I found the hotel to be in a great location walkable to most places I wanted to visit. The hotel staff was very hospitable and informative. The only thing I was a little surprised about was the parking being so expensive and you couldn't go in and out without a charge. Also I think internet should be complimentary in your room. I stayed in room 410 and it was great.Also I was surprised that the fitness room didn't have more machines. It appeared larger online
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
Toni M
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: This is a perfectly adequate hotel among middle ranking Hiltons. Don't expect the luxury or space of some of the European Hiltons or indeed the prime New York Hilton. The rooms are disappointingly small; you can just walk about around the bed; there is no separate chair other than at the desk; soundproofing is limited; and the floor-mounted aircon unit next to the window will blast air at whoever has that side of the bed. The hotel attempted to charge for each device using the internet, but that was soon sorted by the Manager who has a card in the room suggesting guests make email contact as necessary. More positively, pricing appears competitive;the employees are friendly; the doormen are efficient (not so much the rather dopey concierge who thought it would take 1.5 hours to get to JFK early on a Sunday by limo); and the restaurant for breakfast at c. $22 for the buffet is good value and has reasonable choice. Be sure to ask for the buffet if that is what you want since it is hidden away in another room. The hotel's convenience to all the main subways, the major city attractions, a plethora of restaurants and two large supermarkets have already been noted by other travellers. It is also easy to walk further south into Chelsea to explore further.

I believe I have stayed at all (or certainly most) of the hotels in the NY Fashion District and the Hilton on 26th Street was certainly the best. The rooms are nice, the elevators reasonably fast, the service in the restaurant and the bars excellent and the reception personnel attentive. The hotel is close to Penn Station (walking distance) and convenient to the subway. If you are in to health food, Whole Foods is less than two blocks away.

Whenever we go into Manhattan, Hilton is always our first choice and we like this one the best. The price is always right and the location is perfect - we can walk to just about anywhere. The rooms are on the small side, but more than adequate. It's Manhattan, if you're staying in the room, why bother? But, service is impecable and the hotel and rooms are spotless. Another plus is the rooftop lounge/bar. Open all year and there are some incredible views from there.

Perfect Location and professional Team. We came back already 4 times. Most important Areas in Manhattan are in Walking distance (Time Square, Union Square, High Line Park etc.). The staff remembered us already the second time!

Excellent service, from the front desk ( walked me to my room to let me in on check-in because the key machine was temporarily shooting blanks ) to the restaurant ( Pearl was great ).Restaurant was surprisingly good and fairly reasonable.Fitness center was not excellent, but there are plenty of clubs in the area.Room was as expected, and was clean and ready to go.

4 friends and myself stayed in this branch of the Hilton earlier this year. The hotel is conveniently placed a short distance from Penn Station, it is modern, clean, and reasonably priced. However, that's where the compliments end, despite having plentiful staff on the reception desk only a few were dealing with customers (the remainder were chatting). The staff at reception and on the door were not very approachable, and in fact seemed quite arrogant and pretentious! Personally, I was dismayed at this fact as having stayed in other Hilton's the staff are normally friendly, attentive, and approachable; I often stay at Hilton's throughout Europe in business. It's quite shocking that the staff we encountered were more interested in the tip they'd receive than the job itself! I am aware that tipping is customary is the United States, but I personally feel that a good level of service should be provided in order to merit such tips.Except from the staff, the only other disappointment with the hotel was that the "roof-top" bar was not available to myself and friends on the 3 occasions we desired entry. The reason for this is that it was booked for private parties! Surely the primary use of the bar should be for the hotel guests!Previous trips to the the United States have been shown that hotels (and staff) are very welcoming and accommodating. I will be visiting NYC again, I will stay in other Hilton's, but I will not be visiting this hilton again.P.s. I normally read trip advisor reviews on hotels etc, but don't post. However, a recent trip to Thailand and the fantastic levels of service received has compelled me to create a profile and give credit to some of the great places I've stayed and visited..... This has also prompted me to post a review on this hotel; recent stays in the Glasgow Hilton (UK), and the Den Hague Hilton (NL) have reflected how bad the the fashion District NYC experience actually was!

I travel to NYC a lot and normally stay at the DT on Broadway or HGI a couple streets over on 28th.The rates were the same as the HGI, so decided to give this property a try.This is a perfect location if you want to be near a lot of things but not have to deal with the madness of the crowded sidewalks in times square. The 1 subway is only a couple blocks away and will take you to times square or the 8th street subway is close by as well. The weather was nice this weekend and I enjoy walking anyway and it is only about a 15 minute walk to the theaters depending on how congested the sidewalks are once you hit 42nd. The wife always likes to go to Macy's and I always like to shop at B&H everytime we are in NYC and it's convenient to both those stores. Also a great location for events at MSG.We prefer to use Newark Airport and it's only about a 10 minute walk to Penn Station and $12.50 a person to take the train to EWR.Plenty of restaurants on 7th to eat at and rare is very good as well.No suites, so the only upgrade is to a higher floor if you are diamond. Rooms are kind of small, but I guess average for NYC, and the furnishings are new and pretty modern. I like the Kcup coffee makers. Welcome bag with the water and chocolate covered raisins was nice at checkin and they recognized my diamond status which I always find nice.For HH-Diamonds you have a choice of a hot buffet or a variety of hot items off a special menu. I did the black forest crossaint one day and my wife did the eggs benedict that same morning and both were great. We both did the buffet the other morning. Not sure of the breakfast benefit for golds.My only real complaint was the elevators. They have three elevators that service all the guest floors and when the rooftop bar is open they take one of those out of service to use strictly for the bar. The one day we were there, some elevator problem happened and the elevator was stuck on a floor and unusable. That night, it meant only one elevator was usable since the other one was being used for the bar which caused a long wait.The room was pretty noisy and lots of street noise at night but we were facing the street. I would recomend getting a room away from the street and as high up as possible. I realize this isn't the Hiltons fault and they did leave earplugs in the room.Staff was great, location is perfect and I love the free breakfast. Will defnitely return.

We stayed for 3 nights at the end of October for a wedding anniversary celebration. The reception desk was very friendly and welcoming, and the booking-in procedure went without a hitch. We had an up-grade to "a room with a view" on an upper floor and it really was worth it. We had a magnificent view of the Empire State Building which looked quite fairy-like when lit up at night. The room was quite large with the usual king size bed and all the requirements for making tea, coffee etc. The hotel is centrally placed for easy 20 min.walk to many of NY's attractions such as Times Square, Macys, Madison Square Gdns, Central Park, and not too far from Penn station.. The restaurant on the ground floor is adequate and good value for money, (just don't expect cordon bleu). Many good restaurants in the neighbourhood, although they take some finding. All in all, a satisfied customer. Recommended.

Everything was spot-on: super-friendly and helpful front desk, and Leon from security was wonderfully helpful when our room key malfunctioned. Top-notch service all around! The location was good, in that we were able to shlep up 7th avenue, and back down 9th and hit a few galleries in Chelsea.

Stayed two nights in late October. Hotel was perfect. Great location (walk to everything and transportation close by if needed). Service was excellent. Hotel room was on the sampler side but more than adequate and very updated. There is a restaurant in the hotel but with so many wonderful places nearby we never went in. Nice fitness center which is always a must for me. Room was a little noisy from the outside (no one sleeps in the city it seems) so I would get a rear facing view next time. Overall a great hotel at a decent price and highly recommended for that area of the city.

The Hilton Fashion District has a boutique feel with all the amenities of a bigger hotel, plus you get Hilton's great customer service. I stay at this hotel whenever I can get a good rate since I absolutely love the location, the beds, and the coffee maker (Keurig)! My recent visit gave me another reason to choose it--there was an issue with the booking and the rate I thought I had booked. The manager, J.P. Destreza, took the time and effort it took to resolve this and follow-up with a revised receipt as I caught my flight home. The hotel is comfortable and very nice, but it's the customer service that keeps bringing me back to the Hilton New York Fashion District.

Well done Hilton! From the check-in to our departure your staff and accomidations were execellent. Friendly staff did not treat us like tourists, very friendly and approachable. We will surely be back.
user_name:
Mark V
Lancaster, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: The hotel is very compact. We had a nice double-queen room. The decorations are very tailored and neat - an homage to its location in the Fashion District. We've stayed here twice. In the winter the room was VERY drafty and cold. We couldn't keep our shoes on the floor because they became too cold to step into! But in the summer it was comfortable. The restaurant is nice, but doesn't stay open very late. The hotel's location is ideal for walking around midtown. The staff was very accommodating as you expect them to be at a Hilton. It was a pleasure to stay in this "newest" hotel in Manhattan.
user_name:
pah11
New York City, New York

review_body: We live in Boston and escape for a weekend in NYC every couple of months. We typically search around for the best hotel deal and this past weekend we ended up in the Hilton New York Fashion District.Overall it was a pleasant stay. We had a nice room in the back on a low floor so we didn't have a view, but there was no outside street noise either. The room was modern and the bathroom was super clean. The shades were 'black-out' ones and the bed was comfortable.My only complaint is that typical hotel rooms have a long hallway, in the room, separating the bed from the door out. In our room, our bed was a couple feet from the door so the hallway noise was terrible. We heard everyone pass by and come and go with the slamming doors from the room across the hall. Thankfully most people slept in as well so it didn't get too bad until late morning.

The purpose of my trip was business and I had meetings spread out from Chelsea to Soho to midtown. The location turned out perfectly central to everything I had to do and the accommodations and service far exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitively stay here the next time.

We walked to Times Square no problem. But the rooms were alright. Beds were soft and everything was clean. We requested a high room so we could have a veiw, but we had a veiw of the building next to us. No rooftops. ;-; And my last coffee coffee cup had a hole in it, but that's just me whining. Overall it was a great stay and I'd love to stay again.
user_name:
Jess H
Fort Wayne, Indiana, United States

review_body: We stayed here one night when we had a function in Chelsea. On check-in desk clerk was very friendly and efficient. Hotel was in excellent condition. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Was exactly what we were looking for. We paid extra for a room on a higher floor thinking we might get a city view. Instead our windows looked out onto the windows of adjacent buildings. From the time we initially booked until just before we arrived the prices dropped and the reservation was quickly changed to the lower price.

I have chosen this hotel because all the other Hiltons were with a insane high price during the NYC marathon weekend. I was working during the weekend on 42nd and 5th and this location seemed a bit far for a quick walking. I am glad I made the choice to stay here. Everything is brand new. The room size is NYC style of course but very cozy and comfortable.The Rare bar and grill is an excellent choice for dinner (see my review about them) and the rooftop bar has an amazing view of the Empire State building.If you are a HHonors Gold member you will be extremely satisfied with the benefits as they allow you to order anything on the breakfast menu, and the quality is really good!

Large room with a classic looking furniture; nice breakfast with large selection of meals, but too expensive for a nothing special hotel. Having to work in that area I've been there, but I honestly would look for something different for a vacation.

Like a little oasis on an otherwise non-touristy street, the Hilton New York felt like a hidden gem on 26th Street. We usually stay at the W in Union Square, but they were considerably more expensive for the weekend we chose, and were not running any specials. The Hilton rooms are definitely smaller, but you don't come to NYC to sit in the room. The amenities at the Hilton were comparable to the W, and the rooftop bar was lots of fun!Rooms: on the small side, but temperature control was responsive. Even on the 12th floor, you could hear the street noise, but hey, it's NYC. We could see into the windows of the FIT fashion students' classroom windows, which was cool. The bathroom was nice, tho the shower was one where you had to reach your head and shoulders in to turn on, so you got a blast of cold water before every shower, and the water pressure was low, but nothing that would be a deterrent from staying here again. Bars: Rooftop bar has great views and was fun, and is heated in the cooler weather. But it has the feel of a sports bar, since that is what's playing on the screens, and the alcohol choices are severely limited. (Nothing frozen, no blenders, etc.) Still, it was worth the view. The Rare (restaurant) bar in the lobby was fun, not too crowded when we were there and a nice atmosphere. Check in was super quick and check out is a breeze. Standard 11am TV-turnoff on day of check out, but that happens everywhere. Kureg machines in the room, iPod dock alarm clock, even a small closet. The mini fridge is the dispensing kind, so don't think you can squeeze some leftovers in there, you can't. All-in-all, nice little hotel in a great location with a pretty reasonable price.

A clean hotel in the fashion district of the City. Not too close to tourist attractions, but numerous subway options nearby. If you choose to drive into the City, which is ridiculous, do not expect to find street parking. Will be ticketed and probably towed at night, and only commercial vehicles can park in the area during the day. $40 for overnight parking is very expensive. Newer hotel. Staff were very friendly. Unlike the majority of Hilton family hotels I have previously stayed at, the front desk staff readily thanked me for being an HHonors Diamond member and handed me a bag with two (2) water bottles. I was told I had been provided a room away from construction noise, but could switch rooms if I was not happy with the assigned room. It was late, and even though the room was very small and tight, it was quiet as far as street noise, but I could easily hear the noise from the adjoining room. Room was clean. The towels were thin, and worn, and one (1) was quite dirty. There was no bath, just a tight shower. Bed was comfortable. Good breakfast, with good options and very attentive wait staff. I would probably stay at the hotel again as the price was very reasonable for New York City. Overall, an average hotel, but the higher rating is earned because of the staff.

I had never stayed in Chelsea before and this area was new to me. I truly enjoyed walking around and finding new places. Tube stops are a few blocks, but you can get to anywhere quickly. Hotel is pleasant, reasonably priced and the rooms is small but comfortable. Breakfast area is spacious and service is good. Cabs were a bit tough to get but bellman worked his but off to get us one.

I stay in NYC often for business and it is hard to find a nice hotel for around $300 a night. This place is not cheap, but there is a lot of value. I plan on coming back.Little things make the stay better. Like thick fluffy towels, Q-tips, fresh coffee maker, big shower, no bed spread, a big flat screen that faces the bed, a window that opens a little, iron, digital alarm clock, big desk, etc.Also a cool rooftop bar,

Service continued to be great even after I left ! I had a technical issue in reflecting my HH into my Freq flyer miles. I communicated with the hotel in order to get a contact # to resolve it, and they did not refer me to someone else, but helped me by resolving the issue by themselves! Thank you Ahram Suh !!!Mario W

I must admit, when I first saw the property, I thought my room was going to be small. Sometimes when you stay in New York City, you expect to have small rooms (well, based on the amount that you pay). But to my surprise, the rooms were nice and cozy. The staff were great! They were very nice and accommodating. The next time I venture up to New York, you'd best believe this place will be my first priority.
user_name:
MrJayBee
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Had a great stay recently at the Hilton Fashion District in NYC. Room was comfortable with all the standard amenities. The restaurant downstairs was great as well. Had a nice meal and a few drinks my first night there. The shower door opened inwards which was odd and made it hard to turn on without getting wet or having it flood the bathroom floor a bit but I've seen that in a few other NY hotels. My room was on one of the lower floors which led to a bit more street noise from cars and pedestrians than I'm used to, so I would request a higher floor or something not on the the street side.
user_name:
Evan O
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Clean and pristine for New York! Great restaurant and roof top bar. Staff was very friendly and service was fast at front desk and in restaurant. Housekeeping was attentive and respectful. Location was convenient and room was relatively quiet from outside noise.

After experiencing a horrible night at the Hilton Garden Inn Soho , I decided to look for better accomodation . I have stayed at dozens of hotels and this was the quickest checkin I ever experienced. Very clean rooms and a bit larger than expected except for the bathroom which are quite tiny. During this trip I travelled with my baby girl who was about 5 months old at the time , so among all of the other things a mom has to carry I had a full size stroller w/ car seat and a carryon yet the rooms is so spacious I didn't even need to fold the stroller. My number one priority is a clean room and this place fits the bill plus . The bed is super comfy and the concierge exceptional. My only complaint : As I was traveling with an infant it would have been nice if the bathroom included a tub instead of a walk-in shower ( parents with babies understand this ) bathing a baby in that type of shower is next to impossible. The location is perfect for tourist that like to walk to all the touristy stuff but are smart enough to stay a safe distance away from all the craziness near Times Square. - We'lll be back!

The Hilton New York Fashion District is in a great location that is accessible to just about anywhere you want to go in New York. We came with some friends of ours who also stayed here. The rooms were small but clean and well-maintained, and the staff was very friendly. We lucked out in that our room was facing the alley behind the hotel so it was much quieter. Our friends stayed on the street side of the hotel and said that the sirens and noise kept them from having a restful night. We tried both of the bars at the hotel. I would recommend the lobby bar since it is attached to the restaurant and allows you to have a bigger selection of food. We went to the Rare View Rooftop Bar in order to watch an NFL game on Sunday and were very disappointed by the limited options for food (also there were no prices listed except for drinks). The food that they did have was delicious (we tried the sliders, wings, nachos, and quesadilla over the course of the game), I just wish there had been more options. All in all it was a great stay!

Staff is fantastic, service to fast, room's are large by NYC standards. Location is great!, I stay here every time I come into NYC. The rooftop is amazing, given the lobby at night can be a little busy but that's a small price to pay for such a outstanding hotel.

Not only was the hotel very clean, in a great location, but the staff was very helpful. I felt compelled to put a thank you out there for the excellent service I received from the evening manger at the front desk. Sid went above and beyond what was necessary to allow my stay to be comfortable.I would highly recommend this hotel. There is a fun bar on the top floor, the rooms are small, but very well appointed and the staff is very considerate and attentive.Many thanks for a wonderful stay.

Just returned from a week's stay at the Hilton New York Fashion District hotel - check-in very straightforward had booked kingsize bedroomed which was on the 11th floor. Sleep quality very good, the room was well appointed with everything you need, good shower, TV, tea and coffee maker -view a bit of a let down with only a view of the building opposite . I was disappointed that wi-fi was only free in public rooms and that you had to pay extra to be able to access this in your own room - seems rather behind the times for such a modern city hotel? The Hotel also has a rooftop bar which provides an excellent view of the Empire State Building at night and is well worth visiting.The hotel is well placed within easy walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building and Macy's and east access to the subway which is very good and cheap for finding your way around New York. The concierge could not have been more helpful in identifying the best ways to get to the sights we wanted to a see and will also help with booking Broadway shows or arranging transport. You may also want to ensure you've brought a comfortable pair of walking shoes with you as it is likely you will walk miles!!We found a little french style bistro 'Cafe Champignon' on 7th Avenue 20th street? which had very good food for a reasonable price and where you were made to feel special rather than processed as in many other of the New York eating places we visited! One other benefit of this hotel is its proximity to the Fashion Institute of Technology which has free exhibitions which are well worth a visit.

Just came in from South Africa where they excel in service. Staff nice, room small but comfortable, location terrific. One block from the subway, next to Chelse. Everything very clean so this is the perfect base for moving around the city. We are on the 8th floor with views of the next door office building so will keep the drapes closed. I love the energy and the fashion institute next door.

We stayed for three nights at this hotel.I felt it was really comfortable and nice.Staffs are really friendly and kind.I could check in at AM 9:00.But I misread my room number and the room I first got was in the middle of cleaning.I complained about it to a staff and she kindly dealt with that.But that was my mistake!Sorry for the staff!Thank you staffs, for attending to my awkward English.I would choice here again if i can get a chance to visit NYC again.

Great location and very clean and modern rooms. We were a short subway ride to everything. Rooms are a little small but who stays in their room when there is so much to do in the city? This is a hidden treasure and a fantastic value for the location.

Booked and prepaid to stay here from Friday to Monday. On arriving at 2am on Friday night I was informed the hotel was overbooked and I would need to take a taxi to another hotel.The front desk staff dealt with it very well, but that doesn't make up for hours of missed sleep, and the annoyance of having to check out of the other hotel and return again the next day.Terrible experience.A hotel has so many rooms, I expect they know how many.... how do you overbook a hotel?

We love being in Chelsea, and this was a decent choice for a weekend. Room was furnished well, staff were extremely helpful. The roof garden with retractable roof is definitely a plus, although you don't have to be a guest to use it: great night time views of the city. With the exception of the semi-public restroom near the restaurant, everything was clean and tidy.

This was not my favorite New York hilton. The rooms were small and smelled like smoke. However it did have a nice size bathroom. If you are going for business not a bad choice but if you are going for vacation I would pick another hotel. It is about a 15-20 walk to Times Square. The hotel breakfast was good.

Second time I've stayed at this property, very good location, nice rooms, good staff, all the hallmarks of a good business hotel. Kudos to the doormen who are very dilligent in flagging down a cab when one is required (cabs don't seem to like 26th Street in the morning), they consistantly went out of their way to get one for me each time it was required. Also, if you're going to JFK from the property, check out their 'house car', the cost w/tip is less than a cab, was a nice suggestion by the doorman and a relaxing drive to the airport....!

The hotel itself is in a pretty good location - easy walking through Chelsea, easy to get further up or downtown. The place seems relatively modern and the building and rooms are in good condition. On checking in I was handed an amenity bag, with two bottles of water and a small box of snacks which was a nice touch.Rooms nothing much to write home about - but nicely appointed and the sort of size you would expect for a hotel in the city. The elevators were the biggest frustration with this hotel - if you stay here, be prepared to wait a while for the elevators to arrive on your floor - so if you need to get down to the lobby in a hurry, prepare ahead.

Hilton Fashion was recommended to us for its central location, convenience to subway and comfortable walking distances to most places of attraction. The whole staff was very good except there was a mis- and non- information incident at the Front desk which I am still chasing...a cost to me of US$156.00 after to and froing in and out of my daughter and I's credit cards to the tune of US$2000.00 plus the exchange rate and conversion fees of the A$.

Good location if you need to be around Union Station As a Hilton Diamond, you get free breakfast in the restaurant. There's a special menu which you can order off of. Or, you can get the buffet. All rooms are pretty much the same and are decent size for New York. I've stayed 4 or 5 times, and there has been elevator trouble a few times.
user_name:
Dee E
Boston, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: My best friend and I went to NYC for a quick shopping trip and picked this hotel because it was between SoHo and the stores near Rock Center. It was absolutely perfect. New hotel, comfortable beds, great location, friendly staff and a great rate! Would highly recommend.

My Fiancé and I stayed here over NYE 12/13 so this review is a little late..but better than never I guess! We stayed for 4 nights from the 29th of December - 2 January. The hotel and lobby area are very funky and really fit the vibe of the 'fashion district'. The decor was much newer and fresher looking than the Sheraton on Canal that we had spent the previous 5 nights at. The room was compact but that is to be expected in NYC and although it wasn't huge it was more than ample considering the amount of time we spent in the room.Location is good with only a 2 block walk to the next subway line. There were some good cafes and a whole foods within walking distance which was handy. My only complaint, and it may seem petty, was that when you order room service to your room, you are charged a delivery fee of about $3! On one of the days I got a salad for lunch from whole foods and didn't pick up a fork so I asked room service for one, when I was told about the fee I asked if I could just come and get the fork but was told the kitchen was on level 3 or something, which is off limit to guests. Another day we had thick shakes from the room service menu and same fee again. Seems so silly when you can order food from a local place that is usually cheaper food and they don't charge you a delivery fee! To add to the stupidity - when your food order from outside arrives some one from the concierge has to escort the delivery guy up to your room as the elevators are key access only!! What a waste of your staffers time. I just thought it was a bit ridiculous considering we were already paying a premium of about $400 a night for the room over this time of year.Don't get me wrong in that this wouldn't sway my decision to return to this hotel as I absolutely would - just a bit of feedback on the overall experience. Other than that we really liked this place and thought the location was great!

It's not easy to rest easy in the city that never sleeps - but it can be done in this Hilton. Clean, convenient and a very helpful staff. Rooms were a nice size - not huge but way better than the usual NY shoebox. Internet worked well and the roof top bar was fantastic - if not a little loud (but hey it is NY). Would do it all over again!

What more can I say.I'm born and bred from England - English is native. Took a while for my to explain a certain situation (accidentally booked an accessible room instead of a normal one so I was asking if we could change)After a couple of minutes passed I could see the staff giving the 'oh someone complaining' kind of look, as though they were fed up. After finally sorting everything out, I turned around and could hear them say "Took ages - she should have known" and the other sayng "You know what asians are like"...I think it's self explanatory how I feel about this place. I advanced booked to come on the 24th-29th November too BEFORE I realised how racist and rude the staff were. Safe to say I am not looking forward

We come to NY two times a year on business and this is now our go to place to stay. The staff is always so wonderful especially Dean who helped us arrange a car to the airport. Love it here look forward to coming back in August!

2nd year in a row staying at the Hilton Fashion District. The staff were very pleasant and accommodating, anything we wanted they were happy to assist with. Location is great, walking distance from all major sites. Roof top bar is a must visit, fantastic views both day and night.

Lets start with the price - probably the best rates we have seen for an NYC hotel - great location, courteous staff, comfortable beds. We were pleasantly surprised that you needed to scan your room key to get access to your floor (in the elevator). If you are staying here you have to check out the rooftop lounge - probably our favorite part of the stay.

it was just ok for me - clean and efficient - no wow factor which you kind of want to expect in NYC. Room was basic and service was good. Location was very convenient to easily move around in city. Overall fine but just not memorable.

Quick check in, room was on 3rd overlooking another building which was fine wanted a room with a view but got over it very quick.Room was a good size and the bathroom was great very clean looked new.We didn't eat at the hotel as the menu was a little limited for a fussy eater but we didn't need to enough places close by. The roof top bar was fab! Cheap drinks on game night and a great view, an added bonus to this hotel.As a travel agent I would recommend this hotel to my customers.Ok it isn't the closest hotel to times square but only about 10-15 mins away, nr Madison sq gardens and empire state.The only let down for me was I did email Hilton and fax the hotel to advise that is was my partners birthday but nothing was done, normally we would receive chocolates or wine in the past at others hotels but nothing here.

The hotel was good, clean, nice and spacious rooms (not very big but just enough for trip to NYC). The service at the reception was courteous. It's not cheap but worth the money. Cones: not enough elevators, so you have to wait for them.

I was in NYC for the weekend for a conference and stayed at this Hilton Property. The rooms, although small (like most NYC hotels), were modern, comfortable and well equipped. The staff was pleasant and welcoming upon my arrival. There is nice restaurant and bar in the hotel called Rare which made it convenient to have breakfast and a drink in the evening.

We stayed at the Hilton NY over night on Sep. Our room was a double room traveling with two small kids 4,and 3 year old.Beds were very comfortable and clean! I did notice the mattresses had covers (nice) bathroom nice and clean, not a big room but very comfortable. Next morning had breakfast buffet it was good. Not Great! But good price! And friendly staff!

Great location right in the heart of NYC. Convenient for both business and pleasure. Rooms are smallish (typical NY) but decent. It's quite a new hotel so not run down or anything yet unlike many other hotels in NY in that category. Staff was friendly and helpful and the burgers in the downstairs restaurant are awesome.Would I come back bad stay again? Yes!

This was a great hotel! It was very clean and updated, the staff was friendly, and it had a nice bar. The location couldn't have been better and the price was one of the best we found in Manhattan... it's nearly impossible to find a good hotel under $200 these days. They even granted a late check out when we asked. The front desk also gave us a room on a high floor as requested and gave us bottles of water at check-in. We were already planning our next trip to the city while leaving and we will DEFINATELY be staying here again. Great find.

Perfect location for my first visit to the city! Easy reach to all the sights. The hotel was spotless and the staff were so friendly and helpful. We had a great dinner in the restaurant and the view from the rooftop bar was breathtaking, good tunes too! We had to query an extra $70 which was charged to our room, but the reception staff quickly rectified this for us. Will definately stay here again, can't wait to book my next visit.

It's a Hilton - so it's consistent with the brand - clean, comfortable, conveniently located. The service here is fantastic. One thing that stands out is the restaurant offerings - the rooftop bar is fun and the view is beautiful! "Rare" is perfect for a night at the bar or a sit-down dinner. Great food, great service. Only downside is the rooms don't have much soundproofing to the outside, so the street noise is worse than other NYC hotels I've stayed in.

Great Hotel. Great Location. Everyone was extremely helpful. My room was spotless and cleaned everyday. Truly a great experience. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone for business or leisure.
user_name:
Dawn Litwak N
Simi Valley, United States

review_body: Just checked out of our 4 night stay at the Hilton Fashion District.Great little hotel, all the staff were very friendly and a credit to New York and the hotel.We found Caroline at the front desk particularly helpful and friendly.The hotel room is small but from what I gather all hotel rooms in NYC are.We did a lot of walking and the hotel is about 15 blocks from Time Square. It took us an easy 25 minute walk to and from there many times.The Hotel is still very much in the heart of the city with lots of 24hour cafes and stalls nearby.The best thing about the hotel is its location. Quiet enough at night to afford a good night sleep without listening to garbage trucks, police cars and car horns all night. Room was clean and comfy. Several local subway stations. Great value.

Maintenance apparently trumped guest comfort and quiet. Also, despite talking to 4 employees, they failed to understand that I needed distilled water rather than fancy drinking water for a medical device. Pretty shabby for close to $500 a night.

We stayed there for 3 nights. The hotel is more central when you liked to be more south. Everything looks modern and clean. Our room was quite big with a nice view. The room was also clean and modern. I personally do not like that the light goes on when somebody goes in the bathroom especially at night. The view from the rooftop bar was incredible. The service at the restaurant for Hilton and honors members is upgradable. On one day nobody took notice of us and luckily we got coffee and helped us with the very nice buffet. There was also a problem with the coupons and nobody excused about it.

I believe that this hotel has recently been renovated - and therefore is offered at a competitive rate. Which is fortunate, as the property is located in a good area that puts you in easy reach of Chelsea and Meatpacking.The rooms are a decent size and comfortable. I had a room on the 22nd floor, which offered me a great view of the Empire State Building.But thats where it ends really. There's nothing special about this place, so if you are on a budget, then you pay for what you get. In fact you pay through the nose for WIFI - $14 per day. This can be bypassed if you log in to the free service in the lobby, then take your devices up to your room. I see no reason why the Hilton feels the need to charge for what is now a basic requirement for business travellers.The major downside is the "rooftop" bar, which is essentially a tacky soulless cougar den serving poor cocktails in plastic glasses. Not even the view of the city could save this place. Drink anywhere but here.

The Hilton Fashion District is reliably good. It's a fantastic deal for NYC. Most cheaper hotels are in the Financial District, but the Hilton is right next to Chelsea and close to the subway for easy access anywhere in Manhattan. The burger place downstairs is great. The staff are friendly and the rooms are comfy. I've stayed at this hotel often and the only problem I've had in the past is with valet service. It's not even the hotel staff's fault; it's the garage they subcontract out to. Give yourself plenty of time for your car if you use the valet service. Otherwise, this place is a gem.

Kristin M. was very helpful to me upon arrival, mapping out (literally, with pen and highlighter) multiple destinations & subway options for each. Kristin's knowledgeable and helpful response made my stay a pleasure.

Traveled with my cousin to NYC for our 60th birthdays and stayed here cause they gave us a great rate. I travel to NYC often, but never stayed here before but this experience was so good, I can't see myself staying any other hotel in NYC. Rooms are clean and well-kept - not roomy, but not small either. Staff is what makes the difference here. Mily at the front desk was professional and accommodating. The restaurant, called Rare, had great food (try the Vegetarian Meltsation - thin slices of eggplant replaces bread on this 'sandwich' of portobello mushrooms, red peppers and brie - and reasonably priced too! The drive in from the airport was $120.00 USD. Dean at the front desk got us a car with tips, taxes and tolls all in the cost was $88.00. I'll never book anywhere else when I visit NYC - you have got to love Thirsty Thursday and cupcake day!

Check in was very speedy! Hotel held are bags as we arrived before check in time! We had contacted hotel before hand to check this was okay. Room was small but clean and modern! Had everything we needed for the amount of time we spent in it. Bathroom very clean and modern. No tub just walk in shower. Restaurant was very very good, nice food, nice atmosphere and great service!!Staff were friendly and approachable- helping pick restaurants for evening meals and booking shuttle from hotel to the airport. The location would probably put us off returning as we found ourselves around Times Square every night. But overall an enjoyable stay! Thank you!

My spouse and I stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for 1 night in mid-July 2013. We redeemed Hilton HHonors points for a free night's stay. The hotel is located in the midtown area (in the Garment District), near Madison Square Garden/Penn Station, so it is a good location for Times Square sightseeing, and offers convenient access to various subway lines, bars, restaurants, and souvenir shops. The lobby area itself is not large, although it offers a few places for guests to sit and chat. The décor fits the theme of a Fashion District hotel, with spools of thread composing an interesting art piece behind the front desk, which has space for three agents to check guests in (one agent is reserved for Hhonors check-ins). A tiny concierge/tour desk is located adjacent to the front door. RARE Bar & Grill is located at one end of the lobby, where breakfast is served (complimentary for Hhonors Gold and Diamond members; however, we did not partake of breakfast). The hotel also features the RARE rooftop bar and lounge, although we did not visit that either. In the evenings, one elevator is dedicated to whisking patrons from the lobby to the 23rd floor rooftop. Two additional elevators access guestrooms on the 2nd to 22nd floors. The hotel offers valet and self-parking for an additional fee, and the garage is located just a few yards from the hotel entrance. Taxi cabs were plentiful in front of the hotel. We had a corner room on the 22nd floor with a great view of the Empire State Building. The room was average size for New York City, with a king-size bed abutted by two nightstands, a desk/dresser/bureau combination, small ottoman/seat that could be moved around, and a shelving unit that housed the glass-fronted minibar (do not move anything or you will be charged) and coffee-making supplies, and a small closet that contained an electronic safe, iron, and ironing board. The room décor was modern and appealing, and the fashion theme (or sewing theme) carried through on some of the artwork. The bathroom was a decent size, with a combination tub/shower unit and large countertop vanity with a single sink. The light fixture is super modern and just a little dangerous, in our opinion. It is a long thin tube light that projects just a little too far from the wall for our comfort because it can be confused for a pipe. Peter Thomas Roth toiletries were provided - two kinds of soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, and mouthwash, as well as Q-tips and cotton balls. Three sets of towels were provided, despite the fact that the room could really only sleep two guests. (We have found only two sets of towels in most Hilton properties that we have recently stayed, so the third set was a welcome site.) The hotel does not offer turndown service, nor does it offer vending or ice machines; however, we called down to the front desk several times to request ice delivery, and it was done quickly, complimentarily, and with a smile. We would not hesitate to stay here again, although there are three other Hilton properties within a few blocks of this one (Doubletree, Hampton Inn, and Hilton Garden Inn), so those are valid options as well if you are loyal to Hilton.

Hilton elite member traveling for business. Canceled 2 days in advance last week and was charged $75 + taxes for not adhering to the 3 day cancellation policy. After calling the hotel to explain, they would not credit the charge. I spend many nights in Hiltons and decided to take my business to another Hilton in NYC this week due to this experience. I suggest you do as well.

I can not speak high enough of this hotel! We arrived on a their "thirsty Thursday" and were greated with a glass of wine and a room upgrade to the top floor. The cheapest room rate I found was directly thru the hilton website, and was one the cheapest I could find for the area. It is in a central location, with no local noise, only a few blocks away from times square, and under a 5 min walk to a subway station; tho we didnt need to use the subway as we were able to walk within half hr to city attractions! The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly and there is a rooftop bar! The room was cleaned daily, and had a massive tv, tidy bathroom with an amazing shower (the water was the best pressure all trip)!

New York stay has never been so accomodating. The sales rep. Ivan to the Supervisor Sid, to the cleaning staff, Concierge, Front Desk, Door Man. Everyone was friendly, thoughtful and just nice. I have traveled and been to 5 star establishments and other Hiltons. This was my nicest stay. The room service was exceptional and fresh. Thank you I will be back.

very clean, nicely appointed, good location, roof top bar is fun & offers great view of NYC skyline at nite. Staff most helpful with where to eat, where to shop & play! Spend 6 days exploring 10 neighbourhoods & hotel was good central location to navigate the subways to get around.

I stayed here the other weak and was pretty disappointed - the location is good if you want Midtown - Chelsea - Fashion District. The staff were friendly enough. The room though was a let down. The room was pretty small and had large windows that faced the rear buildings large windows - zero privacy. This would have been ok if there had been anything else on the windows than blinds - no sheers. So it was a choice of full view or blocking out what very limited natural light the room was getting. The door was thin and there was a lot of outside noise....... I am unlikely to stay there again so many other choices for the price in the area.

we had a great experience at the hotel. you're close to absolutely everything needed in nyc, and there are some great new bars/restaurants on 26th st. We checked in rather late, and Sid was EXTREMELY helpful in making the process go as smoothly as possible. even the maids were a hit, everyone took great care of my family - no doubt i would come back.

If your looking for a place where you're treated like you matter, this is the place. It is conveniently located in the city so that trips to the highlights of Manhattan are never far away. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

We covered an absolutely HUGE amount of New York during a 3-day sightseeing visit and I don't see how it would have been possible if we had stayed anywhere else (esp further north or south). Centrally located (geographically) in Manhattan and a very short 2 block walk to the subway, we could get virtually anywhere in the city in 20 minutes, max! Beyond that, the hotel itself is fine - quite chic and very efficient. Friendly staff and good service. The rooms are comfortable and clean and definitely a "New York" version of "large". But hey, when you're out seeing so much you hardly have time to notice that you have to step over your bags to reach the lavatory! I guess my only criticism is that the decor/atmosphere of the rooftop bar (rated among the city's best) simply does not match the rest of the hotel. The light oak/spruce-covered walls make it feel like a place that specializes in BBQ and chicken wings (a la Hooters?) rather than a romantic and chic perch above a fantastically located and otherwise chic hotel!

I was on the 4th floor and lady from house keeping spoke to me every time she saw me and asked how I was doing and if there was anything she could do.Also the bar Rare View describes it well...a great view of the city to enjoy your favorite beverage.

I decided to stay here since it was near FIT and close to Penn Station and in the heart of Chelsea. Just off 7th Avenue, it is very well located. Good lobby and the checkin was smooth. The room was small like all typical New york hotels. Otherwise comfortable beds with small but well appointed bathrooms. I could hear from my next door room and the door locks make a lot of noise and can be heard from outside. Could not figure out the airconditioning as it got very cold and then used to switch off midway thru the night. The RARE bar on the top floor was ok. Great views but was very noisy!!!. Lots of small restaurants and fast food joints nearby for a quick bite. Good overall service and the staff is very helpful in organising taxi's or airport drops. I would go back to this hotel on my next trip.

Excellent access to this world-class hotel which has off-street lane for hassle-free unloading/loading. Self/valet parking half block down the street. Instant service by remarkably friendly staff sets the standard in customer service. Smiles, friendly chat, courteous service are genuine standards at this service-oriented hotel. Rooms have best beds we've encountered in years of US and European travel. Room service is prompt, courteous and friendly.Excellent locationable to easily walk to all neighborhoods between lower Central Park and Staten Island ferry. This excellent hotel is the standard bearer forAmerican service.

The building itself is functional. The neighborhood is standard Chelsea. But what REALLY sets this place apart is the service. I arrived VERY late one morning, 2:30AM, and the hotel was ready for me. They had my keycard ready, and even asked if I was hungry (which I was). They then suggested a place that delivered and suggested I could shower and relax, and they'd call me when the food arrived. When the food DID arrive, it was around 4:00 so they offered a later check out time. Because I got in so late, I didn't get to experience any of the amenities. The room was VERY comfortable and the TV even greeted me when I arrived. I travel for work all the time but almost never had a chance to stay at a Hilton so I didn't know what to expect. I was very happily shocked. One thing to keep in mind - unlike a lot of other hotels, unless you're a Hilton member, internet access is an additional cost. However, the rooms here are less expensive than comparable hotels with free internet, so I'd rather pay for internet at a hotel with such great service, than get internet free from some chain with surly front desk staff. Next time I'm in NY, back to Hilton NY Fashion District.

The building is correct, not luxurious. The best is the people who work in it. The service is excellent. The continental breakfast is good at "RARE" restaurant. And the house made vegetable soup is fresh and tasty. The attention of the people at the front desk is excellent. Caroline assist me in many request quickly and efficiently. It is not fancy, but very comfortable.The rooms are ok and the maids work efficiently.

I travel to NYC on business about 8 weeks a year and have been doing do for the last 4 years.As a Hilton preferred customer I have stayed in 3 different Hiltons, The Waldorf Astoria and 2 Doubletrees in Manhattan over the last 5 years.By far my favorite is the Hilton Fashion District.The location is quiet compared to the other hotels- though still central to the majority of the attractions I enjoy. The staff here is attentive and gracious without being pretentious.Especially the folks at the front desk. The ladies there are fantastic and I always look forward to stepping into the hotel. :-)I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues.

This Hilton is in the perfect location if you want to see plays, restaurants, characters from TV shows. I requested an accessible room with a roll in shower but got a hearing impaired accessible. I called to find out why I wasn't given the room of my choice and was told they could find me another room on a lower floor. I was settled in and stayed in the room and tried to be as careful as possible. Also, I was promised a 2:00 p.m. check-out because I'm an AARP member and was given a hard time by the front desk receptionist. A manager just happened to be passing by and overheard the conversation. He told her to give me the 2 o'clock check out and she reminded him that they would be very busy the next day. He told her to give it to me. I had a great time in New York but I thought I paid too much money for the inconveniences.

We stayed there for our honeymoon trip. We got upgraded to 18th floor whoch provided us with great views of the town. It was close t everything - we walked to finance centre and to central park (it was a good walk) but very nice. REally enjoy the stay. Nice quiet and well placed hotel

I spent a couple of nights at this hotel, I called in advance to find out if my room could be changed to a double. Terrible customer service, finally my friend didn't come and I got the room changed. The room was small in the second floor, no view and a smelly room. When I was leaving they tried to charge for an extra person, even when I made clear no one was coming and no one did. Very disappointing. I've stayed in the Ritz Carlton of battery park and Marriott and got much better customer service. Sorry but not a repeat.

Recently stayed at the hotel which is in a great location. It is about a 10 minute walk away from The Empire State Buidling and the lively hotel roof top bar has magnificant views of it. The rooms were not small at all and the beds were very comfortable, although the air conditioning unit in the room was noisy so didnt have it turned on at night. There is free wifi in the hotel reception area which does work in the hotel room as well, depending on the signal strength, and they do have a small business centre which was great from checking in for our flight on-line and printing off the boarding cards. Reception staff were helpful, some door staff werent as helpful. Would definitely stay at this hotel again, overall a fantastic NYC stay. There is a gorgeous Italian restaurant a few doors away from the hotel called Tre Dici if you fancy dining out.

The Hilton Fashion District is a nice hotel in a great location. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was quiet and comfortable. I had a great burger at the hotel restaurant, Rare. The hotel is an easy walk to everything from Times Square to Union Square. Subway station is close also.

We stayed here over the summer and found this hotel to be very nice. It is a short walk to the subway and in a great location. The roof top bar has a great view of the city and decently priced drinks compared to the rest of Manhattan. They provided for early check in, and arranged transportation back to LaGuardia. I would definitely stay here again.

Having stayed in several different Hilton Hotels, this one was definitely up to standard. The rooms in any Hilton are beautiful with the most comfortable beds, and this one is no exception.The views are alright - could see the Empire State from our window as requested, but could also see the grotty back end of the hotel - you win some you lost some though eh?The hotel was clean, great location and comfortable. We stayed for five nights and we very happy throughout. My now husband asked if we could have a view of the Empire State Building as we were there celebrating our engagement. They did this, as well as leaving us a bottle of bubble and treats on arrival! A nice touch. We didn't sample the food there, or the room service, but what we did do we were happy with.

I've stayed at the Fashion District Hilton at least 5 times over the past 3 years for both business and weekend getaways and have had good experience every time. Front desk staff is always extremely friendly and helpful. Next door neighbor was a bit noisy on my last trip, but hotel security addressed the problem within 5 minutes of my call. The location is great because it is away from the crowds in Times Square but walking distance to many good neighborhoods. The rooms are small but clean and modern. There is really no view from the rooms, but the rooftop bar has a nice view both north and south. Valet parking is $65 per night, but you can probably find a cheaper garage if you plan ahead. 5 short block walk from NY Penn Station if you take the train into NYC.

While we picked the Yotel on 10th avenue and 42nd street as the main hotel for the out of town guests for our daughter's NYC wedding, the Hilton Fashion District was a good 2nd venue for a number of reasons. Great location - just down the street from Chelsea Piers, which is where the ceremony and reception took place. Great for families - they had adjoining rooms with twin beds so that parents could stay in one room and two children in the next room with an internal door in between. And Li the event planner was great, very helpful.

Just stayed one night and enjoyed. Overall it was an enjoyable stay but for a couple of things I didn't particularly like. was the room key card and using the elevator. You had to press your card against a reader, wait for light to turn green then hit button for floor. If you make a mistake good chance you may be headed up or down past your room. Didn't give much time to figure out. Second was the toilet flush was very loud. Tough during night or morning when others are trying to sleep. But over all would recommend.

I stayed here for 2 days to break up my trip to South Carolina and it was brilliant. After a 21hr flight from Australia, the staff greeted me with a big smile and the amenities in my room were absolutely fantastic. The location is also a bonus, with limited time i was able to see most of south manhattan. Will definitely be back again for a proper visit of the city that never sleeps.

The Hilton is well located near 7th and 26th in Manhattan, but the facility is disappointing. The rooms are very small, the in room air-conditioner is noisy. The monitor for the TV does not turn, and channel selection is limited. The elevators are slow. As a Hilton Honors member my profile requests two things: a higher floor, and a room away from the elevators. I was assigned room 215 which is obviously a low floor looking into a wall, and directly behind and next to the elevators. Some service for their preferred customers. I could have complained, but it was late, and there were things to prepare for the following day, so I did not. That was my mistake. During the time when the noise from the air conditioning was not deafening, the elevators were pinging and ringing away. Needless to say, our business will go somewhere else in New York next trip.

We were there for 3 nights. Location of this hotel is central, walking distance to metro stations and many restaurants nearby. The staff were friendly and polite although we were a bit concerned at first after reading all the bad attitudes comments. Room is fairly small yet decent, clean and equipped with amenities. Only complain is that the walls of the rooms are quite thin. We could hear people on the streets even we stayed on the 8th floor. And hear flushing sounds when above guest flushes their toilet. Overall, we had quite a pleasant stay.

when we arrived, the type of room we had asked for was not available. the Night Front desk staff were extremely rude, and unprofessional. The room on the second floor, was too noisy and too close to the street. It was also so close to the Staff closet/room, exit and supplies. So all we heard during the night is doors being shut. Also, this hotel is not the best of locations, it is so far from everything and the surrounding area near by is not so great if you are visiting for leisure.

We stayed 3 nights at the Hilton in Fashion District and loved it. The hotel location was perfect Two blocks from the subway and not far from the Village and Broadway. The hotel room is spacious in NY standard and the staff was courteous and extremely helpful. The overall experience was great and we highly recommend it.

We stayed there 1 night in july, after having stayed 5 nights somewhere else. The Hotel is very good (but a bit pricey), clean and with decent sized rooms (obviously they're not big, but considering it's NY, the size is ok). Location is great, room and bathroom were very clean, staff was helpful and efficient, and the A/C worked perfectly fine (which, surprisingly, doesn't happen very often in USA). The only bad thing i could think is the lack of free wifi in the rooms (although you get it in the lobby). For me a hotel that doesn't give free wifi in 2013, is like a hotel that didn't have A/C or TV 20 years ago.Overall a good stay (and short). I'd definitely return.

Our room was clean and service for the most part was good. We asked for a few things and they were delivered to our room promptly. That being said, I have to rate the hotel “poor” due to two issues that really ruined our experience.We went to the front desk to check in. One of the employees was standing behind a computer so I walked up to her and started checking in (so I thought). She had this puzzled look on her face and asked me, “Check in?” Then she pointed to another line, “Over there.” I asked if this counter was for gold/diamond members only because there was an HHonors sign on the counter (and I’m a gold member). She replied loudly and slowly, “WE HAVE THE HHONORS SIGN BECAUSE WE ARE A HILTON HOTEL.” I don’t know where all that attitude came from and apparently this hotel doesn’t have a separate line for gold/diamond members.We booked a “high floor” room through a third-party website who told me “high floor” meant 15th floor or higher. Hilton’s own website says high floor rooms “have magnificent views of New York City's iconic buildings…” Our room was on the 14th floor and had a view of couple dozen windows across the street. When I called the front desk, I was told 12th floor and above were considered “high floor” and I was misinformed by the third-party website. So, if you decide to spend a little extra on a “high floor” room for “magnificent views of New York City's iconic buildings”, there’s a chance the best they can offer you is the windows across the street. Can you say false advertising?

I stayed 10 nights at Hilton Fashion District location and had an excellent experience. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating and so was the restaurant staff - I enjoyed a very nice breakfast each morning.
user_name:
Arendals
New York City, New York

review_body: Great experience and great location at this hotel. The staff was very friendly. The room was a bit small but was clean and comfortable. No problems during my 4 day stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone or stay here again.
user_name:
Ernest L
Upper Marlboro, United States

review_body: Unconcerned staff, ignored basic requests for enough towels to accommodate each guest, failed to restock toilet and facial tissue, never cleaned the toilet daily, bellhops stood out in front of hotel like bouncers leaving guests feeling uncomfortable, adjacent restaurant left smelly garbage out in front of store front that you have to walk by each evening, small room accommodations for the price, did not even provide complimentary bottled water each day for guests, etc. ... extremely poor value in a very high priced area of New York - choose another location and perhaps brand of hotel for a better experience!
user_name:
Richard M M
New York, United States

review_body: We had a great stay here due to location, convenience, and comfortable room which is clean and modern. Bigger than some four star hotel rooms near Times Square area. I love updated and roomy bathrooms like theirs. Steps away from subway stations, coffee shops, restaurants, and grocery stores, so convenient~

Had only one request: to be put away from the elevator. Instead they gave me a room directly in front of the elevator. When I spoke to the manager, he refused to accomodate my request due my room being an upgrade even though I did not request an upgrade. To me being away from the noisy elevator is much more important than a room on a higher floor. Very disappointed and the furnishing of the room is very outdated.

We booked two rooms. My mom and daughter had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building, while our room looked onto the neighboring brick wall. Rooms clean, well maintained and ours, whilst without a view, was very quiet. The entire staff very accommodating. Everyone friendly and helpful. The Roof top bar was great. Very close to all train stations and cabs easy to catch. Wallking distance to many attractions. Would stay again.

This hotel is centrally located and would be a good value if the price of the rooms wasn't so inflated for NYC. The rooms are on the small side, but are modern with clean new modern bathrooms. There are restaurants in the lobby and on the roof and lots in the area. I may choose this hotel again if there was a good rate, but it is just okay compared to other hotels in the area.

Excellent Location. Decent rooms, clean and comfortable. Only downside - no free wiFi (in this day and age that should come as standard - no?). They have also got a great rooftop bar - worth checking out.

Everything was perfect the staff were friendly just loved the environment. When i checked in i was upgraded from a queen to a king. The bathroom was beautiful made out of marble.Will definitely come back. And the complimentary cupcakes when I checked in was a nice touch.
user_name:
Emilemny M
New York, United States

review_body: My second time at the Hilton Fashion District. Very good value considering NY prices. Perhaps the best of the several new "in-fill" small hotels in Chelsea. Yes, small room but well furnished, almost new, good bed, bath etc. All the attributes of a more expensive hotel but on a smaller scale. Rare Bar and Grill is convenient and lively (best hamburger for the price in NYC). But come on Hilton! You are perhaps the only hotel chain, big or small, in the USA still charging for WiFi (only free for "gold" level Hilton Rewards members). I get free WiFi even in b&b's.

Check in was very quick and easy, they were prepared for our arrival. We got a king size bedroom for two people. The room was small but it was clean, modern and had every we needed including a Keurig coffee maker. It was very comfortable. The location was convenient and close to attractions but it was pretty quiet. The rooftop bar provided a great view, music and drinks. Breakfast was good and the service was very friendly.It's not most fancy place but for the price and location, it's perfect.

Hilton botched our reservation and kicked us out a day early. They didn't offer any assistance and didn't care if we found a place to stay near our conference. The staff including the manager and the 800 operator were ice cold. I will go out of my way to avoid Hilton in the future.

My friends and I chose to stay at the Hilton hotel Fashion district as the Hilton brand is so renowned around the world - we thought it would be the safest option for staying in a city unknown to us. Our trip to NYC was 9 days in total, so comfort, great service and ease is what we were looking for in a hotel. Unfortunately, this is not what we found at the Hilton Fashion District. Not only were the lifts small in size, the room to accomodate for 3 girls, was smaller than my bedroom at home -- as soon as we stepped in the door I started feeling so costraphobic, not only was it small it was SO stuffy. To be quite open, I couldn't even go to the bathroom without having to keep the bathroom door open - how uncomforting! We explained this to the front office staff who were completely unempathetic and would not move us to a different room. We spent out first night in NYC looking up alternate hotels to stay in and checked out of this hotel the following morning and found a much more accomodating hotel (The Refinery - amazing!).However, unfortunately this was not the end of our dealings with Hilton. After a few days into our NYC trip, we noticed on our travel card statements that the hilton was taking money from our accounts, one of the multiple transactions was over $2000!!!!!!!!! Being on a budget holiday and in an expensive city, this was the most stressful thing that could have happened and we spent our only Saturday evening (until 9pm) at the Hilton reception, arguing back and forth why Hilton STOLE money from our account without any authorization. After 4 hours, FINALLY we came to an agreement that the Hilton would get the money back into all of our accounts - and we were still not given an explanation as to why the money was even taken out. The service at the front desk was APPALLING, unempathetic and so unprofessional. Staying at this hotel is not a risk you would want to take in terms of keeping your money safe when passing on credit card details. I will never be staying in a Hilton Hotel again & have issued a formal complaint to head office regarding this particular matter. For all travellers out there, I recommend not staying at this hotel for the comfort of your holiday, the security of your money and your dealings with supposed 'service'.

My son and I had a wonderful experience in NY Hilton Fashion District. The beds are extremely clean and comfortable. The bathroom is clean, room is clean, location is near Argotea and Whole Food, close to subway stations.
user_name:
Sylvia T
Redwood City, United States

review_body: Location is close to quite a few lower midtown offices and great eats in the flatiron district. Hotel was clean, staff friendly though non-intrusive and efficient. Rooms were clean, comfy and functional. A bit cozy but to be expected in NY

We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton NY. The staff were a great help to my wife and I with an early check in. Breakfast was filling and the beds were very comfortable. The area felt safe aand alot to explore as soon as you walk out the front doors.

Great location in the heart of the City and the Staff were very friendly and the view from their Roof top Bar is fantastic. Rooms were a decent size and the restaurant (Rare Bar & Grill) has some of the most amazing "Lollipop" Buffalo Wings I have ever tasted. The Concierge service had some wonderful restaurant recommendations and being in the heart of the Financial District never hurts. I would recommend this location for business travel as well as hosting a local client for Happy Hour.
