Decent enough hotel, the quality you would expect from a Hilton.Found the room décor very dark with dingy lighting and no natural light.The roof top bar was a bonus with great views of the Empire State Building.Good location subway station a block away.

I have stayed at this hotel several times when traveling to NY. It is centrally located next to Penn Station and it has a very upscale environment. Highly recommend their restaurant too; "Rare" is comparable with any steakhouse in the city!
user_name:
Flavio R
Hudson, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights in July and had a wonderful time. The hotel was very clean, staff was friendly, breakfast was satisfying, room was reasonably sized and in an excellent location. Plenty of things to explore in the immediate area and subway stations a short walk away. This hotel is away from the crowded/noisy times square/theater district but is still close to everything you'd want to do. This stay was everything I have come to expect from a Hilton. Excellent service, clean room, and a comfortable stay!

Great HOtel in the Heart of chelsea in Manhattan, very clean and great customer services in general. The rooms are very clean and the quality in general of the hotel is good for the price we paid. Looking forward to coming back there again.
user_name:
Siomel M
Basking Ridge, United States

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights over the July 4th weekend. This was the perfect location, with subway stations very nearby. We walked to and from Times Square and back from the Intrepid after the fireworks due to it being very crowded. Chelsea Market and the Highline are also very close by.I got an excellent rate with AAA discount for this weekend. I had paid for the premium higher floor room - NOT guaranteed with Empire State Building view. We had arrived after a red eye and took whatever room was available for early check in rather than wait for one with a ESB view. It was a good trade off in my books. I had called the day before to inquire about early check in.The queen bed room on the 22th floor was big for Manhattan standards. There was some noise but nothing that kept me up. We did not have any issues with the elevators. Definitely will stay here again and would recommend without hesitations.

We stay here for two weeks every summer while my daughter participates in a ballet program in the city. I can't say enough good things about this hotel! The staff is incredibly nice, the hotel is clean and feels safe, and it's in a great, centralized location. The price is very fair, considering all the pluses this hotel has to offer. I never hesitate to recommend it to friends!

Stayed for 3 nights during a business trip. The hotel is well maintained and decent size rooms. I did not have any issues and overall it was a good stay. Nothing exceptional, a normal hilton experience. The rooftop bar is a plus, specially on a nice evening and provides good views of NYC

Hotel is so loud, stayed up all night! Doors are very loud when they close, attracts more a party crowd. People were opening and closing doors way into the night. Great location and rooftop bar, though. Gorgeous view and nice atmosphere.

The hotel is in a most convenient location and it's easy to get anywhere you want to in Manhattan. It was fairly quiet for NYC. The room was small-ish but very comfortable and there was a great stall shower in the bathroom.

Great location, bathroom size is fine and the facilities are adequate. The amount of room space for a party of 4 is slightly under par, but overall the room space was okay. If there were any hindrances, the rooftop bar is only for over 21's, apart from noon on Sundays when anyone is allowed up. The view is spectacular, but unfortunately the staff in the bar area weren't keen for us to be there, due to some of our party being under 21. However, the location of the hotel is excellent, well within walking distance of landmarks such as Times Square and the Flatiron Building.

It started when I pulled up no signs as to where to valet or guest park almost got a ticket. Then got to my high floor which I pay extra for and there is zero view of an ally and another window. I am also a Hilton honor member so no help. If you pay extra for a high floor go above 17. Your along walk from anything especially time square. And to top it off I get in my bed that I pay extra for and the mattress is broken on one side. Hilton does give me 5000 points bc of all of this but they lost a lot with me. There are a lot of other hotels that will give better of and the 470.00 I paid for the room to go through this. Not worth it. FYI room service food is amazing but way over priced for it as well. Read other reviews I have written this is the worst. Said to say bc I love NYC

The Hilton New York Fashion District is in a great location! Only a 10 minute walk to Time Square. There is a Whole Foods store just down the street. Service at the hotel was great! We got to store our luggage in their storage room while we walk around the city. Room was very clean, keurig machine in the room, bed was very comfortable, staff was very friendly. Rooftop bar was cool! Except we had to wait 30 minutes to get onto the rooftop bar because they said it was at capacity, but by the time we got up there it was not packed at all. Having said that the bar was awesome and had amazing views of the city, including the Empire State Building! I would definitely return to this hotel the next time I am in NYC!

Had a wonderful stay here. Was surprised at how quiet our room was very easy to sleep, bed was very comfy. Staff very helpful and the rooftop bar had the most amazing view! Restaurant had good affordable breakfast. Walking distance to most places we wanted to go. Would stay here again

We've stayed here many times and have always had a great time. Perfect location for us since our daughter attends F.I.T. and we love staying in the Chelsea neighborhood. Great restaurants, shopping, attractions etc.

pretty unusual combination of good value, location, convenience, and quality for a manhattan hotel. i wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. however, we didn't use any additional services beyond a quick one-night stay, so others may have different experiences.

Just OK. Best is its location. Rooms are small and a little loud - especially on a lower floor facing the street. A lot of places to eat near the hotel as the food in the hotel is very expensive, even by New York standards.

Staff was helpful and courteous. Room was clean and comfortable. I would stay again. Everyone from the lobby staff to the bell hops and the restaurant staff was helpful and courteous. I like the idea of having a key that allowed only those who had one to be permitted on any floor and only the floor of their occupancy. It was probably difficult for the housekeeping to work around us but they did in a timely manner.

We boarded a red eye from SFO reaching Newyork early morning !After the scheduled meeting , checked in at Hilton Fashion district which is easy to locate and close to subway stationStay was comfortable and room size was goodOne small complain though.My kid used the dispenser to get a peanut flavour M and M can.Since he didnt want it we requested management to take it back to which they graciously agreedInspite of this we were charged 15 usd on our card after 3 days , I wonder why ??

My Bestie and I stayed here the weekend trying to pick up a few last things for my upcoming weeding and we were very disappointed in the service. I come to NYC about once a month from Canada and I have stayed in many of the hotels but the service was very poor at this hotel for Hilton standards. We called to ensure that we will be arriving late which ended up to be after midnight since we had to go across town to get some arruns done. When we arrived we parked the car at the front and there were several employees standing at the front and NO one asked us if we need help with our luggage as we struggled to get everything on the hotel trolley into the hotel. The next day we requested to be on a higher floor since it was realy noisy on the 2nd floor which they gladly moved us into. but, when we checked int he said they would move orur stuff which they did not do and we need to move everything form our room to the another after realizing it was not done as said.Another little annoying thing was the key access for the elevator since we checked into the hotel so late they did not explain it to us and we later on were told by another guest how to operate the the elevator. After going up and down the elevator for about 10 minutes... Needless to say, in the future I plan to stay at another Location for that extra homey feel and also free wifi which is NOT included at this location. (additional charges)

I've stayed here many times with work. The rooms are modern, clean and well appointed. The rooftop bar is great, if a little dated with the wood cladding. The restaurant serves good food and the service there has always been superb. All in all, this is a very good place, a safe bet for 4* in NY.

Great location. Lots of restaurants and things to see and do around this hotel. Hotel room was modern, very clean. Price was reasonable. The Rare restaurant located within the hotel is a well priced, good restaurant. Rare's bar is a popular hangout at night so you don't have to go far for night life. Rooftop bar slightly disappointing with it's layout and minimal seating, otherwise another option for an evening drink.

The hotel was clean, in a very good location, staff was polite. Had a great stay would stay again. We walked to times square. We were close to the subways that led to Chinatown etc. The walk to the empire state building was short. It was hot 90+ degrees and we could walk back shower change and go back out.

I am a regular visitor to this hotel - around 5 or 6 stays in the last 3 years - and with another already booked. Needless to say I am a fan! It is conveniently located in midtown Manhattan - close enough to walk to sites such as the Empire State Building, the Highline etc., but without the circus of being in the middle of Times Square; easy access to many restaurants. Service is top notch - on this most recent visit i was contacted before arrival to see if I had any special requests, for example. Rooms are small (but then most are in NYC) but clean and well appointed. Try getting a room high up on the W26th Street side - great views of the Empire State. Food in the restaurant is good - helps if you are a carnivore - and views from the rooftop bar also great.

The location is very practical. Located in the middle of Manhattan. You have a subway station 1 block from the hotel and you're close to everything either you want to go downtown or in Times Square. You are in Chelsea and you are close to the HighLine Park, the Chelsea Market and many other main attractions.

We felt so special and pampered at your hotel. It made our anniversary even better. The security was awesome and made us feel safe and secure during our visit. The champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries made our night special.

Everyone was very friendly and genuinely helpful. I felt safe, and the staff did a good job at keeping everything clean and organized. Even when I stayed in the room until mid-afternoon on some days, the housekeeper always came to take care of the room. I did not expect that level of service.

This hotel is in a great location to see all the sights. In the heart of New York. Rooms were good , bathroom was ultra modern with a fab shower. To set you up for the day. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful.

This turned out to be another bad Manhattan hotell.I have been to several Hilton Hotels, among them Hilton Mid town and Millenium Hilton in financial district. Both of them in a total different league than this hotel.First of all the hotell is not in the fashion district, but 8 blocks south of 34th street. I did not find this a nice aerea of the town. The hotell reception is small and crowded when 4 guests checked inn at the same time. The rooms are very small compared to the other Hilton hotels, and not at all what should be expected.The noicy air condition in the room was less than 3 feet from my pillow and was pooring out ice cold air every time it turned on. This resulted in a terrible headache the next day. The room was not properly cleaned, and we got a late check inn.Shame on You Hilton !!!

Spent July 3rd & 4th at this hotel. Check in was quick and smooth. All employees I spoke with were helpful and pleasant. The only nuisance if you will was the bathroom. The lights are controlled by a sensor so would go on everytime you walked by the bathroom if the door was open and in turn would go off after a minute in the shower. Also found the shower design odd as there was no way not to get wet turning the shower on. Kind of a hassle adjusting water temp before getting in.

We stayed at the Hilton Fashion District in NYC from June 10th to June 16th for the second time. We stayed there already during our stay in NYC in May 2011. We recommended the hotel to our friends and a couple followed the recommendation and was very happy with the choice.I don't know why hotels still bill WLAN in the room with free access growing very fast even in public. You can sit with your mobile phone or tablet/PC in the reception area and you'll have free internet access.Based on our experience two years ago we booked again a room in the upper floors. They are slightly more expensive, but worth it - alone from the view you get. We saw the empire state building from our window.Rooftop bar is still great and an excellent service. One single bar tender (woman) managed so many peoples wishes for drinks. There are many people coming to visit the rooftop bar from outside the hotel. If there is a long queue on weekends you can show the lift-guy your hotel room card and you can jump infront of the queue and will be going up with the next possibility (as soon as some guests come down as they manage to have a fix maximum of people up there.The room itself was very clean and modern. We did not take breakfast and got Starbucks coffee in the morning which is nearby. The restaurant RARE in the hotel is excellent. Access to the subway is ideal as well. You can either take the 23rd or the 28th.We will come back to this hotel for our next stay in NYC.

This is a very good hotel in Manhattan, with a Whole Foods a block away (this helped us a lot!) The staff is professional and dignified, and the view from the 19th floor was great. It was somewhat expensive but worth it to us, and I would go back again.

Cordially met by parking valet at entrance, very helpful, quickly directed to validated parking site 2/3 block away, garage attendant took care of parking. Quick check in using Expedia itinerary (prepaid), no issues whatsoever. Even easier checkout, car retrieved in reasonable time. I should point out that self-parking is $40 per 24 hour period from time of arrival.
user_name:
George L
Sudbury, MA, United States

review_body: The room was nice and great location. The staff was amazingly professional even when my friend who shared the room with me gave them an unreasonable hard time. Book this hotel with confidence. I will be back

Impressed with the customer service and comfortable beds. Stayed over 4th of July weekend. Easy access to 1 subway line. Chelsea Market, new High Line walkway, Meatpacking District for bars and night scene...saw 4th fireworks over Hudson. Liked the rooftop bar but not that impressed (don't like the layout - wish it had better views).I respect love the energy saving bathroom lights but don't like it when the light shuts off during shower. Keep the shower light turned on so when the overall bathroom light turns off, at least the dim shower light is on. Great hotel for the most part!!! Would stay here again!

This is a very conveniently located hotel. One subway stop is about 2 blocks away and one is about 3 blocks away. Everything you could want nearby-pharmacy, food, grocery store. Such a bargain for the location. The rooftop bar is awesome! Kids can go up between 12-5 but not at night. It gives the best view of the Empire State Bldg day or nite. I kept hearing how small NY hotel rooms are-ours was fine. We had plenty of room with 2 adults, a 7 and 14 yr old. They took care of arranging our car to the airport and made sure we had water for the ride and all we had to do was get in. $65 for a Town Car to LaGuardia. Penn Station is very close about 6 blocks. We walked it since we took Amtrak in but you could hop on the metro and save a few blocks of walking. The only thing I didn't like was having to order ice from room service. It was free but wasn't like being able to walk out to the hall and just get it. But, that was a VERY minor thing. I have not one other complaint! Snacks and drinks in the lobby in the afternoons. Quiet the whole time we were there. We stayed on the 8th floor right by the elevator and no noise at all-street or inside.

We stayed here (me, my wife and our two children) for four nights. We had a room on 22th floor with a look of Freedom Tower. The room was a bit small as most NYC hotels but clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was kind and helpful. The hotel is very modern and has a great location. It is in walking distance to Penn Station, Macy's and other attractions. We enjoyed our stay in Hilton.

We stay at this Hilton each time we come to the city. It is in a nice, safe area that is central to many things in NYC. The staff is professional and friendly. The accommodations are neat and clean. The restaurant "RARE" has amazing food. I would highly recommend.
user_name:
Colleen A
Hellertown, PA, United States

review_body: I stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for business and completely enjoyed the stay. The hotel has been recently remodelled. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. Service was amazing. I ordered room service and the food was fantastic. I completely enjoyed my stay and plan on returning for business & pleasure.
user_name:
William B
New York, United States

review_body: My wife and I had a great visit. the staff was excellent. They were friendly, accommodating and willing to go the extra mile. The hotel was really clean, nicely furnished and the best thing is that is was not too close to Times Square. My wife and I felt that it was great to get away from the hustle and bustle and relax at night in a super-comfortable bed. Kudos to Hilton and the staff at the Hilton Fashion District

Loved our stay. Close it because it was close to the HighLine walking tour. That was fabulous by the way! Ended our walk in the Chelsea Market area. If you have not been there it is well worth going to. The Mailibu Diner a few blocks over was great for breakfast. The hotel has a nice bar, lounge a restaurant. Nice decor and small but very clean rooms. He staff is great. There is a roof top bar for the younger crowd. A little too loud for our older group.

The hotel is located in a great place in the Chelsea area, on 26st street between 6th and 7th ave.In the same area there is Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Chelsea and Hilton Garden Inn New York - Chelsea whihc I stayed in the pas (Here are my reviews:http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60763-d281234-r118492698-Four_Points_by_Sheraton_Manhattan_Chelsea-New_York_City_New_York.htmlhttp://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60763-d641209-r133030763-Hilton_Garden_Inn_New_York_Chelsea-New_York_City_New_York.html)The place "quality wise" is closer to the level of Hilton Garden Inn, rather than the regular Hilton chain. That said, the price is also lower considerably (paid about $250.night in June).the room was small, but very well organised. The hotel looks very well inside (although it is yet another building turned to a hotel, an ongoing trend).I was on a high floor (21) and facing back, and it was completely quite all times of the day.The only weak side was the cell reception.In my room, the reception of the T-mobile was very sketchy, and problematic.

Recently stayed here while on business. Always hesitant when staying t an unknown hotel in NYC but this one surpassed our expectations. Rooms are very modern, clean and well appointed. Staff is outstanding. The waitress at the bar actually remembered us the next day and remembered our order (and we only had one drink the previous night!). Check out the rooftop bar. Nice for a quick drink. But skip the burger restaurant. It was the only disappointment but everything else far outweighed this minor disappointment. Would definitely stay there again

This is a great hotel, the location isn't the best but this is reflected in the price. Two subways lines, PENN station and the PATH is within walking distance. If you are coming from JFK I would suggest you get the LIRR (Long Island Rail Road) from Jamaica to Penn station and walk from there. Its a lot easier than getting the subway into Manhattan. The room was very cosy and a bit on the small side, the bathroom was very nice and modern with a fantastic shower, but no bath. We paid a little bit more for a high floor, and then requested an Empire State view. If this is important to you, then its worth the upgrade, but if not, then the view from the rooftop bar should suffice you. There was a great bedside alarm clock with an iPod/iPhone dock, but be warned, this isn't the latest small apple connector, its the old one. If you have a newer iPhone or iPod then bring an adapter. The TV was great, mostly HD but unfortunately, it was all local channels. For a large international chain like Hilton I would have liked to see CNN International, BBC World or similar. The wardrobe has a large free space, which I believe could fit most small to medium laptops.There are a few downsides to this hotel. There are 4 lifts, but one is reserved for the gym and in the evenings the 4th is reserved for the rooftop bar. This means there is a lot of traffic for just two lifts and they can take a long time to come, before making many stops en route. The lobby is not very inviting, and the staff are dressed very hip with caps and shirts. This makes the place feel more like the lobby of a nightclub and doesn't give a warm or inviting feel.The Wi-Fi is very expensive, and these days internet access is more of a need than a luxury. If the fee was per room this would have been more agreeable, but at $14 a device it becomes a large expense. There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby, but this stopped being offered after the 5th day.The coffee machine is great to have, but we were given very limited pods, only enough for 2 a day, it also could do with being plumbed in as every cup made requires a single cup of water pouring into it. Hanging space was very limited, and with a bit more thought in the room another wardrobe could have been provided. Also, there wasn't anywhere to store empty cases.If you are looking for somewhere to go for breakfast there is a fantastic American diner nearby which was excellent. Really well priced, great food, great service and very popular with the locals, called Johny's Luncheonette. Look it up on here and make yourself a regular!I’m sure there are many many worse places to stay, but for the money, I think I could have done better elsewhere. I'm happy that we stayed, but I wouldn't make a point of going back.

My mother and I just stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and we were both extremely pleased! The hotel is in a great location in close proximately to several subway lines as well as coffee shops and restaurants. Additionally, the hotel has very clean and pleasant rooms and a wonderful rooftop bar with a great view! But most of all, we were extremely impressed with the staff. Check-in was quick and easy and they were able to accommodate my request of a room with two queen beds (I had originally reserved one with just a single king bed) by the second night we were there, even moving our luggage for us while we were out sight seeing. The concierge was also very helpful in reserving us tickets for a show that same night. Would definitely go back!

The lobby is quite beautiful compared to the rooms and corridors; the hotel is just quite outdated. The location is of course really nice, and will probably work for you if you don't know where in NYC to go. The rooms have an espresso machine and they are very clean, etc. They are quite noisy, though. It just doesn't feel like many other Hilton hotels... It all depends on the price you are paying and the time you are going. If you get a good deal, this is definitely better than many still-quite-expensive hotels. I could pay something like $200 for this.

Great location, clean and nice staff. What more can one ask for. Oh, I got a call from the manager tonight to make sure we were happy with our stay. That's nice! That's why I like staying at Hilton hotels when I travel.

Checked in late from a west coast to nyc flight. Long story short, hotel has construction going on next door. Three feet from my room were two men with sandblasting and torches working on the walls at 7AM. For $500 a night I expect better. They offered me a $100 discount for the 7 hours I spent in the hotel attempting to sleep. No apology, no care. "We are required to book all rooms, we know it's a bad room". Shame Hilton, Shame.

We have stayed there for a week. It was a great decision, as we chose this Hilton Hotel. The staff is very friendly and we are still enjoying the greatest city in the world.Only the lack of espresso can i say as a disadvantage but around the corner is very nice aro's tea shop Book now :)

Booked this hotel due to location to Penn Station, quiet location in safe area. Rooms are of decent size and are very modern and clean. I had a comfortable stay while here and had initial reservations as have read about noisy elevators especially when my room was located behind them however they did not pose a problem. The entrance door for the room next door woke me in the early hours which was the only noise. No view from my room only the next door neighbors. Staff seemed invisible at times except when checking out and were extremely helpful. Good amenities in the room including iron and iron board, coffee machine. A little pricey but hey this is New York. Would stay here again if could get the right rate.

Had my second stay at the Hilton in Fashion District, Chelsea area. I love the location and the rooms are quite clean. My only complaint (which I had the first time) is the lighting near where the full length mirror is. The mirror outside the bathroom is dimly lit and I think an easy fix would make this a better situation. Other than that, wonderful helpful people. Definitely recommend.

We returned here after a couple of years for one weekend night with the kids. The room was excellent, junior suite with plenty of space for us and the kids. Buffet breakfast was fantastic and the customer service from start to finish was second to none. Could not fault our stay at all. Great Hotel with awesome staff. My room was very comfortable and clean. Restaurant staff make me feel very welcome, food was excellent.

The area this hotel is is in is great. If coming in from JFK then using the subway or LIRR to Penn makes it easy to get to. There are 2 stations for the subway close by giving you options for which line you need for where you need to go.The hotel is very modern. The staff arent in usual hotel uniforms and look as though they are going for a night out. Once you get your head aroubd this its ok. It does mean it doesnt feel like a hotel at times and can feel cold and unwelcoming for those staying at the hotel, getting back tired and wanting normal hotel services.The hotel has a roof top bar. There are 4 lifts in the hotel, one of which is used just for the gym and another used for the roof top bar in the evenings. This is frustrating if you are staying in the hotel as you can have a wait for the lift in the evenings and when it does come you end up having to stop at a few floors if you, like us, stay on a higher floor. They charge for rooms on higher floors due to the view. The view of Empire States is nice, but the rest of the view isnt of anything and I would suggest not paying for this and looking at the view from the roof top bar.The roof top bar can also be noisy. On my first night there I had to use sleeping tablets due to the banging noise. This went on past 2am, and is unfair on guests who have paid a fair bit of money to stay there.The rooms are small. They are also poorly laid out and more thought should have gone into this. The main part of the room is taken by the bed as you would expect and in ours a large air con system was on the floor. This should have been on the wall to increase space. There was a long desk at the other side of the room from the bed, which was way too big and some of this space should have been used to provide extra hanging space.As you walk in the room there is a wardrobe, this is tiny giving enough space to have 7-10 items, which for 2 people for a week isnt enough. The bathroom isnt a bad size, but again is poorly laid out. The room could have been better designed to fit a bath, but this hasnt been done so there is just a large shower area, it does have to be said the shower was nice. The light into the bathroom is on a movement sensor which is great when going in, but even with the door closed light does leak into the bedroom at night when trying to get to sleep.The room had a coffee pod machine. This needed water putting in it and for the cost of the hotel room I would have expected this to have been plumbed in. They never left enough pods despite us asking on the second day for more to be left.The bed is pretty comfy (Nowhere as near as good as a Marriott bed) but the pillows poor.The hotel offers free wifi in reception for guests. This only seemed to work for 5 days before they wanted us to pay. The cost is way too high for a service I need all the time and consider esential. The cost was $14 per day per device. If it was $14 per room per day this wouldnt have been as bad. I did find if logged into the free wifi it would still work in the room.This hotel is aimed at couples, business users and young single people. I would not recomend to families.Im pretty sure there are better hotels in NYC for the same money and would look around before booking. This isnt somewhere I would book again.

My wife and I were visiting from Bermuda where hospitality and friendliness is in abundance. We enjoyed three lovely nights at the this Hilton hotel Celebrating our wedding anniversary. From arriving to departing the hotel we were received friendly courteous service. We were not in our room long when we received a complementary bottle of wine and greeting card from the staff. The Concierge Krsitin M was very helpful and polite.Our room was lovely. Modern clean and was kept clean by the attendant, it spacious and the bed was very comfortableJohn & Betty Dale

We were originally booked at the USUAL Hilton on 53/6th but found this Hilton to be in the Chelsea area and much closer to the conference that I was attending.The staff at this Hotel was really nice and attentive. The rooms were neat and clean and always stocked with enough "supplies" so you didn't have to hunt a maid down and get stuff. At one point my husband's toothbrush BROKE and the front desk just gave us one at N/C.It is a 2 block walk to the subway - which makes it very convenient to get anywhere you need to in the city. It was a little more difficult hailing a taxi from this location. In fact, the day we were leaving for the airport we had to take a Hotel car because the taxi's were not coming down this street.They have a rooftop bar which is very nice and relaxing. The price of the drinks are lower than most other bars in the city and they were GOOD. They had a DJ playing there on Saturday evening so you may have to wait in line a bit on a night they have entertainment.I am a Diamond Member with Hilton so I am used to a lot of incentives to stay at their properties. The only upgrade was to a higher floor. The room was SO small that basically the bed fit in it and that is about it. The closet was so small that my dresses hit the safe that was also located in the closet. Usually, I get access to club lounges but they don't have on at this property so don't expect anything like that. I also get vouchers for breakfast - which they give us - however, at other Hiltons, you usually have access to an enormous spread of "continental" delights OR you can put that money towards anything on their menu. The first thing they ask when you enter the restaurant is "do you have a voucher?" - then they hand you a menu or tell you to choose from the small buffet. I finally asked if there was a different menu for those without vouchers and she said "yes." I didn't care for this at all. But, like I said - staff was awesome, food was "ok" and atmosphere was nice.IF you want to stay in the Chelsea area, then this may be a good spot for you. IF you don't, then there are other hotels that offer a little more and have larger rooms.

First and foremost, the location of this hotel is great if you are doing things in Manhatten. The area is quiet and safe and is walking distance of the usual amenities. 23rd street station is just a few blocks away and Penn station a few further. The rooms were smaller than we were expecting for the price we paid but furnished well enough and clean. The view at the time of our stay was of construction on a nearby building but one can hardly fault the hotel for that. The service was very good. We had had a mix up before checking in and the hotel staff was quick to solve the problem. The concierge was also knowledgeable and helpful. I will consider staying here again in the future.

We stayed here for three nights recently. It is a very nice hotel. The rooms are a good size for New York and the location is very convient. It was relatively good value also for New York, but we did get a deal on a travel website. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly. We were there while it was quite bad weather with alot of rain and so when we visited the roof top bar, it was not that nice. It is like a cross between a shed and a conservatory and it was leaking quite badly - but it was very bad rain!!! It did have a lovely view though and no doubt in good weather would have been fabulous. The restaurant assocaited with the hotel, Rare, was lovely though and alright value. For choosing a bedroom, I would suggest between 6th and 19th. This would have you high enough up to avoid street noise (bins are collected quite early on a friday morning and they are loud!!) and down enough to avoid the noise from the bar on the roof.

The small, but fashionable rooms at this Hilton are clean and comfortable. The location is extremely convenient to the train station and easy walking distance to many great restaurants. Close to Chelsea. The staff are always extremely friendly and welcoming. They usually have some tasty nibbles at the front desk for welcoming guests.

Wonderful, comfortable, and clean place to stay.. Friendly staff! Only few blocks away from Penn Station. Wish to have the bucket of ice provided.. Lots of restaurants around there. Wish to have free WiFi in the guest room.

Overall really impressed. Had 5 nights here recently and thought the service was excellent. No request too problematic.After an initial hiccup with the room we were immedialtely moved and comped for breakfast for the week. Instantly dealt with by the head of customer service dude ( i think AJ but dont quote me on that).Rooms on the small side ( but value for the cost) and rooftop bar a real bonus. Gym a little small - more of a large workout room - but well equipped and lotsa nice touches. Free bottles of water, headphones and towels.Location perfect and front desk very helpful.Well done. As Arnie said, I'll be back! ( sorry couldnt resist! :)

This hotel located in the Fashion District of Manhattan was quite a find. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the rooms...ample space for a NYC hotel. I believe there were other rooms that were even larger than ours for the same price. The real treat was the roof top lounge. It is located on the 20th floor (you must be 21) and is an open air lounge. There are stunning views of the Empire State Building (go at night for the lights) as well as view of the Freedom Tower view to the South of the Island. Drinks are reasonably priced for NYC - the bucket of craft beers at 5 for $30 was a winner in my book.

We only stayed in NYC a few nights and we selected the Fashion 26 for its location and based on previous reviews, as we were concerned about being in a roach motel in a rough area of the city, being first time visitors. The hotel was just what we wanted, a quick walk to the local subway station, and clean modern room.Of course hotels in NYC are pretty expensive and you're paying for the location, but we were very pleased with the look of the hotel...although it was a bit pretentious...felt like the staff had been told to act a certain way to fit in with the plush modern surroundings...a bit robotic and disingenuous.

The first thing you notice about this hotel is that it doesn't appear like any other Hilton you've been to. The lobby music sounds like it belongs at a fashion show, and the staff are all dressed accordingly. Having said that, the rooms reflect the usual Hilton quality standards. The restaurant is decent enough, but the undoubted highlight is the rooftop bar, which gives spectacular views of the Empire State Building and the rest of the Manhattan skyline. The location is perfect for those who want to discover New York's tourist attractions, as well as hitting the shops. There is free Wi-Fi available in the lobby, but we occasionally managed to pick it up in our room on the 12th floor as well. There was no bath in the room, but the shower was big and powerful enough. The bed was comfortable, and there wasn't too much street noise, so we slept really well. Probably not ideal for families with small kids, but great for couples exploring the city.

My family almost always stay at Hilton properties when we travel because you generally know what you are going to get. Last summer my daughter and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on 26th (2 blocks away from this location). We loved it and booked our recent trip there as well. But the price had gone up $190 a night from our previous stay in Aug. I belong to the Playbill Club and received an email about a discount available for the Hilton New York Fashion District at a considerable savings. So I promptly moved our reservation. We saved about $270 staying at this location.Now on to the hotel.....it has been my experience that Hilton hotels tend to cater to the business traveler. This location was no exception. I find that Hampton Inn, Embassy Suites and Hilton Garden Inn are more family friendly. As far as appearance, this hotel has a beautiful lobby and being right around the corner from the Fashion Institute of Technology (where my daughter attends school), it was nicely decorated with fashion themed items. The room was small (as are most NYC rooms). We never felt crammped though. The bathroom was very nice and had all the amenities you would expect. Traveling with a family, it is always nice and convienient to have a microwave and fridge. I knew going in there would not be either of those. I was willing to do without those for 3 days for the savings. There was a stocked mini-bar with drinks, snacks, etc. I enjoyed the Keurig and Newman's Own coffee. It was a nice touchHilton properties never disappoint when it comes to bed comfort. This hotel was no exception. The beds were so comfortable and the bedding was plush and wonderful. I have a bad back and found the beds to be very comfortable. I would have preferred Queen beds (Hilton Garden Inn has Queen) instead of double beds, but we made due. I did find the service in the lobby less than adequate. Several days we were in need of a cab and none of the staff out front offered to hail one or even seemed to acknowlede you exhisted when you came and went from the hotel. They were all just standing around. I had the opposite experience at the Hilton Garden Inn on 26th (which I will also be reviewing). The subway (red 1 line) is about a block away and is a 5 minute ride into Times Sq. and the Orange line is a few blocks away as well. There was no free WiFi, which is a must when traveling with teenagers.. This was definetly an inconvienience. Parking was available on the same street at $40 a day. No in and out privledges. It was fine for us because we moved our daughter out of the dorm and then parked the car for the duration of our trip.Overall. it was a nice stay and the quality was what you would expect from a Hilton property. If the price is right, i would definetly stay here again.

As an avid traveler and Hilton Diamond Honors member, I would like to state for the record that this place was great !! Friendly and courteous staff, great location, great restaurant on site "Rare", clean rooms, I highly recommend !! Oh almost forgot , they have the "Rare View" lounge on the top , I believe it's the 25th floor, nice !! also in walking distance to NY Penn Station, subway and nice area attractions !!

I would NEVER have though I would ever be raving about a Hilton... Well let me tell you, this place rocks. The rooms and bathrooms are obviously small (NY) BUT the beds are super comfy, and the room service is fantastic. Even better, their restaurant downstairs RARE is the BEST deal in NY ($28 bone-in ribeye w/ spinach truffle risotto, omg), and their rooftop lounge/bar has the BEST VIEW of NY staring right at the Empire State building! Holy crap this place was a complete surprise and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay near Soho. RARE FIND in NY!!! Good job Hilton, well done.

If you need to be between Midtown and Downtown, the Hilton near 7th Avenue and W 26th Street is the hotel you should pick. The garage on the same street is convenient but very pricey ($55). The subway (1 train) station is very close. The management is very efficient. We had at least a dozen rooms for a weekend wedding event. The negotiated rates was very reasonable given the nice location. You should have your meals outside the hotel, including breakfast, to keep your total cost of your stay under control.

This hotel is located in the garment district, which is central to almost everything in the city - Herald Square, Empire State Building, Union Square, the subway are all within easy walking distance. Also, tucked away on a quiet street so the rooms are quiet as well! Great hotel!

So, I'm actually in the lobby as I'm typing this review.I had a very nice stay at this hotel and highly recommend it. The staff is courteous, professional and friendly.The front desk staff was very kind and accomodating with a friendly smile and "how can I assist you in any way" attitude which is exactly what I'm looking for in a hotel. The room was clean( a double on 16thfl.), had nice linen and had a modern design/color scheme. No view but who cares. I was here to get out and about. The bathroom shower was excellent with a solid (not the cheap) glass enclosure.J.P., Caroline, Angelica and Zoribel were all outstanding to deal with. It didn't hurt that a couple of the girls who work there could be professional models :)Expedia offered the best deal in town at about $125. And for that..(or even some of the higher rates at times) this place absolutely can't be beat.In the immortal words of the terminator.... "Ill be back".
user_name:
Solomon C
New York City, New York

review_body: The Hilton Fashion District Hotel is newly renovated and modern. The lobby is amazing. The rooms are small however, quite nice, and clean. Each room has a Keurig machine which I love. The hotel staff were very accommodating in storing my luggage after check-out, until my transfer to the airport. My favorite part the hotel is the rooftop bar. Great view of the city, and the bar- tending staff are awesome. I recommend this location, and I shall return.

I was attending a conference at another hotel, but they did not have rooms, so I ended up staying here. I was actually very glad that the first hotel did not have rooms, as I stayed there previously and thought it was only ok. This hotel was much nicer than the other one where I was attending the conference. I only wish MSNBC and Comedy Central were offered on television (Fox News and CNN, as well as OWN are offered.) Otherwise, I was very pleased.

Very well located, modern and clean. Nice bar and restaurant.Negative point : we had to wear ear-plugs to sleep due to noisy air-conditioning outside the rooms.We tried the 2nd and 10th floors...Mattresses should be checked regularly and bed sheets changed when asked...

Stayed at this hotel for a night in May. The hotel is modern and well designed. Our room was small but had enough space to store large suitcases. Staff is very efficient. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel as our flight was not until the evening and they arranged a transfer to the airport for us. The hotel is very well located. I know that others have said that they were disturbed by the elevators and building works but it did not bother us at all. We were near the elevators on the 6th floor and although we were on the side where the building works were taking place we could not hear any noise in our room and our room was very quiet. The reason I am not giving it 5 stars? It is the only hotel during our stay where we had to pay to use the internet (unless you go down to the lobby where they have free wifi). (Even the trains offer free wifi!). In the Hilton you not only have to pay a daily fee but you have to pay per device. My husband and I just wanted to use our cellphones to read the news and check the weather so the daily fee seemed a bit too much. We had a brilliant stay in the Hilton. I would recommend that they consider offering free wifi to guests in their rooms.

I had an excellent stay at this Hilton. The hotel's public areas and the rooms are both modern and clean. This Hilton offers a small, but amply outfitted, fitness room, But maybe the best feature is that it's well located for an easy walk to Madison Square Park, some good restaurants and the F line that runs north and south under 6th avenue.

Perfect location, good service, really nice stay in New York City. There is one BIG minus: Hilton is still charging 15 dollars a day for internect connection PER unit, really ridiculous! The hotel is well located, near Midtown and Chelsea, lots of restaurants and bars. The bar on the top floor is fanastic!

I had read the reviews for the property and wasn't really sure what I'd get. After staying I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the property is, great views, and fantastic service. First the service. The staff was very accommodating on all requests from assistance with restaurant recommendations the extending my stay. Each request was done promptly and with a smile. The room was smaller but typical for NYC with an extremely comfortable bed. Of course the stay is not complete without a trip to the Rooftop Lounge. The view is terrific and on Friday and Saturday nights the scene is vibrant and energetic. On my next visit to the city I will definitely stay at the Hilton Fashion District.

We stayed at here for four nights while on vacation in mid May. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was rather large by NY standards and our king bed quite adequate. The bathroom and shower were excellent. The AC worked really well. We were on a high floor with a pretty good view of the empire state building. The subway was very convenient so we ended up using it more than usual for our NY trips. The only downside to our stay was the somewhat thin walls but no worse than most places. Unfortunately it rained while we were there. We asked where we could get umbrellas and their answer was "we have loaners at the front desk",great surprise. We stayed here because our regular hotel was full but we will be quite happy staying here again.

Last week my husband and I went to N.Y. to visit our grandson. My husband was due to arrive on a later flight from another city, so I arrived at the hotel before him with my hotel confirmation (and a credit card). However, my name was not on the reservation so I was not allowed to check in due to "privacy concerns". The manager said that their policy was not to allow checkin for persons not named in the reservation. Being unable to checkin was a significant inconvenience. The best the manager could suggest was that I wait in the lobby or a restaurant till my husband arrived. My impression of Hilton is that compliance with their "policies" is much more important than the needs and convenience of their guests. They seem to be unaware of what keeps them going.Ginny Bellwood, Toronto

This is a great hotel with modern rooms and contemporary finishings. The restaurant is very good and the breakfast burger is not to be missed. It has a decidely trendy decor that is a pleasant change from other hotels. It is the hotel I always chose when I travel to NYC.
user_name:
William B
Louisville, KY, United States

review_body: PROS: The hotel is very well located near 6th Av, near many cafes, restaurants and shops. It is nicely decorated. The restaurant in-house offered great food at great prices, just order your meat cooked higher than you'd like. I ordered medium well and got medium rare. The rooftop bar was charming. The iron provided in the room was very good, and there were brand name toiletries in the bathroom, but bring your own shower cap. none provided. We decided we needed to stay two more nights, but the hotel wanted $700/night. Not the way to treat a customer. CONS: Our room was on the 8th floor, facing the street. I heard cars honking, people yelling, traffic noise and there was construction work that woke us up very early in the morning. The AC in the room made a lot of noise. The ironing board in the room was useless. The closet was ridiculously small. The rooms are kind of small, like in many other hotels in the area. The elevator situation at night gets complicated with "bouncer" type guards don't allow hotel guests to use a certain elevator(s) because they need it to escort people up to the roof top bar. It gets annoying, but I guess they do it to make sure random people getting in the hotel's hallways.I hope I never get to stay there again. I would go again to the restaurant and the rooftop bar, though.

Great hotel, nice rooms location. Would stay again.Only issue: Rude security in the lobby on weekends can be aggressive with the elevators if you are not going to the rooftop bar. Found it very rude to be grabbed and held so others could use a lift first to go up while i waited.

Staff always greets me, and its a nice quiet hotel, but it is close to my business contacts. It's a smaller room then most; but it's clean/modern and I like that you can quickly get in and out of your room.

Nice and clean hotel room, decent size. Staff were nice to me and let me do a late check out which was very convenient for free. The roof top bar is very lively and it seems that locals, not with the hotel often go there. Good places to grab food close by. About 25 min walk to the park, 15mins to times square and 10mins to Macys/Penn Station.

We got a good deal on this one as my husband is diamond member. The hotel lobby was very lively on a Friday night. It was actually earth hour so I'm not sure was it because of that or every Saturday. We got a room on upper floors, away from the elevator. Ask for that if possible, otherwise you'll hear the elevator arrive... Room was good, even if it was a little cramped, like in Europe. My complaints were to the slow elevators which took forever to arrive. We also felt that the breakfast was superslow, even if decent quality. On last days we decided to go out for breakfast to have it faster. Pros for this hotel are the location which is very central! There are metros around the block, Macy is quite nearby and Whole foods around the corner.

Good location. Away from the noise of Times Sq, but only a short walk from the main attractions and close to two subway stations. Bedroom was small, but great modern decor. Bathroom was also very good and the full length window makes a big difference to the room and brings in a lot of light. Great value for money at $175. Lobby was also nice and modern and hotel staff were very friendly. Hilton website doesn't do the hotel justice.

When in NYC I always stay at the Hilton in Midtown on 5th, stayed here for a change. The hotel is small and chic. The rooms were modern, very clean and perfectly adequate, but much smaller than the room I am used to at the Hilton on 5th, if my wife would have accompanied me it would have been tight. The only issue I had was one elevator was broken, another elevator was "set aside" at night for access to the rooftop bar, leaving only 1 elevator for most of the occupants. This proved to be a slow point. Assuming they are getting that fixed, I would not hesitate to stay here again.
user_location: Grand Island, New York, United States
user_name:
Paul C
Grand Island, New York, United States

review_body: Excellent location and well priced. Quiet room at back of hotel. Good food. Rooftop bar with stunning views. Only downside: one bar waitress who wished to determine the size of her tip. But thoroughly recommend hotel.

Rooms are clean and reasonably well equipped. Not the biggest room I've stayed in in NYC for the money. Bathroom ok, though shower pressure disappointing. Location is good for Penn station. The best thing about this hotel is the rooftop bar which has excellent views. The downside to this is the bar hijacks one of the (only) 3 lifts in the evening so there was occasionally a few minutes wait for the lift. All in all a good hotel, though there are definitely better hotels in the city for similar prices.

Me and my husband just stayed in Hilton on March 31st. We felt at ease going to this hotel because beforehand all questions were answered by the manager Ahram. She was very helpful and kind. The hotel itself is very classy and modern and has lovely little touches..the reception is a little small compared to other Hilton's but the ceiling decor is lovely!Our room was lovely, spacious and very clean. The bed was so comfy! and we had a view of the Empire State which was out of this world. I read a few reviews about the noise level but to be honest our room was fine and we were not disturbed by any unwanted noises. The TV in the room is big and had a brilliant selection of channels. The hotel staff were lovely! very polite, friendly and willing to go that extra mile. I ordered breakfast in bed one day which unfortunately came on the wrong day but was refunded straight away! One of the days my wifi was not working and one of the staff gave me free wifi access for that night in my room which was a realy treat. Upon reading the reviews I wasn't happy that wifi would not be free but this was not much of a bother. You can use free wifi in the lounge and there is also a small internet cafe type thing (which btw has lovely Hilton pens which write very nice! I took a few for home) There is also a cute little gym and a lovely Rare restaurant. The hotel is nearby many metro stations which take you to all the stops and is just a small walk away from Madison Square Gardens and two avenues away from 5th avenue. I could safely say if I visited again I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Oh and one thing I loved was that they always had daily treats at reception for the guests..cupcakes, popcorn, cookies..delicious! All in all a very good stay..amazing hotel, location and staff

I've stayed at this hotel twice and will continue to go back. The location is perfect for those traveling in or out of Penn Station. If you love going to Eataly, this hotel is perfect too -- just a few blocks away. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They have a great rooftop bar - very lively!

The sum it up: Great location - walking distance to the ferry. The staff was super nice and helpful. It's about what you woudl expect for a Hilton in the Fashion District. No real surprises or anything that was "above and beyond" - but overall, a very nice stay and friendly staff. Not too much more you can ask for on a weekend "popcorn trip" to NYC.

Had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton New York Fashion District for several days. Room was nice size with a desk to work from and internet was available. Large bathroom and a good view from the upper floor I was on. Restaurant onsite had great food and very friendly staff. All the staff in the hotel went out of their way to help and provide an enjoyable experience.

Folks at the front desk were very courteous. Liked the location of the hotel. Safe to walk. Walking distance to nice eating places and shopping. Easy access to taxis. Overall, good experience. I would recommend our friends and family.

Great welcoming staff, with good sense of humor. I was pleased to be here for the Tribeca Film Festival. We also conducted press interviews in rooms here -- all very good. The beds were amazingly comfortable.

we're very happy to chose Hilton Hotel inspite of the listing of hotels in the neighborhood,my reservation was only for 2 nites,but my husband was hospitalized for overnite observation and I need to extend our stay but and the place was fully book,they help me to find a hotel nearby . I'm thankful to everyone,you made my stay in New York a pleasant one and I feel safe.

I stayed one night and it was quite pleasant. Good front desk staff, smallish but pretty room, great bed, good sized bathroom. Small mini-bar. Did not visit rooftop bar nor gym. There were some elevator issues, for which I was compensated with Hilton Honors points. In back of hotel, no view but very quiet.

Was not as impressed as I hoped I would be. The highlight was going to be tbe rooftop bar at the hotel, but we were misinformed at check-in. We saw the bar on-line and the hours indicated they were open on the weekend; the front desk said they opened at 5:30. However, when we went to go up at 6:30 to catch the sunset on this beautiful Spring day, we were sadly disappointed to learn that they weren't open tonight. Would have been a nice treat on our 5th anniversary to enjoy the view of the city, in the absence of the Rise bar that we used to love.Room is small, even by NYC standards, but clean. Hampton Inns seem to have more to offer.

My second stay at this hotel in a great location - only a couple of short blocks from the subway. The room is modern with a comfortable bed and lots of pillows. Liked the bathroom - a shower and no tub to have to step in and out of. Yeah. The hallway noise echoes in the halls and the room doors tend to slam loudly and can disrupt sleep a little. The windows in the rooms open to let fresh air in and I loved that. They also keep a lot of street noise away. The only real issue for me is the elevators - one was being exclusively used in the late afternoon and evenings for the rooftop bar and there was only one for the 20 something guest rooms floor. You had to call to the front desk to get an elevator to stop on your floor during this time period. Not good,

Clean room like almost all Hilton properties. It's small, loud, expensive and hotel staff was less than helpful. As a Diamond member, I expect so much more. Roof top bar was fun but only serve sliders and wings. $400 plus per night was just silly!! Hotel construction woke me up at 7am.

excelent service and help at this well placed hotel.View from our guest room (of Empire State Building)was marvelous.All staff were friendly and helpful.Convenient for local shops and amenities, and handy for sites.

The lobby definitely has a "scene" - lots of activity - I've never been there when it hasn't been busy and buzzing. Even so the check in staff always have a gracious greeting and help to offer if you need something. The location is convenient to subways, to the Fashion Institute of Technology, to Chelsea, to Macy's and is near avenues with coffee shops and a Whole Foods supermarket. There is no excuse to stay in for breakfast. Some of the rooms, on higher floors, can have decent cityscape views, the rooms are strategically designed to make the most of space, and some of the bathrooms have shower/tub combinations, while others just a shower. In spite of its full to capacity status, I've never had a problem with noise from the hallway or adjacent rooms. The only complaint is that there are not enough elevators! One is usually reserved for their terrace. On busy check in nights the remaining two don't cut it. And on two occasions one of the remaining two was out of order. On one occasion the bed was squishy and uncomfortable - if I wasn't so tired I would have requested another room. During other stays the beds were fine. The guests are a range of business travelers to almost hipsters - and international travelers. It is my stand by choice if the price is right and I want to be in the neighborhood for under $225 a night.

We stayed over a Saturday & Sunday night during the Tribeca Film Festival. It was busy but not over crowded. The rooms are nice. It was clean. The service was very good. We also ate at Rare (the restaurant in the hotel). The burgers and fries are delicious. Breakfast was included in our stay. It was good. I definitely recommend the oatmeal. Our only complaints was that one day two of the three elevators didn't work and the next day one of the three elevators didn't work. Be prepared to wait for the elevators if one of them is out of service.

I have stayed here a few times before but I thought the staff was especially friendly and helpful this visit. The room was very comfortable for sleeping and I was able to adjust the' temperature for nice, cool conditions. We had a nice meal at the bar; I was impressed with the quality of ingredients. It's a nice alternative location if you don't want to stay right in the hustle and bustle of Times Square.

Our room was on the 16th floor and we directly across from the elevators. The noise from the street and from the elevators and slamming doors didn't allow us to get very good sleep on the two nights that we stayed which was unfortunate because the beds were wonderful. But other then that I have nothing to do but rave about the hotel, especially the staff. They went out of their way to be helpful and nice. Wonderful job and the room and hotel was very clean and nice. Will probably be returning again.

The location of this hotel is fantastic! It's in a great neighborhood! Close to restaurants and shops! Short walk to Chelsea Market and the West Village! Hotel lobby was very pretty. Staff was friendly and rooms were a decent size compared to other hotels in NY. Bathroom was full size with glass shower! Room was very clean too! Also, this hotel has a rooftop bar with a great view of the city! You get it all!

I stayed with a friend in this hotel for one night and we arrived early in the morning, the room wasn't ready for us. They let us to leave our luggage and comeback later to check in. We loved the location, right in the heart of the Fashion District around the best stores and a few blocks away from Time Square.The Bare Restaurant is excellent... We had our best Cesar Salad there. The staff is very helpful.

I had a change in the people I was traveling with and asked well in advance if I could switch get a 2 bed room. The first response I was given was you will be put on the top of a waiting list if a room were to open, since you are an HH member (notes were made on my reservation to reflect this). When I called again to check on the status I was told that rooms are available now although it is considered an upgrade and would cost another 100,000 HH points per night, and that I could not use cash for the difference, although there were rooms available at this point. I was told that I still can get an upgrade at check in. When I arrived after waiting, when there was not even anyone in line, the token response I was given without a hesitation was “we have no 2 bed rooms”. Sorry but being a HH member does not have its rewards. I own a small business and stay in NYC often during the year, and have been trying to see if HH is the right program for me, it does not appear to be at this point. The people at the front desk were apathetic at best, and provided incorrect information about parking. There was no personal service yet alone attention to a HH member. It’s as if they could not get me checked in quick enough. (again, there was not a line of people) The room was "super small" (I realize its NYC) and it offered nothing more than an average hotel in any other city across the country. I have had problems in other hotel stays, the difference is they did their best to accommodate the situation and I still gave them a good review. I never am looking for a cash discount, I understand the costs when I book a room, although I do expect a reasonable level of service and a reasonable attempt to accommodate my needs.

Just a short walk south of Penn station we stayed overnight at a most wonderful little hotel. Bright and clean with exceptional service, we loved this hotel.We are looking forward to returning during the summer to experience the rooftop bar! The Keurig coffee machine was an unexpected bonus.

We stayed at the Hilton for two nights and had a wonderful time. Most of our time was spent exploring New York City but the hotel was a perfect place to regroup, relax and sleep. The staff at the Hilton were incredibly helpful and offered umbrellas, maps, and cabs! The room was very clean, fun wallpaper, and the beds were incredibly comfy.There also is a clothing department in their store and the clothes were absolutely stunning!Most importantly for us- the location was perfect! We walked almost everywhere.A wonderful place to go!

It was my 2nd stay in this hotel, and just like last time, everything was great. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone who want to stay at a good place in Midtown. Rooms are on the smaller side but they are still great and very comfortable! Location is perfect too! Do not miss the roof-terrace!

Extremely pleasant staff and highly service oriented. Seems like they know the property is a little older and try to make up for it by wowing you with service, and they were successful. Compared to many NYC hotels where the staff has a level of arrogance because they're in NYC, this Hilton is exactly the opposite! Truly felt like the staff were interested in making sure that my visit was positive and made up for a small room mistake with excellent responsiveness. Would definitely stay there again just wish the rooms were bigger (but that's true of a zillion hotels in NYC)....well run hotel, great food at the restaurant too,

I've stayed in several hotels in NYC, and the Hilton on W. 26th is my favorite. You can find less expensive hotels, but believe me, they rank far, far below the Hilton in my book. Every inch of this hotel is well-designed. It's clean and comfortable and I would even say quiet (by New York standards). My room was on the 19th floor and I had a great view of the Empire State Building. The hotel staff was super-friendly. I enjoyed the breakfast and lunch I had at the hotel's restaurant, Rare (even though that was a bit pricey).

Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Description on site was realistic and checkin/out was easy and quick. Friendly staff and good help booking table at restaurant. Clean and beautiful but small room. Location exellent. We recommend this hotel and would book it again.

I have stayed in numerous NY hotels and due to the high service level and friendliness of staff, the clean and neat room, and especially the very quiet room I had, this was a great stay. I'll be back for sure. Another plus is the Rare restaurant in the hotel is not run by the hotel, and has a distinct and unique character. Definitely will go back.

Stayed here for 1 night for a fun day/night in NYC using hilton honors points. Absolutely awesome view of the Empire State Building from my room on the 21st floor. Queen bed and the view was incredible. How often do you get to fall asleep watching the NYC skyline. Staff was great, helpful and friendly and room was clean and well appointed. Great location if you're going to shop in Chelsea and eat in the Flatiron district. Everything was walkable. It was a fun stay and I intend to go back.

Stayed here one night in between flights from Europe to home. We are Hilton honor members and got a nice king size room on 17th floor with free wi if and breakfast. The staff here are great. Very friendly and helpful. Let us store our luggage until we left for the airport. Smaller hotel and they go the extra mile to make sure you have a good experience. Very quiet also. Highly recommend if you want to stay in the area of manhattan.

Nicely updated Hilton with fair sized rooms (at least for NYC). Seems to have better rates than most in the Hilton chain. Clean and reasonably well appointed, with an an up-to-date vibe in a great location. Staff very receptive and helpful. Overall, a rare bargain for NYC!
user_name:
Stephen G
Stony Brook, New York

review_body: For NYC, the king sized room we had was large and comfortable. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. Street-side rooms are noisy. I asked the front desk for earplugs and they kindly brought them up. The weekend we were there, there were elevator issues, so you had to call down with the house phone to have the elevator come to your floor, but this was only a minor inconvenience. And the staff was warm and generous through it all.Breakfast was expensive and not that thrilling. I'd recommend one of the nearby Greek diners.

Writing this whilst staying here. Read all the recent reviews and agree with most comments. Very small lobby but welcome pack with water and chocs a nice touch ... Stayed clear of the hot popcorn on the reception desk (seems to be only available around 3pm to 5pm but I may be wrong). Corridor noise is correct and you can hear room conversations waiting for the lift. Beware! Remember this is a new hotel, so someone missed out there then or perhaps they didn't if you're nosey. Corner rooms are best ... I'm in one.... Nos 4 and 12 look south. (Sun for some!) nos 5 & 11 look north (shade). High floors ... I suspect from about floor 17 get a "view" but do remember this is New York !!! Most people taking breakfast in the Rare restaurant are on vouchers/coupons like me and whilst the food is OK, if I was paying I'd be down the street sampling the many other offerings. 23rd st is 3 blocks down with all manner of restaurants the Chelsea area has to offer. Oh ...the sting in the tail? Just woke up with an email from Hilton.. Why not stay (here!!) from tonight at $107... Almost a third of my prepaid (locked in) rate. The laws of supply and demand are alive and well here in the US...oh well!

Great choice especially for location of the beaten track but just as easy to get to all popular areas,metro close by.A little disappointed to be told only on 7th floor of a 22 storey hotel even though I asked at check in for a higher room, but due to the weather that weekend the hotel was full.In the end it is NEW YORK the city that never sleeps!Our trip coincided with the blizzard and so the only night the traffic was quieter was due to the thick SNOW. The hotel did an amazing job with coping with the snow, fashion week and a toy fair all going on in the city at the same time .Check in and out was very good and efficient, all staff ,friendly and especially on our check out.Room service was excellent we had a taster basket of various fries they were hot and one side order was enough for at least 3 people and very good value.Free Wi-Fi in the lobby and use of a computer and printer in the lobby is really useful. As other reviews have said can't wait to go back and would DEFINITELY book the Hilton again.

Look...the beds are comfortable, staff are energetic and helpful , location is central..ish. No noise issues and I was on the 5 floor facing the street. Food was pretty good. All in all a I had a great 8 night stay. But....WIFI rip off!! Are you hearing me? $15 a day. Why do hotels do this? Why not just put $10 on the room per night and give me "free" WIFI. You would have me forever. But by insisting on ripping us off the ever growing group of customers that only stay at Hotels that have free WIFI has just got a new member. I nearly forgot to thank you for the extra late checkout without charging me the half day rate.

This hotel is very conveniently located and offers a great rooftop bar with view of the empire state building. Servie at this hotel is great and has lead to me staying there for 2 trips in a row and I definitely will go back.

My choice of hotel stay! Very clean, great location and accessible to Macy's (Herald Square), Time Square and just a block or so away from the subway! My first visit to NY where I walked to almost all of my locations. The cleanliness of the room was immaculate. Can't wait to visit NY again and will stay at the Hilton again!!

I went to New York for a quick trip and chose the Hilton New York Fashion District; It is locatedwithin walking distance to quite a few places which is great. I read a few of the other reviews where people were disappointed with the size of the room, etc. but it's New York space is a premium and everything is on top of every other thing. The room was great for New York standards. The view wasn't much it was the alley/ roof of another building; but I didnt mind I wasnt there for view from my room, I wanted the excitement of New York. The staff was also outstanding they gave many reccomendations of shopping, sight seeing and eateries. Would definately stay here again

I was very impressed with the size of the rooms, how quiet the room was (we were right by the elevators and we didn't hear anything), and all the amenities. My other experiences at NYC hotels is that you get a room that's like a closet. This room was spacious and comfortable (even the bathroom was really quite large), had a window that opened, free popcorn and bottled water in the lobby, and options for dining/drinks right on site. We really enjoyed our stay.The only issue we encountered was that the self-parking was full so we were forced to do valet, which costs more. But clearly that's not the hotel's fault. It was nice that valet was an option so we did not have to start driving around to find somewhere safe to park.

I stay at this Hilton property regularly. The management is extremely responsive to your needs. The location is perfect - Rare, the onsite restaurant, is actually super yummy. Plus, be sure to checkout Eatly and Ainsworth, both are a short walk from the hotel.

Visited Hilton Fashion District for a four night stay with my partner earlier this month. The reception is quirkily decorated with coloured bobbins in a Mondrian style and with the silver bobbin detail on the reception desk; it was quite nice to see the hotel chain personalise their hotel to the fashion district. As I additionally have a Hilton credit card, I am supposed to get free Wi Fi in all Hilton Hotels, due to my levels of expenditure on this card, but no one seemed to know about it there. In the end we got the WiFi in our room but not without an arduous elongated discussion first. Room was nicely decorated, fantastic coffee machine! Loved waking up and making those and watching some american television from our bed. There was dedicated space to store luggage so you weren't constantly aware of your suitcases. Bed was very comfortable and we both slept soundly. Only problem would be that the safe is in the upper part of the wardrobe in the darkest part of the room so it really was a case of scrambling around with your hand in the dark trying to locate stuff inside the safe. Location is great as we know the whole Chelsea, Meatpacking, Village areas well and feel very comfortable there. Whilst we were staying we used the Rare Restaurant and went to the Rare Bar several times for cocktails. We also had drinks before going out in their Rooftop Bar. Obviously this was in march so the glass roofing was across but I imagine in the summer it must be great. Fantastic views across New York skyline. Wonderful cocktails! Caroline the bar tender made us feel very welcome as well as mixing great cocktails! Decor up there was a bit grim though with pine tongue and groove panelling. Never been to a bar in Alaska but I imagine it must be similar! As it also is a "Rare" bar I don't know why it was not funky like downstairs. Fantastic views irrespective! As a Hilton Honours member I stayed loyal to the brand and booked this hotel as part of a flight hotel package for a 4 night break to NYC. What I have observed from many previous Hilton hotel stays - and also this one - is that they take your loyalty as a given and I have yet to see any type of actual perk to me in using their hotel chain worldwide for the last 18 months. Whilst I would certainly say I had a great time at this hotel, had I ditched my loyalty I could have had a much better deal elsewhere with a hotel on parr with this one.

The hotel did a great job. Enjoyed it very much except the downtown tour the concierge turned us on to..that was a disaster!We were unhappy with the NYC bus tour that the concierge agent sold us as great!He said we just had to walk down to 5 th ave and go left and 2 or 3 block would be the bus station. It took a long time to figure out (too vague) then when we got on the correct bus the tour person would not except the vouchers the concierge had given us. This tour person made us get off the bus....saying they don't except vouchers and we had to go to 48th st to another station to exchange for tickets which was 20 blocks away. We called the Hilton and spoke to desk and then concierge and he said they (the bus) should have taken the vouchers and we should try again and if they tried to stop us we were to call him. We did this and again the tour person did not want to take them, we had to plead with him. Then we let the concierge know we got on but the problem all this confusion was over 1 hour of time. Then problems started with the tour..the bus stopped because they were done for the day and we (everyone on the bus) had to get off and get on another bus at Battery park because that bus was done for the day. More problems with tickets agents (3 guys in red jackets came up on the bus upset about our vouchers not wanting us to get on this second bus! Finally they decided we were OK and exchanged the vouchers for tickets. ...Then and a long line of people in front of us so by the time we got on this new bus we had the worst seats. We drove in that bus and you could not see anything because the plexiglas covering over this double decker was so badly scared the city was a blurry mess! Then in Time square the tour guide said again everyone had to get off the bus and wait for the next bus since that bus and guide were done for the day. It was crazy at that time of day at time square and we could not even get near this next bus so we walked out of the crowded area got in a taxis $13.00) back to our hotel. Never go to finish our $115.00 tour of downtown NYC.
