They had what looked like hot chocolate “lip marks” on the outside rim of the cup. I took the cup down to Reception in the lobby and, to their merit, they quickly replaced it with clean cups and gave us some breakfast vouchers for the hotel restaurant to apologize for what had happened.One needs to be weary of the elevators at this hotel. They use an unusual security system that requires guests to swipe their room card over a sensor to gain access to their floor. This caused bedlam when the elevator was full of people - each reaching over one another to swipe their card... I actually found that once swiped I could access any floor in the hotel!Perhaps this feature was the reason for huge delays when waiting for a lift – up to 5 minutes. We were on the 4th floor and became adept at using the staircase to dodge the bottleneck.

For some reason I didn't have a great view of Hilton hotels, but this one was really impressive!Great location in Chelsea so perfect for uptown/downtown. Very friendly staff, exceptionally clean rooms - compact, but that's New York! Great view from rooftop bar. Nice touches like complimentary cupcakes and water in Lobby.

I arrived early for check in at 8:30 am on Friday , January 4th, 2013. The staff were very friendly and assured me that I could have my room within an hour.I had a King Bed on a High Floor. The room was adequate for one person, but it would be tight for 2 people (unless you really liked each other). The room was clean and bright. I asked for more towels and a bible. They were brought to me within 15 minutes. I tipped the bellman $5 and he was veryyyyyyy appreciative.I ate in the Rare Lounge and the manager, Heidi, was from Cuba. She was polished and eloquent. She filled me in on Cuba. This conversation made my extra worthwhile. The hotel security was excellent.I left in the morning on Sunday and the concierge helped me with the cab.I am staying at this Hilton in March 2013. Recommend this hotel, especially if you are traveling alone.

Stayed in a range of hotels and locations in NY and this is probably the best in context of what you can get. Location is in the middle of Manhattan which means you end up riding more taxis than you might if you parked up further north or south. Rooms were clean and fresh and bathrooms were nice. Comfortable bed, new electronics. Nice bathroom products and attention to detail with the coffee machine. Only small gripe is that sleep can be challenged by the chorus of garbage trucks down below that crosses a few hours, followed by the chorus of door slamming inside the hotel that starts around 6. A focus on sound proofing could help with both. Will consider again for next time.

Well situated for Macy's, Empire State, Maddison Square Garden and Penn Station for trains to Newark airport! Hotel was well presented and very clean! Room was well equipped. Staff were very friendly! Would recommend!

We stayed here for one night in December of 2012 with our family of four. The room is small with two small double beds. This would be a wonderful stay for two people. The hotel is wonderfully centrally located, clean and pretty. There is a nice restaurant downstairs and the staff are all nice and helpful. The fitness room is small but quite nice. I would highly recommend this hotel, but not for a family of four. They were very nice about not charging any extra money for cancelling and leaving for a hotel with a larger room.

This hotel is well located, dont be put of by thinking its not in Times Square its so close, yet not in the middle of all the noise. The metro is a very short walk away, and there are plenty of eat places around. We found it very central to walking aroun didfferent parts of New York.The room was not large (thats New York for you) but was very comfortable. Heating and cooling available, the window does open a little if you like fresh air. The room also had Keureg coffee/tea machine and Hilton were wonderful in topping up with our favourites.Bathroom clean and modern. The lobby was very modern and had hints of fashion district in it.The breakfast (included because of HHonors Gold Status) was fantastsic, a great way to start the day with lots of selections hot and cold.Definitely stay there again.

This Hotel is a decent hotel in Manhattan, conveniently located and therefore a great base to explore the city. But, it doesn't deserve the Hilton Brand, which in my opinion stands for a certain minimum quality level all over the world. For once I didn't book directly through the Hilton portal and used Expedia instead. A big mistake. Although the rooms on both portals had the same price, the Expedia booked rooms were stripped of all Hilton hhonors benefits. As a long term Hilton dedicated guest (see my other reviews) I've never had such a cold reception at a Hilton branded hotel. Furthermore, although booked well ahead (august) we were appointed some very small rooms on very low floors. More importantly, the rooms we were appointed were not clean (stains on bed linen, lipstick marks on glasses and even the minibar menu (???), sewer smell in the bathroom (although not uncommon in NYC) and very dusty. This remained the case during our stay with housekeeping putting the paper covers on used glasses.... Although the hotel appears relatively new, many things are already worn out, obviously as a result of using low quality materials (window shades, heater, carpet, etc). The hotel has too little elevator capacity and as a result expect to be waiting for one (both in the lobby and on your floor). To add some excitement to the elevator experience, the hotel has adopted a security system that does not work properly so expect people frantically trying to select their floor number...To finish of the 'great' experience the hotel provided us with transportation to the airport which nearly killed us before reaching the airport as the driver fell asleep behind the wheel. I wonder if the 'only cash payment (no credit card) to the driver' system of arranging transportation provides the guests with the Hilton class service the brand stands for...As mentioned, the hotel does what it should do (provide a place to sleep) and it is located great (with both the downtown neighborhoods and midtown well accessible), the subway is nearby and around the hotel there are multiple options for a quick breakfast, coffee or some groceries. It is however a three star hotel at the most. and for that, there are cheaper options around. I'll not return and chose the midtown option instead.

My partner and I were delayed in flying to New York as our airline had cancelled our flight and rebooked us for the following day. I contacted Hilton and was connected to Martha Vargas at the hotel. Ms. Vargas was good enough to change our arrival and departure dates, honouring the same room rates I had booked two months earlier. Our new flight had us arrive earlier to the hotel than originally planned. The hotel had our room ready. I was feeling a bit under the weather our first night and went to the hotel's restaurant to buy a cup of tea to take to the room. The restaurant hostess brought me the tea with honey and insisted that there was no charge. We spoke to the two female concierges a few times over our trip and found them to be very helpful. We like to walk, so the hotel's location didn't pose as a problem to get to restaurants or theatres. My only recommendation for the hotel is for them to soundproof the suite doors in some way to prevent noise from the hallways disturbing guests. Other than this, we'd be happy to stay at this property again.

I stayed here over the Christmas holidays with my mom and had a fantastic experience. I have stayed in many hotels in New York and this was by far my favorite. We arrived early and the man behind the desk was very helpful in letting us check in early, the check in process was very fast and efficient. Our airline had lost our luggage and the people behind the desk where very helpful in alerting us when our bags arrived. The rooms are spotless; I was very surprised, of all the NYC hotels I have stayed at this is the first clean hotel I have seen. I really liked the fact that your hotel room key only allows you to gain access to the floor you are staying on, it made me feel very safe. I will definitely stay here again as I come to New York often to see Broadway plays. I have even recommended this hotel to some family members who will be staying in the area shortly, and will continue to recommend it to others.I can’t understand some of the negative reviews on here, those people obviously didn’t stay at the same hotel that I did.

Good hotel. Would recommend to others. Not necessarily the most vibrant neighbourhood but Chelsea is only a few blocks away. Well designed rooms. Cool rooftop bar with good bars but could do with more extensive cocktail menu. Be warned that wifi in the room is expensive - but free only on the lobby.

My daughter and I just returned from a 4 day stay. The hotel room was small but we didn't need a big one just to sleep. I was impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel, restaurant and our room. There is a gym and restaurant named RARE. The food was excellant but a little pricey. Easy access to subway. I was hoping for a spa but there was none. Front desk staff extremely polite and helpful.

My daughter and I booked a 3-day, 2 night trip to NYC after Christmas. It is our tradition and we have stayed in many small Hilton brand hotels in the Chelsea neighborhood, within walking distance of Penn Station. The Hilton Garden Inn, The Hampton Inn and the Doubletree hotel. This was our first time at the Hilton New York Fashion District. We had a double room with two queen size beds. The room was well appointed with 'stylish' black furniture (with silver pull handles) and the hotel felt "fresh". It is one of those small footprint, high rise hotels snuggled into West 26th street between 6th and 7th Avenues. The room was cozy. It was smaller than the Hilton Garden Inn rooms, but had 'style'. Bathroom was large enough to accommodate two people. Good hot water and water pressure. The breakfast, which is included because of my status in the Hilton Honors program, was excellent. You have breakfast in the 'Rare' restaurant attached to the hotel. Many good cold and hot choices you ordered from a menu. My daughter ordered the three eggs with bacon, sausage, home fries and toast. A lot of food. I order the granola and yogurt with fruit, also a very large portion. The coffee was good and strong and not watered down.The location of the hotel is excellent for those who enjoy an easy walk to The High Line (highly recommended), Chelsea Market, and the beautiful brownstone neighborhoods between 20th and 27th streets between 9th, 10th, and 11th Avenues (very much 'old' New York). The hotel is also an easy walking distance to lots of retail shopping in Herald Square.Knowing that we would be visiting the city after Xmas, I booked this room in early October and it was very reasonable. Of course the rates zoom up as the hotel fills up, so anyone booking within weeks of arrival would have paid twice the price.

Staying at this hotel on a regular basis (close to our office) it is always good to be back. The lobby is pretty stylish and the staff is friendly. The rooms are pretty large for NY standards and the bathroom clean. I like the set up with the coffee maker and the space to work. The only thing one could criticise is the lightning in the room entrance / wardrobe area, as it is too dark.The lobby bar and rooftop bar are good places to visit, and the view from the rooftop bar is pretty good. Many stores and brands are close by in walking distance and you can get to pretty much anywhere in Manhattan in a short taxi ride.Will go back there anytime as it is good value for money, considering you are in New York.

This is a very nice, reasonable priced hotel and a good location from which to see the City. The hotel is clean, rooms have plenty of space and very clean. The staff we very friendly and helpful. This is a Hilton but they are clearly trying to adopt some off the best of the Kimpton boutique hotel ways. My only complaint is the elevators. You need to use your key to access the elevator and the system just didn't seem to work. I had to have my key reprogrammed twice (in a two night stay) and had no ability to get to my parent's room on a different floor then mine. Not a big deal but it was an unnecessary hassle in what was otherwise a great experience

Close to two subway lines, close to Broadway/Times Square and yet quiet.Room is "big" by NY standards, bathroom is nice. Should improve in the cleaning though.Internet is way too expensive in the room but I got it for free in the lobby. The room rate was expensive enough that internet access should be included. In today's world it's becoming a standard necessity especially in big cities.Would stay again

We were able to get a room with two beds at this Hilton for a reasonable price, something that's hard to do in NYC where needing a two-bedded room runs up the costs hugely. Everything was in order in the room and the staff were all very helpful. It would be nice if Hilton stopped charging for Internet, but at least there were a few computers in the lobby we could use for free. Rooms are small, but we managed with 3 people just fine. Loved the Keurig, but not the fake milk they give you to use with it. This Hilton is a bit off the main track in NY, but close enough to be a great choice.

We stayed here in December 2012 for 3 nights, 4 days. The room was small but well appointed and in great shape compared to a lot of hotels I have seen lately. The bed was very comfortable, there was plenty of hot water, etc. The problem I had was in dealing with the front desk personnel. They didn't remember me 5 minutes after I talked to them, they couldn't arrange for a car or quote the fare price to save their lives, and they deactivated my room key not once but twice AFTER confirming that I had late checkout. Do NOT arrange for theater or Rockettes tickets through the Concierge desk either. The price is double to that I paid at Radio City Music Hall and you can't select your seats; it's a mystery seating event, apparently, when you arrange through the hotel. Just go to the ticket booth and purchase your tickets; you can select your seats from a seating chart. The location, in the Fashion District, is awesome, I have to admit. It is very close to the Flatiron builiding, Vapiano restaurant that is in or near the Chelsea district; within walking distance of literally hundreds of restaurants, a Whole Foods, several small parks, and lots of shopping. It's a nice hotel; it's just that the "help" at the front desk was not helpful.

Spent the weekend at this hotel recently. A combined business and family get-together. The room was average size for NYC. Very clean with very comfortable bed and pillows. Very good location/central location. Excellent customer service from all staff! Wouldn't hesitate to stay again or refer to others.

The location is great and service spot-on. I had a truly wonderful and effortless stay. Kudos to Eliecer Garcia who provided an much needed evening libation with my popcorn. Definitely will stay at Hilton Fashion District again and recommend to my friends without hesitation.

I booked via a twitter deal...rate was not bad for NYC in mid-December. Stayed three nights with a girlfriend, so wanted to ensure double beds (as opposed to a queen bed). This was a shopping trip and, as many reviewers have stated, this hotel is in a fabulous location - easy access to SoHo and 5th Ave. Room was a decent size for NYC...my friend inquired about paying for an upgrade to a suite, but apparently there are no suites, only standard rooms. No big deal - beds were comfy, rooms were well-cleaned every day, water pressure in shower was good. We spent our last night in the hotel restaurant - very reasonably priced and scrumptious food. Enjoyed the free wifi in the lobby - gave me the ability to quickly check my phone for emails and keep connected with my hubby without being fully "linked-in" (it was a girls' trip, after all).Would definitely consider this hotel again, however, I prefer to book via Priceline if travelling with my hubby and one bed is sufficient.

I have stayed at the NY Hilton Fashion District twice-once in May, 2012 and once in December 2012. Both stays were uneventful, which is a change in NYC! I love the location-close to Whole Foods on 7th Avenue and to Eataly on 23rd. In December it was a great location away from the enormous crowds and the hustle and bustle of midtown and 5th Avenue shoppers and tourists. The rooftop bar is very fun in the summer, but very crowded. Our rooms were clean and sufficient for our needs. Our airline lost our luggage during our December stay and the hotel staff was very accomodating. I would stay here again.

Issue with the room was sorted as soon as they could. Help by offering us free water and Breakfast as compensation. Staff where always helpful and rooms where a good size but as others have said before rooms were on the small side. Great Location to most attractions. I would definitely stay here again. Food in Rare was very good and tasty and bar staff and resturant staff helpful. Only issue was I forgot my dress and a new jumper and sweater rang hotel as soon as i was aware and was told no sigh of it but would look into it for me further.

I stayed one night at the Hilton Fashion District while on business in Manhattan. I've stayed at many hotels over the last two years and this was my first visit here. The lobby is beautiful, and they graciously checked my luggage in the morning when I arrived in NYC. The room, with a king bed, was small, but this was expected. The bathroom could have had more counter space for place my things. The shower was very nice. The bigger than average TV offered real HD, and they had a Kuerig in the room - which was very nice. I had a room with a door to an adjoining room. When those guests arrive the noise was a little louder than I would have liked. I did not eat on site, but the hostess did help me get some coffee supplies for my room. Overall a pleasant stay in a great central location.

I stayed overnight for a work trip. This hotel was clean and conveniently located to Penn Station. The room was small, but that is usual for Manhattan. The fitness center was good. I would definitely stay here again.

Good choice in NY. Centrally located between Midtown/Upper East & West sides and Greenwich Village, Downtown etc. Good value for the price. Staff is personable and helpful. The concierge was able to nail down some hard to get reservations.

Although I travel quite a deal, this was my first stay in New York. I chose this based on location to another hotel our friends were staying at so we were close, but I was very pleased. Some of the goods and bads:Goods:Rooms were new and cleanAlthough the rooms were small, it wasn't overly so, and I'm sure it's on par with other NY hotelsThe king bed we had was very, very comfortableThe shower was nice, strongGreat flatscreen HD tv with good channel selectionGreat location, was able to easily get to many parts of the city and our favorite - Eataly!Bads:They act like the rooftop bar is a nightclub...it's not, get over it. They announce parties coming up on the elevator, and late night, instead of a cool place to chill, they had a DJ blaring music for like 10 people. It didn't fit the vibe of the placeThe elevators themselves were ridiculous, it seemed to take forever and had no rhyme or reason to their pattern, not to mention they commandeer one elevator just for the "nightclub"It was a bit loudOverall, I'd stay there again and was very pleased.

Just returning from my weekend in New York, and a second visit to the Hilton New York Fashion District hotel. My last visit was before the hotel was bought by the Hilton chain, and I have to say I miss the cupcakes by the reception! Otherwise, the hotel appears unchanged.Last time, I had a room on a higher floor, but this time we were given rooms on the fourth floor. This is a very noisy level, and if you are placed here, make sure you are either a sound sleeper, or ask for a room facing the inner courtyard. Though the view is pretty dim and dark, at least it will be quiet. The rooms are kept spotlessly clean and are in good shape, with big TVs, well equipped bathrooms and comfortable beds. My only complaint is that the rooms are too dark. There is not enough light to comfortably light up the room.The hotel is well located, within easy walking distance of Penn Station, Macy's, and Times Square. There are subway options for travel further afield, and plenty of coffee shops and restaurants around the corner. I would definitely stay here again, but would request a room on the upper floors next time.

Hotel was nice. Rooms were small but expected for NYC. Only issues I had were that I had shipped a package to the hotel and it had been received as I received notification. I asked about the package when I checked in and was told they would look into it and send it to my room. We stopped in hours later and still nothing. I called the front desk and was told they would look into it... waited an hour and nothing. Finally I went right to the front desk and Vivian took complete ownership for the issued and assured me it would be up in my room withing 15min. We left for the evening but once back it was there. The only other issue was the noise levels, not from the street but hallways and rooms beside and above us. Very thin walls.

I have to write this review to acknowledge the manager and staff. This is the second time my wife and I stayed here. Some rooms are larger than others, ask for the largest one available at check in. If your room is faces west 26th street choose a upper floor because of the traffic noise.

Stayed here for one week in November, got a good deal on the room so it was good value. Loved the location, very convenient to subway and walking distance to Penn Station, shopping on 34th street, Chelsea and other midtown areas. There is a WholeFoods and plenty of cafes and coffee shops around the area. Check in was fast and efficient, the concierge friendly and helpful. The room and especially the bathroom were a decent size (for NYC). Not a big fan of the automatic light in the bathroom though, especially in the middle of the night... but very comfortable bed ! Lighting is not great in the room, it does have a full length mirror, but because of the dim lighting it's not as useful as it could be. Altogether would definitely stay there again !

In New York for 2 weeks stayed at the Hilton NY @ fashion district. The room was clean and well prepared as one would expect. High Def TV is great for college football on Saturday, shower was always hot and housekeeping kept the room stocked with soaps, towels, etc. For me the front desk staff was exceptional and is primary reason I recommend this hotel. Martha, Mileen, Angelica, Vivian, Kathy and Caroline were more than just courteous - the ladies took the time to talk instead of simply handing you a room key and ushering you to your room. After 12 hours of dealing with other people, it's very refreshing to return to your hotel and know that the staff will take care of you. It's not hard to find a good room in NY, but to find a staff like this is a rare find.The elevators can be a little finicky at times, but I was on the 3rd floor so just a few flights of stairs down and I was out of the hotel and ready to go. The restaurant serves a great NY strip - had one for Thanksgiving dinner. The night manager was also top notch, he was able to clear up a small matter for me with zero drama and hassle.If you have the opportunity add this Hilton to your list of stops while in NY.DM

My partner and I stayed here from 11/30-12/2 and we really enjoyed the great location and the friendly service on the part of the desk clerks and the bellman. They were kind, courteous, and always helpful. The concierge was also very nice, but completely useless when it came to giving any kind of suitable advice. When asked about neighborhood restaurants for dinner and breakfast, we waited while she looked up some locations, but could not speak with any authority about any of them. Similarly, we were interested in getting a driver for the evening and she was clueless as to how to do this. I'm not all together sure this is her fault, perhaps she needs more or better training. The room was clean and small (but it's NYC so that's to be expected), however the towels and linens weren't really up to the quality I've come to expect from Hilton. The towels were small, coarse, and tattered. They really should be ashamed of themselves for providing such poor quality linens especially when you're paying $500/night.

We had a quick trip into New York for a Christmas party and stayed at the Fashion Distract Hilton. Very close to everything, hip & cool hotel vibe, friendly staff, nice clean rooms even though little on the small size, fast elevators but having to scan your key first was ignoring (forgot and we where up to 22nd then gradually got back down), love the valet parking for its location and Rare restaurant had good burgers but service tad slow. Would stay again.

The location's great! You can walk to midtown or the village, and easily to Penn Station. The lobby was small and while the front desk couldn't check in the group in front of me, she was great checking me in at 11am on a Saturday morning. She was friendly, efficient, professional, and gave use three gifts which our kid loved. I was told that the view was bad (could have checked in later for a better view but wanted the room now). It was. Just terrible but it's NYC and every room can't have a great view. The room was small but beds were comfy, bathroom was well appointed, and tiny closet had a safe. I paid $150 for a two bed room when the rest of the city was about $75 more and I was very happy. They have a cool rooftop bar and while my kid couldn't go up there, the manager offered to take us up during the day while they were closed so my kid could see the view. It was great (& great service)!Check out was fast and they checked our bags wiki wiki. How do you make up for a miserable view, provide great service and make me feel valued. I look forward to my next visit.

Stayed here for Black Friday shopping weekend, great check in . The room was bigger than I expected but sorry the cleaning was not up to standad, I found hairs on the sink and finger marks on the doors and dust on the light fittings. The bed were really comfortable.I would say a good location to stay , minutes from Madison square gardens. There are some good places for breakfast on the way to the tube station.The room was dark and I dont think the black furniture helps. Not really that good for 2 ladies to get ready to go out as only one mirror in bathroom , there is one on the back of the bathroom door but its too dark in the room to see properly.

My wife ( of 26+yrs. ) always wanted wanted to go to the Macy's T-Day parade (a "bucket list" item), I don't much like cities and vowed I'd never go to N.Y. So for her 50th B-Day I surprised her with a 4 day trip to the Big Apple and stayed at this Hilton. She loved it! I booked it 13 months out so I got a great rate (For N.Y.) The decor was maybe not my style but she said it was very cool, sort of a late 60's early 70's retro-look. I hate it when my childhood memories are now "retro"! Good walking distance from Times Square, several Subway stations, Shopping, the cool variety of "burgs"/unique neighborhoods and a variety of great places to eat. Staff did great job and the rooftop bar is cool, (could use some munchies, which I suggested and they said they would pass along) I am not "backwoods" but I am more of a skier, hiker, biker etc. more used to being more "self reliant" than a "New Yorker" but I never felt unsafe walking in the neighborhood around the hotel. I would stay here again, I have no relative perspective for what a "N.Y. city" hotel should be like but I was told I got a super rate and everything else was very much on target for this type of hotel in this location should be. We had a car service both to and from the airport which they helped coordinate as well.

Meeting room en c-3 was very poor. Not addapted to hold 40 people. Air conditionning not working well: Sometimes it was too cold and then too hot. Screen on the wall for the presentation is very small and was impossible to see the slides from the back of the room. Card key system for the elevator not working well. Several times the card was not properly read and it was impossible to stop at the wright floor. Once my key was not working in my room (18th floor) and needed to go to the reception to ask to reitinialise the key. the service on the restaurant is very poor. During one lunch, they did a mistake taking the order and we have to wait for almost one hour to get a salar and an hambourger... One of the person in the table never got his order. The only answer we have received it was "sorry sirs, the kitchen is fully booked ..."For sure is the last time I organized a business meeting in this hotel. This was the worst experience in my life.

We stayed at the "Hilton fashion district" for Black Friday shopping weekend. The staff was very friendly and extremely accommodating with an early check in. My wife is a clean freak and this is one of the few hotel rooms we stayed in that she had zero complaints about the cleanliness. The bed was so comfortable that I didn’t want to get up in the morning. The hotel is in a great location for a shopping trip in Chelsea and at Macy’s.

This Hilton is a nice change for a Hilton hotel. Since its located in the Fashion district is cooler in look and service. Overall very friendly staff. Decent size rooms for New York with a good selection for breakfast. The location is good and easy walk/taxi or metro from anywhere in Manhattan. Would stay here again.

I was nicely surprised by the location - whole foods just one block away, close to subway and many attractions. Your view may have empire state building!However, it already looks very warn out after it was opened in April this year! Elevators are very slow and scratched inside in multiple places, the electronic keys always are difficult to get you to your floor or the upper floor lounge.The rooms are very small, very cheap furnishings, not a lot of light. We had not clean showers left.Service even more terrible: I had an email from the hotel asking if I need anything etc and that they would be at my service if I have any special requests. So I did have a request - no answer and certainly no request was fulfilled or even acknowledged.Really sorry to see that good location to be left to hilton which is not doing a good job...

Here are some thoughts on my stay:1. Self park at MPG parking on 26th street, drive car there, parking attendant will give you a ticket, he will park your car. Alternatively, valet parking is available (drop off in front of the hotel). Cost to self park is $40, $10 more for Van or SUV. Get your parking ticket stamped at the front desk to get those rates. Tip is $2 (for me anyway). Parking is good for 24 hours from the time of entry.2. Recommend high floor, quieter, nicer vew (although rear just faces the back of the another building).3. Got room via AAA for a good rate (for some reason, non available online)4. Kudos to the friendly staff !!5. Clean room, nice shower, glass partition - Very comfortable bed - No issues with TV - Coffee maker includes regular and decaf, tea serving - Room faced the back, asked foe was not able to get a front facing room but minor issue6. To uptown (Broadway shows), take the 1 (“One”) train to the 42nd street stop (second stop). Cost is around $2.50 per passenger. We took the NQ or R train on the way back, but it stopped in a different location. Still close to the hotel. Just be aware in case you get disoriented. Best is to take the “One” train back if possible. Staff mentioned cab rides also easy way to travel.7. As far as nearby restaurants – I disagree with the other posts saying there are few places to eat. There are two BBQ places on the same block, a Japanese restaurant nearby, Korea Town just 2 or 3 blocks away, so plenty of places to eat, but may not be open 24 hours though.8. For checkout, we had our bags kept for an extra hour or two by the front desk after checkout, gave us time to have lunch before our departure.9. Catholic Church – St Francis of Assissi, on 31st st, within 10 min walk, http://www.stfrancisnyc.org/10. Fitness room is on the bottom floor, nice standard equipment, with complimentary headphones11. Other posters menitioned small rooms, I disagree - thought it was adequate at least for the rate that I got..12. Short walk, 15 min to the Empire State Building

my experience with Hilton in Fashion District is really mixed on both good and bad, let me share what happened coming from an Asian.1. I went over early before check in time, so i left my luggage with the hotel and went to woodsbury for shopping spree. I'm not used to the culture of tipping coming from where i am from (everything has service charges in the total bill) so i didnt tip. When I arrive back from shopping with 1 luggage bag and 7 to 8 bags of clothes, the bellboy handed me my luggage bag and expect me to go up to the hotel room myself, because i didnt tip him earlier. Imagine this, 2 Big luggage bag (1 i bought from woodsbury), 1 backpack, and 7 - 8 bags of clothes. I cant even walk on a straight line, they just smile and walk off.2. I was checked into a room that is at the end of row (not my preferred room as listed in my hhonours membership) and to make the thing worst, the room is facing the main road, I basically have to put my noise cancelling headphone on just to sleep.3. I complained to the hotel, they manage to get me a new room, which is on level 7 facing the back , which is 500 times better. 4. Tipping, knowing that it's a culture there, i started to tip, and the service is much better, the bell boys was so efficient, taking my bags when i checked out, and getting me a cab and arranging my bags in the cab and making sure that they close my cab door. I just wish i know about this earlier.so morale of the story is. start giving 2 dollar tip to the bellboys and make your life easier

Good location for the west side of Manhattan. Quiet street. Staff was very welcoming. Rooms are new and bright, ample space for person and things. The hotel includes a good bar. Great hamburger. Overall a convenient and less expensive alternative to the usual New York tourist hotel.

So I admittedly did not intend to stay here. I was stranded during Sandy while attempting to relocate from Chelsea (NYC) to Miami, Florida (the irony of moving to a hjurricane city, right?!). Nonetheless this hotel is excellent. It's new, and the rooms are small, but if you have business or pleasure in the area, it's darn well located. Not perfect for tourists as you will need a cab or subway to get to times sq etc. (not that I'd go there since I lived in NYC for 12 years), but if the CITY DOES HAVE POWER, you're very close (ie. walking distance) to Flatiron where there are lots of great restaurants and places to hang out. The staff is excellent. Very helpful and patient. And remember, this was literally during the superstorm! I'd highly recommend it.

We had the best view of Manhattan! The employees were very nice and helpful! Especially a girl at the front desk named KATHY! She was so polite, professional, and patient with us. We asked for many different things and she always had a solution! I would definitely make sure she is given a gift for her excellent service.

As a loyal Hilton member, this Hilton in particular was our choice for a weekend getaway in NYC. The location is perfect, you are only a few blocks from Madison Square garden and only a mile from the theaters on Broadway.The room was spotless, not too small for a hotel in this district and the staff and concierge could not have been any better or more willing to answer questions or assist in any way possible.

What a great experience we had at this hotel. I'd booked a room a month in advance knowing at the time that our overnight flight would bring us in super early. At the time of reservation I asked if we could get an early check-in. I followed up on the request each week and the morning that we arrived I very politely asked if we could get in early. The hotel was so accommodating, they called us while we were eating breakfast and gave us a beyond belief early check in. Everone from the concierge to the front desk employees gave us great suggestions, great directions and made our trip fantastic. The bed was very comfortable and the room was immaculate. We even had a room overlooking the street and it was so very quiet.Will definitely stay there again!

The Hilton Fashion District is a brand new, boutique style hotel in Chelsea. It has a nice neighborhood feel, is close to the subway, good restaurants, without the tourist bustle of times square. Rooms were typically small for New York, but comfortable and well-appointed. Nice restaurant/bar in the lobby as well as a rooftop bar with amazing views!

There is nothing really awful about this hotel, but nothing great either. The room was clean, but small and dark, especially when first entered. It looks to be fairly recently refurbished, but it isn't inviting. The bed was comfortable and pillows were ample, but the pillows were on the hard side. Little details seemed cheap : no fan in bathroom, no notepads to write on, just tiny squares of paper. When I checked out, there was a minibar charge for a minibar that I hadn't even opened. For the money, there are other hotels in this area of NYC that are a better value, and I don't think I'd stay here again.

Right after Hurricane Sandy -- my husband and I were forced out of our NYC apartment and spent one night at this hotel. We were really pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms. We got a queen-sized room but the rest of the room and bathroom was quite large. It was comfortable and the Kerig coffee maker was a nice touch. WiFi, in my opinion, should always be included. It wasn't at this hotel. But I was only there for one night so it was fine. If you are coming from out of town -- I don't know if this is the best area to stay in just because it's not that central. You aren't in walking distance to a lot of attractions. I didn't think the staff was particularly nice because when we came in the girl at the front desk acted like we were bothering her when we tried to check in. She didn't greet us with a smile or anything. But at least the rooms are really nice to make up for it.
user_name:
paularizzo
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed in two different hotels this trip to NYC, so interesting to compare. Location of this one is not bad, in the middle of a mixed business/residential area of New York but close enough to 42nd or Canal St. that walking is not a big problem (plus pretty close to two subway lines). Not much in the way of restaurants nearby, a fair number of delis, etc. Will probably stay further north or south on our next visit to NYC. Rooms are as expected, comfortable but small. Price maybe a bit high (the whole "fashion district" thing"?) but you get what you pay for, and certainly no complaints to share.A few quirks - guests must use room key to access elevators but do not have direct access to the roof-top bar, must use lobby - no reason why, just because. Elevator girl was kind enough to drop us off at our floor on the way down but said not really supposed to do that (staff were very friendly and helpful). Bathroom lights are on a motion sensor to save energy but both mornings I ended up having part of my shower in the dark because the sensor thought the bathroom was empty.

Central location in walking / short taxi ride to everything. Close to metro. Staff were very helpful -arranged for us to have 2 rooms beside each other and a late check out even though we booked with a last minute rate. The room size was ok considering it was NYC. Not on the best looking street but safe. Excellent roof top bar with views of the city.

When I had a problem with the heating in the room the manager Eliza did a fantastic job sorting it out. He was helpful and courteous - beyond expectations. Overall prompt service made me feel welcome. Well-located for midtown.

Definitely a very good location in Manhattan, a few blocks away from the tourist areas.The rooms are small but quite comfortable as long as you are in a high enough floor and not on the street side (very noisy, as everywhere in New York).Service is not always nice but generally helpful enough (not at the level you would expect from a Hilton, though !)The card entry system is fairly inconvenient and the "security" explanation that was given to us is a joke, since you can take the stairs. The gym is quite small and not very well equipped.The bar downstairs is good and friendly, but the rooftop one is a total "miss": although the view is great, the decor is terrible, the service barely OK and the menu really discouraging.

We stayed over the weekend the marathon was to occur. We were disappointed they would not allow cancellation given the exceptional circumstances. The stay was fine although the rooms are small given the costs. Service was nice and helpful. Position of the hotel is handy - walk able from penn station and close to times square the meat packing district etc. it's far enough from times square to be relaxing. Overall the hotel is solid but below average value for mOney.
user_name:
kellyenz
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Very good Location at this hotel. Very trendy for it being a Hilton, looks more like a small W hotel or a morgans group hotel. Rooms were very small, very similar to the W on lexington if you have stayed there. I was only there for a night, good check in, no upgrade or anything (Diamond Member). I wasnt even told that there was no upgrade available or something. After check in went to get some food and the elevators weren't working. Had to go down the stairs and never got an apology or even a notice to my rooms that the elevators were back and working. The weird thing is that they lock 1 of the elevators to take people to the lounge on the roof. And even though the other elevators werent working they didn't even try to accomodate the guests of the hotel.Didnt try breakfast or the hotel restaurant. They bellmen did a good job of getting me a cab to the airport, kudos to them!It was an ok experience, would definitely look for other hotel when in NYC, rate was 379 so i am sure I can find something nicer for that price even in NYC.Good air conditioning! and nice bed!!

This was the place to stay for a night in order to attend a gallery opening nearby. Clean and comfortable with a nice exercise facility, and the price was right. However, not much great restaurtants around. It happened their card entry system was down for the day, so they escorted me up and open the door for me every time.

From the moment we arrived to the moment we left all the staff were so helpful,Room and bathroom was very clean and well presented, great pod style coffee machine in the room which made a nice change to a old kettle! hotel is situated about a 10-15 minute walk from Times square, so is central, Both restaurant and room service were great, bar up top has great views.We are looking to go back to New York soon and would defiantly go back to this hotel.

I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. The room was small, but I expect that of NYC hotels. The room was clean, for the most part. Staff was friendly. My one complaint was that I had a nice window view of a brick wall,this was not the fault of the staff though. Location is good if in town for work I downtown area or in for theater shows as the places to eat around the area are plentiful.

The hotel staff and restaurant staff were extremely helpful and offered professional service every minute during our stay at the time of the hurricane disaster. Whatever they could do to help --flexible in keeping our room booked past our planned stay because we were stranded and could not get a flight out to California. We were so stressed, they even printed out our boarding passes for us when we finally did get a flight. The staff helped us get cabs, when it was almost impossible to find one. Even helped my husband look for his misplaced wallet. Everyone was wonderful and we greatly appreciated.

Room was OK except the A/C unit. It was old unit and loud. Front desk agents were not service oriented, typical NYC hotel standard? We did not like the surroundings of the hotel - dirty. We probably will not go back.
user_name:
ksuzudc2301
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: You cannot beat this hotel for the location, price, cleanliness and great bar restaurant to boot! We booked our room for $220/night which was a very fair price. Our room was clean (the most important factor for me), spacious, great bath products & very quiet. I asked for a quiet room b/c I have insomnia so our room was in back of hotel so not much of a view but that was fine with me. This location is perfect b/c if you want to walk uptown or downtown, it's an easy walk with lots to see on the way. I only hope that I can stay here again and get the same price!

Stayed here in Oct 2012, two nights. Small room, but decently located on the 15th floor which gives you an ok view on the Empire State Building. Loved the shower, which was perfect. Nicely sorted minibar, prices not so nicely. WIFI is expensive ($15 per day), unless your Elite Hilton member. Hotel has a great roofterrace and bar, great views over the city.The area itself is a bit gritty in my opinion, but is a decent base to explore the city. Macy's is a few blocks away (8 to be prices), the High Line is nearby, and the Meat Packing Disctrict is 10 blocks south.Bit too corporate and popular for my liking, wouldnt stay here

I booked the room on Priceline, and even though I couldn't collect Hilton Honors points, I was treated like a VIP. I was allowed to check in early. The room, albeit small, was clean, comfortable and quiet. The hotel isn't on a street where many cabs come by, but the bellman ran down 7th Avenue to flag one. The restaurant features casual dining, and the food is very good. You can walk almost everywhere from this location, and the subway is also nearby.

My friend and I stayed at the Hilton District for 3 nights, and found it ideal both for its location and the comfort of the room. It's around 10 blocks south of the proper midtown area, being nearer Chelsea. This is actually an advantage as it is slightly quieter and surrounded by independent restaurants and interesting shops, while not being too far to walk to Times Sq etc. The room was so comfortable, and bathroom lovely. The rooftop bar is definitely worth a visit, just to see the Manhattan skyline by night.

This was the 1st (and NOT the last), time we had stayed in this particular hotel in NYC. By NY standards the rooms are quite roomy. Very clean, nice amenities, comfy beds, plenty of storage space and lots of electric outlets!! Bathroom was not huge, but generously sized. The staff could not have been more courteous and helpful. Many less expensive places to eat or just grab a coffee very near by (Dunkin Donuts, Whole Foods, Chipotle Grill). The location of this hotel makes it perfect for many activities in the city. Since it is not quite mid-town is is a little quieter and less hustle & bustle. The bell staff will gladly get you a cab. As we were checking out and telling the gals @ the desk how much we enjoyed our stay, she handed us 2 "goodie bags", containing water, pretzels and jelly beans! I've NEVER had that happen before! Lovely touch!!!!!

We stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for 3 nights recently & were pleasantly surprised. We had a king room & it was bigger than most in NYC but still small. The room was very comfortable and well appointed. The bed was very comfy & it had a great shower. The staff was nice & the rooftop bar was very nice. I would stay here again. The hotel was close enough to everything & very clean.

The Hilton New York Fashion District is truly a great place to stay.Oversized rooms that are clean and comfortable;stylish throughout the hotel;plenty of reasonably priced restaurants;a pleasant staff and great amenities(shower,gym,bar) makes this one of the best places to stay in NYC.

So this will be my second review about the Hilton. Stayed there with my dad for a short holiday in New York.The room is good, comfy beds, enough space to stash your stuff. It just has everything you basically need. The staff is just very helpful from the front desk till the doormen. They did everything they could to make our stay as pleasant as possible and I can't thank you enough for that! A special thanks to Martha, Kathy and Christine from the front desk. If there's a problem these ladies will do anything to help you. Also Jose and Moises, thanks guys for getting me a cab when I needed one and fix me a nice car to get me to the airport...The location of the hotel is just perfect. It's situated in a not to busy street and Macy's, Penn station and Madison Square Garden are just a few blocks away same as the subway....Just a great hotel and I'm sure next time I will stay there again!!

Great place to stay, very stylish and rooms very comfortable.Very brief stay, but very happy. Staff a very helpful and will promptly resolve anything you find not 10/10.Doesnt look like a chain hotel, the lobby has an interesting bar and there's lots of life around
user_name:
Rob Y
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: This is my new favorite hotel in NYC. I've already booked my next 3 stays (I am in NYC every other week for work). It is convenient to the 1 train, has some of the largest, cleanest rooms I have seen in Manhattan, and a shower that rivals my Kohler shower at home. The gym is nice and the hotel overall feels very new and safe. I enjoy the fact I get an e-mail before and after every stay confirming I get and did get everything I wanted. The burger bar in the hotel is also convenient and is the first time I've eaten in a hotel in a long time.Ahram Suh the Guest Services Manager at the Hilton Fashion District consistently reaches out to ensure I have everything I need for my upcoming stay. A high point of my last trip is the door man walking two blocks down the street to get me a cab at 6am. He made it clear, no tip necessary!

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We arrived early ( before the 3:00 checkin time) and they had our room ready, which was nice. The first night was very quiet - had a room facing W. 26th. The second night, which was a Friday, the street level got very loud around 1 or 2 in the morning. The third night was not as bad but early in the morning someone slammed a door on our floor. The room itself was good. One strange thing was that there were no towel racks - only one on the shower door. I like to hang up the hand towel and not have it on the wet bath towels. There was non ice bucket or place to get ice. Had to call the front desk. My husband needed to ice his arm and had to wait a 1/2 hour for them to bring ice. Staff was nice - computer printer not working - so they printed my boarding passes at the front desk. I thought the location was good. Walk a few blocks up on 7th and there are all kinds of breakfast and lunch places. We walked to the theatre district/ Times Square. There are 2 subway stops for the 1 train within 2 or 3 blocks either direction. Beautiful day on our last day and we walked back to hotel from West Village area. Easy to get to most places from this location.

Great hotel. The location is fantastic as you are between the lower west side and mid-town not to mention all the stuff you can find in Chelsea. Also, you can walk everywhere and if you get tired the hotel is close to the subway. Having said that one of the best features is the rooftop patio. You can relax with a drink and enjoy the views of the city.

I arrived at this hotel to find that agora had stuffed up my booking. Despite Agoda sending sending me a voucher the hotel didn't have any record of a booking. The wonderful front desk staff went out of their way to help us contact Agoda and try to sort it out. All Agoda could offer was to organise to book us into another hotel (after 5 hours o n the road this was not what we wanted). Despite being booked out the hotel managed to make a room available for us and even brought up a bottle of champagne to our room after we had checked in.Rooms are definitely small - but this seems to be the standard in New York. The roof top bar is magnificent - views straight over to Empire State Would definitely recommend.

My stay could not have been any better with this new hotel. In a great location on the west side, easily walkable to many places. Recently build in 2010, you can tell it still is new and has a modern touch to it. Check in was super quick and easy to get me up to my room, which I appreciated since it was late. The rooms were very clean, and in fact one of the things that impressed me was the maid service. They were respectful and thorough. Room service was easy and right on time each morning as well. Even though I didn't get a chance to use it, the gym looked clean and had more than just a couple tread mills. The restaurant in the hotel is great as well. It is called RARE. Try the lobster burger, amazing! Great service as well. Over all, great time. Only thing I would say was annoying, which wasn't that big of a deal was that they apparently change our their oil tanks to replenish the hotel for cooking/heating/ etc. at 1230 am. I can handle 1030-11pm but not 1230-1 am. But, still 5 stars!!

My husband booked the hotel as part of a surprise trip. First impressions- cool, with decor based on a hip night club. Room had just one double bed, but was pretty spacious for NY. Everything was clean and new. A pretty high standard. The sort of place for a cool 25 yr old guy to take his girlfriend if he really wants to impress her! Location wise, its great for all the usual tourist stuff, with good cafes and coffee shops very close. On the negative side- there is no kettle in the room if you drink tea( just a tasimo coffee machine) and the minibar is designed so that if you want to put anything in it ,you cant! Really clever and 100% business minded, yet it felt a little cheap. Didnt see any doorstaff, so you were on your own trying to get a taxi.

This hotel suited us just fine for our one night stay in the neighborhood while visiting family. Decent size rooms for the city and the area! Despite our room's location on the 6th floor behind the bank of elevators, we did not hear any elevator noises during our stay. We enjoyed watching a baseball game and cocktails in the Rooftop Lounge. Staff is friendly and polite. We will consider staying here again.

Good location but a bit of a walk to get to subways compared to other locations. Room was nice and clean,recently renovated.No problems with service.Had asked for just lots of ice from room service and they brought about 10 plus pounds of it! Which was a good thing.Had a fairly decent room service breakfast.Hotel is right near FIT and is in a relatively quieter area of the city.Whole Foods is about 1 block down from the hotel which was convenient.

Nice hotel, good location. Had two double beds and the room was a good size by New York standards. Nice touch of turn down service! Only criticism: bad lighting with the extra mirror on the exterior of the bathroom. Would rather have had an extra mirror in the main part of the room. Definitely would stay there again!

First time i stayed at this Hotel was last year. Everything was great. The room was comfortable and clean. The location is also great, about 15 mins walk to Times Square and Empire State bldg. The service was great. It was in October and it was freezing and snowing and the door man went a got a cab for us.My second stay was this past Sept. We were 4 and made a reseration for 2 doubles and instead they reserved 1 king. We were told there were no rooms available with 2 doubles. Had to wait about 30 mins in the lobby and magically the manager found a room. So that was kind of frustrating. Had the opportunity to check out the lounge upstairs and it was amazing. The view was fantastic.
user_name:
Diachel
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Decent sized rooms for NYC, very comfortable bed and newly refurbished bathroom suite with walk-in shower (no tub). Room on the 14th floor at the back of the hotel was quiet enough that we did not need to use the earplugs supplied. We were in a hurry so took breakfast, not included in our room deal, in the restaurant at ground level. A cheese omelette and greasy hash browns for $14 to a standard worse than alrline food was unexpected and never to be repeated.

We stayed here for a long weekend and the end of September whilst having a weekend away in New York. The room was compact (typical NY) but modern and clean with a comfortable bed. The views from our room were great (20th floor overlooking the Empire State Building) and the hotel is only a couple of blocks from two metro lines, and six blocks from the highline.What we weren't particularly keen on was the food and bar areas. The rare bar is all at ground and lower ground levels, so rather than being a feature of the stay it was more something to get out the way and get on with the day somewhere else.The buffet breakfast was OK and there is a small cook to order list as well.The service was good and the rooftop bar has great views of the city. Only downside is the plastic cups for beer and cocktails but I'm guessing this might be NY regulations.Overall a good venue, would just be good if they served breakfast on the roof as well!M

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on 4 and 5 October 2012. Having requested a room on a high floor with a good view, I was given a room on the 22nd floor. Great you might think! However, if you read other reviews the problem with the 22nd floor is that it is directly below the roof top bar on the 23rd floor and there is music playing until 12.30am. So beware of the rooms on the 22nd floor if you are looking for a quiet room with no noise!My first impression on entering the hotel is that it is quite dark. The carpets on each floor are a dark colour, the elavators are painted in a dark brown colour as are the skirting boards. The room itself was much smaller compared to the one I stayed in at the Millenium Hilton 5 days earlier. There was no bath in the room just a shower which was perfectly acceptable for my purposes. Again dark carpets and walls!Despite my comments about the roof top bar, I would recommend that you visit it to experience the view especially of the Empire State Building. There is a private elavator which takes you up the bar from lobby level. The girl who takes you up in the elevator is extremely friendly and pleasant as is the girl who meets you once you reach the roof top. I found both of them to be a very personable and a credit to the hotel.Guests also have access to a small business centre located behind the check-in desk where you can print off boarding passes and also access the internet free of charge!In summary, not bad hotel although if I had a choice, I would choose the Millenium Hilton over this hotel despite its location in Lower Manhattan.

My partner and I spent my birthday weekend in my favorite city!! I researched hotels and am very picky about staying in dumpy places however I don't want to spend $500.00 for one night!! I was quite leary when I saw the price...never thought it would be as nice as it sounded. How nice to be surprised!! It did have great reviews on Trip Advisor so that was my deciding factor! Everything was clean and spotless...the room was newly decorated, bathroom was immaculate, and Peter Roth bath amenities to top it all off! The bed was incredibly comfortable and plenty of room for a NYC hotel room...people were complaining about the "pain in the neck" system of the elevators! I thought it was great....felt very secure! Not easy to get up to the floors if you didnt have a room key. Oh yeah, and location, location, location!! Definitely will be back!

I just recently returned from NYC with my boyfriend and we had a great 2 night stay at this hotel. I sort of knew what to expect as I have been reading everyone's reviews for quite some time and the reviews were pretty spot on. We asked for a high room with a great view but unfortunately we were only able to get a room on the 10th floor facing another building. No big deal for us though, we felt it was quite intimate and secluded - very romantic. The room was very small but at the same time was very comfortable with modern amenities and a very comfy bed :) The decor was fresh and modern and the room was very clean. Bathroom had only a shower but we didnt mind at all. The concierge and front desk seemed very friendly and were very helpful in answering our questions. Location was by far the best. We were in close walking distance to all the shopping, dining and nightlife. Taxis were right out in front of the hotel if we needed to travel a longer distance. I would definetely stay at the hotel again, we had a great stay!

We stayed here one night as my husband had business in NYC. The rooms are pretty large compared to other NYC hotels I have stayed in, and we got a good rate on the Hilton website. Very clean and modern looking.Issues: our tv wouldn't work. We were going out to dinner anyway, but we saw a cleaning staff lady on the elevator and mentioned it to her. No idea if she was even assigned to our room. She said she would make sure it was fixed, and sure enough, when we returned from dinner, it was working.2nd issue: got up the next morning, and the shower wasn't working. No water at all. Called the front desk, who told us the maintainence man would be there at 8 am. That was a problem as my husband had an appt which he could not be late for. I explained this, and the manager said he would call me back. within 5 minutes, he had found the maintainence man and got him up to our room. Shower was fixed in 15 minutes.The location is perfect if you are interested in shopping. There is close access to the subway. I would definitely stay here again.

Clean, reasonably comfortable and staff that can help out when called upon. Some minor quirks including a fitness center half the size of the guest room and useless ironing boards that are small enough to fit in your carry-on luggage, but certainly nothing that would keep me from the hotel in the future - just consider paying for a high-floor if the construction on 26th & 6th Ave continues.

I am not sure I would call this hotel trendy in 2012. It looks like a W circa 1988 if there was one then. But that is not to detract from the fact that this hotel is very decent. Rooms are very spacious for New York with a roomy bathroom and clean beds. Shower was strong and water warm. A/C was controlled by a modern digital thermostat. The location is great and close to the emergent Flatiron district and Chelsea.The hotel is far from perfect. The minimal lobby has three elevators, one of which is commandeered for use for the rooftop bar. Far from enough if you want to get to your room and the wait is almost guaranteed. Noise from the street is ceaseless overnight, reason for ear plugs being given free of charge bedside. WiFi is a rip-off $15/device. Enough to convince you to bring your own network device. Breakfast at the hotel's Rare restaurant was mediocre.Still, if you need a clean room in New York in a good area - this Hilton is a fair choice.

Just returned from three nights at the Hilton on 26th street. Rooms were very nice and spacious for NYC.... friends of ours stayed at the Holiday Inn on 26th and at the Gansevoort in the meat packing district and their rooms were small in comparison.Cleaning staff worked well, concierge was helpful, no issues whatsoever! Would return any time!

The Hilton New York Fashion District is probably the best Hilton hotel I have stayed in. The rooms are nice, clean and not to noisy. The in-room dining options are good - unless you are a vegetarian or tired of steaks and gourmet burgers. The receptionists are helpful. Most important: The handicap rooms are truly accessible, with a great shower chair and a sturdy frame around the bathroom. And it does not feel like a hospital room, something many European handicap rooms does. That being said, the Hilton Fashion District is stil a Hilton-hotel. This means NO INTERNET UNLESS YOU PAY 14 $ A DAY PER DEVICE. That is just greedy. Also, the rooftop bar is tacky, cheesy, noisy, and full of screens showing sports really loud. Don´t waste your time on that.

I am French and everybody knows that the French are very demanding so I want to recommend this hotel hilton for the quality of its services. You know, despite a problem with my reservation, management team has demonstrated a true commercial sense, a kindness and a professionalism Many hotels in New York could learn from Hilton New York Fashion District. Luidin their Assistance Front Office Manager is PERFECT and the Manager Guest Services is GREAT. We had a nice room, on the top floor with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building, extremly clean, a beautiful bathroom, a cofee machine was very appreciated. Also a good location. I highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel is new and clean but overpriced. For NYC the size of the room is OK. The advantage of the hotel is its location - 5 min walk to Penn station and 10 min to Empire State. I do not like Chelsea disrict so consider other options

I met visitors from overseas for a day of meetings at the Hilton NY Fashion District. They were in town for the Interop Conference at the nearby Javits Convention Center on 34th street. Our meetings were in the Hilton's conference room. It all worked out very well, included wonderful weather for travel.The Hilton is a small boutique-ish hotel with a very small lobby and limited drive-up area. The hotel was nicely updated and well staffed with friendly people happy to help you with walking directions or to offer you a small popcorn snack when you check in.Room. My room was small with a king sized bed. There was a nice desk area, and plenty good Internet ($14.95/day) and HD TV. The bathroom has been updated very nicely; no bath tub, just a large walk-in shower. My schedule was such that I needed to work late into the evening, and I had a room service dinner at 10pm... all was fine.Conference Room. Our meeting room was plenty big for our needs. Our hosts ordered breakfast and lunch; it was nicely served buffet-style and we always had a hotel staff person nearby to clear dishes and keep things tidy. The conference room did have one draw back: it is three stories underground. That means very limited mobile phone coverage. We did have WIFI; it worked ok, but it meant people had to go up to the lobby to take calls. It was ok.Walking around. I am always a tourist when I go to Manhattan. For this trip I took advantage of the hotel location and went for a walk to 5th Ave and took some beautiful late afternoon pictures of the Flatiron building and the Empire State building. Further, I went for a walk through the Flatiron and Garment Districts, stopping for a nice break at Herald Square. The hotel is about 4 short blocks from Penn Station.Airport transportation. From LaGuardia, I took the NYCAirporter Express Bus. The pickup was right outside of baggage claim. I paid the nice guy in the green suit coat $13. I had to wait 10 minutes for the bus. It took me and about 20 other people to the Grand Central Terminal. It was 4pm and the ride took 25 minutes -- traffic was heavy but not stop and go. From there, I connected with a van that took me right to my hotel -- about a 15 minute ride. It should have been much quicker except we had to wait for a garbage truck and we got stopped by a firetruck / ambulance. This worked well for me and I would do it again.Taxi. Of our course, having done my first bus ride from LGA to Manhattan, on my return trip I took a taxi ($44). I just ran out of time and needed to quickly get to the airport. I think the taxi saved me 30 minutes.

Recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. Staff were very helpful and always available. Hotel is very clean with nice size rooms for NYC standards. Location was perfect for visiting Times Square, Macy's and other attractions. Roof top bar is great as well. Will return on my next visit.

Great hotel. Very clean and friendly staff. But, there is a rooftop bar that is very loud. Do not stay on the 22nd floor. They did move me to lower floor, but it took several phone calls. Close to the 1 subway.

I stayed here for only one night to catch up with friends in NYC. My partner has stayed here before and has never had cause to complain. The location is fantastic and the hotel itself is great. The room was a little small but to be honest Ive never really managed to find a hotel room in NYC much bigger unless one was going to shell out a fortune. The staff were very friendly, the service in the bar and rooftop bar were attentive and professional.On our departure the bellboy was a delight. He could not have done more. A delightful end to a very pleasant visit.

I booked a room on the high up floor and had a great view of the Empire State Building. The room was very clean, the bed and sheets comfy and I loved the modern decor. The front desk staff was very friendly and even hand out umbrellas when it rains. The location is also great however there are a few issues.1) The rooftop bar is very loud. I was on the 21st floor and could hear people cheering and music thumping until 1am. Needless to say I didnt go to sleep until after 1am and I had to be up early the next morning.2) No ice on the floors. I found that very odd.3) Closet space very very tiny only enough space and hangers for 1 person.4) No bathrobes.All in all its a nice hotel with just a few issues the roof top bar being the worst. I would stay again but would request a floor a few lower than the one I had.

This hotel is very well located to the underground stations and all the other famous attractions as Times Square and Empire State Building. But the room was a bit small, eventhough it was clean and neat. I found the whole experience with this hotel very average.

We've stayed at this hotel 5-6 times the last 2 years. Great location, very accomodating staff, nice rooms and good views. Our daughter is a student at F.I.T. and this hotel is very near the camplus making it the perfect location. We've thought about trying some other hotels in the area, but keep coming back. Very nice Rooftop Bar & Lounge Area.

Nice, clean Hotel in a good location. Friendly staff. I recommend you request a high floor facing the courtyard as the street side canbe noisey especially on a lower floor. Internet is slow. Breakfast food is poorly prepared.

Nice rooms, clean and ok size. Friendly staff and an ok restaurant. Didn't have the breakfast but dinner was ok, nothing special though. Very noisy a/c. In fact the a/c gave us trouble sleeping. Location is great though.

Great location. Comfortable stay. Close to all the main shopping label store and restaurants. This hotel had a cool rooftop bar. The only thing that was a flaw was the fact that we had to pay 15 dollars a day for the wifi which was per device so be warned.

I stayed here in Sept 2012 for two nights on business and while most of my meetings were downtown, the 28th St 1&2 subway is close by and made the commute relatively easy. The room was decent sized and the bathroom effecient - although be careful as the front desk initially had me on a low floor facing the fairly busy (and loud) street. The fitness center is suprisingly good although small with a decent range of equipment.

Had a king size bed on a high floor 21st to be exact rooms are close to the elevators noise can be bit annoying .nothing spectacular about the view preety obstructed due to high rise buildings around if your looking for a hotel just to crash this is perfect . Rooms don't have a mini cooler but you can request one from the front desk. The hotel mini bar is a bit pricey but what's not in new York enough of the gloom and doom the door mans are bloody brilliant Jose mosses are just the boom fun to chat with and always giving you good info . Front desk and house keeping are extremely friendly making my two days fun

Stayed in Sept 2012 as a couple for 6 days.First impressions, ok, nothing special, really small room, but being a Londoner I can't really complain as most standard hotel rooms are small.By the end of the holiday it didn't really matter because we were hardly ever in the hotel room, and when we were it was absolutely fine. Bed is comfortable, nice ipod dock, good sized bathroom with decent toiletries and good TV. I would say that the walls could be a bit more soundproof but that's it!Reception staff were helpful even though we checked out 1 hour late. Concierge aren't the most helpful people but we figured everything out.Was my first trip to New York and I loved it, this Hilton is a 10 minute walk from Times Square, next to convenient subways and generally a good area. The Rooftop bar is actually really nice, and the views are pretty cool. NY foodie places to try: Buddakan next to Chelsea Market, Gansewoort in Meatpacking district, Shake Shack on Lexington, Soy and Sake in Greenwhich Village.

Stayed here twice now...this time was equally as impressed. The hotel rooms are modern, clean and if you are good at the check in desk, they can give you a high floored room. We got a room on 22 and my parents on 18, the photo I have added is actually the view from our room on 22. The rooftop bar is pretty trendy and on the weekends does get busy. It opens at 4.30pm, so my tip if you are a tourist and not a local is go for a drink when it opens to see the great views of the Empire State without everyone else. 2 metro stations are within 15 minutes on 23rd and 28th. Far enough from Midtown so you are not greeted by Mcdonalds and lots of tourists..but lots of great bars are restaurants nearby....10 minutes from Chelsea, it's just great and Hilton is a name you can trust. 2 PC's in reception - free of charge, cash machine, printer, bar..the breakfasts are great too.

We chose this hotel because it was a Hilton and because of the location. This is real close to many things and Chelsea area is very nice. Friendly staff when we arrived and we were offered mini cupcakes at the desk! Room cards are chipped and they allow you to access your room floor in the elevator and your room door by simply holding it in front of the scanner. The room was small but it didn't matter. We are in New York City and won't be spending much time in the room anyway. Very clean and modern room. Large LCD TV (very small choice of channels), small automated drink and snack fridge, desk area, 3 drawers and a small closet. Comfy queen sized bed and very clean and functional bathroom. The staff is very friendly. The restaurant, "RARE" has a fantastic rooftop bar with an open atrium area and great view of the city. Breakfast buffet is standard fare in a very nicely decorated dining room. Another wonderful Hilton experience!

The Hilton is in a great location within walking distance of Penn Station, subway stops, lots of wonderful dining options and the sites of New York City. They always had snacks available. The breakfast buffet was excellent although they could use more fruit. The staff were wonderful and took an interest in making sure we were enjoying our stay. This is our second stay at this hotel and we will be back again I'm sure.

It was difficult to choose where to stay in Mahnattan... Evidently, this is a city where there are way too many choices, and for all tastes! But this Hotel had it all; prior mi stay: location and room rates; after my stay: those two, adding great staff and nice rooms, amazing Roof with great drinks and views. I would definitely stay here again when I come back to Manhattan and have recommend it already to all my friends and relatives. Totally worth it!

I struggle with the rates in NY but this hotel was a little lower than others nearbyThe rooms were clean nice but filled with typical NY noise from below and the a/cThe breakfast was great and the oatmeal the best I have had in a hotel; fresh, creamy and delightfully paired with fresh fruit

The hotel is new, clean and modern. The restaurant attached to the hotel "Rare" is an excellent place for a late night snack or a full meal (I had both). Try the french fry "appetizer". Delicious! The service was outstanding, from check in to check out. I will be staying here again.

My husband and I just spent three September nights at this hotel. In a nutshell: Our standard room with a queen bed was nothing special, but we found the service and location to be outstanding.Room experience. The first room reserved for us (18th floor) had an overpowering sewer smell in the bathroom. When I complained, we were able to move immediately to another standard room on the 17th floor that did not have this odor. Though our room overlooked the street, we were high enough to escape any traffic or pedestrian noise. Our small, but adequate, room had a comfortable bed, a nice flat-screen TV, a safe and a compact ironing board with iron. The bathroom had a shower (no tub) and no towel racks. There were shelves below the sink to store things but I found these impractical for wet towels. We found the A/C to be difficult to regulate and thus we were often too cold or too warm. The Housekeeping staff did a fine job on everything except the carpeting. Two small pieces of string and a thin layer of dust that edged the room's perimeter greeted us on arrival and still decorated the floor upon our departure. A bank of elevators stood outside our room. We only heard noise on one occasion -- a rowdy group got off an elevator at 2:30 one morning and awakened us. These elevators proved to be fast and efficient and our longest wait was about 1 minute. We appreciated the free USA Today newspaper that was delivered outside our room each morning. But we thought that wi-fi should also have been free. There is a $14.95 daily charge for wi-fi unless you have a certain standing with the Hilton Honors program. Myriad New York City hotels offer free wi-fi, so if this is important for you, go elsewhere.Service. This was exceptional. Check-in and check-out at the front desk went quickly and efficiently and someone always addressed inquiries/concerns in the same manner, along with a friendly, upbeat attitude. Everyone at the concierge desk during our stay also proved to be outstanding in their attitude and helpfulness. They gave really good information about transportation, places to eat, directions, etc.Location. This was excellent for our situation. We arrived at Newark airport and took the train to Penn Station. From there, it was a mere 10-minute walk to the hotel. I was interested in learning more about the Chelsey area so this was a perfect spot to be. It was an easy walk to Chelsea Market, the High Line and art galleries. There are many restaurants, cafes and breakfast places in the area and Macy's and Fifth Avenue shopping are also nearby. For those who aren't walkers, there are plenty of subway stops and buses around.
