For others interested in learning more about Chelsey, I would recommend the Big Onion tour of Chelsea and the High Line. It starts a few blocks from the hotel and allowed me to learn much more about the area than I would have wandering around on my own.

What an excellent experience!From the warm smiles of the doormen to genuinely friendly and helpful services ushered by Caroline, Zoribel and Kathy, I can not say enough great things about this Hotel! My family and I agree that from now on, this hotel will be our "maintain" when we visit NYC. Great service, great price that we got when we called directly, very clean, very safe, very chic! Oh and the mini cupcakes at the front desk and "good bye" goodie bag is truly an added touch!Hey, Alabama fans-- just FYI-- this hotel is 2 shops down from the "Alabama Bar", so you can catch your game-day action there or at the Hotel's rocking "Rare" steakhouse!! Yum!!Good job all! We will be back!!Southern smiles from Alabama

The hotel is nicely decorated, the king room on the 14th floor was small but very comfortable and despite the small bathroom, the ample storage beneath the sink provided perfect storage room for toiletries. The receptionists were pleasant as was the porter. But the wifi access, which is complimentary, is through an access code that changed a couple of times during our 5 day stay WITH NO NOTICE and the front desk was uninformed of the change, making access unpredictable. The housekeepers skipped clean-up of our room one day for no reason (but the front desk rectified it when we told them) and did not leave the complimentary bottles of water each day. Housekeeping neglected to refill toiletries, change our bedding or vacuum the room--@ 400/nt, not acceptable.

As indicated by the rating above, we gave this hotel a rating that is very good. Being a retired school adminisrator from the south, my greatest drawback is that the daily room rate is somewhat expensive, but what is not in NYC. All of the staff encountered were knowledgeable, courtesy, and provided service with a smile. In particlular, I would liike to commend front-desk attendant Martha V. She was all that I just mentioned for the staff overall and then some. Hire more Marthas...

Great location for a short stay, however, a little expensive side. Lots do within walking distance. The hotel itself is trendy, clean and modern. The rooms may appear to be small, but they are definitely comfortable. What I didnt like so much were thin the walls. I heard the TV, Radio, and talking of the guest next door. Overall, the front desk staff was very welcoming and friendly. I really enjoyed the energy of the lobby bar. Not a bad place for a nightcap after a night out. I would definitely stay here again.

I stayed in the Hotel for six nights from September 2 - 8, 2012 and my Hhonours number is 716237358. My initial experience on arrival by about 21.30pm with my two sons was very unwelcoming as the front officer, Mr Luidin and his Team insisted that my reservation was cancelled. He claimed that the hotel notified me via email a day earlier. When I challenged the claim, he printed an email by Mr Destreza to me by 13.29pm same day while I was on transit to the hotel. The email gave me only up to 16.00pm to respond or my reservation would be cancelled. He also claimed that my two visa cards were faulty and offered to take me and my sons to another hotel.It was when I put my foot down that we were going no other hotel that he offered us our room and asked us to pay $300 in cash to the hotel. This whole event took over an hour and was traumatic for me and my children who travelled over 6 hours by road from Boston to New York. All we needed was a room we rightly reserved to rest.However, the next day I brought the two Visa cards which Mr Luidin and his Team rejected and one of them (1526) was swiped by Ms Zoribel and was okay. Ms Zoribel too was nicer and listened to us. Her disposition was quite pleasant and welcoming. We had her to commend for turning around out stay in that Hotel.

We have stayed in this hotel twice in less than a month. The first morning I woke up with bites on my legs and stomach. My husband seemed to have nothing, but I was feasted on by something during the night. I was not outside at all that evening so it had to be something in the room. We were told there are no bed bugs at the hotel. The next morning I had more bites! But seeing as we were told they have a certificate of being bed bug free I thought it maybe was a few mosquitoes in the room and we were checking out so I left it at that. My husband stayed just last night and has a rash of bites all over his stomach. He did notify the manager and she said she would make an incident report but offered no further assistance or compensation. I also do not like that the rooftop lounge is closed to all under 21. It should be closed to the younger crowd after a certain time, say 8:30-9 pm. My 19 year old daughter would have enjoyed the view but was forced to wait in the lobby while we went up quick to check it out. Food in Rare is good. Mini bar in room insanely overpriced and no room to take back left overs from dinner. Location is good.
Elevator noise in room was terrible; wifi very expensive; business section very small; rooftop Bar very nice, but expensive.

Had a business trip to New York. This hotel was conveniently located for me from Penn Station and to my appointments in the city. Room was clean, teh air conditoning worked perfectly, the staff was helpful and I received a complimentary breakfast.

This is a great hotel. Location is good, rooms are spacious and attractive. Young energetic staff is eager to please. This is a relatively new Hilton with an upscale modern decor, similar to W, but with comfortable furniture. The Rare restaurant and rooftop bar provide great views of Midtown, including the Empire State Building.

Rather like another reviewer whose opinions I read a moment ago, I consider this hotel to be adequate. Our check-in experience was a drawn-out-affair, with them being unable to locate our reservation for some minutes. It may seem like nothing, but after a long journey, this simple clerical error was very ill-timed. On our first night, we decided to make use of the rooftop bar. The drinks were very expensive, but we drank whilst enjoying the view. That is, of course, until a drunken member of the public, who introduced himself to us by drunkenly and repeatedly "giving us the finger", possibly because we are a gay couple, intruded on our evening. He was being watched by the security staff but clearly they thought his behaviour to be acceptable, or at least, not bad enough to remove him from the premises. We then decided to leave the rooftop bar, and judging that to be the average standard of customer, did not return for the rest of our stay. It is a shame that the security staff's reaction to his behaviour prevented us from enjoying the rooftop bar, further. In a further encounter with security staff from the rooftop bar, a 40-something-chap with blond hair and an abrupt attitude very curtly told my partner and myself to vacate a lift he held, empty at ground level solely for use for the rooftop bar, with several groups of people waiting in the foyer area for the other lifts. His manner was abrupt, and his logic still escapes me.The lack of complimentary WiFi was annoying, and since we were staying for ten nights, we saw the daily charge of $14.95 as rather excessive, particularly when other Hilton hotels in the city, and every Starbucks, provide this, gratis. We made limited use of the two computers available in the foyer, though this area has little or no privacy when performing tasks such as internet banking - indeed, on one occasion, I was forced to ask a hotel member of staff to leave so that I might continue.On the plus side, the room was well appointed and clean. The air conditioning a little loud, but at least worked reliably during the hot spell which encompassed all of our stay. The hotel is a good base from which to join the subway, explore the city, and get to know NYC. But, and I say this as a frequent traveller - Hilton hotels, at one point, were about luxury and attention to detail. It's a shame that my abiding memory of this hotel, during this trip, is that it was normal, that is to say, nothing special, and that we came to treat it as the average room in which we slept, before leaving each morning to enjoy more of that amazing city. On balance of price and facilities, combined with the incidents detailed above, I'm afraid I cannot recommend this hotel.

We stayed one night on our way to a weekend in Boston. We selected this hotel because it was close to Penn Station as we were traveling by train. And to Eataly. Location is excellent !! We walked from Penn Station, and then we had lunch and dinner at Eataly ( yeah big fans!) . We walked to High Line Park and Chelsea Piers. Loved the location! The room was excellent! Clean and the Beds very comfortable. I loved the soap and all the bath products!!

We loved the service in this hotel, starting with the check-in staff at the front desk: extremely friendly and welcoming but efficient. We enjoyed the Fashion District /Garment Industry theme throughout the hotel. Our room, while small in size typical for New York City, was very well laid out to maximize space. We loved the view and the Keurig coffee machine and the mini bar for a ice cold diet coke.Joseph, our bartender at the Rare View rooftop bar was a hospitality superstar - friendly and helpful in recommending Eataly nearby. We had lunch at Rare in the bar on the lobby floor around 2 pm -- this was a MISS but the breakfast in RARE downstairs the next morning was terrific. We stayed one night prior to a cruise and found this Hilton a great location for exploring the High Line Park and surrounding neighborhoods. For pictures inside our room and around the hotel, see http://www.travelingwiththejones.com/2012/08/06/a-peek-inside-the-hilton-new-york-fashion-district-hotel/

I've stayed at quite a few Hilton properties in Manhattan, but this was the best experience as far as service goes that I've ever encountered. My check-in took less than 30 seconds, my room was clean, and little extras (like a high-floor room with a view of the Empire State Building!) made it way more than what was expected. When I go back to the Big Apple, it will be my first choice.

Stayed 2 days over Labor Day weekend. Room was small (normal for NYC), well appointed, clean, had a comfortable bed. The check-in was easy and the reception friendly. The elevators require a long wait sometimes, and require your key card to go to your floor. The problem: in the smallish elevators, if some else was standing near the buttons you couldn't reach in, and by the time you maneuver over, you've passed your floor. One evening an overdressed big haired young woman in the elevator demanded that we take another, because she was on the way to the top floor lounge and wanted an express ride. The lobby security supported her on this. Classy. We decided not to spend our money on a drink up there as a result. If she was the clientele it must be mainly a hangout for drunken businessmen who like her type.Location is reasonably quiet, not right in tourist central, but the #1 subway is only 2 blocks. Some nightclub activity in the area, but not much else goes on.The fitness room is an extra charge. The restaurant looked uninspired, so we didn't try it. No fridge, just a minibar. No extras, nothing special, just an adequate place to stay.

Perfect location for a first time trip to NYC. Right in the middle of Manhatten and walking distance to Times Square & Central Park (20mins). Rooftop bar was a nice experience. Not open on Mondays but opens from 5pm daily. My only critism would be to have wifi readily available, don't really expect hotels (as well known as Hilton) to charge extra for wifi. Get with the times man, it's free at Starbucks and other neighbouring businesses. Why not Hilton?

I was at this hotel in late August of 2012. My husband and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and polite. The only problem I had was for the amount of money spent on the hotel they did not have fitted sheets for the bed. So when you got in bed your feet were on the mattress. Yuck. I didn't even want to think about all the people who touched that mattress. :( Besides that room service was great. 2 blocks from the subway station and near several decently priced restaurants. The view from the rooftop grill is awesome! I reccommend to go up at night and see the views of the city. Would definitely stay here again!

We booked this hotel for a 2 night stay on a second trip to the city. First impressions count. For starters the hotel is not trendy at all - it has had a makeover but is not a truly boutique hotel experience.Secondly, when we arrived from a long flight we were greeted by a surly receptionist who had no manners whatsoever. Please and thank you were not in his vocabulary.You would think that paying over £1,000 for 2 rooms for two nights things like free wi fi throughout the hotel and in your room would come as standard but no. They cost extra. For a hotel that calls itself hi-end and fashionable this is totally ridiculous.One of our rooms had a missing remote control and both rooms were nothing to write home about - not fashionable at all.Air conditioning in the hotel is really noisy and kept us awake.In additon, avoid getting a taxi from this hotel - they tried to charge us 65 dollars for a fare to the airport (when the standard fare is 45 dollars). Finally, the rooftop bar has a great view but the decor is tacky and music is played out of tiny speakers by what looked like a children's entertainer. Not cool.The only thing we liked about this hotel was the fitness center but beware it is small and gets busy early. Be prepared to be there at 3am.We love New York but would not DREAM of staying in this hotel again.

My 10 year old daughter and I wanted a project runway inspired mother-daughter trip to New York, but we were not in a position to break the bank. Everything was walking distance: Bryant park, Time Sqaure, the Empire state building, MOMA, even the New York public library! I was most impressed with the concierges. My daughter had her list and they patiently helped her plan out her day - each day including important directions to stay safe. Thank-you for making a girl's dream trip to the big city - a big experience.

I stayed for one night in August 2012, by myself, for leisure. Overall, I am happy and consider coming back, especially if I stay by myself. Below are more details:Pros:(1) decently priced. It was cheaper than Hilton in the Times Square, or New York Hilton. One of the more reasonably priced four-star hotels around Penn station.(2) Close to Penn station (34th and 7th). The hotel is located at 26th and 7th, so it is 8 blocks walk. It's not much. It takes about 10-15min.(3) Less touristic or more quiet than the Times square Hilton or New York Hilton. Several coffee shops and many good bars near by. Not as crazily touristic as those around the Time square.(4) Clean. I read (might be wrong) that it's relatively new. And the interior has a bit of hip (boutique hotel) flavor. Something like (a bit cheap version of) W hotels.(5) People at the hotel were nice, cool and efficient. It helps that it's a relatively smaller hotel so there's no crazy check-out line.Cons(1) The room is small. But it is typical NYC size. So it's not really a cons.(2) There is a rooftop bar. I was expecting a cool, quiet bar with a nice view, but it was noisy (DJ was playing (college) party music), and the decoration/furniture is not really good-taste. Naturally, the people at the bar was not really cool. My friend and I were disappointed and left without ordering anything. Especially since the hotel is sort of cool, and the hotel bar on the ground floor is also cool, I was expecting something nice, but totally betrayed...(3) It's probably not a cons either, but the hotel is sandwiched by two buildings, so there is no view from the hotel. I have to use the curtain not to be seen by people in rooms on the neighboring building. But I guess it's also typical in NYC.

This was our 3rd trip to NYC. I wasn't crazy about the location but all we were really looking for was clean and safe hotel. I wasn't crazy about the location, it seemed like everything was a long walk away. The staff was very friendly. The rooms were small but then again it is New York City. I would stay here again.

clean,friendly staff and well maintained.we stayed two nights.we ate at rare and the burgers were outrageous! on the top of the hotel is rare view which has great views day or nite and is a cool place to hang out. ask for breakfast vouchers when you book food was good but price for breakfast .easy walk to the empire state building,times square,eataly and chelsea market.we will defiantly go back.

My family and I visit NY often and usually stay at the Hilton uptown on 6th Avenue but we decided upon the Fashion District Hilton because we were moving our daughter into college nearby. The location of this hotel is ideal. We could walk to Times Square and 5th Avenue and the Chelsea neighborhood offers wonderful places to shop and eat. The hotel staff, especailly the bell men, were wonderful and accommodating and that made the moving of our daughter into her dorm rom that much easier. The rooms were spacious by NYC standards and each had an in room safe to store our valuables. The hotel also features a great roof top bar with magnificant city views.We had a 2 night stay boked a this hotel and, on the first night, the AC was not working properly in our room. I called the front desk and was told that the hotel did not have an availible room for that night, but I would be moved for my second night stay and that the rate of my room for the first night would be reduced 50%. i did not ask for any type of rate reduction and I was very pleased that the hotel offerred this without any prompting on my part. The next day, the hotel moved all of our luggage while we were at our daughters college so, when we came back after a long day, we were able to go directly into a nice, new room.My wife and I wil be coming to NYC often to visit our daughter and will now be staying at the Hilton Fashion District as our new hotel of choice.

This hotel is in a perfect location for a New York stay - especially if you are a young traveller who wants to enjoy the nightlife of the Meatpacking district but stay close enough to the rest of the action.Close to the subway (however we always caught taxi's) It is a 15min walk to times square. The hotel staff were polite and checked us in without a fuss. It was nothing exceptional but nothing to complain about either. The room was spacious enough but a little dated. Not mouldy or smelly though as they definitely take care of cleaning the rooms. No noise in this part of the city, so sleep was great!The rooftop bar is worth going up to for a great view of Manhattan and some wonderful cocktails before a big night out. The hotel was attentive with providing us a service to the airport on departure and the door staff are always there and available to assist.Good value for a New York hotel, clean, and in a very safe area. I would happily return here.

I stay here frequently and love the location. Easy access to the trains, friendly staff and clean rooms. My only complaint would be the elevators. After 5pm they reserve one for the rooftop bar leaving guests with only two. On any given evening be prepared to wait five minutes or more for one especially if you're on a higher floor. Otherwise a great hotel.

The staff was very friendly & polite. Very accommodating with any questions. Only downside was left an article on nightstand that was not there once room was cleaned. It was not something that I could put a value on but was with me for years when I travelled. Staff looked for it to no avail & I was called & told after check out that it was not found. I was told they were sorry.

This was more like a 3.5 rating, but since I don't have that option I bumped it up rather than down. Overall my stay was pleasant and I liked some of the personal touches I received as a HH gold member. My first gripe so to speak was with the check in process. I arrived before the stated check in time and there weren't any rooms available - understandable. I was told I would receive a call when my room was available. Call never happened. I had to follow up in order to know when was a good time to return to take my luggage up to my room. There were a few other issues too - all tied to lack of communication. I found out by chance that because I booked half my staff with reward points and other half paid, that I would need to come down at 12 noon on the change over day to get my card refreshed to be able to enter my room again. Also, I had to ask about my breakfast coupons. For some reason my room didn't have any washcloths. I called down to the front desk and received a couple, but same problem continued throughout my stay. On the positive side, I did appreciate some of the personal touches acknowledging my visit. The property was well kept and I liked my room. The location worked for me. I requested a room that was away from the front of the building and was not close to the rooftop bar. I did venture up to the bar for a little bit, but since I don't drink I didn't stay long. The view and breeze were nice. For the most part staff was friendly. I did encounter a bell hop that seemed disinterested in helping me, but really everyone else overshadowed that experience because they were nice and accommodating. I do recommend this property, but you definitely have to make sure you are on top of your stay.

I spent 1 night at Hilton NY Fashion District, I was in room 2209, at the very last floor(22nd) with an incredible view of the Empire State which was so close that it seemed i could touch it. I loved the staff, everybody is very polite and efficient. The hotel is super clean and everything was absolutely amazing! I hope I come back soon...obviously again with my bff ! excellent

This hotel is new, modern, has nice clean rooms and a very nice rooftop bar. The location is great if you want to see NYC (far enough from Times Square to avoid the crowds - still conveniently located close to subway stops). Price was decent compared to other hotels in NYC. They have a nice workout room. We asked for a room with view of the ESB, and they fixed that without any problem. Generally, we experienced the service to be very good. Check-in and check-out went swift.A major drawback is that there are far to few elevators, and after 5pm they reserve one of them solely to the guests of the rooftop bar (even though many of them weren´t hotel guests). How is this possible in an otherwise so modern hotel?? Also, complimentary water bottles should be included in the room of a four-star hotel..If you are arriving at JFK and don´t have too much luggage, a good option for swift and cheap transport is to take the train/subway to Penn station and a cab from there.

Needed a conveniently located and affordable ($500 total) home base for two days while getting my daughter settled in at college. Short walk from Penn Station. Good restaurants nearby. Easy walk to Union Sq and other attractions. Best of all, excellent clean room nicely appointed and quiet(by NYC standards) location on side street. Taxis plentiful right out front. Also offered rooftop lounge....didn't get to try it but judging by the line to go up there, must be a happening spot.

Hotel is at a best location. walking distance from times square and Penn station. We took high rise room on 14th floor and it was quiet and full of natural light in the day time. amenities are good in the room though smoke alarm troubled us at the beginning. they took care of it fast enough and also let us have early check in without extra charges. out stay was nice and peaceful.

I highly recommend this hotel if you want to be in a great spot on the west side. Walking distance to Chelsea market & meat packing district, the high line and union square. Rooms are small if more than 2 are staying

The hotel's pluses are a great location, great rooftop bar, and nice rooms. Service, however, is strange, or maybe we were unlucky and everything started breaking down when we came. Upon arrival they wanted to charge us for the internet and breakfast that were both included in the rate we paid for. Ok - they fixed that when we complained. The room was perfect until the moment we realized the airconditioning didn't work (an important feature in NY in August) - the next day we moved to another room with an ac that worked (albeit loud). The next was the elevator. One of the three elevators suddenly died (it was acting funny the day before it finally said bye). At the same time, the hotel uses one of the three elevators to carry people to the rooftop bar only (?!). Consequently, we were down to 1 elevator. Finally, I wanted to do the check out (pay) the evening before we left (this time I decided to do that), and was shut down by the lady at the reception desk who didn't want to do it because it would be better for them if I paid in the morning. All in all, a nice place to visit, conveniently located, but they could do something about the service. The level is way below the usual Hilton level.

The service is fair. Location is great! Room condition ample for business travel. Check-in and Check-out were ultra efficient.Great access to restaurants near by and cabs are not too hard to find in the area.The service, however, have room to improve : such as sending plug adapter to the room took more than 15 min; and there were no one to help me with my luggage when i stepped off the taxi). Bottle waters in the room would be great, there were none.I would give it 3.5 stars instead of a 3 if i can...

This was my first visit to New York and this hotel was very nice! The rooms were small but clean. The staff was very friendly and professional, the food was great and the location was great to the events I had to attend. The only thing I would change for this hotel would be a larger closet and a larger ironing board! The only thing missed by the staff was my complimentary internet service - even though I logged in with my special code, I was still charged the fee. Didn't notice until I got home that the charge was on my bill. I would definitely go back to this hotel and would recommend it to others!

I have been in this hotel for a night in August 2012 and I really enjoyed it.I asked for a high floor room and they gave me a last floor room with an unbelievable view on midtown and on the Empire State. The room was very clean and comfortable, the personnel of the hotel was very helpful and kind. The neighborhood are safe and full of bars and restaurants.I definitely recommend it for a nice staying in the city.

I took a lot of time searching for a hotel in NYC because I wanted to be fairly close to the High Line, and was looking for a modern hotel that is not too noisy. This Hilton is in walking distance to the High Line and Chelsea Market, one of the few plusses for me. My first room was on one of the upper floors overlooking 26th street. As other guests have commented, the street noise was very annoying especially in the middle of the night when garbage trucks were rumbling through it, or standing with engines idling. I did ask to change rooms and was given one. Both rooms were very small, the décor non descript modern but the rooms clean. I did go up to the (small) rooftop bar, and enjoyed the views over Manhattan, and mercifully, the party noise did not carry into the rooms below. But all in all, this hotel was too expensive for what it offered, the service being merely OK and far from exceptional. Also, in a supposedly 4star hotel I expected to have proper cups or mugs for tea/coffee rather than the standard take away containers. This might be a small point but it is one of those things that separates an ordinary hotel from a superior one. I ended up buying a mug! I won't stay there again as I felt I did not get my money's worth.

If you are a Hilton Honors member with any status, and you're looking for a Hilton, this isn't it. Pros:The hotel is well situated 5 blocks from Penn Station. The elevators are fast. The staff is pleasant. The shower had no flow restrictor. The rooms are new and clean.Cons:The room are small, you can't sit at the desk and see the TV. The blinds are pain to work. The staff missed a wake up call. The hanging wardrobe isn't big enough to hold anything. There is no closet in my room. The ironing board is a toy.The lobby is really small and quickly crowded. They have a bar at the top floor (no noise issues) and they tie up one of the three elevators for the bar, leaving you to wait a minute or two longer for an elevator in the eveningThe elevator needs an insensitive RFID swipe from your room key to get up. If you're not quick enough and traveling with others you miss your floor. You see all sorts of people on wrong floors because of this feature. You can't get to the lobby without a swipe, which would seem to be a safety issue.There is no concierge floor. There is no hospitality room. Why am I staying at a Hilton then?The breakfast buffet in the dining room looks like Hampton Inn buffet. None of the extensive fruits, pastries and berries usually found in a Hilton. The elevator cables rattle. It isn't loud but it is enough to be upsetting. My "Gold" profile said away from elevators, so they stuck me right next to one. The refrigerator in the room is completely packed with expensive vending items. You don't even get a fridge.The other Hiltons in NYC are much nicer and much dearer.

I stayed here because of the price. The room rate was about $100 less than other Hilton's in the midtown area . I found out why. The rooms are smaller than the other Hilton's in manhattan and it is off the beaten track relative to the other Hilton's. This may be because this hotel was another brand (wyndham I think) before converting to a Hilton. Despite the smaller size room which was furnished in trendy Modern (not to my taste) decor my biggest issue was street noise. I was on the 5th floor overlooking the front entrance and everytime a garbage truck went by I could clearly hear the loud diesel engine. It seemed like a dozen garbage trucks passed the hotel between five and six am in the morning. I mentioned something to management but they just replyed they did not have another room. I got the impression that they get the noise complaint alot. As a Hilton Diamond member I expected more. The hotel food is very good and reasonable for a manhatten hotel. I would not stay here again because of the street noise.

Stayed for seven nights in January 2012.I had contacted the then Guest Services Manager, Elle, who exceeded all of my expectations in the excellent and friendly service she provided from the outset.We were given the room that was promised on level 20 with a great view of the city. Room was not huge but well designed and furnished.Housekeeping were fantastic, the room was always spotlessly clean on our return in the evenings.Staff at checking were lovely and professional.Breakfast was also very good ( included as a HH Gold).Staff were super friendly and very efficient, food was pretty good too.Didn't get to the rooftop bar, but I did go many times to the bar on street level.We had many cocktails made by the barman from Bangladesh ( sorry I forgot his name) great man , great service, and great cocktails.Hotel is in a great location, and would highly recommend it to everyone as it is so well positioned , has such friendly staff, great food and beverage facility and functional, clean rooms.

Our first visit of NYC and we were amazed by everything! My wife and I stayed there 7 days at the beginning of January 2012. the hotel is located on a very good location in the Chelsea neighborhood, close to two subway stations. Also the Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Port Authority etc. are on walking distance. There are lot of diners and restaurants around the hotel too, so we did not have breakfast at the hotel. The rooms are not small (everybody says that rooms in NYC hotels are small), very clean, comfortable and perfectly designed with very comfortable beds. From our point of view they are like in 4* hotel in Europe. The bathroom is also nice designed and clean. We loved the fluffy towels. Our room was on a higher floor, so we also had a perfect view of the Empire State Building. Nice! The personnel is kind and helpful, ready to assist you in every moment. In other words amazing place, great location and value. We would definitely love to return to the place!

every thing is great , well and we really immpress, but little expensive .ideal for business trips and exclusive stay. it is a very close to chelsea , roof top bar is good.good hamburger steak. rooms was very clean and extremelly comfortable.
user_name:
blyork
New York City, New York

review_body: If you travel to New York, you should know the hotel rooms are small and the expense on hotels will be high. However, if you don't know which hotel should be choosen, pls do choose Hilton Fashion District. It is the hotel provide you amazoning experience!First, I plan to stay in this hotel for only 1 night because I arrived new york from Boston with Megabus late in the night, and the hotel is near the Penn Station. When I arrived the hotel, I found it is new and very fashion and the room are larger than those in Sheraton. It keeps the tradition of Hilton, very comfortable room.I was provided a HHornor breakfast, that made me suprise, because it was not a continental breakfast or a club breakfast, it was a menu! I choose a steak burger, it was well cooked with perfect steak. I check the menu for fee and found the resturant was reasonable priced, that suprised me!Suddendly I found I should stayed in New York for more days. Then I cancel the travel to DC and extend my stay in New York.The hotel is in good location, and almost steps to most famous places. When I back in the evening, I found the staff kindly gave me a bottle of wine to thank me for the extending of my stay.How wonderful!If you travel to New york, remember, this hotel is your first choice, kindly staffs, nice room, nice food, nice location, and don't be surprise, it is also have a reasonable price!

Very nice hotel. Almost felt more like a boutique hotel than a regular Hilton. The key cards are rfid instead of magnetic strip so no worries of de-magnetized cards. Thought that was cool and modern.The room was extremely comfortable. Decorated nicely and the bathroom was very nice with motion sensor lights. I also liked that they put a Keurig coffee maker in the room. This is way more useful that a regular coffee pot or other single cup makers.Breakfast in the restaurant was very high quality. I opted to order eggs benedict instead of the buffet and the eggs were poached perfectly. You could tell they were poached the way an expert chef would do it and not in some egg poacher.Location of the hotel was central to everything. A 15 min walk to most major areas of Manhattan and a block or two away from the subway.I definitely will be back to this hotel.

Paid $259/night and had a great experience and value. Clean, comfortable rooms. The ones away from 26th street are a bit smaller but much quieter. Service is very friendly, kind and excellent. Has a nice lobby bar adjacent to a good hamburger/steak restaurant that is not overly expensive and a fun rooftop bar with a DJ on some nights. The location is adjacent to Chelsea, so you can walk there, to the Hi Line or Macy's Herald Sq. A central location all in all, a nice boutiquey vibe and a great value

The hotel is located in a premium location. Walking distance to most of attractions and main subway lines. I had to travel to NJ, and I took the path three blocks away from the hotel. It is very close to Chelsea and its local and cool bars. The service of the hotel is great. Suites are new and the rooftop bar has a breathtaking view. I would fully recommend this hotel to anyone going to NJ for a visit or business travel. I would go back any time.

Had a great 10day stay. Professional staff, awesome location, nice amenities, new hotel! Decent size rooms & scenic rooftop bar. Much thanks to Eliecer, the General Manager who addressed my concerns.The hotel is within a 2 block distance of two major subway lines (ACE & 1). I was initially in room 606 which had a good view of the front street 26th st, but due to trash trucks and light night traffic I asked to be moved to a back room. In room 1115, things were pretty much perfect. No street noise!

2nd stay at this property. OVERWHELMED by customer service and a great location. It has a great cozy, boutique feel to it. The rooms are NOT huge, but they are comfortable with a great bed and good bathroom. Nice Keurig coffee pot (complimentary) and we had an amazing view from 19th floor, plus no street noise. At night, the city was lit up and we had a view of the Empire State Bldg and 1/2 of the town. Ordered their signature RARE burgers; very good quality and smiling room service attendant. This property didnt miss a beat regarding customer service. The location is between 6th and 7th with a short and interesting walk to 5th Ave. We found a weekend flea market (sorta) on the way and scored some beautiful African beads on Saturday morning on the way to Eataly (my new fav spot). Just a few blocks to Herald Square and all kinds of shopping and then on to Times Square to people watch with again, a short cab ride back. The Front Desk reps were helpful, smiling and called 2-3x to make sure we were happy and comfortable(could be due to HiltonHonors status, but whatever the reason it was welcome) We scored a $127/night rate (planned ahead). Didnt have breakfast there, but went to Malibu Diner on 23rd for a huge omelette for only 8.50 including coffee, juice, potatoes.yum

Great location, only 6 blocks from Penn Station and well situated for exploring Chelsea and Meat Packing as well as Kips Bay across town. Very clean with very comfortable beds. The Poor service rating is due to having to call the front desk every time you need ice and at least one elevator being out of service the whole weekend; the elevator card system was also quite annoying. But overall still highly recommended - would stay there again.

Had a great 11 day stay at this place. Awesome staff, great location, would highly recommend staying here. The only minor cons were the lifts are slow and there are no views, but the positives far out weigh this. Suggest going to the roof top bar which is very relaxed despite the impression it gives from the lobby, a nice place to chill out with the view and they give a 10% discount for the hotel restaurant after visiting the bar.

We stayed at this place last week and we pretty much enjoyed our stay. The room was spacious and the shower was great (very good water pressure). The bed was very comfortable as well. The only annoying part was the elevator. The card system does not work very well so I suggest they change this method of getting to the rooms. Overall, a nice hotel.

I travel a lot and I must say that this hotel was a HUGE disappointment to me. I just do not get the decent reviews. Here's my experience:PROS: Good shower, comfortable bed, and a keurig for coffee...CONS: Rooms: the rooms are seriously the size of a postage stamp...tiny for NY standards even...the closet is about 18 inches wide, no lie, bathrooms are also small with no tub, our view was of a ugly wall with traffic noise below. Those who were lucky enough to get a higher floor may have had a better experience...good luck getting one.Service: Horrible at best. We called ahead to reserve a "higher floor with king bed" and were told that that would be taken care of. Upon arrival there were none available and we arrived at 12:30 willing to wait!! We asked front desk to please move us to a larger room...no can do, so sorry. The concierge was lacking in providing helpful information. I could figure out my answers better than she could.Location: I did not like this area...it is not really near anything so you have to know the subway system well enough to get around or taxi anywhere you go unless you want to walk 1-2 miles. Subway is a couple blocks which is not bad. Lobby: Tiny! You walk into hotel greeted with a line out the door of people waiting for an elevator to get to the rooftop bar. Elevators are slow and HOT! Hallways are dark and narrow.Pool: What pool? No pool. NOT FOR KIDS!: no pool, can't go to rooftop bar with your kid unless he/she is 21, rooms are too small...there is no extra space.Wifi: no wifi...unless you want to pay a small fortune for it during your stay. They have it in the lobby...ha!...there is no room to move in the lobby.Bottom line is I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone and will never stay here again.

Overall was a very good experience, but could have been better! I was very surprised when we arrived at 9am that the room was ready for check in. I also like how fast it was to check in, so I could get right to the Broadway District to purchase tickets for a show that night. Also, one night me and my girlfriends came in late, and were starving; all of the food place in NYC close early (11pm-12am), but the front desk helped us with a takeout menu. Watch out for the Concierge Service! It’s a rip-off, and they lie to you! This would be the downfall of the hotel. I feel taken advantage of and lied to. I was sold a CitySights NY tour, which I was told would be the best way to see SOHO, Little Italy, Chinatown, Statue of Liberty, and Ground Zero. You are much better taking the subway and doing your own thing. In addition, Concierge Service is a third party company and has nothing to do with the hotel. Therefore when you are angry management does nothing, and say oh they are an outside company. Well I think that you could have done something more than Complementary Breakfast that cost under $ 40 for three people. Brandon the Bell Boy, WOW!!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!! Brandon is the best employee this hotel has! I only wish that we would have met him a pond arrival and not our departure. He took are bags and put them into storage for us, and booked us a very nice SUV for only $65 with tip. He told us to have fun and safe travel home because he would not be there when we retuned at 6pm for our bags and car ride back to JFK. However, to our surprise he was still there and very patient as we had to get stuff into other bags. Finally before our departure from the Hilton, he said can I get a group picture for you ladies, very professional and a pleasure.  I would like to add that I know hospitality as I do work for The Walt Disney World Company in Orlando, FL. I know that a company can do more for you than the manager who was on duty Saturday evening, she just choose not to and blew me off. I think that shows a lack of respect for me the guest.

Staying at this hotel was such a great experience. The room was comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and helpfull. Without a doubt I would stay here again.The location is excellent, couple of blocks to the subway, the neighborhood is beautiful and there are many restaurants to choose from. If you enjoy walking, you can walk to the Meatpacking District. Don't miss The Chelsea Market!!!

Over all good experience. But when you stay there for 5 nights you learn a few things.No ice machines on any floors...Just call room service...shortest amount of time it took them was 25 minutes. then you got to tip as well. elevators were is sore shape..seems like only one was working at most times. Was close to elevators and very loud. Clean room. location is good.

We were very pleased with this Hotel on our vacation in NYC. The rooms were clean the staff was very pleasant and helpful The location is great - couple of blocks to the subway and many places to eat all around. We didn't get to the Rooftop on site because we were out doing a lot of sight seeing all day long so just stopped whenever we felt the need to eat. The only thing was that the rooms were small so we had a hard time adjusting the AC and it was very hot during our stay. But that is minor next to all the positives this Hotel has to offer. I would stay here again and the price is good for NYC

To find a good hotel for under 200 dollars a night in NYC is a challenge, to find a Hilton for one is a minor miracle.I was a little concerned based on some of the reviews, then I realized the majority of the reviews cried more about room size (Its New York for goodness sake?) and internet fees (googling the hotel would have solved that) then anything actually important I felt a lot better booking it. We arrived the first day of fashion week around noon. Needless to say our room was not ready. However the front desk was stellar in assuring our bags were tagged and stored while standing there and gave us a very solid mini-tour on the map of what was around the hotel. The lobby is pretty small, but its New York so its not unexpected. The only time this became a problem was during check out when we wanted to store our bags and it was packed with people. The hotel has an amazing rooftop bar (The Rare view) and has a pretty good trendy burger place in the lobby which we really enjoyed. The location is great because its not that busy (for Manhattan) and getting a cab proved very easy as they were always available out front. Its also a short walk to two subway stations and a few stops from Times Square and Herald Square.We got our room just before 2PM, and it was what I had hoped. Clean, Soft Bed, and Trendy Decor.The room sizes are smaller then your standard Hilton, but short of staying at the Hilton Club or Hilton Times Square that is a reality of staying in Manhattan. I found the service to be excellent, the food was good, and the location was pretty impressive. This hotel has rapidly become one of the best values in the city.

We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. We got a killer deal staying on a Sunday night ($129) so we didn't expect much. To our surprise this is one of the nicest hotels we've stayed at in the City. Excellent location, friendly staff. We would definitely book again

Cool sleek vibe in a small lobby.Small updated rooms.Average experience. Caution-#1508 is across from the elevators & you hear them. Left my room for a couple of hrs in the a.m. & when I returned the bed was stripped before checkout. The front desk was useless about the situation. Lastly, the previous occupant's mouthwash was left in the shower. Makes me wonder how thorough housekeeping really is when turning over a room.

The hotel may not be a full fledge ***** Hilton, but rooms offers everything you need - great bed, flat screen TV, excellent shower. There is a roof top bar as well as restaurant by the lobby.The main reason for staying here is the excellent location for a good price.One and two blocks from the subway stops, three blocks from the Italian food emprium, Eataly, and three blocks from the High Line Park. The location on the border of the Chelsea district, you also have plenty of great restaurant options like Hill Country BBQ Market.

We stayed at this hotel for a few nights for my birthday and it was a awesome stay. Nice clean contemporary hotel with a restaurant and a rooftop bar. The hotel staff was very friendly and we checked in quickly. Its close enough to everything that you can walk to or quickly take public transportation. The room we stayed in had a good view of the Empire State Building. There is a small safe in the closet, it has enough room to fit a regular size laptop. There is a mini bar fridge but don't take anything out unless you plan to purchase. A bottle of Evian water cost around $4-5. Didn't get a chance to eat at the Rare Bar and Restaurant but we went to the rooftop bar which was very nice and again had a really great view of the Empire State Building. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel!

What makes a hotel different? Better than just another regular boxed shape room? Surely it's the staff, the decor, the little things. There's a buzz about this hotel. It's just a bit different and better than average. So, i don't agree when people say average hotel. I stay in Hilton's all over the world and this is trendy. It's a bit like a W Hotel. Close to a Whole Foods Store and subway nearby. RARE rooftop bar and restaurant are excellent. I have stayed here many times and continue to come back. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

I booked this hotel due to its location and trendy environment for my sister-in-law's bachelorette celebration. A day before our check-in, I woke up to an email about my reservation cancellation due to an invalid credit card. Once I got in touch with them and explained I had paid in full earlier in the year, they were very accomodating. When I checked in, I learned I had been upgraded to a higher floor and provided complimentary champagne. Even more, they decorated our hotel room in honor of my sister-in-law's bachelorette weekend. They made us feel very welcome and special, and the staff was very attentive of our many needs/demands.
user_name:
Nisha5312
New York City, New York

review_body: That pretty much sums up our experience there. We stayed at this hotel a few months back, 2 weeks ago, and we will be checking in again today. But since I have to write a minimum of 200 characters, I will continue. I can say that we have had good experiences with this property. The hotel was perfectly located for our needs (my husband needed midtown). The room each time was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The only rub I have is with the noise from the elevator. If you are a light sleeper, or need to ensure a full night's rest, request a room away from the elevator bank. The rooftop bar/restaurant is open late and there isn't much sound-proofing in those elevator shafts. And if there is a "lively" crowd up there, you will hear their comings and goings. (They sounded like they were having a blast, I'm bummed I had an early meeting the next day or I would've joined them.)Overall, we would stay again. Like I said, checking in again today.

The hotel itself isn't much to write about. It is your average hotel with few amenities to take advantage of. The room is small, and has limited space to put your suitcases - which is the usual for any Manhattan hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the white sheets were clean. The hotel has a rooftop patio, which has a nice view of the city, however it gets quite busy on Friday and Saturday nights so you might want to get there early. They have a "business center" which is 2 computers in a side nook next to the front desk and it is free to use, and free to print. Wifi is available in your room for an added cost. The main plus about this hotel is the location. The location is fantastic and you are within walking distance to a couple different subway lines which was nice. A direct walk up 7th Avenue puts you at Times Square. You're close to Penn station and the shops on 34th as well as Union Square. I would stay at this hotel again, but I would probably shop around first to see if i could get a better deal.

My husband stayed here during the week of July 4, 2012. We are Hilton HHonors members and try to stay at Hilton hotels whenever we travel. Two of the best things about this hotel was the location and the rate. The rates were competitive and we got a great value. Being just off 7th Ave., we were only 2-3 blocks from a subway stop along the 1 line; that took us pretty much wherever we needed to go. We were also reasonably close to the Hudson River Greenway, which was great for a morning run. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was excellent and the roof-top bar was great fun! Definitely get a drink there to appreciate the NYC skyline. It's not a very tall building, but the roof has nice views of the Empire State Building and Downtown. There was no ice machine, so we were able to request complimentary ice from room service whenever we wanted it. One time they ran out of ice buckets and had to deliver our ice in a bag, but that wasn't really an issue. We only had 2 small issues while staying here. First, our check-in was a little messy...we were given keys to a room that had not yet been cleaned and promptly called the front desk. Then, we were escorted to a new room--which had also not yet been cleaned. Finally we were shown to a 3rd room that was perfect. It was just a small hiccup, but I've never had that happen before. The only other issue was with washcloths. We only received washcloths on 2 days of our week-long trip. Every other day we had to request them, even after I left a note for housekeeping. I'm not sure what the problem was, but housekeeping always brought them to us fairly quickly. It was kind of a nuisance, but overall not a big deal.The fitness room was small, but at least it was something. There were 2 treadmills, an ARC trainer, and a stationary bike. There were numerous free weights and a couple of weight machines, bench press, etc. I would definitely stay here again. The room was clean, the concierge was helpful, and the location superb.

Very good location very professional staff, helpful & welcoming. Room size was very suitable, and extremely clean. Lovely lobby...the location of this hotel is its best feature. It’s on W. 26th between 6th and 7th. You’re a short walk to shopping on 34th, about a 15 minute walk to Union Square, there are several subway stops nearby, and lots of good restaurants.Will stay again.
user_name:
aristoninsurance
New York City, New York

review_body: After many bad experiences with hotel on Manhattan, Hilton Fashion District was a great exception. The hotel is very stylish and the location is great for seeing the city. Rooms are small (typical for NY hotels), but very comfortable and clean. I would definately stay here again.

I'll definitely stay here again. There were four of us in the room, so it was a bit crowded, but any minor inconvenience caused by the "Manhattan size" of the accomodations was easily overcome by the friendly, informative staff. The room was extremely clean and an excellent value. Rare Bar and Grill offers a wide variety of salads/burgers/steaks, which is especially nice for families, and I expected to spend a lot more $ for an excellent meal. The rooftop bar offers a great view of Uptown and Downtown, depending which side of the building you look out from, and it offers a very relaxed setting with large chairs and couchs for pre-dinner cocktails.The staff, from those at the front desk to the concierge, cleaners, waitresses and at the bar, all seemed genuinely interested in making the stay enjoyable. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

I stayed two nights at the Hilton Fashion District while spending the weekend in New York. We arrived around lunchtime and the front desk had a room available but gave us the option of waiting a little while we could have an “upgraded room with a view of the Empire State Building.” I’ve seen the Empire State Building more than I need to but I decided to wait for a better room. The bell stand held our bags while we were getting lunch at Eataly. We returned a few hours later and checked in. The room key cards don’t need to be inserted into a slot to open the door, just waived in front of a key pad. That was convenient for entering the room. I didn’t need to get the card out of my wallet to open my room door. The room was clean but real small…though probably typical by New York standards. The bed was comfortable, sheets were clean. As for the view, well I could see the top of the ESB if I bent down to look but most of the window was filled with the drab building across the street. If this is an upgrade, the standard rooms are nothing to get excited about. The shower was all tile with glass doors which leaked all over the floor, even during a short shower, leaving the bathmat a soggy mess.Breakfast was included with our room. It was served in the restaurant on the first floor which is called Rare. For Hilton Honors Gold and Diamond, there’s a choice between a buffet or a pre fixe menu which included a choice of eggs, French toast, or pancakes, a side of bacon or sausage, toast or cereal and a few other items. We were also served a good sized fruit bowl that was really good. Having a choice to order from menu or buffet was nice, not all Hiltons offer that. I had the buffet one morning which was pretty standard for a Hilton (breads, cereal, scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon, yogurt). The next morning I had over-easy eggs that were good as well. Juice and coffee or tea included. Service was good both days.The hotel doesn’t have ice machines available. We asked where they were and were told “this is a full service hotel. Just call room service and they will bring you a bucket of ice.” What they didn’t tell us was that there was a $3 delivery charge! Plus you’ve got to tip the guy who brings it, so you’re paying $4-5 for a bucket of ice. That’s irritating. There’s a Duane Reade right down the street which sells ice for only $2. Pick up one there if you really need it. There are three elevators, but one seems to be reserved for the rooftop bar. Either that or it just wasn’t working while we were there. We waited for a while for an elevator several times when we were trying to leave. The location of this hotel is its best feature. It’s on W. 26th between 6th and 7th. You’re a short walk to shopping on 34th, about a 15 minute walk to Union Square, there are several subway stops nearby, and lots of good restaurants. It’s centrally located and an easy walk to a lot Manhattan has to offer. I probably won’t return to this Hilton. There are better hotels in the area in this price range.

Hotel is in an excellent location - very central to everything. Rooms are "Manhattan size" but very modern. I am Hilton Gold and received breakfast for 1 person for each night we were there but nothing else (no upgrade or view). Rare Bar and Grill in the hotel has the most incredible lobster burger ($23) well worth the money. Rooftop bar was too crowded to enjoy while I was there so left straight away.Only downside was a cleaning issue. I dropped something that rolled under the bed and discovered other guests dropped items and a lot of dust ! It was obvious no one had ever cleaned under the bed which was disappointing. I reported to Hilton management and received an apology/assurance would not happen again but I expected better from Hilton.

Our short stay here was lovely. If we had to spend the night in NYC again, we'd likely stay here. Upon check in we were given a complimentary upgrade to a king size room on the top floor with an amazing view. Everyone was really friendly, the room was clean, the bed was really comfortable. Great location, close to Midtown, close to Chelsea, we could walk to the Village, very accessible.

It was a great hotel for the price I paid. We mainly stuck to the Meatpacking District because it's where most of the shops, restaurants and bars we wanted to go to were located and this hotel was close to the action and convenient. It was located on a pretty quiet street (considering that it IS New York) although, I had to do a late night drugstore run and decided against it because of the amount of homeless people on the street, which didn't make me feel all that safe going alone. Again, it's New York and that notion is understood. My room was very clean and pretty spacious for NY standards. The only reason I did not give it a 5 was because one of the elevators was broken during our two night stay. They have either three or four elevators total and only one was operating to/from the rooms. The others were solely being used to take people up to the rooftop restaurant/deck/bar. That was a bit inconvenient but not a huge deal. Overall, great service, great room, great location and a great two night stay.

The location, for us, was perfect! A subway that goes North/South (#1-2-3) was only 2 blocks away - on 28th & 7th. We stayed for 5 nights and bought a 7-Day Unlimited Metrocard for $29/each. The only disappointment for this hotel was not having free wifi. We both had ipads with data plans so we got what we needed but when it was slow and it was frustrating to know that Wifi was just a click away...at $15 bucks. Bummer.I wish I caught the name of our bellman. We had him both in/out and he was very personable and eager to help you. It goes to show you that being "nice" doubles your tip. If you are driving into the city, a nice "perk" was that the hotel is set back a little. Enough so you can pull into the "U" shape driveway and unload your luggage stressfree with no one behind you. We parked our car for $20/day at Alliance Parking across town. Pre-paid online, dropped the car off, picked it up 5 days later hassle free. Quick from start to finish. The beds in the hotel were AWESOME! Soooo very comfortable after a long day and night in the city.I did notice some minor issues with the elevator. You had to swipe your room key infront of a small black circle then push your floor. Although this is the same technology that worked perfect to get into your room, it didn't work so well in the elevator. After I understood how it worked, it still presented problems for other people as well. No ice machine but room service will bring you some.In summary, I would recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

This was not my first choice of hotels to stay at (last year we stayed at the Setai on Fifth) but we were meeting up with friends and wanted to be with them. For summertime in New York, the rate was unbeatable ($169/night) so we decided to give a shot. I must say I was pleasantly surpirsed! The staff at the desk were very friendly and consistently offered their services. While I do agree with others that the rooms are small, our King room had a very comfortable bed and a large washroom with great-smelling toiletries. The minibar was such that you couldn't open it without being charged - a definite negative that you can't keep cold drinks in the room. Add to that that there are no ice machines and the only way to keep things cool was to put them on the air conditioner (which actually worked quite well)! Two computers in lobby allowed us to check email and print boarding passes so no paid internet time was needed.The location was good - not much in the immediate vicinity for those of us who like to walk everywhere, but within 15 minutes you can be close to Times Square or the village. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice hotel at a great price in a central location.

Booked a group of 17 for a week to attend an Institute; everything from the contract for rooms, check-in, services and food was outstanding and exceeded our expectations. Great location and terrific staff.

Great hotel. We arrived early and they had a room for us. They also allowed a late checkout and bag storage at no charge. The room was clean and comfortable and hotel was in a central location and really quiet. Staff were super friendly and really helpful.

Just came back from a 10 day stay here so this review is based on a substantial amount of experiences.Pros1. The beds: the most comfortable beds I have slept in a long time. After a full day of walking around NY these beds were heaven!2. cleanliness: 5 stars for this. I travel a lot and I have very high standards when it comes to this. Everything in the room was spotless and housekeeping did a great job every day. 3. Location: really good location. Easy to get anywhere from the hotel.4. Roof top bar: very cool spot with amazing views of the manhattan sky line.Cons1. Wifi is ridiculously expensive!!! They charge $15 PER DAY PER DEVICE which is an absolute joke. Get with the times Hilton, if Starbucks and McDonalds can provide free wifi your charges are just ludicrous!2. The lobby is very dark and the hall ways are very narrow and has a retro feel. Not what I'm used to from Hilton hotels. I understand that they are trying to be stylish and fashion forward by the name of the hotel, but it actually feels very gloomy in the lobby and very motel like in the hall ways.3. The mini bar works on a stupid sensor system. And the fridge can not be used for anything else as it resembles a vending machine, not a standard mini bar fridge. Very annoying when you are staying for 10 days and want to keep some cold drinks and things in there.4. Rooms are small. Yes I know, this is Manhattan and space is at a premium, but there is absolutely no room for 2 people to keep their suitcases open on the floor. At least they provide enough drawer space so we could unpack  completely and put our suitcases away for the duration of our stay.5. Rooms are VERY dark. Even with all the lights on and bedside and desk lamps on the room felt very dark and claustrophobic. 6.  Quality of towels was poor. For the first 7 days we received quite threadbare and small bath towels and for the last 3 days we got nice big fluffy towels. Again, not what I'm used to from Hilton!7. Room service food was quite average. Ordered a burger which was greasy and soggy and a salad which was rather bland. Unacceptable considering it cost $45 for the two items!8. Staff at check in was quite rude. We arrived late at night after 30 hours of travelling and we received a very cold welcome and a rude attitude form the girl at the front desk. Wish I remembered her name.9. Toiletries provided were insufficient, they provide mouthwash and sewing kits but no body wash or shower caps. Weird!So there you have it. Quite a lengthy list of cons compared to the pros. Would I stay there again despite the lengthy list of cons? Yes but ONLY if they wake up to themselves and stop charging for wifi. Given how expensive hotels are in Manhattan this hotel would be good value for money if they lift their game a bit and come up to par with other Hilton hotels around the world.

We stayed one week in this hotel while sightseeing in New York, the location is not really that great as far as the subway is concerned, but it is a nice short walk from times square and the empire state building, rockefeller centre, etc. The restaurant in the hotel has decent food but it's way over-priced for the value, even for New York. The roof top lounge is a complete joke, it's like a casual lounge trying to be a club, and each night they totally monopolize one of the elevators to shuttle people up and down from it. The space would be much better as a casual lounge for hotel patrons, with food service and drinks (right now it's drinks only). Another note about the elevators, don't be surprised if one of them takes you for a ride up to the 20th floor even though you're supposed to be goind down, they have a mind of their own, and also get stuck frequently but don't panic it only lasts a minute. The rooms are a really nice size with extremely comfortable beds and nice amenities in the bathrooms. Front desk staff are amazingly helpful and eager to please, as are the bellmen. Overall we very much enjoyed our stayed, despite the minor annoyances mentioned above.

I had a reservation to stay one week in this hotel, due to flight delays, my arrival was at 2 am, when I arrived with my wife, they informed me that I didn't arrive at 6 pm, so they decided to sell my room and the hotel was fully booked. The three persons in the counter were limited to tell me: "sorry, you didn't arrive early and you have to go to another hotel", was the only phrase, a really bad way to attend and receive a frecuent customer of Hilton Family. I had to walk with my wife at 2 am to a near Holiday Inn paying US$ 100 more than the original room I had in the Hilton.At following day, they wrote to my email saying that they had the room available if I wanted to go back. I decided to decline because a bad moment like that is terrible when you are starting a vacation with your wife.

Location within walking distance to Grand Central Station which was convenient for Amtrak train departures and arrivals. Small intimate hotel with great service and well designed rooms. Clean and noise free. Fantastic restuarant on the property.

Stayed in room 1604 (2 double beds) for 6 nights in July. Room size was good, despite there being two, very comfy, beds, plenty Pf space to move. Bathroom also a good size with a very large shower. Didn't mind the lack of bath one bit! All kept very clean.Location just brilliant, corner of 26 St and 7 Ave, subway on corners of 23 or 28 and 7th. Times square 10 minute walk north on 7 Avenue, Empire State also close! No noise though, and very little passing traffic!Staff very polite and helpful, concierge keen to help and on the last day the hotel was more than happy to look after our bags for the day as we weren't flying home until late at night.Couple of small points, ordered room service one night which didn't arrive, not overly bothered though and could have chased it up if needed. Only other thing, when arriving back at the hotel at night there is a large pile of binbags outside the hotel awaiting collection which smells bad and looks nasty! Not fair to blame the hotel though as obviously this us when they need collected, wonder if there's anywhere to the rear of the hotel that they could be collected from though?All in all, loved the hotel, have no hesitation in recommending it and if I'm lucky enough to be back in NYC will be staying there again!!!

At the last minute we decided to stay in NYC on July 4th. We found an incredible price and were not expecting much. It is a lovely small hotel. Clean, new and just as nice as one we stayed in a few months ago at three times the price.The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Location worked for what we needed and for this price would stay here even if we needed to be farther north or east.

Very new hotel! So it's definitely clean and nice. Room is bit small but overall it's comfortable. Hilton is indeed Hilton ... Switched on the tv and saw a welcome page with my name there... Was happy! U will prob see this only when staying at the expensive hotels and I was lucky to booked Hilton at a reasonable price before my trip. The bed was really comfy! The best out of my whole trip so I really enjoyed my stay with them. They use coffee machine in the room and not those packed coffee! Anyway I will stay there again the next time I visit NYC! :)

Whether this hotel can be branded as a Hilton is a matter of debate.The building itself has been built on the very same blue prints they used for a few others Garden Inn / Doubletree in the same neighborhood. Narrow and tall building. When entering the small lobby, you face a bank of stainless doors elevators. On one side a small front desk. Very little space for seating. The room floors have a single narrow hallway for about 12 rooms per floor. So, this is not a typical Hilton brand setting.As for the building, one nice thing is that it is relatively more soundproof to external noises than other close by hotels. Unfortunately, not soundproof from inside. Thin walls. You can hear every slamming door on the whole floor, and all the conversations in the hallway. More unpleasant, I was able to hear the guest on floor above …….. having a pee. Had the pleasure to hear it to the last drop, and then the toilet flush: not very classy …..The rooms (including bathrooms) are spacious. A single closet, quite small. Large working desk. Comfortable bed. Housekeeping OK. A/C not the best for temperature control and comfort. This is a window-type system, so noisy, and when you are on the bed, you take the air flux straight on you. Almost impossible to have it working at night. Besides temp control is not very accurate: its rather on or off but barely controls anything.At Hiltons, you expect a certain amenities. You don’t find the all here. No guest services directory in room. None of the usual visitor’s magazines (you have to pick them up yourself in the lobby). No ice bucket (useless anyway, no ice machines). Generally,the staff is nice, smiling, polite and helpful. It looks to me that they try to give to this hotel a different feeling, probably because of being located in Chelsea-Fashion District. This is essentially perceptible with the restaurant decoration, the restaurant staff attitude and the rooftop bar. The restaurant setting and staff attitude there are less formal and prim than at most of Hilton hotels. It might create a surprise at first but the level of service is perfectly acceptable. The rooftop bar however is a different story. I think they do not take full advantage of this rooftop. Some tables and chairs are cheap-garden-barbecue style. You have a few sofas, but they are oddly oriented, so you don’t face the view. There is continuous very loud music played. So if you were thinking about a nice relaxing outdoor terrace, forget it. They are also using plastic glasses….cheap! Very annoying is their access policy. You cannot access it directly from you floor. You have to go down to the lobby to take an elevator that shuttles between the bar and the lobby during opening hours. In the lobby, the elevator is patrolled by a security guard that checks IDs. You have to wait in line behind a barrier. In the elevator, you are escorted by a staff member, and when reaching the terrace, guided by a third one. When you order drinks, whether you are a hotel guest or not, they ask you for an ID and credit card …. This is way too much and you don’t feel very welcome. It made me feel like I was trying to sneak into a highly select VIP night club.In summary, I don’t want to give a bad review to this hotel, because there was objectively nothing unacceptable. Probably some room for improvements to really bring it into the Hilton brand bracket: as it is now, considering it a Hilton is probably overrated.Finally, whether you will like it or not is a matter of personal taste. But be aware of the particularities.

When I checked in, I was sent to a room that hadn't been cleaned. I had to leave the room and come back later.I had stayed at other Hiltons in the past and I was expecting the same large and comfortable rooms, but this location has very small rooms and no bathtub in the bathroom. Staff was friendly.

My favorite Hilton Property in all of Manhattan. Great Restaurant Manager(s) and the view upstairs is great. Nice bar area downstairs and the steaks and hamburgers are great. One of only 2 hotels that greeted me by name when I walked in (the other being a high end Starwood...). Much better for the price than the Hilton Millenium, Hilton Times Square and about 5 other Manhattan hotels I stayed in over a 4 month period. Great location within Manhattan being nicely located in the middle of everything on 35th and 7th.

I had been hoping to stay at the Hilton Times Square for an NY wedding in June, since that location is so quiet and well-appointed. I couldn't get a good rate for that hotel, so I went with this Hilton down on 26th Street and Seventh Ave. This Hilton's rooms are much, much smaller, and aim to be much more hip and trendy, with funky wallpaper and furnishings. The hotel in general is trying for that "boutique hotel" feeling, with a rooftop bar and a velvet rope in the lobby. Normally I feel like that would put me off, but this Hilton managed to do this without alienating any of the less trendy people staying there, and in fact, in the end I liked this hotel very much. The room we had (on the 11th floor) was quiet, and most importantly, the bed was so comfortable--very firm, probably fairly new. The room was very clean. We also had a great view--just the street below, but still nice, fun for people watching. The only thing that I did really take issue with was the lack of a full-size ironing board, since we were going to a wedding and needed to press our clothes after being in the suitcase. The Hilton Times Square has full size ironing boards and in fact a ton of room to iron--this hotel, not so much. I also didn't like that this hotel didn't have a bathtub in my room. Otherwise, I was pleasantly surprised by how nice and convenient this hotel was--close to Midtown for sightseeing and transportation, but close enough to downtown to go out to cool bars and restaurants easily. Definitely a worthy option for a weekend in New York!
user_name:
Lucy_Wanderlust
New York City, New York

review_body: Although a 25 mins walk to Times Square ,position is ok.All staff are great and the Rave Bar good place for drinks.The Hotel is less than 2 years old but due to dark colour scheme the rooms look older.Having said that they are very clean with good showers.Tips---- 1.Do not stop on floor below Rave Bar (rooftop)-noisy. 2.We stayed when all New York rates were very High and at 348 dollars a touch expensive. 3.Rooms without a view at rear of Hotel very quietAll in all a good stay .

Loved this hotel for it's proximity to Penn Station. We flew into Newark, and the train from that airport goes to Penn Station, so it was a short walk to the hotel (no need for a taxi or subway ride). The room was nice and quiet for NYC and the bathroom was quite nice. (14th flr). We had a package that included wifi, b'fast and late check out. We had to remind the front desk of all the add ons as the wifi code and b'fast coupons were not offered until we mentioned the package. As well, we had to remind them about the late check out - and the keys stop working at noon or so, so when we came back the last time to check out at 2pm, we had to go back down stairs and get our key swiped before it would work. I wish they had mentioned that when I confirmed the late check out that morning. It would have saved an extra elevator ride and a bit of stress. B'fast was nothing special at all so we only used the coupons once - there is a Brooklyn Bagel Co. a few blocks away, (really good bagels) so that was a great local option. I would stay again due to the location, and comfort of the rooms.

A perfect place to stay in the middle of town. New hotel with clean rooms, however small. Roof top bar is not that great though. Restaurant nice and good food. Also has a bar next to the lobby, so nice place to hang out in the eve when tired after a long day of walking around.

The stay, Friday night through Monday morning.Room(1514)- PROS: The room looked nice modern, washroom was good, washroom supplied well, nicer coffee maker.CONS: The soap in the washroom was filmy. The view was directly into another building. The headboard wall was connected to the door frame of the adjacent room so you woke up with a bang when the neighbors used the door. The room was right next to the cleaning staff supply room so there was constant bang bang from that. I booked and fully paid for my room a month in advance, how did I end up with such a terribly located room? Complaining to Hilton on that one.Transportation- Took a cab from LGA at about 1030pm. The trip cost about $31 and took about 30 minutes. If you want to save money and if you are mobile enough to take the subway. Take a cab from LGA to Astoria BLVd subway station (should be less than $10) and ride the subway into town ($2.25/ride). The way to LGA- As we had to leave back to LGA at rush hour (545pm), I inquired with concierge as to the best way to get to the airport. Conceirge said it would be tough getting a taxi and I should let them book a sedan with the hotel that cost $63.
