Leaving to the airport at rush hour, there were plenty of cabs still available and traffic wasn't bad. I think it took about 35-40 minutes to LGA. I feel that the concierge lied to me so that I would book the sedan with the hotel and it cost twice as much as a taxi.Location- I found the location easy access to getting around NY. It is close to both the 23rd and 28th subway stations. Walking distance to the Empire State building, Times Square and the theatre district. There are a lot of food choices on both 6th and 7th including grocery stores (whole foods) and 24 hour pharmacies nearby.Staff- In general very friendly including front desk, concierge, bell boys and cleaning staff.Rooftop Bar- My favorite part of the hotel. Great views of the NY skyline and especially Empire State building. Wasn't crowded on the Sunday night we were there, which was great for me. Expensive drinks though, $14 for a mojito.Summary- The Room and concierge/taxi situation is enough of a turnoff to stay elsewhere next time.

Myself and my wife stayed here in February 2012 for a long weekend in NYC. We stayed in a high-floor king room and whilst "small" was very usable. The room was impeccably clean and the AC was quiet, the addition of a premium coffee maker in the room and other small touches made it feel a cut above the norm. Its a great location with a couple of different subway lines just a block or 2 in either direction, great restaurants and easy to get everywhere from, the only downside was the lack of desk staff. This is a busy hotel with a constant flow of people and it was not unusual during our stay to see a queue at the main desk with a single person serving (as was the case when we checked out), however the access to the rooftop bar had 3 doormen, an employee working the lift and 2 "greeters" at the top. It really was a minor point, but when everything else was pretty much great, it stuck out. Other than this the service offered by the staff was excellent.

Who charges for internet access in 2012. Booked 2 rooms for 4 nights and was expecting the advertized rate of 14.95 for Internet access. I was not really happy with this but really like the location of this hotel so thought I would live with it. I was appalled when I was told that this charge was per computer, per day meaning that we were going to be charged 30$ per day per room as there were 4 members in our party. So, 2 rooms * 4 nights * 30$ = $240 for Internet access!If they don't change this policy, this was our last stay at this hotel.

My girlfriend and I at the hotel from June 14-18 for a Girls getaway weekend and had a guest room on the 21st floor. Each morning, we were awoken by the extremely loud banging of the exit to stairwell doors that began at 6 am daily (including Saturday and Sunday), as well as the incessant banging of the doors where housekeeping items are kept). Apparently the housekeeping was on our floor. It made it extremely challenging to sleep and no one seemed to care. The staff also chose to yell at each other in the hallways, and the walls aren't exactly sound proof! While we were there, staff were also painting the elevator doors and the doors where the housekeeping supplies are kept. We received no notice, or apology for the smell and inconvenience this caused. Each day when I attempted to find a manager or someone other than at the front desk to speak to, I was disappointed at the lack of individuals who could assist me with my issues. Even the odd individual who worked in the lobby or the concierge refused to say good morning or good evening when I made eye contact in MY effort to be polite and cordial as though I was some hoodlum off the street, not a 'valued' paying guest. In addition, on Saturday night, Sunday and Monday morning, we were also disturbed by the sound of loud banging on the rooftop for what I assume were repairs? I initially thought it was the rooftop bar speakers that were making the noise, NOT someone with a hammer. Once again, no email/voice mail/letter or attempt at an apology for the inconvenience. I am more appalled with the lack of customer service and the lack of desire to address my issues and concerns rather than the size of my room. Thankfully the gent who helped load my luggage in my car service was friendly and the young lady who helped me at check in was also kind. I expect more from a Hilton Property, and find it sad that I may have received better service from their Hampton Inn properties... (free wifi and breakfast at least)...

I stayed total of 15 days at this hotel in June 2012 and actually, thought - this is one of the best located and value for money hotel for business. This is until, the last day - when the most appalling treatment given by the service staff. I got delayed by couple of hours on check-out time as I got stuck in traffic. I requested the hotel staff - to allow me 15 mins to get my luggage out. They refused me access to my room citing it was "cleaned". I asked if their own staff member can get the luggage out - was refused as well. It was humiliating and I just agreed to pay half a day charge to at least get an access to my room. As soon as I enter the room - I realized it was not even cleaned on the ground on which I was refused the access. The manager on duty was rude when I informed him about this. When I provided a feedback that I expect honesty from the staff and will definitely take up during the feedback, he offered me to waive off half a day charge - which he earlier forced me to pay just to get an access. I was beyond argument by this time and appalled that staff of Hilton can behave like this. I simply paid and walked out with a promise that I'm never to step in there again.

We had a room facing the Empire State Building. Even if the room was very confortable, we spend half of the night enjoying the view :o) how could we sleep when we had such a fabulous view on New York !Great costumer service at the reception with a very special "thank you" to Luidin for his help !Everything was nice but breakfast is quit poor and could really be better.....also the service was there not very friendly.....

I stayed at the hotel for one night on June 28 and really enjoyed it. Though the room was quite small, it's New York City so I can't complain. It was very clean, the bed was huge and super comfortable, and the water pressure in the shower was great... these are all things that are not always the easiest to find in NYC hotels. I visited the roof top bar which had beautiful views and the drinks were absolutely divine (get the vodka thyme!). It wasn't pretentious, everyone I came into contact with was friendly and happy to serve us. We also ate at the restaurant which was fun, the truffle oil fries are heavenly and come with 6 different dipping sauces. Everyone at the front desk was friendly, particularly the young lady with dark hair working around 6 o'clock on Thursday night who charged my phone for me since I left mine at home! I live in the city, and I work at a hotel, so I know the way it goes in this business and I've seen it all. This hotel was really a great deal for the price (I got a 149.00 rate on Booking.com). The location is perfect, it's near trains, great restaurants, shopping, and night life. I look forward to staying here again the next time I have a mini-getaway!
user_name:
caity t
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for a week in early April 2012 and really enjoyed it. Perfect place to explore the city and all the main sights. Our room was on 3rd floor, had good size and was very clean, modern and cozy. Really felt like home there. You could hear some traffic and street noise especially during weekend nights so I had to sleep with earplugs in. Rooftop bar was also great, chill atmosphere and lay back feeling, and had a nice view overlooking the Empire State Building. Go and enjoy a drink or two there! We had our breakfast every morning in Rare Bar and Grill which served tasty and sturdy "breakfast meals". There were some confusion with charging because some mornings they charged us only for meals (drinks and coffee were free) and other mornings for meals, coffee and drinks. But lucky for us, we usually got our coffee and drinks for free! :) Remember that hotel charges for like 50 dollars per night for incidentals when you check-in. This caused us some inconvienience because they didn´t release the amount (we paid with credit card) as promised so we had to solve this on our own when we came back home. Hotel manager tried to help us by sending a release letter by fax to our bank but it never went through and the story goes on. All in all, we would come back again here and would also recommend the hotel.

This hotel was the perfect solution to our needs. We were a group of four In NY to work on a film project. Our activities took place in Chelsea, midtown and lower 5th Ave. and this was the perfect location. Hotel is modern and very funtional. Everything works and service is professional. Room rates were fair. 1st hotel room I've been in in years with more electric sockets then needed. High floor rooms were quiet with a good view of Empire State Bldg.Only wish was that WiFi was not so expensive. At $15.00 day per device a big cost for extended stay. No free WiFi in lobby. AT&T reception iffy. In room phones overpriced. All tends to make communications a bit difficult.

Stayed here for Memorial Day on a vacation with two other couples because of good rates on Priceline. While the rooms are small, they are not much smaller than any other hotel room in NYC. The beds and linens are very comfortable and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a very convenient location, and you can easily walk to Eataly, MSG/Penn Station and various other Midtown destinations. We did not eat at the restaurant, but the menu looked appealing. Both the lobby bar and the rooftop bar were great spots to hang out for a drink while we waited for the other couples before we would go out.Overall an enjoyable stay.

Reviews of this property were consistently outstanding; so much so that I was prepared to be a bit disappointed. Well based on our recent stay, I can't say enough good things about this hotel and especially the staff. They were consistently friendly and went out of their way to provide the services we needed. From check-in to breakfast to help with transportation, they were exceptional. The room was as promised - very clean, contemporary, and serviced properly everyday. The breakfast was well prepared, PC service on the mark, and the elevators worked flawlessly. But the most surprising was the help we received when leaving NY. I asked the doorman to get us a taxi to go to the airport. I had already priced car service and because it was mid morning decided it would be less expensive to take a taxi. Well the hotel has an arrangement with a car service and after a brief discussion with an amazingly upbeat and courteous doorman, we took the car service offered (two cars waiting). When we arrived at the airport the driver advised us that Delta now flew from serveral terminals and waited while I checked. We were at the wrong termianl for our flight so he took us to the correct one before leaving. Although the hotel was conveniently located and the rooms better than average, the staff made a good trip to NYC truly great.

Very new, very modern, very secure hotel. I loved it. It was close to everything as well. The staff were very friendly. The rooftop bar was interesting as it was filled with many neighborhood dwellers that didn't actually know it was a Hilton, but a fun atmosphere none the less. I would definitely stay here again. Tip: If you don't have a high floor room (I was on floor 25 and had an amazing view of the Empire State Building), you'll be looking at a brick wall (my coworker was floor 9).

I really enjoyed my stay in Hilton Fashion District. Great location for nightlife, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the room is clean and cozy. The concierge, Rose, was very helpful. She assisted me in booking a broadway show and trasportation to the JFK airport. It is a perfect location for most of the NYC's popular sites and to the clubs and bars. I decided to travel in NYC very comfortably, that is why I booked the Hilton Fashion District. But that means that the price per night is a bit costly compared to other similar hotels. Also, most of the hotels (including the cheaper ones) have free wifi access, as complimentary. I would have thought that with that price, the wifi would be included. But everything else is good.

I had a 2 night stay here with my boyfriend. We managed to get a cheap deal, by going through hotels.com , so were extremely pleased with what we got for our money. The room had lovely decor, really modern. We didn't have any troubles getting to where we wanted to be and the area felt safe at night. My only complaint was that we needed to store our luggage in New york for a few nights before out stay and were told we could leave it at the hotel. We arrived and the receptionist told us that we couldn't. Slightly annoyed, we asked if she had any reccommendations. She sent us on a wild goose chase around New york (it was raining and we had a flight to catch), to luggage storage places that had now closed down! We ended up paying to take them on our flight. Not great service!

Excellent value for the money! Clean, comfortable, decent sized room for a city centre hotel, not big but big enough. Had a room on the 14th floor that has an ESB view and high enough to reduce street noise but not too high up near the roof bar which was a little lively after a long day sightseeing. The view from up there is exactly as per all the photos! Staff very helpful and courteous, from the front desk up to the roof bar staff. Chose to eat breakfast elsewhere but ate in the Rare restaurant for dinner once and the bar for lunch once and particular compliments to the bar staff in there, they gave us complimentary samples of cocktails they were trying out. Good burgers and steaks, admittedly at NYC prices i.e. not cheap but good nonetheless.Dozens of decent places to eat wthin a few mins walk. A great base for exploring NYC and close to 28th St subway that gets you to many of the major landmarks. If you're feeling adventurous you can walk as far uptown as Central Park in around 45-90 mins depending on what you stop to look at along the way and I guess a similar distance downtown but you'll need comfortable shoes!Our one gripe - and prior to going I always thought it was a bit petty to complain about having to pay for WiFi access - was that at $15 per device per day this is totally out of sync with many places in the city. C'mon Hilton, if McD can do it for free so should you ;-)Overall though we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and recommend it to anyone looking for a good value well-located hotel in NYC.
A bit different from the usual Hilton experience, better bar, better food, great staff. Conveniently located for either uptown or downtown.
The entire staff was oustanding and very attentive to our every need. The room was spotless and clean. I always stay at one of the Hilton Hotels in NYC and I would rate this one tops.

I really liked this hotel. Not one of the super large hotels in NYC. But not a small hotel either. I found the location to be excellent. Easy to get uptown as well as downtown. The room was on the small side, but was clean and comfortable. At checkin a found the checkin staff I worked with to be a bit rude and arrogant. He recognized my HHonors status, and was like we upgraded you to a king room, well that is what I reserved and was put on the 4th floor. And that was okay with me as I was only there one night. But not act like you are doing me a favor. I did not use roomservice. The bathroom had a walk in shower, which I really liked. I will be staying at this hotel again as I thought the location was great, the room was clean and the price was right for NYC.

It's quiet, reasonably priced, relatively good service and convenient.My only 2 negative points are:a) Breakfast is terrible - feels like a cheap motel 6 - for the price, they should be able to put together a reasonable breakfastb) Gym is tiny - 2 treadmill machines for hundreds of guests - somewhat a joke.Otherwise, a good business hotel

Great hotel, with a fabulous (small but perfectly formed) bar attached (serves fantastic burgers). When I checked in .. which was super fast I was upgraded to a King Room which was nice and the front desk staff were helpful, courteous and smiled !! which is always such a great way to be greeted away from home !!The first room wasn't cleaned .. in that the bathroom hadn't been cleaned dirty towels on the floor etc .. I immediately called the front desk who said that someone would be sent immediately. I asked them to switch my room, as I had a dinner meeting in 30 minutes and really wanted a shower .. they did this with no problem .. The hotel was a little noisy, but it's New york !! and it was also a Friday night .. upside was that it was a little larger than most NYC hotels, bathroom was perfect .... and there was a kuerig machine for coffee !! nice touch .. My only complaint would be that the wi-fi was $14.95 a day .. which in the modern day I think is not usual in most of the hotels I stay in travelling it's free !!But the location was great, staff friendly, roof terrace bar fabulously Chic .. and the restaurant/bar attached ("rare") was fabulous .. Even with the Wi-Fi charge I will stay here again .. !!

I've been in this hotel on the last week of May 2011, I have to say that it is in a perfect location, near to all the beautiful attraction of NYC, the rooms are spacious, clean, well made, silent. The privacy standard is high, you have free coffee in the room, newspaper outside of the door every morning and the staff is awesome. I strongly recommend this hotel, even if I can see the rates are higher than 2011 (more or less 70 $ plus vs 2011 per night....not a small increase...). a particular mention to Ann Lee, the reservation manager, a sweet girl who provide us everything to make our week in this hotel a pefect week.Honestly I would come back in this hotel in the future, but I hope with the same rate I paid during last yea (c.a. 235 USD per room per night).

I usually stay at the 6th Ave Hilton for business, but since this was pleasure, I tried this Hilton and glad I did. We drove to the property and you have a choice of valet or self park up the street. Either way you are charged an additional $10 for in/out privledges. The hotel appears realtively new. Rooms very clean and typical NYC small but adequate. Staff was over the top in wanting to help you. Housekeeping would always stop you in the hallways with a smile and ask you if you were having a good stay. My wife and I prefer taking the subway all over Manhattan and the #1 train stop is at 7th and 28th (the hotel is on 26th just off 7th). We came back from Broadway shows late at night on both nights of our visit and we felt very safe walking from the subway back to the hotel. There is a great rooftop bar on the property as well. We will definitely be back.

If you are visiting New York for the purpose of seeing as much of the city as possible (rather than lounging around the hotel); but, you would still like a hotel that offers a great location as well as a very clean, spacious, sleek and well-designed room for a great price, this is it! The location places you within a reasonable walking distance of virtually all key districts of Manhattan - assuming you enjoy walking. I was simply thrilled with this hotel and will definitely stay there again. I paid $500 in total for two nights and I think I received more than my money's worth. Do not pay attention to any bad reviews of this hotel. It is absolutely great in every respect!!!!

I was upgraded to a room with a king bed: it is a good thing I was alone. The room was very small. There would not have been enough space for two travelers with one suitcase each.But all in all, clean, comfortable, if a little too cozy.

This is the perfect Hotel for a business trip. In the center of the Fashion District. Small Lobby and friendly front desk Staff. Rooms are small and basic. Nice bar right at the Lobby with very friendly bartenders. The roof top Bar has a great view of the New York skyline including the Empire State building. I was not crazy about the location of this Hotel. The breakfast buffet was average and the breakfast staff was not the best.

We stayed for 4 nights. Nice rooms. Central location. Breakfast buffet (25usd all included) was ok if you like eggs and bacon. Even if you know before internet is not included, it's always sad to hear they ask you 15usd for it. In the 'business center' there are 2 pc's with free internet.

I may be in the minority but I am the type of person that sometimes just likes to do things for myself without anyones help. Whether its getting ice, some coffee, a taxi or anything else, I prefer doing these things myself. If you are this type of person, don't come anywhere near this hotel. My recent experience at this hotel bore this out. You want some ice in your room, staff will have to bring it to your room. You are at the front desk and want to switch some decaf coffee packs for regular coffee, someone from their staff will have to bring it up to your room. You want a taxi, a staff member has to call one for you. It just goes on and on. It seems like everything in this hotel exists solely to generate tips for staff. I have read other reviews for this hotel on this site and this issue has been mentioned. During my stay in New York, I switched hotels and stayed at another hotel nearby and they LET YOU get everything you wanted yourself including ice, coffee, and a taxi cab. WHAT A CONCEPT.

I bought this hotel on Priceline on a very busy weekend in NY. Among all the 4* areas, minus Wall Street, I secured this for $208 plus tax and fees. I then read the reviews and agree with most of them. Good service, nice people. Rooms are ok, reminding me of a Holiday Inn Express. Very clean and fresh. The air conditioner fan blows about 24" above the floor when it is on; I put a pillow on top of it so it was not blowing on my head. Location and access are great. Rooms are quiet even on a high floor near the bar. Compared to the more established 4* spots, if available at the same price, this would be a low priority.

The Hilton NY Fashion District was great for a fun weekend in NYC. Location was perfect, easy to get to from airports and buses, and really easy to get to SoHo, Meatpacking Dist and other midtown locations. Everyone at the hotel--from the front desk to housekeeping to the servers in the bar--were extremely helpful and pleasant. Desk staff recommended good restaurants and routes to get around. The rooftop bar was a great place to hang out. The rooms were small (like all rooms in NY!) but clean and well appointed. The size of the hotel is great, very easy to manage for check in, get to/from rooms, and we never waited for service. I will definitely go back!

pretty new and that counts a lot cos the last thing u want is to walk into a dump, let alone sleep in one. having said that, the surrounding streets arent exactly Times Square material. the rooms are decent size with modern furnishings and toiletries. there's also a laundromat right across the street which is super convenient! Small gym set up only. Didnt try the food as this was not included. they have 2 computers with internet access otherwise, you will have to pay for things. for me the advantage was the newness of the place, otherwise, a bit let down by the location.

I really enjoyed my stay at this Hilton. Anytime I stay in the city I worry about room size, amenities, and noise. First, the staff was great- super friendly and helpful ( I am a New Yorker but for anyone touring and staying here, the staff gives a great first impression of New Yorkers). The rooms are great- not super spacious but plenty of room to settle in and spread out. The rooms are updated, fresh and modern. Beds and bedding super comfy. The location is great - close enough to midtown without being in the center of the noise. It's in a much quieter area of NYC which is ideal. If you are gold or platinum, you get breakfast in the restaurant. You don't just have a buffet to choose from but you have a menu of made to order items to choose from as well- eggs, pancakes, or French toast. Buffet is still an option but if you hate the powder eggs that buffets serve, this choice is awesome. Had a great stay here and would definitely stay here again.
Our family had a very nice stay at this hotel! Good location, clean, great breakfasts with bed and breakfast rate- cool rooftop bar. Good service.

We would certainly stay here again. Very professional staff. Very clean. Room was small, as most NYC hotel rooms are, but did not feel cramped. Our room was very quiet: we faced the inner courtyard, not the street. Our room was near the end of the hall, not near the elevator. We were on the 15th floor, high enough to avoid street noise, but far enough below the very popular roof-top bar.

We stayed for 3 nights in June 2012 in double beds room. Hotel has been refurbished so bathroom and room conditions were like new. Very good value for money through online booking.Very good service throughout. Cudos to hotel manager Martha Vargas for her patience and great smile while going the extra mile to help me fix my printing/scanning problems.We will be back for sure.

The doors parted to welcome us to perfection! From the moment we entered the lobby we could sense this was no ordinary Hilton hotel. This place was special. The check-in was one of the best ever (in the top five for this Tripadvisor novice who has stayed at dozens upon dozens of hotels in his day). How was that possible? Martha V! That's how. As she checked us in I tried to control the awestruck expression on my face as she wowed us with her knowledge of the hotel amenities and services, as well as her knowledge of the area. It's not often one finds front desk a agent so well versed and professional. The room itself was a bit small, but very modern and well appointed. The hotel stays true to its Fashion District roots by payin homage through its decor. The rooftop lounge was a pleasant surprise. The views from the rooms are quite limited, but the view from the rooftop lounge, with complementary access, made up for that. I would definitely stay here again, if for no other reason than its convenient location close to a number of subway lines.

Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend .Very pleased with everything . Did not know what to expect as I made these reservations after cancelling at another place 2 days prior to arrival. So glad I made this choice. Zoribel and front desk staff were so kind and personable . As I was travelling with my teenager we could not go up to the rooftop bar during regular bar hours so one of the managers was so kind as to bring us up the last day prior to checkout just so we could see the view . We had a 2 double bed room .While it was on the smaller side, I would not say small for NYC. We had enough closet space and a real plus was the bathroom, Very clean , modern and plenty of counter space. Coffee in room. No problems with noise .Very good location to get to Times Square, subway , catch a cab, etc.Hotel staff was very helpful regarding recommendations for restaurants ,etc.We will definitely stay here again , Very reasonalble rates for NYC. I highly recommend .Again, very good service for a NYC hotel.

I had the good sense to book a hotel room over a month in advance of my trip. I booked four nights. Well---when my plans changed due to personal reasons, I had to cancel one night so would only be staying 3 nights. The hotel told me that would be fine, but each night would now cost me over $200 more. When I booked no one told me I was getting a 4-night deal. I travel frequently and have never had this happen before...beware of this hotel.
user_name:
Kimso331
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: This is a great hotel. Located very close to Penn station and MSG. Staff is awesome - told us where to eat a good breakfast in the morning. Room size was good compared to other New York hotels, with two double beds, nicely and modernly decorated. Very reasonable rates - especially on a Friday. Parking is 40$ per day. One comment - all pillows in our room were pretty stiff - not sure why as we stayed many times at Hilton before and never had this issue.Good value overall! would totally recommend!

This new hotel was pretty nice with avg size rooms for NYC ,a friendly staff, and midtown sout location. The big knock is that the street side rooms are noisy ( ear plugs are supplied!!) as the builders did not spend the extra money on sound proof windows.
user_name:
Tally11111
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff is excellent - friendly, helpful, understanding. The went out of their way to accommodate a couple of special requests related to our schedule. The king bed was enormous and very comfortable. My husband loved the big TV. Nice decor, very clean. Location and price were perfect. Also loved the attached restaurant.

So many times I feel like I want to give somewhere 3.5 stars and this is one of them. I was warmly welcomed and the hotel and decor seems pretty new. Unfortunately the rooms are tiny, the bathroom is tiny, the closet is tiny, the shower is tiny (well, you get the point). I'm not sure how they fit a 37" LCD in the room!The biggest problem I have with my 8th floor room is the noise from the hallway and the street. It was impossible to get to sleep before 1am.

Nice front desk people, good clean and moder room, nice views on 21st floor. Only minus: high speed internet is not so high speed at this hotel. Measured a few times, max 1.2Mb. Thats not so high to me ;) the front desk solved it fantastic.

Because that is the size you need to be to fit in the room. I can honestly say it was the smallest hotel room I've ever seen. Plus, the staff is simply functional. Not rude, but not warm either.Admittedly, the hotel has several positives. The price is reasonable. The decor in the room is nice and the bed is comfy. The major positive is that the location is not in a busy area. No taxi horns. No sirens blaring. Really quiet. Unusually quiet for NYC.

Six people, three rooms, one night stay only. Everything was great from the minute we pulled up until the minute we left. 24 short hours but we had lunch at Rare, drinks at the rooftop bar, and breakfast. Food was great and the service was fantastic. Check in painless (early check in at that!) and such friendly staff and good food. We thought the rooms were very clean and fresh looking, linens and towels as well. We were on the sixth floor, right next to the elevator, and the rooms were soundproof and quiet enough to ensure even a light sleeper a good night's sleep. We were prepared for ordinary and received extra special -- what a pleasant surprise in today's world. And believe me -- we are fussy people!
Room was really small, may be it is just NYC. It rained the day we were there, helpful staff provided us with umbrellas. Good location.

This hotel is very new and is fabulous as far as room cleanliness, decor, location. It's one block from the subway stop and one subway stop away from Penn Station on the 1 train. The King bed rooms have the best rooms as they are offer a better city view than the double rooms. As written by previous reviewers, make sure you don't get a room on the top floor as the noise from the rooftop bar is ridiculously annoying. Free breakfast (part of package) was nothing to brag about, especially given the price difference from that of a normal-priced room. You'd be better off going out to the streets of NY for something to eat. My biggest gripe with this hotel, having stayed here before and having experienced the same issue, is their need for 'tips' for just about everything. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready. No problem; we left our bag in the luggage room--tip needed. We came back, checked in, and found that our bags had to be 'delivered' to room even though we were standing there and could easily have wheeled them up ourselves--another tip needed. We asked for an extra set of towels to be delivered to room since we didn't get the extra set we had requested, and then left for dinner. No towels upon return. Asked for them again and left to go out for evening. No towels for the second time. Finally figured out that they wouldn't deliver them since there was no one there to give a tip! Ice bucket--tip needed. Bottle opener--tip needed. In conclusion, I would certainly recommend this hotel, but just be aware that you need to have lots of small bills in your pocket for the tipping. It was also disappointing to learn that they have done away with the mini cupcakes upon check-in. This was something that set this hotel apart from others.

I spent one evening at the Hilton while in NYC on business. The staff were super-friendly--from the front desk to the concierge. They went out of their way to welcome me and make me feel comfortable. The rooms were well-appointed and of typical size for Manhattan hotels. The hotel is very centrally located with plenty of places to eat and shop in the area. And the price for my Sunday evening stay was reasonable by NYC standards. I would DEFINITELY stay here again!

Staff is the friendliest in NY and location is very convenient!Rooms are relatively small but this is not uncommon in NYC.Had a room on the higher floors (17th) which was very comfortable although missing a few usual Hilton amenities (slippers, shoe horn, clothes brush) but a very enjoyable and recommendable stay!

We were very pleased with our recent stay at this hotel. The price was right and the location was great. We were only 2 blocks from the subway and a short walk to Times Square. The room wasn't huge but was plenty big enough for two with a good bit of luggage. The bathroom had a nice glass shower. The lobby has a really cool, modern vibe and though we didn't get the chance to go, has a restaurant attached. Overall a great experience. Would definitely stay here again.

All the positive reviews are spot on. The property really is better than advertised. Clean,well appointed rooms and a staff second to none. I never write reviews and was so impressed I decided to put finger to I phone. The staff has the perfect mix of professionalism and warmth. Check in to check out was smooth and simple. Special thanks to Katherine and Zoribel who exceeded our expectations in every way. Thanks for a wonderful stay in our favorite city.

This location is fabulous - easy walk to FlatIron, Times Square. It's clean, a great price, the staff is super friendly, and overall it was a great place to be. I was here for work, so I didn't spend alot of time in the hotel rooms, but when I was here, I felt very relaxed and sheltered from the bustling NYC streets. Would definitely stay again!

So I'm writing this on my last day here at the hotel and I just wanna say this is an awesome hotel. The rooms are great, the beds are just amazing had a great night sleep, all staff is very polite and very helpfull. And I would say a big thank you to Kathy at the frontdesk! If you need anything she will help you always, she is the best.The next time I will return to NYC I will make sure I will stay there again.

I recently stayed at the Hilton Fashion District in NYC on business. I was only there a couple of days but will definitely be back.The hotel is only a couple of years old so everything is new and modern. The lobby and rooms are very stylish and hip. The room was a bit small but not at all uncomfortable. The staff was helpful. There is a restaurant and bar in the lobby that I did not try but it seemed extremely popular and was always crowded.There is an incredible rooftop bar and lounge that is also very popular, especially with the afterwork and weekend crowd. It's fairly large though and offers fantastic views of Midtown and lower Manhattan.The property is located just off 7th Avenue on 26th street and is right in the middle of the Fashion District and close to everything including the Empire State Building, Macy’s at Herald Square, Madison Square Garden, and the Fashion Institute of Technology.My only complaint with Hilton is that while they provide free internet at their other properties like Hampton Inn and Hilton Garden Inn, for some reason they still charge for it at their Hilton properties. I'm sure they get tons of complaints about it. Overall though the hotel is fantastic.

I stayed at the Hilton in the Fashion District on a recent business trip. The overall stay was great - good service, Rare restaurant was fast enough for me to grab a bite before meeting with colleagues and the roof top bar was a perfect place to unwind. The bed was comfortable and the linens were high quality. Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance.
Solid hotel in New York, and I'm a repeat guest. Friendly, clean, and quiet (as quiet as it gets in NYC).

This new Hilton is excellent for anyone having business in NYC's Fashion district. Rooms are good size for this part of Manhattan with all the usual amenities. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The on-site restaurant and bar is nice and dinner entrees are affordable. There are also local area restaurants that are good and in easy walking distance. The concierge recommended an Italian place on 7th avenue that was also very good and reasonable. We walked easily up to 42nd St/Times Square along 5th Ave. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Booked a twin room with two double beds for a trip to New York in beginning of May. Cannot say a bad thing about the hotel at all. The location was great; found on W26th Street near to 7th Avenue which was about a 40 minute walk to Times Square and within walking distance to nearby attractions. For anything further, there are a couple of subway stations within a five minute walk, nearest one being on W28th Street.Rooms are big and well equipped. Ours had a modern coffee machine and plenty of 'pods' were supplied, although we had to ask for more milk. Bathroom and shower was very clean and modern. Not much of a view over W26th Street but you're not paying for the view with this hotel; it's mainly the location. It says 'Fashion District' but this is more like Chelsea. For the price, we couldn't find a better hotel closer to Lower Manhattan. The hotel has a bar downstairs which serves good steaks and traditional New York style burgers and there's a trendy rooftop bar which was always a popular choice for passers-by. There was no noise from this nor the street traffic.Hotel staff were more than helpful and made the stay very enjoyable. Check out the flat caps on the porters! It is the 'Fashion District' after all...

My husband and I ended up at the Hilton Fashion District at the end of our 5 day trip to NYC. We only stayed one night (May 13) as a little treat as part of our anniversary. We chose this property because of mostly positive reviews and a discount we had through hotels.com. Overall, everything was fine with our stay. The location was convenient and it was an easy walk to a number of subway lines and Madison Square Park. The room wasn't big, but didn't need to be, and everything was clean. We were also very happy to be able to store our bags in the basement free of charge for part of the afternoon after we vacated our room.Even though we only went up there for a minute, we were pretty impressed by the cool rooftop bar on top of Rare restaurant, located in the hotel. Great views and it wasn't crowded on a Sunday afternoon, although the cocktails are as pricey as you would expect in NYC. Certainly less pretentious than the rooftop bar at 230 Fifth!My biggest complaint about this hotel is the shower. It's small and there is no barrier keeping the water in that area of the bathroom, so part of the floor got totally soaked. I don't know why it was designed this way, but watch out! Also, there is no fridge to store things in - just a minibar filled with things to buy.

We stayed at the Hilton Fashion District from May 11-14, 2012 with our 2 year old daughter. The location was great - convenient to Penn Station, the 1 line on the Subway, lots of restaurants, shops, etc. Hotel was very clean and modern. The room had a minibar fridge but you couldn't use it to store any other food/leftovers, which was kind of annoying. We had some perishable food we bought, and had to keep asking the hotel for bags of ice to keep it cold. Only complaint about the hotel is that the elevator is SO annoying. You would have to swipe your card to get to your floor, and it seemed to be broken all of the time. No matter how quickly you pressed your floor after swiping the card, it just would not work. So half the time we'd miss our floor, end up on 20, and have to go all the way back down to 5. I get that they are worried about security or people just walking in the hotel, but when carrying bags, stroller etc it was a huge hassle. I hope they do something to fix the elevator system. Otherwise, price was great and I'll keep the hotel in mind for future trips to NYC.

Against my better judgement I stayed here again. Temperamental elevators and the shade in my window was not working and it could not be fixed. Additionally I was given an adjoining room. And the kicker of all kickers, ear plugs were left. I imagine it will be a noisy room I'm hoping I can switch hotels.

The hotel is clean. Room are not big, but there is enough room Being in New York. I would suggest it. However if you will ever decide to stay At this hotel DO NOT COUNT on concierge. If you need any reservations for attractions such as hop on off buses or services such as shuttles or cabs do it yourself on the internet. The people At the desk are not qualified to do the job! They don't work for the hotel but the unefficiency of the service influences my opinion of it.

Enjoyed staying at this Hilton. The rooms are very typical Hilton which is clean, bright, and a bit sterile. Nonetheless, I found the hotel to be in a vibrant location in Chelsea and staffed with helpful people. They also have a great restaurant downstairs called Rare that serves delicious burgers. There are lots of greats restaurants nearby which is another bonus. I'm sad to say we didn't visit the rooftop but we got a great deal on the hotel (by manhattan standards) so would definitely stay there again.
user_name:
ehub
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed there last weekend for a long NYC weekend. Staff is very friendly and helpful (thanks Alen)! The lobby bar was more to my taste than the rooftop bar. The view up there is great and the seating is very nice, I just didn't like all the unfinished wood (more shack than chic, IMO). The location is an easy walk from the High Line, Grammery/Flatiron and Chelsea Market. Always easy to get up 6th Ave to Midtown and the area is not loaded with tourist crowds. Our room was modern, clean and quiet. The hotel has a very trendy and up to date look. We would stay there again.

Me and my friend stayed at this hotel last week, we were looking for a room with 2 beds, which was more difficult to find than we had anticipated. Compared to similar hotels at the time it was also reasonable priced.The rooms are the standard new york size, but clean and big shower. The location was perfect for us because we could walk nearly everywhere and in the evenings was easy to get taxis to go to restaurants. There is a Whole Foods opposite and Penn station is only a 5 min walk away. The staff were always helful and friendly.The only very small problem is that somejtimes you have to wait a while for the lift.At the right price will definitely consider staying here again.

Stayed at the Hilton the weekend of May 4-6, 2012 -- cannot say enough positives about this hotel!! Rooftop bar was fabulous; customer service excellent; extremely clean and location was desirable -- overall a very trendy vibe! The one drawback is the Rare bar features 'beef' and not being a beef eater I didnt have many options -- but there were plenty of restaurants in the area to choose from!!

Am a frequent traveller to NY, Hilton Diamond status so I'm comparing this primarily to Hilton hotels. The good:- recently renovated, hotel is spotless throughout- location - close to midtown shopping, Penn Station, etc. without being overrun by tourists when you leave (I appreciate the irony that I don't want to be over-run by tourists while staying in a hotel)- service excellent - genuinely friendly staff that are very accomodating- Rare restaurant attached to the hotel had good service, food, and ambience. The bad (not terribly bad but enough I wouldn't stay again)- small rooms - I usually stay HIlton Times Square/Doubletree Times Square/Hilton 6th Ave which give you quite a bit more space than this at equivalent rates. Even Garden Inn/Residence Inns in NY give you better space. Was travelling with my wife and we found it cramped. - paper-thin walls - I read this elsewhere and it really is true. Example, my wife went into the wash room and I heard someone speaking, I figured she was talking to herself, or got a phone call. Turns out it was someone out in the hall, who we both could hear clear as a bell. Same for TV in room next door, was like they were in the same room. Surprising they didn't put more effort into sound-proofing in recent reno. - gym pretty basic. Older equipment, sounded like one of the treadmills was on its last legs when tried to adjust the tilt. So overall although we did like parts of the hotel and location, think you can do better at the other Hiltons in midtown.

I'm not a fan of the word 'nice' - I often find it quite wishy washy and overall having not much substance. This was my overall impression of staying at the Hilton Fashion District. This doesn't mean to say that the service wasn't impressive or even that the location was bad....both were very, very good! We're quite familiar with the Chelsea area so found the location to be very handy for us....a short 5 minute walk to Macys, Wholefoods a block away, convenience store around the corner, Stumptown Cafe approx 5 blocks away for a great morning coffee & metro lines close by (1, F, M, N & R).Firstly we checked into #2105 (queen rm) facing 26th St which seemed to be more spacious than #2101 (facing back of hotel). Even though #2101 was by the elevator there were no noise issues. Friends of ours had #2111 ( I think it was) which was at the end of the hall facing 26th St and we would have to conclude this room was the pick ... more spacious of all 3 rooms and you were less affected from noisy people coming to/from the elevator. We were advised at Reception that rooms on the 22nd room could be affected by noise coming from the rooftop bar.The rooms were fine but nothing out of the ordinary interior or size-wise....like the Ace or the Standard for example. The rate was the major drawcard for our reservation for late April/early May. We had breakfast included in our rate and found it to be disappointing. My one tip is to order fresh off the menu rather than dine from the buffet (an option incl in the breakfast). The French toast was good. Other than that the restaurant felt dated...particularly the food and the service was so/so.The rooftop bar was embarrasingly old-fashioned with atrocious, dance party music for 5pm in the afternoon! I envisioned the rooftop bar to have a really cool ambiance, great cocktails, comfortable seating and just overall wow! There was no wow. The sofas were dilapidated and looked like they needed a complete overhaul....and whoever designed the overall interior just got it wrong.The most frustrating part of our stay was the wifi. It kept logging out each and every time I wanted to go back online. When paying for this service I find this incredibly frustrating ... Hilton needs a lesson in a working 'Guest Access Management' solution....and I'm not even in Tech! Notable thanks has to be extended to Raoul and the lovely girls on the Front Desk!

I really enjoyed my stay at this Hilton. The location is great for anyone taking the train because you can walk to and from Penn Station. It is also conveniently located for access to mid-town, Times square, and within 15-20 minutes walking distance of the Village and on to Soho if one wishes. The hotel is directly in Chelsea which is a great neighborhood which I got to explore on this trip. I followed other reviewer's advice and asked for a quiet room in the back of the hotel (facing south I believe) and it was a very nice room, which was indeed quiet and had no view (backs of other brick buildings). The rooftop bar was fun also though not exactly my scene my friend and I enjoyed a drink there.
A modern and friendly hotel. I liked the downstairs bar, but the real gem is the rooftop bar with amazing views. Nice sized room.

New York is often disappointing given the cost of rooms and the small rooms that are the hallmark of most hotels. This property was a nice surprise. Rooms were clean, (relatively) spacious, and fairly quiet by New York standards. My room offered a nice view of the Empire State Building. Bedding was comfortable, there was a decent work space, and lighting was very adequate.Food options were above-average by hotel standards. The restaurant on property is Rare - featuring great, gourmet burgers and a variety of other options. Great spot for lunch and a casual dinner. Breakfast was also fairly good. There is an option to order off of a menu or a well appointed buffet. The lobby area is small. While I often use lobby space in New York hotels to meet or work with colleagues, there was no suitable space in this hotel to accommodate a meeting. I was even willing to pay for a meeting room, however there were none available during my stay due to large group functions.The rooftop bar mentioned in other reviews was average - I wouldn't go out of my way to get there if there is a line. Drinks are expensive ( it IS New York), so head up for a drink and a quick look around at an unspectacular view if you have the chance.

The location of this hotel is perfect (26th St. & close to 7th Ave.). The rooms were spacious, clean and in great condition. The front desk staff, housekeeping and bellman were outstanding. I mention only them as they were the only people we encountered. Our rooom was on the 20th floor and I must mention that the walls were paper thin. We could hear everything in the rooms next to us. I say that because the first evening at around 12:15am our 'neighbors' were having sex on and off for about two hours. Good for them, but I really don't want to hear it. Of all the hotels I have stayed at in the US and abroad I have never experienced a room where you can hear everything that your neighbors are doing - earplugs would not have helped. Due to the thin walls I would not stay at this hotel or recommend staying here.

This relatively new Hilton property in New York is what you expect from Hilton. The rooms are updated, clean and average size for New York. The hotel has a very modern vibe, including the Rare Bar and Grill located in the lobby and the Rare Rooftop Lounge. The location is good, being a reasonable walk from the Greenwich Village area. I would stay here again in the future due to the cleanliness and location.

Worst Internet experience ever... Stayed here several weeks on different rooms each week and I have to say that it is impossible to work at this hotel, the Internet is just horrible! If you don't need Internet, then it is a good place to stay!

Girls long weekend in NYC started a little on the downside. However, the hotel staff assisted and corrected the situation immediately. They even sent lovely fruit trays for the inconvience that occured upon check in. Elevators in lobby is the acess to room floors. You must use your key card to obtain your floor. HAVE YOUR KEY READY. If others are on elevator its easy to miss your floor if sensor is not working properly. The room size was a nice size for NYC. I was expected cramped space but three ladies were able to manuever the room while preparing for our adventures. They were clean and nicely attended to by Lillian our housekeeper. I give her five stars. Bathroom has just a shower stall but who has time to soak with all to see in the city.Speaking of viewing the city. Be sure to visit the rooftop lounge, awesome view. Then make your way to the restaurant downstairs. I had the best Portabella mushroom sandwich there. One of the other ladies ordered the T-Bone Steakburger 3 nights. She said it was fabulous. Dont sleep on your hotel restaurant. This was the best food I had in NYC. Many of the staff were quite friendly and accomodating. Great staff all around. Ugh...Cupcakes! They must remove that from the website. We were expecting cupcakes. None onsite, However managers did see that us group of ladies(A large group). Did receive our cupackes. Hey we have sweet tooths. We started on the bottom literally. And the hotel turned out to be a pleasant stay.

My mum and I stayed here in June/July of 2011 for a week. The reception staff were nice, room was clean and roomy enough- not massive and not tiny. We ate at the hotel's restaurant and had cocktails in the Rare Rooftop Bar, all good experiences with no problems. The only hitch was that they were doing some construction next door but the noise wasn't bad at all!Room cost us around $190 AUD per night, great price for what we got. I'd have no hesitation recommending this hotel to others! Thumbs up :-)

If you go to NYC and want a huge room then expect to pay at least a grand a night or more. Stayed here last fall. Booked the room on the Hilton website for less than $200 a night. It is a short walk to Penn Station, which is very convenient especially if your coming in from Newark. Its also very convenient to Times Square. The hotel is new. The rooms are small but really if your spending lots of time in the room in NYC you shouldn't be there. The rooms are very clean. The beds are triple sheeted and the mattresses have the anti bed bug covers on them. A#1 on my list when travelling now days. Would definitely stay here again.

Definitely made the best choice when it came to picking a hotel for me and my husband to stay at for 6 nights in NYC during spring break. This hotel is brand new and is in a great location. It's close to almost everything (either walking distance or a short taxi ride). The room was a good size for NYC. The bed was large and comfortable.The customer service was probably the best I've ever received at a hotel. The staff greeted us every time we left and arrived. I think they even remembered our names by the 2nd day. The manager christol keane was very helpful and accommodating with our travel situation. We were made to feel very welcomed by her and the other staff members. Our favorite things were the bed and the customer service. Our least favorite thing was the street noise. Overall the hotel is wonderful and we would definitely stay there again!

Recently (4/20-22/12) I had occasion to (on very short notice) have to make reservations for my young adult son in NYC for hotel accommodations. Even though he is a young adult and more than able to take care of himself, and been to NYC several times, you remain concerned as a parent that you child is not taken advantage of by various businesses or ill treated because of their youth. I made the accommodations at the HILTON FASHION DISTRICT in NYC and I could not have been more pleased with those that promptly and professionally aided me and I can not praise the staff of the property enough in making my son feel welcome, safe, and appreciated for staying at the HILTON FASHION DISTRICT NYC. My son was more than pleased with the room accommodations and all of the staff from start to finish. I travel the country and I can tell you that without question this is a hotel to stay at and is underpriced substantially for the value provided. The staff is one that HILTON should be proud of, must be proud of, and one that sets the benchmark for all that is good in the business....and NYC should be happy that the guests of the greatest city in the world are so well taken care of.

The Hilton Fashion District is more like a boutique hotel than a typical Hilton. Although there are 23 floors, there are only a handful of rooms on each floor and a rooftop bar that caters to the hip city scene (complete with deafening sound system) until well past midnight. The rooms are nice sized for NYC and the location is conveniently halfway between midtown and the village (just around the corner from FIT). Ask for (pay for?) a higher floor to better insulate yourself from street noise.

I am a diamond member and this was one of the best hiltons i have stayed in, the front desk staff was great! mostly Zoribel, she checked me in and every day she say me she new my name and asked how I was doing and if I needed something. All hotels should learn how to treat there customers from Zoribel and this hotel!

The hotel is very new, very clean and has very small rooms!!! Staff was nice at front desk, but did wait about 15mins till "room was cleaned" while the guest in front of us and ones after us got rooms. I think they save the very small rooms for us Expedia guest! But for what I paid, I will wait! Room nice for one person!!!Don't park your car with them go half block up and park yourself in garage!!! $55 for hotel to park per night...$42 other place.Roof top bar nice!No ice machines...ordered ice and never came!!!

Spent an opera weekend here. First time in this neighbourhood. Convenient to the subway and very clean, very secure and excellent staff and service. Only problem is that it can be a bit noisy but then it is new york. Near to Malibu diner on 23rd street which I also recommend as well as the whole food market on 7th and 25th which is open late if you fancy a snack.

This was my first visit to the Fashion District Hilton. The staff were young and appeared proud of "their" hotel. The room was the perfect compact size I much prefer, scrupulously clean with all the expected amenities. Only issue was a broken night latch on the door. I called down after 10 PM and the latch was repaired, cheerfully, within 15 minutes, definitely a first in my experience with hotel repairs! Although the Tribeca Film Festival had filled the hotel, and the lobby and restaurant were crowded and noisy, the rooms were quiet.Climate control was quiet and could be kept on, rather than the noisy on-and-off I've encountered elsewhere. Breakfast was excellent and the cab I'd requested was available exactly when needed. I would return in a heartbeat and recommend it to anyone.

The hotel room was very nice but a little on the petite side. Though it shouldn't really matter unless you plan on spending all your time in the room. The front desk and concierge were all very friendly which was nice and the hotel itself was really clean. Our only complaints were that our heater only worked half the time and the street noise was out of control a few of the nights. We were on the seventh floor so perhaps staying on a higher floor might help. All in all it was a great stay!

We had booked a loft for our 5 night stay in New York. Big mistake. Not taken care of and dirty, we did not want to stay there. Fortunately, the Hilton Fashion District was right across the street. Even though they were busy, they were able to get us in for the last 3 nights of our stay. The staff went out of there way to help us out. It was a relief to get out of the loft and into the Hilton. The room was clean and quiet, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the location was excellent. The rooftop had an amazing view of Manhattan and was a hopping nightclub on the weekends. Thanks Hilton, for rescuing our vacation and making our stay in New York fantastic. Wayne D

Only complaint is no cupcakes spotted or offered the entire time we were there! Otherwise, easy in and out with valet parking. Good floor by floor security although area was good, never felt unsafe. Restaurant loud, but food ok. Good location and clean.

We generally had a good stay at this hotel. It is located near Penn Station and many sights. Aside from one person in the restaurant, we generally found the hotel staff to be helpful. Although our room was small, as is often the case in New York, it was well-organized and clean. We had significant problems with noise during our stay. Our room faced 26th Street. Street noises were frequent during the night, with many loud noises from trucks and other vehicles. The hotel windows did not sufficiently block sound in our view, making this among the noisier hotels where we have stayed in New York. We stayed in two different rooms in two stays in a single week. We found the automatic lights in the bathrooms did not function very well. We would, however, consider staying in this hotel in the future.

I stayed here with a group of 29 for a college competition. Great location, right around the corner from FIT and MSG and a quick ten minute walk to Times Square and Union Square/Flatiron. The staff was extremely helpful. All of our rooms were not read upon our arrival but they allowed us to use the bathroom to get ready, keep our luggage safe and gave us access to a room to get ready in as well. Always someone greeting you in and out of the hotel and asking if you're doing ok. Front desk attendants are very personable and pleaseny especially a man named Luidin.Has a gorgeous roof top bar. Drinks are a bit steep in price, but has a priceless view of the city. Definitely recommend this hotel. Rooms were very nice, beds extremely comfortable. CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN and housekeeping was phenomenal.
user_name:
Kate G
Webster, New York, United States

review_body: The best overall hotel I have ever stayed in! Nice clean hotel with outstanding staff that was very acccommodating, friendly, efficient, happy ... every one of them from the bell hop to the front desk (Kathy is the best!), to the restaurant staff. They all made my stay very enjoyable and I will be going to New York quite often and will be staying here.
user_name:
Rosemary G
New York City, New York

review_body: This wouldn't have been my first choice, but I couldn't crack the $300 barrier and this came up at $220 for a room with two doubles. The hotel was fancier than the similarly located big name chain Fairfield Inn (called Chelsea). Similar in lots of ways. immaculate, spacious enough for New York, quite enough and comfortable. No breakfast included but the HIlton has a restaurant and bar (and room service). Our coffee pot did not work but they replaced it quickly. Really do try to walk to Penn station, its only a few blocks and if you are looking for NJ transit, it is on the station corner closest to the hotel (Southeast)

Disappointment #1: I reserved a late check in, knowing that our train was scheduled to arrive after 9 pm. Once I realized the train would be much later, I called the hotel, around 5 pm, to alert them and specifically requested that they not release my room, even though it would be after 11 or even midnight or 1 am before we arrived. They assured me my reservation was held. We arrived at 1 am, only to be told by the desk clerk that "unfortunately there was a problem" and there was no room for us. (US = myself and my 13 year old daughter, who had been on a train for about 8 hours or more.) When I asked how this happened, especially given that I had called at 5 pm specifically to alert the hotel about our delay and to request my reservation be held, the clerk said, "there was a 'stayover,'" and he could find NO note of my phone call in his system. When I asked what sort of corporate policy permits a person without a reservation to bump someone WITH a paid reservation, he muttered something about "maybe a Hilton Gold member." Ultimately, at 1:30 pm, the desk clerk had the bellhop put us in a cab bound for a "sister property," with a "letter" to the sister property ... but didn't give the cab driver clear directions. The confusion about where we were going only increased my frustration. Also, the desk clerk advised that the stay at the sister property would be "on Hilton," but of course the sister property took my credit card for "incidentals," and, now, 6 days later, a $275 charge for the room rate at the sister property remains on my card.Disappointment # 2: I picked this hotel for its location and for the rooftop restaurant/bar, only to discover that no one under 21 gets to go to the rooftop (at least the night we tried to go, that was true, and when I asked the bouncers at the elevator and the concierge about it, neither informed me that it would be open for those under 21 a different night). I did not see that policy/rule clearly published anywhere, and definitely did not see it on the hotel's website. Had I known that I would not be able to take my daughter to the rooftop, I probably wouldn't have chosen this hotel. (Which may be why they didn't inform me of that rule in the first place...)I travel fairly frequently and am generally a go-with-the-flow, easy-to-please person. This is the first time I have been assertive and visibly irritated by circumstances at a hotel, and the first time I have ever given a bad review. I gave a second star only because the room was clean. I will refrain from using Hilton or any of its "sister properties" in my future travels. I do not believe I should have to be a "Hilton gold" or some other special club member in order to have a paid reservation actually held.
user_name:
Mandi S
Staunton, Virginia, United States

review_body: Great location in Chelsea, very close to the Flatiron district. Room was very clean and modern, but on the small side and noisy. We stayed on the 9th floor on the street side and especially at night there was lots of noise from traffic. It woke me up several times, but other than this I have no complaints. Very friendly staff.Roof top bar is worth a visit for a cocktail and snack: great view!

Overall we had a great stay. As a Hilton Honors Diamond member, I have stayed at many Hiltons across the country and this one is top-notch. The location was excellent. Breakfast service in the RARE restaurant each morning was fast and exceptionally friendly. One reason this Hilton appealed to us over others in the city was the rooftop bar. We visited on several occasions during our stay. One night however, after returning from dinner, the bar was at full capacity with a long line to get up. Hotel guests are given no priority over walk-ins. After then standing at the downstairs bar for 15 minutes waiting to order a drink from the overwhelmed bartender, we gave up and went upstairs to our room. It was very disappointing, especially considering that we were on the top floor and had a hard time falling asleep with the very LOUD music and bass pumping from the bar right above us. (The front desk had warned us of the noise at night on this floor upon check-in, but we said it would be no problem as we planned on being up there at night!)

The hotel is a good choice if you are attending an event at Madison Square Garden or need to be close to Penn Station. I had a room with two double beds that I found to be quite compact, even by NYC standards. Very comfortable beds, nice wall mounted flat screen. Our mini-bar was not cold and since they charge you first, kind of a bummer to spend $6.95 on a warm beer. Nice but small kitchen, I honestly think a very large person would probably not fit in the shower. Trendy furnishings. Kind of a ghost town at night--was surprised to have returned home from dinner and the bar was closed. I would return but perhaps better rates can be had on travel sites that would make this a better deal.

I had booked a queen size room but got an upgrade to king size upon check-in. I had stayed in Hilton on 35th St. in last August so I kind of knew what to expect: perfect location and good quality. Slept like a baby in that comfy bed on a 6th floor with a view to a 26th St. Room was a bit dark, but it was not a big issue for me. Room was though a more spacious than similar room on 35th, which was only a good thing. Bathroom with walk-in shower was clean and spacious. Only thing which slightly got me annoyed was the fact that I had to pay for wifi. As I managed to establish user code by one device and needed wifi for several other devices, the from desk kindly gave me complimentary wifi code for other devices. I was still a bit surprised to pay for wifi, I mean nowadays. But all good at the end!Rooftop bar with its lovely view was a nice touch! And cocktails were good too! Enjoyed some Fashionista while watching Masters tournament. Night view is spectacular, do ride up also on a night time.Altogether experience was very good and I will be back. Very recommendable!

Nice hotel in Manhattan between 7th and 6th Avenue. The rooms are nice decorated and very clean. Close to the subway. I can recomend this hotel based on service, price and the calm location. I could hardly hear any traffic and slept like a kid!

I have many friends in NYC, sometimes I stay with them and others I share rooms with other visiting friends. Due to a snafu in scheduling and budget issues with friends we stayed at three different places in four days. I had stayed at this Hotel prior and when we had the opportunity to secure this place (for the same $) as the others there was no comparison. We were able to come to the city a couple of days earlier than planned and knowing how nice this place was I convinced my friend it was worth the move to the other nearby Hotel. The service is amazing as well as the security and the RARE BAR (Roof Top) is now a routine stop on all visits. The room was not HUGE but is it so comfortable and clean with a modern design. The bathroom with only a shower was just awesome. All the little things are perfect here form the quality of the soap to the in room safe etc. FYI: our improvised trip included stays here, the Holiday Inn (across the street) and the Indigo. All were nice but in order of preference: Hilton, Indigo, HI. That being said I am pretty frugal when traveling. I want comfort and location as priorities. All of these "fit the bill" but I would gladly pay $25-30 more a night to stay here over the others all things being equal.

My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hilton for 9 nights while staying in New York.We were really impressed with the room itself, service, and the Chelsea location is within walking distance to plenty of nice restaurants within Chelsea and The Meat Packing District. Considering the hotel was the one of the cheapest when we were searching, overall we were very happy with it and would definitely recommend it. The Rooftop bar also offers great views of the skyline.The only slight gripes I had was that paying extra for a high floor was probably not really worth it as the view was nothing special (although for $150 in total I guess it only works out to $20 a night or so), and the wifi at $15 dollars a day is pretty extortionate.

This was my very first trip to NYC and my partner's second (first trip 22 years ago).The hotel has an excellent value for money. We stayed there for one week and enjoyed it very much. The location is ideal to discover NYC, near of two subway stations.The room was nice, good size and clean with walk in shower, which for me is very important - I hate the bath tubes with those dirty curtains......).We booked an upper level room, which is a bit more expensive than the lower floor rooms, but it's well worth for the view you get.There are two computers with free internet usage around the corner of the reception desk, which offers you a printer to take print-outs of your google searches or whatever you where looking for in NYC.We did not take breakfast included as there are plenty of coffee shops around where you can have a snack to take off your sightseeing. Sometimes we bought a coffee down at the restaurant bar (breakfast reception desk) to take into our room. You could either bill it to your room or pay it directly at the desk.There is a nice roof top bar in the hotel with a nice view to the empire state building and surrounding. To get a much nicer view I recommend the Top of the Strand roof top bar - great view (you think you could touch the empire state bilding!) nice long island ice tea!Friends of us will travel to NYC End of April 2012 and they also booked the upper floor room. Hope they will enjoy as much as we did.

We stayed at this hotel when my niece appeared on the Martha Stewart Show. The front desk attendant, Luidin, was very professional,helpful and somehow had the ability to put us at ease. Every time he saw us he gave us a warm smile. The room was small but comfortable. Our request to have rooms near one another was honored. All staff were polite and attentive. We would definitely stay again. We found the location near subway and within walking distance of Penn Station.
Great location for two first-time travellers to NY. Walkingdistance to Empire State, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Flatiron Building, Meatpacking District....overall great location.

I was just headed to NYC for the night and basically needed a place to drop my bags. I booked through the Hilton website and got the room for less than $200, pretty good for NYC. For that price I was pleasantly surprised when I entered my room there was room to walk all the way around the bed. Some hotels in NYC don't provide that luxury (ahem, Dream.) The room was very simple, modern and clean. I really liked it. The Keurig in the room was a plus. The lighting could have been a little brighter. Being dimly lit, it made it hard for two girls to get ready at once. The location was perfect for what we had planned. We were able to walk everywhere we needed to go. Overall, this hotel fit my needs perfectly and that would have sufficed. But what really made the biggest impression on me was the friendliness of the staff. They just couldn't have been more helpful and pleasant which you don't always find in NYC hotels (again referring to Dream) When we asked about what to do in the area, we were told the things that THEY like to do, not some list of things for tourists to do. BTW, if you go to a place called the Black Door, tell them the girls from Club Swami sent you. And if you're looking for breakfast, there is a great vegan place just around the corner called Loving Hut, not pricey AND they deliver.

I recently stayed here with my son while we looked at colleges in Manhattan. During our stay it was my son's 17th birthday. I looked into getting 17 balloons delivered but quickly decided I didn't want to pay $80. I asked Ahram Suh; the front desk manager if they do anything nice and he assured me they would. Ahram arranged for balloons, sparkling cider and cake with candles numbered "17". The hotel took the time to nicely setup the balloons, etc and create a nice surprise for my son. They really made it special for him!The location is central to getting around the city and Rare offered good late night food. We will stay here again!

This hotel is well located for everything in the City. Service was welcoming and efficient, particularly the bellmen and the Concierge.We were allocated a room on the 19th floor which looked out across the City. The view is very New York and we loved it. The room itself was fine, a little on the small side and a bit dark but well fitted out. We enjoyed the coffee maker and the sizeable shower but would have liked some shower gel as well as soap, and somewhere to sit other than on the bed or at the desk.Regardless of the fabric of a hotel, for us it's usually the staff that can make or break it. Here they made it - you just felt genuinely welcomed and like they wanted you to have a good stay, right down to calling up to confirm everything was ok after we checked-in which we really appreciated.

The HIlton in the fashion district provided the worst travel experience of my career. I arrived and they had given my room away. They referred me to a far inferior hotel 10 blocks away that did not have the amenities I needed, plus had to listen to trash trucks all night. It We booked in advance with credit card back up. This was inexcusable. You cant trust this hotel.

We arrived at noon after a long flight and made the check in fast and we received our double room ready. The staff was nice, courteous and helpful.The room size was normal for New York, full equiped and in mint condition. The hotel is good located, near the fashion district, Madison Square Garden, Time Square and 34th Av . It is a perfect election to stay for shopping.Just for fun and for the architect:-Small lobby with lighting design good for a disco but not for a hotel.-Rooms decoration minimalist. No paintings, only two small pictures. One with a sentence “Be well”. I could not read the second one. See photos.-All furniture in black color. -Carpet and walls in dark colors. Be careful if you are depressed......But it was a nice experience and I probably will back .

Stayed here for business meeting. Only 7 blocks or so from Penn Station--an easy walk. We had an interior room and it was quiet. Great bed! Staff were all very nice. Liked the good-sized shower. I thought the room was very dark especially the entrance to the room and the closet--one tiny lightbulb for both. It has a very small closet--maybe 3' wide. The closet had a safe, but it was near the floor and the closet was so dark I had a hard time setting it. They were having a problem with the elevators (one of three was not working) and during busy times, the wait became very inconvenient. The staff were present and facilitated things as they were able. Small lobby. No ice buckets/ice or make-up mirrors. If I could get a good rate again, I would return.

My family came into town for a wedding, and stayed here from Thursday to Saturday. So far it's been a great experience. The bar at the upstairs has one of the most beautiful views of the city I have ever seen. Also, Chitra (one of the housekeeping staff) was one of the most friendly and outgoing housekeepers I have met. She was quick, courteous and fulfilled the request of extra towels with a smile. Hey, I'm a big guy, and I need more towel than most... It's a matter. Of surface area, really.The elevators could use a bit of help, but otherwise it's a great place to stay.
user_name:
Vinnie S
Manchester, Missouri, United States

review_body: Good room, nice location. I was surprised at the size for NYC. I've definitely had smaller rooms. The lobby is a little too shiny and cold, but overall, the hotel is clean, comfortable, with good service.

I liked the look of the property, and the neighborhood was a lot of fun. My comped breakfasts were above the average for Hilton properties, particularly the breakfast sandwich.My main complaint is noise. Not just street noise, but noise from other rooms. I felt like we were all sharing one big room. I didn't get a good night's sleep the whole time I was there. The Times Square property is far quieter.

If this is Hilton's idea of a good hotel someone in management should be looking for a new job. Strange elevators leave you out in a narrow, gloomy corridor with plastic wallpaper. The modest sized room is not much better. Perhaps the naked fluorescent bulb ion the bathroom is supposed to be funky, but it and many other furnishings simply look cheap.
