I stayed at another hotel in NYC a few weeks before in a similar price range (Hotel Roger Williams) and definitely preferred the Hilton.

Stayed here for 2 nights in July.I had a seminar a few blocks away and that hotel looked like a dump online, it was worse in person.Fashion Hilton looked, well fashionable online, wanted to take wife and she liked the concept.Got to the hotel and front desk was challenged by my two reservations for 2 rooms...Asked concierge for help finding kid friendly restaurant, she made almost zero effort - door man was far more helpful and I tipped accordingly, he got cab during a busy time, provided great ideas for kids activities and suggested hotel restaurant for kids and it turned out great (see RARE review).As for the rooms - When I made the reservation I made it clear that second room was for small kids, and they said they would note in the reservations to have connecting rooms - I called the day before to confirm this.We check in and they made NO effort to give us adjoining rooms - not the end of the world.Second room was down the hall, but due to the extreme small size of the rooms they were still close .Each room was the same, tiny, tiny and smaller - bathroom was well designed and compact.Views from windows did not exist at all, one room looked into an interior space that displayed cleaners smoking on the fire escape 5 feet away.If I had to be there for a conference again I might choose this hotel , but not if with the family.

Last weekend I stayed and the Hilton for my birthday - Katherine ensured I had a great room with a view of the sparkling Empire State building! When I came back later in the day to retrieve my bag and the desk was busy, she retrieved it herself so I wouldn't have to wait long. Katherine provided top-notch customer service.
user_name:
KDinDC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I had a great stay at Hilton New York Fashion District. The staff (everyone) were really friendly (they even remembered me by name). We got there before check-in time, and the front desk were attentive to call us as soon as a room was ready. They also had no problem when we requested a later check-out time.The elevator took a little getting used to - we had to swipe our card to operate the elevator and if you didn't swipe it properly, it would not work and you'll miss your floor.We had a room with two double beds and it was a decent size and very clean. They did a good job in cleaning and giving fresh towels every day. The air conditioning was a little noisy and strong - it bothered me at night. The bed could feel a little mushy at times (some people love the softness of it, but I prefer the beds to be firm).The location of the hotel was great - it was away from the business of Times Square, but was surrounded by unique shops and great restaurants. The area had a lot of character.The bellboys were really helpful and helped us get a taxi to the airport at a great price.You can't lose with Hilton hotels.

Firstly, the good. Location is excellent and the rooms, while small, are nice and for NY very clean and new. There were free bite-size cupcakes at the desk, which were delicious, and the staff were pretty nice, especially for NY.The bad - our keys were a giant pain. The keys provided only worked after being swiped many, many times - you get a red light tens to hundreds of times before a swipe turns green and the door opens. We were tired and I went to bed, but my husband stayed up with his brother. My husband came back to the room and swiped many times but could not get in. I heard him at the door - but the rooms are so close I thought it was a neighbor. He went down to the desk for help and they told him I'd probably locked him out! He ended up sleeping on the floor of his brother's room. We weren't the only ones, a lot of people had problems with keys. Since you also need to swipe them in the elevator, a lot of people missed their floor and had to ride up and down till the key worked.The rooftop bar is just OK. Drinks are very expensive and made with the cheapest of well liquor, but the views are nice and it's a good place for people watching. Don't expect to sit down.

A nice Hilton in the Chelsea/Fashion District. Cant really complain here...nice service, nice restaurant and rooftop bar...great location..rooms are decent/small, but that is nyc!! dont expect views..only buildings around this area.
user_name:
The_Idey
New York City, New York

review_body: Pros: good location, very nice stuff, free coffee, pool (I didn't visit), nice street entrance, rooftop bar (open 5-11pm)Cons: a bit small room, a bizzare system to go to the 1st floor in order to get to the rooftop bar even if you are 1 floor away (but it was even fun), this bar hours of operation, Internet access being expencive (but later they gave login and password for a free use).Overall very pleasant experience, I would recommend it for shopping purposes, business, and romantic if you don't plan to stay too much time in the room :)

Had a wonderful experience staying at this hotel! It was fairly new, so everything was nice and clean. The rooms weren't huge, but it is New York and that is typical. It was in walking distance to lots of great areas in New York. The attached restaurant, Rare, was really awesome! I had a yummy burger and parmesan truffle fries, highly recommend!

As a Hilton Diamond member, I'm used to getting nice treatment and this hotel is no exception. Checkin was fast and very courteous, and the staff was friendly throughout. The rooms are clean and modern. some folks here have complained about small room size but rooms in NYC do tend toward the small side, as a rule. I cannot really "complain" about the rooftop bar, because it was really hot outside and I was too tired to go up -- but even if I had wanted to, I wouldn't have been able to: "private parties" and a huge line (by which I mean over 100 people at 10:30 pm) made that impossible. So I guess what I will say is: this is the first time I have never had even a prayer of getting into the featured bar at the hotel at which I was a guest; and I encourage management to put some helpful information on the website, such as "reservations required" and "often closed for private parties.". As for me, well, I'm going to slap myself upside the head for violating my own rule to always visit TA first!
Right in fashion district near the institute, near great restaurnats and shops fantastic

Hotel is in a great location. I was there Easter Sunday, and they had a special rate. As my stay was unexpectedly extended, they offered me another great rate for 2 more nights. The room was good size, nicely laid out, everything you could possibly want and quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable. Great blackout curtains. The staff were extremely personable, and helpful. I would stay there again.

We stayed at this hotel in February for 4 nights. Wonderful stay. Great courteous service and front desk. LIttle cupcakes at the front desk was a nice touch. The room was very comfortable, modern and chic. As any New York hotel, the room was rather on a small side, however we didn't need much space as we did not spend a whole lot of time in the room; that said, the usage of space in the room was superb! The location was great as well, about 15 minute walk to Times Square; 5-10 minutes cab ride anywhere else. The price at the time was unbeatable $135/night (one Expedia.com) - we lucked out!

We were pleased we were able to check in early & quickly upon arrival. The room was a good size with nice amenities such as the Ipod dock clock, Keurig coffee maker & Peter Thomas Roth bath products. The bed was comfortable & the shower was great. The orange chair in the room looked a little worn & had some stains, other than that the room was clean. We were 2 floors down from the roof, with one floor of guest rooms above us & you could hear the music from the rooftop bar in our bathroom, so the noise may have been an issue for the floor above us, it wasn't for us. We had an early decent dinner in the hotel restaurant one night because it was convenient & then tried to go up to see the rooftop. We were told we were not dressed properly because my husband had on flip flops, (with his short sleeve dress shirt & khakis.) I would not have an issue with the dress code, however the following night we were a bit more dressed up & went to the rooftop bar. The couple who went up in front of us were not guests of the hotel & were dressed extremely causally in shorts and flip flops. Once we were in the bar, we noticed a number of guys in flip flops. This kinda soured the rooftop experience for me since we were denied entry the day before due to the dress code. In addition, the $15 martini was not good & it should be at that price. The crowd was a bit younger than we were & we found it was not our scene. The view was somewhat obstructed. Although we did find a quieter section with a better view on the other side were you could watch the planes coming & going. This must have been the smoking area & we left when the smokers arrived. We found a pub down the street & around the corner.The hotel was conveniently located & we would stay there again, but skip the rooftop bar.

I would think twice about staying here again due to poor environmental controls (you're either freezing or burning up), the lack of shelving and adequate lighting within the room and the $15 per day internet charge. Add more if you want to tip for ice, one must place orders for this convenience. Elevators - super fast. although neither the lifts nor the rooms would recognize the magnetic cards on first swipe...and sometimes not on the third or fourth. Location - there weren't many highly-rated destinations for out-of-town guests. Very residential feeling...would be a nice place to live if you like organic grocery shopping. The Hilton NY staff were well-trained, very friendly and hustled. Top notch. If you go, definitely try "Melissa's" miniature cupcakes offered at the front desk - they were a nice treat.

We stayed here when it was still called "Fashion 26" and seemed to be relatively new. The location is very convenient - a short walk from Times Square, Union Square, Chelsea and close to the subway. The decor was immaculate and very smart. The view from our room was spectacular and the soundproofing was excellent. The only minor drawback was that one of the lifts was out of order and the other seemed to be reserved for shuttling the (relatively few) bar guests to and from the rooftop, which meant that hotel guests waiting for lifts would accumulate from time to time in the lobby. Overall, though, a good choice.
Very Good service. the restraunt is nice and the people and service have been very good.
user_name:
johnmgreiner
New York City, New York

review_body: The reason that l choosed this hotel is the location and reviews about the hotel.But when we arrived to the hotel we were a little bit surprised because of the cleanliness.The pillows were not clean enough and there were some stains on them.The staff who work in the lobby and entrance were not friendly.They were not willing to help.

My husband and I stayed here in July while we visited the city. We absolutely loved it! Every staff member we encountered was wonderful, the room was brand new and very clean and super comfortable, the roof top bar has a very special view of the city, and the hotel restaurant was pretty good too. The hotel is handy to metro stations and isn't a far walk to many attractions (i.e. Chelsea Market, the High Line). We only have a few negatives to mention. The hotel does not have complimentary wifi. And although we loved the atmosphere of the roof top bar, the drinks were terrible and very, very expensive (even by hotel standards).All and all, we had a wonderful trip to the city and the Hilton was definitely a large contributor to our enjoyment! Can't wait to stay there again!

I stayed here for one night. This hotel was excellent value for money, the room was very comfortable and luxurious and the location very convenient to Penn Station. The Foyer is attractive, and the staff were extremely polite and helpful. I would definitely stay again.

We brought our son to New York to celebrate his 13th birthday and stayed at this Hilton. We had a great stay here. One of the best things about this hotel is the staff, especially the bell hops and the conceirge. They were all super friendly -- especially to our son -- and incredibly helpful. The room was clean, and for a NYC hotel room and the price it was an adequate size. The only thing we lacked was a refrigerator to keep our own drink and food in. The location was perfect for us. It was just several blocks to subway stations and easy cab rides to many of the places we were visiting. We will definitely stay here again. We didn't eat in the restaurant downstairs, but my husband and I did have a drink one night in the rooftop bar. Nothing memorable there and it was a young crowd.

Except for a couple of distinctions, this is a typical mid-town Manhattan hotel--a small busy lobby, small driveway, parking via independent garage down the block. It's also a typical Hilton with surgical-suite clean white linens, lush but firm mattresses, several inviting pillows arrayed on the bed, and a spotless bathroom. It's everyone one should expect in a $300/night class Manhattan room.The hotel's decor is contemporary but still warm and welcoming. The lobby has two or three elevators dedicated to guests, and one direct express to the rooftop bar complete with a velvet rope and guestkeeper in a suit. The hotel offers thumbnail-sized cupcakes at the front desk provided by a local bakery. That last feature would could be the hotel's most unique charm, except for the fact that the cupcakes are not always available until after 3 pm. This resulted in a crushing disappointment on two mornings for the three year old member of our party. If she could do math, she would downgrade the hotel by a star or two. The hotel giveth cupcakes (good), but not so much when hotel taketh away. This seems like an insignificant quibble until you experience it with a three year old. The hotel has shower stalls, not bathtubs. This proved to be a problem for the youngest member of our party who likes baths but is terrified of the shower.Internet access if $15/night. The upper floors (21 in our case) have a spectacular view of the mid-town skyline, including the Empire State Building. Lower floors (3 in our case) are across from some kind of fashion design studio that looks straight out of Project Runway, at least as viewed through its windows.

The hotel is fairly new and things right now are nice. The layout of the room (we had a King room) is a little odd, however, so it seems smaller than the 300 sf that it was. Overall, it was a fine hotel. And, the rooms are very, very dark. The staff is very friendly, which is nice. Things don't always flow well though - you wait a long time for the very slow and small two working elevators (a third is reserved for the roof top bar). Also, it took a while to get helped and to get our luggage checked and returned. And, I know it is a hotel where you feel like every little extra thing is a further charge (including trying to get a room not looking at a brick wall). Hilton seems to have imposed a lot of rules and regulations and the staff seems helpless to work around them.The fitness room is small but actually very nice for a hotel of this size and stature.One complaint I had was that the big selling point of the hotel from the website is the "rooftop bar" - but when we were there it was closed for 1 of the 3 nights (a Saturday!) that we were there for a private event. So, I wouldn't stay there hoping to go up, it's not always open to guests.All in all, it's a fine place. If you get a good rate and need to stay in Chelsea, it's a good option. It's nothing special though and certainly isn't memorable.

We stayed for almost 2 weeks and never had less than an amazing experience. The service was above and beyond from the doorman and bellman, to the front desk staff and maids. Everyone was always courteous and kind and went out of the way to make guests feel welcome. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.

The Hilton New York Fashion District is a new 4* Hotel which has been open since Feb 2011.I have nothing to complain during my visit in NY I stayed for 2 weeks and was pleased with absolutely everything. The rooms are bright, spacious and have been cleaned daily, air-condition in every room, big window, big bathroom with a quite roomy walk in shower, own coffee-machine with new free coffee every morning, big flat-screen on the wall (satellite TV) and a safe in the wardrobe which was also free to use. No noise on the floor during the night so I had always a good night sleep.The staff was polite and helpful and all my questions had been answered as expected. On the roof is a stunning bar with reasonable prices with view over Manhattan I found it as a European living in Switzerland quite cheap even the breakfast prices where ok for a 4*. I had no breakfast every morning but what I had was excellent I had also dinner with friend a few times and found it also excellent.The location is in the middle of Manhattan which I also found perfect for me and you can walk in every direction to get where ever you want even the underground is just a few min away.A Taxi from JFK is between 45 and 50 dollar which is also ok as it is between 30 and 45 min depends on traffic of course.I would recommend the Hotel to everyone who is planning to stay in NYC with a sense of a good quality Hotel. You have to check out special offers but $ 250 are not too expensive for that Hotel.Karin .... 13.06-23.06.2011

This is a newly built hotel and it shows - great, clean, well furnished rooms and everything in full working order! Great shower. Automatically refilling mini-bar and a huge safe in the room which takes a laptop and several other items. The air conditioning actually runs to the thermostat temperature in the room and therefore sets a comfortable temperature, unlike many units which leave you either freezing or boiling. Restaurant serves great food (though it helps to be a meat lover), reasonably priced considering the location. Location is great - easy to walk to sights such as the Empire State Building and very close to a number of subway lines. Only small gripe is lack of a nice reception area to sit in - it is small and noisy due to the restaurant, but this is very liveable with given the many advantages of staying here.

It is noisy. We stayed in back so didn't have street noise. Doesn't seem like flimsy construction but you can hear EVERYTHING in the halls & the surrounding rooms. Small rooms but clean & nice. Good location & staff tries their best. As far as the roof top bar, forget about it. Friday night was loud & crowded beyond belief w/ what looked like the cast of Jersey Shores. Saturday - closed for a private party which I was told it was "frequently closed for private parties but the hotel doesn't operate it so it's nothing they can control". Sunday, it's closed. 3 nights there - never able to enjoy it. Good price but not the 4 star priceline moved it to trying to get people to bid 4 star pricing on a 3 star hotel.

Sydney, Down Under: We stayed at Hilton Fashion District for two weeks from late June 2011 and had the time of our lives. We’re seasoned travellers: my husband travels o/s regularly for work and I’ve roamed the world for work and fun which means we’ve stayed in hotels just about everywhere, ranging from 3 to 6 stars. The Hilton Fashion District beats anywhere else we’ve stayed (truly) for its vibe and outstanding hotel staff – from the dude ‘operating’ the lift that takes you to an awesome rooftop bar, right to the personable Managers who walk the floor. Needless to say, we’re going back real soon. If you get a chance, say “Hi” to Christol and the gang at reception. Christol: I’m sitting in Sydney salivating at those mini-cupcakes you have waiting for guests checking in. We miss you! Cheers, Lisl and Denham

Our honeymoon in January to NYC was incredible! Since there was a snow storm, we had to change plans and dates of the honeymoon. (Then) Fashion 26 was so understanding and helpful and didn’t get mad or charge us extra for the changes. Our flight got in extra early (around 5 am) and we couldn’t get a good room until later in the afternoon, so we went to breakfast and then back to the hotel around 8 am, but they understood that we were tired, it was cold out, and it was our honeymoon, so they let us check in early AND gave us a great room with a great view! The room was small (same size as everything in NYC-- we are from Vegas with huge hotel rooms), but it was very clean! The view was of the Empire State Building and it was gorgeous! The hotel is in the garment district, a few blocks from a subway stop, so it was great! The only thing I will complain about is the room service time-- they stop at 9:45 pm, which is normal in other places other than Las Vegas, which is 24 hour service. The people there that made is wonderful and memorable with amazing customer service were Ludwin, Lynda, and Caroline. Thanks!

Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Hilton Fashion District. The location is very good, walking to distance to Times Square, Madison Square Park, The Meatpacking District and West village.The hotel's rooftop bar is a nice feature. It has great views of The Empire State Building at night and the hostesses and bar staff are friendly.I had a standard King room which was a little small (to be expected in New York) but otherwise clean and newly decorated.I also ate at the ground floor Rare Bar & Grill which was okay, but could use some healthier options on the menu.In terms of improvements, I'd offer the following constructive criticism:* The hotel staff, especially the doormen, were generally very unfriendly. A smile and "good morning sir!" would go a long way. This was true of some of the check in staff also.* My room could be quite noisy in the morning, especially with the constant loud slamming of surrounding doors between seven and ten am.* The wireless internet and mini-bar were very expensive and for this kind of rate (about $300 a night), Hilton should look at brands like the Hyatt's Andaz that offer free wireless and water/in-room snacks.Traveler tip - it took me forever to realize that there is no off switch to the bathroom light - it's automatic! Also, the air-conditioning seems to turn itself off in the middle of the night based on a motion-detecting sensor. Might explain why I kept waking up very hot and as soon as I walked around it would turn back on!

This hotel is mid-sized, modern and the room I had was not the largest you could imagine. But it all had a good, modern design and made you feel welcome. The quality of the rooms was excellent and there was also a helpful service at reception and concierge. My impression is that this hotel is one of the best choices in the mid-price range if you are looking for something in this part of Manhattan.

My wife and i stayed at this hotel for three nights.One problematic issue was the noisy street the hotel is located at, with building work very near.Other than that, we had a very good stay.The staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived very early in the morning, and they made the effort to get us a room by 10 AM.The hotel and the rooms are completely new, well decorated, and well equipped, and the location on 26th street is excellent. Our deal also included free WiFi.We will probably return to the Hilton Fashion District on our next trip to NY.

I am a very frequent traveler. Most of the larger hotels chains blend together. I stayed at the Hilton New York Fashion District. This property has all of the ammenities of a large hotel property with the air of a smaller high end boutique. The staff is abundant and proacitve in their attempt to make the stay a good one. When is the last time that several staff members of a chain hotel remembered your name with a greeting as you passed through the lobby? The rooms are plush and comfortable. The location is convenient to most of Manhattan.

I stayed here overnight before continued my travel to the inner states. The hotel is great. The service was awesome, the room was perfectly clean and nice, the bed was very comfy and also the view of the ESB was a pleasant add. I've got my room with Tripadvisor's promotion for $170+tax what is absolutely great for NY in mid-June. But the location was not so nice, especially at the late night.
Just checked in here. Stayed here last year when it was the Fashion 26 run by Wyndham. Wifi was free, now it is $14.95 per day???? in this day and age that is not only absurd it is plain greed.

Had a great 2 night stay @ Hilton Fashion. For the price we paid per night I have no major complaints. The room was clean, bed was fairly comfortable and the staff was very helpful. Great location as well. Certainly not the most glamorous hotel, but if you can snag this at a good price, you won't be disappointed.

We stayed at the Hilton from June 14-16, 2011. The good news: excellent maid service, courteous and friendly staff, good location, and Jose and Alen who work the front door (talk about great ambassadors for both the Hilton and NYC!). The bad news: mediocre room, slow room service, and no access to the rooftop bar which was listed as an amenity. A private party had taken it over and we were not notified of the party in advance nor offered compensation. Fifteen dollars a day for wifi is just extortion, in my view.We have stayed in other hotels in NYC for considerably less money and received way more value. We won't be staying there again.Mary

Considering NYC standards - an excellent choice for the price (paid USD 239/night on 21st floor)PROSRecenetly builtHigh standard in (small) room and well planned rooms (ipod-clock radio etc)Good bathroomNice views (had a high floor, 21st, towards empire state bulding)Friendly staffCup cakes in front desk for freePretty good surroundings, walking distances to good areas as Meatpacking, Chelsea Market, Highline Park etcEfficient ACCONSNo complimentary InternetNo breakfast Roof top bar is not really luxurious, and views in (some I guess) rooms are betterNot really much to complain about...Good breakfasts in the area includes Johnny's Lunchenotte (takeaway), Brooklyn Bagle Co, Murrays Bagles and heaps more...Nice dining was Junoon (a rare high class indian) the other nights we went to other nighbourhoods to eat...

Overall, our stay at the Hilton Fashion District was really good. Used points for a two-day girls getaway during the week. Am a Diamond member. The hotel is new and small and not a mad-house like other NYC Hiltons. The room was small but nice. Bathroom was good sized, Peter Thomas Roth products. Only complaint about the room was that they do not provide a full-sized ironing board. I understand given the closets are small, but perhaps they could put it on the wall? It was nearly impossible to iron our clothes!The location was good, in Chelsea, between 6th and 7th. There is an Argo Tea on the corner and a Whole Foods a block away. Good sports bar a few doors down. Really enjoyed Rare, the rooftop bar. One complaint was breakfast. I stay/eat at a lot of Hiltons and this breakfast was one of the worst I've ever eaten at. The menu had no healthy options, aside from a bowl of oatmeal. The buffet had eggs, bacon, sausage, and french toast and it was all cold. The baked goods were run of the mill, only sugary yogurt, very little fruit, no oatmeal, and just a few cereals. Not as much variety or healthy options as normal Hilton breakfast buffets. Not even peanut butter. We skipped it day two even though it was free. However, for the rooms, location, and free mini-cupcakes and rooftop bar would definitely stay here again.

I really wanted to like this hotel but alas I probably won't stay again. I like the fact it is new, it is clean and the staff is courteous, and the location is fine for my needs. But the Wanderport Internet service is a disaster, and after repeated complaints nothing has changed. Also, it is a big disappointment that their TV coverage includes all sorts of cable news programs but not MSNBC.

A very friendly staff and a new modern hotel awaits you at the Hilton Fashion District on West 26. Room size was compact and very nicely appointed, as was the hotel lobby. The fashion district theme is prevalent and tastefully done.Great location for walking to Macy's and Times Square. Subway is close by, so you are not far from anywhere. We would return.

First the bad - no free wifi anywhere in the hotel. This is to be expected from Hilton Good - clean and nicely furnished rooms with friendly staff. Location is great - close to Macy's st Herald Sq and close to Penn StationRestaurant was expensive and food was average. I had a better burger at BRGR around the cornerI would stay here again

Room on 17th floor was a nice size, big bed with lovely tea and coffee. Couldn't really ask for more from the room. Reception was really friendly and a pleasant greeting on returning to the hotel is always a nice gesture.It is really quite a midtown location which is good for getting around from without too much bustle of true midtown but not a neighbourhood area.One problem was the roof terrace bar. We were told on check-in that it was closed on Sunday - pity since we were only there for a long weekend. We decided to try it out on the Saturday night before going out (7:30 ish) only to find that it was full so they wouldn't let us go up in the lift. The guy at the lift said he was 'holding the door' which means nothing to me but worked out that you could queue in the reception if you wanted to go up. So never saw what is a selling point for the hotel.
